description: The final flurry of weekend efforts to stir interest in New York's offyear election was carried out yesterday, most of the activity keyed to the two judgments that dominate the, ballotwhether the state should pass a women'srights amendment to its Constitution and whether the city should pass a package of amendments to its Charter.

title: Stage: A Daring Jesse
description: Bandit and His Queen Are Roles to Behold

title: Songs by Souzay Top a Weekend of French Artistry at Local Recital Halls
description: Since Gerard Souzay is the leading interpreter of French song on the recital stage today, no one could have been surprised that the first half of his program at Hunter College yesterday afternoon, devoted to Faure and Poulenc, was carried through with consummate style. He and his longtime accompanist, Dalton Baldwin, understand every tint and mezzotint of this repertory and could extract the utmost poignancy from Poulenc's Le Disparu as well as throw off Faure's Mandoline with a glittering lightness.

title: Students Flock to JobRelated Courses
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Nov. 1The nation's troubled economy and the accompanying complications or the energy shortage are causing an unprecedented boom in business and energyrelated courses at colleges and universities across ,the country.

title: Advertising
description: The word underwhelming and the phrase my cup runneth under may have negative connotations, but the Hanes Corporation, the country's largest hosiery manufacturer, is betting that a new product called Underalls will have a positive impact with female consumers.

title: Cultural Agencies Reducing Hours and Security
description: Cut, cut! moaned the director of a museum that receives substantial city funds. We can't cut back any more. If we lose a few more guards, we'll have to go to a noday week.

title: Jewish Cemetery Vandalized
description: SCHWETZINGEN, West Germany, Nov. 2 (UPI) Vandals overturned 51 tombstones in this town's Jewish cemetery during the weekend, the police said today. A police spokesman said the vandals painted Nazi swastikas on several other tombstones.

title: Republican Given Even Chance In Mississippi Governor Race
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 2Gil Carmichael, a silverhaired 48yearold Republican who has raised issues ranging from the licensing of pistols to a new state constitution, may break is 100year Democratic hold on the Governor's office Tuesday.

title: U.S. TO TELL 11.0. IT PLANS TO NIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The United States will notify the International Labor Organization this week that it intends to withdraw from the 124member United Nations body, according to highranking Administration officials.

title: Chile Reports Reds Planned To Kill Uruguayan President
description: SANTTAGO, Chile, Nov. 2 (Reuters)The military government said here today that Chilean Communists planned to assassinate Uniguay's President, Juan Maria Bordaherry, during his state visit here in September.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: VOTERS TO CHOOSE ENTIRE ASSEMBLY
description: Candidates for the New Jersey Assembly went through the usual closing ritual of visiting shopping centers yesterday to shake hands and, they hoped, pick up a few new votes in an election tomorrow that many of them fear will provide only a lackluster turnout.

title: Good Old Gerry Reagan
description: There has been a puzzlement about Gerald Ford all along. From the day he became President he was described as a nice man, a decent man: good old Gerry Ford. But the description die not fit certain nasty pages in his recordepisodes of political ugliness.

title: Japanese Yacht Wins
description: TOKYO. Nov. 2 (AP)The Wing Of Yamaha, a 34foot yacht skippered by Hiroshi Tozuki of Japan. won an international yacht race today. completing, a 7,460mile voyage from San Francisco to Okinawa in 41 days 14 hours 33 minutes.

title: Marquette Five Wins in Yawner
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 2 (AP)  Marquette University' s basketball team scored a 6756 victory over a Russian national team today in a game fans had dubbed the Midnight Special.

title: Fewer Policemen, Firemen on Duty After Layoffs
description: Cuts in the city's expenditures these days are announced as drastic and massive: Dollars in the billions, policemen, firemen and sanitation laid off by the thousands, attrition accelerated for thousands more, superagencies dismantled, possible reorganizations of the city's vast Civil Service and pension systems.

title: 28 Hurt in Hayride Mishap
description: BATESVILLE, Ind., Nov. 2 (UPI)A car ran into a tractordrawn wagon carrying a group on a hayride near this southeastern Indiana community late last night, injuring 28 persons.

title: Latins Announce Creation of National Hispanic Caucus Affiliated With Democratic, Party
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 2The creation of a NationalHispanic Caucus, a new organization affiliated with the Democratic! Party, was announced here today.

title: Japanese Is Victor
description: TANABE, Japan, Nov. 2 (UPI)  Yoshitaka Yamamoto of Kyoto won the $100,000 Bridgestone golf tournament by three strokes today with a 72283. Yamamoto, 24 years old, won $20,000.

title: Philip James, 85, Composer, Conductor, N.Y.U. Aide, Dead
description: Philip James, a composer and conductor who retired in 1955 as chairman of the music department at New York University, died Saturday at his home, 33 Aqua Drive, Southampton, L.I. He was 85 years old.

title: Grey Agency Is Hired For Energy Campaign
description: The Federal Energy Administration, which last June lost the services of an ad agency that was working on a volunteer basis, has just hired Grey Advertising. The contract is for 5668,520. Fifteen agencies were seeking the businessthe National Energy Conservation Public Service Advertising Campaign.

title: Schmidt in Iran for Talks
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany arrived here today for a twoday official visit end talks on economic relations. J. W. Fulbright, former chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations ComImittee, also arrived for a Ithreeday visit.

title: Amtrak Restores the Lake Shore Limited
description: ABOARD THE LAKE SHORE LIMITEDToledo called it the return of a missing piece of the city. South Bend looked to it to attract Europeans and end a period of urban decay. Syracuse saw it as the burial of a major mistake, and Cleveland hailed it as the return of our train.

title: ExPoliceman Gets Probation in Fire at Weekly
description: WHITESBURG, Ky., Nov. 1A former city policeman here, convicted of conspiring to burn down the office of The Mountain Eagle, an aggressively independent weekly newspaper in this coal town has been placed on five years probation for procuring the wilful and malicious burning.

title: 3 YOUTHS ARRESTED EQUIPMENT THEFT
description: A teenager's wallet, found at a New York Telephone Company garage, yesterday led to the arrest of three youths for allegedly breaking into 26 telephonecompany trucks and stealing thousands of dollars worth of equipment.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Prison Inmates Wives Stage Protest

title: Edwards Reelected Governor By a Wide Margin in Louisiana
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. Gov. Edwin W. Edwards, reelected overwhelmingly yesterday for a second fouryear term, viewed his victory as solid expression of support by the people of Louisiana for some expansive reform.

title: A Town Copes With a Murder
description: GREENWICH, Conn. Nov. 2 Shortly after the murder of 15yearold Martha Moxley, the 150man police force here asked the state police to send in its mobile crime laboratory to help in the investigation.

title: HAROLD KAMBER
description: Harold Kamber, a former wholesale randy broker here, died Saturday at the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset, L. I. He was 68 years old and lived in Palm Beach Fla., and Sea Cliff, L. I.

title: 11 Addicts Escape After Threatening Guards in Queens,
description: Eleven addicts escaped from a state rehabilitation center in Long Island City, Queens, last night after confronting two guards with improvised weapons and pushing down a matron at the front door of the minimumsecurity facility.

title: Jersey City Nurses End Their Illness At Medical Center
description: Nurses and hospital officials at the Jersey City Medical Cen, ter signed an agreement yesterday ending a wage dispute, that had resulted in a sickout that kept nearly 50 nurses off] the job.

title: Telly's Pop Wins Rich Coast Race
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Nov. 2 (UPI)Telly's Pop, owned by the actor, Telly Savalas and the movie producer, Howard Koch, came from last place with a powerful stretch run today and captured the sixth running of the $123,825 Norfolk Stakes for 2year olds. It was the closing day of the Oak Tree meeting at Santa Anita.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Swainson Convicted
description: John B. Swainson, a justice of the Michigan Supreme Court and former Governor, was convicted of perjury but acquitted of conspiracy in connection with allegations that he accepted a $20,000 bribe. Page 16.

title: U.S. GROUP REPORTS ON VISIT TO PEKING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP)  A bipartisan Congressional delegation that visited China in August reported today that it appeared at present to have peaceful intentions toward the outside world.

title: President and Sadat Confer on Lebanon At Florida Meeting
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Nov. 2 President Ford and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt discussed the worsening civil strife in Lebanon here today against a backdrop of awareness that neither the United States nor Egypt was in a position to intervene.

title: BearRavaged Wall St. Turns to Tenders
description: Highstakes tender offers are the rage these days. The United Technologies Corporation is battling for control of the Otis Elevator. Company in an adventure that could cost more than $200million. The French holding company, Societe Imetal, is trying to buy out the shareholders of the Copperweld Corporation with an offer of more than $10million, and the Crane Company has offered a large package of debentures for the Anaconda Company.

title: Damaged Soviet Ship Sails
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Nov. 2 (UPI)The Soviet cruise ship Maxim Gorki, with two bomb holes in her hull, left the United States Virgin Islands today for New York, where she will undergo repairs, the Coast Guard reported. The 638foot vessel, carrying Caribbean cruise passengers, was damaged by two explosions while docked at 1 A.M. yesterday.

title: G.A.O. Scores Ford Proposal for Private Industry to Build Nuclear Fuel Plant
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Ford Administration's plan to increase the supply of nuclear reactor fuel by having private industry build a new uranium enrichment plant is inequitable, more costly and probably would mean greater delay than if the Government enlarged its existing plants, a report by the General Accounting Office charged yesterday.

title: Rival Angolan Groups Halt Fighting for Talks
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 2 (Reuters)The three warring liberation movements in Angola have ceased fire, Portuguese Government sources said here today.

title: O. J.'s Day, or Virtue Triumphant
description: On the first play from scrimmage, Joe Ferguson handed the football to 0..1. Simpson, who took a step or two toward the line before Ed Galigher of the Jets clutched him by the eyeballs. At 212 pounds. Simpson is no hothouse plant but. Galigher weighs 253. They went down with 0..1. on the bottom for a loss of two yards and the foretaste an intensely physical afternoon. A trying afternoon, that was dwindling into twilight before virtue finally triumphed

title: Boston Race for Mayor Turns Bitter in Closing Days
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2The oncetepid mayoral contest in Boston has suddenly turned in its closing days into hat many observers feel is the bitttrest and dirtiest political campaign here, in recent memory.

title: For Ford, Advice With Consent
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. IOn the theory that everyone is ready to advise the President, but that few are prepared to so, Princeton University has just held a twoday conference on Advising the President.

title: After 5 Months, LaidOff City Worker Despairs
description: Sometimes at night, after another lonely disappointmentfilled day, Alfred Prato will try to still the apprehensions in his household by letting the children climb into bed with him and Marie for a few minutes.

title: GOLF CLUB SHAFT SOUGHT IN SLAYING
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 2 The Greenwich police issued a nationwide alarm tonight for] the grip and shaft of a stainless steel golf club used in the bludgeoning death of 15year1 old Martha Moxley last week.

title: BENEFITS ARE HIGH FOR STATE WORKERS
description: New York's state government employees earn two and a half times the national average for all state workers in fringe boneifts (other than sick leave) and unemployment insuranceaccording to the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: COFFEE TALKS SET AMONG 63 NATIONS
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (AP)Coffee growing and importing nations of the International Coffee Organization will meet here tomorrow to make another attempt to work out a world coffee pact.

title: U.S. Captives in Ethiopia Tell of Hardships
description: Two United States servicemen kidnapped in September by Eritrean guerrillas in Ethiopia are sitting out their captivity in desert heat near the Sudanese border dreaming of ColaCola, hamburgers and home.

title: U. N Council Seeks to Have Sahara March Called Off
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 2The Security Council, faced with clear threats of military action in Spanish Sahara, urged all parties to the dispute today to avoid any action that might further escalate the tension in the area.

title: FORD ACTS TO BAR DEATH PLOT DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Ford and the Department of Justice are moving to keep details of United States involvement in assassination plots against foreign leaders from being made public by the Senate or in a court case here.

title: Swainson Convicted
description: John B. Swainson, a justice of the Michigan Supreme Court and former Governor, was convicted of perjury but acquitted of conspiracy in connection with allegations that he accepted a $20,000 bribe. Page 16.

title: Opposition Rises in Canada To Wage and Price Curbs
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2Confusion and controversy surround the Canadian program of wage and price controls to reduce inflation, which is now running at a rate of more than 11 percent a year here.

title: Tonight's Yonkers Entries; Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing
Dressing Up, Shopping, Eating Sweets, in the Spirit of Divali
description: A festival of lights, a day of joy, a time of new beginnings, an occasion for dressing up in new clothes, a pretext for setting off fireworks and turning children loose on sweets, an event of religious significance.

title: Flyers Sink Scouts in 100 Rout
description: PHILADELPHIA. Nov. 2 (AP)Bobby Clarke. Orest Kindrachuk and Mel Bridgman scored two goals apiece to lead the Philadelphia Flyers to a 100 rout of the Kansas City Scouts in a National Hockey League game tonight.

title: Miss Kertzman Holds Lead
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 2 (AP) Karolyn Kertzman of Santee, Calif., shot a twooverpar 75 today and retained a onestroke lead after two rounds of the $100,000 Japan Classic golf tournament.

title: JOHN H. MORRIS
description: John H. Morris, a lawyer and real estate man who was active in the development of the Far Rockaway section of Queens, died Saturday at his home, 2006 .Cornaga Avenue, Far Rockaway. He was 78 years old.

title: JOAN K. SAMUELS
description: Joan Katherine Samuels, personnet director of Peters Griffin Woodward, Inc., television and radio representatives, died Saturday of a brain tumor on a visit to Cuernavaca, Mexico. She was 43 years old and lived here.

title: !METHADONE CLINIC TO CLOSE ITS DOORS
description: The Mary Scranton metha, done maintenance clinic at 205 Second Avenue, near 13th Street, will close by the end of the year as a result of community opposition and an inability to negotiate a satisfactory new lease for its premises, its operator, Dr. William A. Triebel, said.

title: Japan Title to Braves
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 2 (AP)The Hankyu Braves defeated the Hiroshima Toyo Carp, 73, today to win the Japanese professional baseball championship. Gail Hopkins homered for the losers.

title: Theory of Greenhouse Effect Of Sun's Rays Is Challenged
description: The greenhouse effect, term often used to describe how the earth's surface remains in a temperature range enabling man, animals and plants to prosper, is a much more complex interplay of elements and forces than was originally believed several recent scientific studies have indicated.

title: Police Recover 26 Paintings Stolen From Milan Museum!
description: FOLIGNO, Italy, Nov. 2 (UPI) Italian and West German auI thorities yesterday recovered 26 of 38 stolen paintings, some of them taken twice in the last three months from the Milani Gallery of Modern Art.

title: Gorey Sets Spice Eglevsky Swan Lake
description: Presenting Edward Gorey's realization of the dcor for the second act of Swan Lake, an Saturday night demonstrated again Andre Eglevsky's adventurousness and taste in providing the environs of New York with substantial ballet fare. The company, with the Hudson Valley Philharmonic under Akiro Endo's direction, appeared at Rockland Community College in Suffern, N.Y., in the school's autumn series.

title: Justice Swainson of Michigan Convicted of Perjury
description: DETROIT, Nov. 2John B. Swainson, a justice of the Michigan Supreme Court and a former Democratic Governor of the state, was convicted of three counts of perjury .today but was acquitted of conspiracy in connection with charges that he accepted a $20,000 bribe in 1972 to help a burglar gain a review of his conviction.

title: Petty Wins at Bristol; Earnings Pass $300,000
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., Nov. 2 (UPI)Richard Petty scored his 13th racing victory of the year today, winning the Volunteer 500 at Bristol International Speedway, and becoming the first NASCAR driver to earn $300,000 in a single season.

title: Kennedy Urges Reorganization Of F.D.A. to Eliminate Defects
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 2Sen iator Edward M. Kennedy charged today that there were fundamental defects in our nation's current regulatory procedures for prescription drugs. He said that, to give the American people the protection they deserve, he had designed a plan for a major overhaul of the Food and Drug Administration.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Television
description: 7:30 P.M. Diving High (7)

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 3, 1975

title: H.E.W Chief Declines to Discuss Sex Bias With Women's Groups
description: ASHINGTON, Nov. 2F. David Mathews, who took over as Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare in August with a promise to build bridges between Government and people, has turned down a request by 17 women's groups to meet to talk about sex discrimination in education.

title: Susan Jeanette Laster Is Bride Of Franklin David Rubenstein
description: Temple Beth El of Northern Westchester in Chappaqua, N.Y., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Susan Jeanette Laster, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Laster of Chappaqua, to Dr. Franklin David Rubenstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Rubenstein of Stamford, Conn. Rabbi Chaim Stern performed the ceremony.

title: Thieves Climb, Loot Cologne Cathedral
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Nov. 2  Thieves scaled the 14thcentury buttresses of Cologne Cathedral, swung down Gothic wall with mountainclimbing spikes and a rope ladder into the religious treasury and made off with millions of dollars of precious stones, gold and silver in a daring midnight raid last night.

title: FORD ACTS TO BAR DEATH PLOT DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Ford and the Department of Justice are moving to keep details of United States involvement in assassination plots against foreign leaders from being made public by the Senate or in a court case here.

title: Ford Aides Say Economic Talks in France Won't Deal in Specifics
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Ford is going to a toplevel economic meeting in France in two weeks with no specific policy objectives and no expectation of any substantive achievements, according to wellinformed White House officials.

title: California Makes a Run for the Roses
description: Mike White, the University of California's 39yearold head football coach, said yesterday, The victory [over Southern California] represents three and a half years of hard work by a lot of peoplepeople working despite the Berkeley image here.

title: Rockaway Captures Crown
description: The Callahan brothers have been stars in Far Rockaway High School football for six years, and yesterday the youngest brother, Billy, helped the Sea Horses win the title in the Public Schools Athletic League Division A Queens section with an 180 victory over Jackson.

title: Ford Hit Head at Pool During Day With Sadat
description: WASHINGTON. Monday, Nov. 3 (Reuters)President Ford had a red mark over his right eyebrow when he returned from Florida early today, the result of a minor accident when he went for a swim.

title: Opposition Rises in Canada To Wage and Price Curbs
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2Confusioni and controversy surround the Canadian program of wage and price controls to reduce inflation, which is now running at a rate of more than 11 percent a year here.

title: Once Lowly Oilers Win And Share Division Lead
description: Two years ago, the Houston Oilers could win only one of 14 National Football League games. Last season, they won six of their final eight games and finished with a 77 wonlost record.

title: Prince, in a Visit, Assures Spanish Saharan People
description: MADRID, Nov. 2  Prince Juan Carlos de Borbon, in spectacular display of his new role as Acting Chief of State, flew into Spanish Sahara today with a promise to protect the legitimate rights of its inhabitants and the honor and prestige of the army.

title: Mary Watts Married to George Novak
description: The chapel of Callaway Gardens in Pine Mountain, Ga., was the setting yesterday morning for the marriage of Mary Godfrey Watts of Atlanta to George P. Novak of St. Louis. The Rev. Ralph Mabry, a Methodist minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: Late Gamble by Jets Helps Bills Win, 2423
description: Maybe all the Jets really need is a good ruler.

title: Ford Motors Is Testing Potential Engine of Future
description: Behind the serpentine brick wall of the Ford Motor Cornpany's old test track in Dearborn, Mich., a conventionallooking automobile with a most unconventional engine has been going through some cautious preliminary runs.

title: Statewide Referenda
description: The following statewide referenda will be submitted to the voters tomorrow:

title: Experts Say 2 Laws Proposed to Clean Up Times Square Face Constitutional Problems
description: Two proposed laws are at the heart of the Beame administration's latest campaign to clean up Times Squarean antiloitering statute to curb the activities of pimps and prostitutes and a zoning regulation to rid the area of massage parlors that serve as fronts for illicit sex.

title: Thieves Climb, Loot Cologne Cathedral
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Nov. 2  Thieves scaled the 14thcentury buttresses of Cologne Cathedral, swung down Gothic wall with mountainclimbing spikes and a rope ladder into the religious treasury and made off with millions of dollars of precious stones, gold and silver in a daring midnight raid last night.

title: JetsBills Scoring
description: N.Y. Buff. FIRST QUARTER

title: 2 Women Killed by Fumes From Bleach and Ammonia
description: PORTLAND. Me., Nov. 2 (UPI)Two women were killed yesterday by toxic fumes from a mixture of household bleach and ammonia used to clean up eggs splattered by Halloween pranksters. The victims were Muriel Holmes. 68 years old, and her niece. Muriel Perta, 55.

title: Nicklaus 3Stroke Winner
description: SYDNEY, Australia Nov. 2 (UPI)Jack Nicklaus won the Australian open golf championship for the fourth time today with a 72hole score of 279, nineunderpar, at the Australian Golf Club.

title: Bronx Man Fatally Stabbed In Apartment Burglary
description: A 66yearold Bronx man was found stabbed to death yes1 terday in his apartment, which had been ransacked during an apparent burglary, the police reported.

title: Tennessee Williams on Art and Sex
description: Tennessee Williams's Memoirs, published this week by Doubleday & company, was originally entitled Flee, Flee, This Sad Hotel. a quotation from a poem by Anne Sexton. The author changed the title when he realized that my life is as much a merry tavern as a sad hotel. My God, he said, I've gotten a lot of laughs out of life.

title: Rockets Top Bucks for 1st Victory
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 2 (AP) Calvin Murphy and Rudy Tomjanovich paced a thirdquarter surge that gave the Houston Rockets a 10489 National Basketball Association victory over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight in a battle between teams that had not won a game this season. It was Houston's opener in its new Summit arena.

title: WagePrice Plans Historically Vague, Brookings Indicates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Brookings Institution published today a history of the Government's efforts to influence or control private price and wage decisions since the Truman Administration, based largely on doucments in Presidential libraries that had not previously been examined in detail.

title: Nets
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 2Kevin Loughery, the Nets coach, spent the day off yesterday working to get sonic movement in his offense and today against the Utah Stars the movement appeared.

title: TOOTS AND MAYTALS IN REGGAE CONCERT
description: To those used to the apparently primitive nature of reggae music as dispensed by Bob Marley and the Wailers, the music of another West Indian group, Toots and the Maytals, presents a different perspective. The Maytals appeared at a midnight concert Saturday at the Beacon Theater, Broadway and 74th Street, with much advance drumbeating  reggae music seems ready to become the rage these days.

title: Last Hope
description: The Senate Banking Committee's tough municipal aid bill and similar legislation in the House offer the last slender hope that this cityand nationcan escape the consequences of past misdeeds in City Hall and of present folly in the White House.

title: Guard Unit Sent Home
description: ANDERSON, S. C., Nov. (UPI)  National Guardsmen,, put on standby alert when a carload of white men shot and wounded three black men and a black teenager Friday night, were sent home today. An aide to Gov. James B. Edwards said the 150 troops had been sent home because no violence was :reported last night.

title: Bridge:
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 2 An astonishing stretch drive by a Californian sextet in the final of the international team trials of the American Contract Bridge League just fell short here today.

title: Zionism and the U.N.
description: JERUSALEMThe United Nations began its life as an antiNazi alliance. Thirty years later it is on the way to becoming the world center of antiSemitism. There is no other tribunal from which such a torrent of abuse is poured forth every year against values, ideals and articles of faith revered by the Jewish people across the centuries. The horrifying truth is that Hitler himself would often have felt at home in a forum which gave applause to a guntoting Yasir Arafat and an obsequious ovation to the murderous Idi Amin.

title: Methodist Church Plans Shipments to 2 Vietnams
description: WASHINGTON, Nov 2 (UPI)  The United Methodist Church's board for global ministries has approved a project to send medicine, food and reconstruction tools to North and South Vietnam, according to church officials.

title: Critic W ants 76 Test of Campaign Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Representative Wayne L. Hays, despite serious personal doubts about the controversial new campaign law, believes Congress should wait until after 1976 to consider rewriting or scrapping it.

title: City Rejects a Plan To End Free Meals For Hospital Aides
description: The city's Budget Director yesterday rejected a Health and Hospitals Corporation plan to eliminate free meals for municipalhospital employees and expressed skepticism about various corporation proposals designed to cut $18.2million from its budget to meet the demands of the fiscal crisis.

title: IndiaChina Clash on 62 Battle Site
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 2 (UPI) A Defense Ministry source said today that a border clash between Indian and Chinese troops last month occurred in the northeastern territory of Arunachal Pradesh, the area that was the main theater of fighting between Indian and Chinese forces in 1962.

title: British Landmark Bombed
description: BRIGHTON, England, Nov. 2 (Reuters)A gasoline bomb extensively damaged groundfloor rooms of one of Britain's top tourist attractions today, the Royal Pavilion in this South Coast resort. The police said that there appeared to be no political motive and that a man would be charged tomorrow with arson.

title: Weakening of Clean Air Act Is Feared
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.  2Two amendments to the Clean Air Act of 1970 may well set, off another of those battles whose outcome could have farreaching effects but! that go publicly unnoticed cause of the complexity of the issues.

title: The New McCarthyism
description: WASHINGTONBecause we have always thought of government as friendly, asserted the late Adlai Stevenson in 1952, not as brutal characterassassins and slanderers, the Congress of the United States has had a free hand in the method they use.

title: Ashe Bows To Okker In Final
description: PARIS, Nov. 2 (AP)Twin Okker of the Netherlands, playing cool tennis against a legweary Arthur Ashe, won the $50,000 Paris indoor tournament, 36, 62, 36, 63, 64, today.

title: Kissinger Has a Jest: It Was a Military Coup
description: WASHINGTON, Monday, Nov. 3Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger joked last night that there had been a military coup as the White House continued to withhold any comment on a highlevel executive shuffle.

title: Spain's Key Issue: the Communists
description: MADRID, Nov. 2How to deal with the Communist Party in postFranco Spain is already a key issue here. Many people tend to speak of the Communist issue elliptically, speaking of the pace of liberalization, gradual opening or freedom for all sincere democrats. Basically, what they have in mind is what to do about the Communists.

title: State's Voters Tomorrow to Consider Proposed Bond Issues of $922 Million
description: The largest package of pro1 posed state bond issues since! 1968, calling for a total ofj $922 million in capital spending for transportation, housing,] water resources and facilities for social and institutional services, will be considered by New Jersey voters tomorrow.

title: STRIKE CALLED KEY IN COAST ELECTION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 2The strike by policemen and firemen last August is the most important issue in this city's election Tuesday, but the candidates for mayor, district attorney, sheriff and supervisor would prefer to talk about almost anything else.

title: Schools, Banks to Close For Election Day Here
description: Tomorrow is Election Day. The following is a list of services that are affected:

title: Bills Beat Jets, 2423
description: The Buffalo Bills defeated the New York Jets, 2423, yesterday at Shea Stadium on a late touchdown pass play from Joe Ferguson to O.J. Simpson that covered 64 yards. Details on Page 51.

title: Drive for Women's Rights Culminates at Polls Today
description: On to the streets! On with the leaflets! shouted City Council President Paul O'Dwyer, and a crowd of placardcarrying officials swarmed into midday midtown crowds yesterday to urge support of the, women's rights amendment that will he on the New York State ballot today.

title: Supreme Court Upholds 2 Convictions of Gross
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI)The United States Supreme Court let stand today the 1974 perjury and taxfraud convictions of Nelson G. Gross, a former New Jersey state Republican chairman.

title: JEROME B. BARRY
description: Jerome B. Barry, a writer and artist, died Saturday at his home, 420 West 24th Street. He was 81 years old.

title: Cologne Police Tell Of Leads
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The police said today that they were followeding up several promising leads in a hunt for two burglars who stole priceless relics from Cologne Cathedral after getting in through the roof.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
BURNS URGES OUT IN FEDERAL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (Renters)The chairman of the federal reserve board, Arthur F. Burns, has recommended that the board aim at a Federal funds rate of 6.125 percent and aim to reduce the rate progressively, the Fed reported today.

title: Television
description: 8:00 P.M Good Times (2)

title: Big Board Dividends Rise
description: Companies listed on the New York Stock Exchtinge paid $20.07 billion in cash dividends on common stocks during the first nine months of 1975, up 6.6 percent from the yearago figure, according to the latest issue of Exchange magazine, released yesterday. The magazine, publication of the exchange, said 1,250 common stocks paid cash dividends out of the 1,531 listed on Sept, 30, 1975.

title: Snow Geese Are Declared Legal Game
description: ALBANY, Nov. 3For the first time since 1930, the snow goose is a legal target for hunter in New York State.

title: Jovanovich Denies Curbing Book He's In
description: William Jovanovich, publisher of Harcourt Brace Jovanovich Inc., and one of his former authors are locked in literary combat over Mr. Jovanovich's alleged censorship of the author's justpublished book.

title: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games
BACON FUTURES SHOW PRICE DROP
description: Futures prices for pork bellies, the raw material used for bacon, dropped the daily limit. of 2 cents a pound yesterday on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. Market  observers termed the decline a response to tectnical factors, including increased margin calls.

title: House Banking Committee Backs Guarantee for City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The House Banking Committee today approved, 23 to 16, legislation to authorize $7 billion in loan guarantees to New York City before or after default

title: Ford Is Critical of U.N., But Says It Advances
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. (AP)President Ford Complained to Congress today of divisive actions by the United Nations last year but said he believed the organization had made progress toward promoting peace and said the United States remained firm in support of the principles of its Charter

title: Problem for Busy Senator: Being in 3 Places at Once
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3It was just one minute before 10 A.M. when Senator Walter F. Mondale left his office and, trailed by a top aide, walked down a maze of nearby deserted marble corridors to the klieglit Senate Caucus Room.

title: Music: DoubleBass Art
description: You might think, not knowing the name Gary Karr, that a doublebass player who hired a hall for a recital might have the place pretty much to himself. But Mr. Karr is not only a virtuoso performer on his bulky instrument but also an artist with the indefinable quality that can transform a listener into fan. So. far from being lonely at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night, he was playing to a full house.

title: Giants Have Health Problem
description: Floyd Peters is not a man to be envied this week. He has a task that has to make him wonder why he left his job in San Francisco. Peters is the Giants defensive line coach, which isn't a good thing to be when the defensive line has severe injury problems and when the Giants must next face the team that gave the defense a lashing in a 4913 game earlier this season.

title: NEW AIDE TO FORD RUMSFELD PROTEGE
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 3 (AF) Richard R. Chaney, the man designated by President Ford An succeed Donald H. Rumsfeld :as White House chief of staff. has been a Rumsfeld protege for years.

title: Rams In 423 Rout Of Eagles
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3 (AP)James Harris demolished Philadelphia's secondary with three touchdown passes and his defensive teammates ruined the Eagles aerial game, leading the Los Angeles Rains to a 423 National Football League victory tonight.

title: Canadiens Score Over Sabres. 32
description: MONTREAL. Nov. 3 (UPI) Yvon Lambert tallied twice in the final four minutes tonight, giving the Montreal Canadiens a 32 victory over the Buffalo Sabres before a record Forum crowd of 19,027.

title: ACIDTOSSING CASE BRINGS ACQUITTAL
description: Accused Considered Insane in Blinding of Child

title: Tonight's Yonkers Entries
description: (Horses listed in order of roost positions.) Letter designates OTB listing

title: HARTFORD TO HOLD SENTENCING INQUIRY
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 3 (AP) Connecticut's Judicial Review Council plans to conduct an unusual hearing on a complaint against a judge who gave youth convicted of murder suspended sentence.

title: People in Sports
description: Davis Can't Wait for jets, Picks Toronto

title: ElectionDay Schedule
description: All stock exchanges will be open today as well as the Chicago Board of Trade and the New York and Chicago mercantile exchanges. Other commodity exchanges will be closed for Election Day as will banks in New York and New Jersey. Banks in Connecticut, however, will be open.

title: Utilities showing Interest in Gas Turbines
description: Cashshort electric utilities and those worried about being short of power should there he a surge in demand, are again turning to the gas turbine generator.

title: 2 STATES TO ELECT GOVERNORS TODAY
description: Two states will elect Governors, and some of the nation's biggest cities will choose mayors in general elections today. Democrats are favored in most of the major contests.

title: Behind Shift: Push for Arms Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Al. though President Ford treated the subject of dtente cautious. ly tonight, the dramatic person, nel shifts he announced ap peared to signal a strengthened determination to strike a new strategic arms agreement with the Soviet Union. Without this accord, the policy of detente would be in serious jeopardy.

title: City Council Pay Up 25c
description: YORK, Ala., Nov. 3 (AP)The York city councilmen, noting the problems brought by inflation, have voted themselves a 25 per cent pay risefrom $1 to $1.25 a year.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: DR. VANDER VELDE
description: Dr. Lewis G. Vander Velde. professor emeritus of history and founder and former director of the Michigan historical collection at the University of Michigan died Friday in Alhion, Mich., where he lived. His age was 85.

title: Mrs. Peron Hospitalized Amid Clamor of Accusations!
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 3 President Isabel Martinez de Pern entered a private medical clinic today as pressure mounted for a full investigation of corruption in her administration.

title: Business Records
description: Monday, Nov. 3, 1975

title: Youth Held for British Fire
description: BRIGHTON, England, Nov. 3 (AP)A 22yearold student has been charged with causing a fire that badly damaged the music room of the Brighton Pavilion, one of Britain's most popular tourist attractions. The police said there appeared to be no political motive for the action yesterday by Leonard R. Kirzynowski of Brighton, who threw a fire bomb through a window of the villa that King George IV built while he was Prince Regent.

title: Mr. Ford Reaches Both Ways
description: The hand that sacrificed Nelson Rockefeller to the right wing of the Republican Partyif that is what Gerald Ford has donealso reached out strongly to the moderate Republican center. At first glance, the result seems to strengthen Mr. Ford's chances for renomination, and to raise the possibility of a Gerald FordRonald Reagan ticket next year.

title: Study Says Lottery Funds In Banks Earn No Interest
description: As much as $5 million in state lottery income has lain in New York banks without collecting interest while the banks earned a fee for handling the money, investigators for the State Assembly charged yesterday.

title: Ford's Timetable Is Upset in Shakeup
description: Continued From Page 1, Col. 4

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 4, 1975

title: BROOKHOUSER DIES; NEWSMAN, AUTHOR
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3 (AP)Frank Brookhouser, columnist and newsman here for 39 years, died today of a heart attack at his home. He was 63 years old.

title: Honduran Peasant Organizers Report Large.Seizures of Land
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras. Nov. 3 (AP)Peasant organiiers said today that a Government landdistribution proposal had been rejected and that 800 peasants had seized 3.700 acres of private and public land over the weekend.

title: Attempt to Depose Miller Is Made by Miners
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3An internal political struggle in the United Mine Workers against the leadership of Ar nold R. Miller. the reformer who won the union presidency nearly thre years ago, broke into public view today with: the disclosure of an abortive, attempt to oust him from offire.

title: ExPentagon Chief Met With President Saturday
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3On the day before his abrupt dismissal as Secretary of Defense, James R. Schlesinger began dropping hints to President Ford that he was prepared to resign if the White House did not approve what he regarded as an adequate defense budget.

title: Staubach's Folly Rare and Costly
description: Crisp, clean Roger Staubach, a devout Catholic who has been described as saintly, was in a confessional frame of mind yesterday in Dallas. The Cowboys guarterback startled About Pro Football his teammates and himself when he threw elbows and fists at Pat Fischer, the Redskins cornerback, at the wrong moment in the overtime game won by Washington, 3024, on Sunday. He was caught and penalized 15 yards for a personal foul.

title: But Credit Rates Are Up on a Light Turnover
description: Prime rate reductions to the 7 per cent level spread, as expected, yesterday to other major commercial banks. In the credit market themselves, however, interest rates moved up as prices declined in light trading. Credit Banks that joined Markets in the  point cut in the rate charged their largest business borrowers included the Bank of America. the nation's largest commercial bank, the Chase Manhattan Bank, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, the First National Bank of Chicago, and the Philadelphia National Bank.

title: Bridge:
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 3As a result of the international team trials of the American Contract Bridge League that ended here yesterday, American representation in next summer's world team championship in Monte Carlo will have a new look. Playing in the Bermuda Bowl, representing North America, will be an interesting mixture of experienced talent and new blood.

title: Behind the President's Moves: Push for a New Arms Accord
description: Continued From Page 1, Col. 7

title: New York Uncertainties Trouble Investors
description: The unknown effects of expected default by New York City depressed stock prices yesterday in sluggish trading.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Brooklyn Academy Updating a Theater
description: Hundreds of openings pockmark the rough cement floor of the Music Hall in the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Loose strings of wire and slivers of lumber litter the area formerly filled by 1,100 seats. Overhead from the highly designed plaster ceiling hang bare light bulbs. And behind the balcony carpenters work to create a projection room where none existed before.

title: Relocated Employees Miss New York's Stimulation
description: Tim McCaffrey used to read his newspaper from cover to cover on the commuter train from Ossining, N. Y., to Manhattan. But his company moved to Greenwich, Conn., in 1974 and now he spends only five or 10 minutes reading the paper.

title: Laurel Race Adds Shady Character
description: Shady Character's victory in yesterday's Knickerbocker at Belmont Park earned the colt berth in next Saturday's $150,000 Washington, D.C. International, a 1mile turf event at Laurel.

title: Alrick Man Jr., ExTennis Star And Davis Cup Captain, Dies
description: Alrick H. Man Jr., a prominent tennis official for many years and an influential figure in the management of United States Davis Cup teams, died Saturday in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital after a heart attack. He was 83 years old.

title: Today Is Election Day; Some Services Affected
description: Today is Election Day. The following is a list of services that are affected.

title: Violations Charged In 25 Food Places By City Inspectors
description: The Health Department has named 25 more food businesses for violating the Health Code and, warned that they faced closing if violations persisted upon a second and final visit by its inspectors. The names of the establishments and the actions taken follow:

title: Behind the Rangers
description: Of all the species of New York sports freaks, those who root for the Rangers are the most complex. They are the most vocal and the most demonstrative, the most impatient and the most impetuous, the most emotional and the most embarrassed the most fickle and, most of all, the most frustrated. To the tune of what is known as The Rangers Victory Song, some fans now chorus, Oh, it's been 35 years oh, it's been 35 years. meaning the span since 1940 when the Rangers last filled the Stanley Cup with champagne, an event that inspired that Sports of The Times ditty by J. Fred Coots, a songwriter somewhat better known for Love Letters in the Sand. Since then, the Rangers often have Performed as if J. Fred Muggs was their inspiration. Now at the beginning of their 50th season in the National Hockey League, the Rangers have incensed their loyalists by not only reverting to their most incompetent form but also by holding a clearance sale three popular players for $30,000, a used defenseman and a future draft choice. Well sometimes popular players. all the turmoil in the lost week, perhaps the most meaningful words were uttered h. Ed Giacomin as he unbuckled Tina goaltender's pads in the Detroit Red Wings locker room at Madison Situate Garden on Sunday night.

title: Lambert Brussels Raises William D. Witter Stake
description: The Lamhert Brussels Corporation, a subsidiary of Banque Bruxelles Lambert, has raised its investment in William D. Witter Inc., a researchoriented brokeraee house, Wall Street Letter reported yesterday. Neither company could he reached for comment, although Witter reported earlier this year that Lambert held a $3.2million investment in the company, amounting to a 20 percent in terest.

title: Horse Show Takes Over At Garden
description: At 10 A.M., Vince Wholey will sound a call on a fourfoot mail coach horn and the National Horse Show will start an eightday run in Madison Square Garden.

title: King Getting Waldheim Plea
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y.. Nov. 3Secretary General Kurt Waldheirr, sent a special representative to Morocco tonight with an appeal to King Hucsein II to call of the planner; rnare'n he Nloroccanc into Spanish Sahara.

title: SWEEPING CHANGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 President Ford tonight confirmed sweeping changes in his national security hierarchy and also announced he would nominate Elliot L. Richardson to succeed Rogers C. B. Morton as Secretary of Commerce.

title: Judge Runs Away, Thwarting a Holdup by 6 Youths
description: A Brooklyn Criminal Court judge yesterday thwarted an attempt by six youths to rob him near his home in Flatbush when he turned and ran instead of complying with a demand to surrender his money.

title: Mulligan, Baker And Hamilton Play At Carnegie Hall
description: The headlining of Gerry Mulligan, Chet Baker and Chico Hamilton at a Carnegie Hall concert on Sunday evening promised a reunion of threequarters of the Mulligan Quartet, formed 23 years ago in Los Angeles, which set the tone for what became known as West Coast jazz. Although the reunion did take placebriefly, for two numbersthe provocative point of the evening was the emergence of what might be a new aspect of Mr. Mulligan.

title: Cum Laude Commerce Chief
description: Not many officeholders in the nation's history have held as many highlevel Government positions for so short time as has Elliot Ler Richardson the 55yearold Ambassador to Britain. who was named by President Ford tonight as his choice to succeed Rogers C. B. Morton as Secretary of Commerce.

title: A CROWD PROTESTS INJURY OF SUSPECT
description: A 23pearold East Harlem man was unconscious and in critical condition at Metropolitan Hospital yesterday as a result of injuries sustained during his arrest late Wednesday by Housing Authority policemen who were breaking up a street craps game.

title: Tunney Lists Income
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) Senator John V. Tunney. Democrat of California. issued today a personal financial statement listing 1974 income of $76,175.

title: Books of The Times
description: I am sufficiently interested in Samuel Johnson to have read with pleasure what he ate and how he slept when he went on a tour in the Hebrides with Boswell. On learning that Boswell's friend Malone had persuaded him to omit some of their meals, I was disappointed. I have always enjoyed a mental picture of Johnson's rejecting cold sheep's head that had been sent to him for breakfast, by someone who could afford better. The doctor remarked that was not a fit repast for a gentleman.

title: Press Club Protests Plan To Keep Ford Talk Closed
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 3 (AP)A local press club protested today White House plans to bar reporters from an editors meeting to he addressed by President Ford.

title: SIX YOUTHS CHARGED WITH MANSLAUGHTER
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., Nov. 3Six youths are being held in the Ulster County Jail for preliminary hearing Wedneday on charges of manslaughter and robbery in connection with the death of Kenneth Taylor, 21 years old, of Rosendale.

title: Rebuilding Blamed for Rangers
description: You couldn't blame the National Hockey League if it old a doubletake yesterday. The report trickled in that that the Detroit Red Wings had finally won a game on the road as Ed About Pro Hockey Giacomin l e d them to an emotional 64 victory over his old team. the New York Rangers.

title: MATTEL SETTLES 5 CLASS LAWSUITS
description: HAWTHORNE, Calif., Nov. 3  Mattel Inc., the world's largest toy manufacturer, announced today that it had reached an outofcourt settlement in five classaction shareholder suits that would distribute $30 million to shareholders.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
10Hour Nursery School Eases Burden of Parents Who Work
description: Because of this school, beve become more geared to pursuing my own career, Shirley Longshore said as she brought her daughter to the Childen's All Day School. It's hard for working mothers to get themselves together about their children without a situation like this.

title: Mixed Impact From Moves Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The temptation is to say that Vice President Rockefeller's decision not to accept the VicePresidential nomination next year

title: Ford Doesn't Mention 2 Aides Were Ousted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 President Ford announced two new nominees for his Administration tonight without saying that he had dismissed the men who were being replaced.

title: Preston and Williams Star as Linebackers
description: Ray Preston remembers the day I was turned down by Penn State as a sad one.

title: Contract Awards
description: A $53.4million contract for trucks has been received by the Chrysler Corporation from the Army.

title: Franco Has an Operation To Stem Hemorrhaging
description: MADRID, Tuesday, Nov. 4; Generalissimo Francisco Franco, underwent a threehour emergency operation last night to halt largescale hemorrhaging in his stomach. Early this, morning his doctors said his vital signs had become normal but that the prognosis was very grave.

title: DR. JOSEPH WEITZ
description: Dr. Joseph Weitz, professor of psychology at New York University, where he was coordinator of the graduate program in industrial psychology, died of cancer Sunday at his home, 7 Washington Mews. He was 59 years old.

title: Three Rescued at Sea
description: WRIGHTSVILLE BEACH, N.C., Nov. 3 (AP)Three Canadians described as physically and emotionally drained were taken aboard a Coast Guard cutter today after drifting for several days on the high seas in the 31foot sloop Klu Anne. The three were identified as the skipper, Pierre Accelin; Dave McNaught and Reginald Stock.

title: CAROLA LEVY KAUFMANN
description: Carole Levy Kaufmann, founder and former president of the Women's International Zionist Organization of Switzerland, died yesterday in New Rochelle (N.Y.) Hospital. She was 82 years old and lived in New Rochelle.

title: Winner to Stay As Jets
description: The most distraught Jet fan of all, the team's president, Phil Iselin, said yesterday he would not dismiss Coach Charley Winner this season.

title: Prices Fall on Amex and OTC Amid City Default Uncertainties
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market dropped yesterday in light trading.

title: U.S. High Court Rejects Podell and Gross Pleas
description: The Supreme Court of the United states yesterday refused to consider appals from Bertram L. Podell, a former Democratic Representative from Brooklyn, and Nelson G. Cross, a former New Jersey Republican chairman, ooth of whom have been seeking to avoid imprisonmant.

title: Clash in Himalayas Confirmed by China; Indians Are Blamed
description: PEKING, Nov. 3The Chinese Government acknowl edged today that guards at a border checkpost had killed four Indian soldiers last month but said the Indians had crossed into Chinese territory and fired first.

title: Hockey Scoring
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: A Call by Witness Saves Man Beaten By 6 TeenAgers
description: A 62yearold Bronx man walking home before dawn yesterday was set upon by six teenagers and robbed, stabbed, kicked and beaten, the police said.

title: Problem for Busy Senator: Being in 3 Places at Once
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3It was just one minute before JO A.M. when Senator Walter F. Mondale left his office and, trailed by a top aide, walked down a maze of nearby deserted marble corridors to the klieglit Senate Caucus Room.

title: Diamond Crystal To Increase Price On Its Salt by 8%
description: The Diamond Crystal Salt Company announced yesterday that it would raise evaporated salt prices by 8 per cent, effective Dec. 1.

title: Ford to See Alaska Pipeline
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 3 (AP)President Ford and Secretary of State Henry Kissinger will tour the trans Alaska pipeline on the way to their postThanksgiving visit to China.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: GoldCoin Sales Ordered Halted

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Thousands Jam Opening Of Alexander's New Store
description: As thousands of shoppers swarmed into the 13th and newest store in the Alexander's retail chain, the president, Alexander Farkas, said yesterday that New York City may not be a growing retail market, but with its dense population it is still a very viable market for lame stores like ours.

title: Iraq Executes an Israeli On Charges of Espionage
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Nov. (Reuters)An Israeli of Dutch origin has been hanged here for spying for Israel, the Iraqi press agency said today. The man, Alexander Haroun, was tried by a revolutionary tribunal here last month.

title: ACIDTOSSING CASE BRINGS ACQUITTAL
description: A 26yearold Brooklyn Irian has been acquitted by reason of insanity of a charge of blinding and disfiguring the 4 yearold son of his family's nextdoor neighbors.
