description: TAYLORBertha Louisa. Dearest Mother veers, Weyer In my thoghts and heat Bet.

title: Behind Shift: Push for Arms Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Although President Ford treated the subject of detente cautiously tonight, the dramatic personnel shifts he announced ap

title: Miss Hamlin Wins By Shot in Japan
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 3 (AP)  Shelly Hamlin recorded the first victory of her threeyear professional golfing career today when she won the $100,000 Japan Classic, a Ladies Professional Golf Association event, by one stroke. She shot a closing 71, two under par, for a 54hole total of 218.

title: French Utility Signs Pact For Transit of Soviet Gas
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 ((AP)Gaz de France, the staterun utility. said today It had signed an agreement for the transportation of Soviet natural gas to Germany and France with companies in West Germany and Austria.

title: Colby Says He Leaves With No Hard Feelings
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 3 (AP)William E. Colby, the ousted Director of Central Intelligence says he has turned down a very nice ambassadorship and is getting out of Government with no hard feelings despite his abrupt dismissal.

title: A Breezy Head of the C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 3Shortly after arriving in Peking last fall as chief of the American liaison office, George Herbert Walker Bush astonished fellow diplomats by arriving at official receptions on a bicycle instead of in a limousine.

title: Rockefeller Down
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller, who won confirmation as Vice President less than a year ago after prolonged and controversial hearings, has now removed his name from future consideration for that office. Mr. Rockefeller's surprising withdrawal is the central event in a power shakeup that leaves the Ford Administration looking weak and beleaguered.

title: NO LIABILITY FOUND IN IRA HAUPT CASE
description: A sixmember jury has decided that officers of the New York Produce Exchange, the Bunge Corporation, the Continental Grain Company and Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc. were not liable for alleged irregularities that led to the saladoil swindle of 1963.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A portion of southbound roadway on the New Jersey Turnpike's westerly meadow route will be closed to traffic today to allow for repairs to a sign bridge over the roadway near Interchange 15W in Kearny.

title: Overseas Units of U.S. Banks Share Lag in Gaining Assets
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) The Federal Reserve Board said todal that foreign branches of United States banks accumulated assets at a slower rate last year.

title: What We Are Cheering For
description: A man sat in a New York City court the other day and watched a judge set free an assortment of rogues, scoundrels and misdemeanants for lack of evidence. The police who had arrested them failed to show up. The city had fired them to cut expenses.

title: Transcript of President's News Conference on Domestic and Foreign Matters
description: Good evening. Will you please sit down. I have several announcements to make tonight.

title: Bankers Advance Deadline On Massachusetts Budget
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (AP)Bankers have given Massachusetts a deadline of this weekend for passage of a new state budget. the Senate president, Kevin B. Harrington, said tonight.

title: Westport and Its Neighbors In a LongSimmering Feud
description: WESTPORT, Conn.  The usually well hidden but sometimes bitter animosity between this affluent community and its less wealthy neighbors broke into the open for a few brief moments last month. Then it disappeared from view again, leaving only polite smiles to mark the place where the apparent tranquility of suburbia had been disturbed.

title: TV: A 7 O'Clock Debut
description: The one nice thing about waking up in an Atlanta hotel to watch the 7 o'clock debut of Good Morning, America, yesteday was that the local ABC affiliate carries only one of two hours being fed to a yawning nation. One was quite enough for anybody to sniff the essence of this new mongrel sprung whole from the head of a research computer.

title: MUTUAL DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Vice President Rockefeller added today to the sudden upheaval within the Ford Administration by saying that he would not be the President's running mate in 1976.

title: Venezuela's Oil Output Off
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 3 (AP)Venezuela's daily crude oil production for 1975 averaged 2.4 million barrels through Oct. 29, the Mines and Hydrocarbons Ministry has reported. The daily production figure was down 18.98 percent or 570,528 barrels a day compared ;with the 3 million barrels a day production for the same period last year, the ministry said.

title: Homebuilding Contracts Rise by 21%
description: Contracts for residential building valued at $2.97 billion in September were 21 per cent above the level of September 1974, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday. The increase was the first such rise in 26 months, indicating a revival in home building it said.

title: HalfTon Turtle Caught
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, (UPI)A giant turtle estimated to be 200 years old and of a nearly extinct species was captured off the Brazilian coast and ended up as soup. The 1,100pound turtle was captured by fishermen in a net and fishing regulatory authorities pondered for five hours before authorizing its slaughter.

title: Soviet Show on Siberia Opens in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 3  A rare chance to glimpse the official Soviet view of Siberianot as a cold wasteland of the human spirit but as a new, expanding frontier of achievement is being offered here in an exhibition called Scientific Siberia.

title: Lisbon Cautiously Trying to Curb Communist Influence
description: LISBON, Nov. 3The Government of Portugal, backed by nonCommunist parties, has opened a slow but concerted campaign to curb Communist influence in many areas of Portuguese life.

title: Ford Food Stamp Plan Assailed As Deficient for Diet of Elderly
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Older Americans and administrators of organizations that represent them told a Senate hearing today tit the elderly vsculd It:A be able to e adequately if the Department of Agriculture ins??ed the food stamp benefit reduction plan it proposed.

title: Clues to China's Political Life Sought Below Surface Tranquillity
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 2 With Peking's leaders repeatedly proclaiming their devotion to moderate goals of stability and economic growth, it has been a quiet

title: Shady Character, $8, Victor
description: In what might well have been considered the celebration of an anniversary, Ogden Mills Phipps's Shady Character won the $56,500 Knickerbocker Handicap at Belmont Park yesterday. At the Race Tracks Shady Character's finish in the 1mile turf race marked the first time he had reached the winner's circle in a stakes event since his triumph in the same event last year.

title: BOEING NET GAINS 0.6% IN 3D QUARTER
description: The Boeing Company. the nation's leading producer of commercial and military aircraft and missiles, reported yesterday earnings gains of 0.6 percent for the third quarter and 4.9 percent for the first nine months of the year. Sales for these periods, however. were down 13.1 per cent and 1.8 percent, respectively.

title: M.A.C. Weighs Proposal for a Trade of Notes for Its Securities
description: Municipal Assistance Corporation officials have scaled down a plan to use union pension funds to borrow money for the city and have combined it with another proposal for averting defaulta voluntary exchange of outstanding city notes for M.A.C. bonds.

title: Advertising
description: After six years, five complete rewritings and some very stiff editing by David Ogilvy, Kenneth Roman's and Jane Maas's little 156page howto book for advertisers has finally been printed.

title: Rockefeller Seen. Leaving State G.O.P. Leaderlessil
description: The leadership of the New York Republican Party, which has been dominated by Nelson A. Rockefeller for nearly two decades and will he up for grabs if the Vice President is a lame duck stunned New York Republican leaders agreed yesterday.

title: HIGH COURT SETS RAIL RATE RULING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The Supreme Court said today it would review a decision barring the Interstate Commerce Commission from withholding a nationwide freight rate increase from any railroad that refused to spend the money as the I.C.C. directed.

title: WHIM REJECTS OPPOSITION OFFER
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 31 Australia's Opposition parties today modified their demand that Prime Minister Gough Whitlam hold a national election in return for their acceptance of the Government budget, but their new proposal was rejected by Mr. Whitlam.

title: Be on Hand
description: Governor Carey yesterday notified the leaders of the State Legislature to be prepared and on hand in Albany to resume the special legislative session next Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Vice President's Letter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI)Following is the text of Vice President Rochefeller's letter, delivered to the White House today, telling President Ford he will not be his 1976 running mate:

title: RETIREMENT AT 65 BACKED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The Supreme Court upheld today as constitutional a Louisiana law that requires state civil service employees to retire at age 65.

title: Harris Poll Shows Decline Of 3% in Ford's Popularity
description: President Ford's rating with the American people has slumped again to a 5938 percent negative margin, the Harris poll reported yesterday. This represents a drop of 3 percent from September.

title: Mayors From Pago Pago to Paris Agree New York's Woes Will Be Theirs, Too
description: All the mayors of the world are the same, said Andre Michel Epee, the Mayor of Douala, Cameroon, surveying the 30 other foreign Mayors sitting with him on a bus going up the Avenue of the Americas yesterday.

title: Ford Camoaizn Aides Named
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) Two men were named today to become deputy managers of President Ford's 1976 campaign. Howard H. Callaway, the campaign manager, appointed Stuart Spencer. 48 years old, a political consultant of Long Beach, Calif., and Robert Marik, 39, a former Administration official of Los Angeles.

title: Newspaper Guild at The Times Breaks Off Talks on a Contract
description: The Newspaper Guild unit a The New York Times broke of negotiations yesterday until, spokesman said, The Times ready to engage in meaningfu negotiations for a new con. tract.

title: Xerox to Lay Off 500 to Cut Costs, Mainly in Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 3 (AP)The Xerox Corporation, the giant producer of office copying machines, said today it would dismiss 500 salaried employees this month as part of a continuing cost reduction effort.

title: ABC News Cuts Its Documentary Schedule in Half
description: Partly as a result of economic austerities throughout the American Broadcasting Companies, Inc., ABC News has cut its schedule of news documentaries in half for 1976 and has resleased 21 employees in the production unit, including four producers.

title: Doctors Are Using Charcoal in Tests to Reduce Artificial Kidney Treatments
description: Doctors in Brooklyn and at medical centers elsewhere in the world are prescribing charcoal and similar chemical blotters in experiments designed to reduce the frequency of artificial kidney treatments and to develop an effective therapy for chronic liver disease.

title: Striking Doctors In Chicago Hospital Ask Aid of N.L.R.B.
description: CHICAGO. Nov. 3 (AP)Striking doctors and internes at one of the nation's largest health centers have asked the National Labor Relations Board to settle their walkout at Cook County Hospital, officials said today. A decision on whether the board would enter the dispute was expected Wednesday.

title: Industrialist Frees Himself After Abduction From Home
description: LAPEER, Mich., Nov. 3 (AP) Eugene Vesely, president of the Vesely Corporation, which, manufactures Apache camping trailers, was reported safe to, day after escaping an abduction, attempt, according to the Mich, igan state police.

title: Rizzo Victory Believed Sure in Philadelphia Today
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3It this city where American politics virtually began, the current mayoral race ended today with minimum suspense and maxi mum indifference.

title: Advance Party's Flight To China Is Scrubbed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI)An advance party ordered by the White House to go to Peking to map out President Ford's scheduled trip to China hoarded a plane today and then was told to debark, White House officials said.

title: fudge Runs Away, Thwarting a Holdup by 6 Youths
description: A Brooklyn Criminal Court judge yesterday thwarted an attempt by six youths to rob him near his home in Flatbush when he turned and ran instead of complying with a demand to surrender his money.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Stanley Kramer reported from Hollywood that he has paid $250,000 for movie rights to The Domino Principle, the novel by Adam Kennedy published in September by Viking Press. Mr. Kramer also said that the author now is working on screenplay of the book, which deals with a man serving a life term in prison, who is secretively released by shadowy but powerful types and is forced into becoming the assassin of an important governmental figin national conpiracy.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 4, 1975

title: State Says 32% of Relief Ineligibles Are Entitled to Some Form of Welfare
description: Nearly onethird of welfare families labeled ineligible in the latest statewide audit by the State Department of Social Services are in fact eligible for some form of help, such as home relief, the state agency said yesterday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Rock Island Allowed To Lease Grain Cars
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3 (UPI)The bankrupt Chicago, Rock Island & Pacific Railroad was given permission today to lease 300 covered hopper cars to help move this year's bumber Midwest grain harvest.

title: Business Briefs
description: VIENNA, Nov. 3 (UPI)Economic experts of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries opened discussions today on oil price premiums that could lead minor reductions in crude oil prices.

title: Viking Flight to Mars Is Periled By Trouble in Electrical System
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI) Electrical trouble has developed in one of two Viking spacecraft heading toward landings on Mars next summer in the first attempt to search for life on another planet, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration reported today.

title: Byrne and Labor Leaders Hopeful of Bond Approval
description: TRENTON, Nov. 3Byrne administration leaders and officials of organized labor in New Jersey expressed hope this evening that their economic arguments in favor of the administration's proposed $922 million bond issue would overcome anticipated public opposition in tomorrow's referendum.

title: Nation's. New Defense Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3There are people in Washington who find him a little frightening in his seeming ambition, and there are others who like him so much

title: RICHARD W. INCE
description: Richard W. Ince, chairman of the Haas Securities Corporation, died Sunday night at his home, 10 Plateau Circle, Bronxville, N.Y. He was 70 years old.

title: Drive for W omen's Rights Culminates at Polls Today
description: On to the streets! On with the leaflets! shouted City Council President Paul O'Dwyer, and a crowd of placardcarrying officials swarmed into midday midtown crowds yesterday to urge support of the women's rights amendment that will be on the New York State ballot today.

title: Franco Has an Operation To Stem Hemorrhaging
description: MADRID, Tuesday, Nov. 4Generalissimo Francisco Franco underwent a threehour emergency operation last night to halt large cale hemorrhaging in the stomach. Early this morning his doctors said his vital signs had become normal but that the prognosis was ver grave.

title: Infirmary Will Observe 100 Years at Its Site
description: The New York Infirmary, 321 East 15th Street, will mark on Nov. 16 the 100th anniversary of its move to its present site on Stuyvesant Square with outdoor and indoor ceremonies featuring Helen Hayes and a luncheon for more than 100 guests.

title: Memorial Service For Stengel Today
description: A service in honor of the memory of Casey Stengel, the former manager of the Yankees and Mets who died last month, will be held today at St. Patrick's Cathedral at 11 A.M. Terence Cardinal Cooke will preside.

title: October Car Output Is the Best of Year, But Off From 1974
description: DETROIT, Nov.  The United States auto industry built 749,947 cars in October. off 11.1 percent from 843,973 in the same month of 1974 but still the best production for any month of 1975.

title: People and Business
description: Price cutting on Wall Street by brokers has developed into a maior concern.

title: Equal Rights Amendment Is Stirring Controversy
description: TRENTON, Nov. 3The campaign to strengthen women's rights in New Jersey by adding an equal rights amendment to the State Constitution has generated high emotions and widespread confusion among voters. As a result, leaders of both factions believe their campaigns have failed to persuade voters of their merit.

title: FORD'S TIMETABLE UPSET IN SHAKEUP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The strategy behind Vice President Rockefeller's withdrawal, the dismissal of Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger and other possible moves yet to come is to put a distinct Ford imprimatur on his Administration's domestic and foreign policies, Administration sources said today.

title: Chess:
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 2Efim Geller pressed on powerfully, scoring 93 to open a clear lead after 14 rounds of the Alekhine Memorial Tournament here in the Railwaymen's House of Culture.

title: DOLLAR ABROAD OFF ON MOST MARKETS
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 3 (UPI)The dollar remained on a downward trend on most European money markets today, adversely affected by declining United States interest rates and uncertainties about New York City's financial future.

title: Jazz on Upbeat, Thanks to Moore and Maravich
description: How can the New Orleans Jazz be leading the Central Division of the National Basketball Association and have won five straight games after an opening loss? After all, the are the About Pro Basketball Jazz who as an expansion team last season lost 15 of their first 16 games and failed to gain their fifth victory until Jan. 17. With the exception of Ron Behagen, who came from Kansas City in the offseason for a firstround draft choice, the Jazz starting lineup is the same that finished with a 2359 wonlost record, the worst in the league.

title: DR. OSCAR GINDER
description: Dr. Oscar Ginder, clinical pro. fessor of fixed prosthodontics at the New York University College of Dentistry, died yesterday in Flower and Fifth Avenue hospitals at 65 years of age, He lived at 30210 66th Road, Forest Hills, Queens, and practiced at 57 West 57th Street.

title: MUTUAL DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Vice President Rockefeller added today to the sudden upheaval within the Ford Administration by saying that he would not be the President's running mate in 1976.

title: Wood,Field&Stream
description: I am perhaps unjustified in criticizing it so belatedly, but I now object to the word harvest when applied to same shot by hunters.

title: Beirut CeaseFire Marred By Sniper Fire and Blasts
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. Nov. 3The latest ceasefire, the 12th !since mid  September. was marred today by continued sniper fire and explosions, but Prime Minister Rashid Karam expressed confidence that the long factional strife would soon end.

title: Autopsy Shows Pasolini Died After Being Run Over
description: ROME, Nov. 3 (UPI)An autopsy today showed that Pier Paolo Pasolini, the film director, was still alive when run over by his confessed killer, a 17yearold delinquent.

title: NATO Reported to Feel It Is Losing Strong Ally
description: LONDON. Nov. 3European nations reacted with surprise and uneasiness today to news of President Ford's dismissal of Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger.

title: Upstate G.O.P. Bemoans Typos in Ad
description: An advertisement for the Ulster County Republican Party in the Kingston (N.Y.) Daily Freeman raised readers eyebrows on Sunday and, for voters on this election day, may once again put Abe Lincoln's epigram to the test.

title: Clash Indicated on 1975 Start for Hearst Trial
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Nov. 3Patricia Hearst's defense lawyers and her prosecutors oatshed today in a coed conference over whether her trial will bezin before the end of the year it appeared rem comments made after the meetinz

title: Todd Believes Republicans. Will Not Capture Assembly
description: NEWARK, Nov. 3Webster B. Todd, the state Republican chairman, said today it would be a miracle if his party captured control of the State Assembly in tomorrow's gener al elections.

title: New Air Canada Plan
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 3 (UPI)Air Canada is planning an ex. perimental, lowcost weekend night coach excursion fare linking Toronto and Montreal with Miami. The service is scheduled to begin Jan. 2, subject to ap proval by Canadian and Ameri can aviation authorities. Basic return fare between Toronto and Miami will be $119 and between Montreal and Miami $133.

title: Name Dropped From Ballot
description: The name of Hyman Silverglad, who had been listed as a candidate for Civil Court in Manhattan's second district, will be taped over on voting machines, a Board of Elections spokesman said yesterday. Mr. Silverglad's name was ordered removed by Supreme Court Justice George Postel on the ground that the candidate had not met the statutory requirement that a candidate must have been admitted to the bar more than 10 years previously.

title: Stage: Wail for the 60's
description: The sack of Camelot, a wail for the sixties, the disillusionment of an Empire, the detritus of a tattered age, a remembrance of sins past, all that, popped into a mixture of cocaine, cola and cyanide, is the heady mixture of Robert Patrick's play Kennedy's Children. It opened at the John Golden Theater last night after a history that mieht be called checkered.

title: Bianchi Dismissed As Squires Coach
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 3 (UPI)Al Bianchi was dismissed tonight as head coach of the Virginia Squires, the American Basketball Association club he has directed since 1969. An injured guard, Mack Calvin, was appointed interim head coach.

title: Reagan Shocked at Schlesinger Ouster
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Ronald said today thai he was shocked by the Ford Administration's dismissal of Defense Secretary James R. Schlesineer.

title: U.S. ACTS TO CURB MORTGAGE ABUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) The. Department of Housing and Urban Development announced today that the Government intended to suspend the nation's largest mortgage company from issuing new mortgages insured by the Federal Housing Administration.

title: Patent Treaty Approved
description: WASHINGTON (UPI) The House of Representatives voted final Congressional approval today of a treaty providing for international processing of patent applications. The measure; was approved on a 3495 vote and cleared the Senate earlier by voice vote. The treaty provides for centralized filing procedures of patents and a standardized application format.

title: CANADA'S POOR GET HOMEBUILDING AID
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 3The Canadian Government, in a new move to stimulate the economy announced today a program of financial assistance to home builders, especially the lowpaid.

title: SWEEPING CHANGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 President Ford tonight confirmed sweeping changes in his (national security heirarchy and also announced he would nomMate Elliot L. Richardson to succeed Rogers C. B. Morton as Secretary of Commerce.

title: HEARINGS STARTED ON POLICE SCHEDULE
description: A threemember impasse panel appointed by the city's Office of Collective Bargaining began hearings yesterday on the longdisputed attempt by the city to add 18 days a year to the work schedule of police officers by cutting work shifts from eight and a half hours to eight hours.

title: U.S. Study Raises Questions. About Safety of Cosmetics
description: In 1970, the National Commission on Product Safety estimated that there were 60,000 injuries a year caused by cosmetics, a figure that the cosmetics industry labeled a gross exaggeration.

title: Summary of the Various Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The Supreme Court, with Justice William O. Douglas taking no part, took the following actions today: ATTORNEYS

title: Mother of U.S. EqualRights Measure Nearly Penniless in Nursing Horne at 90
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Nov. 3On the eve of the vote on Equal Rights Amendments in New York and New Jersey, the author of the original Federal version is near destitution, recovering from stroke at a nursing home here.

title: PALESTINE ISSUE TAKEN UP AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Nov. 3A leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization opened the General Assembly debate on the Palestinian question today with a warning to the United States that his guerrilla movement had the endorsement of our friend, the Soviet Union.

title: Election Day
description: Below is a recapitulation of The Times recommendations for today's elections in New York City, Nassau County and New Jersey. Asterisks denote incumbents.

title: 28 LEFTISTS SEIZED IN SPANISH REGION
description: LA CORUNA, Spain, Nov. 3 (Reuters)  The police in this northwestern Spanish city said tonight that they had arrested 28 persons as members of the Spanish Communist Party and the Maoist Revolutionary AntiFascist Patriotic Front.

title: Mixed Impact From Moves Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The temptation is to say that Vice President Rockefeller's decision not to accept the VicePresidential nomination next year has solved one of President Ford's chief problems. That was an interpretation encouraged by officials of the President Ford Committee, one of whom said that the biggest millstone is off the President's neck now. and some politicians appeared initially to agree.

title: Notes on People
description: Following his day of talks with President Ford. President Anwar elSadat of Egypt rested in ,lacksonvilie and worked on the speech he was make to a joint session of Congress today. But his family was off to Disney World for the day that the enourage of young people had been talking about, according to Americans in charge of the tour, ever since they arrived here. The group includes the three Sadat daughters, 21yearold Lubna, Noha, 18, and Jihan, 15; the son, Gamal, 19, a student at the American University in Cairn: the husbands of the two older daughters, Garnet's girl friend and Jihan's fiance, Mahmoud Osman, an engineer.

title: Statement by Hills On Lawyers
description: Cyrus R. Vance, president of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York, took issue yesterday with a statement made by Roderick M. Hills, the new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, that it was the universal practice of big New York law firms to bribe court clerks to get case files. Mr. Hills's statement was made at is recent meeting with reporters! land editors of The New York; Times, and reported in the Times yesterday.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN BIDS FOR A NEWS GROUP
description: JOHANNESBURG. South Africa, Nov. 3 (Reuters)A fertilizer magnate, Louis Luyt, has raised his offer by a third in his bid to take over one of South Africa's biggest englishlanguage newspaper groups. His latest offer is 11.6 million rands or $13 million. [The increased offer was rejected, Agence FrancePresse renorted.]

title: Vessel With Cargo For Israel Arrives In Eilat From Suez
description: FILAT, Israel, Tuesday, Nov. 4 (UPI)The first Israeli cargo to nass through the Suez Canal in 14 years arrived at this Red Sea port early today aboard the Greek freighter Olympus.

title: M.A.C. Weighs Proposal for a Trade of Notes for Its Securities
description: Municipal Assistance Corporation officials have scaled down a plan to use union pension funds to borrow money for the city and have combined it with another proposal for averting defaulta voluntary exchange of outstanding city notes for M.A.C. bonds.

title: Mixed Impact From Moves Held Likely
description: Continued From Page 1, Col. 7

title: INDUSTRY SEEN HURT BY SHORTAGE OF GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) Most states probably can ride out this winter's expected shortage of natural gas by using other fuels, but industries in at least eight states may have to shut down, the Federal Energy Administration says.

title: NO CLUES FOUND IN PARK MURDER
description: Detectives Revisit Pond in Stabbing Death of Man, 48

title: U.S. Aide Heightens Power Plant Fight
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 3A key Federal official added verbal fuel today to the controversay over the proposed Kaiparowits power plant, a cornerstone or projected energy development in the Southwest.

title: Flow of Oil From North Sea Into Britain Is Inaugurated by Queen
description: ABERDEEN, Scotland, Nov. 3 (Reuters)Queen Elizabeth If pressed a button at a control panel here today to start the flow of oil into Britain from its vast deposits below the stormy North Sea. It was a symbolic opening as the field has been in operation for a month.

title: Jackson Sees Ford Ready To Favor OH Price Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UNI) Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, said today that House and Senate conferees on energy were sure to insist on a forced reduction of oil prices and he thinks President Ford will go along this time.

title: Women's Ordination Approved By Anglican Bishops of Canada
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 3The Anglican Bishops of Canada have voted overwhelmingly to permit the ordination of women as priests after Nov. 1, 1976, over the strong objections of [conservative clerics here and in the United States and other countries.

title: U.S. INVESTIGATING ALUMINUM MAKERS
description: The antitrust division of the Department of Justice confirmed reports yesterday that it was investigating the aluminum industry.

title: Market Place
description: Many investors who have been trading in calls on the options exchanges may be unaware that in the overthecounter market they can buy and sell puts in every stock for which there is a call market on the option exchanges.

title: Vilas, Kodes Upset
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 3 (AP) Graham Stillwell, 29yearold former British Davis Cup player, scored the first major upset in the $100,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament today with a 62, 62 victory over thirdseeded Guillermo Vilas of Argentina.

title: BANGLADESH HIT BY SHIFT IN ARMY
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 3The Government of President Khandaker Moshtaque Ahmed, who took control of Bagladesh in coup d'etat two and one half months ago, was shaken today by a shift of power within the country's military.

title: Three Seized in Bronx With Bootleg Cigarettes
description: The police have reported the arrest of three men znd he confiscation of 30,000 cartons untaxed cigerettesone of the largest such seizures in New York City in recent years.

title: Classmates Are Writing A Eulogy for Slain Girl
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. Martha Moxley was voted the girl with the best personality in her junior high school last year and yet she was stranger to many in this community until her murder Thursday night.

title: The Trauma of Default: A Wave Effect Beyond the Hudson
description: MINNEAPOLIS

title: Ford Campaign Aides Named
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) Two men were named today to become deputy managers of President Ford's 1976 campaign. Howard H. Callaway, the campaign manager, appointed Stuart Spencer. 48 years old, a political consultant of Long Beach, Calif., and Robert Marik. 39. a former Administration official of Los Angeles.

title: $1Million Won in Lottery By a Brooklyn Resident
description: RANDOLPH TOWNSHIP, N.J., Nov. 3 (AP)A Brooklyn man won $1 million here today, but was not on hand to collect it. On the other hand, a woman who flew in from Chicago won only $500.

title: Eritrean Rebel Groups Overcoming Differences
description: Emanuel was a machine gunner in the Eritrean Liberation Front until October of last year, when he refused to fight against the rival Popular Liberation Forces and was sentenced to death for insurrection.

title: 10% CROP DROP SEEN IN WESTERN EUROPE
description: BRUSSELS., Nov. 3 (AP)Western Europe will have its smallest grain crop sincr 1970. 10 per cent less than last year, the statistic, orrice of the Eurcpcni Common Market prodicted today.

title: U.S. Medical Supplies Are Going to Lebanon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The United States will supply Lebanon with $500,000 worth of disaster relief aid, particularly drugs and medicine, the State Department said today.

title: $2 Bill Will Return on April 13, Jefferson's Birthday
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The $2 bill will return to the pockets and purses of America in 1976 in an effort by the Treasury Department to commemorate the Bicentennial, save printing costs and make life little easier for the public.

title: Aspin Tells of Overruns On Five Air Force Projects
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP): Contractors for five major) Air Force research and developmerit programs spent $65.6 million more than Congress appropriated for them in the year ending last June 30. Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin said today.

title: TRIAL SET TODAY FOR MISS FROMME
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 3Lunette Alice Fromme will go on trial in Federal court here tomorrow on a charge that she attempted to assassinate President Ford Sept. 5 as he strolled across the Capitol grounds on his way to address the California Legislature.

title: Amid Uncertainty in Spain, College Youths Bide Time
description: MADRID. Nov. 3The universities are quiet now. Young) men in bright colored gym suits tramped in and out of the college hall, bouncing a bit on their shoes with spilling: energy. Others chatted easily, in the hall. There was no atmosphere of urgency or tension.

title: General Graham Is Said to Have Quit As the Chief of Defense Intelligence
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Lieut. Gen. Daniel O. Graham, chief of the Defense Intelligence Agency, which coordinates military intelligence, resigned today, according to senior defense and intelligence officials.

title: Clamdiggers and Texaco Settle on Damages in Spill
description: PORTLAND. Me. Nov. 3 (AP)A Federal judge today approved a $100,000 settlement by Texaco, Inc., to 33 clamdiggers for damages caused by 100,000gallon oil spill off the Maine coast three years ago.

title: Rock Doc
description: Dr. William Abruzzi, who was tagged as the rock doc few years ago for his treatment of drug users had trips at Woodstock, Powder Ridge and other rockmusic festivals. pleaded guilty yesterday to the sexual abuse of a 27yearold patient during a gynecological examination in his office at Wappingers Falls. N.Y.

title: Deputy in Kissinger's Place
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 3Lieut. Gen. Brent Seowcroft, the new director of the National Security Council, has a Ph.D. from Columbia University, is fluent in Russian and Serbian, has a fighter pilot's wings and has the reputation of being an efficient, selfeffacing professional.

title: Standing Room Has an Audience of Its Own
description: The lights dim, the curtain rises. And in the back of the orchestra seats, shoes are eased off and packages and bags slide to the floor. Another evening at the theater has begun, and another group of hardy theatergoers has elected to stand through a performance.

title: Guide
description: MAGYARS MIDTOWN An exhibition of paintings by Hungarianborn artists is at St. Peter's Church, 16 East 56th Street, whose cultural activities also include special musical programs and theateratnoon. The art show in the church gallery represents a variety of techniques and styles by paintermembers of the New York Feszek Club, a cultural and social organization stemming from the original Feszek Klub (Hungarian for Nest Club'), a wellknown rallying place for the artistic and literary elite of Budapest before World War 1.

title: JUDGE'S WIFE ASKS COURT TO BE SILENT
description: TRENTON, Nov. 3 (AP)A judge's wife argued, through her lawyer, in the State Supreme Court today, for her right to a public life of her own without that court's interference.

title: New Orders Drop, Paced by Durables
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP)The Commerce Department reported today that new orders received by manufacturers declined in September for the first time in six months, providing further evidence of a slowdown in economic growth.

title: Justices to Weigh Ford's Oil Import Fee
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether President Ford had authority to impose the $2abarrel fee on imported oil that he levied earlier this year on national security grounds.

title: Stage: Clumsy Elephant
description: THE ELEPHANT IN THE HOUSE. by Bertha Kerr. Directed by Marshall W. Mason; setting to John Lee Beatty; costumes by Jennifer Von Mayrhauser; lighting by Dennis Parlehy, music by Jonathan Hogan; sound by Check London and George Hansen: stage mananer, Susana Meyer. Presented by the Circle Repertory Company. At 99 Seventh Avenue South.

title: House Banking Committee Backs Guarantee for City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The House Banking Committee today approved, 23 to 16, legislation to authorize $7 billion in loan guarantees to New York City before or after default.

title: CHURCH COUNCIL DEBATES AWARD
description: In response to mounting protests against President Ford's opposition to Federal aid for New York City, the Board of Director's of the City Council of Churches met informally yesterday to consider withdrawing Mr. Ford's name as a recipient of one of its annual Family of Man awards.

title: F.B.I. Studies Dumping Of Factory's Equipment
description: WEST BABYLON, L.I., Nov. 3The Federal Bureau of Investigation has started an inquiry into why nearly $1 million worth of equipment in textile factory here was carted off to the town dump by local officials when the owner of the business apparently owed $575 in rental arrears.

title: FORD'S TIMETABLE UPSET IN SHAKEUP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The strategy behind Vice President Rockefeller's withdrawal, the dismiisal of Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger and other possible moves yet to come is to put a distinct Ford imprimatur on his Administration's domestic and foreign policies, Administration sources said today.

title: Shifted Workers Miss Stimulation
description: Tim McCaffrey used to read his newspaper from cover to cover on the commuter train from Ossining, N. Y., to Manhattan. But his company moved to Greenwich, Conn., in 1974, and now he spends only five or 10 miuntes reading the naner.

title: 2 College Student Groups To Press for Aid for City
description: ALBANY, Nov. 3 (AP)Two major student groups have begun a lobbying campaign for Federal loan guarantees to help New York City avert default.

title: Kissinger Up
description: If the displacement of Vice President Rockefeller enlarges President Ford's freedom to maneuver, it highly doubtful that he has achieved any political gain by dismissing Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger.

title: LONDON EXPLOSION IS 10TH IN 2 MONTHS
description: LONDON, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The 10th bomb to explode around London in two months devastated a lawyer's car today, but the owner survived.

title: At 110, Albanian Woman Looks to a New Life
description: Looking alert and brightyed, Mrika Mrnaci, an Albanonhorn woman who says she is 110 years old, filed an application yesterday for United States citizenship.

description: LONDON, Nov. 3 (AP);Merchant fleets of all nations iincreased by nearly 10 percent in the last 12 months to a total 342.2 million tons, double the figure for 1966, Lloyd'sRegister reported today.

title: REVISED OTIS BID FILED BY UNITED
description: The United Technologiesi Corporation said yesterday that; it had filed a new tender offer for Otis Elevator Company common stockwith the Securities and Exchange CommisI sion. The otter essentially the same Merger as the one it News withdrew last week, seeks to purchase any and all shares of Otis at $42 a share. Otis has approximately 8.1 million common shares outstand, ing.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Good design. That's for paintings or houses or maybe furniture. But what has it to do with clothes? More important these days are such code words as youthful, contemporary, wearable.

title: G.O.P. Indiana Aide Indicted
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 3 (AP) Buena Chaney, former Republican state chairman, was one of five persons indicted by a Marion County grand jury in vestigating political dirty tricks, the authorities said today. Mr., Chaney told The Indianapolis News he had been informed'or the indictment by telephone from the Vigo County sheriff's office. The newspaper identified the other persons named in the indictments as C. Timothy Wilcox, Edgar L. Longworth, Gerald R. Redding and Eston L.

title: Westport and Its Neighbors in a LongSimmering Feud
description: WESTPORT, Conn.  The usually well hidden but sometimes bitter animosity between this affluent community and its less wealthy neighbors broke into the open for a few brief moments last month. Then it disappeared from view again, leaving only polite smiles to mark the place where the apparent tranquility of suburbia had been disturbed.

title: BANK SUES TO FORCE CITY TO PAY ON BONDS
description: The Flushing National Bank of Queens began a suit yesterday to stop the city from paying city revenues to anyone ahead of city bondholders.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Looking alert and brighteyed, Mrika Mrnaci, an Albanianborn woman who says she is 110 years old, filed an application yesterday for United States citizenship.

title: ANGOLA UNCERTAIN ABOUT CEASEFIRE
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 3Amid conflicting reports of another ceasefire among Angolan nationalist factions, the mercy flights of Portuguese refugees from this wartorn territory in southern Africa ended today, the American consul prepared to leave and the faction in control of this capital continued to plan independence celebrations for next Tuesday.

title: Black Colleges Ask A 25Y ear Aid Plan For School Parity
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) Presidents of black colleges urged the Government today to embark on a 25year plan to increase Federal support for the 107 traditionally black colleges and universities in the country.

title: JUDGE BARS PLEA BY MISS FROMM
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 4Lynette Alice Fromme strode to a courtroom microphone here today a halfhour after jury selection began for her trial on a charge of having attempted to assassinate President Ford and tried unsuccessfully to change her not guilty plea.

title: Advertising
description: Although a number of advertisers are including 10second commercials in their new campaigns for the first time, or fo rthe first time in years, people in the business do not see any trend developing in that direction.

title: RICHARDSON OPEN TO ELECTIVE POST
description: LONDON, Nov. 4Elliot L. Richardson, named yesterday to succeed Rogers C. B. Morton as Secretary of Commerce, rejected speculation today that the job would lead to a VicePresidential candidacy with President Ford in next year's elections.

title: Mrs. Shriver Backs Kennedy In Pregnant TeenAger Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  Eunice Kennedy Shriver testified today that Senator Edward M. Kennedy's proposed Federal program for pregnant; teenagers and their children; is essential to insure that) schoolage parents do not harm the children's early years.

description: While women airline pilots and miners have dominated the headline as invaders of male bastions of power, a small number of men have been staging a career revolution of their own.

title: Right Horse Readied for Classic Race
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 4When John Russell returned from Paris last month after saddling Ogden Mills Phipps's Intrepid Hero to a 10th placefinish in the $400,000 Prix de L'Arc de Triomphe, he wished aloud that he had done things differently.

title: Capital Is Asking Who Did What to Whom
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4If it had all gone according to the closely held plan this city might have been marveling over a decisive display of Presidential authority.

title: Closings on Election Day
description: The Chicago Board of Trade and the New York and Chicago mercantile exchanges were closed yesterday because of the Election Day holiday. There was no trading in Government and agency bonds or foreign currencies because banks in New York were also closed,

title: Former Manson Follower Is Freed by Coast Judge
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 4 (UPI) Ruth Ann Morehouse, once a Charles Manson follower, was set free today by a county judge who said he was satified she had cut all ties with the cult and joined only because her father abandoned her when she was 14 years old.

title: Banking on a Capitol Ballast
description: WASHINGTONThe crisis of New York is more than financial: It is crisis of leadership. Regardless of who is to blameand there are manywe cannot walk away from New York. New York is a national responsibility.

title: RALPH A. BURNS
description: Ralph A. Burns, professor emeritus of education at Dartmouth College, died yesterday at the Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital in Hanover, N.H. He was 78 years old.

title: FROM ROCK AND WOOD TO BIRD
description: When Lubomir Tomaszewski looks at a rock, he sees a piece of sculpture. Something in the layering, the shape, the natural formation suggests to hint the body of an animal or bird.

title: CHARGES REDUCED IN PACKER'S TRIM
description: OMAHA, Nov. 4 (UPI)A Federal judge dismissed today 68 charges against Frank R. West in the American Beef Packers Inc. trial and threw out all 92 charges against Beefland International Inc. an A.B.P. subsidiary.

title: Voters in Nassau County Keep Supervisor System
description: MINEOLA, L.. l., Nov. 4Nassau County voters today defeated a proposition to change the present. Board of Supervisors form of government to a county legislative system and Republicans swept all judicial and town posts, on the hasis of incomplete returns.

title: Aid To Fruit Stands Gains
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 4 (UPI) The House approved Federal aid today to encourage direct. farmertoconsumer roadside fruit and vegetable stands. The measure, approved on a 299to95 vote, would authorize 51.5million in a oneyear program of Agriculture Department technical advice to small farmers with roadside operations in or near urban areas.

title: Syria Welcomes the CeaseFire in Beirut
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 4Syria's leftwing leadership hailed the return of calm in Lebanon today but ruled out any lessening of tension along the Syrian border with Israel.

title: Indian Summer Here As Mercury Hits 78
description: Summer returned to the city yesterday. Even though the clocks have been turned back and the calendars say fall, temperatures under sunny skies reached a record high of 78 degrees for the date. The high was recorded at 1:18 P.M.

title: 2 Futures Markets Approve a Merger
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4 (AP)Members of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange and the International Monetary Market. have voted to merge and reorganize the two exchanges.

title: City ote Apparently Bars 4 Amendments to Charter
description: New York City voters were approving the first six amendments to the City Charter in early returns, but apparently rejecting the last four amendments, which proposed the most farranging changes.

title: Grizzly Bear Seen in Peril
description: BOZEMAN. Mont., Nov. 4 (AP)The grizzly bear, declared a threatened species this year may still he in trouble from excessive killing both inside and outside of Yellowstone National Park. according to John Craighead. a private researcher. Mr. Craighead is the leader of the University of Montana's Cooperative Wildlife Research Unit.

title: CORRECTION
description: A report in The New York Times yesterday about the thirdquarter earnings of MCA Inc. incorrectly gave the amount of revenues the company realized on rentals of the motion picture Jaws in the United States and Canada through Oct. 31. The correct figure is $95 million.

title: PETR ZENKL DIES; CZECH LEADER, 91
description: Petr Zenkl, a noted leader of democratic Czechoslovika, died Monday in Raleigh, N. C. He was 91 years old.

title: Case of Karen Quinlan Gives Hospital Maintenance and Security Problems
description: DENVILLENuns and lay people have gathered morning after morning at 7 o'clock in the chapel of St. Clare's Hospital here to ask God to restore Karen Anne Quinlan from her coma to normal life.

title: Nine YearsInto Supposed Retirement, A Full Life Amid Blooms and Greens
description: ARMONK, N.Y.When she retired nine years ago, Zelma Clark was ready to throw herself wholeheartedly into gardening. After all, she did know the difference between a petunia and a geranium, and she had met with some success in raising tuberous begonias.

title: Cosmos 778 and 779
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4 (AP)The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 778 and 779 into orbit today to continue the space exploration program. according to Tass, the official press agency.

title: U.S. Accepts 31 More Refugees
description: MANILA, Nov. 4The American Embassy said today that the United States had decided to accept 31 Indochinese refgees from among 118 who have been staying in a welfare camp here. The fate of the, rest is uncertain.

title: Jury Picked in S.L.A. Trial
description: LOS ANGELES. Nov. 4 (UPI) A jury of six women and six men was selected today to hear the trial of Russell Little and Joseph Remiro. members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army who arc accused of assaulting police officers. They have already been convicted of the murder of the Oakland School Superintendent. Marcus Foster. and sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: Golf Coach Suspended
description: TEMPE., Ariz., Nov. 4 (AP) Billy Mann, the 49yearold Arizona State University golf coach, was suspended today for eligibility irregularities and reassigned to the basketball staff. Fred Miller, the athletic director said Mann's resignation was accepted, effective rune 3 i. 1976. lie declined to ccmrrien! on the infractions.

title: Aemarial Services
description: DIETRICHAlbert George. Dear cousin, ovingly remembered.

title: Detroit Gets Integration Order; 21,200 Students Will Be Bused
description: DETROIT, Nov. 4A Federal judge ruled today that the Detroit school system must begin next Jan. 26 a student integration plan that will affect about 28,300 students, 21,200 of whom will be bused. The 7,100 others will be reassigned.

title: 2 New Top Officers Not Tied to Views of Townsend
description: DETROIT, Nov. 4A month after the retirement of Lynn Townsend as chairman of the Chrysler Corporation, its two principal officers have made it clear that they are not bound by his policies.

title: PRESSMEN'S UNION AND 2 DAILIES MEET
description: Negotiators for The Daily News and The New York Times met yesterday with representatives of Pressmen's Union No. 2 following a tentative contract settlement Monday night with the Newspaper Drivers.

title: Soviet Hints Approval of Ford Moves
description: The Soviet press took an expectedly cautious, waitandsee stand yesterday on President Ford's Cabinet shuffle, but indicated that the ouster of Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger was welcome in Moscow. Newspapers in countries allied with the United States expressed mixed views.

title: Coast Vote Against City Aid
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif. Nov. 4 (AP)  Marin County Supervisors voted today against a Fetlcral bailout of financially stricken New York City. The vote, proposed by Supervisor Robert A. Rournigulena was 4 to 0. The Supervisors copies of the resolution sent to all California Supervisors and all the states.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Emerson Installs President
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Dr. Gus Turbeville was installed as the eighth president of Emerson College in weekend ceremonies at the school. Dr. Turbeville, 52 years old, is a former president of Northland College in Ashland, Wis., and Coker College in Hartsville, S. C.

title: 2 Women Chosen Lieutenant Governors; Rizzo Reelected, White Narrowly Wins
description: In an offyear election with governors races in only two states and just a handful of bigcity mayoral contests, voters across the country yesterday elected women as lieutenant governors of Kentucky and Mississippi, reelected the Democratic governor of Kentucky and turned the Mississippi governor's race into a cliffhanger.

title: Routine in the Hospital Changed by Quinlan Case
description: DENVILLE, N. J.Nuns and lay people have gathered morning after morning at 7 o'clock in the chapel of St. Clare's Hospital here to ask God to restore Karen Anne Quinlan from her coma to normal life.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Following is the text of President Ford's letter to Senator Frank Church urging that the Senate Select Committee investigating the intelligence community not niche public its report on the subject of asossinations:

title: AUSTERITY WIDENS AS RUTGERS SAVES
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 4Two consecutive years of severe budget cuts have forcdd Rutgers, the State University, to eliminate some positions, cancel or enlarge classes, cut student services and retain outdated laboratory equipment.

title: HARVEY ORKIN, 57, FILM AGENT, DIES
description: Harvey Orkin, who had been a motionpicture executive, a talent agent, a novelist, a television writer and a brilliant, raconteur on TV, died Monday evening at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 315 East 72d Street.

title: Senator Church Rejects Request by Ford That Panel Keep Secret Its Report on C.I.A. Assassination Plots
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Senator Frank Church, accusing the Administration of attempting to obstruct a Senate committee's investigation of Federal intelligence agencies, formally rejected today a request by President Ford that the panel keep secret its findings of involvement by the Central Intelligence Agency in attempts to assassinate foreign heads of state.

title: Senate Vote Opposes Lebanese Intervention
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) The Senate adopted a resolution today that deplored the violence in Lebanon and opposed intervention by any nation.

title: PRICE UNIT SCORES ANTIFREEZE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) The Council on Wage and Price Stability said today that the Union Carbide Corpor'ation's recent increase in the wholesale price of its antifreeze was not fully warranted.

title: DOLLAR AND GOLD UP IN TRADING ABROAD
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 4 (UPI)The dollar rose for the first time in almost a week on European money markets today, buoyed partly by the West German central bank.

title: Two Men Held and One Is Sought as Suspects in Robberies Totaling $1 Million From 38 Banks Here
description: Two of the three members of a gang suspected of having got more than $1 million in 38 bank robberies in the last two and a half years were seized and arraigned yesterday.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y,, Nov. 4Egypt proposed today that the Palestine Liberation Organization be invited to take part in the Geneva conference on the Middle East on , an equal footing with other participants.

description: MIAMI, Nov. 4 (AP)The Justice Department has decided to prosecute former Senator Edward J. Gurney of Florida on two unresolved criminal charges, The Miami Herald reported in its Wednesday editions.

title: Francs Shows Signs of Phlebitis After Surgery to Repair Artery
description: MADRID, Nov. 4Generalissimo Francisco Franco, in grave condition after prolonged internal bleeding, was officially reported today to be recuperating from an operation that repaired a burst artery.

title: The Acting Company Returns With Three Sisters

Perhaps Moscow is the answer; anything is the answer except the tedious provincial town in which they live, a town in which as their brother Andrei observes, one knows everyone and is still a stranger.

title: Japan Account in Surplus
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4 (Reuters Japan's visible trade surplus of more than $500 million in October brought its current account payment into surplus from a $55 million deficit in September, Finance Ministry preliminary estimates showed today.Ministry officials estimated the visible trade surplus more than offset the deficit on invisibles which rose to over $500 million in October from $467 million in September.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Small Claims Courts are supposed to be the courts of the people, halls of justice where the ordinary citizen need not be represented by a lawyer to obtain satisfaction. But a 1974 study by the Community Service Society of New York showed that half of the people who sued successfully and obtained judgments were unable to collect the money due them.

title: Help!
description: It strikes me that there is far too much paranoia and suspicion, far too much of a we're the good guys and you're the bad guys attitude, far too much defending of turf and displaying of muscle, far too much of a tendency to see every difference in perspective and point of view as a doordie issuefar too much of this sort of highdecibel, surface noise surrounding the effort to carry on a constructive conversation about how best to get on with the job of incorporating environmental concerns into the daytoday business of this country.

title: A NEW NOTE PLAN STUDIED BY M.A.C.

title: Music: Superb Marlboro
description: Music From Marlboro is like a stream fed by springs. The name, which applies to chamber ensembles sent out under the imprimatur of the Marlboro Festival in Vermont that functions each summer under the direction of Rudolf Serkin, has been in existence for a decade. The ensembles, however, change each year, refreshed by the younger artists emerging from the festival.

title: Wary Citizens of Beirut Venture Into Streets as Shooting Fades
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 4An improvement in the security situation here today encouraged Lebanese to venture onto the streets, and in some districts traffic jams developed to give this city some of the flavor it had lost in weeks of factional fighting.

title: U.S. Line Sets Suez Route
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  American President Lines will start a twice monthly container service through the Suez Canal, linking the West Coast with various ports in the Mediterranean, the company's agents announced here today.

title: DETECTIVES STUDY LINK IN 2 KILLINGS
description: Teams of detectives separately investigating the slayipg of a 27yearold nurse found dead in her Vest Side brownstone apartment two weeks ago ands, the murder of a 76yearoldl woman killed in a singleroomoccupancy hotel eight and a half blocks away, net yesterday morning to pool information in both crimes.

title: Loan by London Is Reported an AimPact Seen Near
description: LONDON, Nov. 4  The Chrysler Corporation, in talks here, is seeking British Government aid to keep the company's four automobile plants in Britain operating.

title: Democrats Make Gains in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Wednesday, Nov. 5Democrats scored substantial gains in Westchester County yesterday, taking the Mayor's office in New Rochelle and Peekskill and scoring upsets in races for the 17member County Board of Legislators.

title: Fewer Vote Machines A Mark of City Cuts
description: A spokesman for the city's Board of Elections said last night that because of the city's economic plight, it had placed only one voting machine in each of the city's 4,736 election districtsnot two as it had done in some districts with higher enrollments in past years.

title: Unclaimed Lottery Winnings
description: EAST PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 4 (AP)The Rhode Island lottery commission says, more than $1million in unclaimed winnings remain in its coffers for the year ending Sept. 30. Under lottery rules, the unclaimed prize money is held for one year and, if still unclaimed, reverts to the current prize fund.

title: CORRECTION
description: A report in The New York Times yesterday about the thirdquarter earnings of MCA Inc. incorrectly gave the amount of revenues the company realized on rentals of the motion picture Jaws in the United States and Canada through Oct. 31. The correct figure is S95 million.

description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)James Muregi, member of Parliament for Nyandarua South, was today elected deputy speaker of the National Assembly. He replaces JeanMarie Seroney, the deputy speaker detained recently, along with Martin Shikuku, another legislator, for accusing Kenyan authorities of trying to kill parliamentary democracy.

title: Connors Victor in Stockholm

Dick Stockton was upset by Victor Pecci of Paraguay, 62, 64, and in another upset Jim McManus downed Jeff Borowiak, 76, 67, 75.

title: Notes on People

The apostolic deleeate to the United States, Archbishop Jean Jadat, announced yesterday the appointment of Archbishop Joseph T. Ryan of Anchorage as coadjutor archbishop to the Cardinal and Navy chaplain James J. Killeen, now a monsignor, as auxiliary bishop. They will serve at the 1011 First Avenue headquarters of the Military Ordinariate, which also serves personnel and dependents of reserve units and at veterans hospitals

title: Drugs Found on 2 Women
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 4 (Reuters)  The United States Customs Service said today that it had seized cocaine worth about a million dollars taped to the bodies of two women and also concealed in their platform shoes. The women, both Colombian nationals, were apprehended after arriving at Dulles Airport on a flight from Guatemala, a customs spokesman said.

description: President Ford's assumptions that New York City's financial crisis is  a special case and that a default by the city would have only local impact are not shared by the bulk of the American people, according to nationwide poll of public opinion conducted last weekend by The New York Times and CBS News.

description: National Football League officials placed Seattle and Tampa, its two new franchises in divisions yesterday and unanimously approved a twnyear extension the league's contract with the College AllStar Game at a meeting here.

title: Beirut's Prime Minister Gains Authority in Crisis
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 2It has become almost a nightly institution. After reading the evening news, which is usually grim, the television announcer picks up a telephone and talks with Lebanon's Prime Minister, Rashid Karami.

title: LEAH JAVNE SALISBURY
description: Leah Jayne SalisbUry, a literary agent for close to 50 years, died Sunday at New York Hospital. She was 82 years old and lived at 75 Fifth Avenue.

title: People in Sports
description: Jim Palmer of the Baltimore Orioles yesterday became the fifth pitcher to win the Cy Young Award for the second time. The 30yearold righthander was chosen by a 24man panel of the Baseball Writers Association as the best pitcher in the American League in 1975. Jim (Catfish) Hunter of the New York Yankees placed second. Palmer, who won the award in 1973, and Hunter, the 1974 American League winner when he won 25 games for Oakland, tied for most victories in the major leagues this year with 23. Palmer led the major leagues with 10 shutouts and a 2.09 earnedrun average.

Oden of the Drew Theological School said yesterday that, in the light of difference among Protestants and Catholics on the Quinlan case, the group wished to focus on fundamental matters upon which Christian theologians agreed. description: A woman in Rochester helped her brother collect welfara checks under two different names simultaneously, the state welfare inspectorgeneral, Richard V. Horan, said yesterday.

title: Victory for Reform
description: In giving their approval to the first six Charter reforms, New Yorkers have demonstrated their determination to press for more effective management of their embattled city. It is to the credit of New York City's voters that they have refused to let themselves be driven into a docile defense of the status quo by those who habitually react to any call for reform with a warning that to do nothing is safer than to risk change.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4Mayor Frank L. Rizzo was reelected here today in an overwhelming victory that could signal the demise of one of America's last political bosses.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) President Ford nominated Roger W. Hooker Jr., for Congressional and Intergovernmental affairs. Since February, Mr. Hooker has been an assistant to Vice President Rockefeller.

title: NEWCAR SALES UP 2310 IN OCTOBER
description: DETROIT, Nov. 4After a twoyear decline, American newcar sales in October topped the same month of 1974 by 23.3 per cent, industry figures showed today. It was the first time since September, 1973, that sales had exceeded the same month the year before.

description: H. Irving Pratt, an investment banker and amateur yachtsman, died Monday at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Oyster Bay. N.Y.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Board of Health will hold a hearing tomorrow at 125 Worth Street beginning at 8 A.M. on the city's temporary ban on truck shipments of radioactive cargoes through the city's streets. The ban was instituted last July because of the incipient danger from radioactive materials in the event of a transportation accident.

title: BURNS LACKS ZEAL FOR NEW TAX IDEA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that he did not take warmly to a new idea that is gaining support in Congress for compromising the budgetary fight between President Ford and Congressional Democrats.

title: Ford Campaign Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) Former Lieut Gov. David C. Owen of Kansas was named today to direct President Ford's campaign in seven Middle: Western states. The Presidenti Ford Committee said Mr. Owen would be regional director fort Kansas. Iowa, Nebraska. Minnesota, Missouri, North Dakota and South Dakota.

title: Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) The House passed and sent on to the Senate today a bill to increase by at least 8 per cent the maximum income that disabled veterans or their survivors can earn and still receive veteran's pensions. The vote was 400 to 0, The new ceiling reflects the increase in Social Security benefits last June that raised the maximum income of the million veterans receiving pensions and the 930,000 veterans survivors.

title: Conservative Lobby Bids U.S. Keep Panama Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  A selfstyled recluse in California, a 79yearold exnaval captain, a retired ambassador, a Florida realestate developer, two poterrtial Presidential candidates, and Representatives and Senators, together with about 100.000 other people, constitute a gradually growing pressure group opposed to Ad ministraition plans to transfer control of the Americanbuilt Panama Canal to the Republic of Panama.

title: PROTECTIVE BITS ON PHONES ENDED
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4In a decision that could further enhance competition in the telephone industry, the Federal Communications Commission has decided that common carrier companies, such as the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, may no longer require customers to use so  called protective devices when connecting customerowned equipment into a telephone network.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 4Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that he was not yet convinced that the need is clear for Federal financial aid to New York City.

title: Kentucky's Governor Wins With Woman as Top Aide
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 4 (AP)Democratic Gov. Julian M. Carroll won a decisive victory today over Robert Gable, a Republican who predicted backlash against the incumbent, over busing, that failed to materialize.

title: School Buses Face Search
description: WINTER SPRINGS, Fla., Nov. 4 (UPI) The police in this central Florida town said today they would stop and search school buses bound for Oviedo High School if they get any more complaints about students smoking marijuana on the buses.

title: S.B.A. in Richmond Is Held Defrauded Of Some $800,000
description: RICHMOND. Nov. 4 (UPI)A Federal grand jury returned today the first indictment in an investigation of an allegedly Mafiinfiltrated scheme that defruaded the local office of the Small Business Administration of more than $800,000.

description: HARTFORD, Nov. 4New mayors were elected today in five of Connecticut's six largest cities. All but one of them was a Democrat.

title: Leftist Troops Try To Protest at Rally Of Portugal's Chief

title: COPTER'S DEBRIS IS FOUND IN GULF
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 4 (UPI) Coast Guard searchers found floating debris today from a helicopter that disappeared with nine men aboard on a flight to the Louisiana coast from a Gulf of Mexico oil rig. None of the missing men was found.

description: Chris Inman of Manhattan College, who never finished better than third in 11 dual meets this season, won the 49th annual Metropolitan intercollegiate crosscountry championship yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

description: Some 99 stockholders of many who sued the Ecological Science Corporation since 1967 on stock manipulation charges will get all of their money back, less a onethird legal fee, under a ruling by Federal Appeals Judge Bryon Simpson in New Orleans.

title: House Unit Slates Action On City Aid Bill Next Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The House Democratic leadership today scheduled for floor action early next week.legislation to authorize $7 billion in loan guarantees to New York City, and pledged an exhaustive effort on the bill's behalf.

description: ELIZABETH, Nov. 9The Oct. 21 settlement of a 12day strike that disrupted classes for 15,000 pupils here has restored classrooms to normal but left a residue of bitterness.

title: GOING OUT Guide

title: Blast Kills 6 in Britain
description: SCUNTHORPE, England, Nov. 4 (UPI)An explosion ripped through a steelworks on the outskirts of Scunthorpe 150 miles north of London early today. The police said four workers were killed and more than a dozen injured, some seriously.

title: Spanioh Troops Say They Planted Mines on Road From Morocco

title: HighLevel Upheaval
description: The upheaval in the upper hierarchy of the Ford Administration has already been hastily analyzed in terms of its impact on dtente with the Soviet Union, the dominance or slightly lessened dominance of SecEconomic retary of State Analysis Henry A. Kissinger, the effort to outflank Ronald Reagan on the right and other political, foreign policy and military considerations. But what, if anything, does the upheaval mean for business and the economy? And what are its implications for Federal aid to financially beleaguered New York City and New York State?

title: World Premieres Of Music by Dodge And Babbitt Given
description: The Group for Contemporary Music at the Manhattan School of Music assembled a typically stimulating program of recently composed works for its first concert of the season Monday night. All six pieces were written in the last eight years; two of them received world premieres (Milton Babbitt's Phonemena and Charles Dodge's In Celebration), and two their New York premieres (Joe Hudson's Reflexives and Donald Jenni's Cherry Valley: August, 1975).
