The extremist opposition is being fomented by small groups that want no part of the basic law nor indeed of the concept of landuses planning within the sixmillionacre park.

title: For Sale: Two Little Secretariats
description: The first of Secretariat's sons and daughters to reach the sales ring will he offered at auction in Lexington, next week. On Monday a weanling filly from the imported mare, Zest, will he put up for bids, to hn followed a day later by a son of Chou Croute, a mare that could pick up the kitchen stove and run a hole in the wind. The filly has been consigned to the Keeneland sales by Barry Ryan agent for a client overseas. The colt was bred by the Big Sink Farm of E. V. Benjamin Jr., at Versailles, Ky., where he was foaled last April 21.

title: Alcan Jamaica Plant Closing
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Alcan Jamaica Ltd., a subsidiary of the giant Canadian Aluminum company, began closing down its Ewarton alumina plant here today,

title: Bangladesh Cabinet Aides Held on Corruption Charge
description: NEW DELHI, Wednesday, Nov. 5  The Government of Bangladesh today announced that four Cabinet ministers had resigned and that two of them had been arrested on charges of corruption and misuse of power.

title: High Hopes for a Alai in Connecticut Are Soured by Scandal
description: BRIDGEPORT, ConnWhen Ricardo Sotil 6116 abotit why the world's biggest, jaialai stadium may not operi here on schedule, a look bewilderment furrows his Spanish brow.

title: 4th Course Barred In Olympic Sailing
description: LONDON, Nov. 4 (Reuters) The International Yacht Racing Union rejected today in principle a suggestion that a fourth course be used for next summer's Olympic yachting events at Kingston, Ontario.

title: Knicks Start Trip With 119106 Loss
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 4 Failure to adequately defense the smallest player in the National Basketball Association, 5foot9inch Calvin Murphy, meant defeat for the New York Knicks tonight. Murphy scored 33 points, 21 in the first half, and led the Houston Rockets to a 119106 victory as New York opened threegame Western swing.

title: Bentsen Bids McGovern Debate Issues for 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Senator Lloyd Bentsen, responding to criticism of Democratic Presidential contenders by Senator George McGovern, invited Mr. McGovern today to travel the country with him to debate issues.

title: Court Hearing Set On W.F.L. Signing
description: The courthouse is as important a source of news about pro football these days as the stadium. In Cincinnati yesterday Timothy S. Hogan, a United States District Court judge, tempo rarily overruled Commissioner Pete Rozelle's prohibition against the signing of former World Football League players by National League teams.

title: CITY DEFIES TREND
description: Supporters of the equalrights amendments to the State Constitutions of New York and New Jersey, blaming misinformation and prejudice, conceded defeat late last night on the basis of substantial returns that showed the amendments losing in both states.

title: Republican Wins Election As Poughkeepsie's Mayor
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 4 (AP)Robert Ahmed, a Republican making his first try for public office, was elected Mayor today.

title: DWYFR FLUTE MUSIC HAS SPECIAL CHARM
description: Doriot Anthony Dwyer, principal flutist of the Boston Symphony, began her second annual threeconcert stint here on Monday evening at Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Girl, 16, Terminally Ill, Dies in Nassau; Nurse Says Respirator Was Shut Off
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov 4A terminally ill 16yearold girl who had been in a coma at Nassau Hospital here died Sunday night, reportedly after someone switched off her respirator and pulled the plug out of the wall, the Nassau County Medical Examiner said today. The county police and the District Attorney's office would not speculate on the cause of the death of the girl, Mary Jane Dahl, who was a senior and honor student at Newfield High School. But spokesmen said an investigation was under way because of certain unusual facts surrounding the death.

title: Payment to Gulf by an ExOfficer In Settling of Suit Is Questioned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4An activist shareholder group charged today that Claude C. Wild Jr., a former vice president of the Gulf Oil, Corporation, used money from an employee political contribution fund to pay $25,000 to Gulf in settlement of his liability to the company.

title: Cuban Terrorist Group Says It Killed Refugee by Blast
description: MIAMI, Nov. 4 (AP) A Cuban exile terrorist group called Zero said today that it had been responsible for the death of a controversial refugee killed when his car exploded as he switched on the ignition of his car in. Miami last week.

title: BURNS STILL BARS U.S. AID FOR CITY; But He IS More Concerned Now Than 3 Weeks AgoHouse Action Slated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 4Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that he was not yet convinced that the need is clear for Federal financial aid to New York City,

title: New Books
description: General

title: Woman Upheld on Pay Issue
description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP)The Iowa Employment Security Commission has ruled that, a 25yearold woman who quit her job after finding male coworkers were paid more is entitled to unemployment compensation. Patricia McDonald of Tripoli, Iowa, quit her job as a clerk in the sporting goods department of the Waterloo J. C. Penney Co. store last May after she learned that two male clerks in the same department were being paid at least ,.77 cents an hour more than Ole ,was.

title: Gala Honors Syvilla Fort In the Dance
description: Syvilla Fort has had a secure place in the development of dance, especially black dance, as a performer, choreographer, teacher and just plain good person. At her gala celebration Monday evening, her influence and the range of her friends were strikingly and warmly demonstrated at the Majestic Theater.

title: MRS. PERON GIVES A BIG WAGE RISE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 4President Isabel Martinez de Pert5n ordered a large new wage increase for Argentine labor from her sickbed today as she struggled for public support against an opposition campaign to force her resignation.

title: G.E. Is Ordered to Check Ovens for Radiation Leak
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration said today that it has ordered the General Electric Company to inspect 36,000 more microwave ovens for radiation leakage and make free repairs where necessary.

title: Possibility of 3d Party Ticket May Delay Subsidies for Primary Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The possibility that Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama and former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California may run for President on third or fourthparty tickets in 1976 is threatening to delay and perhaps reduce Federal subsidy payments for the primary campaigns of all national contenders.

title: Housing Bond Proposal Beaten by 2toI Margin
description: The psychological spillover from New York City's continuing fiscal perils sent a New York State housing bond issue to resounding defeat yesterday.

title: Market Place
description: The financial pages last week were full of news of lower interest rates. Big banks cut the prime rate. Treasury bill rates reached their lowest levels .since June. Corporate bond yields came down.

title: Sweeping Changes Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) A sweeping overhaul of the nation's financial institutions was proposed in a House Banking Committee staff study released today.

title: Democratic Incumbents Win City Council Seats
description: Democrat ic incumbents retained their City Council seats in two election contests yesterday, one in Brooklyn and the other in the Bronx. The Democrats held a State Assembly scat in Brooklyn by an easy margin in the only other legislative race in the city.

title: F.D.A.Inquiry Finds Favoritism Charge Is Lacking Evidence
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 4 (AP) The Food and Drug commissioner, Alexander M. Schmidt, said today that his personal yearlong investigation had turned up no evidence to support employee charges that the agency favored the drug industry.

title: High Hopes for Jai Alai in Connecticut Are Soured by Scandal
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.When Ricardo Sotil talks about why the world's biggest jai alai stadium May not open here on schedule, a look of bewilderment furrows his Spanish brow.

title: U.S. PLAN TO QUIT ASSAYED BY I.L.O.
description: GENEVA, Nov. 4Officials of the International Labor Organization, faced with a United States threat to withdraw from their agency, say they believe Middle East and other developments may determine whether the threat is carried out.

title: Rabbi I. Edward Kiev Dies at 70; An Expert on Judaic Literature
description: Rabbi I. Edward Kiev, expert on Judaic and Hebraic Literature, died here Monday of heart atack. He was 70 years old and lived at 4 South Pinehurst Avenue, Washington Heights.

title: Books of The Times
description: No surprise, but it doesn't take long to see that The Greatest: My Own Story, by the once and present heavyweight boxing champion, Muhammad Ali, is no routine athlete's autobiography, celebrating God, America, games and self. Turn to the chronology at the beginning of the book and you discover that beyond a citation of the Olympic championship he won back in 1960 not a single important event In

title: Democrats Leading Civil Court Races
description: With more than a third of the votes counted in yesterday's election, the Democrats appeared certain of victory in the contests for District Attorney in the Bronx and on Staten Island and for 13 Civil Court seats at stake in Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Con Ed Warns Ford of Impact Default Would Have on Utility
description: The Consolidated Edison Company warned President, Ford yesterday that the devastating effects of default by the city could force the utility, either to cut off basic services, to city and state agencies or to withhold much of the $400 million it pays in state and city taxes.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 1975

title: Many Brokers Weather Effect of Rate Competition
description: Diversification, continued attention to cost reductions and a sharp rise in operations outside the stock markets are helping many Wall Street securities houses weather the effects of persistently low trading volume, lack of interest from small investors and rate competition for business from financial institutions.

title: People and Business
description: Another confirmation of the favorable trend of balance  of  payment deficits among industrial countries came yesterday in a speech by Vice President Otmar Emminger of the West German Central Bank. At a conference of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Develonment in Paris.

title: ANACONDA TO DIVEST ITS. UNIT OR ASSETS
description: The Federal Trade Commission announced yesterday in Washington that the Anaconda Company had agreed to divest Systems Wire and Cable Inc. or its assets.

title: Food Costs in City Off Slightly
description: New York City families planning large Thanksgiving dinners should start paying attention to special sales in a wide variety of items that now exist, the Department of Consumer Affairs recommended yesterday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Bond Proposals in Jersey Rejected by Huge Margin
description: Four bond issues totaling $922million were overwhelmingly rejected by the voters in yesterday's referendum election in New Jersey.

title: Raymonda
description: Could it? Would it? The American Ballet Theater opened at the Uris Theater last night with Rudolf Nureyev's staging of the Petipa and Glazunov ballet, Raymonda. But it was not American Ballet Theater that was being judged. It was not Rudolf Nureyev. For that matter It was not even Marius Petipa or Alexandre Glazunov. It was, quite simply, the Uris Theater.

title: Increase Forecast In Eximbank's Net For Current Year
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (Reuters)The chairman of the ExportImport Bank, William J. Casey, said today that the bank's net income for the fiscal year running through June 1976 should be close to $100 million. Net income in the first quarter of fiscal 1976 rose 20 percent to $29 million from the yearearlier level, he added.

title: KELLEY SAYS CRITICS ARE HARMING F.B.I.
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Nov. 4, (Reuters)The director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation warned today that a relentless bombardment of criticism was eroding the F.B.I.'s ability to defend the United States against domestic and foreign enemies.

title: Levine Conducts Concert With Controlled Urgency
description: Then, are conduit ors who specialize in control (Pierre Boulez), those who specialize in urgency (Leonard Bernstein), and still others, a few, who seem concerned to hold the two forces in balance. This feeling of controlled urgency dominated the Philadelphia Orchestra's concert on Monday night at Carnegie Hall, where Jams Levine conducted a compelling program.

title: Angolans Seize 40 Foreigners, Free Them in 6Hour Inquiry
description: LUANDA. Angola. Nov. 4 (Reuters)At least 40 foreigners were taken from their hotel rooms to prison cells and held as long as six hours here today in a security cbecR by Angolan liberation forces controlling the capital.

title: Oif Ban on South Africa Voted by U.N. Committee
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 4 (AP)The General Assembly's Special Political Committee approved a resolution today aimed at a x,oluntary oil and raw materials embargo against South Africa.

description: Morning

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: An attempt by a stuntman, Penn Jillette, to jump over five Volkswagens on a rocketpowered unicycle ended in fizzle in Princeton and was greeted by boos from 2,000 spectators. Mr. Jillette, wearing a helmet, a black leather jacket and crimson sneakers, cycled up a starting ramp, fell off his bike and was immediately booed by the spectators.

title: 2 Yachts Threaten 105YearOld Mark
description: SYDNEY, Australia. Nov. 4 (AP)Two competitors in the LondontoSydncv yacht race have a chance to break the 105yearold record of 69 days for the run.

title: 400 Buses Begin Rolling Here Today With MonthLong Photography Show
description: Beginning today, riders on city buses will enjoy a change in farea change, that is, from the usual fare of advertisements.

title: From an A11Peanut Luncheon
description: Dishes made with peanuts or peanut oil comprised the entire menu of a luncheon held at the Harvard Club in New York by the National Peanut Council. Following is one of the dessert recipes.

title: Policewoman Kills Gunman Afte rDeath Of Her Husband
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 4 (UPI)An offduty woman police officer shot to death one gunman and helped with the capture of two others minutes after one of the bandits had shot and killed her husband, also a policeman, the authorities said today.

title: Klein Reelected, but Democrats Gain
description: BLUE POTNT, L. I.. Nov. 4 The Democrats of Suffolk County tonight won at least. 10 seats in the IAmember Count Legislature, thus wresting control from the Republicans who have dominated that body since its inception six years ago.

title: Candidates for Mississippi Governor in Close Race
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 4A moderate reform Republican and a working man's Democrat were locked in a close race for Governor of Mississippi, as returns from today's election were counted.

title: Italian Phone Office Bombed
description: ROME, Nov. 4 (Reuters) Two men disguised as policemen set off a bomb at an office of the Italian telephone company in a Rome suburb today, police officials said. The bombing was the latest series of attacks on telephone company property, apparently to protest recently increased charges.

title: Apartment UnfurnishedManhattan
description: Oae & Two Roams 1511

title: Jets Reunite As Psyches Are Healed
description: HEMPSTEAD, Nov. 4 A curious chemistry tnnk Place at the Jets camp today, their first together since their controversial 2423 defeat to Buffalo last Sunday. The New Yorkers appear to he bonded together more than ever.

title: PANEL COMPLETES TAX BILL REVISION
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 4The House Ways and Means Committee finished work tonight on legislation extending into 1976, with significant changes, the antirecession tax cufs for individuals and businesses that were enacted last spring, applicahel to 1975 taxes.

title: Lie Low Takes Firenze Again
description: A highly unusual twoday sequence was ccmpleted at Belmont Park yesterday before a crowd of 25.550 as Cragwood Stables Lie Low came home first in the Firenze Handicap for the second straight year.

title: 76ers Send Braves to First Loss
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 4 (UP1)Steve Mix, a reserve and George McGinnis led a fourthquarter surge that enabled the Philadelphia 76ers to topple the National Basketball Association's last unbeaten team, the Buffalo Braves, by 121114 tonight.

title: Dow Climbs 4.41 in a Lackluster Session
description: The stock market, despite little favorable economic news, managed to post a modest gain yesterday in continued light trading.

title: About Education
description: There is Increasing friction between the Board of Higher Education and the City University administrative staff over how difficult and unpopular budget cuts should be made and over who should make them.

title: U.S. Riders Take the Lead at Garden
description: The United States Equestrian Team started the defense of its international team championship of the National Horse Show on high note last night. Before a crowd of 8,500 at Madison Square Garden, the American riders swept the first three places in the international jumpingto take a commanding lead with 27 points; Australia's oneman team is next with 13, followed by France with S.Canada 3 and Poland I.

title: With Skill and Fuss, Rostropovich Charms Class
description: Mstislav Rostropovich is not only great musician, but he is also what public conditioned by Hollywood films thinks a great musician should be. Coming onstage Monday afternoon at the Juilliard Theater, where he was giving a public master class in cello, he looked like an endearing, slightly rumpled comic.

title: Conservative Lobby Bids U.S. Keep Panama Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  A selfstyled recluse in California, a 79yearold exnaval captain, a retired ambassador, a Florida real  estate developer, two potential Presidential candidates, and Representatives and Senators, together with about 100,000 other people, constitute a gradually growing pressure group opposed to Ad ministration plans to transfer control of the Americanbuilt Panama Canal to the Republic of Panama.

title: Mr. Ford's Machismo
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Some Presidents lead the country and some merely give the appearance of leading it, and President Ford's slapdash shuffle of his face cards falls in the latter category. He didn't reorganize his Administration but disorganized it.

title: Bridge:
description: The exciting final session of international team trial play in Palo Alto, Calif., Sunday, provided three answers to the following variation of an old conundrum: when is a disaster not a disaster?

title: 2 Women Lieutenant Governors; Rizzo Is Reelected,White Leads
description: Voters across the nation yes terday elected women as lieutenant governors in both Kentucky and Mississippi, returned Democratic incumbents as Kentucky's Governor and Philadelphia's Mayor, and turned the Mississippi Governor's race into one of the closest in years.

title: Professional Offices 1294
description: 35 ST, 35 EAST

title: About Real Estate
description: That empty midtown giant known as 1166 Avenue of the Americas Is about to come to life. Come April there should be tenants in what one real estate man has called the last of the big speculative office buildings.

title: Ricardo and the Chief Give Portugal Some Light Moments in Tense Times
description: LISBON, Nov. 4  When Ricardo worries about a trip to Washington to spy on the Central Intelligence Agency, the Chief tells him not to worry because all the American agents are in Portugal now.

title: CBS IS SWITCHING SOME PROGRAMS.
description: CBSTV announced yesterday changes in its primetime schedule, to take effect in December, which includes the installation of two new series, One Day, At a Time and The Blue Knight, and the shifting of five existing shows to different nights.

title: CITY DEFIES TREND
description: Supporters of trie equalrights amendments to the State Constitutions of New York andNew Jersey conceded defeatlate last night on the basis of substantial returns that showed the amendments trailing badly in both states.

title: Method Used in the Poll
description: The sample of persons interviewed in The New York Times CBS News opinion poll (in a default by New York City was selected by computer from among a complete list of telephone area codeswand exchanges in the continental United States.

title: Russian Egg, Soviet Chicken
description: PANAMA CITY, PanamaUntil its fleet was wiped out by the Japanese at Tsuslima in 1905 Russia had been a considerable naval power since the eighteenth century. Indeed, after the American Revolution, John Paul Jones accepted the office of rear admiral in the service of Catherine the Great.

title: Cleveland Mayor, a Republican, Easily Wins Again
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 4Mayor Ralph J. Perk, a Republican, was reelected by a resounding margin tonight as he turned back the challenge of Arnold R. Pinkney, a Democrat who was seeking to become Cleveland's second black mayor.

title: 14 Theologians Ask Court To Limit Quinlan Ruling
description: Fourteen Roman Catholic and Protestant experts on moral theology, most of them professort at seminaries in the New YorkNew Jersey area, have urged a limited ruling if the court grants the request of the parents of Karen Anne Quinlan for permission to turn off equipment keeping her alive in a coma.

title: Sawhillon the ShakeUp  Disagree and Out You Go
description: ORLANDO. Fla.. Nov. 4 (UPI)Dr. John C. Sawhill, ousted as the Federal Energy Administrator a year ago. says that if you disagree with President Ford, 'out you go.

title: Jersey Democrats Solidify 73 Gains in the Assembly
description: New Jersey Democrats yesterday solidified election gains made over the last two years in some nominally Republican State Assembly districts and turned hack a lackluster comeback hid by the G.O.P.

title: Elton John Acquires An Interestin Aztecs
description: Elton John. the rock singer, acquired an ownership interest in the Los Angeles Aztecs of the North American Soccer League yesterday in move that the league's commissioner called as significant as the acquisition of Pele. We now have two of the biggest names in the world associated with the league, Phil Woosnam, the commissioner, said.

title: Murdered Greenwich Girl, Is Buried
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 4  Martha Elizabeth Moxley was buried here today after a brief ceremony that was marked by tears from a few of the 500 mourners despite the blond teenager's repeatedly expressed desire for a happy funeral.

title: BOSTON ELECTION CARRIED BY WHITE
description: BOSTON, Noy. 4  Mayor Kevin H. White, overcoming lastminute charges of corruption in his eightyear administration, narrowly defeated State Senator Joseph F. Timilty in Boston's election today.

title: Judge Delays Decision on Whether Miss Hearst Is Competent to Stand Trial
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Nov. 4A Federal judge today delayed until Friday his decision on whether Patricia Hearst is competent to stand trial for an armed robbery that was committed allegedly after she had joined the radical group that kidnapped her.

title: Stengel Gets a Farewell at St. Patrick's
description: New York said goodbye to Casey Stengel yesterday in an ecumenical service at St. Patrick's Cathedral, where Terence Cardinal Cooke said: He gave happiness and joy to millions of people.

title: CocaCola Company Raises Earnings for the Quarter
description: The CocaCola Company reported yesterday profit in creases of 24.5 per cent for The third quarter and 18.8 pe cent for the first nine months.

title: DR. CHARLES SCHUMAN
description: Dr. Charles Schuman, an internist died Tuesday at Beekman Downtown Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 77 Park Avenue.

title: President of Raceway Stands Trial for Fraud
description: Leon Greenberg, the president of Monticello Raceway in Sullivan County, went on trial in Federal District Court here yesterday on charges of defrauding the track, by using its funds to pay $4,856 for his son's 1970 bar mitzvah at Grossinger's Hotel in the Catskills.

title: TAXFREE ISSUES ATTRACT BUYERS
description: The taxexempt market, still feeling its way through New York City's financial plight, gave what appeared to be a cordial response yesterday to several new offerings. The Continental Illinois National Bank and Trust Company of Chicago won $200 million of Michigan shortterm

title: ESPIONAGE SUSPECT ALLEGES COERCION
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 5 (AP)A mathematician indicted here for violating espionage laws is seeking dismissal of the charges on the ground that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had coerced him into making damaging admissions about his case.

title: Regulators Alter Nuclear Power Views
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4State utility regulators are apparently modifying their views regarding their traditionally firm support for nuclear power, their opposition to competition in the telephone business and their casebycase approach to ratemaking. These changes are being stimulated by depressed economic conditions, the consumer movement and the emergence of new and young faces on the regulatory commissions.

title: Buyers Set Mark At Yearling Sales
description: HARRISBURG. Pa., Nov. 5 (UPI)  Buyers set a record at the 37th annual standardbred horse sales paying more than $7.4  million for 536 yearling harness horses, or an average of 314,830 for each filly or colt.

title: The Rockefeller Conference
description: Vice President Rockefeller's news conference today will be carried live by the three networks and will be seen locally on Channels 2, 4 and 7 starting at 10 A.M. Channel 13 will rebroadcast the proceedings at 10:30 tonight. The following radio stations have also scheduled live coverage: WCBSAM, WINS, WMCA, WNWS and WNYCAM.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY DEBATED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The House of Representatives began a floor fight today on a bill creating a consumer protection agency as Republican leaders warned that President Ford would veto it.

title: The View From the Top
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5My campaign organization is in a shambles, there's all this bickering going on in the Cabinet, and nobody thinks I'm really a President.

title: Hank Williams ExWife Dies
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 5 (AP)Audrey Williams, a former wife of the late country music singer Hank Williams, died yesterday. Mrs. Williams, a singer, Song writer and businesswoman, had been converting her home into a museum to house the memorabilia of Mr. Williams who died in 1953.

title: TV: NBC Dramatizes the Ordeal of Cadet Pelosi
description: It is the season, evidently, for basedonfact TV drama. One network executive swears he has threatened to dismiss the next underling who brings him another biography for program consideration. In any case, the subject for this evening is James Pelosi, a 1973 West Point graduate who underwent 19 months of ostracism and virtual isolation within the military academy. The Silence was written by Stanley Greenberg and directed by Joseph Hardy. It will be shown on NBC at 9:30 P.M.

title: NEW NAMES VOTED FOR 2 COMMUNITIES
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5 (UPDMadison Township in Middlesex County and the Borough of New Shrewsbury in Monmouth County joined the ranks of the Edsel and the 5cent cigar today.

title: 2 CONGRESS PANELS HEAR COLBY TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) William E. Colby, staying on as Director of Central Intelligence until his successor is confirmed, will testify before two Congressional committees tomorrow and may make more appearances in Congressional inquiries into intelligence onerations.

title: Prosecutor to Get Data On a Methadone Center
description: Testimony given yesterday about allegedly illicit drug sales, improper medical care and falsified records at an East Harlem methadone center will be forwarded to the Manhattan District Attorney's office and the special state prosecutor investigating Medicaid fraud, Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein. said

title: Ford Urges a Drive For Women's Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI)President Ford called today for a national commitment to remove barriers to women's rights, a day after voters in two states turned down equal rights amendments.

title: 14 Bomb Threats in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (AP)About 1,500 employees at the State of Illinois Building were evacuated on two separate occasions today as a result of two bomb threats that were among 14 separate threats received by the Chicago police. No bombs were found at the 21story State of Illinois Building or at any other locations.

title: Majors Await U.S. Approval to Send AllStars to Cuba
description: The major leagues have completed plans to send an allstar baseball team to Cuba next spring for two goodwill games, but the State Department has not yet given the project its diplomatic green light.

title: Commodore Hotel Is Scene Of Three Suspicious
description: Three small fires that officials described as suspicious, broke out last night on separate floors of the Commodore Hotel in midtown Manhattan, Fire marshals said that they were seeking an unknown arsonist. No one was reported insured.

title: Chile Searches for Priest and Two U.S. Nuns Said to Help Rebele
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. (AP)Security agents searched today for a Roman Catholic priest and two American nuns accused of giving refuge to Chile's most wanted leftwing extremists.

title: Vidata's President Admits Over billing On JobTraining Aid
description: Murray J. King, president of the Vidata Corporation, pleaded guilty yesterday to overcharging a Federal agency for his company's services in providing job training for disadvantaged workers.

description: MANHATTAN

title: MORE FOREIGNERS BORROWING IN U.S
description: Underwriters are scheduled to begin selling a $75 million issue of European Investment Bank sevenyear notes today in what appears to be at least a temporary resurgence of interest in the American credit market by foreign borrowers.

title: Iran Grants India Loan
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Iran has granted India a $630 million loan for development and exploitation of the Kudranukh iron ore mines, to be repaid in iron ore exports to Iran, the Iranian Finance and Economic Affairs Minister, Houshang Ansary, said today.

title: Princeton Student's Bid For Office Rejected
description: PRINCETON, Nov. 5  In an unusual contest yesterday, a Princeton University student failed to unseat the incumbent Princeton Township Tax Collector in the first challenge posted for the office in l 1 years.

title: Books of The Times
description: The disillusioning news in Fortune magazine recently that Aristotle Onassis was not even half as rich as Croesus tarnished a little the image of the golden Greeks so determinedly put l'orth in international gossip columns. Still a cachet of wealth, power, private islands, romantic cruises on private yachts clings to the surviving elite of Greek shipowners, and who can replace them?

title: I.O.S. and Lipper Barred by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission said today it has bared I.O.S. Ltd. of Geneva from association with any brokerdealer.

title: Senate Votes Aid Bill Stressing Poorest Nations
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 5 (AP) . The Senate today approved a $3.1 billion economic foreign aid package that provides new international food aid on formula helping the poorest countries first.

title: 8 Boston Students Arrested
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)Eight students were arrested today at South Boston High School after racial fighting broke out in hallway. The students, four blacks and four whites, were taken from the school after State police broke up the fight. Six persons suffered minor injuries, officials said.

description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 5The questioning of prospective jurors in the trial of Lynette Alice Fromme, accused of having attempted to assassinate President Ford, concentrated heavily today on their feelings about the socalled Manson family.

description: Khondaker Moshtaque Ahmed, who became President of Bangladesh in a coup two and a half months ago, has decided to resign, the Government radio said. Page 12.

title: Viking Mars Craf Has Battery Charge And Is Now Healthy
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. (UPI)Engineers switched on backup equipment aboard Viking 2 today to charge up vital battery aboard the Marsbound spacecraft.

title: Commercial Radio Reports 23.6% Decline in Profits
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Commercial radio reported 23.6 percent decline in profits last year, but television income raised overall broadcasting profits by 7.6 percent.

title: Gtambling Is Seeking Bid to Bowl
description: Although he has put together another in his long line of ,good football teams at Grambling, Coach Eddie Robinson was in town yesterday not so much to boast, about his Tigers 711 wonlost record as he was to stress his team's drawing power and ,put in an early bid for a postseason bowl invitation.

title: Signal to the Nation'...
description: The voters of New York City gave a resounding reply Tuesday to doubters in Washington and elsewhere who have begun to question the capacity of this metropolis to govern itself responsibly.

title: Chile Interior Minister Quits
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 5 (Reuters)  President Augusto Pinochet of Chile tonight accepted the resignation of his Interior Minister, Raid Saez, it was announced here.

title: They Dined and Danced as a Tribute
description: Issey Miyake flew in from Tokyo. Rosita and Ottavio (Tai) Missoni came with two of their children, Angela and Luca. Vidal Escojido who makes Tshirts in, Nimes, France, was able to get here for his first visit to New York after having to improvise because of an Air France strike.

title: SPACE PANEL URGES EXPANDED PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) A House space subcommittee called today for an expanded space program to help solve downtoearth problems while laying the foundation for advanced projects, such as moon bases and orbital colonies.

title: 8 Boston Students Arrested
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)Eight students were arrested today at. South Boston High School after racial fighting broke out in hallway. The students, four blacks and four whites, were taken from the school after State police broke up the fight. Six persons suffered minor injuries, officials said.

title: G.O.P. FAVORS FORD IN NEW GALLUP POLL
description: A choice by Republican voters, should next year's convention in Kansas City narrow down to a choice between President Ford and former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California, currently finds Mr. Ford the favorite by a margin of 58 to 36 percent.

title: Thousands of Romans Pay Final Tribute to Pasolini
description: ROME, Nov. 5Thousands today paid a final tribute to Pier Paolo Pasolini, the writer and film director murdered near here last weekend.

title: No Clear Pattern Is Found In National Election Result
description: Democrats won most of the major contests in Tuesday's state and local elections, with Republicans showing a bit more strength than they did a year ago and incumbents running well in most areas.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Is in Trouble, Barely Meeting Payroll
description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People is in grave financial trouble, barely meeting its payrolls, failing to meet increasing legal expenses around the country and unable to satisfy nowinsistent creditors. Some branches are reportedly barely staving alive.

title: U.S. Aides Deny Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The State Department declined official comment today on the Australian charges concerning Mr. Stallings. However, United States officials dismissed as absolutely untrue suggestions that Mr. Stallings had cultivated Australian politicians for espionage purposes or had passed them money.

title: Representing Consumers
description: The tantalized and tortured consumer advocacy bill is about to face what could be the happy ending to a sixyear legislative battle. The House of Representatives is due to vote final passage today; if the House can muster twothirds support, as the Senate did last May, it would virtually assure enactment even against the threatened Presidential veto.

title: Striking Union to Use Pickets on Horseback
description: LOGANSPORT, Ind., Nov. 5 (UPI)  Union members striking the Muehlhausen Brothers Spring and Manufacturing Corporation say they are introducing, a new form of picketingmounted patrols.

title: TWO U.S. COMPANIES STUDY FRENCH JET
description: PARIS, Nov, 5 (AP)Marcel Dassault, builder of the French Mirage jet, said today his company was discussing with two United States companies the possibility of jointly constructing a mediumrange airliner. He said the discussions were undertaken at the request of the French Government, which was anxious to keep civilian airplane programs going despite a lack of sales.

title: President of Bangladesh Resigns, Nearly 3 Months After Coup, in Confrontation With Military Officers
description: NEW DELHI, Thursday, Nov. 6President Khandaker Moshtaque Ahmed of Bangladesh, who took power in a coup d'etat two and one half months ago, has decided to resign, the Bangladesh radio announced this morning.

title: Series Game TV Hit
description: The seventh game of the 1975 World Series drew a TV , audience of 75 million, highest total for any televised sport program, the American League reported yesterday. The Super Bowl game last. January had a TV audience, of 71 million.

title: Democratic Gains Alter Suffolk Political Picture
description: SELDEN, L.I., Nov. 5The wideranging victories of Sufi folk Democrats in yesterday's! leglislative and town elections! sharply altered the political landscape of this traditionally Republican county.

description: William S. Hart Sr., the Mayor of East Orange, N.J., was indicted by an Essex County grand jury on charges of having paid a $1,000 bribe to obtain a municipal judgeship for an East Orange lawyer. [Page 45.]

title: Lockhart Seeking First Interception
description: As he contemplated the start of the second half of the Giants season yesterday, Spider Lockhart sounded like, well, like Spider Lockhart. The words fought each other to see which could come out fastest.

description: BOSERAllred. In fond moms; of MY dearly belayed husband who passed away 8 years ago today Ha will remain in my heart forever Dreyer. Broken hearted wife, Ann.

description: MONASTEREVIN, Ireland, Nov. 5 (AP)Authorities held a 20yearold mechanic today in the kidnapping of Hiede Herrema, the Dutch businessman who has been held captive here for 15 days by Irish Republican Army guerrillas.

description: TAIPEI, TaiwanIf you are young and unemployed, you might try the classified pages of Taipei's newspapers. In contrast with the situation in most countries, they are filled with dozens of help wanted ads.

description: BOSTON, Nov. 5Mayor Keyin H. White survived the passions of courtordered busing and a barrage of lastminute charges of corruption in his administration to win the nar rowest mayoralty election here in 26 years.

description: TRENTON, Nov. 5Governor Byrne said today that New Jersey faces a new fiscal crisis with the overwhelming defeat of four bond issues yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Federal Government filed a civilrights action yesterday that seeks to bar group of residents in Rosedale, Queens, from threatening, intimidating or otherwise interfering with blacks seeking housing in the predominantly white community.

title: Robert Sarnoff Quits Post At RCA in a Surprise Move
description: In a surprise move, Robert W. Sarnoff resigned yesterday as chairman and a director of the RCA Corporation. The company said Mr. Sarnoff had indicated that he intends to pursue other interests of a personal nature.

title: SENATE VOTES 860 TO OPEN MEETINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) The Senate voted, 860, today to require that all its committee meetings be open to the press and public except in cases infringing on national security or personal privacy.

description: In a surprise move, Robert W. Sarnoff resigned yesterday as chairman and a director of the RCA Corporation. The company said Mr. Sarnoff had indicated that he intends to pursue other interests of a personal nature.

That is especially true for those who vow they will take a little out of each paycheck and save it, but sometimes neglect it. United States Savings Bonds are easy to buy and indestructible.

title: 50 City Hospital Clinics Will Close
description: Fifty healthcare clinics maintained by the Health and Hospitals Corporation will be closed by the end of December to mbet the $85 million budget cut imposed on the corporation as a result of the city's fiscal crisis.

title: Beame Tells Ford City Is Not Grand Rapids
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Mayor Beame, reminded today of the suggestion that the city might be able to cope with its problems better if it were a 51st state, drew a round of applause and laughter by telling his National Press Club audience that the city was under normal circumstances, too good a friend to the state to eive us uo.

description: A Brooklyn grand jury yesterday voted indictments of Stanley Steingut, Speaker of the State Assembly, and his son, Robert, a City Councilman. at Large, in connection with a violation of the election laws, according to sources close to the investigation.

title: Connprs and Ashe Advance
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 5 (AP) Arthur Ashe and Jimmy Connors scored victories today and reached the third round of the $100,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament. Bjorn Borg and Ilie Nastase also won.

description: Bigstdre sales in New York City last month slightly exceeded the yearago level but failed to demonstiate the vitality anticipated from a strong Columbus Day's response.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Liberal Democrats in the House began organizing an attempt today to strengthen the reform provisions of the tax bill that the Ways and Means Commit. tee finished work on last night.

description: The Palace of Versailles. The very words brings to mind visions of the ultimate in luxury. And now copies of the fabrics used to cover Marie Antoinette's walls are available in the United States.

title: DOLLAR UP SHARPLY IN TRADING ABROAD
description: BRUSSELS; Nov. 5 (UPI)The dollar rose sharply on European money markets today, largely offsetting losses of the last week. Th price of gold rose to a twoweek high.

title: FOOD FOR SCHOOLS CUT OFF BY DEALER
description: A grocery dealer supplying canned goods to city schools for use in lunch programs cut off its shipments yesterday, decldring that it feared possible default by the city. It said that henceforth it wanted to be paid, in effect, cold., and that it had offered school officials a 2 percent discount on that basis.

title: For Durant, 90, History Is in the Past
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5High on a hillside above Hollywood, in a brown mansion grown musty with age, Will Durant and his child bride, Ariel, have finished their life work and passion.

title: Political Long Island
description: Doubtless influenced by governmental and fiscal malaise across the line in New York City, voters of Nassau County (including many commuters) chose to stick by the old, undemocratic method of rule by local Republican town supervisors with their emphasis on keeping taxes down instead of creating a new, truly representative legislature. The wellfinanced machine of G.O.P. leader Joseph Margiotta spent heavily to convince the public that the weightedvoting system, which gives Republicans 125 votes to 5 votes for Democrats, would mean saving home rule. In fact, it means continued boss rule, secret dealings and, in the long run, costlier government.

title: The New York Times/George Tames
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, in an address today to a joint meeting of Congress, again urged the United States to adopt a sympathetic attitude toward the Palestinian cause and to temper its support of Israel.

title: ALFRED I. SCHIMPF
description: Alfred I. Schimpf, a retired banker, died Monday at New York Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived at 50 East 72d Street.

Mrs. School lost by. 2 to I to Alexander W. Clark, a,Republican who said the campaign lost respectability be. cause of the poster.

title: The Joy of Being Single
description: RUTLAND, Mass. (AP) Amelia Copcut says the reason she has lived to be 109 years old is that she never married. I never had a real beau either, she told reporters at her recent birthday party.

title: Maine Voted to Abolish The Executive Council
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 5 (AP)Maine citizens voted decisively yesterday to abolish their 155yearold appointed Executive Council, leaving only New Hampshire and Massachuetts with that vestige of Colonial rule within their state governments.

title: SERGE! S. KANASH
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 (UPI)Sergei S. Kanash, a leading Soviet botanist who developed cotton varieties resistant to wilt diseases, died Oct. 30 after a long illness, according to the, provincial newspaper Pravda Vostoka, which reached Moscow today. He was 79 years old.

description: LOCHGILPHEAD, Scotland, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Fire tonight devastated the 18th century castle of the Duke and Duchess of Argyll, one of Scotland's most stately homes.

title: Boy Aiding Dog Killed
description: SIMPSONVILLE, S. C., Nov. 5 (UPI)A sixyearold boy, racing to help his dog after it had been struck by a car, was hit by another car and killed Tuesday in front of his home. He was identified as Roy Fate Balentine..

title: Defeat of Equal Rights Bills Traced to Women's Votes
description: It was women, not men, whose negative votes brought about the stunning defeat of state equalrights amendments in New York and New Jersey, both supporters and opponents of the amendments agreed yesterday on the basis of their contacts with thousands of women in the final days of the campaign.

title: Home Rule Charter Wins
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Nov. 5 (AP)  Lehigh County voters yesterday overwhelmingly became the first county in Pennsylvania history to approve a home rule charter. The new form of Government approved by a 2toI margin calls for an elected executive and a ninemember Board of Commissioners.

title: 1976 CODE OFFEREE BY COMMON CAUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Common Cause opened a pioneering effort today to introduce more truth and honesty into political campaigning by setting a code of standards for candidates and monitoring their compliance in the 1976 Election year.

description: In the Bicentennial reinvestigation of America's theatrical past, some plays will fade like old programs. Perhaps in some cases, such as Clifford Odets's Golden Boy, the old program would Irare been more fascinating than the revival. The original Group Theater production in 1937 had a cast headed by Ltither Adler and Frances Farmer, with, in minor roles, John Garfield, Lee J. Cobb, Karl Malden and Elia Kazan (as tough gangster).

description: PENSACOLA, Fla., Nov. 5 (AP)The body of a kidnapping victim, Alma C. Hartley of Pensacola, was found today in a wooded area, hours after two suspects in the case had been arrested, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said.

description: NUREMBERG, West Germany, Nov. 5 (Reuters)West German unemployment rose to L061,100 in October from 1,005,500 in September, the Federal Labor Office said today. This lifted the unemployment rate to 4.6 percent of the labori force from 4.4 percent in September.

title: The Ford Upheaval and Some Explanations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The only explanation that President Ford has given for dismissing the Secretary of Defense and the Director of Central Intelligence and setting off a Cabinet upneavat is that the President News wanted, as he put Analysis it, my guys in the jobs.

title: Egyptians See Sadat Gain in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Egyptian officials feel that President Anwar elSadat, during his 10day visit, has stated the Arab cause to the American public and politicians in an un adorned yet moderate way and that AmericanEgyptian relations as a result have become closer and more solid than at any time in the last quartercentury.

title: Personal Finance: Points on Shifting From One Bank to Another
description: Jack Leroy, who was transferred by his company from Boston to New York, made a list of details that had to be taken care of in the course of the move: renting a new apartment, finding a new doctor and dentist, choosing new insurance and securities brokers and so on.

title: Senate and House Conferees Approve Separate Bills on Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Despite a threatened veto by President Ford, Senate and House conferees approved today separate proposals that would reduce the average price of crude oil produced in the United States over the next two years.

description: Governor Carey appealed yesterday to the Federal Reserve Board for a 90day loan of $576 million to avert immr nent default in four state agencies over the next three months.

title: SANDS HOLD RICHE IN SPANISH SAIIAIV
description: PARIS, Nov. 5Five years ago with credits from the United States Government and the Chase Manhattan Bank and capital equipment supplied by the Krupp company of West Germany, Spain began the extraction of phosphates from Spanish Sahara.

title: Rain or Shine, UMass Rolls On
description: It was a muddy day in Amherst, Mass., on Sept. 27 when Massachusetts slid arid fumbled its way to a 73 football victory over Dartmouth, Luck was with the Minutemen when Rich Jessamy took a pass, from Brian McNally, ran a few yards and lost the slip pery ball at the Dartmouth 3yard line. But Jessamy slid on into the end zone and recovered the forward fumble for the winning touchdown.

title: Iowa Mayor Is Unseated After 40 Years in Office
description: LARRABEE, Iowa, Nov. 5 (UPI)You've got to step down someday, George Cochran said trlay as he accepted defeat after spending 40 years, his full adult life, as Mayor of this northwestern Iowa town.

title: Death Laid to Deodorant
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Nov. 5 (UPI)  The Jackson County medical examiner has deter1 mined that a 13yearold boy believed to have been killed by eating poisoned Halloween candy died instead from sniffing deodorant spray fumes. Dr. Bonita J. Peterson made the ruling in the case of Kevin Perry, who was found dead early Sunr, day in fronffof a television sef in the family living room

title: Lifer Wins 2d Trial in Brooklyn Killing
description: A man serving a life sentence for the murder of a Brooklyn liquorstore manager must be set free or given a new trial because of what a Federal appeals court described yesterday as the reprehensible conduct of the orosecutor in the case.

title: Most Bond Plans Rejected by U.S. Voters
description: Voters in various parts of the country indicated a preference for curbs on government spending by rejecting most bond proposals on the ballots in Tuesday's elections, sometimes apparently in reaction to the fi nancial crisis in New York City.

title: ALEXANDER'S SETS CHANGE FOR BOARD
description: Alexander's Inc. will propose to its shareholders at the Dec. 110 annual meeting that three classes of directors be elected for terms of one to three years instead of electing the entire board for one year. The company, the New York area's fourthlargest retailer in terms of sales, said it was seeking this change to make it difficult for any outside company interested in seeking control of Alexander's.

title: CHESSIE SYSTEM ALTERS AID PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Chessie System confronted the United States Railway Association today with new, tougher terms for its aiding the massive Federal reorganization of the bankrupt Northeastern railroads.

title: British Cardinal Hospitalized
description: LONDON, Nov. 5 (UPI) John Cardinal Heenan, 70 years old, Roman Catholic Archbishop of Westminster, was admitted to Westminster Hospital today after a mild heart attack, a church spokesman said.

title: E.R.A.'s Setback
description: Defeat of the state equal rights amendments in both New York and New Jersey represents the loss of a limited campaign, not the rejection of an idea. Evidence of national support for the concept of equality of the sexes is too massive by now to admit of any other conclusion.

title: General Franco Is Put on Artificial Kidney Machine
description: MADRID, Nov. 5Generalissimo Francisco Franco was put on a kidney dialysis machine today to clear his blood after uremia developed.

title: GEORGE B. STORER, BROADCASTER, 75
description: George B. Storer, who had been involved in broadcasting] since the early days of radio and had headed Storer Broadcasting Company, died Tuesday in the Miami Heart Institute. He was 75 years old and lived in Saratoga, Wyo., and Palm Springs, Calif. He spent part of leach year in Miami Beach.

title: BRITAIN RUSHING TROOPS TO BELIZE
description: BELIZE, Nov. 5 (AP)Britain rushed troops, planes and a frigate to this Central American colony today in the face of what officials here described as a possible threat of invasion from neighboring Guatemala.

title: COLBY KEEPS POST TILL SENATE ACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5WilLiam E. Colby, dismissed this week by President Ford as head of the Central Intelligence Agency, was asked today to continue to run the agency until his successor is confirmed by the Senate and acceded to the request.

title: Jefferson and Clinton Rematch Looms
description: Prospects of a rematch between Jefferson and Clinton for the Public Schools Athletic League football title still exist,. but the road to such a game will not be easy for either team. Jef

title: 35 Held in Yugoslavia
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 5 (Reuers)About 35 people have been arrested in various parts of Yugoslavia for Cominformist activities, informed sources said here today. The reference is to efforts to restore Yugoslav membership in the Soviet bloc, as in the days of the Cominform, a Sovietled alliance of Communist parties from which Yugoslavia was expelled in 1948.

title: Camden Mayor Strives for Rebirth of Blighted City
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 5When Angelo J. Errichetti was sworn in as Camden's 40th Mayor in June 1973, he described his hometown as a city mired in a downward spiral, a city with a dying business district, a city plagued by crime, a city with a weak tax base because of the suburban flight, a city that in some sections resembles Vietnam.

title: 4 New Works From Japan Are Played
description: Confronted with an event called A Concert of Contemporary Music From Japan, only the naive listener would expect, nowadays, to hear anything indentifiably Japanese. The socalled international style has such a firm stranglehold on composers that new music, whatever its national or regional source, tends to sound pretty much the same.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 5After four years in New York, Peking's representatives at the United Nations have stepped out, at least partly, from their selfimposed isolation.

title: BIG GAIN REPORTED IN STUDY OF FUSION
description: The United States Energy Research and Development Administration announced yesterday what it called a major development in improving the confinement of ultrahot gases, or plasmas, that would be needed in any future thermonuclear fusion power plant.

title: PLAN LINKS SUIT TO NOTE EXCHANGE
description: Officials of the Municipal Asistance Corporation are considering a plan to have a Federal court order the holders of city notes to exchange them for M.A.C. bonds in settlement of suit filed three months ago by an outraged noteholder.

title: House Unit Drafts Bankruptcy Legislation for City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5  A House judiciary subcommittee today worked out the major provisions of legislation to enable New York City to petition for bankruptcy, but postponed final action until tomorrow.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. for Gebate on Palestine issue.

title: ERROR RATE IS CITED IN GRADING OF GRAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Senator Dick Clark, Democrat of Iowa, said today that investigators of the Federal grain inspection system have found up to a 30 percent error rate for grading grain in some areas.

title: 17 Members of Greek Junta Freed on a Treason Charge

New Jersey Briefs
description: State health inspectors cited the main kitchens at the Trenton Psychiatric Hospital and the Woodbridge State School in Avenel for unsanitary conditions. Officials closed the kitchen at the hospital, and other arrangements were made to feed some 700 patients. A spokesman said the kitchen at the hospital had been cited on 15 counts of unsanitary conditions, mostly for roach infestation. Commissioner Ann Klein of the Department of Institutions and Agencies assured the Health Department that efforts were under way to alleviate the alleged conditions. About 1,200 people are fed at each meal at the school.

title: About the Jets . .
description: The thirdstring middle linebacker, John Ebersole, will be starting on Sunday against the Dolphins at Miami. Jamie Rivers, No. 1, and Steve Reese, his backup, are nursing leg injuries. . . . The Dolphins Garo Yepremian hasn't missed a field goal this season, making all nine he has attempted. And Don Nottingham has as many touchdowns, nine, as Larry Csonka produced all last season. . . . If fans really are objective, says the New Yorkers right guard, Garry Puetz, they'll realize that we've got hell of a good football team.

description: Enough progress has been made toward an understanding of aging to foster a belief that the miseries of old age will some day be eliminated and that perhaps life may be extended indefinitely, according to the lead article in the October issue of Bioscience.

Two notable Hamptim alumni, Jimmy Owens and Illinois Jacquet, are in the 14piece band, that Mr, Hampton is leading this week at Buddy's Place.

description: Silver and gold futures contracts rose yesterday on the Commodity exchange here. The oneday rise was not as sharp as it appeared because the Comex was closed for trading on Tuesday, Election Day, while trading continued in the metals in Chicago on Tuesday. Yesterday, the futures prices caught up here for the day they lost.

Schlesinger, who had just lost his as Secretary of Defense, to commiserate. You know, Mr. Schlesinger said, Dick Helms outlasted us both.

title: Human Factor Seen In L.I. Girl's Death
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 5A police spokesman said today that Maryjane Dahl, a 16yearold terminally ill patient, was still alive Sunday night at Nassau Hospital when her respirator Became disconnected, leading to her death.

title: 'No Way Out' Is a Thriller From Italy
description: Do not be deceived by the blurry stuff in the foreground. "No Way Out," made in Italy a couple of years ago and arriving now for no good reason, is about Italian interior design. It has black leather chairs. Lucite-topped tables, stainless steel clocks, white-veneer beds and orange-panel radio controls.Partly obscuring all this excitement are a lot of people killing one another. They work for the Mafia and one of them, played by Alain Delon, decides to quit. As a result he and his former colleagues engage in mutual destruction.People die by shooting, stabbing, strangulation, defenestration from a moving train and compacting in an automobile graveyard.Stick with the furniture, though. It is colorful and well-photographed. It is far more expressive than Mr. Delon, Richard Conte or the rest of the bullet-studded cast. The film opened yesterday at the National, the Eastside and other theaters.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 (Reuters)  The composer Kirill Molchanov has resigned as director of the Bolshoi Theater just as it begins its 200th anniversary season, a theater spokesman said today.

title: CAREY REQUESTS FEDERAL RESERVE TO AID 4 AGENCIES

New York, said another message, on the north side of the building, will survive.

title: Threats on Mayor of Lodi Under Inquiry;

description: When Joseph Smith, pianist. made his New York debut last season he played Schumann's Novellettes and Forest! Scenes. In his return to Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night, the young Mannes College faculty member included two more sizable Schumann works in his program.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5The voters here picked a liberal Democratic state senator and a conservative supervisor for the mayoral election runoff Dec. 11, while also registering a sharp punitive vote against all city employesparticularly the police and fire departments, who went on strike briefly last Aueust.

title: COMPUTER EXPERTS APPEAL FOR RUSSIAN
description: The leading society of cornputer specialists in this country has mailed letters to Soviet scientists and officials yesterday on behalf of Prof. Valentin F. Turchin, expressing hope that the physicist and mathematician be permitted to come to Columbia University as a visiting scholar. He was invited more than a year ago but has received no exit visa.

title: WNCN Plans Series For City Opera Funds
description: As part of a fundraising effort for the New York City Opera, WNCN station will broadcast a series of special radio programs this Saturday and Sundays from noon to midnight. Listeners at that time will be able to phone in pledges to subscribe to the spring opera season.

title: G.O.P. Committeeman Quits
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 (AP) William Banowsky, a Republican national committeeman California, has resigned because of problems at Pepperdine University, which he heads. He was chosen as commkteeman two years ago on the recommendation of Gov. Ronald Reagan. However, he has endorsed President Ford !for the Republican. nomination.

title: BRITAIN TO STRESS INDUSTRY IN SHIFT OF ECONOMIC AIMS
description: LONDON, Nov. 5  Prime Minister Harold Wilson, citing a persistent erosion of Britain's economic power, presented a new economic program today that revokes for at least five years national policies that successive Governments have endorsed since the end of World War II. Under the plan, the Government's ambitious social welfare programssuch as nationalized health care and heavily subsidized housingwould come second to aid to industry in the scale of national priorities.

title: STOCKS OF CRUDE OIL UP IN LATEST WEEK
description: The continuation of unusually warm weather has given the petroleum industry a chance to build up its supplies of distillates and crude oil. But at the same time the weather is being called a factor in increased usage of gasoline as motorists take to the highways and use more fuel, reducing gas supplies.

title: Veto Seen for Bill Allowing Civil Servants in Politic:
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  President Ford intends to veto a pending bill that would permit Federal civilian employees en engage in partisan political activities, Robert E. Hampton, Chairman of the Civil Service Commission said today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HAPPY WINGS The elegance of the restaurant at the Sign of the Dove, at 1100 Third Avenue, is one thing. The cheerful informality of its cocktail lounge, on the northeast corner of 65th Street is quite another. It's easy to relax inside this oasis, with brickandtile, hanging plants, an oldstyle bar (a Vodka Martini was $2.97) and simple tables and chairs. And nobody looks more relaxed than Lynn Mullinax, an ample man who presides at the piano, often humming and even whistling along with his melodies. Tuesday through Saturday, he starts at 5:30 P.M., ending around 1:30 A.M.

title: Angolans in Luanda Area Try to Regroup
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 5 The liberation movement that controls the Luanda area is seeking to shift its widely scattered guerrilla units into conventional military commands in preparation for Portugal's relinguishing of sovereignty over Angola next Tuesday.

title: Erving Gets 36 as Nets Down Pacers by 119102
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 5 (AP)Julius Erving, almost singlehandedly choking off a late Indiana rally, scored 36 points tonight as he led the New York Nets to a 119102 triumph over the Pacers in the American Basketball Association.

title: Notes on People

The message was that the Governor was a grandfather for the first time: His daughter, Susan Carey Dempsey, and her husband, Martin, a marineinsurance broker, became the parents of a daughter at 12:25 p.m. at Lenox Hill Hosnital.

description: VANCOUVER. British Columbia, Nov. 5As a vacation area, Where one's body and spirit can be restored in times of stress, this part of western Canada is hard to beat, and that's exactly how the New York Ranger found it on their current visit.

description: It was women, not men, whose negative votes brought about the stunning defeat of state equalrights amendments in New York and New Jersey, both supporters and opponents of the amendments agreed yesterday on the basis of their contacts with thousands of women in the final days of the campaign.

description: ALBANY, Nov. 5Governor Carey, saying he needed a backup in his Albany office to insure continuing attention to all details of state operations, today appointed Robert 3. Morgado, a 32yearfiscal analyst, as director of state operations.

description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 5 (AP)A Federal judge opened the way today for former World Football League players to go jobhunting in the National Football League, and several contending teams were expected to begin looking for help immediately.

description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 AP) A judg3 was called from retirement to preside over the trial of William and Emily Harris, memoers of the selfst.;led Symbionci,e Liberation Army.

title: The Theater: And So to Bed,
description: At first glance one might legitimately wonder why anyone thought it worthwhile to. revive J. B. Fagan's 49yearold English comedy And So to Bed. Yet it was revived at Stage 73 last night, and its revival becomes more comprehensible when we note first that the play is directed by Eugene Leontovich, and second, that Miss Leonlovich made her first major American apperance in a United States, tour of the play in 1928. Furthermore, the play is now produced by Catherine Ellis, who play the leading role in the revival and is president of the Leontovich Workshop in Manhattan. So that is one theatrical mystery cleared up.

title: Carey May Put Lottery Before the Legislature
description: Governor Carey is considering placing the issue of reform of the state lottery before a special session of the State Legislature next week, a source in the Governor's office said yesterday.

title: Policeman Slays Youth on East Side
description: In what the family termed at senseless killing and the police said was the proper performance of a policeman's duty, a 16yearold high school senior from Long Island was shot in the hack and killed by an offduty police officer on the East Side late Tuesday night.
