title: FRANCIS DVORNIK, 83, MEDIEVALIST, IS DEAD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Rev. Francis Dvornik, a historian of the medieval church and professor emeritus of Byzantine history at Dumbarton Oaks, Harvard's Center for Byzantine Studies in Washington, died at his family home inKromeriz, Czechoslovakia, on Tuesday. He was 83 years old.

title: Screen: 'Mr. Quilp' Based, Loosely, on Dickens
description: Dickens may be dead, but anybody trying to pirouette on his grave is going to get broken ankles. Applying musical comedy conventions to his work is like skimming the highlights off a Rembrandt and trying to sell them as a painting. Whether you find him moving or stupefying, Dickens is a grainy accumulation of detailcomic, grotesque, lachrymoseamounting to a complex but integrated whole. Like the man whose character was so strong that he had to change his shirt twice a day, Dickens reeks of himself."Mr. Quilp," a musical film by Anthony Newley that opened yesterday at the Guild Theater, is a boneless and tentative excursion through "The Old Curiosity Shop." It starts off fairly directly with the misadventures of Little Nell and her grandfather, but it lags farther and farther behind the mercilessly advancing plot. Soon all you hear are faint voices among the furniture, dwindling finally into the fog that directors pump into Dickens movies when they can't find their way out.To say that "Mr. Quilp" is by Anthony Newley is technically inaccurate. The director is Michael Tuchner, and the screenplay, such as it is, was written by Louis and Irene Kamp. But it is clearly fashioned around Mr. Newley as Quilp, the fiendish Cockney entrepreneur who persecutes Little Nell and her grandfather. And Mr. Newley, who seems to be directing himself, also wrote the lyrics and the music.This is part of the problem. Mr. Newley's lyricsexcept for one that may finally put out of their misery the three most abused words in musical comedy: "somewhere," "sometime" and "somehow"are often clever. There is a particularly good one where he catalogues himself as a walking horror who is "so crooked I have to screw my socks on."But the music is virtually nonexistent. It runs up and down and goes nowhere. Music can do a lot for a musical. It helped "Oliver," the last Dickens musical around, quite a bit, and it would have been welcome in "Mr. Quilp."Without it we are back to Mr. Newley, eyes rolling, teeth like old Gorgonzola, posturing and mugging and putting out his cigara crooked one, of coursein a cucumber sandwich. He is good up to a point, but he can't manage to decide whether he is pantomiming evil or portraying it.When he is on, at least, the picture has a certain vitality. Otherwise it gets by on the pinched-back performance of Sarah Jane Varley as Little Nell, the immovable melancholy of Michael Hordern as her Grandfather and the plain immovableness of David Hemmings, who literally has nothing to do in the role of Richard Swiveller.Bits of Dickens drift in. There are moments when the wanderings of Little Nell and Grandfather, joining first a traveling carnival and then a traveling waxworks, almost become a persuasive image of uprootedness. For the brief time she is on, Jill Bennett does a marvelously palpitating termagant whose feet would stamp except that they don't quite reach the ground.Mostly, though, the picture is becalmed, treacly and about three-quarters of an hour too long.

title: Goldwater and McGovern On TV for the Conventions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Senators Barry Goldwater and George McGovern, two men who lost Presidential elections by landslide margins, have signed up to become television commentators for next year's national nominating conven, I dons.

title: Ford Denies ShakeUp Signals Change in Nation's Defense Policies
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7President Ford declared today that the shift in Defense Secretaries and other national security advisers that he announced this week signaled no softening or change in the nation's defense policies.

title: Compensation Sought for Rape Victim
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7, (AP)New Jersey's Public Advocate said, today that his department would try to win an award from the Violent Crimes Compensation Board for an 18yearold rape victim who never knew until it was too late that she was eligible for aid.

title: Art: Edlich Show Echoes Past
description: Stephen Edlich's first oneman show of paintings in New York is at the Gruenebaum Gallery, 25 East 77th Street, and it's just about as good as it could be. It is also very much of our own day. Mr. Edlich was born in 1944. He comes therefore of a generation that knows that by the time it came to manhood the possibilities of art had been so thoroughly researched that a period of adjustment and consolidation was called for. It is to this situation that Mr. Edlich addresses himself in these new paintings, and he does it with an intelligence, a developed historical sense and an unforced sensibility that in combination have a great deal to offer.

title: Britain's AboutFace
description: LONDON, Nov.7In the context of three decades of British Government policy that favored spending for public welfare over industrial development, the program that Prime Minister Harold Wilson unveiled this week is close to revolutionary. The Government, a Labor party Government at that, said that it now favored factories and profits over schools, hospitals, and full employment as an end in itself. Profit, proclaimed the tabloid Daily Mail, is a dirty word no longer.

title: Columbia Censors Radio
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 7 (AP)Describing the nation as in a state of internal commotion, President Alfonso LOpez Michelsen imposed strict radio censorship today and banned public demonstrations. The measures were decreed under a state of siege, or modified martial law, imposed last June. The President empowered the Communications Ministry to cancel broadcasting licenses of stations said to be spreading .reports inimical to the public order.

title: Navy Rally Gives Miami 1716 Loss
description: MIAMI, Nov. 11 (UPI)Gene Ford returned an intercepted pass 24 yards for a touchdown early in the fourth quarter tonight to cap a Navy comeback that gave the Middies a 1716 victory over Miami.

title: Midshipmen March At Kings Pt. to Back 13 Put on Probation
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 7 All 830 midshipmen at the United States Merchant Marine Academy here held a colorful fulldress parade late today in an effort to persuade the academy's superintendent not to dismiss or set back 13 popular midshipmen now on academic robation.

title: Italian High Court Approves A Referendum on Abortion
description: ROME, Nov. 7 (AP)The Supreme Court of Italy today declared valid a petition for a referendum on whether to legalize abortion.

title: Mental. Centers in Jersey And L.I. to Lose US. Aid
description: The United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare has notified two major psychiatric facilities in the metropolitan area that Federal Medicaid and Medicare payments will cease by the end of the year because they do not meet the required standards of medical care.

title: Financial Default Consequences Held Exaggerated
description: In a departure from the view of other major banks here, the First National City Bank has concluded that warnings of widespread financial repercussions from a default by New York City are undoubtedly exaggerated and that a domino theory of the economic disasters that default would bring is not supported by experience.

title: NAVY ASKS BONUSES TO BAR BRAIN DRAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) The Navy is warning Congress that a brain drain of specially trained officers moving to civilian industry could force the service to lay up some of its multimillion dollar nuclearpowered submarines and surface ships in 1980.

title: Texas Golf to Crenshaw
description: MARBLE FALLS, Tex., Nov. 7 (AP)Ben Crenshaw carded five consecutive birdies to open his final round today and posted a fivestroke victory an the Texas state open golf tournament. Crenshaw won the $5,000 first prize on a 64 and a total of 268.

title: Schlesin ei's View of Kissinger Described
description: In the view of Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger, differences between him and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger on how to deal with Soviet violations of the first agreement on limitation of strategic arms were a major cause of Mr. Schlesinger's dismissal, according to a close aide of the Secretary.

title: Waldheim Expected to Propose Small U.N. Presence in Sahara
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 7  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim is expected to recommend that the Security Council set up a modest international administration in the disputed territory of Spanish Sahara to prepare for a referendum within six months.

title: Progress
description: The energy crisis  was a blow to American pride and prosperity, but it may well turn out to be a fortunate turning point in our history. We learned, at a stage short of the truly critical, that we had allowed ourselves to become overly dependent upon foreign supplies a vital good. The Arab oil embargo  has opened our eyes to the shortsighted policy we had been pursuing.

title: LILLIAN WALKER, 88, SILENTMOVIE STAR
description: Lillian Walker, a popular star of early silent films, died Oct. 10 in Trinidad, where she lived with the family of her late husband, Dr. Eugene W. Senior. She was 88 years old.

title: State Psychiatric Facility To Lose Federal Support
description: The regional office of the United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare notified state officials in Trenton yesterday that the Trenton Psychiatric Center did not meet accreditation standards and that Federal Medicaid and Medicare payments would cease by the end of the year.

title: Heptagonal Run Is Won By Merrick
description: Dave Merrick of Penn set a meet record yesterday in winning the individual title for the third time in the 37th annual Heptagonal Games Association crosscountry championships at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: BRITISH SAID TO PLAN MORE ARMS TO EGYPT
description: LONDON, Nov. 7 (Reuters)Britain is ready to increase its sales of arms to Egypt and will probably lift restrictions on the supply of the powerful BritishFrench Jaguar aircraft, in formed sources said tonight.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices finished mixed on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday as trading was influenced by a cut in the prime lending rate to 71/4 percent by the First National City Bank.

title: for Energy
description: It may not be fair to say that nothing has been done with energy policy since October 1973. After all, 2,480 energyrelated bills have been introduced in Congress! And 38 actually passedthough President Ford vetoed five of them.

title: Opera: Rita Hunter in Met Norma
description: To get it over quicky, Rita Hunter is not a satisfactory Norma in any respect. In fact, the Metropolitan Opera's first Norma of the season, on Thursday night, proved to be a travesty of Bellini's work both musically and dramatically, and the English soprano's inadequacies were chiefly responsible.

title: A Store Does Its Part To Help Save the City
description: Ronald Price, vice president of a handbag store at 735 Madison Avenue. at 64th Street, says he feels that President Ford is not treating the city like a part of the United States, he's not treating us like human beings.

title: Shah on Deal Pullback: Pari Am Not Well Ran
description: The Shah of Iran has revealed that one reason for his country's pullback on its projected $300 million plan for aiding Pan American World Airways was that Pan Am was not very well run.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Ford Says He Will Enter All of the Primaries in 76
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7President Ford said tonight that he would enter all of the Presidential primaries next year. And he vowed to remain in the race until he won the Republican Presidential nomination at the party's national convention next August in Kansas City, Mo.

title: ACCOUNTING SHIFT ON LOANS WEIGHED
description: In an effort to resolve widespread uncertainties among businesses over how to account for changes in the terms of loans on balance sheets, the Financial Accounting Standards Board pr,oposed yesterday rules that would require the borrower to determine its gain or loss on the loan based on the relationship of the renegotiated interest rate to the original interest rate.

title: Antiques: Six Dynasties
description: The ripple effect of the re cent archeological excavations of dated Six Dynasties tombs in China has stimulated enormous curiosity and vigorous intellectual investigation of the poorly documented finds made decades or centuries ago.

title: CBSTV Will Add Afternoon Reruns Of All in Family
description: CBSTV, in an attempt to boost its sagging daytime ratings, will add reruns of All in the FarnilY to its afternoon I schedule starting Dec. 1. Original episodes will continue to be shown on Monday nights at 9.

title: Happy Thought
description: ROCKVILLE, Md., Nov. 7 I belong here, where everything is civilized and gay and rotted and polite. And wouldn't mind a bit if in a few years Zelda and I could snuggle up together under a stone in some old graveyard here. That is really a happy thought and not melancholy at all.

title: Friend of Victim's Is Seized in Slaying Of Man, 48, in Park
description: A 50yearold man whom the police described as a friend of the victim's for many, many years was arrested late yesterday in the slaying of Richard Harral, who was stabbed to death in Central Park last Saturday evening as he was sailing his model boat in the pond off Fact 74th Street.

description: 1 (OTB payoffs subject to 5% State lax.) FIRST$8,000, pace, mile.

title: Time to Negotiate
description: If King Hassan II is willing to settle for the symbolic conquest achieved in the initial sixmile penetration the Spanish Sahara by 100,000 unarmed Moroccans, the opportunities for averting bloodshed and negotiating peaceful settlement for the territory will be preserved. It will improve the negotiating climate enormously if the Kinghaving presumably made his pointwill now withdraw the marchers behind the Moroccan frontier.

title: Ford Is Expected to Keep Arms Data From Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7High Administration officials expressed doubt today that the White House woul dagree to honor a subpoena from the House Intelligence Committee for documents concerning the conduct of the arms limitation talks with the Soviet Union.

title: Strike Continues a 3d Day At Jewish Philanthropies
description: A strike by 200 employees of the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies entered its third day yesterday.

description: On the last birthday of his lifeseven. weeks after the achievement of India's independenceMohandas. K. Gandhi asked for condolences, not congratulations. By then only the flocks of vultures sating themselves on the human carrion of the Punjab had any reason to feel satisfied. description: ROCKVILLE, Md., Nov. 7 I belong here, where everything is civilized and gay and rotted and polite. And wouldn't mind a bit if in a few years Zelda and I could snuggle up together under a stone in some old graveyard here. That is really a happy thought and not melancholy at all.

title: Futures Prices Have Fallen On Gold, Silver, Platinum
description: The precious metalsgold, silver and platinumhave lost much luster for speculators in the last year. The futures contract prices for these metals have shown a long decline.

title: SENATE PANEL BACKS FULLER .DISCLOSURE
description: A bill has been approved by the Senate International Finance subcommittee that would require public disclosure about foreign investments in United States companies.

title: Huge Belfast Shipyard May Shut
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland The British Government is threatening to withdraw its support of a shipyard here that is the largest employer in Northern Ireland. The action could come by Christmas, the Government said, and would force the yard to close within a year or two.

title: Napoles Defense Set
description: Jose Napoles of Mexico will defend his world weltetweight title against John Stracey of England on Nov. 29 in Mexico City as part of a boxing doubleheader. Alfonso Zamora of Mexico, the bamtamweight chatripiori, will meet Socrates Batoto of the Philippines in the othel. bout.

title: College Student, 50, Dies In an Elevator Accident
description: NEWARK, Nov. 7 (AP)  A 50yearold evening student at Essex County College was killed yesterday when she stepped into an elevator shaft and fell nine stories, the police said.

title: Signs of Stability in Oil Profits Found Despite Third Quarter's Sharp Decline
description: Although oil company earnings moved sharply lower in the September quarter, some analysts discerned occasional bright spats in the period and offered hopes that the earnings picture had stabilized.

title: Ashe Ousted by Panatta; Connors, Borg Advance
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 7 (AP) Adriano Panatta of Italy upset the defending champion, Arthur Ashe of the United States, 6.3, 62, today and gained the semifinals of the $100,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament.

title: Florio (Who?) Dralted For President in 76
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 7 (AP)James J. Florio, a firstterm United States Representative from Camden, is the latest candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Political Payoffs Revealed To JaiAlai Inquiry Panel
description: NEWINGTON, Conn., Nov. 1 A 76yearold former Democratic politician today gave the State Gaming Commission a detailed account of political influencepeddling in the state as the commission continued its investigation into the Bridgeport iaialai scandal.

title: 4 Rail Unions Agree to Delay Strike Until Nov. 18
description: Four railroad unions agreed lyesterday to a Federal mediator's request for a oneweek delay after having announced that they would strike the nation's rail system at 6 A.M. next Tuesday.

title: JOBLESSNESS UP BY 0.3% IN OCTOBER TO 8 MILLION TOTAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The nation's unemployment rate rose from 8.3 percent to 8.6 percent in October, and the number of unemployed persons went back up to more than 8 million for the first time since May, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Karl Stern, 69, Psychiatrist, Professor and Author, Dies
description: Karl Stern, an author ana professor of psychiatry at the University of Ottawa, died yes. terday at his home in Westmount, a Montreal suburb. He was 69 years old.

title: British Cite Youth Crimes
description: LONDON (AP)More than half the burglars and 40 percent of the muggers and motorvehiclelaw violators arrested in London are younger than 17, acicording to police statistics.

title: House Committee Extends Tax Cuts to
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The House Ways and Means Committee gave final approval today to legislation modifying and extending into 1976 and beyond the tax reductions that were voted earlier this year for 1975.

title: A Fertilizing Influence on Sociology
description: One of the pioneers in the sociology of science, Robert K. Merton, now a University Professor at Columbia, has long enjoyed a towering reputation in the intellectual world but, alas virtually none outside the academy. This is a great pity because Professor Merton has a mind that plays with important ideas the way a squirrel plays with nuts. He was among the first American sociologiSts to write with percepticn on science and Puritanism in 17thcentury England and for the last 40 years he has exercised a fertilizing influence in his field, not only as a generator of dazzling ideas but also through his students.

title: Boy Waving Flag Narrowly Misses President in Crowd
description: President Ford, who during his travels has bumped his head, stumbled, slipped and fallen and even been in an auto accident, was narrowly missed yesterday by an American flag waved by an excited 8yearold boy in Massachusetts.

title: MISS FROMME OUT AS OWN ATTORNEY
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 7Lynette Alice Fromme was barred from the courtroom today after the tiny, pale dei fendant, calling for Manson and my family to testify in her behalf, refused the judge's ultimatum that she either behave herself or spend the duration of the trial in a closed room.

title: Beame Puts Off Details on Budget Cuts
description: Mayor Beame yesterday postponed until next week the presentation to the Emergency Financial Control Board of $200 million in detailed budget cuts for this year.

title: NYLON FIBER PRICE RAISED BY DU PONT
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company said today that effective Dec. 1 it would raise the prices of nylon staple fiber and dacron polyester staple fiber used in the carpet industry by from 4 to 7 cents a pound.1 A company spokesman said that neither the percentage amount of the increase nor the new price range was immediately available.

description: MOUNT VERNON, Nov. 7 Brooklyn College won the Met Eight Conference football title tonight by beating Iona, 216, and raising its wonlost record to 61.

title: Yachtsman Is Sighted,
description: TOKYO, Nov. 7 (AP)Keniche Horie, Japan's bestknown yachtsman, feared lost in a transPacific race, was sighted today for the first time in 42 days by a defense plane about 90 miles east of Okinawa. He had left San Francisco on Sept. 22 in his sloop Mermaid.

title: People in Sports
description: Alex Grammas, given a threeyear contract yesterday, did not promise any miracles in accepting the job as the new manager of the Milwaukee Brewers. Grammas, who had been the Cincinnati Reds thirdbase coach since 1970 and who is considered by many to have one of the best baseball minds in the major leagues, predicted only that we would be tremendously improved. The Breweri have never been over...500 since the franchise came into being in 1969 as the Seattle Pilots. Grammas replaced Del Crandall, who was dismissed after last season.

description: Jim Kubacki, Harvard's quarterback, went down hard on the point of his left shoulder in the third period at Franklin Field in Philadelphia last Saturday. The result of that impact with the AstroTurf field at Penn is that Kubacki, a southpaw passer and excellent runner, will not be available today for Harvard's game with Princeton at Cambridge, Mass. The quarterback, who leads the Ivy League in individual total offense, suffered severe bruises and stiffness in his throwing shoulder and

title: CITIBANK REDUCES KEY RATE TO 7%
description: The First National City Bank of New York, in a move set off by a continuing decline in shorttime money market rates, cut its prime lending rate yesterday to 7 percent from 7 percent.

title: CAREY, ON COAST, CRITICAL OF FORD
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7Governor Carey flew to California today and sharply criticized President Ford for trying to teach New York a lesson.

description: TRENTON, Nov. 7 (AP)The State Supreme Court today ordered a oneyear suspension for an Essex County lawyer charged with misuing money in his legal trust account.

description: BOSTON, Nov. 7President Ford told Republican supporters here tonight that he would enter all of his party's PresidenI tial primaries next year and that he would be a winner right UD to the end of 1976.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 7The United, States (pledged in the General Assembly today to work for a Middle East settlement taking account of the legitimate interests of The Palestinian people.

Porter said yesterday that it was invidious and irrational to keep lowincome guardians from receiving Federal funds just because they were not the actual parents of the child.

description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 7 All 830 midshipmen at the United States Merchant Marine Academy here held a colorful fulldress parade late today in an effort to persuade the academy's superintendent not to dismiss or set back 13 popular midshipmen now on academic robation.

title: New Bengali President to Stay; 3 Military Men to Assist
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 7The new President of Bangladesh declared tonight that he would remain the chief executive of the country, under martial law, but that the commanding officers of the three armed services would assist him.

title: Music
description: New York Philharmonic subscribers who are perplexed or put off by some of Pierre Boulez's programming must be blessing Erich Leinsdorf this weekend. His program for the current set of four concerts begins with Strauss's Don Juan, ends with Ravel's La Valse, Includes Beethoven's Symphony No. 8 and has its novelty Barber's Piano Concerto. It's a painless package guaranteed to be free of surprises or any implications that earstretching might be good for one's musical health.

description: How to ask for aces when the bidding has reached three notrump is an important theoretical problem to which there are several answers.

description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 7The Supreme Court of India today unanimously reversed the conviction of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi on two electoral offenses in June, removing the threat of her having to resign from office.

description: SWEDESBORO, N.J.Grain and soYbeans are replacing vegetables on many of the farms of the Garden State.

description: The possibility of a New York City default is responsible for recent weakness in the United States dollar and has already had a significant impact on foreignexchange markets all over the world, according to leading market experts.

description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 7 (AP)Three Roman Catholic nuns from the United States accused of a conspiracy to hide some of Chile's fugitive leftwing guerrillas were expelled from the country tonight.

title: Finland Gets Soviet Accord On Correspondents
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7 (Reuters) Finland today became the third Western country to obtain multiple exit and reentry visas for its correspondents in Moscow, as provided under the European security docunfeat signed in Helsinki in August.

White Sox received today, a catcher, Chuck Erickson, as the player to be named later in the September deal that sent first baseman, Deron Johnson, to the Boston Red Sox. Erickson has a minor league batting average of 269 and will be assigned to Denver of the American Association.

description: North Bergen, N.J.  Pedro Soto, 181 pounds, Puerto Rico, and Bobby Walker, 180, Somers, Conn., drew, 10 rounds.

title: Angolan Front in Luanda Concedes Clash in South
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 71The nationalist faction that controls this capital broke its threeday silence today on its batt12 with a mercenary column in the south and announced that violent combat was going on around the vital fort and railroad cities of Lobito and Benguela.

title: City U. Weighs Cut In Open Admissions To Conserve Funds
description: A radical change in the City University's openadmissions policy that would deny immediate admissions to students who need remedial training is among the numerous proposals being considI ered by the school's leadership as solutions to the university's budget problems.

description: Once, when his shirt was torn off and his suspenders flopped over his pants, a bloodied Brad Park turned to the bellowing Boston crowd and raised his fingers in the peace sign.

description: The economy is global, said Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger in his Sept. 1 message to the special session of the United Nations General Assembly devoted to the problems of development and economic cooperation. Recessions, inflation, trade relations ... and growth of transnational enterprisesthey are international phenomena and call for international responses.

description: Rodney Jenkins, the leading rider in th international events at the National Horse Show, gave a spectacular ride last night before a crowd of 11,000 at Madison Square Garden and won the Volco Challenge Trophy.

title: Esposito Gets 2 Goals, But Rangers Lose, 75
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 7 (AP)Phil Esposito scored two goals in his first game for New York, but California's Gary Sabourin netted four goals tonight as the Golden Seals overpowered the Rangers, 75, in a National Hockey League game.

title: MISS HEARST HELD FIT TO STAND TRIAL

Mugavero of the Brooklyn Diocese, added their voices yesterday to those of community leaders already appealing to President Ford and the Congress for speedy action to helo avert default.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The House Appropriations Committee's action today will not result in a cut in the food stamp program, a spokesman for the committee said.

title: Codd Rules Out Pensions In Ousters for Corruption

description: Ann L. Woodfield, a teacher at the Primary Day School in Bethesda, Md., was maried here yesterday afternoon to Dan Cordtz, econornirs editor of ABC News here. Judge E. Leo Milonas of the Criminal Court performed the ceremony in his chambers.

The 32yearold black militant was to begin a series of five weekend seminars on Black

title: Jewish Leader Says Inflation Is Threat For Congregations
description: DALLAS, Nov. 7A lay leader of American Reform Judaism said today that the gap between the nation's inflation and the income from congregational dues posed a serious threat to the development of 715 Reform congregations in this country and Canada.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Mayor William S. Hart Jr. of East Orange, said he would remain in office despite his indictment on bribery and misconductinoffice charges. The City Council chairman, Earl Williams, said he knew of no plans to ask for the Mayor's resignation or suspension.

title: Soviet Omits Big Missiles From Red Square Parade
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7Every building was streaked with red banners this morning. Across Red Square the troops stood in rigid ranks, dwarfed like toy soldiers beneath an immense portrait of Lenin.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Federal energy officials tried today to put public pressure on the HouseSenate conference committee to revise legislation the conferees approved last night that would force an immediate reduction in the price of crude oil produced in the United States.

title: ANGOLA MOVEMENT CLAIMS A VICTORY

title: Brant and Snow Geese Are Added to the Wildfowl That Can Be Hunted on
description: ALBANYThe season for hunting ducks and geese on Long Island will open on Nov, 19, with a forecast by the State Department of Environmental Conservation that the prospects are favorable for good hunting.

title: Red Smith
description: For the third time in five years, crimi nal charges have been brought against a player in the National Hockey League for hoodlum behavior in a game. Dan Maloney of the Detroit Red Wings stands accused of assault occasioning bodily harm. In Toronto Wednesday night he attacked Brian Glennie of the Maple Leafs from behind, slugged him stupid, repeatedly slammed him to the ice and put him in the hospital with concussion. He got five  minute penalty and an automatic $100 fine.

title: 24Hour Arming of Police Reduces Some Crime at Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICKStatistics reveal a decline in some types of crime on the Rutgers University campus since last May, when the university police were authorized to carry weapons 24 hours a day. Formerly, they were armed only 16 hours.

title: ParkandRide Lot
description: A commuter parking lot in Port Jefferson has opened free to the public, Austin H. Emery, Regional Director of Transportation, has announced. The new parkandride lot, which can accommodate 142 vehicles, is on the west side of Route 112, where it intersects Route 25A (Hallock Avenue).

title: School for Disturbed Children in Vanguard of Design
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y.A decade ago, when bold colors, supergraphics, builtin furnishings and carpeted environments began revolutionizing decorating, critics insisted that the style was a fad that would flicker briefly and be snuffed out where it had startedin the home.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Jack Roland Murphy, known In headlines as Murf the Surf, was 27 years old when he teamed up with two men to steal the Star of India sapphire from the American Museum of Natural History in 1964, and he was 32 when he was convicted of killing a young woman in Florida. In between he had been found guilty of armed robbery and, for a time, had been ruled legally insane.

title: The Odyssey Of Kennedy's Children
description: Robert Patrick wrote ?lore than 100 playg of all shapes and sizes before one of them reached Broadway. And Kennedy's Children,  the Patrick play which opened last week at the Golden, arrived here not from Off Off Broadway, where it was born, but from overseas, where critics and audiences from London to Capetown, South Africa, have hailed it as a remarkably evocative summingup of the American experience during the 1960's, and Patrick as an outstanding playwright.

title: State Officials Must Disclose Assets
description: ALBANY, Nov. 8  Physicians, psychiatrists, research scientists and other professionals who earn $30,000 a year or more in state posts will be required to file statements of financial worth with the new State Board of Public Disclosure, the board has ruled.

title: Music: Pears and Ellis Do Britten
description: About this time last year Peter Pears was appearing at the Metropolitan Opera as the star of Benjamin Britten's Death in Venice. He had just made his Met debut at the age of 64.

title: The Hollywood influence
description: Robert Sklar means his title to be taken seriously. Other books tend to settle for making the movies a mirror of society. Thus Michael Woods's recent America in the Movies and Molly Haskell's From Reverence to Rape show how the screen reflected the passions and prejudices of a nation. But Sklar has higher

title: Letters: A New Role For Senior Citizens?
description: To the Editor:

title: Moscow Has About Given Up the Idea of One EastBloc Ideology
description: MOSCOWCommunist pluralism in Europe alive and well, much to the discomfort of Moscow. After months of futile efforts to arrange a congress of European Communist parties that would read China out of the world Communist movement, the Soviets have evidently given up and are now ready to settle for a conference with little substance.

title: Dunlop Asks Policy Shift On Regulatory Agencies
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 8Labor Secretary John T. Dunlop has proposed that the Ford Administration make a subtle but fundamental change in the way the Government develops and enforces regulations that affect the pocketbooks, health and safety of millions of Americans.

title: Mrs. Maxwell Has Nuptials
description: Marion Heard Maxwell, daughter of Donald Bryce Heard of Pittsburgh and the late Mrs. Heard, was married there yesterday noon to Mark Keating McNally, who is with the Pittsburgh law firm of Brandt, McManus, Brandt & Malone. The ceremony at the Longue Vue Club was performed by Judge I. Martin Wekselman of the Allegheny County Court of Common Pleas.

title: SEPARATIST DRIVE WORRYING FRANCE
description: ST.BRIEUC, France, Nov. The French Government, increasingly concerned over separatist movements, is trying to weaken the persistent campaign for more regional independence here in Brittany, which has been a thorn in the crown of Paris for almost 500 years.

title: Engagements
description: HellerAlexander

title: Fragility, of Democracy Stirs Japanese Anxiety
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8Three ballot boxes skelid side by side in an exhibit on the progress of democracy to demonstrate the expansion of the right to vote.

title: ISRAEL IS SEEKING FIRSTSTRIKE ARMS
description: Israel is reportedly pressing the United States for weapons  missiles or aircraft  that would give it the means of launching a preemptive first strike with conventional weapons against Arab states in the event of a crisis comparable with that of October 1973.

title: Talk and SecondRate Coffee
description: MORRIS PLAINS  All that people get here is talk and secondrate coffee, but they keep coming back because they want to get well, said Judy Knowlton a counselor at the Morris County Alcohol Recovery Center, which has an intensive program for county residents with drinking problems.

title: New Law Gives Tenants: Right to Habitable
description: For many years tenants have as sumed that in return for their rent they were entitled to a dwelling fit for human habitation. But not until two months ago was that assumption written into state law.

title: Susan Thomas Plans Nuptials
description: Susan Roy Thomas, teacher at the Montclair (N.J.) Kimberley Academy, and John J. Heidrich Jr., sales manager in Manchester, England, for Deering Milliken Menswear, plan to marry next spring.

title: STAMPS
description: In a strifetorn world and a United Nations beset by bickering between the smalls and the bigs, as well as between blocs of nations, the peacekeeping operations of the world organization, serving a vital need, continue to be one of the greatest strengths of the U.N.

title: Headliners
description: Mr. Sarnoff Leaves a Palace

title: President's Proclamation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. SFollowing is the text of President Ford's Thanksgiving Day proclamation, signed Tuesday, Nov. 4.

title: TUBES, COAST GROUP, IN ROCKDECO SHOW
description: Shades of Ken Russell! The Tubes cranked up the old belief that nothing succeeds like excess'at their Bottom Line debut on Thursday with a theatrical rockshow where the rock'n'roll was used as a framework upon which to build exotic and cheerfully decadent visuals.

title: CAROLINE BARTHOLOMEW
description: Caroline Rowe Bartholomew, who won the Unit,ed States Senior Women's Golf Association championship in 1963, died yesterday in Brookline, Mass., where she had lived. She was 73 years old and also had home in Roca Raton, Fla.

title: Volunteers Help Care for Quadruplets
description: EAST BRUNSWICKEver since the arrival of quadruplets on Aug. 20, the home of Aaron and Mona Weiss has been a little like Grand Central Terminal. And the young parents could not be happier, for most knocks on the front door announce that help has come.

title: Bill to Aid Old Taxpayers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, said today that he would intro. duce legislation to provide Federal aid to older persons who pay more than 4 percent of their income in property taxes. The proposed legislation would be provided to persons who pay 4 percent of their income in property taxes up to a maximum of 9 percent of an $8,000 annual salary, Senator Williams said.

title: Equity Action Unit Lists Mrs. Fenwick
description: EAST BRUNSWICK Representative Millicent Fenwick, Republican of New Jersey, and Ethel Bent Walsh, vice chairman of the Federal Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, will speak next Saturday at a luncheon meeting sponsored by the New Jersey division of the Women's Equity Action League.

title: Integration Has Failed
description: CHICAGOTo the list of appellations bestowed upofi Chicago by Carl Sandburg, add anotherthe most racially segregated Northern city in the United States, according to an unchallenged survey last year by the Council Municipal Performance.

title: If You Go
description: . to Sunnyside and Lyndhurst, the round trip from Grand Central terminal to Irvington costs $3.20 on weekends ($4.20 weekdays). A return trip from Tarrytown costs 90 cents more. Taxis are available at the Irvington train station. and for the trip to Sunnyside, they charge a single passenger $1.75, groups $1 a person; children under 12 ride free.

title: Answers/Questions
description: AWILD STRAWBERRIES (litet..Yip)r.;. m D. L. S., Villanova, Pa. has wild strawberries in his lawn and asked how to get rid of them. Here are two ideas. Ruth Maidman, a Connecticut reader suggests, Keeping the lawn mower in the garage arid:allowing the strawberries to flowerarid ripen Milt. Spend a few minutes a day gathering t*rt forbreakfast cereal, or yogurt or ice cream topping. There Will beplenty of time to mow the lawn in July, August and September. William R. Grippenburg, New *Jersey, notes that wild strawberries grow well on organically depleted soil. He recommends applications of manure and lime to encourage the grass to choke them out.    WHITE BIRCH PROBLEM (Oct. 19)

title: Modern Troupes Gather Under One Umbrella
description: Dance has never had a reputation for intramural cooperation, but this may be the year when dtente becomes a fact of life in the moderndance world. Driven by the need for an economically feasible way to produce what has never been the establishment form of dance, 12 small, experimental, modern  dance companies have joined forces to present a twoseason series called Dance Umbrella.

title: Tinling, Tennis Revolutionary
description: The scene is the 1949 Wimbledon tennis tournament in England. A 26yearold American named Gertrude (Gussie) Moran has stepped into the court wearing a short suntop dress with matching lace underwear, in overt defiance of the staid dress code at Wimbledon. The dress is designed by Ted Tinling.

title: Buckley Hones Arm in Academic Climate
description: In August, 1974, Brian Buckley was considered the leading schoolboy quarterback in the nation as he prepared to enter his final season at Marblehead (Mass.) High School. He was so popular, the school set up an appointment schedule for the horde of recruiters making their way to that suburb of Boston.

title: Kansas Upsets Sooners, 233
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 8Laverne Smith scored two touchdowns in the second half and a crippled Kansas defense gave a tenacious performance as the unranked Jayhawks ended fumbling Oklahoma's 28game winning streak with a stunning 233 Big Eight victory.

title: Colonia Remains Unbeaten
description: Pete Risko plunged for two touchdowns, each from 1 yard, yesterday as unbeaten Colonia's balanced attack subdued Sayreville. 24.10.

title: Gertrude Freeman Kissel Plans Bridal to A. Hunt Marckwald 3d
description: Mr. & Mrs. Peter F. F. Kissel of Indian Creek Island, Fla., formerly of New York and Far Hills, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gertrude Freeman Kissel, to A. Hunt Marckwald 3d, son of Mrs. David H. Mortlock of New York and Quogue, L. I., and the late Albert Hunt Marckwald Jr.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: There's a certain agreeable defiance to the notion, live alone and like it. But nations, like people, simply can't afford it. Specialization, the division of labor and the random distribution of natural resources have created an interdependent world economy in which American wheat, German machinery, Arabian oil and Korean textiles are traded in the interest of mutual prosperity.

title: China Is Reported to Seek Nuclear Data From West
description: GENEVA, Nov. 8 (Reuters).China wants to learn more from Western scientists about nuclear research, according to a scientific delegation that has returned from a twoweek visit there.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayWest Highland White Terrier Club of Greater N.Y. specialty match, American Legion Hall, 16401 Goethals Avenue, Flushing, Queens; entries from 1 P.M.; judging, 2 P.M.; terrier symposium, 10 A.M, handling classes and grooming, noon.

title: Alabama Tops L.S.U., 2310
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 8 (AP)Fifthranked Alabama relied on three secondhalf field goals by Bucky Berrey tonight to hold off Louisiana State University and post a 2310 Southeastern Conference victory.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on amendment to international development and food assistance bill that would require that 80 percent of commodities allocated under the bill go to countries with a per capita gross national product of $250 or less, which passed, 52 to 39, Nov. 4.

title: No tears for Namath
description: In the subtle tumult that was the late 1950's, I composed three sports articles for Carey McWilliams at The Nation, which he called. Money, Muscle and Myth. Presently an editor asked me to expand the pieces into a book.

title: From Sambo To Superspade
description: The Black Experience in Motion Pictures. By Daniel J. Leab. Illustrated. 301 pp. Boston: Houghton Mifflin Company. $15.

title: Experts Debate Legalization of Falconry
description: ROSELAND  Should falconry, the ancient Sport of Kings, be legalized in New Jersey?

description: INCOMING

title: N.C. State Tops Lions, 1514
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa.Nov. 8A 24yard field goal early in the fourth quarter capped a North Carolina State rally today that upset Penn State, 1514, in football.

title: Abdication
description: The Presidency itself is the greatest political asset that any White House incumbent can possess as he enters a political campaign. The office automatically confers historic prestige and an air of authority; it makes him privy to diplomatic and military secrets that his outside rivals may not know; it enables him to generate news and command public attention to an extent that every other politician can only envy.

title: BLACKS MAKE PLEA TO U.N. ON ZIONISM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 8A group of black American scholars, educators and other intellectual leaders appealed to the General Assembly today to set aside the draft resolution that would condemn Zionism as a form of racism and racial discrimination.

title: To the Green Mountains
description: This is an excellent if somewhat perplexing book. It shows no trace of the patronizing attitude all too common in juvenile literature, but it perplexes because so little is explained about the background of the characters. When does tbis story take place? Evidently about the time of World War I, but one must work it out. More puzzling: how does it happen that Kath Rule's mother, Elizabeth, manager of a hotel in South Angela, a small Ohio town, holds liberal ideas about black people? Some townspeople call her nigger

title: TV VIEW
description: These are notes I found in a bottle which I emptied on learning that I was the only one in my peer group who did not watch The Incredible Machine on public television the other Tuesday night, having decided several seasons ago that National Geographic specials made holes in my socks and when I put my foot in my mouth I don't want to be eating my toes. It seemed to me on Tuesday night that it is enough of a trial having to look at one's face in the shaving mirror every morning, when it resembles an undernourished armpit; why volunteer to sit through a tour of the human plumbing in one's own livingrom? This was a mistake because now I can't write a column on the highmindedness of Gulf Oil, which underwrote the program.

title: MOREY SHORTAGE PERILS RESEARCH
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 8hundred scientists from a dozen countries gathered in a con.. ference center here this week to discuss a new world shortage of an important natural resource  monkeys.

title: For young readers
description: This charming narrative of cause and effect is an African legend retold, one of the nicest of many such adaptations of African folklore. It begins with a mosquito teasing an iguana and the iguana inadvertently alarming a python. The panic is contagious, passed on from one forest animal to another, until a monkey, swinging wildly through the trees, breaks a branch that kills a baby owl, and Mother Owl refuses to hoot for the sun to rise. At King

title: Ford Settles Rust Suit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 8 (UPI)  A $27,500 outofcourt settlement has ended a law suit filed by a group of 39 owners of Ford Motor Company cars who said that their vehicles rusted prematurely. The suit was dismissed this week after a Wayne County circuit judge John M. Wise, was notified that all the owner had accepted the Ford offer. He said the payment affected only the 39 plaintiffs because the case was not certified as a class action suit.

title: Endpaper
description: BERKELEY COUNTY, W. Va. About 10 years ago, back in the days when I worked for Republican politicians battling Democratic Presidents, constant harassment by the Internal Revenue Service caused me to snap my twig and just stop paying taxes altogether. I won't go into the tedious details, but I will note that I announced my decision to the I.R.S. by sending along a copy of the Declaration of Independence. By return mail, my tax collector informed me that a lien would be placed against all my propertythat they would take every cent, literally 100 percent, of every penny I might earn and that they could discern.

title: Pennsylvania Milk Is Hurting Farmers Here and in Jersey
description: ALBANY, Nov. 8A growing invasion of milk from outside the usual areas of production into the New York metropolitan area is costing farmers and milk dealers in New York State and northern New Jamey tens of million.; of dollars,this year, according to the State Department of Agriculture and Markets.

title: Mamaroneck Tastes Victory
description: The long nightmare is over for Mamaroneck.

title: The Tennis Clinic
description: The topspin lob in tennis is something like the behindtheback pass in basketball or the roundhouse curve in baseball. It's a flashy, eyecatching play, it's a valuable tool when used at the right time and it's something many players are reluctant to try for fear they'll bungle it and, perhaps what's worse, embarrass themselves.

title: QUINLAN DECISION IS DUE TOMORROW
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J.. Nov. 8 (AP)Judge Robert Muir Jr. has scheduled a closed session in Superior Court on Monday to announce his decision in the case of Karen Anne Quinlan, the comatose New Jersey wornan whose parents want her to be allowed to die with dignity.

title: Egypt Once Eluded Def atilt at a Price
description: Mayor Beanie's deadline to save the city from default is Dec. 1, 1975. The deadline for the Khedive of Egypt was Dec. 1, 1875.

title: Livingston, 3 Others Still Without Defeat
description: Livingston, Hillsborough, Green Crook and Franklin Township scored convincing victories yesterday to remain among the unbeaten teams in New Jersey.

title: Earthquake Prediction Raises Issues
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7Regional, state and local officials responsible for the public welfare before and after an earthquake met here today to try to figure out what to do now that reliable earthquake prediction appears to be around the corner.

title: Park and the Rangers Represent Costly Lesson
description: In the summer of 1972, when the New York Rangers fended off the impending talent raid of the new World Hockey Association by agreeing to pay a halfdozen stars the biggest salaries imaginable, Bill Jennings, the club president, said, We've just bought ourselves a Stanley Cup.

title: Edouard Cournand Dies at 78; Headed Lanvin Perfumes Here
description: Edouard L. Cournand, who established Lanvin Parfums Inc., and made familiar the Promise her anything but give her Arpege slogan, died yesterday lof a stroke at his home, 998 Fifth Avenue. He was 78 years old and also lived in Lloyd Neck, L. I.

title: Correction
description: It was erroneously reported in the Oct. 26 Week in Review that Nelson Rockefeller had resigned as Governor of New York to take the Vice Presidency. Mr. Rockefeller left the Governorship on Dec. 18, 1973, but did not become Vice President until Dec. 19, 1974.

title: Fun and games in East Village
description: Tales of Beatnik Glory is a collection of yarns, anecdotes and shaggy person storiessome perhaps true, a few no doubt autobiographicalof the Lower East Side in the period, roughly 195962, of High Beat, a time in both the arts and lifestyles of a suspicious bubbling that might well pass for ferment. Ed Sanders was there, founding arts magazines with unprintable titles, singing strange songs, radicalizing, effervescing.

title: FEW DEFENDANTS FAIL MENTAL TEST
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 8A psyciatrist who participated in the courtordered mental examination of Sara Jane Moore said this week that the odds are tremendous against any accused person undergoing such tests being found incompetent to stand trial.

title: Lina Krisch Engaged to Edward Vinson
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joel Krisch of Roanoke, Va., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lina Scher Krisch, to Edward Bennett Vinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Vinson of Great Neck, L. I., and Cape May, N. J.

title: CHINA DISPLEASED WITH THE OUSTER OF SCHLESINGER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8China has underscored its concern over Washington's policy of dtente with the Soviet Union by taking the unusual step of issuing a report that criticized President Ford for having dismissed Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger.

title: King of the Gypsies
description: Gypsies are the great mythologizers of the world. According to one legend, they are condemned to roam as perpetual nomads because their ancestors had once renounced Christ. According to another, the Roman soldiers at Mount Calvary were going to use four nails to crucify Jesus, but a gypsy stole the one intended for His Heart. In gratitude, Christ gave them the right to go on stealing forever. Like Khrushchev, who had an old peasant saying to justify whatever he wanted to do, a gypsy can come up with a myth for any

title: Susana HaymanChaffey in Choreographic Debut
description: Susana HaymanChaffey, who has danced with Merce Cunningham's company since 1968, made her local debut as a choreographer Friday night at Pace University's Schimmel Center for the Arts.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as sunerb.

title: JERSEY Ell. LOSS LAID TO 4 COUNTIES,
description: TRENTON, NOV. 7 Leaders of the campaign to add an equalrights amendment to the New Jersey Constitution, still stunned over Tuesday's defeat, conceded today that the amendment drive had faltered badly In four key northern counties, accounting in large part for the defeat.

title: Congress Is Urged to Act On Budget for the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) President Ford has sent Congress the District of Columbia budget with a request that it. be, acted on promptly because it Involves the capital's Bicentennial preparations.

title: Bayside Triumphs Over Bryant, 340
description: Bayside turned back Bryant, 340, yesterday in a P.S.A.L. Queens game at the winner's field. The Commodores (411) were led by Gary Gottsegen, who scored twice on short runs. Other Bayside scores were made by Chy Davidson, George Mason and Reggie Swindell.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Registered nurses returned to work yesterday, ending a oneday sickout at the Bronx Municipal Hospital Center and the City Hospital Center in Elmhurst, Queens. The work stoppage was staged to protest personnel reductions resulting from attrition and cutbacks caused by the city's fiscal crisis. A similar protest by nurses Thursday at Bellevue Hospital ended on Friday. The return to work resulted from meetings held Friday by representatives of the New York State Nurses Association and the Health and Hospitals Corporation, which operates the city's 18 municipal hosiptals.

title: School Zoning Challenged By Parents in Forest Hills
description: A coalition of parents and civic organizations from the Forest Hills area in Queens has gone to court to challenge a Board of Education zoning plan that it contends is resegregating Forest Hills High School,by bringing in minoritygroup students from other neighborhoods.

title: Courtenay Wells Wed in Virginia
description: Courtenay Norton Munford Wells of Richmond was married there yesterday afternoon to David la Bauve Farley Jr. of Greenwich, Conn. The ReF, Richard R. Baker 3d performed the ceremony in St. James Episcopal Church.

title: In the footsteps of the master
description: Frank Kermode, England's grooviest generalpurpose critic, has been helping adorn two Eliotic occasions: the repackaging of an array of Eliot's critical prose, and the delivery of the 1973 T.S. Eliot Memorial Lectures at the invitation of the University of Kent (Canterbury). For his point of departure at Canterbury he chose

title: Margery R. Weil to Marry Dec. 28
description: Margery Roe Weil, a graduate student at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Theodore Van Huysen Mayer, who attends the Harvard Law School, plan to be married Dec. 28.

title: Fashion
description: No matter how many woolly layers one manages to pile on these days, furs are still the warmest coldweather shelter. This season highlights narrower silhouette, jackets for day and night,Nanook of the North hoods and kir classics (raccoon and mink) fashioned into easygoing coats with their own removable foulweather shells.

description: Banks

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Although Lenin, James Joyce and Tristan Tzara (leading Dadaist and apostle of the irrational)  are all in Travesties, Tom Stoppard's play is really about an actor named John Wood. As the author was explaining to Mel Gussow (or having him on) in an openingnight interview for this newspaper, he'd been determined to write a play for Mr. Wood for some time when he happened to come across the odd, though not necessarily meaningful, fact that Lenin, Joyce and Tzara all lived in Zurich at the same time during World War 1. Sensing an opportunity for his special brand of cerebral playfulness, and speculating on what it might or mightn't have been like if any two of the three had met, he first thought of turning Wood into Tzara, though he discarded that notion (he says) upon discovering that they didn't look alike. Wood was next to be cast as Joyce, whose riverspill of language he'd have been so capable of managing; no dice there, either, possibly because Joyce just wasn't going to become all that important to the verbal circus (for very good reasons, which I'll get to later). Hence he had no part for him, which led to the one real inspiration that hit him. He'd give him no part, no part to play at all, make him a nobody at a time when the world was coming to nothing, and let him talk a blue streakfantastifications, furies, liesthat would make the sudden emptiness of 1917, and the disintegration of everything from society to language that followed the war years, blitheringly transparent on

title: No one to blame but himself
description: Dylan Thomas, the AngloWelsh poet, died of his excesses in 1953. I can't be impartial about him, though I never met him. The sort of poetry that he wrote, the taste in poetry that he appealed to and confirmed, above all the notions created by his notorious and disastrous career as to what is a normal relation between a poet and his publicthese I had to struggle with when I began writing poems, and they obstruct me still, just as they obstruct (and in too many cases have destroyed) my contemporaries. The late John Berryman and the late Anne Sexton are just two poets who might, I believe, have had longer and happier lives if they hadn't grown up under the shadow of the Dylan legend.

description: To the Editor:

title: Waldheim Outlines Sahara Role for U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 8Secretary General Kurt Waldheim called today for the utmost restraint in Spanish Sahara to avoid a tragedy and to keep open the path toward a peaceful settlement on the disputed territory.

title: Ruth W. Urban, Carleton Smith Wed in Buffalo
description: Ruth Woodward Robinson Urban, daughter of Henry Zeller Urban, president and publisher of The Buffalo Evening News, and Mrs. Urban of Buffalo, was married yesterday afternoon to Carleton Craig Smith of Washington, a member of the finance staff of the President Ford Committee campaigning for Mr. Ford's Presidential nomination.

title: Policeman Indicted In a Fatal Beating Saves 2 in Crash
description: A 26yearold suspended police officer from the Bronx, under indictment in the fatal beating of a suspect last June, was credited with saving two lives early yesterday, in a multiple car crash in which he suffered leg injuries.

title: Many Basques Hail Their Guerrillas but Expect Peace
description: GUERNICA, Spain, Nov. 3Despite the romantic appeal of guerrilla warfare for many young Basques, most of them (seem to feel at the moment that Basque nationalism will acneve most of its goals without undue bloodshed.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Supporters Extol Verdict
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 8Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Congress party held a victory celebration here today to acclaim her exoneration yesterday by the Supreme Court.

title: Marchi Tells State Lottery Needs Cash To Meet Its Payroll
description: ALBANY, Nov. 8 (AP)The chairman of the State Senate Finance Committee said today that it was virtually certain that the. State Lottery Division would be unable to meet its payroll after Nov. 15 unless the game were resumed.

title: Connors Triumphs Over Borg
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 8 (AP) Jimmy Connors and Adriano Panatta reached the final of the $100,000 Stockholm indoor open tennis tournament today.

title: Syvilla Fort, a Dance Teacher Who Inspired Blacks, Is Dead
description: Syvilla Fort, the dancer and pioneer in black dance, who was honored for her work last Monday, died yesterday of cancer at SloanKettering Memorial Hospital. She was 58 years old and lived at 158 West 44th Street.

title: L.I.A. Warns on City Default
description: JERICHOIf New York City defaults on its debts, the repercussions will rock across the nation and will be particularly evident on Long Island, the Long Island Association of Commerce and Industry has warned.

title: Phosphate: Taking a Leaf From Oil's Book
description: On the surface there would seem to be little to fight over in the windswept deserts of the Spanish Sahara, the North African colony now claimed by Morocco. But beneath the inhospitable sands of the disputed territory lie vast deposits of what some call white gold: phosphate rock, the raw material foronefourth of the world's fertilizers.

title: He Is the First Politician to Be Nominated to Direct the C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTONIn a city where knowledge is power, the Director of Central Intelligence is a man of awesome power. He will know of world crisis before the President, or at least as soon; of oil trading in the Mideast and arms deals Africa, of political shenanigans in Paris and intrigue in Istanbul.

title: 4 Killed in Plane Crash
description: PHILIPSBURG, Pa., Nov. 8 (AP)Four persons, flying tol Penn State for a football weekend, were killed last night when their light plane crashed in heavy fog in a mountainous area near this Centre County) comunity, the police said. The victims were the pilot, Gait Montgomery, 33 years old, and his wife Joanne, 33, of Quakertown, Stuart Stein of BalaCynwyd, and Theresa LivingstonSmith of Lansing, N.Y. the state police said.

title: Donald Bridgman, 83, Dies; Personnel Chief at A.T.&T.
description: Donald S. Bridgman, who retired in 1964 as personnel director of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, died Monday at his home in Rowayton, conn. He was 83 years old.

title: NETWORK SAYS G.M. IS ANTITRUST TARGET
description: Two bureaus of the Federal Trade Commission have recommended an antitrust action against General Motors, NBC News reported last night.

title: Industrial Group Donates Trucks to Nassau County
description: MINEOLANassau County has received five trucks and a tractor trailer as a gift from the National Old Timer's Association of the Energy Industry.

title: Mrs. Donohue, Librarian, Wed At Rye Chapel
description: Margaret Cosgrove Donohue of Larchmont, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Cyril Thomas McDermott of Cortlandt, N. Y., in the chapel of the Convent of the Holy Child Jesus in Rye, N. Y. The Rev. Robert O'Connell, assisted by the Rev. James F. Halligan, performed the cere mony.

title: Hofstra Expects Fiscal Gains
description: HEMPSTEADAs colleges and universities face increasingly burdensome deficits and declining enrollments. Hofstra University's new board chairman sees that school moving into a healthy fiscal position over the next decade.

title: Candlemakers Create a Warm Glow
description: No one really knows when the first candle was made. its warmglow seems to have been part of man's history since earliest times, as evidenced by the fact that archaeologists have found candlesticks dating back to 2500 B.C. The need for them has long since disappeared in this country, yet candlemaking remains a popular craft.

title: Poly Foils Rally by St. Paul's
description: St. Paul's attempt for a twopoint conversion failed yesterday with 3 minutes to play, giving Poly Prep a 2019 victory. Jim Carlopio, the Poly quarterback, had a hand in all the scoring as he threw two firstperiod touchdowns and then ran for a touchdown and the conversion in the final quarter. The 5foot10inch senior had 125 yards rushing.

title: Ohio State Defeats Illinois, Sets Marks
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Nov. (AP)Archie Griffin, Pete Johnson and Tom Skladany turned in recordshattering performances today in leading Ohio State to a 403 Big Ten victory over Illinois..

title: Bruin Aerial Attack Keys 4523 Rout
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Nov. 8A brilliant aerial attack carried Brown to a 4523 triumph over Cornell today and lifted the Bruins into first place in an Ivy League race that was suddenly clogged with contenders.

title: Toronto Museum Robbed
description: TORONTO, Nov. 8 (AP)  A thief made off with a wax and plaster model of Raquel Welch from Toronto's Wax Museum, officials said today. They said the thief might have hidden in the museum until it closed, then fled down the fire escape with the dummy.

title: EDUCATORS CALLED REMISS ABOUT BIAS
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith said Friday that a sociological study con.: diicted for the league showed that educators, more by defiult than by design, were filling to cope With rampant preiudice.

title: Lisa Brothers Sets April Bridal

title: The old boys were masters of deception
description: Perhaps we need to be reminded that deceit and undercover operations have not always been at the service of low causes, such as the subversion of friendly governments, the assassination of chiefs of states with whom we were not at war, the hounding of radicals, and the opening of Senators mail. There was a time when dirty tricks had their plarp, in accordance with Machiavelli's dictum: Though fraud in other activities be detestable, in the management of war it is laudable and glorious.

title: Papp in private
description: Joseph Papp is so busy with his professional theatrical activity that he scarcely has time for a private lifeand that life is exceedingly private.

description: MADRID, Nov. 8 (UPI)Generalissimo Francisco Franco's struggle against death had been described by his doctors; as remarkable for an 82yearold. His medical problems include the following:

title: PublicService Study Popular
description: NEWARK  An apparent resurgence of interest in improving government services has prompted an unusually large number of students to pursue a master' s degree program in public administration at Rutgers University here.

title: WARSAW RELEASES ETHNIC GERMANS
description: BONN, Nov. 8 (AP)Mote than 600 ethnic Germans arrived in West Germany last month from Poland, the first of 125,000 refugees, slated to be resettled In exchange for West German grants of nearly el billion to Warsaw, Bonn officials have reported.

title: L.I. Catholic School Serves as Yeshiva
description: SMITHTOWN  Every Monday evening, around 7 o'clock, buses and cars full of teenage boys and girls pull up at St. Anthony's High School here.

title: The Basic Elements of the Arguments Are Not New
description: The rational effort to understand the ways of man, an enterprise already well launched in the day of Plato, has once again entered a period of ferment. The yeast this time is Sociobiology, the New Synthesis, a monumental book by Edward O. Wilson.

title: If You Go
description: . to the Colonial Pennsylvania Plantation from the New York City area, take the New Jersey Turnpike (Interstate 95) south to the Pennsylvania Turnpike (I276). At Penn Pike exit 35S, pick up U.S. 202 south for a short distance, then State Route 252 south, then State Route 3 west. The entrance to Ridley Creek State Park is on the left; inside, visitors to the plantation can use parking lot 4.

title: APPLICANTS SOUGHT FOR MURROW.GRANT
description: The Council on Foreign Relations, a private nonprofit membership organization engaged in study and research in the field of international relations, announced yesterday that it was accepting applications for its 197677 Edward R. Murrow Fellowship.

title: Remember to hold your hip uphill
description: Efficient skiing requires us to stand flat on both skis and to be able to roll over each ski (edge it) to the same angle. To do that most of us need to some varying degree to have wedges of plastic or metal between boot and ski to compensate for our natural stance.

title: Giant Day at Shea; Jets Play at Miami
description: The people who made Craig Morton the star of an early season production, Run for Your Life, will appear at Shea Stadium today unless the Giants can hijack their buses, lock and barricade the gates or slip laughing gas into their containers of Gatorade.

title: PIANO RECITAL GIVEN BY GUARDARRAIK AS
description: Eduardo Guardarramas showed considerable promise at his 1967 debut, but on the evidence of his Friday night recital at Carnegie Recital Hall, the young pianist has regressed. Mr. Guardarramas's playing still showed lots of temperament, but it was studded with an unacceptable number of technical malfunctions and interpretive misjudgments.

title: A Harpsichord Is Born Of Love and Artistry And a Thousand Parts
description: HOPEWELLIn an age of instant antiques and doityourself kits, Christopher F. Bannister is a rarity. He is a master harpsichordbuilder.

title: Postseason Roundup
description: It was the kind of meeting that takes place only in Hollywood movies about European trains: a man, a woman, a brief encounter. She leaves in Vienna, trailing a boa through clouds of steam as the train pulls out of the station. He lowers the compartment window, leans out and shouts, Wait! I don't even know your name. She, being royalty and good at such things, flashes an enigmatic smile and replies, You don't need to know my name. You already know everything.

title: Held in Threat to Ford
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 8 (AP)An unemployed transient has been charged with threatening to kill President Ford and Vice President Rockefeller. United States Magistrate John Weinberg declined yestreday to set bail for the defendant, 33yearold Philip E. A. Miller. The; charge against Mr. Miller said he told Secret Service agents in (Seattle earlier this week that the would shoot the. President and Vice President yesterday morning.

title: A Low Calorie Diet for the Musically Obese
description: The news that WNCN, NeW York's 24hour Stereo Concert Hail, has returned to our airwaves makes this musiclover, at least, heave an ungracious sigh. As a station, it is undeniably superior to, say, WFUV, whose classicalmusic programs are apparently broadcast out of some painful sense of religious duty; or WBAI, whose Monteverdi seems to seep out of the speakers furtively flavored with marijuana; or WQXR, whose irritatingly hearty announcers all sound as if they wear orange socks and eat too much cheese. Indeed, if the FCC ever ruled that we were allowed only one classicalmusic station per city; I would lobby passionately for WNCN; but even so, isn't 24 hours of the stuff, seven days a week, rather too much of a good thing?

title: Nessen Says Ford Might Limit Campaign Activity in Primaries
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) President Ford is running on his record as President in all of the states, but will not necessarily campaign actively in each primary, Ron Nessen, the White House press secretary, said today.

title: Grow Bean Sprouts On the Kitchen Cupboard...
description: Mung bean sprouting is a. thrifty way to exercise green thumbs anytime of year. Besides, they are nutritious eatink

title: San Francisco Opera Now No.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov, 6The Metropolitan Opera in New York is insistently eager to remind us of its status as America's leading opera house, and by any but the most churlish standards that remains true even when it fails, the Met fails on a scale that other companies in this country can't match.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The $2 bill will return, and it will have a BicentenniaF theme. These announcements, ending more than a year of rumors, were made last'. week by William E. Simon, Secretary of the Treasury. The $2bill, he said, will be released into circulation throughout the country, and in huge quantities, early next spring. The official release date will be.April 13, Thomas Jefferson's birthday.

title: New Zoning Ruling Awaited
description: MOUNT LAUREL TOWNSHIP  As this Burlington County community moves to open its doors to persons of low and moderate incomes, the State Supreme Court is preparing to further define the decision that struck down the township's zoning code.

title: Cancer Death Rate In U.S. Is Up 5.2% Over 1974 Figure
description: WASHINGTON, Nov 8 (UPI) The cancer death rate for Americans in the first seven months of this year increased 5.2 percent over the similar period last year, according to a national sampling conducted by the National Center for Health Statistics.

title: Photo Exhibit Tells The Alaskan Story
description: PRINCETONThe appeal of America's wilderness is portrayed in a diverse collection of color photography on Alaska that goes on view today at the Squibb Gallery. The exhibition, presented by E. R. Squibb and the National Park Foundation, will run throueh Dec. 5.

title: Unwelcome News for Mr. Ford
description: Two consecutive days of bad economic newsa rise in wholesale prices Thursday, an increase in unemployment Fridayought to put something of a damper on Gerald Ford's recent insistence that under his Administration everything is just fine.

title: Miss Atwood Has Nuptials
description: Cynthia Bennett Atwood, daughter of Mrs. George Desler Atwood of Old Bennington, Vt., and the late Mi. Atwood, was married yesterday in Bennington, Vt., to Philip Lyons Dewey, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Jedediah Dewey of Bennington. The Rev. Thomas D. Steffen performed the ceremony in the Second Congregational Church.

title: Design
description: The design of a house, wrote Charles Moore in his recent book The Place of Houses, is a search for the habitable  both the physically habitable, where we can be comfortable and live our lives, and the metaphorically habitable, where we can go beyond where we actually are to wherever our imaginations will transport us. A good house speaks not just of the materials from which it made, but of the intangible rhythms, spirits, and dreams of people's lives. Its site is only a tiny piece of the real world, yet this place is made to seem like an entire world.

title: PARLEY ON GIFTED BUOYS EDUCATORS
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 8Advocates of improved educational cpportunties for the intellectually gifted ended a twoday symposium here yesterday with a feeling of cautious optimism.

title: Dix Hills Ice Rink Wins the Top Archi
description: The Dix Hills Park ice rink complex in Huntington, a $750,000 community structure designed by Ward Associates of Bohemia, won the top prize Thursday in the annual regional competition for architectural excellence sponsored by the Long Island Association of Commerce and Industry.

title: INVESTING
description: Though traditionally thought or as the preserve of supercautious, safetyandincome conscious institutional investors, preferred stocks have suddenly become, very big with individuals.

title: The Subcontinent Has Some Order, Some Prosperity, and the Traditional Despair
description: Just four years ago, Pakistan was an international pariah. The world seemed totally to support Bengali secession, and the Indian invasion of East Pakistan in December, 1971, set a military seal upon Islamabad's ignominy and disgrace.

title: H.E.W. Eases Leave Rules For. Nursing Home Patients
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has announced a liberalized leave policy for 1.2 million Medicaid nursing home patients.

title: U.S. Seeks Tighter Curbs On Drilling Off West Coast
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) The Interior Department has proposed new restrictions on oil and gas drilling off the oil and gas drilling off the Southern California coast designed to protect seabirds, sea mammals and coral formations, and camouflage some drilling rigs that may be viewed from shore.

title: Free Forms Grace Park in Nassau
description: ROSLYNMuch has been done to blight our environment in recent years. Pollution, commercial developments and the general disregard for the sanctity of nature have helped reface the beauty of America's great landscape. One of the recent positive artistic programs to enhance nature rather than to plunder it has been an everincreasing use of sculp. ture along highways in parks and in and out of buildines.

title: Photographer Dies at Powerboat Race
description: KEY WEST, Fla., Nov. (AP)Wally Franz of Brazil won the world offshore powerboat championship today, but the race was marred by the death of, a photographer in a plane crash.

title: November Nights
description: What we think of as the quiet time of the year has come to the country, the time when tree crickets and katydids have had their say, no longer scratching the night or persisting in endless reiteration. But the nights are not really quiet where there are owls and foxes.

title: Joanne Terenzio And a Lawyer Planning Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph V. Terenzio of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joanne Terenzio, to Walter Rice Brewster Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Brewster of New York and Southampton, L. I.

title: Lessons to Be Learned From U.D.C.'s Collapse
description: The postmortem now being conducted on the financial collapse of the Urban Development Corporation is getting little attention, apparently because it is viewed as a somewhat remote historical exercise, overshadowed by the more urgent concerns about the fiscal future of the city and the state itself.

title: Drive Under Way to Decriminalize Consensual Intercourse
description: NEWARKA new drive to decriminalize sexual intercourse between consenting male and female adults who are not married to each other, an act defined as fornication in the criminal statutes of New Jersey and other states, is under way once again.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange finished with almost no change last week In slightly heavier trading despite some favorable economic developments. The Dow Jones industrial average was down 0.24 point for the week to 835.80. The biggest movers were stocks respond. ing to specific corporate developments.
