title: Buddy Baker Takes Dixie StockCar Race
description: HAMPTON, Ga., Nov. 9 (UPI)Buddy Baker of Charlotte, N.C., won the raindelayed Dixie 500 stockcar race at Atlanta International Raceway today, averaging 130.990 miles an hour despite bad weather, two caution flags and darkness.

title: DATA SHOW H.E.W. IS CURBING BUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI)  The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has decided that some schools may remain illegally segregated if desegregation would require busing children a distance ruled ac too far by Congress.

title: Wife of F.B.I. Chief Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 Ruby Kelley, wife of the director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Clarence M. Kelley, died today at the Menorah Medical Center in Kansas City after a long illness, according to a statement by the F.B.I. Mrs. Kelley, the former Ruby Dyeantha Pickett, was 62 years old and had been married to Mr. Kelley for 38 years. Survivors also include a son, Kent Clarence; a daughter, Mary Ruth Dobbins Jr., and two grandchildren.

title: No Democratic Candidate Is Viewed as Likely to Gain a ClearCut Victory in New Hampshire Primary
description: MANCHESTER, N. H. Nov. 9My basic view is that nol, Democrat is likely to score, anything resembling a victory here, and we'll all he left scratching fcr significance. All these bright and sassy campaign operations are going to neutralize each other by the time we vote.

title: Emergency 10% Surcharge On Imports Upheld by Court
description: The Treasury Department acted within the law in imposing an emergency 10 percent Import surcharge in August 1971, a fivejudge United States Court of Customs and Patent Appeals ruled yesterday in overturning a lowercourt ruling.

title: Algeria's National Oil Unit Cancels Chemico Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (Reu1 ters)Algeria's national oil and gas company, Sonatrach, has canceled a $327 million contract with the Chemical Construction Company and is negotiating new bids to build a natural gas liquification plant at Arzew, a Sonatrach spokesman said today.

title: AMF Is Consolidating Accounts
description: AMF Inc. is moving all its leisure products and corporate account to Benton & Bowles from four other agencies. The billings total about V million a year.

title: Protestants Say GiftGiving Rise Trails Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) Protestant church members in the United States increased their giving to record levels last year but the rate of increase was below the pace of inflation, the National Council of Churches reported.

title: Morgan State Triumphs, 2421
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., Nov. 9Duane Danner, one of two white players on a predominantly  black team, kicked a 22yard field goal with 7 minutes 22 seconds left today to give Morgan State a 2421 victory over Virginia Union in a game billed as Westchester's first black football classic.

title: BANGLADESH LEADER PROMISES ELECTIONS
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 9 (UPI)  President Abu Sadat Mohammed Sayem of Bangla, desh pledged today to transfer power to elected representa tives of the people but set no timetable, the Press Trust of India news agency reported from Dacca.

title: FORD LAYS OUSTER OF SCHLESINGER TO CABINET STRAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9President Ford conceded today that growing tension In his Cabinet had contributed to this decision to dismiss James R. Schlesinger as Secretary of Defense.

title: ALVIN G. FIELDS SR.
description: BELLEVILLE, III., NOV. 9 (UPI)Former Mayor Alvin G. Fields Sr. of East St. Louis, a longtime Democratic political power in Illinois, died yesterday at the age of 73 in St. Elizabeth Hospital. He moved to Belleville in 1971 after 20 years as Mayor.

title: fudge May Let Miss Fromme Back in Court Today if She's Good
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 9After Charles M. Manson. was jailed in 1971, Lynette Alice Fromme was described as the unofficial leader of his family, some of whose members had been accused of committing seven murders. She herself was arrested more than a dozen times, on charges ranging from petty theft to murder, but lack of proof freed her in all but case.

title: Uganda Threatens a Break With Soviet
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. (AP)President Idi Amin of Uganda threatened today to break diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union in 48 hours as a protest against Soviet intervention in the Angolan civil war.

description: TEL AVIV, Monday, Nov. 10 Four armed Arabs who indltrated from Lebanon were killed by Israeli soldiers early this morning after a pursuit, reports from the area said.

title: Company Control Over Internal Ethics Is Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9A research group that advises institutional investors on issues of public policy has concluded that the ability of the Government to discover, let alone prevent, improper corporate activities is very limited.

description: Columbia University will present five journalists with its 37th annual Maria Moors Cabot prizes in interAmerican journalism  the oldest international journalism awardsat a ceremony this week.

A spokesman said the two, David C. Sparks and Hector G. Garcia, had been charged with unlawful entry. The ranks and hometowns of the two were not immediately available.

title: Books of The Times
description: Rollo May Is a romantic psychoanalyst, a good father in contrast to those forbidding Freudians who conceive it as their role to reconcile us to the cold comfort of the human condition. Dr. May likes to see our dreams come true. He prefers to regard us as existentially afflicted adults rather than fixated infants. In his cajoling hands, we are closer to Prometheus than to Oedipus.

title: Bel Canto Sings Young Mozart's Zaide
description: Given the young Mozart's artistic profligacy, it might seem easy to dismiss his opera Zaide as yet another bit of early Mozart, pleasant but a bit bland and formulaic.

title: Cabinda Raid Reported
description: LUANDA, Nov. 9 (Reuters)A 400man force of the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda today fought with troops of an Angolan liberation movement after enter ing Cabinda from Zaire, Soviet bloc sources said here.

title: French African Colony Looks to Independence With Coolness

title: C.I.A's Work Unimpeded By Inquiries and Reports, Officials of Agency Assert
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Officials of the Central Intelligence Agency, despite repeated public avowals of diminished prestige and operational ability because of the various inquiries into intelligence operations, are convinced that the agency will suffer no serious loss of authority and no erosion of its ability to produce professional intelligence estimates and reports.

title: CANADA INSISTING ON ROLE AT TALKS
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 9  Despite French objections, Canada is continuing to press President Valery Giscard d'Estaing for an invitation to the economic summit conference in Paris on Nov. 15.

title: Tonia Caldwell Wed To Daniel Cohen
description: Tonia Caldwell, a supervising psychiatric social worker with :the New York State Psychiatric Institute, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr: Daniel Cohen, a psychiatrist here. Rabbi Edward Klein performed the ceremony at the St. RegisSheraton.

title: Conn. Girl Is Awarded Riding Prize
description: Katherine Burdsall is a girl of determination. For two years she has qualified and competed for the championship trophy of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, more familiarly known as the Maclay class, at Madison Square Garden. Yesterday, the 17yearold equestrienne from South Glastonbury, Conn., finally achieved her goal at the National Horse Show and her name will be inscribed on the big silver platter.

title: Dance Company Is His Glass of Tea
description: Although the problems of default for New York and the problems of a ballet company would seem to be on two different levels of concern, they are one in the mind of George Balanchine.

title: Another Balmy Spring Dayin November
description: As the temperature climbed to 75 degrees yesterday, breaking records for the second day in a row, New Yorkers took to the streets and parks, even though some were caught offguard by summer in November.

title: Associated Press PREPARING TO CAMPAIGN: Gov. George C. Wallace Alabama applauding pregame ceremonies at a football contest Saturday in Auburn. He is expected to announce Wednesday that he will again seek the Democratic Presidential nomination.
Richard R. Wiss, 61, Dies; Headed Scissors Company
description: Richard R. Wiss, who retired in 1972 as president of J. Wiss & Sons Co., shears and scissors manufacturer in Newark, died Saturday of a heart attack at the home of friends in Chatham, N. J. He was 61 years old and lived at 214 Channel Lane, Mantoloking, N. J.

title: FUEL ISSUE STIRS NUCLEAR DEBATE
description: New uncertainty about the future of nuclear power in the United States has been stirred by a recent decision of the Westinghouse Electric Corporation to abandon its uranium supply contracts with 20 utilities after 1978 and sharply reduce deliveries until then.

title: TRADE AGENCY SEEKS CURB ON DRUG ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI)  The Federal Trade Commission proposed today a crackdown on advertising for nonprescription drugs, beginning with a ban on contentions that antacids can cure hangovers, emotional disturbances or morning sickness.

title: Surprised Doctors Say Franco Shows Positive Progress
description: MADRID, Nov. 9 (AP)Generalissimo Francisco Franco was reported making positive progress today, two days after his second major abdominal operation. His doctors said that they were astonished.

title: Argentina Reported to Seize 1,300 as Guerrilla Suspects
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 9 (Reuters)  More than 1,300 people were arrested in Argentina last night in operations connected with the army's steppedup campaign against leftwing guerrillas, officials said here today.

title: Today's Schedule
description: AFTERNOON EVENTS 2:00International Jumping, Nations Cue, first round.

title: Board Inquiry Into Nepotism Results In Shakeup of School Supply Agency
description: The Board of Education has shaken up its Bureau of School Supplies, dismissing 15 employees and transferring 15 others, as a first step in an effort to curb what officials believe may be widespread nepotism in the school system.

title: HASSAN CALLS OFF MARCH IN SAHARA
description: AGADIR, Morocco, Nov. 9 King Hassan II, in a dramatic reversal, tonight called off his people's march to annex Spanish Sahara and said the problem would have to be resolved by other means.

title: FRANK T. DEANGELIS
description: Frank T. DeAngelis, president of the L. A. Dreyfus Company of Edison, N. J., a subsidiary of the William Wrigley Jr. Company, maker of thermoplastic compounds and chewinggum base, died Saturday in an auto accident in Highland Park, Ill. He ws 64 years old and lived in Edison.

title: K. J. Bannon Weds Susan R. Epstein
description: Susan Rhona Epstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan B. Epstein of Tarrytown, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Kevin John Ban.ion, son of Mrs, Francis J. Bannon of Cedar Grove, N.J., and the late Mr. Bannon.

title: New Breed of Woman DriverChugging Along in an Astro 95
description: SOMEWHERE ON INTERSTATE 495, Md.  Judy Kuncher, a small platinumblonde woman of 27 years and 124 pounds, eased her 15ton tractortrailer onto the interstate the other morning. Threading deftly through the heavy rushhour traffic, she headed toward Damascus, Md., to deliver a load of aluminum doors and replacement windows.

title: Trudeau's Support in. Party Drops Slightly in 2 Years
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 9 (AP)Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's leadership of the Liberal Party was endorsed today by 80 percent of the delegates at the party convention But that represented a drop in popularity since 1973. Two years ago, 89 percent of the delegates endorsed Mr. Trudeau.

title: About New York
description: It is about 25 years now since the art of political soapbox oratory virtually vanished from the sidewalks of New York, the victim not of political repression but, perhaps, of the torpor that took over the nation in the 1950's and the reluctance to consider extreme opinions.

title: Highly Paid Arbitragers Count Guesses in Dollars
description: When Baron Guy de Rothschild made a $118 million offer for the Copperweld Corporation, acting through Societe Imetal, of which he is chairman, a small and highly mysterious breed of Wall Street experts called risk arbitragers made decisions as to whether he would win. They will make or lose a lot of money on their guesses which, of course, are based on market analysis and research.

title: Dolphins Down Jets in 2d Half, 277
description: MIAMI, Nov. 9For one half, at least, the Jets regained their pride today. But the National FootballLeague requires two halves (barring a tie) and so the New Yorkers bowed to the Dolphins, 277.

title: Bridge :
description: The New York metropolitan trea has always been very well served by its representatives on the American Contract Bridge League's board of directors.

description: Deaths

title: C.I.A.'s Work Unimpeded By Inquiries and Reports, Officials of Agency Assert
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Officials of the Central Intelligence Agency, despite repeated public avowals of diminished prestige and operational ability because of the various inquiries into intelligence operations, are convinced that the agency will suffer no serious loss of authority and no erosion of its ability to produce professional intelligence estimates and reports.

title: Watch What I Do
description: BOSTON, Nov. 9Watching Gerald Ford on Meet the Press, one seemed to see the most open and amiable of men. He felt compassionate toward the unemployed; he was sure there was a considerable degree of unanimity between himself and Ronald Regan. Here again was the simple, appealing character who said when he be.lame President: Let brotherly love purge our hearts of suspicion and of hats,

title: Sense of Pride and Patriotism Stands Out in Corps
description: From the halls of Montezuma to the shores of Tripoli, Guantanamo Bay, Manila Bay, St. Nazaire, Guadalcanal, Tarawa, Guam, Iwo Jima, Inchon and the beaches of Da Nang, the United States Marines for the last 200 years have fought, died and inspired the nation.

description: New York. Eastchester, Boston, Atlanta. Chicago. Cincinnati, Troy, Dallas, Corpus Christi, Palm Beach.

title: Late Steeler Pass Tops Oilers, 2447
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 9 The Steelers took some steam out of the highflying Oilers here today, defeating them, 2417, for their seventh victory of the season. But it was not easy. The Super Bowl champions had to score in the last minute after Houston, which had won six of seven times this season. tied the count at 17ail with 2 minutes 18 seconds to play.

title: Miscellaneous Children
description: The difference between a truant and a mugger should be obvious; socalled problem children are hardly the, same as juvenile delinquents. Yet the State Division for Youth is being accused of blurring that socially responsible istinction, handling problem children alongside juvenile delinquents through the courts and the state training school system.

title: A TROUBLED I.LO. OUTWARDLY CALM
description: GENEVA, Nov. 9  We are Ass panicked than last time, even though we appreciate that this time the situation is more Serious, an International Labor Organization official said in commenting on the United States notice that it would 2ithdraw from the United Naotions specialized agency.

description: Barry Switzer, Oklahoma's coach, said early this season, we'll get beaten if we make too many mistakes against a good football team. He was right.

description: AGADIR, Morocco, Nov. 9 King Hassan II, in a dramatic reversal, tonight called off his people's march to annex Spanish Sahara and said the problem would have to be resolved by other means.

description: Governor Carey canceled a meeting with the legislative leadership yesterday after hearing President Ford again reject current legislation to help the city avoid default.

title: Going Out Guide
description: TRIO DEBUT The presentation tonight of Richard Cavalier's play, Triage, at the downtown Hudson Park branch (time: 6:30 o'clock) is the latest showcasing in the New York Public Libra ry's new series of free, professional performances of stage works unfamiliar to New Yorkers. Mr. Cavalier's drama, depicting an island republic's reaction to a general neglect of starving third world nations, is one of three plays scheduled at four library branches through January.

title: Bomb Found Under Car Outside Heath's Home
description: LONDON, Nov. 9 (AP) A bomb was defused early today outside the home of Edward Heath, the former Conservative Prime Minister.

title: Brezhnev Trip Held Unlikely
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) it is very unlikely that the Soviet Communist party lead. er, Leonid I. Brezhnev, will make his scheduled trip to the United States this year, President Ford said today.

title: G.M. Trust Action Reports Greeted Noncommittally
description: Weekend reports that two bureaus of the Federal Trade Commission had recommended an antitrust suit against General Motors were greeted noncommittally by some industry and Government spokesmen yesterday. Most of the officials who were reached said they had no knowledge of such development.

title: Harris Gets Drive Going In California
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9Once again Fred R. Harris's thundering populist oratory won the longest, most emotional applause for any of the Presidential candidates at the Democratic Conference here this

title: THEATER LEVY SET TO AID BROADWAY
description: IThe League of New York Theater Owners and Producers has voted to impose a levy on all New York and touring shows under its jurisdiction to !promote the legitimate theater I and clean up Times Square.

title: Catholic Teachers Accept 2Year Pact As A Compromisi
description: Members of the Federation of Catholic Teachers voted yesterday to accept a twoyear contract with the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York.

title: BRITISH MAY TRAIN EGYPTIAN AIRMEN
description: Egypt's search for arms in Western Europe, the result of the virtual cutoff in Soviet military supplies, has led four British aerospace companies to set up a school to teach advanced management techniques to Egyptian military and civilian personnel, according to qualified British sources.

title: TEACHERS REJECT A NEW HAVEN PACT
description: New Haven teachers voted overwhelmingly last night to reject a contract offer and to strike the city's public schools this morning.

description: Governor Career canceled a meeting with tfie legislative leadership yesterday after hearing President Ford again reject current legislation to help the city avoid default.

description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9Ins a Los Angeles courthouse, a massive file of documents, affidavits and depositions is being assembled. Its purpose is to help provide an answer to this question: Is a sprawling, multimillion dollar resort complex in Southern California a playground  and investment  of organized crime?

title: Dance: Cast Changes
description: It is very unusual, this season that American Ballet Theater is giving at the Uris Theater. In fact, offhand, am not even certain that it is not unique. I cannot recall a major ballet company's coming into town and giving a twoweek session of just one workin this case, Rudolf Nureyev's staging of the Marius Petipa Aleksandre Glazunov classic Raymonda. It seems to be working, but it is, for the record, a quite new way of marketing and packaging classic ballet.

title: Cholera Outbreak in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 9 (Reuters)More than 30 people are feared dead in a cholera outbreak at Ishiagu, the Governmentowned newspaper Nigerian Observer reported Saturday,

title: UltrahighVoltage Lines Studied as Possible Peril
description: Ultrahigh  voltage power lines that have been proliferat ing over the eastern United States are looming as a new environmental battlegrounda source of electrical emissions suspected by some experts of being potentially, harmful to humans and ahimals.

title: FORDLAYSOUSTER OF SCHLESINGER TOCABINETSTRAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9President Ford conceded today that growing tension in his 1Cabinet had contributed to his decision to dismiss James R. Schlesinger as Secretary of Defense.

title: Government's Rally in Lisbon Disrupted By TearGas Attack
description: LISBON, Nov. 9A mass demonstration in support of the Portuguese Government dissolved in panic tonight as teargas bombs were thrown and shots were fired in the air.

title: Paul Beckwith, 70, Editor Of Christian Hymnals, Dies
description: Paul Beckwith, editor of several hymnals for the InterVarsity Christian Fellowship of Madison, Wis., died Tuesday in Birmingham, Ala., where he had lived. He was 70 years old:

title: TRIAL DATE SOUGHT FOR MISS HEARST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 9Federal prosecutors will press tomorrow for an early trial date for Patricia Hearst to avoid the possibility of being forced to turn her free on her promise to be available later for trial.

title: Stage: The Inspector
description: STAMFORD, Conn, Nov. 8Only 45 minutes from Broadwaymore if traffic is heavyis the Hartman Theater, a new professional regional theater that opened this week with Nikolai Gogol's The Government Inspector. The Hartman also operates a school for acting and directing and has plans to open a small studio theater by March. All this is a welcome benefit not only to Stamford, but also to theatergoers in neighboring areas and in New

title: Cleric Here to Give City $1,350 to Avoid Default
description: The Rev. Dr. Bryant M. Kirkland. pastor of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church. at 55th Street, told his congregation yesterday that he was sending a check for $1,350 on his and his wife's behalf to the city to help it avoid default.

description: As subtle handwriting on the wall turns into peremptory warning signals, some of Wall Street's leading forces have started accepting the inevitability reform.

title: New Chief of Secret Police Named in Soviet Republic;
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 9 (UPI)The head of the secret police in Tadzhikistan, a tiny Soviet republic on the border with Afghanistan, has been appointed chief of the secret police in Kazakhstan.

title: Sonics Rout Jazz, 11197; 41 by Brown
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 9 (UPI)Fred Brown, with 41 points,led the Seattle Supersonics to a 11197 victory over the New Orleans Jazz tonight in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Ousted Diplomats in China
description: PEKING, Nov. 9 (Agence FrancePresse) The Australian charge d'affaires, John Watson, and four other Australian diplomats, including two women, arrived here today by train from Pyongyang, North Korea, from which they had been expelled. They were declared persona non grata in Pyongyang because Australia, in the United Nations last month, voted for a resolution that favored South Korea.

The Juice was at his dazzling best in the early minnutes, scoring three quick touchdowns to give the Bills

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: We have, like all other food writers of our acquaintance, sung hymns loudly in praise of that most dextrous and versatile of food gadgets, the Cuisinart Food Processor. And we have received scores of requests from readers throughout the country for recipes conceived expressly for the machine. Here are some.

title: Marshall Lilly, 90, Dead; Trained 5 Derby Winners
description: Marshall Lilly, a famous exercise rider who retired in 1949 as assistant trainer of the Greentree Stable, died Saturday at Riverview Hospital in Red Bank, N.J. He was 90 years old and lived at 740 Newman Spring Road in Lincroft, N.J.

title: China Reports It's Having 14th Year of Good Harvests
description: TOKYO, Nov. 9 (AP)China reported today that it has had its 14th consecutive year of food harvests despite floods in Fame areas and droughts in others. A statement declared that China now is at an initial stage of prosperity.

title: Advertising
description: As the result of a considerable amount of bad publicity, the research community may have to abandon the common practice of coding socalled confidential mailed research questionnaires.

title: Panatta Topples Connors
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 9 (AP) Adriano Panatta of Italy upset Jimmy Connors of Belleville, Ill., today in a tense match, 46, 63, 75, andwon the $100,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament.

title: Veterans Day
description: New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will observe Veterans Day as a state holiday tomorrow. The Federal observance took place on Oct. 27, so Federal offices and post offices will be open as usual. The stock exchanges will be open. Following is list of services that are affected:

title: H.E.W. . Must Answer Subpoena On Hospital Certifying Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare must answer this week a Congressional subpoena made necessary by a recent outofcourt agreement by the department to keep confidential the very information sought by a House investigating subcommittee.

description: Music of Medieval Europe in the Age of the Crusades was the title of the program performed at Tully Hall on Saturday night by the Waverly Consort, opening its 197576 series of three concerts here.

title: On Eve of Independence, Angola Faces More Strife
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 9 On the eve of Angolan independence from Portugal, a new and critical front may be opening in this African territory, which has been ripped into three parts by battling nationalist movements.

title: Regional Transit
description: The crushing defeat of New Jersey's bond issue in last Tuesday's election blocks off one more source of relief for the failing transportation systems of the metropolitan region. Even if the Federal Conrail corporation takes over operation of the commuter lines, further direct aid from Federal or state governments is all but ruled outleaving a painfully narrow range of options for the mass transit systems.

title: Flatbush Residents Use Motorcade and Rally to Protest Plan to Close Police Station
description: Residents of the Flatbush section of Brooklyn staged a 30car motorcade yesterday followed by a rally of 100 people at Park Circle to protest the closing of a Police station.

description: CAIRO, Nov. 9 (AP)Presicleat Anwar elSadat returned home today after a twoweek trip to France, the United States and Britain.

title: Jews Fear Effect of U.N. Vote Today
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. American Jewish leaders, in communications to United Nations officials and delegates, voiced fears today that approval of a draft resolution terming Zionism a form of racism and racial discrimination may provide a pretext for some countries, including the Soviet Union, to impose restrictions on Jews.

title: Esposito Injury Is Mild
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9Their frazzled emotions strained still more by the sight of Phil Esposito crumpling to the ice in last night's 31 loss to the Los Angeles Kings, the New York Rangers emplaned for St. Louis today wondering what would happen next.

title: PURCHASERS CITE GAINS ON ORDERS
description: Business continues to improve, the National Association of Purchasing Management said over the weekend. The association noted, however, that prices remained a problem and that the employment situation in the nation's businesses was worsening slightly.

title: MARIE RODELL DEAD; LITERARY AGENT, 63
description: Marie F. Rodell, an author and literary agent, died yesterday of cancer at her home, 310 East 55th Street. She was 63 years old.

title: CHINA'S DEPOSITS OF OIL SPUR TRADE
description: PARIS, Nov. 9With prospects of new wealth from what are believed to be extensive deposits of oiland natural gas, China has been eagerly searching for arms and other business in Western Europe.

title: LAKE SUPERIOR SHIP WITH 3035 MISSING
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., Nov, 10 (UPI)The Coast Guard began a search lite Monday for a 729foot cargo ship carrying 30 to 35 persons and repotred missing on windswept Lake Superior.

title: The U.N. Vote
description: The vote of the United Nations General Assembly yesterday in condemnation of one memberstate's national movement, Zionism, was offensive, spiteful and futileand stupid as well. Whatever the perverse satisfaction that Arab Governments and their Communist and thirdworld supporters may have given themselves in this vote, it will be shortlived. An irresponsible majority in the world body has taken itself one large step closer to its own demise as a constructive force in international affairs.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES PLUNGE IN PRICE
description: Corn and soybeans dropped sharply in price early in the trading session on the Chicago Board of Trade. The immediate reason was cropreport estimates issued over the weekend by Conrad Leslie, a leading commodity analyst and private cron estimator.

title: Washington Post Impasse
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Negotiations between The Washington Pest and its striliing pressmen recessed today with both sides deadlocked:3n the 4Idayold dispute and jib indication of a settlement any time soon. After a brief meeting, Kenneth Moffett of the Federal Mediation Service said', that the negotiations were stalemated. No further talks scheduled.

title: Byrne Orders Plan to Cut Spending to Avoid a Crisis
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10Governor Byrne today ordered a cabinetlevel study aimed at effect. ing wholesale shifts and drastic cutbacks of state spending in expectation of a major fiscal crisis early next year.

title: Holiday Schedule
description: All securities exchanges And commodity exchanges except for the New York Cocoa Exchange, the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange and the Commodity Exchange Inc will be open today, Veterans Day. Banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will be closed for the holiday.

title: Lucy Chauncey Dies at 45; Former Teacher and Editor
description: Lucy Lawrence Chauncey, a former editor of University, a Princeton quarterly, and the wife of Dr. Henry Chauncey, retired president of the Educational Testing Service, died Sunday in Princeton (N.J.) Medical Center. She was 45 years old and lived in East Amwell Township, N.J.

title: CITYAID MEASURE GAINS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Senate Democratic leaders indicated today that they had the votes needed to break any filibuster of a New York loanguarantee bill, after meeting with President Ford to seek cooperative effort on the legislation.

title: Banks
description: The trust departments of a group of 10 leading New York banks experienced net operating losses of $40.5 million but earned money as a whole in 1974, according to a study by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

description: Morning

title: G.E. Admits 65 Got Sick From Exposure to PCB
description: ALBANY, Nov. 10The General Electric Company conceded today that at least 65 of its employes had become ill over a 15year period under conditions that may have been caused by or aggravated by exposure to PCB's, or polychlorinated biphenyls.

title: Judge Rules Out Removal Of the Quinlan Respirator
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., Nov. 10 Judge Robert Muir Jr. today refused to authorize the removal of the respirator sustaining the life of Karen Anne Quinlan, saying the decision was a medical one and noting that the woman's attending physicians were opposed to disconnecting the machine.

title: Ford Salutes Marine Corps on Its 200th Birthday
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (UPI)President Ford saluted the Marine Corps on its 200th birthday today before a statue at Arlington National Cemetery depicting marines raising the flag on Iwo Jima.

title: A Couple Live Like Vander bilts, Look Forward to a Simple Life
description: CENTERPORT, L.I.  For the last 20 years, Walter Fasbender, who describes himself as a man of modest origins, has been living in a mansion fit for a millionaire.

title: The Burritos Fuse Rock With Country In Beacon Concert
description: The fusion of country music and rock n roll, occasionally defined by the music business as progressive country, is no longer the unique mixture it was. But it is still with us, as the Flying Burrito Brothers proved Sunday in the Beacon Theater.

title: Prince Thou Art Set for Surgery
description: Prince Thou Art, winner of the Florida Derby, was scheduled to undergo surgery today at the New Bolton Center near Philadelphia in an attempt to save his life.

title: LESLIE LEVI, 75, DIES; EXHIBITION DESIGNER
description: Leslie E. Levi, who retired in 1964 as president of the Ivel Corporation, a leading designer and producer of industrial exhibitions, died Saturday at his home in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 75 years old and had formerly lived here.

description: Film

title: Tet Pass Defenders Given Some Advice
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 10 As if to evaporate the memory of another Sunday defeat, Delles Howell took sauna bath today, then drenched himself in the Jets pool.

title: Girl's Body Identified
description: KINGSBURG, Calif., Nov. 10 (UPI)Sheriff's deputies said today that a body discovered Saturday had been identified as Frances Garcia, the missing 17yearold daughter of Felipe and Pasquala Garcia, an Orange Cove couple charged with five murders. Miss Garcia had been missing since May 17. She had been stabbed.

title: Market Place
description: For nearly 200 security analysts who follow the semiconductor stocks, the last week in October was a busy one. They journeyed to Silicon Valleythe area south of San Francisco where many of the companies are situated to assess the outlook for the industry.

title: Bettors Couldn't See $64 Aqueduct Winner
description: Millions of dollars are being spent to protect Aqueduct and its customers from the elements, but the elements scored an easy victory over the race track yesterday on reopening day.

title: Mexico on the Threshold Of Major Oil Exporting
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 10With a mixture of national pride and reticence, Mexico has been expanding its oil production to the point where it may soon be in position to play a role in world oil trade and politics.

title: Bayh Backers in Dispute With Boston Liberal Unit
description: BOSTON. Nov. 10The duplIcation of a wad of applications has caused somewhat of a stir in liberal political circles here.

title: Grand Jury Indicts 2 Freed by Judge On Robbery Charge
description: Two 19yearold youths who were freed on Oct. 23 by Bronx Criminal Court Judge John Carro of charges of robbing an elderly woman, were indicted by a grand jury yekerday in the same case.

title: Lorillard Division Of Loew'sAdvances Price of Cigarettes
description: The Loew's Corporation said yesterday its Lorillard division was raising immediately the list price of all of its domestic taxpaid cigarette brands, except its 120millimeter brands, by 70 cents a thousand. Lorillard's Price brands include Changes Kent, True, Old Gold filters ands Newport.

title: TILLIE W. GOLD
description: Tillie Wagner Gold, overseer and cofounder with her late husband, Hyman Gold, of Gold's Pure Food Products, Brooklyn, died Sunday in Brookdale Hospital. She was 81 years old and lived at 4127 18th Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Italy and Yugoslavia Sign Accord on Trieste Region
description: ANCONA, Italy, Nov. 10 (Reuters)Italy and Yugoslavia signed an agreement here today ending their 30yearold frontier dispute.

title: High Court's Queries Hint Doubt On Parts of New Election Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Most of the Justices of the Supreme Court expressed concern today that some aspects of the new Federal campaign financing laws might impinge on rights guaranteed by the First and Fifth Amendments.

title: A.B.A. Sails May Fold Today
description: The American Basketball Association owners will meet here today amid strong reports that the troubled San Diego franchise will fold. The Sails have drawn a total of 7,126 paying customers in three home games, hardly enough to pay the rent for the San Diego Sports Arena. Dave DeBusschere, the A.B.A. commissioner, had no comment other than to confirm that the league owners would meet today.

title: TV: The MacNeil Report,
description: There's a new publicaffairs program in town, and it is rapidly proving to be one of the more significant and solid developments in television news. The Robert MacNeil Report is carried on Channel 13 Monday through Friday at 7:30 P.M. (with a taped repeat at 11:30). It replaces Harold Hayes's Roundtable, which generally kept its focus on cultural affairs.

title: Gibson Says 500 Workers May Have to Be Dropped
description: NEWARK, Nov. 10As many as 500 Newark city employees, including members of the Police and Fire Departments. may have to be laid off next year to stabilize the already nigh property tax rate in New Jersey's largest city, Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson said today.

title: Carborundum to Expand
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Nov. 10 (UPI)The Carhorundum Company said today it planned to spend $7.7 million to expand its output of Fiherfrax ceramic fiber papers. The money will go toward enlarging its United States facilities and building new plants in Brazil, Germany and Britain.

title: The Quinlan Quagmire
description: The verdict of New Jersey Superior Court Judge Robert Muir Jr., denying permission to turn off the respirator powering the breathing of Karen Anne Quinlan, hardly settles this most difficult case.

title: Salsa Craze Sweeping Night Spots Here
description: From the posh Act III near the Westchester border to the remote Hadaar on Staten Island, more than a score of the city's morepopular nightclubs, ballrooms and discotheques are booming out a distinctly Latin beat these days and no wonder.

title: Kissinger Voices Irritation At Soviet on Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger voiced annoyance today with the Soviet Union for rejecting the latest American arms control proposals, apparently without offering any kind of reasoned response.

title: CORN CROP IS 25% ABOVE LAST YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Farmers have almcst completed a record corn harvest of 5.8 billion bushels this fall, 25 percent larger than last year's and 1 percent more than forecast in October, the Agriculture Deoartment said today.

title: VICKI BARNES SHOWS ASSURANCE IN SONG
description: Assurance and presence can sometimes do even more for a singer than a voice. Vickie Barnes, who is singing at Jimmy Weston's, 131 East 54th Street, could almost get by on appearance aloneon her authoritative delivery and the ease with which she establishes a commanding presence.

title: Wright Housing Tenants,. Ruled Eligible for Rebates
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10 (UPI)The Appellate Division of the Superior Court ruled today that tenants in public housing projects could be awarded rent rebates if they were forced to live in uninhabitable conditions.

And now, in The Last Days of the Club, Chris Welles has accepted it as a foregone conclusion: The Club is on its last legs, it's obsolete, it's kaput. That once merry band of socially elite backwardlooking ob

title: YELIZAVETA GERDT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 10 (AP) Tass, the Soviet news agency, repoiled today the death of Yelizaveta Gerdt, a former prominent Russian ballerina who taught generations of dancers at the Bolshoi. She was 84 years old.

title: About the Giants
description: Even with the problems they created for themselves in the fourth quarter against Washington, the Giants could have been rescued by the officials. Films of the game indicated the Giants were correct in their contention that Moses Denson fumbled on the first play of the Redskins last drive. The film showed Denson losing the ball before he hit the ground and Brad Van Pelt falling on it. The officials ruled no fumble. . . . On another play on the same drive, a pass from Randy Johnson to Charley Taylor, the Giants argued it should have been ruled incomplete or fumble. However, the film shows the ball bouncing on the outofbounds line, which means it was still Washington's ball, even if it were a fumble.

title: Secretariat Filly Sells for $200,000
description: LEXINGTON. Ky., Nov. 10 (AP)The first offspring of the famed Secretariat to step into an auction sales ring fell $2,000 short of a world record tonight when a man signing the name C. W. Smith bought weanling filly for $200,000 dollars.

title: Columbia Harks to the King's College Days
description: Columbia University began its commemoration yesterday of a Revolution that left it with a new name, some famous alumni and enough documents to keep scholars busy for another 200 years.

title: New York Staff Is Cut By W. T. Grant Company
description: The W. T. Grant Company said yesterday that it had reduced its New York corporate staff by 550 employees, including both buyers and clerical workers. The central staff is now down to about 850 persons.

title: Stage: Impressive Talent
description: For three years Curt Dempster's Ensemble Studio Theater has been quietly nurturing new playwrights and producing new plays in its home in a ramshackle building in Manhattan's Hell's Kitchen. Currently there are 23 resident playwrights at the E.S.T., one of whom is named Michael Dorn Moody. This is probably the first time you've read Mr. Moody's name; it will not be the last.

title: Text of U.N. Resolution
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 10 (Reuters)Following is the text of the resolution on Zionism approved tonight by the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Excerpts From Judge Muir's Decision in the Karen Quinlan Case.
description: The Court's findings of fact are as hereinafter set forth:

title: Druggists Are Not Owed $5 Million, City Insists
description: The city denied yesterday that it owed more than $5 niillion in pastdue Medicaid payments to pharmacistsowners who have threatened not to fill new Medicaid prescriptions unless their bills are paid by Sunday.

title: Player's Condition Grave
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 10 (AP)Ron Barlow, a RhodeIsland University freshman player paralyzed below the neck in Saturday's football game with Temple was reported in very, very guarded condition today, according to a Temple Hospital spokesman. Barlow was hurt trying to tackle Jeff Stempel, tight end, in Temple's 456 victory.

title: Radio
description: 610, WNCNFM. Balletti lamentabili, Biber; Seven Spanish Popular Songs. Falla; Two Fantasias for Harpsichord, Telemann; Modinha Preludio, VillaLobos; Lute Sonata in G Minor, Vivaldi; Three Rondos on Folk Tunes, Bartok; Quartet in F, Scarlatti; Dialogus de Anima, Du Mont; La Finta Giardiniera Overture, Mozart.

title: Hearst Trial Dec. 15
description: A Federal judge in San Francisco tentatively set Dec. 15 as the date for the trial of Patricia Hea st to begin. But the date may be changed after a hearing next week on her competency to stand trial. Page 19.

title: Best Signs With Stockport
description: STOCRPORT, England, Nov. 10 (UPI)George Best, once worth SI million in soccer, signed today to play for Stockport, a Fourth Division team. The contract was for one month for an undisclosed sum.

title: Hugh Brown, Who Cited Peril From Polar Ice Cap, Dies at 96
description: Hugh Auchincloss Brown Sr., an electrical engineer who devoted more than 60 years of his life to the promulgation of his theory that a vast polar ice cap would tip the earth over in this century and wipe out civilization, died Sunday night in his home at 115 Prospect Avenue, Douglaston, Queens. He was 96 years old.

title: Soviet Building Port in Far East
description: NAKHODKA, U.S.S.R.  A new deepwater port, designed to become the largest in the Soviet Union, is being slowly created at the southern tip of the Soviet Far East to handle a large part of the SovirWc Parifir trade.

title: Giants Still Yielding Big Losing Plays
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 10In trudging through the more difficult part of their schedule, the Giants have proved they are capable of making the big playsthe big plays that lose games, that is.

title: Angola Pullout Marks End Of a Vast African Empire
description: LISBON, Tuesday, Nov. 11With the granting of independence to Angola during the night, Portugal completed the dismantling of its vast African empire.

title: Ulster Militiaman Slain
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 10 (AP)A partime soldier with Northern Ireland's Protestant militia was found shot to death in his car tonight in southern Armagh, near the border with the Irish Republic. The 54yearold victim, a staff sergeant in the Ulster Defense Regiment, was the second militiamen killed in the area in four days.

title: Slowly Evolving Spain, Rapidly Changing Church
description: MADRID, Nov. 4  Many churches have been offering prayers for Generalissimo Francisco Franco and for Spain, ritual prayers that have not made a noticeable difference in the habits of the faithful. Most, if perhaps not all, will hold special services when the ailing leader dies, and the Roman Catholic Church will have the primary role at his funeral.

title: OFFICERS OF AMREP DENY LAND CHARGES
description: Seven officers of the Amrep Corporation, a major land developer that marketed Rio Rancho Estates near Albuquerque, N.M., pleaded not guilty yesterday to charges that they cheated consumers of more than $200 million in the sale of the semiarid desert land, United Press International reported.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Beame Welcomes Movie Maker To Paramount Studio in Queens
description: Mayor Beame made a strong bid for a return of the film industry to New York City studios yesterday. He appeared briefly at the cavernous old Paramount Pictures studio in Long Island City, Queens, where the first major feature film is being made since before World War II.

title: Theater: Tenderloin,
description: The Equity Library Theater is one of the oldestperhaps the oldestof the Equity showcase theaters that are the heart of the Off Off Broadway movement. Currently, through Nov. 23, the theater is presenting a most lively revival of the Jerry BockSheldon Harnick musical Tenderloin.

title: Caso Urges Nassau Rise In Sales and Property Tax
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 10An increase of one percentage point in the Nassau County sales taxto 4 percentplus a propertytax increase were proposed in the 1976 budget released today by Ralph G. Caso, the County Executive.

title: Detente Expected to Be Scrutinized Next Year in Both U.S. and Soviet Union
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 10  The United States and the Soviet, Union are entering a period in which their foreign policies, and especially the policy of dtente. will undergo seri ous scrutiny at home  in the United States because of the Presil dential campaign, in the Soviet Union because of the 25th Commu, nist Party congress.

title: Winning Friends
description: Instructions to New Yorkers planning to travel in America:

title: Olympic Aides Urge Subsidy Before a Presidential Panel
description: America's international sports effort should be restructured and given at least some form of government subsidy, Olympic Committee officials told a Federal commission here yesterday.

title: A Generation Returns to Hester St., Where It All Began
description: Dr. William G. Cahan, attending surgeon at Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center and professor of surgery at Cornell Medical School, was walking the other Sunday morning on Hester Street, a street where he never lived but one to which he feels extraordinarily close.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WINNING It's Impossible, sang Jimmy Spencer into his keyboard mike the other night at Gatshy's (7519191), at 873 First Avenue (two doors south of 49th Street). The restaurant's new young entertainer was in a hit of a spot last Wednesday. He was playing and singing against a preoccupied table and bar babble that was somewhat understandable, since most eyes were riveted to a corner TV set silently beaming the Knicks vs the Houston Rockets.

title: Consumption Off 1.7% In Petroleum Products
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 10 (AP)United States consumption of petroleum products averaged 16.15 million barrels of oil a day for the first 10 months of 1975, a decline of 1.7 percent from the same period in 1974, the American Petroleum Institute announced today.

title: A.S.P.C.A. Suit Over Board Removal To Be Discussed by Members Today
description: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, embroiled in a suit charging it with inadequate fund raising and neglect of stray animals, announced yesterday that it had raised $15,000 to put back on the street a truck used to pick up strays.

title: Xerox Officer to Head Singer
description: The financially troubled Singer Company yesterday reached into the top echelon of the Xerox Corporation for a new chief executive officer. He is Joseph B. Flavin, 47, who until yesterday was president of Xerox's international i operations as well as executive vice president and a director of Xerox.

title: CHICAGO JURY HITS SPYING BY POLICE
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 10  The Chicago Police Department's rationale for its undercover surveillance of six local community groups has all the earmarks of a police state, a Cook County grand jury said today in a report sharply criticizing the department's spying activities.

title: F oodAgricaltare Group Of U.N. Elects Lebanese
description: ROME, Nov. 10 The Food and Agricultural Organization elected a Lebanese, Edouard Saouma, today as Director General.

title: Ford vs. Reagan: First Round
description: CONCORD, N.H., Nov. 10A first quick dip of the toe into New Hampshire primary waters produces little splash of warningPresident Ford may not be in quite such trouble here as his managers would have us believe.

title: Viking Press Is Sold to Penguin Books
description: The Viking Press, 50 years old this week, has been sold to Penguin Books, the giant British quality paperback house, for a price that could total $12 million. The merger of the privately held American hardcover publisher with the Penguin combine, effective this week, is the largest in a series of such takeovers that have been ascribed in the book world to rapidly rising publishing costs.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Cowboys Upset by Chiefs
description: IRVING Tex., Nov 10 (UPI)Ed Podolak, who scored two touchdowns within 23 seconds near the end of the first half, produced a thirdand winningscore with 10 minutes remaining tonight and the Kansas City Chiefs took advantage of five fumble recoveries to upset the Dallas Cowboys. 3431.

title: Jewish Groups Are Bitter Over the Vote at the U.N.
description: Jewish leaders reacted with anger throughout the debate in the General Assembly yesterday.

title: Manuel Aznar Zubigaray, ExSpanish Envoy to U.N.
description: MADRID, Nov. 10 (AP)Manuel Aznar Zubigaray, president of the semiofficial Spanish news agency EFE and former Spanish Ambassador to the United Nations, died today at his home here. He was 80 years old.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Hunt Upheld
description: It is a matter of considerable astonishment to this viewer that those who seek to curtail or end hunting in America through court action have, in recent years, focused on migratory birds.

title: U.S.C. Appoints Football Coach
description: The University of Southern California yesterday hired John Robinson, one of its former football coaches, to succeed John McKay as head coach at the end of this sea

title: Carey Tries to Win Over St. Louis Civic Leaders
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 10Governor Carey attempted today to persuade top business and labor leaders here of the severe effects that a New York City default would have on them, but there were indications the message may not have gotten through.

title: Bid to Sue G.M. Denied By Justice Department
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (UPI)The Justice Department said today that its Antitrust Division was not taking the initiative in attempting to break up the General Motors Corporation, the world's largest automobile maker.

title: G.E. Admits 65 Became Sick From Exposure to PCB
description: ALBANY, Nov. 10The General Electric Company conceded today that at east 65 of its employees had become ill over a 15year period under conditions that may have been caused by or aggravated by exposure to PCB's, or polychlorinated bleilenyls.

title: Wall Street Grappling With Tender Traps
description: Merger deals and tender offers come and go but for the first time in years stockholders and investors have four contested corporate acquisitions raging all at once with court battles, unwilling marriage partners, extra suitors, Wail Street arbitragers and even a French baron as key ingredients.

title: CITYAID MEASURE GAINS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Senate Democratic leaders indicated today that they had the votes needed to break any filibuster of a New York loanguarantee bill, after meeting with President Ford to seek cooperative effort on the legislation.

title: Money Market Rates Dip; Fed Funds Tighten to 5%
description: Rates moved a bit lower yesterday in the money markets as participants were given what appeared to be another inkling of the Federal Reserve's current rate targets.

title: A Generation Returns to Hester St., Where It All Began
description: Dr. William G. Cahan, attending surgeon at Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center and professor of surgery at Cornell Medical School, was walking the other Sunday morning on Hester Street, a street where he never lived but one to which he feels extraordinarily close.

title: Senator Ammond Urges Energy Office Be Ended
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10State Senator Alene S. Ammond, a maverick Democrat who has strongly criticized the Byrne administration, called today for the elimination of the State Energy Office in the interest of economy.

title: Dormitory Unit Halts Work at Colleges
description: The State Dormitory Authority, citing a lack of investor confidence and inability to market its bonds, said yesterday that it was suspending work on $229 million in conIstruction at three senior collieges of the City University.

title: Johnson Confident At Redskins
description: Bill Kilmer, the vibrant 36yearold quarterback for the Redskins, suffered a mild separation of the right shoulder against the Giants or. Sunday and he will miss one

title: SCHLESINGER GETS OUTGOING HONORS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10On the parade ground of the Pentagon, Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger bade farewell today to the armed forces with a parting message that the nation's military strength depends upon a rekindled sense of national purpose and unity.

title: VILNA J. MORPURGO
description: Vilna Jorgen Morpurgo, a Norwegianhorn painter and sculptor and the wife of Dr. Attilio J. Morpurgo, a physician, died Friday at their home in Sag Harbor, L.I. She was 75 years old.

title: The Tax Remedy
description: Governor Carey's call for new state and city taxes represents the kind of painfully tough but inescapable choices being forced on New Yorkers by acute fiscal crises at both levels of government.

title: Marines Release Woman Charged in Sex Case
description: YUMA, Ariz., Nov. 10 (AP)Second Lieut. Mary Niflis, accused of sexual misconduct with enlisted men, received her general release from the Marine Corps under honorable conditions, effective at midnight tonight.

title: 4 Police Stations Get Reprieve From an Imminent Closing
description: The proposed closing of four police station houses in the city has been put off until at least Jan. 1, Mayor Beame's office disclosed yesterday.

title: Kissinger Voices Irritation At Soviet on Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger voiced annoyance today with the Soviet Union for rejecting the latest American arms control proposals, apparently without offering any kind of reasoned response.

title: 96YearOld Woman Slain
description: CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 10 (AP) A 96yearold woman was beaten to death Sunday in her home in this Delaware County city during a robbery that netted her assailants $50, the police said. Two 17yearolds were arrested and charged with criminal homicide and robbery in connection with the death or Alma Bloom, the police said.

title: MISS KWAK, IN ARIAS, SHOWS TONAL SHEEN
description: Shinja Kwak, a Korean mezzosoprano and a member of the Metropolitan Opera chorus, gave a recital in Town Hall on Sunday night. As a singer extensively involved with opera, Miss Kwak understandably devdted a large portion of her program to arias by Handel, Stradella, Paisiello, Cherubini, J. C. Bach and Rossini, as well as groups of German songs by Schubert and Schumann.

title: Dr. Harold J. Strecker Dies; Taught at Einstein College
description: Dr. Harold J. Strecker, professor of biochemistry at Albert Einstein College of Medicine. died Sunday in San Diego. He was 56 years old and lived on Conant Valley Road in New Canaan, Conn.

title: Atlantic Swears In Worthington As Its First County Executive
description: MAYS LANDING, Nov. 10Implementing a new form of government approved last year by the voters, Assemblyman Charles Worthington, Democrat of Atlantic County, was sworn in as the first County Executive in Atlantic's history, and an entirely new nine .member Board of Freeholders took over from what had been a board of seven.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
CORRECTION
description: It was reported incorrectly in the Arts and Leisure Guide in The New York Times on Sunday that Jane Olivor would he at the Rainbow Grill this week. Instead, Laura Kenyon will be the opening act for the Peter Gordeno Show through Saturday.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The times they are achanging, as the song says.

title: Struggle Starts on Charter Changes Voted at Polls
description: The Beame administration, which was unsuccessful at persuading voters to reject proposed changes in New York City's Charter, is trying to figure out how to wrest control over implementing the changes from the commission that desi pried them.

title: Pressure for Divestiture Decried by Oil Leaders
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 10Leaders of the American Petroleum Institute called today for war against efforts by some Congressmen to break up the netroleum industry.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Amex and OTC Show Mixed Tone as Volume Falls Slightly
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market finished mixed yesterday as volume fell slightly.

title: Levi Defers Making a Decision On F.B.I. Communication Net
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Attorney General Edward H. Levi refused today to give the Federal Bureau of Investigation immediate permission to build a computerized communications network that had been criticized as possibly leading to the creation of a national police force.

title: CAREY CALLS MIX OF TAXES NEEDED TO AVERT DEFAULT
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that the current attempt to work out a combined citystate fiscal solution invoived proposals for a mix of taxes including a possible 1centonthedollar increase in the city sales tax and possible rises in the state's income, corporate and bank taxes.

title: FOUR BELGIANS HELD BY TUNISIA GUNMAN
description: TUNIS, No. 10 (AP)A Tunisian gunman seized four hostages in the Belgian Embassy here today and threatened to kill two of them unless his estranged wife returned from Belgium with $75,000 that he says she took from him, security sources said.

title: JAMES J. ANDREWS
description: James J. Andrews, superintendent of the United States Assay Office here from 1949 to 1953, who retired several years ago as president of the Andrett Funeral Home Inc., died Sunday of a heart attack in Columbus Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 353 Second Avenue.

title: Judge Rules Out Removal Of the Quinlan Respirator
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., Nov. 10 Judge Robert Muir Jr. today refused to authorize the removal of the respirator sustaining the life of Karen Anne Quinlan, saying the decision was a medical one and noting that the woman's attending physicians were opposed to disconnecting the machine.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 11, 1975

title: Experts Say Housing Programs Fail to Open Suburbs to the Poor
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.. Nov. 9After almost a decade of effort, Federal, state and local housing programs have made virtually no progress in increasing access by lowincome city dwellers to American suburbia.

title: Dr. Emanuel Klempner 67, Gynecologist at Mt. Sinai
description: Dr. Emanuel Klempner, associate attending obstetrician and gynecologist at Mount Sinai Medical Center and associate clinical professor at its medical school, died Sunday of cancer. He was 67 years old and lived at 535 East 86th Street.

title: For Nation's Spies, the War Has Never Had an Ending
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10For most Americans, World War II ended on Aug. 15, 1945. Though the United States would send troops into foreign battle twice in the next 30 years it would never return to the war footing of the early 1940's. Now an 11month Congressional investigation of the nation's intelligence agencies has disclosed that for the spies and counterspies, World War II never really ended.

title: HOUSE VOTES BILL FOR PUBLIC TV FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) The House voted today to authorize annual funding of $88 million to $160 million through 1980 for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

title: CITY FINDS FUNDS TO DRAY DEFAULT
description: The city will have enough cash on hand to avcid default at least until a week from Friday, revised revenue figures indicated yesterday.

title: Plea by Soliah
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Novi 10 (UPI)Steven Soliah pleadcd not guilty today to a Federal charge of participating in a 515,000 bank robbery and slaving

title: Angola, 15751975: Slow Growth and a Sudden Leap
description: GeographyAngola, with 481,351 square miles, is 14 times the size of Portugal, which governed it for 400 years. The territory is rich in resources and, after Zaire, the second largest country in subSaharan Africa. It has an Atlantic coastline of more than 1,000 miles and is on the southwest coast of Africa, bordered on the north and northeast by Zaire, on the southeast by Zambia and on the south by SouthWest Africa. The small but oilproducing Angolan enclave of Cabinda lies to the north, bounded by Zaire and Congo.

title: FRANCO'S DOCTORS FEAR A NEW CRISIS
description: MADRID, Nov. 10 (AP)Doctors reported today that Generalissimo Francisco Franco was progressing without incident in his third day after emergency surgery.

title: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games
U.N. VOTES 7235, TO TERM ZIONISM FORM OF RACISM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 10The General Assembly tonight adopted an Arabinspired resolution defining Zionism as a form of racism and racial discrimination.

title: MOROCCO REPORTS SAHARA PACT NEAR
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 10Morocco said today that an understanding had been reached with Spain on Morocco's claim to Spanish Sahara.

title: Goldman Charge Dropped; Murtagh Upbraids Nadjari
description: A State Supreme Court Justice yesterday dismissed a major indictment against Irving Goldman, the city's former Cultural Affairs Commissioner, declaring that Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor had neither the evidence nor the authority to ask a special grand jury to indict Mr. Goldman.

title: U.N. VOTES, 7235, TO TERM ZIONISM FORM OF RACISM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 10The General Assembly tonight adopted an Arabinspired resolution defining Zionism as a form of racism and racial discrimination.

title: OTTAWA STUDYING DEAL BY SENATOR
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 10Questions in the Canadian Senate and House of Commons about a Senator's financial activities have stirred both the nation and Parliament. A petition to the House of Commons has, asked for a judicial inquiry.

title: Notables of the Academic World At Trilling Rites at Columbia
description: Lionel Trilling went out of the world as he had lived most of his years in it, in the company of the learned and famous.

title: Dave Anderson
description: As if mesmerized by the song of the sweet bird of youth, Henry Aaron will continue swinging for home runs next season when he will be 42 years old.

title: WILLIAM F. DAMRAU, CITY FISCAL CHIEF
description: Dr. William F. Damrau, chief of the City Council's finance division, died Sunday of heart attack at his home, 185 Park Row. He was 59 years old.

title: Bicentennial Stirs Book Deluge; Some Say It's a Bit Too Much
description: The American Revolution freed this country from foreign bonds, and the Bicentennial is burying it in domestic naner.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PROTEST OF EL1SEIlli KEEPS CENTER OPEN: About 100 Queens residents marched briefly on 223d Street against threatened closing of the Laurelton Senior Citizens Center. A city aide reported talks under way to keep it open. The city had decided to cut $1,000amonth payments for center, which gives free lunches, for lack of formal lease.

title: Portuguese Quit Angola As the Civil War Goes On
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 10The Portuguese took home their Flag today, leaving their first, and last, colony in Africa to the Angolan people, who are fighting a civil war.

title: Canadian Price Index Up
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 10 (Reuters) Statistics Canada said today the Canadian general wholesale price index rose 0.4 percent in September to 501.S (193539 equals 100) from a revised 499.6 in August. The latest figure is 6.1 percent higher than the 472.8 of September 1974, the agency said.

title: Chile Reports 14 Leftists Held; Guerrilla Infiltration Plot Found
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 10 (AP)Chile's military Government crlid today that it had arrested 14 leftwing guerrillas and uncovered a plot for the infiltration of 1,200 extremists into southern Chile for terrorist attacks.

title: Gov. Brown's Sister Held Plot Target
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 10The police said today that security measures have been in effect for the last month to protect the sister of Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. from a possible kidnapping reportedly plotted by sympathizers of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army.

title: Chess:
description: One defender after another in the last several years has blithely defied the Maroczy bind, a center defined by white pawns at K4 and QB4 versus a black pawn at Q3. But now the party may well be over.

title: STOCKS ARE HIT BY NEWS ON G.M.
description: The stock market, buffeted yesterday by news that Washington had been discussing an antitrust investigation of General Motors, declined moderately in the morning and then worked itself back up. The net result was a small decline froir Friday.

title: Europe's Warning
description: President Ford blandly reassured the nation Sunday that the weight of advice from his experts and others is that a New York default would not have serious repercussions on the country as a whole. But he neglected to mention even broader concerns expressed to highlevel American representatives in Paris last week by officials of West Europe's finance ministries and central banks.

title: SIDNEY B. WHIPPLE, REPORTER, 87, DIES
description: Stars and Stripes Columnist Was a Lifelong Journalist

title: People and Business
description: Charles J. Pilliod Jr., chairman and chief executive officer of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, said that the company spent $30 million last year in order to comply with various state and Federal regulations.

title: Notes on People
description: After listening to an impassioned speech by James P. Hoffa and giving him a standing ovation, a Detroit local of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters voted Sunday to have the son of the missing former teamsters president appointed as its $400aweek business anent.

title: Lindsay Defends His Record And Fiscal Policies as Mayor
description: Former Mayor John V. Lindsay, making his first public venture before a political forum in almost two years, last night defended his record as Mayor and rejected suggestions that his fiscal policies might have contributed to the city's current crisis.

title: Records Show Bailey Got $235,000 for License Aid
description: NEWINGTON, Conn., Nov. 10 Corporation records entered into evidence at the State Gaming Commission hea rings here today support charges that the late John M. Bailey accepted more than $235,000 to help a Bridgeport jai alai developer obtain a state gamine license.

title: Adm. Wilder D.Baker, 85, Dies; Cited for Attack Against Japan
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 10 (AP)Vice Adm. Wilder D. Baker, who directed the first sea attack against Japan in World War II, died today. He was 85 years old.

title: ISRAEL SAYS TROOPS KILLED 4 GUERRILLAS
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 10 (AP)Israeli troops killed four Arab guerrillas who croseed the border from Lebanon during the night, the Israeli military command announced today. No Israeli casualties were reported.

title: U.S. Agency Bonds To Trade on Amex In Odd Lots Shortly
description: The American Stock Exchange, which introduced oddlot trading in Treasury bonds last January in a major effort to attract small investors, will shortly add a smiliar trading program in Government agency bonds, Wail Street bond sources disclosed yesterday.

title: Trial of Miss Hearst Is Tentatively Set for Dec. 15
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 10 Patricia Hearst's trial date was tentatively set today for Dec. 15. However, this may be changed as a result of a hearing next week at which her lawyers will try to reopen the question of her competency to stand trial on charges of armed bank robbery and use of a gun to commit a felony.

title: AUSTRALIA LEADER IS ORDERED TO QUIT
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Tuesday, Nov. 11Australia's Governor General dismissed Prime Minister Gough Whitlam today and ordered the leader of the Opposition to form a caretaker Government until elections could be held. The action, by Sir John Kerr, was unpreced, ented in Australia's 75year history as a federation, and seemed to catch everyone, including the Prime Minister by surprise.

title: Beame Gets Reminder of City's Plight in Past
description: On Jan. 8, 1899, The New York Herald, in an article on New York's fight for a budget of $138 million, decried the tremendous sum that taxpayers had to pay for being governed during 1898 and bemoaned the vast differences between estimates and actual disbursements.

title: Betty Ford Ranks High In Study by Harris Poll
description: Betty Ford, often described as one of the most outspoken Presidents wives, has become one of the most popular and is a solid asset to her husband, the Harris poll reported yesterday.

title: INSPECTORS CITE THE UNION LEAGUE
description: The Union League Club, which screens its member: carefully, has been cited by the New York City Health De partment for admitting roaches to its thirdfloor kitchen wall

title: Israelis Break Up West Bank Protest
description: RAMALLAH, IsraeliOccupied Jordan, Nov. 10Israeli soldiers fired into the air and used riot sticks here this morning to break up crowds of Palestinian students in their third day of demonstrations against Israeli occupation of the West Bank of the Jordan.

title: COASTAL STATES GAS IS SUING OCCIDENTAL
description: The Coastal States Gas Corporation and one of its subsidiaries have filed an antitrust suit against the Occidental Petroleum Corporation and two of its affiliates, charging Occidental with restraint of trade in connection with an alleged boycott of Libyan oil.

title: AUSTRALIA LEADER IS OUSTED IN CRISIS
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Tuesday, Nov. 11The Governor General of Australia, Sir John Kerr, removed Gough Whitlam from the post of Prime Minister today and asked the Opposition leader, Malcolm Fraser, to form a new Government, statement by the Governor's office said.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD S3311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (2011 MARKET 33900/ WESTCHESTER CO.
