title: ExBronx Teacher Accused Of MassageParlor Hiring
description: A 49yearold Bronx high school teacher, who resigned his post two weeks ago, has been accused by former students of hiring them to work in a homosexual massage parlor in Manhattan, according to sources close to a joint investigation by the Bronx and New York County District Attorneys.

title: On Growth
description: Much of contemporary gloom concerning the future originates from the belief that there are limits to growth an expression which has penetrated deeply into the public subconscious from the catchy title of a muchpublicized book. One of the themes of this book is that the resources of the Earth are limited and that shortages will soon reach critiral

title: SPARKLING TOUCHES IN SZILAGYI PIANISM
description: Bla Szilgyi, the pianist son of a Hungarian gypsy violinist from New York and the sort of technician who can ripple up storm in the most complex music, gave a pleasing if not ultimately satisfying recital Sunday night in Alice Tully Hall

title: Mix business with pleasure.Uniteds L.A. weekend for 2.
description: United knows a place where you can spend a funfilled glamorpacked weekend for only S60.00. Los Angeles.

title: STATE IS RECEIVING MORE FEDERAL AID
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10 (AP)Governor Byrne said today that New Jersey and its local governments had managed to raise the annual amount of Federal aid they received by more than $400 million in the last two years.

title: Paintings by Levine Defy Abstract Trend
description: Not many American artists have been told by Pope Paul VI that their work will always be welcome in the Vatican Museum. But that's what the Pope said two years ago to Jack Levine, at the time his Cain and Abel canvas was purchased for the Vatican's gallery of contemporary religious art.

title: Guerrillas in Argentina Battle Army in a War Without Prisoners
description: FAMAILLA, Argentina  The Argentine Army, which has not fought a war for nearly 100 years, is engaged in close combat with a guerrilla force op*rating in the mountains that overlook this sugarcane growing region.

title: Goldman Charge Dropped; Murtagh Upbraids Nadjari
description: A State Supreme Court Justice yesterday dismissed a major indictment against Irving Goldman, the city's former Cultural Affairs Commissioner, declaring that Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, had neither the evidence nor the authority to ask a special grand jury to indict Mr. Goldman.

title: Religious and Medical Leaders Back Court's Decision in the Quinlan Case
description: Religious leaders tended yesterday to endorse the court decision against letting Karen Anne Quinlan die, and so did leaders of the American Medical Association and American Bar Association in initial personal expressions.

title: Health Food Awards Show Rise in Entries
description: Apparently the Family Health Magazine Nutritional Advertising Awards are beginning to catch on with the advertising community. The magazine reports a 400 percent increase in the entries for the fourth annual competition.

title: Ford Aides See $43 Billion Spending Rise
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 10President Ford's budget experts sent Congress today an estimate that Federal Government spending would rise between $43 billion and 646 billion in the next fiscal years on the basis of present lawwith no new election  year spending proposals.

title: Merger Bid Denied To Citicorp by Fed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The Federal Reserve Board denied today an application by Citicorp, parent holding company of the First National City Bank, to acquire three finance compavies in the Western part of the country.

title: Big Soviet Port Due
description: Russia is building its largest port in the Soviet Far East. Page 47.

title: COURT BIDS STATE U. OPEN SCHOOL ON L.I.
description: The board of trustees of the State University of New York was ordered yesterday to reverse a decision not to open a school of podiatric medicine at Stony Brook, L.I., this term. It was also ordered to admit all students accepted for the current term.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Tax Exemption Upheld For Giants
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10 (AP)The Appellate Division of Superior Court upheld today a lower court ruling exempting from local taxation the state football stadium being built in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Corporations Release Reports Covering Their Sales and Earnings Figures
EXAIDE OF GULF ADMITS TO GIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (UPI) A former Gulf Oil Corporation official has acknowledged making allegedly illegal campaign contributions to at least 15 Senators and Congressmen, incuding cash paid in a hotel men's room and behind a barn, it was learned today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Little Time Found For Pollution Study On Disease Links
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Scientists working on environmental Standards have been under so much pressure to complete the work that they have not been able to give sufficient time and attention to the effects of low levels of pollution on cancer and heart disease, an executive for the Environmental Protection Agency said today.

title: Rangers Play Tonight Without Esposito
description: Beginning a twoweek stretch tonight that will have them facing all 10 of the players they traded away this season, the Rangers have yet to glean any profits from their latest dramatic deal with the Boston Bruins.

title: U.N. RollCall
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 10Following is the rollcall vote in the United Nations General Assembly tonight on resolution that classifies Zionism as a form of racism.

title: Conscience of the Nation
description: Within the past few years, we as people seem to have lost our way, to be floundering in uncertainty, to be unsure of ourselves in our relations to each other and to the world at large. The optimism and moral drive characteristic of America throughout the decades have been largely replaced by a deepseated cynicism and disillusionment. We are now in a period of political uncertainty and economic distress, of growinob disparity between rich and poor, of sporadic violence and threats of racial conflictraising the question whether America's social, political and moral structure is responsive and resilient enough to meet the needs of the convulsive society that we have to anticipateespecially in the great citiesin the next few years.

title: Fromme Judge Cites Aide Of A.C.L.U. for Contempt
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 10An aide of the American Civil Liberties Union refused to testify against Lynette Alice Fromme today and was cited for contempt of court and threatened with a jail sentence by Judge Thomas J, MacBride, who said he was ruling from the mind, not the heart.

title: Connors And Ashe Advance
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Nov. 10 (AP)Roscoe Tanner and Dick Stockton, tired after getting here late from Sweden, were beaten today by British players in the $94,000 Dewar indoor tennis tournament. Topseeded Arthur Ashe won his second match, beating Mike Estep of Dallas, 64, 62. Jimmy Connors downed Wojtek Fibak of Poland, 62, 76, for second time in a week.

title: In Memoriam
description: In Memoriam

title: Salsa Craze Sweeping Night Spots Here
description: From the posh Act III near the Westchester border to the remote Hadaar on Staten Island, more than a score of the city's morepopular nightclubs, ballrooms and discotheques are booming out a distinctly Latin beat these days, and no wonder.

title: Bridge:
description: All experienced players understand the theory of elimination play: remove all cards in irrelevant suits, and hope the opponents can he forced to do something helpful in the end games. But the practice is not always so easy, and some very tricky positions can arise. Consider for example this suit comhinatinn.

title: CORRECTION
description: It was reported incorrectly in the Arts and Leisure Guide in The New York Times on Sunday that Jane Olivor would be at the Rainbow Grill this week. Instead, Laura Kenyon will he the opening act for the Peter Gorden() Show through Saturday.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Today's Entries at Aqueduct

title: Least Likely to Succeed
description: After 490 years of colonial rule, Portugal has proclaimed the independence of Angola and withdrawn in hasteeven ahead of deadlineleaving that huge and potentially rich country of southwestern Africa torn apart by an accelerating civil war with international complications. Even Belgium's exit in 1960 from the Congo (now Zaire), then seething with threats of civil and tribal strife and secession, was accomplished with greater smoothness.

title: GUILDTIMES TALK AT CRITICAL STAGE
description: Critical negotiations between The New York Times and the NeWeipaper Guild continued last night as the two sides tried to work out a contract agreement that would prevent a strike threatened for today.

title: Portuguese Quit Angola As the Civil War Goes On
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 10The Portuguese took home their flag today, leaving their first, and last, colony in Africa to the Angolan people, who are fighting a civil war.

title: William Hardcastle Is Dead; British Broadcaster, Editor
description: LONDON, Nov. 10 (Reuters) William Hardcastle, radio broadcaster and former editor of The Daily Mail of London, died here today. He was 57 years old.

title: Pressure Seen for More Explicit Government Role in U.S. Economic Affairs
description: The United States is well on the way to a planned economy and the current economc crisis will only intensify the preisures for a more explicit Government role in economic affairs, according to a study prepared by the Exploatory Project for Economic Alternatives, a Washingtonbased research group funded by some 25 private foundations.

title: U.S. Equestrian Team Captures Nations Cup
description: The United States Eques trian Team, to the surprise of almost no one who has been following the National Horse Show since it opened an eightday run last Tuesday, won the Nations Cup last night at Madison Square Garden. Since the United States captured the event last year, it needs only one more victory to retire the Maj. Gen Alfred G. Tuckerman Memorial Challenge Trophy.

title: U.S. Boxer Prepares for Soviet Foe
description: At a luncheon for the Soviet heavyweight boxing team which will take on 10 American amateurs on Friday night at Madison Square Garden, the president of the Garden's boxing department proposed a new opponent for Muhammad Ali.

title: Wave of Kidnappings in Lebanon Perils Truce
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 10Kidnapping has replaced rocket and machinegun fire as the principal terror in the streets of the Beirut area.

title: Ford Challenges Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California plans to challenge President Ford in as many Presidential primaries as possible next year, a campaign strategist, James H. Lake, said today. Mr. Lake discounted President Ford's statement that all Presidential candidates should run in all the primaries, with at least 30 onthe schedule. Mr. Ford said he would enter all of them, but would not campaign actively in each state.

title: Court Restores Charge Against Oyster Bay Aide
description: A Federal indictment has been reinstated against Gerard P. Trotta, a 47yearold official accused of extorting political contributions from an engineering company when he was the Public works Commissioner of the Town of Oyster Bay in Nassau County.

title: RESCINDING OF E.R.A. IS TERMED ILLEGAL
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10 (UPI)It would be illegal for the New Jersey Legislature to rescind its ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment to the United States Constitution, the Women's Equity Action League caid today

title: Italian Civil Staffs Strike
description: ROME, Nov. 10 (Reuters)More than 280,000 civil servants, seeking pay increases and other reforms, staged a 24hour strike today, paralyzing airports, emptying Government ministries and halting customs inspections at ports and frontiers.

title: Tax Exemption Upheld For Giants
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10 (AP)The Appellate Division of Superior Court upheld today a lower court ruling exempting from local taxation the state football stadium being built in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Beirut Refugees Halt in Athens
description: ATHENS, Nov. 10A 7yearold edged up to a friend and asked, Do looters take toys?

title: 2 FORCED TO QUIT STATE POSITIONS
description: ALBANY, Nov. 10Governor Carey has forced the resignation of the two top officials in the State Division of Veterans Affairs because they refused to file statements of financial worth with the State Board of Public disclosure.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL DECLINES BY 1.6%
description: Steel production fell to 2,038,000 tons last week, a 1.6 percent drop from the preceding week, according to the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975. by by TTriangle PPublications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: U.S. BOARD ON CITY OPPOSED BY LABOR
description: Two of the city's municipal labor leaders told a joint Congressional committee yesterday that they concurred with the A.F.L.C.I.O. in opposing measures calling for a Federal board to oversee city fiscal affairs as a condition of Federal guarantee of city borrowing.

title: Music: Sarah Caldwell
description: Female chauvinism reared its head last night at Avery Fisher Hall, where Sarah Caldwell became the first woman to conduct a New York Philharmonic Pension Fund concert, and the first to lead a Philharmonic program exclusively devoted to women composers. But since it was all in the good cause of dramatizing how women musicians are catching up with history, the men in the audience did not audibly object. For at least one night an armistice was declared in Thurber's War Between Men and Women.

title: Advertising
description: It looks as if there'll be less advertising around in the near future.

title: Plantation Decline in Hawaii Spurs Exodus
description: LIHUE, HawaiiJust as the collapse of the old plantation economy of the Southeastern United States fed its refugees into the industrial cities of the North, the waning of the sugar and pineapple plantations of the Hawaiian Islands is creating its own exodus from paradise.

title: Rockefeller on 1976: Nobody Knows
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 10Vice President Rockefeller, asked today if he would rule out the possibility that he might run for the Presidency next year, said, Well, nobody knows what might happen.

title: Stage: God, Man, Devil
description: Unlike other plays in Yiddish, Jacob Gordin's Gott, Mensch un Tyvel (God, Man and the Devil) does not require the ambiance of the. Eastern European pale or the shtetl for h.. effect or its effectiveness. It is not a nostalgic romp through the past nor a play whose point derives from the breaking up of ancient folkways or the widening gap between generations.

title: CAREY CALLS MIX OF TAXES NEEDED TO AVERT DEFAULT
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that the current attempt to work out a combined citystate fiscal solution involved proposals for a mix of taxes including a possible 1centonthedollar increase in the city sales tax and possible rises in the state's income, corporate and bank taxes

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Attorney General William F. Hyland says charges made by Assemblyman Morton Salkind about undue influence by lobbyists in the Legislature are basically hearsay and that he will not support a criminal investigation. In a letter to Mr. Salkind, Democrat of Monmouth, the Attorney General said, The information you have given us is basically hearsay and would make it very difficult to support a formal investigation without further corroboration. After the defeat in September of a bill sponsored by Mr. Salkind to set up an emergency state reserve fund for malpractice insurance, he charged that some legislators had been susceptible to intense lobbying efforts against the bill by the insurance industry.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 11, 1975

title: GUILDTIMES TALK AT CRITICAL STAGE
description: Critical negotiations between The New York Times and the Newspaper Guild continued into the early morning today as the, two sides tried to work out a contract agreement that would prevent a strike threatened for today.

title: High Court's Queries Hint Doubt On Parts of New Election Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Most of the Justices of the Supreme Court expressed concern today that some aspects of the new Federal campaign financing laws might impinge on rights guaranteed by the First and Fifth Amendments.

title: Kissinger Sees Weak U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today the United Nations General Assembly vote on Zionism was an example of the blocvoting, of the oneway morality, that has weakened the public support in the United States for the United Nations.

title: Rapist Gets Life Term in Killing Of Carol Hoffmann on 29th St.
description: David Allweiss, who 18 months ego rejected an offer of a minimum of 8 and 1/3 years in prison to cover indictments for several rapes and for the murder of Carol Hoffmann, was sentenced to life in prison yesterday for Miss Hoffmann's murder.

title: The Dance: City Ballet Opens Season
description: When you think of most dance companies you think of dancers. Or even if, forgive the word, should you be more sophisticated, ongoing traditions. But with New York City Ballet, which happily enough opened its new season at the Lincoln Cehter's New York State Theater last night, you think of choreographers. You think of George Balanchine and (in alphabetical order) Jerome Robbins. These two men are precisely, and elegantly, what New York City Ballet is all about.

title: Prices on Big Board Rise On Signs of Rate Decline
description: Prices moved modestly higher yesterday in moderate, selective trading on the New York Stock Exchange amid signs of a continuing decline in shortterm interest rates.

title: About New York
description: The visiting nurse is an old New York institution. The patient who is housebound is ill in such fashion that a hospital is often not needed, and the question of how the lonely sick get medical care is a troublesome one. It is a perennial problem, and the nurses who deal with it are devoted to their service.

title: Diplomat's Daughter Dies Of Bullet Wound in Head
description: LYNCHBURG, Va., Nov. 11 (AP)  Alexandra Bruce Michaelides, 29yearold daughter of David K. E. Bruce, the United States diplomat, has died at a hospital here, reportedly of a self inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Knicks Routed By Suns
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 11Going from bad to worse, the New York Knicks got there tonight as they lost to the Phoenix Suns, 11281, and completed the first alllosing extended trip in their history with a fifth straight defeat.

title: Government Report Cites Lower Rises On the 1976 Autos
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) Two consecutive years of disastrous car sales taught the four major automakers to show considerably more restraint in raising prices for their I976 models, a Government report said.

title: Marty May, Comedian, 77, Dies; Was in Theater, Radio and TV
description: LAS VEGAS. Nev., Nov. 11 (AP)Marty May, whose comedy and song career spanned more than half a century in vaudeville, theater, radio, television and nightclubs, died today of a heart ailment in Sunrise Hospital. He was 77 years old,

title: Market Place
description: American Home Products, one of Wall Street's most durable glamour stocks, closed lower yesterday following a massive block trade and the reported removal of the stock from the buy list of a leading brokerage house.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The New York Times yesterday, the number of shares of common stock of the Anaconda Company that the Crane Company is seeking to acquire was incorrectly stated. Crane has offered to exchange $100 million of its g percent subordinated debentures for five million shares of Anaconda stock.

title: CONTRACTOR FEES HALTED BY ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Army suspended payments today to 900 contractors because of the discovery that it had overspent its procurement budget by about $165million.

title: Quinlan Doctors Vow RoundtheClock Care
description: Physicians and nurses at St. Clare's Hospital in Denville, N.J., said yesterday that they would continue to give roundtheclock care to Karen Anne Quinlan following the court ruling Monday that said any decision to remove her lifesustaining respirator belonged to her doctors.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES PLUNGE IN PRICE
description: After a strong opening, prices of soybean and corn futures dropped sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: For Them, Haute Cuisine Beats Higher Learning
description: BERKELEY, Calif.Robert Flaherty rarely reflects on the fact that his B.A. from Georgetown, his law degree from Michigan, his year of study at the London School of Economics or his threeyear stint with one of San Francisco's more prestigious corporate law firms never really equipped him for his current profession: waiting on tables in Berkeley.

title: Little Big Winner
description: A 9yearold won a 9yearold, when Todd Matarazzo's name was drawn from more than a million entries in the seventh annual Courvoisier Arabian contest. As a result, the fourthgrade student from East Norwich, L.I., Is the owner of a purebred Arabian show horse. Todd, his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Matarazzo, and his brother, Mark 11, attended the National on Sunday night, the first time any of them had seen a horse show.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: David G. Trager, United States Attorney for the Eastern District, accused the heads of two companies of having used for themselves more than $17,500 in taxes that had been withheld from paychecks of their employees. Mr. Trager said that although such cases normally were handled by the Internal Revenue Service, he was acting because he had received reports that the Government had lost hundreds of millions of dollars in such circumstances. Those accused are Mario Lazzinnaro, 37 years old, 10560 115th Street, Richmond Hill, Queens, president the M & C Lazzinnaro Construction Corporation of Brooklyn, and Gerald Lamoureaux, 35, of Norwalk, Conn., former president of United Exterminators Inc. of Smithtown, L.I.

title: Music: Two Firsts for Sarah Caldwell
description: Female chauvinism reared its head on Monday at Avery Fisher Hall, where Sarah Caldwell became the first woman to conduct a New York Philharmonic Pension Fund concert, and the first to lead a Philharmonic program exclusively devoted to women composers. But since it was all in the good cause of dramatizing how women musicians are catching up with history, the men in the audience did not audibly object. For at least one night an armistice was declared in Thurber's War Between Men and Women.

title: Retail Sales Rise Again After September Slump
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 11Retail sales rebounded after September's decline to post a 9 percent gain in October from yearearlier levels, the Commerce Department estimated today.

title: 3 Die in Delaware Fire
description: BLADES. Del.. Nov. 11 (UPI) A woman and her two small, children were killed today when a fire struck their trailer house in a trailer park three miles south of here.

title: Deborah J. Gilardi Bride of Hal Rose
description: Deborah Jean Gilardi, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Victor R. Gilardi Jr., of Columbus, N.J., was married yesterday to Hal Stevens Rose, son of Mr. and Mrs. Homer Rose Jr., of Summit, N.J. The Rev. Reynolds Kowalski performed the ceremony in the St. James Roman Catholic Church in Jamesburr. N.J.

title: Hawks Down Celtics, 10091
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 11 (AP) Lou Hudson led a 9point surge early in the third quarter, then scored three straight baskets to start the fourth as the Atlanta Hawks defeated the Boston Celtics, 10091, in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Transportation Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The House passed a $4 billion appropriations bill for the Transportation Department and related agencies today rejecting challenges to increases in railroad spending and a curb on highway expenditures. The bill now goes back to the Senate, which is expected to send it on to President Ford.

title: Sterile Fruit Flies Taken To Coast in War on Pests
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov 11 (AP) Another 2.5 million sterile Mediterranean fruit flies have been brought in as reinforcements for the nearly 4 million flies who were accidentally killed before they were able to mate with the wild fruit flies discovered here.

title: Legacy of the Incas
description: CUZCO, PeruThe most insoluble problem in contemporary South America is trying to incorporate into modern national societies the ten million Quechuaspeaking Indians who inhabit the high Andes valleys from Bolivia across the length of Peru and northward into the remote, fastnesses of Ecuador.

title: Poll Finds 44 Senators Against City Aid Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)Fewer than a third; of the members of the Senate are ready to vote for a bill to provide $4 billion in feder ally guaranteed loans to en: able New York City to avoid bankruptcy a poll of the Senate by United Press International showed today.

title: MARCUS PURDUE, 61; WITH A.P. OVERSEAS
description: Marcus Purdue, a former foreign correspondent for The Associated Press, died of a (heart attack Monday night at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 61 years old and lived at 333 East 49th (Street).

title: A.B.A. Falls to 8 Teams
description: The American Basketball Association became an eightteam league yesterday, the smallest it has been, with the demise of the San Diego Sails. Although there have been numerous franchise shifts since the troubled league went into operation for the 196768 season it was able to operate with II teams for the first five years and with 10 beginning with the 197273 season.

title: MISS WYLER OFFERS TUNES OF BROADWAY
description: Gretchen Wyler has joined the parade of musicaltheater veterans who are using reviews of their careers as the basis for a supperclub act. But Miss Wyler, who dates her career from 1948 when she was the Baby of the chorus in Where's Charley?, can call on one extratheatrical interest that sets her apart from her colleagues  her concern for animals.

title: Companies Report Their Figures for Sales and Profit
New Cuts Felt the Least By Uniformed Services
description: The details announced yesterday in Mayor Beame's plan to reduce the city's budget by MO million over a year's time show that the burden of the cuts will fall most heavily upon social services, hospitals and education, which together account for almost half, of the economies.

title: F.C.C Begins an Inquiry Into Overseas Cable Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The Federal Communications Commission began an investigation today into reports that international communications companies had disclosed contents of overseas cables to the National Security Agency.

title: NATO Calls Off a Meeting After Schlesinger Ouster
description: BONN, Nov. 10 (Reuters)A meeting of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's nuclear planning group has been called off following the dismissal of the United States Defense Secretary, James R. Schlesinger, informed West German sources said tonight.

title: Announders Are Cited By Umpire
description: MARION, Ohio, Nov. 11 (AP)Larry Barnett says he holds two television sports announcers, Tony Kubek and Curt accountable for the threats on his family over a controversial call he made in baseball's 197$ World Series.

title: Radio
description: 67:25 A.M., WNYCFM. Armida Overture, Haydn; Concertos 7, 8, 9 from La Stravaganza, Vivaldi; Symphony No. 49, Haydn; Les Sylphides, Chopin.

title: Hasidim in Williamsburg Gain High Court Review of Vote Suite
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Hasidic Jewish community in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn today won its bid, for Supreme Court review of the 1974 redistricting that took the tightly knit group of single election district and placed portions of it in to separate districts.

title: For the Recipe Buff..
description: The American Heritage Cookbook and Illustrated History of American Eating & Drinking was first published 11 years ago but deserves fresh attention in keeping with the Bicentennial. Text, pictures and recipes celebrate the development and influences of our own cuisine.

title: DISMISSAL LEAVES AUSTRALIA FACING A BITTER ELECTION
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Nov. 11Australia was thrown into what may be the bitterest election campaign in its history today after the Governor General unexpectedly dismissed Prime Minister Gough Whitlam and dissolved both houses of Parliament.

title: Bridge:
description: In a city with some 5,000 tournament players, it is paradoxical that the experts the top 200, saydo not get enough serious practice.

title: Harris Comments
description: ANTRIM, N.H., Nov. 11Fred R. Harris, a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination, who was also on Mr. Myers list, denied today that he or his aides had ever knowingly accepted an illegal campaign contribution from Gulf.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Nov. 11, 1975

title: Jazz in Chicago Is Muted By Demise of Top Clubs
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 11The marquee at Mr. Kelly's once lighted: the names, and helped propel the careers of such talents as Lenny Brtide, Dick Gregory, Bob Newhart, Elaine May and Mike Nichols, NoW it reads SOLD TO HOT SPURS, a conipany that plans to turn it into a discothenue.

title: Kissinger Says U.S. Will Ignore U.N. Vote
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 11In his first public comment since last night's vote in the United Nations on the Zionism issue, Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said tonight that the United States will ignore this vote and pay no attention to it.

title: Ford Back in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)  President Ford returned aboard Air Force One tonight to the capital from Charleston, W. Va., where he addressed Republican dinner.

title: Jets Sign Davis Jerry From W.F.L.
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 11 His name is Davis and he's from the World Football League and today the Jets signed him to fill a major void.

title: U.S. RIGHTS BOARD FINDS AGENCY LAG sees Failure to Bar BiasAsks White House Move
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)  the United States Civil Rights Commission charged today that several Federal agencies had failed to prevent discrimination in the expenditure of $50 billion annually and recommended that future efforts be coordinated in the White; House.

title: ROUTE 287 PROJECT PRESSED AS A BOON
description: OAKLAND, Nov. II (AM)The extension of Interstate 287 from Montville to Mahwah could he done at a relatively low cost to the state and provide hundreds of jobs, according to former State Transportation Commissioner David J. Goldberg.

title: State G. O. P. to Send Delegates To Convention  Uncommitted
description: Opening the door to a possible Presidential bid by Vice President Rockefeller, Newt Ygrk State Republican leaders have decided to send an uncommitted and united delegation to the Republican National Convention in Kansas City, Mo., next August, according to Richard M. Rosenbaum, the state party chairman.

title: New York's Delegation Lobbying for Aid to City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11It would be damned impressive to me, said Representative Charles E. Bennett, a 14term conservative Democrat, if they decided that people hieed by the city in the future would get more modest pensions.

title: Supreme Court to Review Private School Color Bar
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether private schools may refuse admission to black children because of their race.

title: EXPANDED 370 UNITS ANNOUNCED BY I.B.M.
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 11 (UPI)The International Business Machines Corporation announced today new versions Icf its System370 Models 115 and 125 providing cardless disk lentry and double the disk capacity of earlier models.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Dr. William Kouwenhoven Dies; Helped Develop Cardiac Devices
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 11 (AP)Dr. William B. Kouwenhoven, an electrical engineer who helped develop basic cardiac treatment devices and procedures used around the world, died yesterday, the John Hopkins Medical Institutions announced today. He was 89 years old.

title: BEIRUT RELAXING AS TRUCE HOLDS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 11This gaudy Mediterranean capital, charred and bloodied by civil war, began to relax today for the first time in nearly two month.

title: British Output Rises 0.8%
description: LONDON, Nov. 11 (Reuters) The British industrial production index rose 0.8 percent to 99.8 in September (the base year is 1970) from a revised 99.0 in August, the Central Statistical Office reported today. The rise compares with a revised decline in August of 1.1 percent.

title: Gulf Oil Aids 2 Burn Centers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 11 (AP)Gulf Oil Corporation donated $25,000 each to two burn, treatment centers yesterday in memory of the eight firemen killed while ifghting a devastating blaze at its refinery here in August. The centers are at St. Agnes Hospital in Philadetphia and the CrozerChester Medical Center in Delaware County.

title: ROCKEFELLER SAYS FORD IS FLEXIBLE
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 11Vice President Rockefeller said today that President Ford might reappraise his opposition to Federal guarantees for New York City bonds before the city goes into bankruptcy.

title: Record $250,000 Is Paid For First Secretariat Son
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 11 (AP)The first son of Secretariat, the Triple Crown winner, to be sold at auction set a worldrecord price of $250,000 today at Keeneland's 32d annual breeding sale.

title: Loomis Burrell Dies at 103; Maker of Dairy Equipment
description: Loomis Burrell, a retired manufacturer of dairy machinery equipment, died yesterday at his home in Little Falls, N.Y. He was 103 years old.

title: Moscow Breaks Relations With Uganda
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 11The Soviet Union today broke diplomatie relations with Uganda in a move seen as a setback to Soviet ambitions in Africa.

title: Newspaper Talks: Clash of WellPrepared Strategies
description: Like chess players. The New York Times, the Newspaper Guild and the mediator Theodore W. Kheel followed wellprepared but separate strategies in collective bargaining that ended yesterday in a contract settlement and averted a shutdown of the paper.

title: SHIP LOST WITH 29 IN LAKE SUPERIOR
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., Nov. 11A 729foot ore boat with 29 crewmen aboard sank last night in a storm in Lake Superior.

title: 22 Reproved by U.S. for Northrop Gratuity Roles
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The Defense Department has sent letters of admonition to 22 employees who visited a hunting lodge provided by the Northrop Corporation.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The New York Times yesterday, the number of shares of common stock of the Anaconda Company that the Crane Company is seeking to acquire was incorrectly stated. Crane has offered to exchange $100 million of its 8 percent subordinated debentures for five million shares of Anaconda stock.

title: Fed May Speed Up Pace of Expansion In Money Supply
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (Reuters)The chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, Arthur F. Burns, said today that the board might allow more growth in the United States money supply than previously permitted because of a low rate of growth since July.

title: 2 RIVAL REGIMES SET UP IN ANGOLA
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 11Two competing Governments were proclaimed today for Angola on this first day of independence from Portugal.

title: Burma's Prdsiddnt in China At Start of FourDay Visit
description: PEKING, Nov. 11 (Reuters)Burma's President, Ne Win, arrived in China today on one of his rare trips outside Burma. The President, who paid an informal and friendly visit to Peking in 1971 after the Improvement in relations between the two countries, was met at the airport by Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping and Foreign Minister Chiao Kuanhua.

title: GEORGE BROWN, AIDE OF WHITE MOTOR, 64
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 11 George Brown, vice president, corporate secretary and general counsel of the White Motor Corporation, died today at Hanna House of University Hospitals. He was 64 years old.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: Bogus Tickets Reported Printed for Sinatra Show
description: CHERRY HILL, Nov. 11 (UPI) The Latin Casino said today that it had received reports of counterfeit tickets being circulated for the appearance of Frank Sinatra at the theater restaurant here Feb. 13 to 22.

title: IIVIARTA Valk 41, RAN YOUTH AGENCY
description: Marta Valle, a leader of the City's Puerto Rican community and former Commissioner of the Youth Services Agency, died of cancer Monday night at St. Luke's Hospital. She was 41 years old and lived at 4212 196th Street in Flushing. Queens.

title: McCaffrey Wins Exxon Program
description: The Exxon Corporation has decided to assign all of its huge corporate advertising program to McCaffrey & McCall. The billings are estimated at more than $20 million.

title: Coast Salt Harvest Old, Ecologically Sound Method
description: NEWARK, Calif., Nov. 6The harvest is just about in all across the country, the crops, one by one, clipped from the land.

title: Showers Aren't Just for Washing Today They're for Massaging, Too
description: For years a shower that got one invigoratingly wet and squeaky clean was considered so refreshing that it caused many a person to burst into songor at least what passed for song. Then someone decided that the shower was really an underachiever. It could just as easily give a massage too.

title: UNIT OF CHRYSLER PLANS STOCK SALE
description: DETROIT, Nov. 11 (Reuters) The Chrysler Corporation said today that its Argentina subsidiary, Chrysler Fevre Argentia, had presented a program to the Argentine Government providing for the sale of about 60 per cent of the subsidiary to local investors by 1980 for $30 million.

title: Edwin Rankin Dead at 85; ExInvestment Counselor
description: Edwin Rankin, a retired banker and investment counselor, died Monday at his home in Bethel, Conn. He was 85 years old.

title: 57 Years Afterwards, Veteran Of World War I Gets Medals
description: FORT MONMOUTH. Nov. 11Former Sgt. George Krahnert blinked a couple of tears today but otherwise stood firm and erect as fourstar general pinned over the breast pocket of his World War I infantry uniform the medals he had earned but not received 57 years ago.

title: Carter Criticizes Ford
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 11 (AP)Jimmy Carter, former Governor of Georgia, said today that President Ford is a terrible national leader because he is spending too much time traveling and not enough time running the Government. Mr. Carter, a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination, made the statement at a news conference as he prepared to begin a campaign tour..

title: Mix and Match Fabrics
description: A tiny fabric boutique called La Ronde has opened on the eighth floor of Lord & Taylor, and it is filled with tiny prints, all of them the work of a French couple, Yves and Michelle Halard, who are textile designers.

title: WINE TALK
description: Most tastings cover a specific kind of wine, such as 10 zinfandels, eight Beaujolais, six vintages of Chateau Lascombes or Schloss Vollrads.

title: His Life Is Sunnyside Up
description: With Egg Art, George Moran has this thing about eggs especially when they're fried, and sunnyside up.

title: Huge Rally Here Condemns U.N. AntiZionism Move
description: Tens of thousands of people jammed the heart of the garment district at noon yesterday to protest the approval by the United Nations General Assembly of an Arabinitiated resolution defining Zionism as a form of racism.

title: Listing of Prices for Contracts in Futures of Commodities
description: Tuesday, Nov. 11, 1975

title: Notes on People
description: Returning after a weekend absence, Senator Charles Mcc. Mathias Jr. of Maryland found that a burglary had taken place at his Chevy Chase home and yesterday there was speculation in Washington: Was there a connection between this breakin and another at the Washington home of Senator Howard Baker Jr. of Tennessee on Aug. 6? Both Republicans serve on the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence.

title: Miss Quinlan to Continue to Receive RoundtheClock Medical Attention
description: Physicians and nurses at St. Clare's Hospital in Denville said yesterday they would continue to give roundtheclock care to Karen Anne Quinlan in the wake of the court decision Monday that said any decision to remove her from her lifesustaining respirator belonged to her physicians.

title: West Side Road Stirs New Fears
description: The long and grinding impasse over a lasting solution for the West Side Highway is generating new suspicion among those who favor a new superroad as a replacement and others who want no new road at all.

title: THE HEISKELLS CITED BY CITIZENS UNION
description: Hailed as two great New Yorkers who have preserved the faith, Andrew and Marian Heiskell were honored by the Citizens Union here last night for their outstanding contribution to the quality of life in New York City and the nation.

title: Rhodes and Burns Lessen Resistance to City Help
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Two influential conservative Republicans moved today toward support of Federal action to prevent a New York City default.

title: Challenge to Tunney
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 11 (AP)John G. Schmitz has announced he will seek the United States Senate seat held by John V. Tunney, Democrat. Mr. Schmitz, the 1972 American Independent Party Presidential candidate and a former Representative said yesterday he would make his bid as a Republican.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Judge Cuts Award to Scientist's Heirs

title: Treasury Bill Auction Put Off Till Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)  The Treasury Department announced today it was delaying the auction date of $2.1 billion worth of oneyear bills and cutting back the maturity date by one day as a precautionary measure in case the debt ceiling was not changed in time. The auction, which was set for tomorrow, will be held Thursday.

title: Brazilian Bishops Accuse Authorities of Murder
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 11 (Reuters)  Roman Catholic bishops in So Paulo have accused the Brazilian authorities of torturing and murdering political prisoners and have proclaimed next Friday as a day of casting in defense of human rights.

title: FURTHER EASING BY FED FORECAST
description: Credit  market participants predicted yesterday further moves by the Federal Reserve to ease monetary policy.

title: EDWARD WALLACE OF I.T.T. DIES AT 67
description: Former Assistant Director of Corporate Relations

title: Blues Turn Back Young Rangers, 53
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 11With Alan N. Cohen, president of the Madison Square Garden Corporation, looking on, the New York Rangers tried to make up for the missing Phil Esposito, Carol Vadnais and Doug Jarrett tonight against the St. Louis Blues.

title: MOROCCO RENEWS TALKS WITH SPAIN
description: MADRID, Nov. 11  Morocco's Premier, Ahmed Osman, and Foreign Minister, Ahmed Laraki, arrived here today to resume negotiations with Spain on Morocco's claims to Spanish Sahara.

title: Estimate Board Set to Vote on Key Taino Towers DayCare Lease
description: The Board of Estimate is due, to vote tomorrow on a lease for, a new daycare center that: could mean the difference be tween success or default for a: federally subsidized housing: and community project in East: Harlem, according to the spon, sors of the innovative and controversial complex.

title: Clinton Anderson Dies
description: Former United States Senator Clinton P. Anderson, Democrat of New Mexico, who retired in 1972 after a long career in Congress and as Secretary of Agriculture, died yesterday in Albuquerque, N.M. He was 80 years old. Page 46.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Alcohol Bureau Won't Require Listing of Ingredients on Labels
description: The Tresury Department's Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms announced yesterday that it would not require the producers of alcohol beverages to list ingredients on labels.

title: City's ThirdGrade Pupils Gain on Reading Scores
description: Pupils in New York City public schools have scored gains in reading on recent state and city tests, school officials here and in Albany said yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Times and Guild Reach Accord On Contract, Averting a Strike
description: Negotiators for The New York Times and the Newspaper Guild of New York reached agreement yesterday on a new threeyear contract, averting strike that had been threatened for yesterday morning.

title: Rangers LineUp
description: AT GARDEN

title: DAVIS WEIR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP) Davis Weir, president and founder of American Finance System Inc., with some 600 consumer loan offices across the country, died yesterday at his home here. He was 72 years old. He also had a home in Pompano, Fla.

title: France Stops Marking World War I Triumph
description: PARIS, Nov. 11For the first time since the end of World War I 57 years ago France refrained today from celebrating its 1918 victory over the Germans.

title: FRANCO NOW FACING PNEUMONIA THREAT
description: MADRID, Nov. 11Generalissimo Francisco Franco developed signs of pneumonia today after his doctors had begun to speak optimistically of his recovery.

title: N.C.A.A. Told It Ignores Too Many Olympic Sports
description: A United States Senator who played football at Harvard accused the National Collegiate Athletic Association yesterday of arrogance and smugness for ignoring all but a handful of Olympic Sports.

title: Justice in Justice
description: When two zealous protectors of the community's need for a crimefree system of lawenforcement fall out, public confidence in the fairness of criminal justice suffers a rude blowone it can poorly afford in this period of shattered trust in most institutions.

title: Ouster of Security Chief Reported Sought in Lisbon
description: LISBON, Nov. 11 (AP)Influential officers are seeking to remove Gen. Otelo Saravia de Carvalho, a leftist, as commander of military security, reinole sources reported today.

title: Railway and Airline Union Acts to Acquire REA Routes
description: Three officials of the Brotherhood of Railway and Airline Clerks announced yesterday they had organized a new corporation, BRAC Employees Express, to acquire the routes of the bankrupt REA Express and to get mom than 7,000 union members back to work. The stock of the new company has been put in a trust for the employees, the announcement said.

title: Advertising
description: Hearst Magazines, which has seven wellknown titles, is instituting a massive combination discount program. It is for the advertiser who is willing to think big for big savings.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 12, 1975

title: State Aides Seeking a Signal Of Softer City Stand by Ford
description: Governor Carey postponed the special legislative session yesterday at least until tomorrow as his top fiscal advisers met in Washington with President Ford's economic advisers, (trying to elicit a signal of isoftened White House policy before the President leaves for Paris on Friday.

title: United Asks Simplified Discount Fare
description: United Air Lines announced plans yesterday aimed at reducing some of the confusion caused by the large variety of airfare discounts.

description: Morning

title: New Killing in Ulster Linked To Feud by I.R.A. Factions
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 11 (AP)Gunmen killed a young man at a bus stop in Belfast today in what was believed to be another incident in the feud between the rival wings of the Irish Republican

title: F.D.A. HEAD ADMITS DRUGSTANDARD SLIP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP) The head of the Food and Drug Administration said today that a misunderstanding has caused some physicians and pharmacists to refuse to provide patients with generic drugs that could save the patients money.

title: TUNISIANENDSSIEGE; HOSTAGES RELEASED
description: TUNIS, Nov. 11 (UPI)The Tunisian bartender holding three hostages in the Belgian Embassy while demanding the return of his wife, surrendered to the police today.

title: Canadiens Defeat North Stars by 60
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 11 (UPI) Guy Lafleur and Mario Tremblay scored twice each and Peter Mahovlich picked up four assists tonight as the Montreal Canadiens trounced the Minnesota North Stars, 60, on Ken Dryden's second shutout of the season.

title: CAREY TO APPOINT 2 SPECIAL JUDGES
description: Governor Carey announced yesterday that he would appoint two additional special and extraordinary trial judges to help expedite a growing backlog of corruption cases brought by Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor.

title: Remarks by Kuwaiti
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 11Following are excerpts from an address by Dr. Abdidlah alSayegh of Kuwait during the debate in the General Assembly yesterday onthe resolution classifying Zionism as a form of racism:

title: Carborundum to Expand
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Nov. 10 (UPI) The Carborundum Company said today it planned to spend $7.7 million to expand its output of Fiberfrax ceramic fiber papers.

title: Professors Study Discounts Impact Of a Default Here
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11A default by New York City though not something to he welcomed, would not he a catastrophe, according to a new study of the city's finances made public today.

title: Food Prices in City Show 0.7% Increase
description: The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City last week increased 0.7 percent over the previous week's level, the Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

title: Pastore Assails the F.C.C. on EqualTime Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)Senator John O. Pastore, Democrat of Rhode Island, in a facetoface session with all seven members of the Federal Communications Commission today, accused them of usurping the authority and power of Congress, pure and simple.

title: Mary Poppies Has Her Own Way Even in the Kitchen
description: The woman with crisp, curly gray hair and shining eyes arranged herself comfortably on the sofa in the East Side town house, took the last of her tea, and waited.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Paul Horvat and Dorothy Shavers, James McHale, Tom Kalitowski, Roberta Wieloszynski, Jean Farmer. These are not exactly household names, but to foodconsumer activists, they are among the Terrific Ten, heroes and heroines to be honored because they have done something about food prices, food quality or hunger where they live.

title: Quads Born in Indiana
description: ELKHART, Ind., Nov. 11 (AP)  Betty Schneider of Goshen gave birth to quadruplets today. Mrs. Schneider, 24 years old, said she had been taking fertilby drugs. The boy and three girls are the first children for her and her husband Elvin, 29.

title: Supreme Court to Review Private School Color Bar
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether private schools may refuse admission to black children because of their race.

title: Experts Call Vote Harmful to U.N. and Cause of Peace
description: Scholars and other experts on the United Nations yesterday deplored the General Assembly's antiZionist vote as harmful to the world organization and to the cause of peace in the Middle East.

title: Kissinger States U.S. View
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 11 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said tonight that the United States would not recognize the Luanda government.

title: House Panel Asks Contempt Citation Of Commerce Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)A House subcommittee voted today to cite Commerce Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton for contempt of Congress for refusing to turn over the names of United States companies asked by the Arabs to participate in a boycott of Israel.

title: Bergman Makes Flute a Fable of Fun
description: It's grand opera. It's a Freemasonry fable. It was made for Swedish television and reportedly cost about S650,000, which would barely cover the expenses of a Hollywood motorcycle movie. It's based on a work with a magnificent score but with a libretto whose second act seems to have forgotten how the first act started.

title: FILIBUSTER BROKEN ON PICKETING BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The Senate today swept aside a filibuster that blocked consideration sideration of a controversial) bill that would expand the authority of striking workers at construction sites.

title: Rhodesians Celebrate 10 Years of Autonomy
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 11 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Ian Smith, marking the 10th anniversary of Rhodesia's unrecognized independence, said his beleaguered government never would resort to appeasement.

title: Army Engineers to Weigh Impact of Water Projects
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The United States Army Corps of Engineers said yesterday it would give environmental and social impacts more weight in considering water works projects and would also consider a no development alternative.

title: Leo J. Sheridan, 78, Envoy To Dublin in 68'69. Dies
description: LAKE FOREST, III., Nov. 11 (AP)Leo J. Sheridan, founder of one of Chicago's leading realestate concerns who was Ambassador to Ireland in 196869, died yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: Gulf Oil Investigation Being Reviewed;
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The Watergate Special Prosecutor's Office is reviewing its investigation of the Gulf Oil Corporation for alleged illegal campaign contributions, it was learned today.

description: Mayor Beame yesterday disclosed some of the details of his plan to eliminate an additional 8,000 employees from the city payroll this year and announced further budget cuts that he said would cost the jobs of thousands more,

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 11 (UPI)The dollar edged higher in quiet trading on European money market today. The price of gold fell marginally.

title: DISMISSAL LEAVES AUSTRALIA FACING A BITTER ELECTION
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Nov. 11Australia was thrown into what may be the bitterest election campaign in its history today after the Governor General unexpectedly dismissed Prime Minister Gough Whitlam and dissolved both houses of Parliament.

title: Pike Says the Administration Withholds Data on Intelligence
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Representative Otis G. Pike, chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, said today that the Ford Administration had failed to comply with three of the seven subpoenas issued by the committee last week for a broad range of classified materials. some factual data and periodic reports relating to the armslimitation talks had been provided to the Pike panel that he thought would convince the committee that its suspicions were in error.

title: Tammany in Connecticut
description: Jai alai is a game played by two or more persons who use a long, curved wicker basket strapped to the wrist for catching and throwing a small, hard ball in threesided coqrt. It is the national game of the Basque region of Spain. In Spanish, jai alai means merry game.

description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 11Two competing Governments were proclaimed today for Angola on this first day of independence from Portugal.

title: Gold Prices
description: Selected world golf prices Monday.

title: The Maverick Governor General
description: In Australia, the representative of the British Crown is expected to be seen rather thaw heard. But it came as no surprise to his intimates that Sir John Kerr, a native born boilermakMan er's son known to speak his mind in the and stick to what News he thinks right, shattered, the tradition. Last year when Prime Minister Gough Whitlam, leader of the Labor Party, nominated Sir John to Queen Elizabeth fOr appointment as Australia's ceremonial Governor General and nominal Commander in Chief of the defense force, he seemed a natural choice.

title: Utilities Generating Big Profits
description: The profits of most of the nation's big electric utilities are healthier than they have been for some time.

title: Top Israelis Defiant on U.N. Resolution
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 11  The Israeli Parliament in Jerusalem overwhelmingly rejected tonight the antiZionism and other Middle East resolutions that were voted by the United Nations General Assembly yesterday.

title: Druggists Warn Doctors to Use Code on Medicaid Prescription
description: TRENTON. Nov. 11 (UPI)Pharmacists have warned that Medicaid patients will he turned away unless physicians cooperate and properly code prescriptions to allow certain generic drugs to be substituted for higherpriced tradename medications.

title: Church Urges Senate to Reject Ford's Nomination of Bush as Intelligence Chief and Strongly Backs C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Senator Frank Church, chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, urged the Senate today, in a speech that was a strong defense of the Central Intelligence Agency, to oppose the nomination of George Bush as Director of Central Intelligence.

title: I.T.T. PAYMENT SET FOR LEVITT & SONS
description: Levitt & Sons Inc., the unprofitable former subsidiary of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, announced yesterday that I.T.T had agreed to pay it cash sums equal to the tax credits that Levitt would be able to claim if it were fully independent.

title: College President Named
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., Nov. 11 (AP)An educator with the United States Catholic conference in Washington will become the first lay president of the College of Our Lady of the Elms. He is Dr. Edward R. D'Alessio, 44 years old, of Alexandria, Va.

title: About Real Estate
description: SMITHTOWN, L.I.Delancey Street is coming to the suburbs, by way of the unexpected route known as business failure.

title: Justice Douglas Absent For Part of Arguments
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas, who was absent for part f the Court's morning arguments today, participated in only about 10 percent of the cases disposed of by written orders.

title: Beame Details New Plan To Cut 8,000 Employees
description: Mayor Beame yesterday disclosed some of the details of his plan to eliminate an additional 8,000 employees from the city payroll this year and announced further budget cuts that he said would cost the jobs of thousands more.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation has agreed to supply 144 million pounds of molten aluminum to the central foundry division of the General Motors Corporation over a fouryear period. The size of the contract was not disclosed. Deliveries will start next January.

title: Some Mary Popping Recipes
description: Here are two main dishes that Mary Poppins is said particularly to favor'A certain thriftiness in her character, it is said, disposes her especially toward Shepherd's Pie, which can be used for leftover roast beef. All the recipes appear in Mary Poppins's cookery book.

title: National Study of Busing Is Set By Federal Rights Commission
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)  The United States Civil Rights Commission said today that it would undertake a major public examination of busing and school desegregation over the next 10 month's.

title: Infant Is Now Well After Transfusion Fought by Parents
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., Nov. 11 (AP)The infant daughter of a couple who had fought against giving her a blood transfusion that doctors say saved her life left the hospital today.

title: About Education
description: Hillsdale College, a small private liberalarts college in Michigan, has taken a stand against what it regards as a potential Federal takeover of our campus by refusing to comply with a new regulation that, almost incidentally, contains the stipulation that if students receive Federal financial assistance, colleges will be regarded as a recipient of Federal funds.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Clerk's Day Off Results, In Licenseless Fridays,
description: PENNSAUKEN, Nov. 11 (AP)Residents of this Camden County community will not be able to obtain a marriage license, a bingo permit or dog tag on Fridays.

title: Deposit on Beer Sales Is Asked in U.S. Parks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)  The Environmental Protection Agency proposed today that vendors must charge a 5cent deposit on all beverage cans and bottles sold on Federal property, such as National Parks and military bases.

title: Out in Ford's Country
description: CLEVELAND, Ohio, Nov. 11President Ford has been betting for a long time that there is a conservative tide running in the country against excessive Government spending and bloated Government payrolls, and at least in this part of the country the evidence is on his side.

title: Master of Sport International
description: The Master of Sport International Class kept sticking a jab into the profile of the Merited Master of Sport in manner suggesting that there was nothing sacred left in the great, wide Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. Igor Vysotsky, the Master of Sport International Class, hopes to win the Olympic heavyweight championship in Montreal next summer and get his diploma as a Merited Master Sport, which for a boxer in the Soviet Union is like going to heaven without the inconvenience of dying. Meanwhile he is training with other members of Soviet team for a program of bouts with American amateurs Friday night in Madison Square Garden, and yesterday he was sharpening his jab on Anatoly Klimanov, amateur lightheavyweight champion of Europe, who was the middleweight champion in 1973. Those two European titles qualify Anatoly for the rank of Merited Master, the loftiest possible.

title: CONGRESS CALLS FOR REASSESSING OF U.S. ROLE IN U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Both houses of Congress today reacted to the General Assembly vote equating Zionism and racism by unanimously adopting resolutions calling for a reassessment of American relationship to the world body, and condemning the vote.

title: 57 Years Late, a Veteran Gets His Medals
description: FORT MONMOUTH, Nov. 11Former Sgt. George Krahnert blinked a couple of tears today but otherwise stood firm and erect as a fourstar general pinned over the breast pocket of his World War I infantry uniform the medals he had earned but not received 57 years ago.

title: Aggressive Bees Not Due in U.S. Until 1988 or Later
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 11 The head of a scientific team studying the Africanized honeybee, the aggressive insect that has been spreading northward through South America since its accidental introduction into Brazil in 1957, said today that it would probably not reach the United States until 1988 or the early 1990's.

title: The Stage
description: C.O.R.F.A.X. (Don't Ask), a science fiction musical about an invasion from outer space of a veterinarian's office, begins and ends with a striking comic coup de theatre.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: KATE THE GREAT Rather curiously, Cole Porter's biggest hit show is seldom revived these days, at least in this country, although the Kiss Me Kate songs remain popular staple on the nightlife scene. The Broadway original opened in 1951 to subilant reviews, ran for 1,077 performances and is still a repertory favorite in

title: Papua New Guinea Curbing Secessionist Bougainville
description: PORT MORESBY, Papua New Guinea, Nov. 11 (Reuters)The Papua New Guinea Government has banned unauthorized public processions and meetings in the main centers of the secessionist island of Bougainville, one of the world's richest copoer sources.

title: MRS. GINDHI CITES GAIN DURING CRISIS
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 11Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, in speech broadcast to the nation, Said tonight that India had made substantial economic and Social progress in the four and a half months since the Government declared a state of emerdency.

title: CONGRESS CALLS FOR REASSESSING OF U.S.ROLE IN U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 Both houses of Congress today reacted to the General Assembly vote equating Zionism and racism by unanimously adopting resolutions calling for a reassessment of American relationship to the world body and condemning the vote.

title: Fed's Default View Shifting
description: The danger that a New York City default would pose to financial markets and to the national and international economy has been moving top officials of the nation's central bank to a more sympathetic attiEconomic tude toward some Analysis form of Federal aid to New York. But this growing support of the Federal Reserve for New York's cause also results from and depends oncontinuing evidence that both the city and New York State are doing all they can to set their own fiscal affairs in order.

title: Gulf Ouits Auto Racing
description: LONDON, Nov. 11 (UPI)The Gulf Oil Company an nounced today that it was terminating its entire auto racing program. In nine years of racing, Gulfsponsored sports cars won 29 major races, including the Le Mans 24hours in 1968, 1969 and 1975. A statement said a major reason for the oil corn.: pany's withdrawal was the current uncertainity regarding the future of sports cars racing.

title: People and Business
description: The Saudi Arabian Oil Minister, Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, has given oil consumers encouraging news. He said in an interview published yesterday in The London Daily Telegraph that he expected crude oil prices, frozen until next June, to remain at present levels until the end of next year.

title: Extasin and Miserin
description: Trying or pretending to foretell the future has been a human failing since the earliest times. But futurologists have not always been too successful when peering into the crystal ball. In 1925, for example, Bertrand Russell pronounced that physical science is thus approaching the stage when will be complete and therefore uninteresting.

title: FARM WORKERS LEAD IN COAST ELECTIONS
description: FRESNO, Calif., Nov. II (AP) The United Farm Workers of America is lengthening its lead over the International Brotherhood of Teamsters in labor representation elections at California farms.

title: FORD CRITICIZES CONGRESS ON OIL
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 11President Ford, pressing for lastminute revision of evergy legislation, declared here) tonight that economic recovery was threatened by a shortage of determination in the Congress.

title: COLLISION SPILLS OIL INTO SEA OFF DOVER
description: DOVER, England, Wednesday, Nov. 12 (AP)A British warship and a Panamanian tanker collided in thick fog in the English Channel early today and about 3,000 tons of crude oil spilled into the sea, the coast guard here reported.

title: TOBACCO CONCERN WILL RAISE PRICES
description: The Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation, a subsidiary of the BritishAmerican Tobacco Company, said yesterday It was going along with the move to higher prices for cigarettes. The company said that efPrice fective tomorrow Changes it would raise list prices for its cigarette brands by 75 cents a thousand. This would amount to 1.5 cents a pack and was traced to higher costs. The company's brands include Kool, Viceroy, Bel Air, Raleigh and Du Maurier.

title: I.R.S. Rejects Applications Of A.T. & T. Over Discounts
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Corporation said yesterday the Internal Revenue Service had turned down its application to consider the discount applicable to shares purchased by stockholders through reinvested dividends declared nontaxable.

title: Battles Are Shaping Up Over Nursing Homes as Operators Threaten to Refuse Added Patients
description: A new round of legislative and courtroom battles is taking shape in the nursinghome field in New York State.

title: Jenkins Takes Riding Crown
description: Rodney Jenkins, acknowledged to be the greatest rider of jumpers in America gave the rest of the internationalists a lesson last night in Madison Square Garden as the National Horse Show closed an eightday run before an announced crowd of 9,500.

title: For Lisbon, the Parting With Angola Cuts Deep
description: LISBON, Nov. 11  Portugal has given independence to Angola, a colony for 500 years, but never has that land seemed so close.

title: 92 Festive Mood Wins Stuyvesant

title: Suburban Action Institute Denies It Is Near Collapse
description: Officials of Suburban Action Institute, a nonprofit organization that has sought to end zoning laws that have been a barrier to construction of low and moderate income housing in the suburbs, denied yesterday that the organization was near collapse.

title: Reagan Sets News Parley In Washington on Nov. 20
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 11 (AP) Ronald Reagan is expected to announce whether he is a candidate for the Republican presidential nomination at a Washington news conference Nov. 20. his office reported today.

title: 1,000 AT RALLY URGE U.S. TO BAR DEFAULT
description: Nearly 1,000 people gathered in Foley Square yesterday to urge approval of Federal aid in preventing a city default and to dramatize the determination of New Yorkers to weather the fiscal crisis.

title: ClintonP.AndersonDead; ExSenator WasinCabinet
description: Former United States Senator Clinton P. Anderson of New Mexico, who retired in 1972 following a long career in Congress and as Secretary of Agriculture, died yesterday at his home in Albuquerque. He was 80 years old.

title: I.L.O. HEAD HOPES U.S. WILL STAY IN
description: GENEVA, Nov. 11The head of the International Labor Organization expressed the hope today that the United States would cancel its twoyear notice of withdrawal before the United Nations agency would have to begin planning a cutback in its activities to meet the departure threat.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Board of Estimate is due to vote tomorrow on a lease for a new daycare center that could mean the difference between success or default for a federallysubsidized housing and community project in East Harlem, according to sponsors of the innovative and controversial complex. A $2.2million, 10year lease needed to assure the success of the Housing and Urban Development Administration's biggest project, one that has evolved criticism for its unusually luxury and other features.

title: Chile Expels a U.S. Priest Accused of Aiding Lettistsi
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 11 (UPI)An American priest ac cused of complicity with Chil ean leftists was expelled from the country tonight.

title: U.S. Labor Unit Fails to Seek Approval for Commercial Book
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Department of Labor has been actively seeking a commercial publisher for a Bicentennial history of the American worker, produced with department funds, without having applied for the necessary approval for such an undertaking from the Joint Committee on Printing.

title: Holiday Closings
description: The New York Cocoa Exchange, the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange and the Commodity Exchange Inc. were closed yesterday in observance of Veterans Day, There was no trading in government and agency bonds or foreign currencies because banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut were also closed.

title: 2 Synagogues and Homes FireBombed inBoro Park
description: Three buildingshousing two synagogues, the homes of two Hasidic rabbis and a religious schoolwere firebombed early yesterday morning in the Boro Park section of Brooklyn, where the police say there have been growing tensions between Hispanic youths and members of the Jewish community.

title: UNITED INCREASES BID FOR OTIS STOCK
description: The United Technologies Corporation increased its offer for shares of the Otis Elevator Company yesterday from $42 to $44 a share, and both companies announced that they had agreed to withdraw all legal proMerger ceedings related to News United Technologies offer. It appears that United will win its fight to control Otis, an event that hinges on United's purchase of a majority of Otis's 8.1 million outstanding shares, at a cost of about $178 million.

title: Turmoil Down Under
description: Australia has been plunged into both a political and constitutional crisis by the unprecedented action Governor General Sir John Kerr in dismissing Prime Minister Gough Whitlam, installing in his place the leader of the opposition, and dissolving both houses Parliament. It was the first time a Governor Generalnominally representative of the British Crown, though actually chosen by the Australian Governmenthad fired a Prime Minister since establishment of the Australian Commonwealth in 1901.

title: Mississippi Banker Bids Ford Assist New York
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 11The chairman of the largest chain of banks in Mississippi urged President Ford today to help New York City through its financial crisis.

title: Gillian Fuller Married Here

Fuller of Palm Beach, Fla., and New York, was married yesterday morning to Luis Eduardo Campello Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Campello of So Paulo, Brazil. The Rev. Alan L. Egly, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the Fullers apartment here. A reception was held at the St. RegisSheraton.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP) The Supreme Court agreed today to review a ruling that the Federal Power Commission may consider whether an increase in wholesale power rates would affect retail competition.

description: The long and grinding impasse over a lasting solution for the West Side Highway is generating new suspicion among those who favor a new superroad as a replacement and others who want no new road at all.

description: Annette Hunt, an actress  who has appeared most often in soap operas and commercials, began the serious study of singing six years ago and made her debut in that capacity a year ago in Carnegie Hall. Monday night, 364 days later, she returned to that hall for another zo.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Two influential conservative Republicans moved today toward support of Federal action to prevent a New York City default.

description: Now that a choiceless New York is being forced face cuts so deep and devastating that they will actually jeopardize the city's future, it is essential to ask whether these cuts are being made with a rationale beyond mere desperation. There is as yet little indication that administrative or organizational overhaul aimed at efficiency as well as economy has become a significant part of the process.

title: Heroin Seized in Texas

A spokesman at the agency's regional office here said the heroin was hidden in a dry compartment built inside the gasoline tank of a 1973 sedan. Authorities estimated the street value of the drugs at $11 million.

title: People and Business

title: The Screen: 'Stardust'
description: Jim MacLaine (David Essex), an English rock star, is bored, bored, bored. He's the most popular entertainer in England and America. He has a sweet, pretty French mistress, a wife so noble that she won't take money from him, and good chums in the members of his group who call themselves the Stray Cats. But happiness does not buy happiness.That seems to be the point of the terrible English movie, "Stardust," which opened yesterday at the Columbia I and other theaters. The film follows Jim's climb up the ladder to success with such solemnity you suspect it must be joking: "I'm tired of being locked up in planes and bathrooms, hiding from the people who've made me rich," Jim says in one of his bursts of annotated anguish. After all, he tells us without a flicker of a grin, all he's ever wanted to do was to write an opera deifying women.Unfortunately for us he does write that opera, which is also referred to as a rock symphony, and from what we see and hear of it, it seems that Jim has been cribbing from Radio City Music Hall's Easter stage show when the Rockettes dress up like nuns. It's awful. It's also an immense success, viewed by some 300 million people around the world by satellite. From the proceeds of that venture, Jim buys a castle in Spain, where his unhappiness knows no bounds."Stardust" is the sequel to an earlier English rock film, "That'll Be the Day," which also starred Mr. Essex and told the story of Jim MacLaine from his grubby beginnings until he bought his first electric guitar.Sometimes the story of Jim and the Stray Cats sounds as if it were meant to recall the rise of the Beatles. Sometimes it suggests the stories of other rock personalities. Mostly, though, it's just superficial claptrap, badly acted (except for Adam Faith, who plays Jim's manager), foolishly written and even more foolishly directed.

title: 3 Target Shooters Killed
