description: Lying a new udy show.ing a citywtae tentatvacancy rate of only 2.8 percent for apartments, the city's Rent Commissioner said yesterday that our housing shortage still exists and that rent controls are needed for the next three years.

title: Stocks on Amex Show Big Gain; Counter Issues Up in Heavy Day
description: Rising for the sixth consecutive session, prices on the American Stock Exchange yesterday showed the largest daily gain since midSeptember as volume was the heaviest in nearly four months. Prices also increased sharply in extremely active trading in the overthecounter market.

title: Arabs Will Boycott Ships Sailing Suez Canal to Israel
description: DAMASCUS, Syria. Nov. 12 (UPI)The Arab League's boycott office announced today that it would blacklist foreign vessels that passed through the Suez Canal with goods for Israel.

title: Appellate Court Stays Return Of 4 Sisters to Natural Mother
description: The Appellate Division late yesterday evening granted stay until Dec. 1 of the return of four young sisters from their foster parents to their natural mother.

title: A SPENDING CURB VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The House of Representatives, in a major step toward asserting Congressional control over the budget, voted today to impose a $373.9 billion ceiling on Federal spending in the current fiscal year, leaving a $72.1 billion deficit.

title: Witness in Fromme Trial Says She Asked Him to Kill
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 12A former mental patient from Pennsylvania testified today that Lynette Alice Fromme had asked him to kill William R. Roesch, president of the Kaiser Steel Corporation, and his wife, and to cover their bodies with pink paint.

title: An Era Ends
description: As a good judge should, William O. Douglas assessed the facts, applied them to the issue at handhis ability to discharge his duties on the Supreme Courtand gave what must have been the most distressing judgment his long and illustrious judicial career. He has informed President Ford that the sheer physical pain he now endures prevents him from carrying his share of the Court's workload.

title: Rainstorm Here Sets A Record for the Date
description: A rainsform that caused sporadic flooding and extensive rushhour traffic tieups hit the metropolitan area yesterday afternoon, drenching the city with more than 1.7 inches of rain.

title: Chase Bahrain Bank Burns
description: BAHRAIN, Nov. 12 (AP)fire gutted the Chase Manhattan Bank's main branch and an adjacent travel agency here today.

title: Senate Panel, 85, Rejects Ford Choice for Bank Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The Senate Banking Committee voted today to kill President Ford's nomination of Ben B. Blackburn, a former Representative from Georgia, to head the Federal Home Loan Bank Board.

title: Television
description: Liza Minnelli is a guest of Mac Davis on his special, on Channel 4 at 8 P.M.

title: Personal Finance: Insurance Units Back New Payroll Deduction Plan
description: Payroll deductions for bank savings accounts have long been available to many corporate employees. Similar deductions from weeky or monthly paychecks have also been available to purchase Savings Bonds or company stock and to participate in contributory pension and profitsharing plans.

title: U.S. Inquiry Discovers An Earlier Investigation
description: The United States Attorney in Brooklyn and the District Attorney in Nassau County each discovered to his surprise yesterday that the other was investigating a major automobile leasing company charged with turning back the mileage indicators on the used cars it sold.

title: RARE HEART SURGERY KEEPS INFANT ALIVE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 12 (UPI)Christopher Wall Jr. is only three months old, but he already has made medical historyand could continue to make it.

title: 3d ExAide of Gulf Is Given Immunity
description: Judge John J. Sirica granted immunity to Arthur V. Harris to give a sworn statement to Federal investigators reviewing more than $5 million in Gulf contributions between 1960 and 1972.

title: Stern Seeks Zionism Plaza As Name for a U.N. Block
description: Councilman Henry J. Stern announced yesterday that he would introduce legislation in the City Council today to rename a block of the United Nations Plaza Zionism Plaza.

title: Beame Calls for City Rally In Times Square Nov. 24
description: Mayor Beame, in an effort o raise the spirits of the city, called yesterday on New Yorkrs and their friends to take part in a rally in Times Square on Nov. 24.

title: Dance: Lead for Tippet
description: Clark Tippet, a soloist in American Ballet Theater, took over the leading role in Raymonda on Tuesday night at the Uris Theater. Anyone who has noticed Mr. Tippet rise from the ranks in the last three years would not have been surprised that his first try at this production's role of Jean de Brienne was as superb as it was.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Ninety persons have been indicted in a crackdown on alleged welfare fraud, the Burlington County Prosecutor's office announced today. The suspects were accused cheating the county out of a total of $116,000 in welfare funds. The amount of money obtained illegally by individual suspects was said to have ranged from $1,200 $9.100.

title: Clinton Boasts Harvest of Quarterbacks
description: While some of DeWitt Clinton's football players try to learn how to stop a single wing and others are involved in an informal scrimmage, three athletes practice alone. The three are Clinton's quarterbacks, preparing for Saturday's Public Schools Athletic  League semifinal game with New Dorp at 1 P.M. at Clinton's field in the Bronx.

title: Zionism and Racism
description: Asian and African states that supported the United Nations resolution equating Zionism with racism acted the way they did not out of fear of Arab threats or blackmail, nor for love of Arab gold. They were simply giving a legal and concrete form to their longheld view of the Zionist state.

title: I.T.T. Profit Down 26.6%; Dividend Lifted 2c, to 40c
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reported yesterday a decline of 26.6 percent in thirdquarter net income as sales edged ahead of the yearago level by only 0.1 per cent.

title: Catholic Bishop Named
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 12 (AP)Msgr. Amedee W. Froulx was ordained today as Maine's auxiliary Roman Catholic bishop becoming the first FrancoAmerican elevated to the episcopacy in the Diocese of Portland. Humberto Cardinal Medeiros. Archbishop of Boston, was presiding prelate in the nearly two hour ceremony in the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 13, 1975

title: Byrne Warns Democratic Legislators Only Income Tax Can Solve Fiscal Crisis
description: TRENTON, Nov. 12Governor Byrne told Democratic legilative leaders today that New Jersey faced the biggest deficit in its fiscal history and reiterated his belief that only a state income tax could help resolve it.

title: Sunken Ore Boat Leaking Heavy Oil; Spill No Problem
description: SAULT ST. MARIE, Mich., Nov. 12Heavy black oil has begun to leak from the Edmund Fitzgerald, the ore boat that sank Monday night with 29 men aboard.

title: Gov. Livingston Is Called Bypassed Hero
description: An 18month international search for documents may elevate an oftenoverlooked Founding Father of the country to a place alongside his betterknown colleagues of the Continental Congress and the Constitutional Convention.

title: Final Offer
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 12 (AP)1 Tentative agreement was reached tonight between the union representing striking tugboat crews and tugboat companies in the port of Baltipore, apparently ending a monthlong walkout by 125 crewmen here.

title: DEMOCRATS FIGHT FOR SUFFOLK JOB
description: HAUPPAUGE, LI., Nov. 12Just a week after winning a majority in the 18member Suffolk County Legislature for the first time, Democrats here are fighting over the choice of its next presiding officer, a significant patronage position.

title: Douglas Quits Supreme Court; Ford Hails 36Year Service
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.12William O. Douglas retired from the Supreme Court today because of his failing health, ending a record 36 term on the Court as one of the nation's most adamantand controversialdefenders of the liberal view of the Constitution.

title: Notes on People
description: A December wedding is planned by Mary Elizabeth Hanford, a member of the Federal Trade Commission since 1973, and Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, National Republican Chairman from 1971 to 1973. Announcing the engagement yesterday, Miss Hanford declined to disclose a date or location for the wedding, as did members of her family in Salisbury. N.C.

title: 4 CONTENDERS ASK A SINGLE PRIMARY
description: Four candidates for the Democraticc nomination for President urged Governor Carey yesterday to ask the Legislature at a special session to abolish the April 6 primary for the election of Presidential delegates and to hold one spring primary for this and for nomination for publi office.

title: Unilever Net Gains 8.9%
description: The Unilever Group, the largest nonoil company outside the United States, reported an 8.9 percent increase in its thirdquarter net income yesterday, compared with the 1974 period. Sales for the quarter were up 8.8 percent.

title: The Menninger Clinic, A Farmhouse in 1925, Now a World Center
description: TOPEKA, KaniIn 1908, 46yearold Kansas country doctor journeyed from Topeka to Rochester, Minn., to observe the thenrevolutionary practice of group medicine at a place known as the Mayo Clinic.

title: LEVITT RULES OUT LOAN TO YONKERS
description: YONKERS, Nov. 12State Comptroller Arthur Levitt today rejected a tentatively arranged $35 million loan to Yonkers, but said other sources of funds might be available by Friday, when the city faces default.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Dressing Up for Charity and a Show
description: So many women, said Lauren Peltz, recoiling a little at the entrance to the dining room at the St. Regis Roof.

title: Truckers Get Rate Rise
description: ALBANY, Nov. 12 State Transportation Commissioner Raymond T. Schuler today approved a 2 percent rate increase, effective Monday, for 100 trucking companies that operate in the metropolitan New York area and the lower Hudson River Valley. The truckers are members of the Middle Atlantic Motor Carrier Conference.

title: Madrid Press, in Unusual Move, Denounces Ministry Crackdown
description: MADRID, Nov. 12Despite the imminent change in the Spanish regime, the police have been dealing in their customarily tough way with what have been considered threats to the Government.

title: 28MILLION ADDED TO STADIUM COST
description: NEWARK, Nov. 12  The treasurer of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority said today that the cost of building the football stadium for the, New York Giants and a race track in the Hackensack Meadowlands could cost $28 million more than the anticipated $302 million.

title: F.D.A. Considering Rules On Egg and Chicken Colors
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration is considering rules to let consumers know that the skins of some chickens and the yolks of some eggs may be colored to make them appear more yellow, it was learned today.

title: Three Socialists Resign From San Marino Cabinet
description: SAN MARINO, Nov. 12 (UPI)  Three Socialist ministers have resigned from San Marino's coalition Cabinet in a Government crisis in the world's smallest republic.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Wednesday.

title: MATHEWS YIELDS TO HOUSE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12F. David Mathews, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, turned subpoenaed hospital certification documents over to a House investigating subcommittee today, averting a possible contempt of Congress citation.

title: Wallace Opens 1976 White House Drive
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 12Making official what had been a foregone conclusion for months, GOV. George C. Wallace announced here today that he would seek the Democratic nomination for President in 1976.

title: LEVITT RULES OUT LOAN TO YONKERS
description: YONKERS, Nov. 12State Comptroller Arthur Levitt today rejected a tentatively arranged $35 million loan to Yonkers, but said other sources of funds might be available by Friday, when the city faces default.

title: Experts Consider Caring Society
description: Do people care any more about what kind of world they live in? Or about the sufferings of somebody down the street or across the globe? Arc Americans so desensitized to cruelty and violence that they are no longer outraged by it? Or moved to show kindness?

title: Ford Considers Woman For the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12President Ford is actively considering appointing a woman to succeed Justice William O. Douglas on the Supreme Court, according to highly placed Administration sources.

title: Justice Used Dissent as Effective Tool
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12Associate Justice William O. Douglas, who retired today after serving longer on the nation's highest court than any man in history, has often been the Supreme Court's heretic, and survived to see his heresy become conventional wisdom.

title: 139 ESCAPE DC10 AFIRE AT KENNEDY
description: An Overseas National Airways jumbo jet was destroyed by fire and explosion at Kennedy International Airport yesterday after it struck a flock of birds on its takeoff roll, dropped a flaming engine and was braked to a screeching halt partly off the pavement.

title: SAKHAROV DENIED VISA TO GET PRIZE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 12Soviet authorities, citing a danger to the country's security, today denied Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident advocate of human rights, permission to travel to Oslo on Dec. 10 to receive his Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Taft Hotel Can't Pay Mortgage; Court Names Wagner Receiver
description: The Taft, one of the largest hotels in the Times Square area, went into receivership yesterday.

title: Trip by Ford to China Expected on Dec. 1 to 4
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (AP)The White House is expected to announce tomorrow that President Ford will visit China from Dec. 1 to Dec. 4 and make oneday stops in Indonesia and the Philippines on his way home.

title: Lines of Israeli Settlements in Occupied Areas Are Said to Reflect Plans for Borders
description: YAMIT, IsraeliOccupied Sinai, Nov. 5  The first 23 families have moved into their prefabricated homes, the school population has doubled in a month, to 22 students, and the first edition of the twopage mimeographed newspaper has hit the stands.

title: HOUSE OF LORDS DEFIES COMMONS
description: LONDON, Nov. 12  The House of Lords, in a rare act of defiance on a major bill.. has temporarily blocked a Government proposal to restore to British unions the freedom to organize closedshops.

title: Jersey's 1776 Governor Termed Bypassed Hero
description: An 18month international search for documents may elevate an oftenoverlooked Founding Father of the country to a place alongside his betterknown colleagues of the Continental Congress and the Constitutional Convention.

title: Architect Tells Jai Alai Inquiry He Inflated His Bill
description: NEWINGTON, Conn.. Nov. 12 The architect who designed the $14 million Bridgeport jaialai fronton now under investigation told the State Gaming Commission hearings here today how he had been instructed to inflate his bills by $200,000.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975 by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: Planned Closing of 3 Centers Dismays the Elderly
description: Most of the elderly people who spend their weekdays at the Shalom Senior Citizens Center in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn reacted with dismay yesterday to news that Mayor Beame's latest budget cuts called for closing their facility, along with two other centers for the elderly.

title: Bomb Kills 1, Injures 15 In London Restaurant
description: LONDON, Nov. 12A bomb killed a man and injured 15 people tonight in one of London's bestknown restaurants.

title: POTATO FUTURES EXTEND DECLINES
description: Maine potato futures extended their losses yesterday for the third session this week. The May delivery dropped the new 75point limit on the New York Mercantile Exchange and closed at 9.93 cents a pound, down from 10.68.

title: Boone Helps Stars Put Nets to Rout, 134 to 114
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 12 (AP)Utah snapped a fivegame losing streak tonight as Ron Boone scored 35 points to lead the Stars to a 134114 American Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets.

title: Rizzo Aide Latest Indicted in Philadelphia Prosecutor's Inquiry
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 12When Walter M. Phillips Jr. was asked to become this city's special prosecutor last year, with a mandate to investigate the police and the municipal government, most of his friends advised against it

title: Hostages Freed in Tunis After Gunman Is Seized
description: TUNIS, Nov. 12 (AP)A 34yearold bartender who had been holding three persons hostage in the Belgian Embassy for nearly 36 hours put his submachine gun down while making a telephone call last night, and a policeman dashed in and overpowered him.

title: U.S., IN U.N., ASKS ALL LANDS TO END POLITICAL JAILING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 12The United States, in a move that many delegates viewed as a counter to the General Assembly's branding of Zionism as racism, introduced a draft resolution today that would urge governments around the world to release all political prisoners.

title: imports of Crude Oil Showed Advance for Week
description: Domestic reliance on imported petroleum products increased in the week ended Nov. 7 and was running quite bit ahead of the yearago level, the American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday.

title: Breakthrough?
description: Encouraging signals from the White House late yesterday point toward a decisive breakthrough in New York's long uphill battle for fiscal survival.

title: FRANCO'S DOCTORS STEM NEW BLEEDING
description: MADRID, Nov. 12Generalissimo Francisco Franco appeared tonight to have survived another crisis in his threeweek fight against death when internal bleeding recurred and was brought under control with drugs.

title: Health Assayed
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 12A key issue in Gov. George C. Wallace's candidacy for the Presidency of the United States, which he announced here today, will revolve around questions about the 56yearold paraplegic's physical abilities in campaigning and then serving, if elected.

title: The Library Lions Get Mudpacks as Part of the Full Beauty Treatment
description: The 64  year  old marble lions at the New York Public Librarypockmarked by pollutionreceived their first whiskerstotail mudpacks yesterday as part of a beauty treatment they are scheduled to receive over the next three weeks.

title: Cards Game Sold Out
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 12 (AP)The St. Louis Cardinals announced today that Sunday's National Football League game against the Washington Redskins was a sellout and that the television blackout in the St. Louis area would be lifted.

title: Mexican Accident Kills 13
description: MONTERREY, Mexico, Nov. 12 (AP)Authorities said today that 13 persons were killed and at least 20 injured just outside Monterrey when a string of runaway railroad cars filled with gravel overturned yesterday on squatters shacks beside the tracks.

title: U,S., IN U,N., ASKS ALL LANDS TO END POLITICAL JAILING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 12The United States, in a move that many delegates viewed as a counter to the General Assembly's branding of Zionism as racism, introduced a draft resolution today that would urge governments around the world to release all political prisoners.

title: Senate Panel, 85, Rejects Ford Choice for Bank Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The Senate Banking Committee voted today to kill President Ford's nomination of Ben B. Blackburn, a former Representative from Georgia, to head the Federal Home Loan Bank Board.

title: George E. O'Connor, 82. Led Mohawk Paper Mills
description: George E. O'Connor, founder in 1931 and chairman of Mohawk Paper Mills Inc., of Cohoes, N,Y., died yesterday in the Albany Medical Center. He was 82 years old and lived in Waterford, N.Y.

title: $250,000 to MacDowell To Mark Copland's Day
description: The Norlin Foundation has made a grant of $250,000 to the MacDowell Colony in Peterborough, N.H., to help celebrate the 75th birthday of Aaron Copland.

title: Kennedy Bomb Suspect Dies
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Nov.; 12 (UPI)Richard Paul Pav the man accused of plotting to turn himself into a human bomb to kill John F. Kennedy, in 1960, died yesterday at the Veterans Administration Hospital. He was 88 years old. Mr. Pavlick, a foe mer postal worker, spent six years in county jails, Federal prisons and finally, the New Hampshire State Mental Hospital, for allegedly threatening the life of Mr. Kennedy, then Presidentelect, in Palm Beach, Fla., in December 1960. Mr. Pavlick was released from the mental hospital in Decem

title: TAXFREE ISSUES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Prices of taxexempt issues, the sector of the credit markets that has ben battered for months, rose yesterday amid reports of improved prospects: of Federal action to avert 0 New York City default. A lot of Credit people feel better Markets now, one municipal trader commented about noon, following the report that Federal officials are studying a plan that would prevent default by the city.

title: Rumsfeld Refuses to Rule Out Leaving Pentagon for Politics
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 12 Donald H. Rurnsfeld assured the Senate Armed Services Committee today that as Secretary of Defense he would be totally dedicated to a strong defense posture but left open the possibility that he would leave the Pentagon post if offered the Republican VicePresidential nomination..

title: CONGRESS, FORD REACH AN ACCORD ON PRICING OF OIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 Congress and the Ford Administration reached agreement today on a longterm national policy for regulating the price of crutie oil produced in the United States.

title: Imetal Consent Decree Spurs Copperweld Deal
description: In a more that appears to clear the way for its acquisition of the Copperweld Corporation, Socit Imetal yesterday enteed into a consent decree in a suit against it by Ohio which has held up Imetal's $111 milMerger lion offer for the News giant metal products company. As a result, Imetal said, the state's action has been dismissed. Imetal said its offer to buy Copperweld securities would be mailed to all Copperweld shareholders be ginning today. The offer will remain open until 5 P.M. Dec. 1, (metal said.

title: Motherhood in Art: A Critical Appraisal
description: While a somber drawing of Margaret Sanger, the birth control pioneer, stared down from the dais, the refrains of the rock song You're Having My Baby wafted through a New York Sheraton mntei meeting room the other day

title: Wallace Opens 1976 White House Drive
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 12Making official what had been a foregone conclusion for months, Gov. George C. Wallace announced here today that he would seek the Democratic nomination for President in 1976.

title: Axelson Infuses City Affairs With Business Expertise
description: The thing I don't understand is how complicated the city has become since Sept. 15, Deputy Mayor Kenneth S. Axelson, two months removed from the executive inner sanctum of the J. C. Penney Company was saying.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12Congress and the Administration began today to consider possible response's to the United Nations General Assembly vote on Monday classifying Zionism as racism.

title: 4 ACCUSED BY CITY OF $300,000 FRAUD
description: The theft of $300,000 in welfare checks that were forged and cashed through business bank accounts resulted yesterday in the arrest of two men and two women, including a Welfare Department clerk.

title: NEWS AND GUILD RESUME TALKS
description: Negotiators for The Daily News and the Newspaper Guild of New York resumed bargaining yesterday on a new contract following agreement Tuesday on a new threeyear contract between the guild and The New York Times.

title: MailOrder Officials Defend Practices at Hearing Here
description: Should the tens of millions of Americans whose mail brings unsolicited fliers and brochures have a statutory right to have their names struck from the mailing lists?

title: Track Retains Ban on 3
description: With liedetector results in its possession, Roosevelt Raceway decided yesterday to continue its ban against three of harness racing's top moneywinning drivers. The track in Westbury, L. I., cites business judgment a the reason for maintaining the lockout against Ben Webster, William (Buddy) Gilmour and Ken McNutt. All three were given what management calls terminaion notices last Sept. 29 in connection with a suspicious Sept. 18 exacta race at Roosevelt.

title: Douglas Quits Supreme Court; Ford Hails 36Year Service
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12William O. Douglas retired from the Supreme Court today because of his failing health, ending a record 36year term on the Court, as one of the nation's most adamantand controversialdefenders of the liberal view of the Constitution. His retirement was announced at 5 P.M., several

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 13, 1975

title: Resolution on Bribery Is Passed by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (AP)The Senate passed today a resolution that calls for all end to bribery and other unethical practices in both governmental and private dealings with foreign countries.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times on Nov. 4 about Dr. Alice Paul, founder of the National Woman's Party, erred in stating that she was near destitution. The National Woman's Party has never refused aid to Dr. Paul and in fact has pledged to insure Mrs. Paul's comfortable maintenance for the rest of her life in the event that her existing personal resources become exhausted.

title: Irresistible Sculptures by Di Suyero
description: Nothing quite like the current exhibition of sculptures by Mark di Suvero has ever happened to the five borvaghs of New York City. Quite apart from the quality of the work, there is the quality of the collective involvement. All over the city people have given not only their time and their resources but also an unstinting emotional support. Feelings for or against modern art have nothing to do with it; the work, like the man, has prompted a personal commitment that can be detected as much in the Seatrain Shipbuilding Yards in Brooklyn, which has given Mr. di Suvero all possible technical assistance, as in the telephone calls to the Whitney Museum from people who had happened on one of the sculptures somewhere In the city and just couldn't wait to get on the line and say Thank you.

title: Olympians Warned On Amateur Code
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, Nov. 12 (UPI)Lord Killanin, president of the International Olympic Committee, has warned that the Olympic rule defining amateurism would be strictly policed at both Innsbruck and Montreal.

title: SAKHAROV DENIED VISA TO GET PRIZE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 12Soviet authorities, citing a danger to the country's security, today denied Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident advocate of human rights, permission to travel to Oslo on Dec. 10 to receive his Nobel Peace Prize.

description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. MONDAT THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARK T 339001 WESTLRESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (941)WHITE PLAINS 94300; NASSAU CO. ($161 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. MN 649.1800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Goldin Lists 700 Concerns Billing City, but Out of State
description: City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin yesterday released a list of 700 outofstata businesses that have contracts with the city totaling $1.9 billion, as part of the continuing effort to dramatize the wideranging effects of a city default.

title: 2 States Study Woman's Death Day After She Was Raped Here
description: A twostate inquiry was under way yesterday into the death of a Westfield, N. J., woman, who charged she had been kidnapped Saturday night in Times Square and raped by three men in a Lower East Side apartment.

title: MOZAMBIQUE MOVE IN ANGOLA FORECAST
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 12 (Reuters)Wellplaced Mozambican sources said here today that Mozambique would send troops to help the newly proclaimed People's Republic in Luanda in its war against a rival Angolan regime.

title: Fed to Reconsider Rule On Banks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (AP) Federal Reserve Board announced yesterday it was reconsidering its authority for bank holding companies to engage in automobile leasing.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Carter's Lawyers See Blackmail

title: Gibbon Scholars See Parallels Between Rome's Decline and Present Condition of U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12In the Bicentennial season, scholars commemorate not only the birth and rise of the American Republic but also of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: The fourth and final play of the New York Shakespeare Festival's season at the Vivian Beaumont Theater in Lincoln Center will be The Threepenny Opera, Joseph Papp, the festival's founderproducer, announced yesterday. This will replace the previously announced Peer Gynt.

title: Johannesburg Guard Guilty
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 12 (Reuters)David Protter, a 26yearold former security guard at the Israeli Consulate here, was convicted of murdering an Israeli official during a daylong Consulate siege in April and was sentenced to 25 years. His brother Charles, an accomplice, was ordered to serve 30 months.

title: Uniroyalal Cuts Its Dividend
description: Uniroyal Inc. announced yesterday that it had cut the dividend of its common stock to 12 cents a share from 17 cents, payable Dec. 29 to shareholders of record Nov. 24. Along with the dividend announcement, the company revised downward its 1975 earnings forecast to $24 milliona result of feorignexchange losses of $5 million.

title: Hawks
description: After having lost eight of their previous 10 games, the New York Rangers could be thankful for small favors. They received two last night at Madison Square Garden: a 44 tie with the Chicago Black Hawks and the arrival of Carol Vadnais, the defenseman acquired from the Boston Bruins last Friday.

title: Jacques Loussier And Trio Perform Bach in Jazz Style
description: There is a certain sort of sensibility that is actively appalled by the very notion of popularizing Bachor any classical composer, for that matter. This listener's sensibility is one of those, and so he found the Tuesday evening performance at a sparsely attended Carnegie Hall by the Jacques Loussier Trio tiresome and offensive.

title: Church Council Dispute
description: The Family of Man award to President Ford last week by the Council of Churches of the City of New York touched off a conflict that could have longrange effects.

title: Creole Petroleum In Venezuela Pact
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 12 (AP)The Creole Petroletan Corporation, a subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation, has signed an agreement with the Venezuelan Government awarding the company $476 I, million in compensation for naItionalized assets, a company lsookesman said today.

title: Palestinians Aid Ceasefire in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 12. About 4 o'clock this afternoon, a group of Lebanese Moslems armed with automatic rifles set, up a barricade on a boulevard here about a half mile from the headquarters of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Fire in Louisiana Kills 2 Boys
description: LAFAYETTE, La., Nov. 12 (AP)Two children burned to death in a fire that destroyed their frame home last night. Fire Chief Wayne Trejean identified the victims as Ransom Francis Jr., 7, and Mark Francis, 4, sons of Mrs. Mary Lee Francis.

title: 33 NOBEL WINNERS IN BID ON SAKHAROV
description: Thirtythree Nobel Prize winners have sent a cable to President Nikolai V. Podgorny, of the Soviet Union, asking him to permit Andrei D. Sakharov Ito receive the 1975 Nobel Peace (Prize in Oslo, Norway, on Dec. 10.

title: Utah State Sues Merrill Lynch Firm For a Second Time
description: OGDEN, Utah, Nov. 12 (UPI) Utah State University, loser of $2 million in illegal stock deals, filed another suit yesterday against the giant Wall Street brokerage firm of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc.

title: Bridge
description: If asked to nominate the world's most elaborate published system, most experts would select Benito Garozzo's SuperPrecision. However the Italian superstar, who rarely lets go a title once he is in possession, has just lost this particular claim to fame. His successor is Dr. George Rosenkranz of Mexico City, whose masterly work Win with Romex has just been published here by Crown. It has 401 pages and costs $9.95.

title: Knicks Inundated With Advice
description: The plight of the Knicks has the fans annoyed and concerned. New York's five straight losses on its recent trip, all by overwhelming margins, and their 38 wonlost record have made the Knicks the topic of conversation throughout the city.

title: CAREY CALLS LEGISLATURE, CITING A SIGNAL THAT FORD EASES STAND ON CITY HELP

Grant Company, which entered Chapter XI bankruptcy proceedings on Oct. 2, reportedly will propose that Grant pay off in full $24 million of inventory lien obligations to debenture holders and offer merchandise creditors with liens 66.7 per cent of their $90million in claims.

description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 12  The Government, of Israel and the World Zionist Organization announced today that world Jewish leaders would meet in Jerusalem later this month to consider means of countering the resolution of the United Nations General Assembly defining Zionism as a form of racism.

description: BOSTON, Nov. 12 (AP) Treasury agents today arrested nine persons on charges of illegally selling pistols, shotguns, rifles and machine guns.

title: ALGERIA PRESSES SPAIN ON SAHARA
description: MADRID, Nov. 12President Houari Boumediene of Algeria sent an urgent message to the Spanish Government today in an apparent effort to head off a possible agreement by Spain to hand over its Saharan territory to Morocco.

title: Guess Who Came to Ali's Book Party?
description: He was promoting his book the way he promotes his fights, with his presence. But not as loudly. In his best subdued brown suit and his best subdued manner, Muhammad Ali was on display in the Rainbow Grill on the 65th floor of the RCA Building at a cocktail party his Random House publishers had arranged to introduce The Greatest, My Own Story, the world heavyweight champion's autobiography. Outside, the dazzle of the lights of the city below had replaced the glow of a pink sunset. Muhammad Ali was autographing copies of his boot( when husky man in a red suit moved through the crowd around the champion. Here comes Joe Frazier, somebody announced. Joe Frazier's here. For five years, whenever Muhammad Ali saw Joe Frazier, he usually would shout. Joe Fraaazieeer, get me Joe Fraaazieeer. But after three fights that were a tribute to the glory their manhood, they are linked in history, like Cain and Abel, Dempsey and Tunney, Louis and Conn. They have mutual respect that no one else can share. And now, instead of shouting or posturing as Joe Frazier approached, Muhammad Ali showed that respect by doing something that he had never done before. Muhammad Ali turned away, ducked and covered his head with his hands. But quickly, he turned back and smiled. Joe Frazier was smiling, too.

title: Quebec Considers Olympic TakeOver
description: QUEBEC, Nov. 12 (AP)The Quebec Government will announce within a few days whether it will take over administration of the Olympic Games construction from the city of Montreal, SolicitorGeneral Fernand Lalonde said today.

title: India Frees Ailing Critic of Mrs. Gandhi
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 12Jaya Prakash Narayan, the 73yearold opposition leader who was imprisoned by the Government nearly five months ago, has been released on parole because of his seriously declining health, official sources said tonight.

title: Grand Circuit to Present Gala Bicentennial Slate
description: Harness racing's Grand Circuit, the oldest organization in American sports, will observe its 105th year of operation next season with a Bicentennial schedule at 21 tracks in 10 states and two Canadian provinces. The schedule, announced yesterday by William Hayes 2d of Du Quoin, Ill., the group's president, will offer 136 days of stakes races for 2yearold and 3yearold trotters and pacers. It opens on April 2 at Pompano Park in Pompano Beach, Fla., and closes at the same track Dec. 25.

title: Terry Garthwaite, Back In City, at the Bottom Line

But that group broke up in 1973, and Wednesday night Miss Garthwaite returned to New York for the first time in four years for a fournight run at the Bottom Line, opening for Muddy Waters.

title: 28 DayCare Centers in City Face Closing
description: Children in the 28 daycare centers that will be closed next Jan. 1 due to the city's latest round of budget cuts will be transferred to other programs in their neighborhoods as services are consolidated and more than 2,000 staff positions eliminated, according to the Agency for Child Development.

title: U.N. Assembly's Chief Apologizes for Remark
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Nov. 13The President of the United Nations General Assembly, Prime Minister Gaston Thorn of Luxembourg, apologized today for what he said was an error in making public a statement Tuesday criticizing the resolution branding Zionism form of racism as harmful to the United Nations. Mr. Thorn said he had made the statement as a Luxembourg politician, not as Assembly President as it had first appeared.

title: NEW RULES ISSUED ON PAPAL ELECTION
description: ROME, Nov. 13Pope Paul VI today issued new rules for the election of his successors, largely affirming procedures that had been used for 800 years.

title: CHARGES DROPPED IN ATTICA DEATHS
description: Murder charges against three leaders of the 1971 Attica prison rebellion were dismissed yesterday by a State Supreme Court justice in Buffalo.

title: Surgeons at Jacobi Hospital Stage an 8Hour Sickout
description: Fifteen resident surgeons at Jacobi Hospital in the Bronx yesterday halted all surgery by calling in sick to protest the closing of a 37bed surgical ward. But the sickout which began at 7 A.M., ended at about 3 P.M. after hospital officials agreed to hire additional nursing personnel and open 25 beds in the ward.

title: A STUDY ABSOLVES MATH FACULTIES; Recent Drop in Test Scores Is Laid to Broad Societal Pressure, N Teaching
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 13A study of the way mathematics is taught in the American public schools concludes that recent declines in mathematics test scores are not caused by faulty teaching but are a result of other factors that have caused similar nationwide declines in reading. social studies and science test scores.

title: FORD CHOICE LOSES SAFETY BOARD POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)The Senate Commerce Committee killed today the nomination of Isabel A. Burgess for a second term on the National Transportation Safety Board, dealing President Ford his third defeat over a nomination.

title: FRANCO CONTINUES IN A CRITICAL STATE
description: MADRID, Nov. 13  Generalissimo Francisco Franco continued in critical condition today after further internal hemorrhaging in addition to kidney failure and congested lungs.

title: Major Reforms Proposed For State Medicaid Plan
description: TRENTON, Nov. 13  The Byrne administration proposed today major reforms of New Jersey's Medicaid program for nursing homes to eliminate abuses involving profiteering and the neglect an shoddy care of their aged patients.

title: GUNFIRE DISRUPTS BEIRUT CEASEFIRE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 13After a new wave of kidnappings yesterday, many residents here awoke this morning to the sound of gunfire in the streets, and by midmorning the whole city knew that two armed men had been killed at the airport in a gun battle with Government troops as a result, fewer people left their homes than in recent days. By midafternoon, the only movement in the streets of many areas of the city and its suburbs was by cats prowling among piles of garbage.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Ford's 4Day China Visit To Exclude Sightseeing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP)  President Ford will make a fourday visit to Peking next month that be stripped of sightseeing features, the White House announced today.

title: Slaying of 15 in Honduras Heightens Rural Tensions
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Nov. 11At least 15 landless peasants were killed in western Honduras last weekend, bringing new tensions between the country's conservative landowners and the highly politicized peasant movement.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Norton Morgenthal of Scarsdale, N.Y., former head the management information division of the Board of Education's Office of Planning, was indicted yesterday by Kings County grand jury on a conflictofinterest charge. He was accused of having accepted a trip to Miami for himself and his family from the Computer Specifics Corporation, a company doing business with the board. If convicted, he faces a year in jail and a fine.

title: MAN FOUND SLAIN ON EAST 67TH ST.
description: A man about 50 years old was found stabbed to death in his apartment on the East Side last night, the police reported.

title: New Japan Steel Cuts Force
description: TOKYO, Nov. 13 (UPI)New Japan Steel, the country's largest steel maker, will eliminate 3,000 employees, or about 4 percent, from its work force by attrition, company officials said today. A company spokesman I said the decision resulted from declining demand for steel.

title: Potash Maker Opposes Saskatchewan TakeOver
description: The largest producer of pot ash in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan the International Minerals end Chemical Corporation, said yesterday that it intends to pursue every possible alternative to the provincial government's announcement Wednesday that it would nationalize some or all of the province's extensive potash industry.

title: GOVERNOR PRESSES PLAN ON DEFAULTS: AND GAP IN BUDGET.
description: ALBANY, Nov. 13Governor Carey will ask the Legislature tomorrow to appropriate $S0 million to help keep the Housing Finance Agency from defaulting during the day on $130 million in bond anticipation notes.

title: Ford Ponders Oil Bill
description: President Ford is reported to have told Republican leaders that he has not decided whether he would sign or veto the compromise Congressional energy bill. Page 14.

title: State Sponsoring Of Higher Education
description: Is it not time openly and publicly to reexamine the way in which higher education in New York State is supported? The range of opportunities that only a complex of university centers, colleges and community colleges can offer must continue to be available to citizens in all regions of our state. Only full state sponsorship of university centers and senior colleges can make this possible.

title: Carter Moved to a New Prison After Blackmail
description: Rubin (Hurricane) Carter was transferred from a maximumto a mediumsecurity prison in New Jersey yesterday amid a new controvers over whether prison officials had tried to blackmail him into dropping a civil suit agin against the state.

title: The Pop Life
description: They're about the most unlikely candidates for bigtime pop music stardom that have come along in quite some time. But here the Chieftains are, anyhow, on their fifth visit to the United States, playing two dates at the Bottom Line this week and filling up Avery Fisher Hall for their first major concert here this coming Monday.

title: Offer of Work for Vietnamese Turns Sour
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y.Two months ago, eight Vietnamese refugee families came to this community under the sponsorship of the manager of Candy Lane, a local candy cane factory.

title: Silent American Voices
description: At a recent meeting of the InterAmerican Press Association in Brazil, it was reported that at no time since Latin American independence had the press in most American nations faced greater threats. The armydominated Government of the host country was particularly cited as one of the enemies of press freedom,

title: Suit Seeks to Block Shift Of Nursing Home Patients
description: ELIZABETH, Nov. 13 (UPI)A judge will hear a suit later this month on whether an 86yearold nursing home resident can he evicted because Medicaid pays only $27 a day for her upkeep.

title: Mexican Candidate, Sure Victor, Running Hard Anyway
description: I MEXICO CITY, Nov. 12Although the nomination is tantamount to election, Jose Lopez Portillo appears to be running for the presidency of Mexico i as hard as a politician can.

title: MOSCOW SAYS TIMES OPPOSES DETENTE
description: MOSCOW. Nov. 13 (Reuters) The Kremlin's top political commentator today accused the Western press of conducting a hostile campaign against dtente in violation of last summer's Helsinki security conference decisions.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Carey called last night for substantial cuts in public spending on medical care in New York and unveiled the outline of his legislative package of healthcare proposals for next year. The proposed legislation, he said, would include bills to define death in legal terms for the first time in the state, and to crack down on Medicaid mills that exist more for profit than for the purpose of treating patients.

title: LOUD, LOUD RAINBOW MAKES ROCK DEBUT
description: When Ritchie Blackmore was a member of Deep Purple, the British group made the Guinness Book of World Records in the category of loudest rock band. It is a tradition that Mr. Blackmore is intent on maintaining, to judge from the debut of his new group, Rainbow, at the Beacon Theater on Wednesday. The amplification that towers behind him and his quartet is overgenerous even by the bloated sonic standards of the heavymetal drone rockers.

title: Recital
description: Ignor Kipnis may not be the quintessence of refined style in matters visualhis gold tuxedo jacket, ruffled shirt and red harpsichord looked more appropriate for Johnny Carson than for the Velez Blanco Patio of the Metropolitan Museum, where he appeared Wednesday night.

title: Senate Expected to Halt Labor Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The Senate is expected to vote tomorrow on cutting off debate on a bill long sought by organized labor that would give construction workers the right to picket an entire construction site in a dispute with a single contractor.

title: Television
description: 8:00 P.M. Sanford and Son (4)

title: U.S. and Cuba Clash in the U.N. Over Prisoners
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13  The United States and Cuba accused each other today of violating human rights in a debate on an American move to have the United Nations urge all governments to free their political prisoners.

title: Yonkers to Get State Loan To Avert a Default Today
description: ALBANY, Nov. 13Governor Carey said this evening that the state would advance $10 million in aid to Yonkers as part of a series of measures that he said would avert a, default on the city's shortterm notes that fall due tomorrow.

title: Reviving Auto Industry Signals Cheer in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 13It was like old times at Mickcy's Dodge Bar. Willie and Al were there, and so were scores of other workers from the Chrysler Corporation's hulking old Hamtramck Assembly Plant across the street. The men filled the place with goodhumored chatter, extracting the ultimate in iunchhou hustle from the bartenders.

title: About New York
description: A man got into a taxi in midtown the other day. At red light, the cabby asked, Would you do me a favor? The fare replied that he would, within reason. The cabby handed the man a camera and asked him to take his picture.

title: THOUSANDS KEEP PORTUGUESE CHIEF BESIEGED IN HOME
description: LISBON, Friday, Nov. 14President Francisco da Costa Games appealed last night for unity and discipline as hostile workers held the Prime Minister prisoner in his official residence.

title: Asia Is Reported Free of Smallpox for the First Time in History
description: GENEVA. Nov. 13The World Health Organization announced today that Asia was free of smallpox for the first time in history.

title: Duane Bobick Victor
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 13 (AP)Unbeaten Duane Bobick scored his 33d heavyweight victory tonight when Scrap Iron Johnson failed to answer the bell for the fifth round. Johnson had a bad cut over his right eye.

title: Byrne Urges a Precise State Law Defining Death
description: TRENTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)The case of Karen Anne Quinlan, whose parents were barred by Superior Court from having her lifesustaining respirator disconnected, demonstrates the need for New Jersey to formulate a more precise legal definition of death, Governor Byrne said today.

title: CONFIDENCE SEEN IN C.D. GAINS HERE
description: Moneymarket analysts, tracking the decline in New York City commercial bank holdings of certificates of deposit, have been talking ominously of a flight to safety on the part of sophisticated corporate investors.

title: About New York
description: A man got into a taxi in midtown the other day. At red light, the cabby asked, Would you do me a favor? The fare replied that he would, within reason. The cabby handed the man a camera and asked him to take his picture.

title: Flawed Energy Bill
description: With oil price controls due to expire tomorrow, the long deadlock between President Ford and the Democratic Congress appears to have been broken. Electionyear politics on both the Democratic and Republican sides seems to have triumphed over the need for progress toward energy independence.

title: Power Play in Portugal
description: Last month it was the eightday mutiny by militant leftwing soldiers at a Portuguese army base in Oporto. This week it has been the besieging of Prime Minister Azevedo and members of the Constituent Assembly Lisbon's Sao Bento Palace by thousands of striking construction workers, backed up by farmers hauled in for the occasion by a Communist union.

title: EXLOBBYIST AT GULF ACCUSED IN RECORDS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI) A former Gulf Oil Corporation lobbyist flew to Florida and Tennessee in 1970 to give $7,000 from an alleged illegal fund to two Republican Congressmen seeking Senate seats, Federal Court records showed today.

title: SITE OFF LONG BEACH STUDIED AS A DUMP
description: TOMS RIVER, Nov. 13 (UPI) A site 25 miles off Lang Beach Island is under study by Federal agencies as an alternative sludgedumping ground if the dead sea off Sandy Hook is closed next summer.

title: White House Now Ready To Consider Aid for City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13They White House officially softened its position on financial aid to New York City today and indicated it would consider shortterm assistance to ease the city's cashflow problems once Governor Carey's fiscal plan was implemented.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Nov. 13, 1975

title: 76ers, A.B.A. Fail To Settle on Jones
description: Pat Williams, general manager of the National Basketball Association's Philadelphia 76ers, met with Commissioner Dave DeBusschere of the American Basketball Association yesterday for about 1 hours without settling on a deal for 6foot11inch Caldwell Jones, an A.B.A. allstar with the San Diego, Sails before that franchise folded earlier this week.

title: One Killed in Tunnel Blast
description: MOUNT CLEMENS, Mich. Nov. 13 (UPI)  An explosion tore through a oneandonehalfmile long tunnel below this southeastern Michigan city late today, killing one worker and burning and trapping 10 others in darkness, gas and kneedeep water 50 feet underground. The survivors were rescued or found their own way to safety within three hours of the explosion.

title: Confusion in Angola
description: The independence celebration in Luanda of the Marxist Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) was hardly the triumphal occasion that Dr. Agostinho Neto and his colleagues had envisioned. Only a score of foreign delegates were on hand in a Luanda soccer field for the installation of Dr. Neto as President of the People's Republic of Angola, which at the moment solely an MPLA entity whose control over Angolan territory has been dramatically diminished in recent fighting. A heavy blow had earlier been dealt MPLA by the Organization of African Unity, which advised its 46 member states not to grant recognition to any of the three competing Angolan factions.

title: Singer to Omit Dividend
description: Directors of the Singer Company voted yesterday to omit the fourthquarter common dividend, but declared the dividends on its various classes of preferred stock. It is the first time since 1863 the company has failed to pay a dividend. Shareholders had received 10 cents in the first three quarters, this year. In the third quarter this year the company lost $34.7 million.

title: News Gets a Monday Strike Deadline
description: The Citywide Coordinating Committee of the Newspaper Guild last night set Monday at Et A.M. for a strike against The Daily News if no agreement on a new contract is reached by then.

title: Cost of Auto Insurance To Rise 1520% in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 13Auto insurance rate increases 15 to 20 percent for more than two million New Jersey car owners were announced today by the State Insurance Com

title: In Memoriam
description: GOLDBERGFanny. Nov. 14, 1971. Your memory will live forever in our minds and hearts. Baruch, Jay, Shelley, Eadie and grandchildren.

title: BAYH SEES DANGER IN CRIMINAL CODE
description: Senator Birch Bayh, Democrat of Indiana, said yesterday that there was an excellent chance of either cleaning up or killing provisions in the proposed Federal Criminal Code that would restrict the availability of Government information to news organizations.

title: NAPIER WILT
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13 (UPI)Napier Wilt professor emeritus of English and a faculty member for nearly 40 years in the English department at the University of Chicago died yesterday at hi:: home here. He was 79 years old.

title: Advertising
description: What's happening in the business is that clients more and more are asking about the possibility of using stars or bigname talent ase their spokesmen or as voiceovers in commercials, said Lois Korey, senior vice president and creative director of Needham. Harper & Steers.

title: Islanders Bow, 43, To Kings
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 13Losing the lead twice in the third period and picking up two costly penalties that nullified powerplay opportunities, the New York Islanders lost to the Los Angeles Kings, 43, at the Forum tonight.

title: Reviving Auto Industry Signals Cheer in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 13It was like old times at Mickey's Dodge Bar. Willie and Al were there, and so were scores of other workers from the Chrysler Corporation's hulking old 1Harntramck Assembly Plant across the street. The men filled the place with goodhumored chatter, extracting

title: Amex Sets OptionsOnly Memberships
description: The American Stock Exchange, encouraged by the success of its yearold diversification into stock options, will shortly sell 200 special memberships for the exclusive use of options traders, Paul Kolton, chairman of the exchange, disclosed yesterday.

title: Injured Esposito Assists Ranger Cause
description: In his nonplaying home debut as a member of the New York Rangers Wednesday night in smoky Madison Square Garden, Phil Esposito displayed the entertaining bursts of passion that had drawn so many Boston fans to him.

title: LEO LOMSKI, BOXER, ABERDEEN ASSASSIN
description: ABERDEEN, Wash., Nov. 13 (UPI)Leo Lomski, a light heavyweight boxer of the 1920's who was called the Aberdeen Assassin, died yesterday at his home near here. He was 72 years old.

title: CHARGES DROPPED IN ATTICA DEATHS
description: 3 Leaders of 1971 Rebellion Cleared by Judge

title: Payroll Will Be Met By Fighting Saints
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 13 (AP)The president of the Minnesota Fighting Saints says everybody will get paid this week, apparently assuring the financial stability of the World Hockey Association franchise for the time being.

title: DOW DIPS BY 1.02 IN HEAVY TRADING
description: With trading again extraordinarily active, the stock market yesterday continued the climb that began. Wednesday on heightened hopes of Federal aid for New York City. The advance did not hold, however, and prices slid back.

title: Banks Reported Favoring Moratorium on City Notes
description: New York's largest banks were reported last night to moving toward acceptance of Governor Carey's plan for moratorium on the payment by New York City of principal on its notes. Felix G. Rohatyn, chairman of the Municipal Assistance Corporation, said he expected the banks to go along with a plan to restructure their holdings of $1.65 billion in city notes and Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds. In Washington, meanwhile, a Government report disclosed that 11 large New York banks, collectively owned city and state obligations amounting to 28.7 percent of their capital. [Page 18.]

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
LARGE BANKS HOLD BIG STAKES HERE
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 13The 11 large New York City banks collectively own city and state obligations amounting to 28.7 percent of their capital, it was disclosed today.

title: POLICE ABSOLVED ON HARASSMENT
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13 (AP)A Federal district judge cleared the state police today of an accusation that they advocated a policy of harassment on New Jersey's highways. But he found that 35 illegal searches had been made by troopers acting on their own.

title: Market Place
description: The bonds of New York City, threatened by default, are so deeply depressed in comparison with the prices of some bonds already in default that some people in Wall Street are wondering whether city issues may not offer an attractive speculation.

title: Truck With Olive Oil Stolen
description: A truck containing $35.000 worth of Italian olive oil was stolen overnight from Berio Distributors at 327 Hicks Street H Brooklyn Height.

title: Flyers Tie Hawks After Trailing, 51
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 13 (UPI)Ross Lonsberry of Philadelphia scored two goals and the Flyers wiped out a fourgoal deficit to tie the Chicago Black Hawks, 55, tonight in a battle of National Hockey League division leaders.

title: 6 KILLED, 40 HURT BY BOMB IN ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 13  A huge explosion ripped through Jerusalem's main shopping street tonight, shattering storefronts and leaving at least six persons dead and 40 wounded.

title: Ratings Downgraded For Chrysler's Debt
description: The Standard & Poor's Corporation downgraded yesterday the longterm debt of the Chrysler Corporation and the Chrysler Financial Corporation, a subsidiary of the auto manufacturer.

title: ELEPHANT LANDS IN JAIL FOR SWIMMNG NARROWS
description: Crosses from Coney to New Dorp in Early Dawn.

title: A Kind of Default
description: Governor Carey's program for avoiding default by New York City includes a complex scheme for rescheduling the city's debt which, it must be conceded, itself represents a kind of default.

title: Gary Nolan Wins Hutchinson Award
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 13 (AP)Gary Nolan, who won 15 games for the world champion Cincinnati Reds after being sidelined 2 seasons with a shoulder problem, is the 1975 winner of baseball's Hutch Award.

title: Indicted Speaker of Assembly Given Ovation by Colleagues
description: ALBANY, Nov. 13Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut, who has been under pressure since his indictment last week, received a standing ovation from both sides of the aisle today as the Assembly reconvened in special session.

title: THE HEARST TRIAL MAY BE DELAYED
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 13Patricia Hearst's trial for armed bank robbery appeared today likely to be postponed until well after Jan. 1, perhaps to midFebruary.

title: FORD OFFERS BILL ON DEREGULATING TRUCKS AND BUSES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13President Ford sent Congress today a bill that would sharply reduce Federal regulation of interstate trucking and bus transportation. The legislation is bitterly opposed by the trucking industry and the teamsters union.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: Let's not call it a guarantee, but I'd propose that there is likely to be a reverse correspondence between the level of quality and the length of the menu in New York restaurants. The fewer the dishes offered, the better the chances that they will be good, and vice versa.

title: Yonkers to Get State Loan To Avert a Default Today
description: ALBANY, Nov. 13Governor Carey said this evening that the state would advance $10 million in aid to Yonkers as part of a series of measures that he said would avert a default on the city's shortterm notes that fall due tomorrow.

title: Books of The Times
description: Dr. Andrei D. Sakharov, a Russian genius in nuclear physics who has become meditative and melancholy about the fate of civilization, is increasingly turning his analytical powers to the plights and dangers of mankind, contemplating them with a scientist's orderly mind and a philosopher's moral .principles and perspective.

title: Conviction Is Reversed in Rikers Island Bribery Case
description: Ruling that evidence had been obtained illegally by the Bronx District Attorney's office, the Appellate Division yesterday reversed the conviction of former state parole officer who had pleaded guilty to attempting to receive bribes from Rikers Island inmates.

title: FRANCIS SEARS
description: Francis W. Sears, Appleton Professor of Natural Philosophy emeritus at Dartmouth College and author of physics textbooks, died in Hanover, N. H., on Wednesday. He was 77 years old and lived in Norwich, Vt.

title: Yonkers Is Said to Lack Fiscal Leadership
description: YONKERS, Nov. 13 Yonkers, which faces default tomorrow Unless the State Legislature provides a solution, has been without firm fiscal leadership for much of the last two years. This in the

title: State to Appeal Dismissal Of Dairylea Indictments
description: The State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, said yesterday that he would appeal a State Supreme Court dismissal of indictments against the Dairylea Cooperative and 11 current, and former employees.

title: Knicks Down Rockets To Halt Slide, 108102
description: The Knicks fivegame losing streak ended last night with the aid of a thirdperiod oneonone show by Earl Monroe and some aggressive shooting by John Gianelli in the final quarter.

title: CHICAGO DOCTORS END 18DAY STRIKE
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13The longest doctors strike in the nation's history ended here today when residents and internes at Cook. County Hospital accepted a settlement and returned to their medical duties after 18 days on the picket line.

title: Giants Given Edge Over Eagles; Jets Must Stop Surging Colts
description: The combined wonlost record of the Giants and Jets this season is 511, the same total as their Sunday opponents, the Eagles and Colts, respectively. But that's all

title: Jones Is Ready For Jets Action
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.L. Nov. 13 The dreams of a dozen wouldbe quarterbacks were interrupted abruptly today when J.J. Jones pronounced himself cured overnight.

title: The New U.S. Style in the U.N.
description: Last March, Daniel P. Moynihan, finding himself temporarily between Government jobs, wrote a piece for Commentary magazine outlining a new role for the United States at the United Nations. We are the liberty party, he proclaimed, and it might surprise us what energies might be released were we to unfurl those banners.

title: Robert L. Coe, ExWPIX Aide And Broadcast Professor, Dies
description: Robert L. Coe a broadcast executive for 45 years Who later taught communications at Ohio University and Temple University died of a heart ailment at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center on Wednesday. He was 73 years old.

title: Bullets Halt Celtic Rally, Win, 110107
description: LANDOVER. Wt., Nov. 13 (UPI)Phil Chenier scored 24 points and Dave Bing and Elvin Hayes had 22 each tonight as the Washington Bullets beat the Boston Celtics, 110107, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Farber Dancers in Umbrella Series
description: A new dance series and a new dance theater made a joint and splendid bow Wednesday night when the Viola Farber Dance Coinpany inaugurated the 12company Dance Umbrella series. The new showcase is the Roundabout Theater Company's Stage One, 333 West 23d Street, already the home of an established drama troupe. Few converted movie houses have been put to better use.

title: 2 SOUGHT TO ROUT BIRDS AT KENNEDY
description: A twoman patrol at Kennedy International Airport tried unsuccessfully Wednesday to rout a flock of birds from Runway 13 Right a short time before a jumbo jet hit some seagulls on the runway and burst into flames.

title: SovietWest German Talks End With Little Gain on Exchanges
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13President Walter Scheel of West Germany left Moscow today, evidently having made little progress toward establishing exchanges in cultural, scientific and legal areas.

title: Harris Calls for Redistribution of Economic and Political Power
description: Fred R. Harris, making the first nationwide broadcast in the campaign for next year's Democratic Presidential nomination, said last night that the redistribution of economic and political power should be the stated goal of American government.

title: Amex Stocks Rise As Volume Drops; OTC Is Irregular
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose again yesterday in moderate trading. Stocks in the overthecounter market closed mixed in slightly increased trading.

title: Cavenham Seeking Additional Shares Of Grand Union
description: The United States subsidiary of Cavenham Ltd of London said yesterday that it planned to file an amendment to its registration statement on the Grand Union Company, indicating its intention to

title: Should Rumsfeld and Bush Take the Pledge?; IN THE NATION
description: If the Democrats who control Congress have a good reason not to confirm Donald Rumsfeld as Secretary of Defense, it is not that he might be President Ford's running mate in 1976. And if the same Democrats have good reason to deny confirmation to George Bush as director of the Central Intelligence Agency, it is not that he once was chairman of the Republican National Committee.

title: Harvard Prepares for the Game With Brown Tomorrow With an Eye on The Game With Yale Next Week
description: T.A.D. (Tad) Jones the late Yale football coach once uttered these words to his players before The Game, Gentlemen, you are now going out to play football

title: Musical Jubilee
description: There is so much that is smashing about the new musical entertainment A Musical Jubilee, which opened last night at the St. James Theater, that the tiny things about italmost entirely in conceptionthat are less than perfect may seem oddly niggling. For this Bicentennial celebration of American theater music is graced by seven stars of genuine stature, all in magnificent form. It is amusing, heartwarming and it has the best and certainly the most music of show

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A report of a contract on the life of Mayor Christopher M. Paci of Lodi turned out to be untrue, according the Bergen County Prosecutor.

title: Offer of Work for Vietnamese Turns Sour
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y.Two months ago, eight Vietnamese refugee families came to this community under the sponsorship of the manager of Candy Lane, a local candy cane factory.

title: Notes on People
description: Can a political system with a tradition of smokefilled rooms long endure if the rooms rare] legislated out of existence? Representative Robert F. Drinan introduced a bill in the House yesterday that would make it a Federal offense to smoke in certain public places and would provide smokefree halls, elevators and meeting rooms in thousands of Federal offices, military bases and other facilities. Fines up to $100 would be levied for smoking in waiting lines, lobbies and boarding areas of any passengercarrier in interstate transportation. The bill would also add a cent a pack to the cigarette tax and use the proceeds for heartandlung medical research.

title: Judge Apologizes For Court Remark On Killing of Boy
description: Justice Alfred D. Lerner of State Supreme Court in Queens said yesterday that he regretted having made a statement in his courtroom on Wednesday calling the killing of a 16yearold boy by a policeman an unspeakable horror.

title: THOUSANDS KEEP PORTUGUESE CHIEF BESIEGED IN HOME
description: LISBON, Friday, Nov. 14President Francisco da Costa Gomes appealed last night for unity and discipline as hostile workers held the Prime Minister prisoner in his official residence.

title: Supply of Money Climbed by $3.2 Billion in the Week
description: The nation's money supply grew sharply in the latest reporting week, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Atlantic Oil Drilling Yielding Carbon Shale
description: The high hopes of a few years ago that vast oil reserves lie beneath the deep basins that flank both sides of the Atlantic Ocean have been severely diminished after sampling of the deposits by deepsea drilling.

title: Shaky Europe Looks To the Summit for Aid
description: PARIS, Nov. 13The years since World War II have been an increasingly prosperous period for Europeans. Incomes have risen sharply and life for even the lowestpaid worker has gained in comfort and security.

title: WAYNE IS VIGOROUS IN RAYMONDA
description: Dennis Wayne assumed the adversary role of AbdulRakhman, the Saracen knight, in American Ballet Theater's production of Raymonda on Wednesday night at the Uris Theater and pursued the hand of Raymonda with a bowstring elasticity that made the part ivigorouly alive.

title: Bostonians Under Ozawa Play Haydn
description: The Boston Symphony Orchestra was at its brilliant best in its concert Wednesday night in Carnegie Hall, but in the opening work the playing was just too good.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Tax advantages  legitimate practices utilized by all sorts of businesses and available to owners of major league teamsare among the three basic ingredients that make possible today's immense sports establishment. The others are television and the willingness of many communities to subsidize stadiums and arenas for teams.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts; 1975. by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racial Form) Thursday, Nov. 13. Fourth day. Weather rainy, track sloppy.
description: Aaueduct Entries

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article on the Lasker awards in The New York Times yesterday erroneously credited the wrong scientist with one of the prizewinning discoveries. Dr. Andrew V. Schally of the Veterans Administration System in New Orleans discovered the luteinizing hormonereleasing hormone, which stimulates the pituitary to release hormones that regulate male and female fertility. In the same article, the surname of Godfrey N. Hounsfield, who invented an Xray device called the brain scanner, was misspelled.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 0.3 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials fell to 192.9 from 193.2 last week.

title: Last Minute Bane of Eagles
description: In the coal region of eastern Pennsylvania there's a 79yearold woman who has an idea for turning a football team into a winner.

title: TV: Views Vary on What's Good News
description: Behind and in front of the cameras these days, the nature of television news is being questioned with renewed seriousness, and the answers could prompt significantand unsettling  answers. Looming as a distinct possibilitywhat some traditional broadcast newsmen would call a threatis a spillover of pragmatic news from featureclogged local levels into the traditionally straightforward nationalinternational reports of network news. The concept

title: Army Sergeant Convicted
description: FORT LEONARD WOOD, Mo., Nov. 13 (UPI)Army Sgt. Henry Bradford has been convicted of accepting $200 from basic trainees and gambling with subordinates. A courtmartial sentenced him yester1 day to a onegrade reduction, to staff sergeant and a fine of $425. He was the second drill instructor at the post  to be convicted. Five other sergeants face courtsmartial on similar charges.

title: Critic's Notebook: Stoppard Travesties Stirs New Thoughts of Lenin and Zurich
description: Those morose few who care about intelligence in the theatereven unto wit, the occasional pun lobbed grenadelike into the trenchmouth of the nightcare just as much about Tom Stoppard, whose Travesties at the Ethel Barrymore proves once again that he writes the best first act in the business.

title: Soviet Fighters Here
description: In the first international match featuring an allheavyweight card, the Soviet national boxing team will take on 10 American amateurs tonight at Madison Square Garden. The Garden's seventh international amateur presentation will begin at 8:30 and conclude with a match between Igor Vysotsky, the Soviet Union's top heavyweight against Jimmy Clark of Coatsville, Pa., who has 41 of 46 bouts.

description: Tiffany & Company and Smith, Barney & Company unwittingly ran afoul of Federal securities law.; yesterday in trying to offer Tiffany shares as Christmas gifts.

description: How pathetically funny the security blanket can seem in adult eyes! Dirty, torn and threadbare, leaving tufts of itself in random places.

description: WASHINGTON Nov. 13, (UPI)In a move to protect patients from diseases in the blood of those who sell it, the Food and Drug Administration today proposed new hepatitis warning labels to let doctors and their patients know the source of their blood transfusions.

description: CANBERRA, Australia, Nov. 13The popular reaction against Gough Witlam's dismissal as prime minister continued to mount here today.

description: Coach Dick (Digger) Phelps of Notre Dame, never a man to suffer in silence, admitted yesterday that he was unhappy over the rules that will be used on Thursday night when his Fighting Irish squad opposes the Soviet national basketball team at Madison Square Garden.
