title: WORK BY ALEXANDER HAS PREMIERE HERE
description: The 100plus poems that make up Rabindranath Tagore's Gitanjali have attracted the attention of composers ever since it appeared in 1912. One of the latest to set some of them is Josef Alexander, who as well as being a composer is a professor at Brooklyn College. His Gitanjali, completed in 1973, was given its premiere; Friday night in a program by the Manhattan Percussion Ensemble at the Manhattan School of Music.

title: San Jose Wins League Title. 317
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 15 (AP)Gerald Small of San Jose State made two fourthperiod interceptions, returning one for a touchdown, and helped break up a close game as his team beat San Diego State, 317, today and won the Pacific Coast Athletic Association championship.

title: West Orange Lists Bicentennial Talks
description: WEST ORANGEThe West Orange Bicentennial Commission will present a series of lectures on New JerseyCockpit of the American Revolution. The four related lectures, to be given by four of the state's most knowledgeable historians, will provide insights into the events of 200 years ago that laid the foundation for the state.

title: China Reports Locusts Brought Under Control
description: TOKYO, Nov. 15 (AP)China has brought the ageold locust peril under control by a coordinated national effort, Hsinhua, the official Chinese news agency, has reported.

title: Classical Notes: Off to India With the CSQ
description: The cultural reputation of the United States abroad will be in good hands for the next month: a couple of days ago the Composers String Quartet flew off for a foreign tour, segments of which are sponsored by the Department of State. Columbia University's resident quartet is playing six concerts in Roumania and Norway under official auspices, and after a de tour through Denmark and England the group will double back to India for ten concerts in seven principal cities, also under the State Department's wing. The CSQ is not the first American quartet to go to India, but as first violinist Matthew Raimondi

title: Miss Solomon Bride of G. R. Pattullo 3d
description: Susan Jaye Solomon, daughter of Mrs. Jesse Solomon of Palm Beach, Fla., and New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to George Robson Pattullo 3d, a desk assistant with ABCTV network news here. Civil Court Judge Bentley Kassal performed the ceremony at the Harmonie Club.

title: Merrick Sets Mark In IC4A Title Run
description: Dave Merrick of Penn shattered the meet record yesterday in winning the University Division gold medal in the 67th annual Intercollegiate Association of Amateur Athletes of America crosscountry championships at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: INSTITUTE REPORTS ON FIREWEAPONS
description: The development of a new generation of incendiary weapons, including controlled chemical fireballs radiating thermal energy second only to that of nuclear bombs, has been disclosed by the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 15 (UPI)A warrant has been issued for the arrest of James Kilgore, 28 years old, suspected of being an associate of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberttion Army.

title: U.S. Gave Additional Help to San Francisco in 1906
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 15Further evidence of generous Federal assistance to San Francisco after the 1906 fire and earthquake was turned up this week by William Heintz, a historian doing research for a twovolume history of the city.

title: 20 New England Colleges Give Summer Programs for Elderly
description: DURHAM, N. H., Nov. 15 (AP)A summer program at five New Hampshire colleges and universities has provided the seed for a program throughout New England designed to eliminate planned obsolescence for the elderly.

title: Cakes and Custard
description: Is there any good reason to publish yet another compilation of nursery rhymes? In this instance, two very good reasons: editor and illustrator.

description: MORRISTOWNAn innovative program for surveying the vocational needs and potential of high school dropouts in Morris County may become a prototype for other New Jersey areas.

title: By JACK GOODMAN
description: I was cutting graceful curves on the lower slopes of Mount Timpanagos in central Utah when a rather short, stocky chap stemmed past, carving even more graceful turns, then swung to a halt under stand of aspens heavy with snow. Braking alongside him, I suddenly recognized the ohsofamiliar face: Robert Redford. Encountering the film star is one of the side benefits of skiing at Sundance Resort, a dozen miles uphill from the central Utah university town of Provo. He owns the place.

title: Paper Back Talk
description: Post mortem. A while back we listed 15 authors who were scheduled to spend a typical day, September 29, in 11 cities across the country beating the drum for their booksappearing on. TV talk shows, giving press and radio interviews, autographing books in stores, lecturing at colleges. Now, seven weeks later, what do they have to show for all their effort?

title: A Huge Rice Crop Leaves Philippines Short of Storage
description: MANILA, Nov. 15Phillipine farmers have begun harvesting a rice crop so large that President Ferdinand E. Marcos has authorized the use of public buildings and halls in some areas as temporary warehouses.

title: ANGELA DAVIS JOB DEBATED ON COAST
description: CLAREMONT, Calif., Nov. 15 Angela Davis has joined the teaching staff at the Claremont cluster of six colleges, putting the black Marxist radical in the center of a controversy once more.

description: When the United States Postal Service announced a 3cent rise in the price of a stamp, effective come January, the usual cry of outrage rose from the philatelic world, with inefficiency the main accusation.

title: Hudson High: 72d in Row
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Nov. 15Hudson, Mich., established a new national high school record of 72 consecutive football victories when it defeated Hackett Kalamazoo, 2414 today, in the semifinals of the State Class C championships playoffs.

title: ONE IRAN IMPORT IS U.S. EDUCATION
description: TEHERAN, Iran  United States educational institutions! have been helping themselves lately to a modest slice of Iran's vast oil revenues by agreeing to provide Iranian institutions with a variety of services, ranging from faculty training to advice about educa tional television.

title: McMahon 3827 Victor On a Rally
description: Brien McMahon scored 30 points in the second half yesterday for a 3827 comefrombehind victory over Danbury and a berth in the Fairfield County championship game next Saturday.

title: School Financing Still a Taxing Riddle
description: Never has so much been said and so little done about an educational issue in New York State as the vast inequities that continue to mark the patchwork system by which the state raises and spends tax dollars to school its children. Almost everybody agrees the system is bad, that it discriminates against poor towns in favor of rich ones, but few can agree on a remedy.

title: Vote Workers Err In Count for E.R.A.
description: NEWARK  The voting machine is here to stay, but there are a number of organizations in Essex County these days that probably would have no objection to another fling at paper ballots.

description: Two of the three Division I schools in the metropolitan area have new coaches and higher hopes for the coining season. One is St. Francis in Brooklyn, where Lou Rossini, former Columbia and New York University coach, has taken over and will try to turn the Terriers around after eight consecutive losing seasons.

description: An amendment to the State Constitution to permit legalized gambling under certain religious, charitable and nonprofit auspices appears to have been approved by the voters, although final results will not be certified until midDecember, and there are still enough uncounted votes to tip the scales the other way.

description: St. Vincent's Hospital authorities reported yesterday that doctors were unable to sew hack the severed arm of a woman pushed in front of a subway train Friday evening at the West Fourth Street station by a man she had never seen.

description: EAST ORANGE  Indoor tennis has gripped New Jersey like a fever, with about 88 clubs operating throughout the state. Players of all sizes and shapes, and in age categories ranging from 8 to 80, are matching ground strokes and volleys from A.M. to midnight seven days a weer.

title: The Greeks had a buck for it
description: The Golden Greeks are the 180 Greek families that own more than 4,000 ships worth at least 820 billion. Nicholas Gage uses the same appellation in The Dourtotes Fortune, his novel about the 20th century's kings of the seas. But all that is gold does not glitter on Gage's scales. The wealth of the shipping magnates buys governments, builds new BabyIons and cuts their sensibilities like knife.

title: Food News
description: LIVINGSTONThe advent of fall means that it's apple, or sweet, cider time in North Jersey, and the Nettie Ochs Cider Mill here is braced for its annual customer onslaught.

title: Presbytery Votes to Dissolve Congregation of Village Church
description: The Presbytery of New York City, governing unit for 109 Presbyterian churches, has voted to dissolve the Village Church congregation et 139 West 13th Street and will name a committee to consider options for the use of the church building.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on ratification of the Protocol to the Treaty on Antiballistic Missile Systems, which required a twothirds vote of those present for passage. Ratified. 63 to 15, Nov. 10.

title: Americans Debate the Role of Schools
description: As has often happened in the past, Americans are the midst of a fundamental national debate over the role of schools in their society.

title: For Students, a Course on Marriage Reality
description: PARKROSE, Ore.When Cliff Allen first started teaching history in high school, he devoted the traditional amount of classroom time to such topics as the British royalty, international trade and the United Nations.

title: On the Problems of Hire Education...
description: The specter of the cab driver with a Ph.D. haunts higher education. Like Elanquo's ghost, he just won't go away certainly not while good jobs are as scarce as they are today. With every study that estimates a lower lifelong dollar value for a college degree, the demand grows for colleges and universities to provide hire education  preparation for a specific type of lob with specific skills. But vocationalism is not the answer to the very real concerns of students who face an uncertain job marketor of parents seeking wellmarked routes to their children's employment before making substantial investments in their education. In the short run, vocationalism may pay; but in the long run, society will find this alternative very costly.

title: JURY BY TRIAL
description: Do you think male jailors take advantage of female prisoners? Do you agree that most women who are raped may have encouraged the attack? Do you think that Richard Nixon was treated unfairly during Watergate? What magazines do you subscribe to? And so it went in a darkpaneled courtroom in Raleigh, N. C., last July, as defense attorneys grilled close to 150 prospective jurors. For 10 days, the sevenlawyer defense team tested jurors attitudes toward race and rape, police and jails, politics and fearjust about artything that might affect a vote on the fate of the defendant. Joan Little, a young black woman accused of fatally stabbing a white jailer 11 times with an ice pick. The judge was growing impatient; the prosecution objected that the defense was asking irrelevant questions and psychoanalyzing the jurors; even some of the jurors began to wonder whether they were on trial.

title: For Parents, Seminars on ChildRearing
description: Elaine Mazlish, a mother of three from Roslyn, L. I. looked down at her toes and pouted. Then she glowered at a group of parents sitting front of her and said, I had a had birthday party!

description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 15 (AP)Since taking power in August Gen. Francisco Morales Bermudez has overhauled Peru's revolutionary Government and announced what he calls a moralization campaign against corruption.

title: Menuhin Wears 2 Hats at Carnegie Hall
description: Yehudi Menuhin is, predictably enough, the pervasive force behind the Menuhin Festival Orchestra of London, which appeared Friday night in Carnegie Hall. Dating back to the Bath Festival in 1958, the group toured North America in 1967, but its principal function is to accompany Mr. Menuhin as a violinist or to be conducted by him at summer festivals.

title: Bernar's Harriers Triumph
description: PENNSAUKEN, N.J., Nov. 15Chris Hallinan of Bernards broke the course reccord today as he led his team to the Group 1 title in the New Jersey State crosscountry championships at Pennsauken High School. Hallinan covered the 3mile course in 14 minutes 52 seconds, shattering the record of 14:57.9, set last year by Marty Ludwikowski.

title: Must the Toy Fairy Have a Ph.D.?
description: Parents shopping for Christmas gifts will find themselves confronted with a bewildering array of educational toys, puzzles and games. Many parents, put off by the high prices, will turn away with feelings of guilt for having been forced to deprive their children of the best.

title: The Opening on the United States Supreme Court
description: Two years ago this month, at a dinner marking his long service on the Supreme Court, William O. Douglas rose to speak extemporaneously about his life and the Court. After a few minutes he told some past justices who had stayed on under the handicap of age or illness, in the last century and this. He recalled how Chief Justice Charles Evans Hughes had suddenly retired in 1941, at the height of his powers. His saddened colleagues, Justice Douglas said, asked him why, and Justice Hughes replied: I have always had a fear of continuing office under a delusion of adequacy.

title: Son Questioned by Police In Slaying of Father Here
description: Homicide detectives yesterday said they had no leads in the murder of an 80yearold man in a small penthouse on the Upper West Side Friday, and they continued to question the victim's son about discrepancies and gaps in his accntint of his father's death.

description: What do Americans expect of their public schools? Most people would probably respond that the school is a place Where children are supposed to learn the traditional Three R's: reading, writing and arithmetic.

title: LAWYERS CURBED ON DEFAULT FEES

title: L.I.R.R. Delays Anger Riders

title: Colonial Cup Chase Taken by 161 Shot
description: CAMDEN, S.C., Nov. 15 Augustin Stables Cafe Prince, a 161 shot, took over near the end of the grueling Colonial Cup race today and won America's richest steeplechase race.

title: More Museum Membership Benefits
description: An article about the benefits of museum membership which appeared in this section Nov. 2 neglected to mention the International Center of Photography and certain facts about the Asia Society. The following is to correct those omissions.

title: IceProof Scotch; What is the ideal proof for a Scotch whisky? That depends on the way the whisky is consumed and the palate of the individual. Scotch drinkers are finding that Famous Grouse, the only 90Proof Scotch, is the ideal proof and blend for consuming on the rocks. It's America's first IceProof Scotch.
description: perhaps the most elusive quality of any Scotch whisky is the ability to retain freshness as it dilutes with ice. While no Scotch can be totally iceproof: it can be demonstrated that a 90Proof Scotch will sustain its freshness substantially longer than Scotches bottled at 80, 86, or 86.8 Proof.

title: RiethSules Duo Helps Livingston Go 80
description: The Glenn RiethJohn Sules offensive team led the way again yesterday as unbeaten Livingston beat West Orange Mountain, 410, in Livingston.

title: The Birth of Detente
description: LIMA, PeruNov. 16 was the date in 1933 when the United States and the Soviet Union established diplomatic relations or, put another way, when America resumed relations with Russia after a long hiatus. Recognition in no sense followed the usual, foolish U.S. concept that this implied political approval instead of simply acknowledging a regime as sufficiently strong to administer its country, which is the practice of most nations.

title: Cable Talk
description: Talk is up, transAtlantically, and trailing after it is the sixth telecommunications cable to span the ocean since the first such effort 20 years ago.

title: An Anthropologist Looks at the Rituals of Football
description: The attitude toward the football player has obviously changed since Shakespeare's. time. Today the once base football player, as Shakespeare de. Scribed him in King Lear, occupies the hearts, minds and television screens of millions. He is emulated and sought after, and the stratagems he uses in the game are often followed at the highest levels of government and business.

title: The Brooklyn MuseumA Special Place for a Stroll
description: The Brooklyn Museum has had more than its share of the troubles normal to American museums in the 1970'sstaff disruptions and inadequate fundsbut you would never know it from strolling through the place. And strolling is the right word, for this is a museum conducive to a leisurely visit; it is small enough to be .encompassed and large enough to afford variety.

title: Detroit Enclave Analyzes a Mayor's Defeat
description: HIGHLAND PARK, Mich., Nov. 15Robert B. Blackwell, the Mayor of this enclave in the middle of Detroit, stirred the onions in his vodka cocktail and said, It's like walking behind a horse and getting kicked in the head.

title: DIFFERENT EVENING OF CHAMBER MUSIC
description: Stylish performances, unharkneyed repertory and the enthusiasm of a capacity audionce at Carnegie Recital Hail lidded up to a delightfully different Saturday evening of chamber music. Participating were Milan Turkovic, principal bassoonist of the Vienna Symphony, Ray Still, first oboist of the Chicago Symphony, and John Perry, professor of piano at the University of Texas.

title: Dr. Fredric Stuart, 46, Dies; A Hofstra Department Head;
description: Dr. Fredric Stuart, professor of quantitative methods at the Hofstra University School of Business and chairman of the department of management, marketing and quantitative methods, died Saturday at the Nassau County Medical Center after having suffered a heart attack on the campus Monday. He was 46 years old.

title: SCHOOL AMENDMENT URGED BY WALLACE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, commenting that the South never did have any segregation except in the schools, said today that if elected President he would propose a constitutional amendment to let people choose where their children go to school.

title: Syria Hints It Might Act To Bar Lebanon Partition
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 16 Syria's Foreign Minister, in a major address here tonight, hinted that Syria might intervene militarily to prevent any partition of Lebanon, and that it might take unspecified mil itary action to undermine the recent EgyptianIsraeli agreement on Sinai.

title: STUDY FINDS F.E.A. FAVORS OIL GIANTS
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 16 (UPI) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, has accused the Federal Energy Administration of letting major oil companies gouge consumers out of hundreds of millions of dollars while cracking down on small independent companies.

description: The Daily News and the Newspaper Guild of New York reached a tentative contract agreement early last night, averting a strike by news and clerical personnel that had been threatened for this morning. Page 15.

The most recent creations, flexible necklaces woven of fine silver wire, remind one a little of chain mail.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Public school teachers in New Haven, after protesting a school official's statement that their strike was over, continued talks late into the night toward a threeyear contract and a possible return to work todayone week after their strike began. A spokesman for the New Haven:. Federation of Teachers said a mass meeting was scheduled for 6:30 A.M. today to discuss developments and.: possiblybut not necessarilyto vote on a new contract offer. The School Superintendent, George rarbarito, announced that the strike was over after 12 union leaders had been released from jail.

title: Spanish Regions Bitter At Ruling on Languages
description: MADRID, Nov. 16A Government decree declarirg regional languages  notably Catalan, Basque and Galicianto be national languages and deserving of protection was greeted today as a step back ward in parts of the country where they arc spoken.

title: Letter From a Havana Prison
description: Winter passes and I have had no further news from you or our children. The last news I have of you dates to October and November. Probably you, too, wait with empty hands for my letters. I write to you every month. When 1 know my letters reach you I'll write about other things; meanwhile I'll repeat myself ever and over again always with the hope that at last, reading one of these depressing letters, you'll be able to know how am and what I am thinking after more than 15 years of harsh imprisonment. And I'll speak here of my inner feelings as wellif I did not, this letter would not be mine.

title: Independent Republicans
description: ST. CLOUD, Minn., Nov. 16 (UPI) Minnesota Republicans have voted to change their name to Independent Republicans in a move designed to attract more voters.

title: TURKS AND GREEKS STILL FAR APART

description: For some years Steve Tesich has been a promising American playwrighthe is promising no more. Anyone who can produce Gorky, which opened yesterday afternoon at the American Place Theater, must be considered to have arrived. For Gorky, which is a kind of dramatic essay in biography, is a most interesting play on a number of levels.

title: Douglas Flies to Oregon For Stay in Hospital
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 16 Former Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas was admitted to Good Samaritan Hospital and Medical Center's strokecare program here for what a hospital spokesman said was physical rehabilitation and alleviation of discomfort. Mr. Douglas, who is 77 years old and who suffered a stroke in December 1974, flew here from Washington.

The benefit, to begin at 7:30, is part of a larger campaign to stir public support to block the sale of radio station WRVRFM. Tickets will be $6.50 and 525.

title: Cypriot Woman Freed By Abductors in London
description: LONDON. Nov. 16 (AP)The 18yearold daughter of a Greek Cypriot merchant was freed unharmed by kidnappers today after her family had paid S35,700 ransom, the police said. She had been held 10 days, but her abduction was kept secret at the request of Scotland Yard.

title: Philadelphians, a Story of Tradition
description: There is an anecdote currently floating about musical circles that sums up the Philadelphia Orchestra's reputation for stability and continuity of leadership. It is the year 2000, the orchestra's 100th anniversary, and the board of directors is looking around for a music director to replace Eugene Ormandy, who has just retired. After rejecting all the candidates, the directors vote to offer the job to Leopold Stokowski, the only other conductor who fits the bill.

title: Greece Studies Abolition Of Civil War Restrictions
description: ATHENS, Nov. 16, (Reuters) All emergency measures imposed in Greece after World War 11 to counter an armed Communist rebellion are to be abolished if Parliament approves.

title: Good Money, Bad Water
description: The impact of one of the Bureau of Reclamation's most poorly conceived projectsand that covers a lot of ground and wateris somewhat belatedly to be studied by the United StatesCanadian International Joint Commission. That agency's consideration of the socalled Garrison Diversion Unit in North Dakota comes none too soon because the scheme has become a serious irritant to Canada, as it has long been to American environmentalists and to the many small farmers it will hurt compared with the few big ones it will help.

The deposition was given by Thomas D. Wright of the firm of Eckert, Seamans, Cherin & Mellott in Pittsburgh.

title: Ford Walks in Rain, Then Attends Church
description: PARIS. Nov. 16 (AP)President Ford took a 10minute walk in the rain for exercise today then drove to a tiny rural church for Roman Catholic services that he attended with leaders of France and Italy.

title: Full Eclipse of Moon To Occur Tomorrow
description: Tomorrow evening the Moon will pass through the Earth's shadow, becoming totally eclipsed except for a coppery glow.

title: AID URGED TO AVERT TRANSITFARE RISE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 16 (UPI)The head of a special legislative commission plans today to urge legislators to earmark more than $9 million to head off proposed bus and railfare increases set to go into effect Dec. 1.

title: Computers Help Reduce Corporation Phone Bills
description: When telephone bills skyrocket everyone cries ouch. But when the tab hits $10,000 a month, or even $1.25 million, big business has an option not available to most people. It can curb soaring costs with a new type of minicomputer that achieves savings of $2,000 to $50,000 a month.

title: Tax Imperatives
description: Governor Carey's proposal for more than $1 billion new taxes presents agonizing choicesnone of them pleasantto legislators who will be reconvening in Albany today to try to complete a complex program save New York City and State from bankruptcy.

title: DOUGLAS AHLSTEDT IS ALMAVIVA AT MET
description: Douglas Ahlstedt, who recently moved into the role of Almaviva in the Metropolitan Opera production of Rossini's II Barbiere di Siviglia, appeared in it for the second! !time in the performance of the work given Saturday night. He was part of an othcrwisc familiar cast that included Kostas Paskalis (Figaro), Costanza Cuccaro (Rosins), Fernando Corena (Bartolo) and Jerome Hines (Basilio). John: Nelson conducted.

title: Amex Favors Joint Clearing
description: The American Stock Ex,change said yesterday that it had tentatively approved plans to merge the stockclearing facilities of the Amex, the New York Stock Exchange and the National Association of Securities Dealers into a single, clearing system. Paul Kolton. Amex chairman, said the merger could save the industry several million dollars a year.

title: Princeton Trustees Turn Down Plans to Establish Law School
description: PRINCETON, Nov. 16Princeton University's trustees, in a meeting this weekend, rejected the idea of establishing a law school here in the near future. The decision came after the completion of a report, which the trustees commissioned a year ago, to examine the possibilities of legal education at Princeton.

title: Japan's Rail Workers Plan Walkout for Right to Strike
description: TOKYO, Nov. 16 (Reuters) Workers of the staterun Japan National Railways have decided to start a threeday walkout on Nova 26, to demand the right to strike.

title: Federal Employees Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP)Total civilian employment by the United States Government was 2,877,694 in September with the civilian payroll at approximately $3.4 billion the Civil Service Commission said today. The September employment figure was 25,658 less than August but 10,790 more than in September 1974.

title: REV. E. M. BASKERVILLE
description: The Rev. Edward M. Baskerville, a Maryknoll missionarysurgeon, died Friday, apparently of a heart attack, at the Maryknoll Center near Ossining, N. Y. He was 61 years old.

title: Christmas Catalogues Clutter the Coffee Table, Boggle the Mind
description: Like a counterpart of the first robin of spring, it arrives, brazen in its earliness, not long after Labor Daythe first of the Christmas catalogues.

title: In Memurian
description: IPSCHITZHarris, Deaest Father, who left us 10 years ago today in be with Mother. Your modesty, your intelhoent ways aol sunse of humor ran never he Inruotton You arc always in our thounnts L helm

title: Abracadabra's End
description: ALBANY, Nov. 15Befuddled New Yorkers who have been trying to understand all the semantics and politics of the citystate fiscal crisis will soon be able to grasp the issue in the simple coin of their realmtaxes.

title: Dolphin Streak Ended, 2019, By Bubba Smith and Oilers
description: When Coach Don Shula was heading the Baltimore Colts during the 1960's, one of his most valuable performers was Bubba Smith, the 6foot7inch defensive end. Shula, who has been coaching the Miami Dolphins since 1970, was reminded yesterday of the massive defensive talents of Smith, who 1 is now playing for the Houston Oilers.

title: Cavanagh Forced Out by Elusive Rumors, Mayor Indicates
description: No one, said Mayor Beamenot bankers, not businessmen, not the Governor's representa tivesever admitted to him any dissatisfaction with James A. Cavanagh, his first deputy, his closest friend in government and the man the Mayor was forced to nudge out of his city job over the weekend.

title: The Sinful Saga of Abe Attell
description: Abe Attell, featherweight champion of the world and architect of the World Series fix in 1919, was a great friend of Phil Bieber. A master boxer, dedicated gambler and tireless schemer, Abe had more than 170 bouts and lost only 10, some unintentionally. His record with Harry Forbes out of Rockford, Ill., reflects his modus operandi. When Terry McGovern and Young Corbett moved up into the lightweight division Abe fought George Dixon for the vacant title in Cripple Creek, Colo., where they went 20 rounds a draw. Eight days later Abe beat Dixon St. Louis and a week after that he lost a 15round nontitle match with Forbes in St. Louis. Next they fought a sixround draw Chicago. Then a sixround draw in Indianapolis. Then they went hack to St. Louis with Abe's title on the line. In the fifth round, Forbes was one with Nineveh and Tyre.

title: Guy B. Wheeler Jr., Officer Of Gould and Aldine Paper
description: Guy R. Wheeler Jr., executive vice president of the Gould Paper Corporation and president of the Aldine Paper Company died of cancer Saturday in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 115 Hilis Lane, Westport, Conn.

title: Two Killed in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 16 (UPI)Two more lives were lost in violence over the weekend, but rival factions of the Irish Republican Army apparently called off their bloody street war.

title: Factories Widen Search For Winter's Fuel Supply
description: Talking about a natural gas shortage in the middle of the winter makes people like Ray M. Stephens in Danville, Va., shudder.

title: Gorman Defeats Mayer
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 16 (AP) Tom Gorman of Seattle beat Alex Mayer of Wayne, N. J., 63, 61, 61, in the men's singles final today and captured the $10,000 first prize in the Citizens Tennis Classic.

title: Watson Retains Club Pro Title
description: PINE MOUNTAIN. Ga.. Nov. 16Roger Watson sank a 21foot birdie putt today on the first hole of a sudden= death playoff and v on the club pro championship of the Professional Golfers Association. He made up a deficit of five strokes in 13 holes to tie David Jiminez at. 279 in the 72 holes of regulation play.

title: Personal Finance
description: With New York City's precarious financial situation focusing attention on the entire municipal securities market, investors have become more conscious about the safety of notes and bonds.

title: Study Finds Declining Cities Pay More for Services
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16Public services cost proportionally more in the largest cities and in those with declining populations, the very places that generally have a lessening ability to pay for them, according to a new study of the finances of urban areas.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: State Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran has asked Blue Shield to join a program aimed at reducing medical costs in New Jersey by eliminating unnecessary surgery.

title: REAGAN IS TERMED FLORIDA FAVORITE
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 16Even before announcing his candidacy, former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has emerged as the clear favorite over President Ford in the pivotal Florida primary election.

title: ALBANY SESSION MAY BE EXTENDED UNTIL NEXT WEEK
description: Addition of Medicaid Reform to Agenda and G.O.P. View of Budget Hint of Delay

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Ive been sending your recipes for many years to my daughter in Alaska, Joseph Slotnik of White Plains writes. Now she asks me out a formula for one of the YIddish delights, bialys, known in English as a water roll.

title: 2 Girls Die in Rescue Attempt
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa, Nov. 16 (UPI)Three children were killed today when they were trapped in one room of a burning duplex, and the authorities said they had not ruled out arson as a cause of the fire. Two of the victimsDeide Brown, 9 years old, and Stephanie Rand, 11, her babysitterwere rescued by a neighbor, but went back into the house in an attempt to save Deide's 11monthold brother.

title: Flyers Victors By 31
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 16 (UPI)  Bob Kelly, Rick MacLeish and Gary Bornhoefer scored one goal each tonight to carry the Philadelphia Flyers to a 31 victory over the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Woman State Senator Seeks Scott's Seat in U.S. Senate,
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Nov. 16 (UPI)  Jeanette Reibman, 60, years old, the only woman in the Pennsylvania Senate, announced today that she was. seeking the 1976 Democratic nomination for the United States Senate seat held by Hugh Scott a Republican.

title: 8 Die in Pakistani Collision
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 16 (UPI)Eight persons were killed and 18 injured today when a train collided with bus at a railroad crossing near here, the police reported. Eleven of the injured are in serious condition, hospital authorities said.

title: Police Find Explosives In Port, Search QE2
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England, Nov. 16 (AP)The police discovered a 400pound cache of explosives in a store in this port city today, detained 42 persons for questioning and ordered a deckbydeck search of the luxury liner QE2.

title: News Summary and Index
description: At the sixnation economic meeting at the Chateau de Rambouillet near Paris, the United States and France yesterday reached a compromise agreement on their dispute over exchange rates and President Ford invited foreign countries to invest in new energy development in the United States. Mr. Ford's invitation carried a promise of a share in the new energy production. The agreement on exchange rates reportedly would allow both fixed exchange rates, favored by France, and a floating system for the dollar, which the United States has insisted upon. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Study Finds I.R.S. Unequal In Treatment of Taxpayers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The treatment of American taxpayers by the Internal Revenue Service frequently is whimsical, inconsistent, unpredictable and highly personal, according to a yearlong Federal study made public today.

title: Edmonton Wins C.F.L. West Title
description: EDMONTON. Alberta, Nov. 16 (UN)The Edmonton Fskimos scored three touchdowns in the final quarter to heat the Saskatchewan Roughriders, 3018. todly and win the Western. Conference Title in the Canadian Football I vague. The victory advanced Edmonton to the Grey Cop championship against the Montreal Alouettes.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Reexamining Arms Aid
description: An inevitable reaction to the United Nations General Assembly vote branding Zionism as a form of racism will be far closer Congressional scrutiny of the various aid commitments of the United States to foreign countries. If governments choose to bid for Arab money by voting to promote racism and antiSemitism, destroy human rights and to undermine the United Nations itself, they can well expect a corresponding sense of outrage and loss of sympathy in this country.

title: Bing Out for 2 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP)Dave Bing of the Bullets will he sidelined for two months with a knee injury suffered last night in a game with the Philadelphia 76ers, the Washington club ant ounced today. A spokesman said Bing, who was acquired from the Detroit Pistons in August, broke a hone in his right knee in a collision with Billy Cunningham with 38 seconds left the fourth quarter of the National Basketball Association game. The 76ers won, 110109, in three overtime periods.

title: Woman Plans Political Bid
description: BOSTON, Nov. 16 (AP)Ellen McCormack, a housewife from Merrick, L.I., who is active in the righttolife move ment, said today she would: seek entry into the Massachusetts Democratic Presidential primary election on March 2 She told a news conference during a meeting of the ProLife Action Committee that people, not judges, should be making the basic value judgmenus about the future of our country.

title: Local Economy Sags as Volcanic Mount Baker Keeps Steaming
description: CONCRETE, Wash.,Mour Baker, the snowcapped, 10,77Sfoot dormant volcano near here that began showing signs of a vigorous new life last spring, continues to steam heavily now while scientists monitor developments on the peak with radios, airplanes and satellites.

title: FRANCO'S CONDITION STILL VERY GRAVE
description: MADRID. Nov. 16 (AP) Generalissimo Francisco Franco remained in very grave condition today.

title: Brask Wins in Golf
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Nov. 16 (AP)Billy Brask of the L'nitad SLates shot a 71 today and won the 535,000 New Zealand Golf Tournament with a 276 total, Iwo over par.

title: Northern Syria Finds New Prosperity, Thanks to Help From Its Neighbors
description: MEDINAT al THAWRA, Syria, Nov. 10In far Palmyra the donkey carts have new Japanese rubber tires. Tall grain silos are rising. The flow of the Euphrates makes huge turbines hum.

title: PHILIP MALLORY, 90, INDUSTRIALIST, DIES
description: Philip Rogers Mallory, founder and honorary chairman of P. R. Mallory & Company of Indianapolis and former chairman of Mystic Seaport Inc., the restoration of the Connecticut village seaport of the early days of the nation, died yesterday at his home on Fishers Island, N. Y. He was 90 years old.

title: Card of Thanks
description: TEIERThe family of Mrs. Esther Stele,. To ad those who knew her, loved her ? ? ? us in her ? we ? you. She is none but never forgotten. ? and Jeffrey ? and family,

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Federal Employees Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP)Total civilian employment by the United States Government was 2,877,694 in September, with the civilian payroll at approximately $3.4 billion, the Civil Service Commission said today. The September employment figure was 25,658 less than August but 10,790 more than in September 1974.

title: Article 80091844 -- No Title
description: By WALLACE TURNER Special to The New York Times

title: Arthur Morgan of Antioch, First T.V.A. Head, Dies
description: XENIA, Ohio, Nov. 16 (AP)Arthur E. Morgan, the first chairman of the Tennessee Valley Authority and president 3meritus of Antioch College, died today in a nursing home here. He was 97 years old.

title: Hartford Battles Suburbs for Federal Aid
description: HARTFORDThis city, by an unusal legal action that has blocked seven of its suburbs from collecting more than $4 million in Federal community development funds, has jeopardized several fragile efforts in citysuburban cooperation.

title: Israel Would Go to Geneva
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 16Israel said today that it would accept a Soviet proposal for reconvening of the Geneva conference on the Middle East if Syria agreed first to renewal of the mandate of the United Nations peacekeeping force on the Golan Heights.

title: TV: 3Hour Guilty or Innocent: Sheppard Murder Case
description: The matter, unquestionably depressing, is one of priorities. Early Saturday evening, I went to the movies to see Ingmar Bergman's enchanting interpretation of The Magic Flute. Long lines of people waited patiently to see a production made specifically for television. In Sweden, evidently, broadcasters believe that the combination of Bergman and Mozart deserves nearly two and a half hours of TV time.

title: ...and Economic Aid, Too
description: American economic and development aid is another matter. The pending $1.3 billion authorization bill for development assistance, which goes to conference committee in a few days, will still leave the World's richest nation near the bottom of the list of aid contributors in percentage of gross national product. In 1961 the United States gave 51 percent of all the world's development aid; it was 19 percent in 1974. The rejection by half of black Africa and other third world countries of the American campaign in the U.N. against the antiZionist resolution doubtless reflects, at least in part, the decline of stature that has accompanied the decline in American generosity toward the world's impoverished people.

title: Extent of Rise in Auto Sales. Seems Uncertain
description: DETROIT, Nov. 16l need cars. I'm short all along the line, Ross Moody. ?? ?? ager of Jack Cautez let, said. It's been our or five years since ?? e been this short of cars.

title: STABILIZING SEEN FOR FED'S POLICY
description: Expectations Result From Brighter City Outlook and Surge in Money Supply

title: In Revolt's Wake, a Lisbon Family Gets Involved
description: LISBON, Nov. 16  We were apathetic people but the revolution has shaken us up and now we feel we can do something, Humberto Borges said the other day.

title: U. S. SAYS ACCORD ON CURRENCY RIFT WITH PARIS IS SET
description: PARIS, Nov. 16The United States and France reached a compromise agreement on their dispute over monetary exchange rates today and President Ford invited foreign countries to invest in new energy development in America.

title: Hudson,Mich.,Is No. 1 in Football
description: HUDSON. Mich., Nov. 16This was no ordinary football game. Everybody watching the game in the crisp November sunshine knew that.

title: Miss Hearst Is Termed Cooperative
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Nov. 16 (AP)  Patricia Hearst received today her second jail visit from a British expert on brainwashing. Dr. William W. Sargent, who reported her extremely cooperative.

title: Beame Chooses Zuccotti For First Deputy Mayor
description: John E. Zuccotti, the chairman of the City Planning Commission and one of Mayor Beame's closest advisers, has been chosen to succeed James A. Cavanagh as First Deputy Mayor on Jan. 1, City Hall officials said yesterday.

title: Freed Foe of Mrs. Gandhi Says Regime Seeks Talks
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 16 (AP)Jaya Prakash Narayan, the first opposition leader released from detention since Prime Minister Indira Gandhi imposed a state of emergency five months ago, said today the Government wanted to talk with him on ways to end India's political crisis.

title: Dorsett Is Third MajorCollege Runner to Top 4,000 Yards
description: Pittsburgh's Tony Dorsett became the third majorcollege football player in history to gain more than 4,000 yards rushing in a career Saturday when he picked up 303 yards against Notre Dame. His performance gave Pitt a stunning 3420 upset over the Irish and put the Panthers into the Sun Bowl game at El Paso, Tex., Dec. 26.

title: About NewYork: Plaudits For a Silver Anniversary
description: Roberta Peters, a Bronx girl who took the D train to overnight stardom 25 years ago today, will be honored between the acts at the Metropolitan Opera tonight.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Margate police officer was killed and another was slightly injured when their patrol car and a civilian car collided during a highspeed chase, authorities reported. The police said Sgt. Richard L. Himber, 32 years old, was killed during the chase, which began in Margate and ended in Atlantic City about 3:45 A.M. Sergeant Himber's partner, Patrolman Frank Tieman, was treated for minor back and leg injuries at Atlantic City Medical Center.

title: To day's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Horses listed In order of post onsitiona Letter designates OTB listing

title: Bridge:
description: A young New YorkPhiladelphia foursome led into the final session of the Greater New York Bridge Association's Swiss team championship at the New York Hilton Hotel last night.

title: Bar Panel Praises Ford's List Of Possible High Court Choices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The Ford Administration's list of possible replacements for Supreme Court Justice William, O. Douglas is a good one which was responsibly drawn, the chairman of an American, Bar Association committee reviewing the names said today. Justice Douglas retired Wednesday.

title: STRIKE IS AVERTED AT THE DAILY NEWS
description: Negotiations for The New York Daily News and the Newspaper Guild of New York. reached a tentative contract, agreement last night, averting, a strike that had been set for 8 A.M. today.

title: Ballet: Jewels
description: Eight years after its premiere as what could be called the first threeact plotless ballet, George Balanchine's Jewels continues to be sold out, a fact confirmed by the New York City Ballet again Saturday night at the New York State Theater.

title: Sahara Agreement Is Viewed as a Triumph for Morocco's King
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 16The feeling in the diplomatic; community here is that the agreement Friday, under which Morocco and Mauritania will assume control of the Spanish Sahara, was a triumph for King Hassan II.

title: 1776 Lottery Begins Today
description: Tickets for the new state lottery game, based on a Bicentennial theme and featuring a grand prize of $1,776 a week for life, are to go on sale today at 4,000 retail stores throughout the state.

title: California and Hawaii Feel Series of Weekend Quakes
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 16 (UP)Residents of earthquake areas from Northern to South ern California and in Hawaii. shook off today a series of: weekend tremors that left them unnerved but unscathed.

title: New York Infirmary Reenacts a Centennial Event
description: I looked on this hospital as my family, my husband, my children, my lifetime goal, my reason for being born, said the character of Dr. Elizabeth Blackwell in a dramatized celebration yesterday marking New York Infirmary's 100 years of serving the sick from Stuyvesant Square.

title: Vilas Tops Panatta in TennisFinal
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 16 (AP)Guillermo Vilas of Argentina defeated Italy's Adriano Panatta, 61, 64, 64 today to win the men's singles title at the Argentine open.

title: Russians Report 2 Satellites Doing Well in Orbit of Venus
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 16 (UPI)Two satellites placed in orbit around Venus last month as part of a twin probe by the Russians of earth's nearest planetary neighbor are still functioning normally, a leading scientist said today.

title: AWOL G.I. Out Gets Tests
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 16 (UPI)Veto Baker, 27 years old, who went AWOL for love and apparently was the last American to leave South Vietnam, spent his first full day back in America today undergoing medical tests and conferring with his lawyer. Mr. Baker arrived at Hickam Air Force Base with the woman he deserted for, his Vietnamese commonlaw wife) Mai, and their three children.

title: Poll Shows 45% of Americans Back Loan Guarantees for City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16With the Federal Government now apparently ready to help New York City avert default, the results of a national poll reported yesterday by the Gallup organization suggest that the majority of Americans favor Federal loan guarantees for the city.

title: Bottle Sill Gets Signatures
description: NEWTON, Mass., Nov. 16 (AP)Backers of a bill that would ban nonreturnable bevlerage containers say they have collected 40,000 signatures in Ian effort to bring the measure, before the Massachusetts legislature. Norman Stein, an associate with the Massachusetts Public Interest Research Group, said 56,000 signatures must be collected by Dec. 3 to put the petition before the lawmakers.

title: EVIDENCE IS DUE IN SUFFOLK CASE
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Nov. 16The special state prosecutor for Suffolk County will reportedly present evidence to a grruxi jury investigating the county's Police Commissioner and the District Attorney that could result in the grand jury's cerfsuring both officials for ethical misconduct.

title: Mexico City Disturbance
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 16 (Reuters)  A total of 211 people were in jail awaiting trial today after a night of looting and violence in a working class district of Mexico City. The police said hundreds of youths roamed through the normally quiet district of San Juan de Aragon looting stores, hijacking buses and beating up pedestrians. One youth was shot to death by a liquor store owner.

title: Church in Brooklyn Destroyed by Flames
description: A Roman Catholic church: that had been a Brooklynlandmark since 1897 was destroyed last night by a spectacular threealarm fire that burned out of control for more than three hours.

title: Ribicoff and Long Complain Of U.S. Diplomatic Method
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) Two Democratic Senators have called on American leaders to establish an atmosphere of candor, trust and cooperation with other industrialized countries.

title: An Increase in Vandalism Prompts Statewide Parley
description: PARAMUS, Nov. 16DiMaggio Park is a small carefully landscaped children's playground surrounded by immaculately groomed homes in a quiet; residential corner of this Bergen County borough. The neighborhood could be a model of suburban order and pride.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: For week ended Nov. 15, 1975) UTILITY BONDS

title: Anthony Sanchez Weds Ellen Karsh
description: Ellen Karsh, a teacher of mentally retarded children here, and Anthony Sanchez, a history teacher at Martin van Buren High School in Jamaica, Queens, were married yesterday afternoon. Rabbi Edward Klein performed the ceremony in the Stephen Wise Free Synagogue.

title: Dead Man Will Receive. State Law License
description: Daniel J. Borcher, who died last month at the age of 28, is to be admitted posthumously to the New Jersey Bar this month.

title: Wille Will Step Down As F.D.I.C. Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 16 Frank Wille, chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, announced today that he would leave office at the end of his term, which expires next March 16.

title: COMMUNISTS HOLD BIG LISBON RALLY
description: LISBON, Nov. 16Communistled unions staged a major show of strength here today and demanded the resignation of Prime Minister Jos Batista Pinheiro de Azevedo.

title: Spanish Regions Bitter At Ruling on Languages
description: MADRID, Nov. 16A Government decree declaring regional languages  notably Catalan, Basque and Galicianto be national languages and deserving of protection was greeted today as a step backward in parts of the country where they are spoken.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of misinformation by a legal secretary, the lawyer who gave a sworn deposition that the Gulf Oil Corporation had made regular contributions to Senator Hugh Scott was incorrectly identified in The New York Times Saturday. The deposition was given by Thomas D. Wright of the firm of Eckert, Seamans, Cherin & Mellott in Pittsburgh.

title: Output Is Surging In Textile Industry
description: Textile industry sales, which fell more sharply than those of any other industry during the recession in 1974 and early 1975, are now showing one of the largest in creases in the current recovery. Renewed consumer interest in apparel and home furnishings has been a boon Co textile employment.

title: John Clarke Mattimore, 59, Marketing Official at Time
description: John Clarke Mattimore, founder in 1965 and president of Selling Areas Marketing Inc., a marketing subsidiary of Time Inc., until 1972, when he retired, died of cancer yesterday at Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 122 Stamford Avenue, Stamford.

title: Imprinting TShirts Is Saturday Fun For a Whole Family
description: A few hours earlier, students at an allday Y.M.C.A. workshop had hardly known a squeegee from a stencil. But here they were imprinting, with a reasonable amount of expertise, snappy designs on Tshirts.

title: Debra Ruth Kamesar Wed to Arthur Peyser
description: Temple Torah in Little Neck, Queens, was the setting yesterday evening for the marriage of Debra Ruth Kamesar, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry E. Kamesar of the Bronx, to Arthur Elliot Peyser, son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Peyser of Hillside, N. J. Rabbi Harry Lasker performed the ceremony.

title: MAYOR APPOINTS A CHARTER GROUP
description: Mayor Beanie, who failedi to persuade voters to reject changes in New York City's Charter, has named a 22member task force to begin in earnest the work of implementing the reforms, City Hall announced yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: Put aside your private guilt for a moment, Ernest van Den Haag suggests, and you may be able to look more objectively at the problem of criminal guilt. Instead of asking am I my brother's keeper, perhaps you should be asking whether you are not his victim. Our sentimentality about what is currently called a human being seems to have attached itself to the criminal without extending to his prey.

title: Sammartino Wins
description: Bruno Sammartino, the World Wide Wrestling Federation champion, defeated Ivan Koloft before 22,090 fans last night in Madison Square Garden.

title: Colt's Death Spurs Hospital Plan Here
description: Ruffian injured at Belmont, died across the street in a private clinic where a delicate operation couldn't save the great filly.

title: Recruits Leaving Vermont ChickenProcessing Plant
description: SOUTH ROYALTON, Vt.My parents were refugees, and grandparents, too. Uncles, aunts, everybody, Harold Jacobs was saying in the office of his chicken slaughterhouse here. On the Lower East Side of New York they were working in sweat shops.

title: Why I Left the U.S. And Why I Am Returning
description: PARIS

title: Japan Payments Deficit Up
description: TOKYO, Nov. 17 (Reuters)Japan's balanceofpayments deficit soared to $800 million in October, from $104 million the month before, according to preliminary figures released by the Finance Ministry today.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Jobless Pay in Pregnancy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The Supreme Court ruled today that states may not refuse unemployment benefits women during their last three months of pregnancy and the six weeks following delivery simply because the states presume that all such women are unable to work.

title: Quarterly Net Soars at 5 Retail Chains, Due Partly to Lower Interest Expense
description: Thirdquarter profits soared at five of the country's largest retail chains, showing both record results and the best quarterly gains of the year.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 18, 1975

title: Bid to Cut Name in Report on C.I.A. Fails
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17A Federal District judge ruled today that the publication of a report on Central Intelligence involvement in political assassinations might endanger the life of a former C.I.A. official but refused to order the man's, name deleted on jurisdictional; grounds.

title: Season of Content
description: The principle of longrange funding of public broadcasting by Congress is a little closer to achievementand this is bound to have a salutary effect all down the line to the 260 local TV stations, including Channel 13, which is having one of its strongest seasons in years a time when programming on the commercial networks is in the creative doldrums.

title: CHRYSLER OFFER TO BRITAIN SEEN
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17  The Chrysler Corporation is prepared to turn over the property, plants, equipment and assets of Chrysler United Kingdom to the British Government, company sources said today, if the Government would agree to take over the financiallydistressed subsidiary.

title: For Economic Health
description: PARIS, Nov. 17The leaders of six of the nonCommunist world's richest countries rang the expected note of optimism as they went home today after their weekend economic meeting News at nearby RamAnalysis bouillet. They promised they would act to reduce unemployment, keep recovery moving and prevent a renewed surge of inflation.

title: Planner With Great Patience
description: Wearing a worn necktie emblazoned with tiny profiles of Don Quixote, John Eugene Zuccotti, chairman of the City Planning Commission and a holdover from John

title: STATE UNIT URGES 10% WELFARE CUT
description: A ninemember bipartisan state commission has recommended cutting welfare grants by 10 percent and reducing Medicaid eligibility and optional services so that $466.6 million a year may be trimmed from state and local welfare and Medicaid costs.

title: Western Union Tariff Bids
description: MAHWAH, NJ., Nov. 17 (UPI)Western Union has filed two tariff revisions with the Federal Communications Commission. One would cut to $2.50 from $5.25 the charge to a sender of a telegram for confirmation of delivery. The other involves notifying by telephone recipients of money orders by credit card that the funds are available. The charge for the service would be 25 cents. Western Union plans to make the revisions efiectivs Dec. 15.

title: Presidential Decree Extends India's Emergency Powers
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 17 (Reuters)The Indian Government has extended its emergency powers of arrest by presidential decree.

title: Music: A Chamber Risk
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center offered an even more unusual program than normal on Sunday in Alice Tully Hall (to be repeated tonight at 7:30). And the society showed laudable, even reckless faith in its subscribers by programming the SchoenbergWebern Chamber Symphony (Op. 9) last, thus risking a mass walkout of those horrified by not one but two bogeynames. As it happened, only a small number actually did leave, which means that the society's subscribers may be nearly as sophisticated as they think they are.

title: Surgery for Bench
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov 17Johnny Bench of the Cincinnati Reds, baseball's toprated catcher, underwent surgery today to correct a shoulder injury he suffered during a collision at home plate in the first two weeks of the season. He is expected to recover in time for spring training.

title: ATHEROSCLEROSIS REVERSED IN TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17A drug under study for its cholesterollowering possibilities has reversed the process of atherosolerosis in monkeys, according to the results of a twoyear study by scientists at the University of Chicago made public today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: People and Business
description: A. Robert Abboud, has been elected chairman of the First Chicago Corporation and its wholly owned subsidiary, the First National Bank of Chicago, the nation's eighth largest.

title: Concerts
description: Robert Bernstein a local classical music promoter, opened a new series of concerts Sunday night at Carnegie Hall. The series has two innovations: each is a double recital and none will be paperedin other words, no free seats will be given out to fill unsold spaces.

title: Stocks at 4Month High As Average Rises 2.99
description: After fluctuating in a narrow range for most of the session, the stock market closed moderately higher yesterday, with the Dow Jones average of 30 industrials closing at its best level since midJuly.

title: Philadelphia Parade Shifted
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 17 (AP) Philadelphia is rerouting its 56yearold Thanksgiving Day parade this year to show off its new transitway along Chestnut Street, which is off limits to cars. The parade usually marches down Market Street, one block north.

title: Publisher in Capital Says Strike Accord Not, a Sure Thing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (AP) It is not a sure thing that The Washington Post and striking pressmen can reach a settlement that is fair to both sides, Katharine Graham, the newspaper publisher, said today.

title: Cleaver Returning After 7Year Exile
description: PARIS, Nov. 17Eldridge Cleaver, a former leader of the Black Panther Party and a fugitive from American justice, will give himself up tomorrow in New York when he returns to his home country after seven years of exile.

title: THAI REPORTERS SEE A CAMBODIAN TOWN
description: POIPET, Cambodia, Nov. 17 (AP)Thai journalists had a brief look today at a Cambodian border town empty of people and scarred by fire.

title: Dr. Detlev Bronk Dies
description: Dr. Detlev W. Bronk, dent emeritus of Rockefeller University and former president of Johns Hopkins University, the National Academy of Sciences and the American Association for the Advancement of Science, died yesterday at 78. Page 40.

title: Bank Sues Over Debt Moratorium
description: The legality of the threeyear lebt moratorium enacted by the State Legislature for New fork City was challenged yeserday in a suit, which charges I hat the law amounted to an unconstitutional impairment of ontract and that the Depresion precedents cited by its Sponsors did not apply.

title: Michael Ayrton, Sculptor And Theater Designer, 54
description: LONDON, Nov. 17 (AP)Michael Ayrton, sculptor, writer and theater designer known for his interpretations of Greek legends, died today. He was 54 years old.

title: Douglas to Stay a Month in Stroke Unit
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 17Former Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas will be treated in a special stroke care unit here for as long as a month but he Is not expected to recover from the paralysis of his left side, his doctors said today.

title: Byrne Trades Cadillac For a Rented Lincoln
description: TRENTON, Nov. 17 (AP)Governor Byrne will be riding around the state in a brand new Lincoln Continental, but his office says the state will save money because the 1976 luxury automobile is a rentacar.

title: Bank Sues Over Debt Moratoriutii
description: The legality of the threeyear lebt moratorium enacted by the State Legislature for New fork City was challenged yeserday in a suit, which charges hat the law amounted to an unconstitutional impairment of contract and that the Depresion precedents cited by its sponsors did not apoly.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 17 (UP1)The dollar hit sixweek highs on all European money markets today, as the price of gold fell slightly, closing at $141.75 an ounce in London and $142 in Zurich, down 25 cents an ounce on both markets.

title: Japanese Who Struck Miki Gets 2Year Jail Sentence
description: TOKYO, Nov. 17The Tokyo District Court today sentenced to two years at hard labor a 35yearold rightist who 11 attacked Prime Minister Takeo Miki last June at the state fuineral for former Prime Minister Eisaku Sato.

title: TREASURY ISSUES BOUGHT BY FED
description: The Federal Reserve supplied permanent reserves to the banking system yesterday in a move apparently designed to show it had not changed its recent policy of less restraint.

title: COPPERPRICE DIP TARGET OF TALKS
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 17 (AP)The world's major copperexporting nations met today in search of ways to combat the 65 percent decline in copper prices, possibly through creation of a buffer stock to regulate the amount of copper available.

title: 6 NATIONS PLEDGE ECONOMIC STEPS TO END THE SLUMP
description: RAMBOUILLET, France, Nov. 17Leaders of the United States, Japan and four Western European industrial powers pledged today to work closely together to assure the recovery of their economies and put them on a course of growth that is steady and lasting.

title: Nation's Treasure House
description: The Library of Congress is the nation's intellectual treasure house containing more than 75 million books, prints and other items. It is of indispensable assistance to Congress itself through factual analyses of legislative issues and provides the public with specialized services too numerous to mention.

title: Spain Fails to Persuade Algeria To Accept Sahara Agreement
description: MADRID, Nov. 17Spain has failed to persuade Algeria to accept an agreement reached last week by which Spanish Sahara, now under Spanish administration, will be turned over to Morocco and Mauritania.

title: Dance: Weekend to Delight Terpsichore
description: A weekend of New York dance is like a week of dance in any other town. On Sunday night I saw the last of Viola Farber's performances at the highly successful unfurling of the Dance Umbrella at the Roundabout Theater's Stage Onebut that was merely the finale of a dance orgy.

title: Inflationary Trend Easing In Buildina Trades Waaes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI) Union wages and benefits for urban building trades workers averaged $10.67 an hour on Oct. 1, a 9.6 percent increase over a year earlier the Labor Department reported today.

title: Soviet Spurs Support to Luanda And Restores Ties With Uganda
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 17The Soviet Union has thrown the weight of its diplomatic prestige behind the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola in an effort to help the proMarxist faction triumph over its two rivals in the war for control of the newly independent African state.

title: FUTURES IN GOLD OFF $2 AN OUNCE
description: Gold futures contracts dropped more than $2 an ounce yesterday after a rumor circulated early in the trading session on the Commodity Exchange that the United States Treasury might hold another gold auction before the end of the year. The Treasury held two gold auctions earlier this year, with the idea of keeping a lid on churning gold prices and also with the idea of stressing its advocacy of less monetary reliance on gold.

title: BUFFALO TV PLANS A JAM
description: The Federal Communications Commission has advised three television stations in Buffalo, in a preliminary determination, that it would not be a violation of international law for them to jam their own signals to keep them from being picked up by cableTV systems in Canada.

title: Vietnamese Refugees Seeking to Stay in a Group Pose Resettlement Problem
description: FORT CHAFFEE, Ark., Nov. 16  Nguyen Van Hut, a stocky, 40yearold Vietnamese fisherman, looked discouraged as he sat awkwardly on the edge of an army cot and tried to explain his frustration after six months in the refugee camp here.

title: U. S. Discounts Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (Reuters)United States officials said today there was no indication that Indian forces were involved in continuing clashes between guerrillas and Government troops along the Bangladesh border.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975, by Triangle Publication Inc. (The Dally Racing Form)

title: CHESSIE IN ACCORD ON BUYING TRACKAGE
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 17 (AP)The Chessie System's board of directors voted today to accept conditionally an offer to buy from the United States Railway Association 2,185 miles of railroad, plus trackage rights over an additional 744 miles, for $54.5 million.

title: Delaney Captures India Net Opener
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 17 (AP)  Jim Delaney of the United States defeated Anand Amritraj of India, 62, 64, today in the first round of the India Grand Prix lawn tennis championships.

title: Jersey Intensifying StreetCrime Drive
description: TRENTON, Nov. 17Citing occasional excessive leniency on the part of some judges, Chief Justice Richard J. Hughes of the State Supreme Court issued a series of guidelines today as part of an effort to make prosecutors and the courts to get tougher with defendants accused of violent street crimes.

title: Harry J. Anslinger Dies at 83; HardHitting Foe of Narcotics
description: Harry J. Arrslinger, an implacable, hardhitting foe of drug pushers and users during the 32 years he was the Treasury Department's Commissioner of Narcotics, died Friday in Hollidaysburg, Pa. His age was 83.

title: Soviet Said to Press Syria for Golan Extension
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17The Soviet Union has urged Syria to consent to another extension of the military buffer zone arrangement in the Golan Heights, and prefers Secretary General Kurt Waldheim rather than Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger to work out such an accord, a United Nations source said today.

title: Chilean President Asks Disbandment Of a Church Group
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 17 (AP)The Interchurch Committee of Cooperation for Peace, formed after the 1973 military coup to aid relatives of leftists who were arrested or disappeared, said today that it had been asked to disband by President Aueusto Pinochet.

title: Bavarian Farmers: Tireless Struggle, a Losing Battle
description: STEINBACH  AN  DER HOLZECKE, West Germany Close to 11 P.M. the other night, when one of Karl Stoll's 22 milk cows was still unable to calve after four hours of strain, Mr. Stoll decided he needed help. His wife, Anne, and their 19yearold son Friedrich went across the village's main road to get their neighbor, Hans Langkammerer. Together, the four of them pulled the new calf out into the world at midnight.

title: Nixon Says Peril to U.S. Lives Might Restore Sense of Belief
description: Former President Richird M.I Nixon said in an interview conducted last May and published yesterday that Americans had become so cynical that it might take the shock of an invasion in a country where American lives would be threatened to restore a sense of belief in the nation.

title: Buckley Marks 20 Years Of The National Review
description: Buckley Marks 20 Years Of The National Review

title: MISTRIAL IS SOUGHT FOR MISS FROMME
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 17The lawyer for Lynnette Alice Fromme, angrily contending that the prosecution had wilfully suppressed evidence, filed a motion today to dismiss the case and won an adjournment of the trial until Wednesday.adjournment of a week to study reports by some 60 witnesses to the incident that the prosecution turned over to Mr. Virga on Friday. Instead, Judge MacBride gave him a twoday recess.

title: 25 Democrats Sue U.S. on Arab Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (AP) Twentyfive Democratic members of the House of Representatives filed a suit today accusing two Government departments of encouraging American] companies to participate in an Arab boycott of Israel in violation of Congresslonal law.

title: Madrid Seizes Six Reds in Crackdown
description: MADRID, Nov. 17The arrests of leftists that has marked the transition of power from Generalissimo Francisco Franco to Prince Juan Carlos de Borbin continued yesterday with the jailing of at least six members of the clandestine Spanish Communist Party.

title: The Housing Crisis
description: At some point, when New York has tither ceased its daily trip to the edge of the precipice or it has become routine procedure, some of the issues involved, are going to be recognized for their larger implications. The important fact is that New York's problems are national in scope, alarmingly resistant to solution and increasing in severity. When the preoccupation with original municipal sin and appropriate suffering has faded, a much bigger reckoning will have to be faced.

title: DAVID P.DAWSON,62, VIOLIST AT INDIAN AU.
description: David P. Dawson, a member of the Berkshire String Quartet since 1948 and professor of vinla at the Indiana University School of Music, died Sunday in Bloomington (Ind.) Hospital after a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: State High Court to Hear Appeal by Quinlan Family
description: MORRISTOWN, Nov. 17The parents of Karen Anne Quinlan today filed an appeal of the court decision that denied their request to turn, off, the respirator that is sustaining the life of their comatose daughter.

title: Market Place
description: Some observers believe that the options exchanges established over the last two and a half years have enriched more brokers than customers.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market closed mixed yesterday in quiet trading.

title: Expertise Enhances Musicianly Singing By Janice Harsanyi
description: Janice Harsanyi should be saluted for her enterprise in devoting her entire Alice Tully Hall recital to contemporary songs Sunday, and congratulations are due the soprano for the high expertise with which she delivered them. Her intelligent, musicianly singing was a glowing constant; she has developed communication to a fine art. But when a Webern group becomes the melodic high point of the program, the audience does not have an easy time of it.

title: F.D.I.C.'s Chairman Urges New Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (Reuters)  The chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, Frank Wille, urged today a restructuring of the present system of Federal Bank supervision that would eliminate his own agency.

title: Miss Moore Ruled Competent; Judge Refuses to Delay Trial
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 17Sara Jane Moore was found competent today to stand trial on the charge that she attempted to murder President Ford on Sept. 22.

title: Sudan Forms Courts to Try Defendants in Coup Attempt
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Nov. 17 (UPI)President Gilder alNimeiry has ordered the formation of two state security courts for the trial of 141 army officers, soldiers and civilians involved in an abortive coup, in; September, according to the Sudanese press agency.

title: Dr. Detlev Bronk Dies
description: Dr. Detlev W. Bronk, president emeritus of Rockefeller University and former president of Johns Hopkins University, the National Academy of Sciences and the American Association for the Advancement of Science, died yesterday at 78. Page 40.

title: Nadjari's Perjury Case Against Lawyer Dismissed
description: Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday threw out a perjury indictment against a Manhattan lawyer that had been brought by the office of Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state anticorruption prosecutor.

title: ThreeCount Contempt Citation Of Kissinger Defended in House
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 17 The chairman of the House Select Committee on Intelligence said today that it would press ahead with a threecount contempt citation of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger despite a State Department assertion that the panel had erred.

title: Bridge; The S Team (Including a G) Wins Swiss Tourney Here
description: The Swiss Team Championship of the Greater New York Bridge Association ended Sunday night at the New York Hilton Hotel in a victory for the S team: Sam Stayman, John Solodar, Jerry Shakofsky, Martin Scheinbergand Matt Granovetter, who is rumored to be changing his name to Sgranovetter.

title: A Summary of Actions Taken by the United States Supreme Court on a Variety of Matters
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Thai Sailor Reported Slain By Laotians on the Mekong
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 17 (Reuters)A Thai sailor was killed and another wounded today when Laotian troops opened fire on their patrol boat pn the Mekong River, radio Thailand reported.

title: The Progress of the Jets and Giants
description: At least the Jets are making progress. Three losses their final five games will assure a 410 wonlost record. That should assure a purge of the franchise, perhaps its sale. Allie Sherman, once the Giants coach, assembled group of buyers for the Jets in 1970, but the $18 million deal never materialized. But negotiations might resume soon. Publicly now, the Jets owners are embarrassed by what they have wrought. And the Jets followers, perhaps unwilling to accept Allie Sherman as president and general

title: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games
U.S. Seeks Curb on Unfair Export Aid
description: GENEVA, Nov. 17  The United States, in a major move at the world trade negotiations, has proposed an international accord to curb government sub, sidies that enable exporters to undercut unfairly their compet, itors in foreign markets.

title: Rural Water Lines a Mixed Blessing
description: GRAND FORKS, N.D.Perhaps the Romans found the same skepticism when they built their aqueducts.

title: India Denies Fighting
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 17 (AP)The Indian Government today denied reports of clashes on its border with Bangladesh but said that in an incident of utmost gravity a live grenade had been found on the grounds of the Indian High Commissioner's residence in Dacca.

title: Rural Water Lines a Mixed Blessing
description: GRAND FORKS, N.D.Perhaps the Romans found the same skepticism when they built their aqueducts.

title: Beirut, After Two Weeks of Truce, Begins to Bustle
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon,. Nov. 17 In a determined display of Monday  morning normality, Beirut's warweary citizens surged into the streets today and for the first time in two months heavy traffic clogged the downtown section, where banks were open.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Foreign Arms Expected to Prolong Lebanon Strife
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17United States officials who have been watching the armed struggle in Lebanon believe the flow of weapons and ammunition to the opposing sides there is so large and varied that, even despite the current calm, continuation of the civil conflict seems all but inevitable.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: FASHION TALK
description: Seventh Avenue has a new hero this week. He's not exactly an unknown. Three years ago John Anthony picked up a Winnie in the Coty Fashion Critics annual sweepstakes for affecting the course of fashion in 1972. But that was another race.

title: HELENA DEVEREUX
description: DEVON, Pa., Nov. 17 (UPI) Helena Devereux, a pioneer in the establishment of resi dential centers for the treatment of mentally retarded and emotionally disturbed children, died today at her home. She was 90 years old.

title: Francs and Beans
description: As chance would have it, the very evening Craig Claiborne ate his historic $4,000 dinner for two with 31 dishes and nine wines in Paris, Lucullan repast for one was prepared and consumed in New York by this correspondent, no slouch himself when it comes to titillating the palate.

title: Dr. Detlev W. Bronk, 78, Of Rockefeller U., Is Dead
description: Dr. Detlev Wulf Bronk, president emeritus of Rockefeller University and the former president of Johns Hopkins University, the National Academy of Sciences and the American Association for the Advancement of Science, died yesterday at New York Hosp ital. He was 78 years old.

title: Bottle Bill Gets Signatures
description: NEWTON, Mass., Nov. 16 (AP)Backers of a bill that would ban nonreturnable beverage containers say they have collected 40,000 signatures in an effort to bring the measure before the Massachusetts legislature. Norman Stein, an associate with the Massachusetts Public Interest Research Group, said 56,000 signatures must be collected by Dec. 3 to put the petition before the lawmakers.

title: InnerCity School Becomes Magnet
