description: SEOUL, South Korea American and other foreign bankers have been cocking an increasingly skeptical eye on big new loans to South Korea because of Seoul's rapidly mounting external debt and their own already sizable commitments.

title: Spain Without Franco
description: Francisco Franco Bahamonde, hated by many, loved by few but respected by most of his fellow countrymen, was a political leader of extraordinary qualities and staying power. Only such a man could have dominated the Spanish people for 36 years and steered the Spanish nation through the aftermath of civil war, the hazards World War II and the turbulent times since the end that conflict.

title: Card of Thank
description: WEBERThe family of the late ArthI Weiser wishes to express their deco appre elation and heartfelt thanks for the many, enressions of sympathy, condolences, ccompassion and understanding.

title: Office BuildingHotel for U.N. Is Opened
description: A 39story building, the first major structure in the city designated for both hotel and office use, was formally opened yesterday as the newest addition to the United Nations complex on First Avenue.

title: Reagan in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Nov. 20 Mr. Reagan made his fiist campaign effort in New Hampshire tonight with a town hallstyle meeting attended by about 1,000 Tersons in a motel convention center here.

title: New Education Standards Approved by State Board
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20  The State Board of Education today approved, by a vote of 10 to 2, a series of controversial new regulations for New Jersey's 607 local school districts, requiring them to provide a thorough and efficient education, as mandated by the State Supreme Court, for all public school children. The two negative votes were cast by members of the board Who objected to omission in the new rules of any minimum statewide standard for pupil proficiency in the basic skills of reading and mathematics.

title: Drivers Warned on Use Of Bicentennial Plates
description: TRENTON. Nov. 20 (AP) The New Jersey Division of Motor Vehicles has warned motorists not to put unauthorized Bicentennial license plates on their vehicles.

title: Reagan's Challenge for Leadership of Republican Party: The Assets and Liabilities
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20One of the more prominent Republican Governors telephoned an associate in Washington this noon. The Republican Governors Conference was about to begin. He said anxiously: What should he say about former Gov. Ronald Reagan's announcement of his Presidential candidacy this morning?

title: DATA MADE PUBLIC
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A bipartisan, select committee of the Senate reported today that officials of the United States Government instigated assassination plots against two foreign leaders and became embroiled in plotting that led to the deaths of three others.

title: Braves Win in Overtime
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 20 (AP) Bob McAdoo scored 50 points tonight as the Buffalo Braves erased a 23point deficit and beat the Cleveland Cavaliers, 118115, in overtime in a National Basketball Association flame.

title: CASH UNTIL DEC. 4 ASSURED FOR CITY
description: ALBANY, Nov. 20  New York City was assured today by State Comptroller Arthur Levitt that it would have the cash to meet its expenses through Dec. 3but only after a series of hurried negotiations and demands among city and state officials that threw into temporary jeopardy the city's ability to meet its payroll tomorrow.

title: Frank Puglia, 83, Actor Of Stage, Screen and TV
description: Frank Puglia, a character actor for more than 60 years on the stage, screen and television, died Oct. 25 in Pasadena, Calif. He was 83 years old.

title: Wednesday's Fight
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev.  Marvin Camel, Missoula, Mont., outpointed Danny Brewer, Perris, Calif., lightheavyweights, 10 rounds.

title: BENTSEN IS FACING TROUBLE IN TEXAS
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 20Senator Lloyd M. Bentsen Jr. looked last summer like a man who had just saddled up his home state of Texas and was ready to gallop into the Democratic National Convention with its delegation to enhance his Presidential bid, or at least do some serious bargaining.

title: Dairylea Is Indicted in Selling State Units Adulterated Milk
description: ALBANY, Nov. 20The Dairylea Milk Cooperative Inc. and three of its former officers have been indicted by a grand jury here on charges of selling adulterated milk to state institutions.

title: Contempt Trial Completed In CoOp City Fund Case
description: The contempt trial of leaders of Coop City residents who refuse to pay maintenancecharge increases ended yesterday .before Justice Alfred J. Callahan in State Supreme Court in the Bronx.

title: Reagan Enters Campaign, Seeks a Curb on Spending
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20  Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California officially announced today that he was a candidate for President, challenging Gerald R. Ford for leadership of the Republican Party. Declaring at a news conference in Washington that his candidacy in the primaries would be healthy for the party, the 64yearold former movie actor made it clear that his chief target would be not President Ford but a philosophy of governmental spending that he said contributed to the nation's economic woes.

title: Market Place
description: The St. Joe Mineral Corporation's decision on Tuesday to drop its plans to acquire the Austral Oil Company left arbitragers in an exposed position.

title: U. N. CYPRUS VOTE ANGERS THE TURKS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20The General Assembly approved a Cyprus resolution tonight over bitter opposition from Turkey, raising the possibility that the Turkish Cypriots would set up a separate, independent state on the Island.

title: ElectionFund Equality
description: In a significant interpretation of the new campaign finance law, the Federal Election Commission has now put corporations on virtually the same basis as labor unions in helping fund political candidates and in paying the expenses of the committees through which the contributions pass.

title: QE2 CARRIED. ARMS FOR I.RA.,POLICE SAY
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Queen Elizabeth 2 sailed for New York today with several hundred passengers as the police disclosed that they had evidence that the liner had been used for smuggling of Irish Republican Army guns and explosives from New York to Britain.

title: DANIEL S. GILLIVIOR, WRITER, DIES AT 58
description: Opposed Loyalty InquiriesAuthor of Fear the Accuser

title: I Ponder the Paradox
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla.Recently I received a letter from Watergate codefendant, now free. He wrote to recommend an attorney to represent me at my parole hearing, and was astonished when I replied that his suggestion was premature: would not even be eligible for parole until January 1977, some fourteen months away. At that time I will have completed 30 months of Federal imprisonment, the minimum term imposed in my eightyear sentence, plus $10,000 fine.

title: Ford 75 Political Travel Exempt From Cost Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Federal Election Commission ruled today that money spent to finance President Ford's political travel as an announced candidate in 1975 should not be charged against his 1976 campaign spending ceiling except in special cases.

title: The Pop Life
description: Their noses quivering, the popmusicbusiness mavens sniff continually for trends. If you can spot a trend, the thinking seems to run, you can make hits. Trendsearching is common in any bigmoney popularart industry, of course; witness the deluge of disaster epics, black ex.ploitation vehicles and the like. But with the low over head of pop and the short time required to conceive, produce and release a pop single, the eddies and shifts in popmusic trends come quicker and more manically than almost anywhere else.

title: Pope Offers Condolences; Asks Blessings for Spain
description: ROME, Nov. 20 (Reuters) Pope Paul VI sent condolences to Spain today on the death of Generalissimo Francisco Franco.

title: Franco Urged Spain In a Final Message To Maintain Unity
description: MADRID, Nov. 20Generalissimo Francisco Franco, in a message to his people made public on the day of his death, appealed for continued unity, warning that the enemies of Spain and of Christian, civilization are watching. General Franco, dictator of Spain for 36 years, died at 4:40 this morning. He would have been 83 years old on Dec. 4. With the death, Spain prepared to usher in a new era under Juan Carlos de Borbon, who is to be its first King since 1931. Parliament and The Council of the Realm were called to meet Saturday to hear Prince Juan Carlos swear fidelity to the fundamental principles of the Franco regime.

title: Scots Charge HomeRule Offer Is a Case of Evasion and Delay
description: LONDON, Nov. 20A few weeks ago, William Wolfe, dressed in a red plaid kilt of his own making, sat in a small car on a narrow road in the shadow of Edinburgh Castle and spoke with optimism about the day when Scotland would be rid of the English yoke, set free to pursue its course as an independent nation.

title: Times Engravers Drop Strike Threat And Continue Talks
description: Photoengravers at The New York Times called off a strike threatened for yesterday and agreed to continue negotiations on a new contract.

title: Rohr Says Payout Nay Be Omitted; New Chief Named
description: Rohr Industries Inc. an nounced yesterday that might have to omit its dividend as a result of a writeoff of about $23 motion. At the same time the company disclosed that its president, Fred W. Garry, who is 54 years old, had assumed the office of chief executive, succeeding Burt F. Raynes, 62, who re mains as chairman of the board.

title: TEXTS ON ALLEGED U. S. ASSASSINATION PLOTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Following are the texts of four sections of the report on alleged United States involvement in assassination plots against foreign leaders. It was released today by the Senate Intelligence Committee.

title: Democrats, Fearing a Close Tally, Said to Block Floor Ballot
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Senate Democratic leadership, fearing too narrow a margin of support, prevented a floor vote today on making public the report on political assassinations, according to Senate sources. Senators attending an unusual closed session of the chamber said that Administration supporters, who opposed the release of the document, had pressed in debate for a vote because they thought that narrow margin favoring release would reduce the report's impact. The Democrats apparently agreed with this opinion and decided to block a vote, the Senators said.

title: Money to Squires Now Called Loans
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 20 (AP)A report that the Norfolk Investment Company would directly invest $200,000 into the financially ailing Virginia Squires was a misunderstanding, the general manager of the company reported today.

title: Yonkers Results
description: (OTB Payoffs subject to 5% Stale tax.)

title: 2 GERMANS KILLED IN NUCLEAR PLANT
description: BONN, Nov. 20Two workmen were killed in a nuclear power plant accident yesterday in Bavaria, and medical authorities said today that the deaths had resulted from burns inflicted by escaping steam, not from radioactivity.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 3.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and ndustrial materials fell to 189.7 from 192.9 last week.

title: NO VOTE BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Senate Democratic leadership, fearing too narrow a margin of support, prevented a floor vote today on making public the report on political assassinations, according to Senate sources.

title: Old Reagan Movies Held Liable to TV Equal Time
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Television stations that broadcast old Ronald Reagan movies will be liable for equal time demands by other Republican Presidential candidates, a Federal Communications Com; mission spokesman said today.

title: Oceangoing Classroom Mary E. to Cruise Both Coasts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The last of the Mainebuilt clipper schooners, used this summer as a seagoing classroom for. disadvantaged city school children in the New YorkNew Jersey area, will become part of a nationwide program created by an agreement signed today.

title: StatisticsWatching: A Guide for the Perplexed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  In a world of travel guides, restaurant guides and even sportsviewing guides, there is a place for a guide to economic statistics.

title: Britain Threatens to Use Navy Off Iceland in Fishing Dispute
description: LONDON, Nov. 20The British Government vowed today to send naval vessels if necessary to support the interests of British trawlers defying Iceland's new 200mile fishing limit.

title: Mourning at the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov, 20The United Nations flag flew at half staff today as Secretary General Kurt Waldheim led the diplomatic community in paying tribute to General Franco.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Pacific Palisades home and Santa Barbara ranch, several hundred acres outside of Los Angeles that he obtained in a complicated exchange for other land when he became Governor.

title: More Retailers Gain
description: Alexander's Inc. and the Associated Dry Goods Corporation have reported large quarterly earnings gains, continuing a trend by major retailers. Page 67.

title: Pittsburgh Air Crisis Abates, but Disputes Persist
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 20Although he retired eight years ago, Alex DeGregorio still has not learned to sleep late, and this morning as usual the 69yearold former steel worker was up before the sun, puttering around the house and trying not to disturb his ailing wife as he brewed the day's first coffee.

title: 2 G.O.P. Leaders Deny Taping Talk With Ford
description: ALBANY, Nov. 20While it was not their foremost concern, two Republicansthe Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, and his colleague, Perry B. Duryea, the Assembly minority leader had to contend today with report that they had taperecorded their telephone con; versation yesterday with President Ford.

title: Kodak Sets 50c Dividend
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 20 (UPI) The Eastman Kodak Company announced today a yearend dividend on common stock of 50 cents a share plus the regular 39centsashare quarterly dividend, both payable Jan. 2 to shareholders of record Dec. 1. This brings to $2.06 the total dividends for 1975, up 7 cents a share from a year ago

title: SENATE SETS CURB ON 197576 BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Senate voted today to impose a ceiling of $375.6 billion on Federal spending in the current fiscal year, with a contemplated deficit of 574.8 billion.

title: RIFT DELAYS PARLEY OF EUROPEAN REDS
description: EAST BERLIN, Nov. 20As a result of continuing differences over political strategies, Europe's Communists have put off until next year their plan to hold a European Communist Party conference.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: Is it a truism that while you don't always get what you pay for, you always pay for what you get? We don't want any truisms around here, but having eaten well on a recent occasion for $6.13 a person and more copiously on another for $5.72 a person and rather elegantly on yet another for $14.50 a person (in all cases after tax but before tip and not counting wine), herewith a report on three restaurants where you pay for what you get and get what you pay for. Including frills, if any.

title: ISRAELI PLANES FLY OVER BEIRUT AGAIN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 20Sporadic shooting continued in Beirut today and air raid sirens howled as Israeli planes flew over for the second day in succession.

title: U.S. Money. Supply Still Rising Sharply
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday that the nation's money supply moved sharply higher again in the latest statement week and indicated that the record monetary upsurge reported for the preceding week was not a statistical aberration.

title: Airlines'
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI) The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations asked congress today to abolish the airlines mutual aid pact because, the organization said, it guarantees a profit to any airline shut down by a strike. The pact began in 1958 on the principle that a strikebound airline would receive back from the other airlines the extra profits they were earning as a result of the strike.

title: Ford 75 Political Travel Exempt From Cost Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Federal Election Commission ruled today that money spent to finance President Ford's political travel as an announced candidate in 1975 should not be charged against his 1976 campaign spending ceiling except in special cases.

title: Leftist Rally in Lisbon Asks New Cabinet
description: LISBON, Nov. 20A large crowd of Communistled workers massed in front of the Presidential Palace here today and demanded the dismissal of the centristleft Cabinet and the formation of a leftwing revolutionary government.

title: FUGITIVES SOUGHT IN BOMBINGS HERE
description: Investigators on the trail of Puerto Rican terrorists who set off bombs elsewhere in New York have been focusing on a group of fugitives who were accused of plotting five 1969 hotel and nightclub bombings in the San Juan area.

title: Jets in Silent Workout As Shipp Takes Helm
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 20 In an eerie atmosphere that made the players look like part of a silent movie, Ken Shipp began his first day as head coach of the New York Jets Football Club, Inc.

title: CUBICAL THREAT FIELD WIDESPREAD
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20The Northeastern United States and Ontario appear to be hot spots for concentrations of potentially harmful polychlorinated biphenyls in people, wildlife and fish, but scientists presenting research papers here today made it clear that no geographical area can be considered safe from this group of chemicals.

title: Cities Abroad Hurt By the Crisis Here
description: LONDON, Nov. 20International bankers here say that New York City's financial plight is beginning to inhibit fundraising abilities of cities outside the United States and that there has been some movement of funds and investments from the major New York banks.

title: C.C.N.Y. Asks Nobel Winners For Help in Its Hour of Need
description: Like a merchant placing his finest wares at the front of the window, City College called home yesterday the four Nobel laureates it has produced to help us in our hour of need.

title: New Haven Teachers Resume Talks
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 20With support for a general strike in New Haven gathering, the school board and striking teachers resumed negotiations today, principally through timeconsuming telephone calls to teachers being held in jails in three places in the state.

title: S.E.C. LETS CRANE PURSUE ITS OFFER
description: The Crane Company announced late Wednesday that the Securities and Exchange Commission had approved its prospectus describing its exchange offer of 8 percent subordinated debentures for 5 million shares of common stock of the Anaconda Company. Crane said it was proceeding with the offer, which will expire Dec. 11, 1975, unless extended. If more than 5 million shares are tendered, Crane will purchase shares on a prorated basis. Those not bought will be returned.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Moynihan's Style in the U.N. Is Now an Open Debate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20Critical whisperings here about the performance of Daniel P. Moynihan as the chief American delegate broke into the open this week, but the State Department said today that Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger had full confidence in the outspoken diplomat.

title: Islanders Goal Ties Bruins
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20A shy, fourthline Islander center called Scoop and a goalie who prefers to play on the road helped put an end to the New York Islanders fourgame losing streak tonight during a 22 tie in Boston Garden.

title: Fashion, if Not Tradition, Ready For Women Cacdets at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 20The United States Military Academy demonstrated today that it has been easier to tailor its uniforms than its attitudes to the admission of women next summer.

title: Court Dismisses Most Charges In Bergman Suit Over Publicity
description: A Federal judge has dismissed most of the claims in a civil rights suit that Bernard Bergman, the nursinghome operator, filed early this year against a state official, an Assemblyman and a New York Times reporter.

title: Church. Reads 10 Names That Colby Sought to Omit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)  The chairman of the Senate intelligence committee said today that the contention of William E. Colby, the Director of Central Intelligence, that the panel was endangering the lives of agents named in its report was absurd.

title: Tokushichi Mishima Dies; Invented a Magnetic Steel
description: TOKYO, Nov. 20 (AP)Tokushichi Misnima; inventor of the magnetic steel known as M.K. steel and made from nickel and alumintim, died of a heart ailment in a hospital here yesterday. He was S2 years old.

title: The Politics Of Anarchy
description: You can hardly pick up the papers these days without reading about the element of madness and even of anarchy in our national life. The latest threat against Ronald Reagan in Miami merely underscores the problem.

title: Thomas Dukehart. 60, Dies; ExLacrosse AllAmerica
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 20 (AP)Thomas Van Arden Dukehart, a former AllAmerica lacrosse player at Johns Hopkins University, died yesterday at the Greater Baltimore Medical Center. He was 60 years old.

title: BACHE NET OFF 66%; NAME CHANGE IS SET
description: The Bache Group Inc., a holding company for the brokerage house of Bache & Company, registered a 66 percent drop in earnings for the fiscal quarter ended Oct. 31, John E. Leslie, chairman and chief executive, told stockholders at the annual meeting here yesterday.

title: Rodman Says His Intention Is to Stay at Grand Union
description: Charles G. Rodman, chairman of the Grand Union Company, said yesterday that he had no intention of leaving the company, contrary to the impression created at Wednesday's court hearing involving the bankruptcy proceedings of, the W. T. Grant Company.

title: Dolores lbarrari Calls For Action
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20 (Reuters)  Dolores lbarruri, the exiled Spanish Communist leader, called today for widespread action by the people of Spain after the death of Generalissimo Francisco Franco.

title: Fog Shuts the Entire 118 Miles of Jersey Turnpike for 5 Hours, Causing Major TieUps
description: Fog that enveloped the metropolitan area forced the closing of all 118 miles of the New Jersey Turnpike for five hours early yesterday, causing extensive traffic jams for morning rushhour commuters.

title: ENERGY CHIEF BACKS GAS PROFIT MARGIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Federal Energy Administrator, Frank G. Zarb, rejected today a request by consumers groups for a reduction in the profit margin authorized for retain filling stations. Consumers Union and others had challenged the additional markup of 3 cents a gallon awarded to the stations during the gasoline shortage of early 1974.

title: Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 20A Solomonic decision by the board of the American Contract Bridge League at a meeting here yesterday, just before the start of the Fall National Championships, has virtually determined the composition of the United States Women's team in the 1976 world championships in Monte Carlo in May.

title: Inciting Suicide
description: The revelation that the F.B.I. sent a communication to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. which he, not unreasonably, took as an attempt to push him to suicide, surely the most loathsome of a startling number of indications that Congress has long been negligent in its responsibility to bring the bureau under control.

title: HIGH ISRAELI TOLL IN A NEW WAR SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20William E. Colby, the Director of Cental Intelligence, has surprised Israel's supporters on Capitol Hill by asserting that Israel's military superiority over the Arabs was increasing but that in another Middle East war Israel would probably suffer 8,000 dead, more than three times the 2.500 fatalities in the October 1973 war.

title: Kissinger and C.I.A. Said to Conflict iri Testimony on Chile Plot
description: The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence reported yesterday that during its hearings there had been conflicts in testimony between Henry A. Kissinger and the Central Intelligence Agency about the extentk of White House authorization for the agency's role in a Chilean kidnapping plot in October 1970.

title: HYDROGEN WARHEAD BLASTS OUT CAVERN
description: PAHUTE MESA, Nev., Nov. 20 (UPI)A hydrogen warhead, possibly 50 times as devastating as the atomic bombs dropped on Japan, blasted out a molten cavern 2,680 feet below this test site today and swayed highrise buildings 80 miles away in Las Vegas.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Leiter designaes 010 listing

title: School Study Calls 28% of TeenAgers Problem
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Nov. 20 (AP) A national study has found that 28 percent of the nation's teenagers are problem drinkers.

title: Wood, Field &
description: Some months ago, looking ahead to surfcasting for striped bass in the fall and winter waterfowl hunting decided that contact lenses would be the answer to glasses drenched with salt spray or streaming with rain.

title: House Unit Backs Emergency Gas Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The House Commerce subcommittee on energy and power approved today by a vote of 12 to 4, an emergency bill that would let interstate pipelines short of natural gas pay more than the Federal ceiling price for extra supplies this winter.

title: Weekly Auto Production Climbs to High for Year
description: DETROIT, Nov. 20 (AP)Weekly United States auto production climbed to its highest level of the year for a second consecutive week, topping the previous 1975 high by 1,600 units, the industry trade journal Automotive News said today.

title: 34 Reds Earn Shares in Series of $19,060
description: The ninthinning run that won the World Series for the Cincinnati Reds proved to be worth $5,734.59 a man yesterday when the top teams in baseball sliced up their shares of the postseason prize money.

title: Byrne Drops a Hint on Basis For Giving Carter a Pardon
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 20, (AP)Governor Byrne hinted strongly today that there was one aspect of the prison record of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter that would weigh favorably in the inmate's bid for executive. clemency.

title: Those Sunday Family Outings: Food (and Floor Shows of Sorts)
description: On fall Sundays in New York, the avenues are alive with families searching for Something to Do.

title: Last Statement by Franco
description: Now that the time is near for me to stand in judgment before God Almighty, I ask that He look kindly upon me since I have striven to live and to die as a good Catholic.

title: Spain: Thinking About the Future
description: MADRIDA long era of almost forty years of personal power has come to an end and a monarchy in the person of Juan Carlos de Borbon, who is 37 years old, is on the point of starting life as an institution.

title: REV. JOHN KEATING, PAULIST, ECUMENIST
description: The Rev. John J. Keating, vice president of the Paulist Fathers and a leading ecumenist, died yesterday of cancer in St. Michael's Hospital, Toronto. He was 57 years old and had been living at the Paulist headquarters in Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Fragment of Ancient Tablet Is Returned to Israel
description: A fragment of a clay tablet 3,500 to 4,000 years old that confirms the existence of the biblical city of Hazor in Israel was returned yesterday to the Israel Government after a teacher who smuggled it out of Israel agreed to surrender it to avoid prosecution.

title: Part of Capital Staff Dismissest By Westinghouse Broadcasting
description: The Westinghouse Broadcasting Company, which operates WINS here and similar allnews radio stations in Los Angeles and Philadelphia, has dismissed seven correspondents from its Washington bureau as an economy measure and is negotiating with national news services to provide the stations with hardnews coverage of the capital.

title: Buckley Changes Position; Now Backs U.S. Aid Here
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Senator James L. Buckley, New York ConservativeRepublican, reversed himself today and urged immediate shortterm Federal loans or loan guarantees of $2.5billion to ease New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: European Airbus Opens Shuttle Service Between Here and Caribbean
description: The baby elephant of jumbo jets, the European A300B Airbus, made its commercial debut in the Western Hemisphere yesterday as Air France put it in service from New York to the Caribbean.

title: Teachers Ending Ties
description: The threeyearold merger that produced the 217,000member New York State Union Teachers is on the verge of being dissolved, leading observers to expect intensified strife between the American Federation of Teachers and the National Education Association. Page 47.

title: Moscow Restricts Gifts From Abroad Under New Rules
description: MOSCOW, Nov: 20 (UPI)The Soviet Union has revealed plans for a new currency rule that would reduce the value of foreign money gifts remitted from abroad.

title: Bayh, Harris, Shapp and Udall Are Fighting Hard for Democratic Liberal Bloc's Endorsement for '76
description: Four Democratic aspirants for the Presidency are campaigning intensively in New York, even down to the clubhouse level, in preparation for their first test of strength in the state in two weeks.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975. by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form) Thursday, Nov. 20. 10th day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: Dr. Aleksandr Vishnevsky Dies; Leading Soviet Surgeon Was 69
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20 (AP)Dr. Aleksandr A. Vishnevsky, head of the Institute of Surgery of the Soviet Academy of Medical Sciences since 1948, died yesterday, it was reported today by Tass the Soviet press agency. He was 69 years old.

title: A Touch of Whimsey In Fashions for the Very Young
description: Pity the child model. Having to be curled and combed and yanked into clothes and then having all those people laugh if you fall on the runway. Well, sometimes it's a drag.

title: Harvard vs. Yale: Winner Takes All
description: Contrary to Yale lore, when Capt. John Smoot and his Yale teammates appear in the Bowl tomorrow to play Harvard for the 100th time, it won't be the most important thing in their lives. But it is important: the Ivy League Championship will be at stake.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MA, BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIC 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO .4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRI,. DAY: NEW JUZSEY (201) MARKET 3.39lL WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 94300; NASSAU CO. (51h) 7470500: SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6694800; CONNECTICUT (203) 348.7767.

title: Hoover Allowed F.B.I. To Send Phony Letters
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)Angered by a news report describing free love at the University of Texas, J. Edgar Hoover authorized the Federal Bureau of Investigation to write phony letters from parents to protest conditions at the university, according to bureau documents. The action was disclosed yesterday by the Senate. Select. Committee on Intelligence.

title: Accord Reached in Groton Shin Strike
description: GROTON, Conn., Nov. 20Negotiators reached a tentative agreement here this morning in the 21weekold strike by 10,000 shipbuilders against the Electric Boat Division of the General Dynamics Corporation.

title: ALBANY LEADERS REACH AN ACCORD ON CITY TAXATION
description: ALBANY, Nov. 20The Republican and Democratic leadership here tentatively agreed tonight on a $200 million New York City tax package that does not include an increase in the city sales tax, but includes increases of possibly 25 per cent in the resident income tax.

title: The Game (West): Stanford and Cal
description: PALO ALTO. Calif., Nov. 20They call it The Big Game, the annual football match between Stanford and California, the equivalent of The Game between Yale and Harvard on the opposite side of the continent. But yesterday's installment here has special elements, and is part of a larger picture in West Coast college athletics.

title: Reagan Enters Campaign, Seeks a Curb on Spending
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20  Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California officially announced today that he was a candidate for President, challenging Gerald R. Ford for leadership of the Republican Party.

title: Bail Set at $500,000
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20Mr. Carvin was being held here on provisional bail of $500,000, pending arraignment tomorrow before a United States magistrate.

title: FORD TAKES STEPS TO PROTECT JEWS IN ARAB BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20President Ford announced today a series of measures designed to protect American citizens and businesses against discrimination because of foreign boycotts.

title: JET PILOTS REPORT SIGHTING MISSILES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating a report by two airline pilots that they saw missiles near their passenger jet as it flew over southern irginia, an official of the agency said today.

title: Toy Safety Found Improved
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Government safety officials say they have decided not to publish the annual list of banned toys this year and have dropped the program of sending volunteers into stores before Christmas to check for dangerous toys.

title: Mayer, Gorman Gain
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 20 (AP)Haroon Rahim of Pakistan and two Americans, Alex Mayer and Tom Gorman, advanced today to the singles quarterfinals of India's Grand Prix lawn tennis championships.

title: StatisticsWatching: A Guide for the Perplexed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  In a world of travel guides, restaurant guides and even sportsviewing guides, there is a place for a guide to economic statistics.

title: Reaction of Spaniards on Franco Is Wary Reserve
description: MADRID, Nov. 20The red and yellow Spanish flag, pinned with a bow of black crepe, was being stretched over Arabesque wroughtiron balconies and plain storefront awnings across the country today to mark the death of Generalissimo Francisco Franco.

title: Office BuildingHotel for U.N. Is Opened
description: A 39story building, the first major structure in the city designated for both hotel and office use, was formally opened yesterday as the newest addition to the United Nations complex on First Avenue.

title: Cuba Is Said to Have Sent 3,000 To Aid SovietBacked Angolans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20United States officials said today that Cuba had sent 3,000 fighting men and advisers to Angola, to which the Soviet Union has shipped large quantities of arms in recent weeks in support of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola.

title: Falcons Acquire Herron on Waivers
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 20 (AP)  The Atlanta Falcons claimed Mack Herron, the. 17foot5inch recordbreaking speedster, for the $100 waiver price from the New England Patriots today.

title: Notes on People
description: Everybody knew it had been a year of sweeping change in Congress, but yesterday, for the first time in the nation's history, two members of the House of Representatives announced their angagement to each other. Representatives Martha Keys of Kansas and Andrew Jacobs Jr of Indiana, both liberal Democrats and divorced, said they would be married in January. They both plan to run for reelection next year, and both will keep their own names and maintain residences in their own districts.

title: Food Prices Led Increase Of 0.7% in October Index
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Consumer prices rose a little more in October than in September, with most of the problem in the volatile sector of food prices, the Labor Department reported today. The October increase in the Consumer Price Index was seventenths of 1 percent after adjustment for normal seasonal variation in some prices. This was the third largest monthly rise in the index this year, the department said, after increases of eighttenths of, 1 percent in June and 1.2 percent in July. The rise in September was fivetenths of 1 percent.

title: Campaign and Economic Aides Differ On Advice to Ford on Help for the City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20President Ford's 1976 campaign advisers, convinced of political advantage in continued White House opposition to a Federal bailout of New York City, urged the President early this week to give a fresh sign that he would hang tough against aid to the city.

title: NEW BOND ISSUES IN MIXED PATTERN
description: Prices improved slightly yesterday in the Government and corporate bond markets, but new offerings met with varying degrees of successespecially in the taxexempt sector. After the Federal Reserve released figures late in the day showing another substantial increase in the money supply, small price declines appeared in some Treasury and corporate bonds.

title: MISS FROMME COMES TO COURT FOR HOUR
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 20 (UPI)Lynette Alice Fromme briefly appeared in court today to end her nineday exile and listened quietly to legal arguments in her trial on a charge of attempting to assassinate President Ford.

title: Tin Plate Lifted 7% By Bethlehem Steel, Effective on Feb. 1
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation and the WheelingPittsburgh Steel Corporation said yesterday that they were raising their prices on tin plate from 7 to 9 percent, matching an increase announced Tuesday by the National Steel Company. Tin mill products are generally used to make cans for food, beverages and industrial products such as paint.

title: ALBANY LEADERS REACH AN ACCORD ON CITY TAXATION
description: ALBANY, Nov. 20The Republican and Democratic leadership here tentatively agreed tonight on a $200 million New York City tax package that does not include an increase in the city sales tax, but includes increases of possibly 25 per tent in the resident income tax.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Intramural Fights Put End to Playoffs
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 20 Intramural playoffs at the University of WisconsinMilwaukee have been suspended because of what officials call a series of unsportsmanlike conduct incidents.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: MAGAZINE BACKED IN A LIBEL RULING
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20Superior Court Judge Thomas W. Le Sage ruled today that Rancho La Costa, a southern California hotel and real estate development with alleged links to organized crime, and its four principal owners were public figures and therefore valid subjects for probing scrutiny by the press.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE DOWNWARD DRIFT
description: Stock prices drifted lower yesterday in moderate trading, with the market showing little response to mixed economic reports and continued uncertainty over the unresolved New York City financial crisis.

title: CoalIntoOil Project Set By Energy Agency Nations
description: PARIS, Nov. 20 (AP)Major oilimporting nations signed today a $24 million project to develop improved techniques for turning coal into energy, as the first concrete operation of the yearold International Energy Agency.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 20 (AP)Lord Alexander Hesketh, wealthy autoracing enthusiast, said today his Grand Prix team has ceased operations.

title: M.A.C. FACES SNAG IN BOND TRADEOFF
description: Caught in a quandary, officials of the Municipal Assistance Corporation are considering a proposal to make their massive intended public exchange of city notes for M.A.C. bonds contingent on some form of Federal assistance.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The chairman of the board of Barton's Candy Corporation, Stephen Klein, and the corporation itself, pleaded guilty in Federal court in Brooklyn to a onecount information charging contamination by beetles of flour used make cookies.

title: City's Crisis Means Hard Times for Harlem
description: Ella Harrell is 52 years old and has eight children. For the last 11 years, she has worked as a janitor in a Harlem Head Start program, using her earnings from this and jobs like it in the past to send six of her children to college.

title: A Giant Vote for Arnsparger
description: Bill Arnsparger lives. Bill Arnsparger, in fact, is the sole survivor of the Shea Stadium syndrome of 75.

title: House Unit Refuses To Bar Cheap Pistols In Gun Control Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) A House subcommittee refused today to ban socalled Saturday night special pistols, and then approved handgun control legislation stripped of the most controversial proposals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To Prevent LandSale Abuses

title: Dr. Helen Zagat, 82, Pasto'r Of Church of Divine Unity
description: Dr. Helen Zagat, pastor of the Church of Divine Unity here, died yesterday at her home at 123 West 57th Street. She was 82 years old.

title: Report Will Be Printed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The report of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence will be made available to the public through the Government Printing Office. A printing office spokesman said today that it would print 10,000 copies o the report beginning tonight. The price will be announced tomorrow. It is expected to cost between 53 and $4.

title: About Real Estate
description: GUTTENBERG, N.J.As long ago as 1966 it would have been possible to put up two 50story residential buildings here on the heights overlooking Manhattan opposite the West 70's, says Norman Belfer, a builder.

title: Catholic Bishops Approve a Plan to Mobilize Public Support Against Abortions on Request
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Roman Caholic bishops of the United States significantly stepped up today the church's fight against abortion by approving a plan to create nonsectarian prolife groups in every Congressional district.

title: memorial Seruices
description: PARKINSONDorothy Mintz. A Memorial Service will be held on Tuesday, Novembe: 25, at 11 A.M., at the Mount Neboh Cor oregati on, 130 W. 79 Street. In lieu or flowers contributions to the charity of your choice may be made in her memory.

title: Maj. Gen. Elvin S. Ligon Jr. Of the Air Force Dies at 64
description: Maj. Gen. Elvin S. Ligon Jr., who retired from the. Air Force, died Wednesday at the Walter Reed Medical Center in Washington. He was 64 years old and lived in Arlington, Va.

title: Ashe Gains 3d Round In S. Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 20. (AP)Topseeded Arthur Ashe and seventhseeded Brian Gottfried scored straightset victories today in secondround play of the South African, 64, 63. nis championships.

title: 25 SIGN AN APPEAL TO FORD ON SPAIN
description: Twentyfive prominent American educators, scientists, historians and public officials, including four Nobel laureates, have urged President Ford to initiate a fundamental review of United States policy toward Spain in the postFranco period.

title: Rooneys Study JaiAlai Bid
description: The Rooney family of Pittsburgh, which controls the Pittsburgh Steelers of the National League as well as several race tracks, has signed a letter proposal to purchase the scandalinvolved jaialai fronton in Bridgeport, Conn.

title: REACTION TO DEATH OF FRANCO MUTED
description: LONDON, Nov. 20The reaction to the death of Generalissimo Francisco Franco was muted in most West European capitals. Officials went no further than routine diplomatic courtesies, and the press seemed less critical than usual of Spain and the dictator.

title: People and Business
description: Directors of the Allied Chemical Corporation yesterday chose Alexander B. Trowbridge, former Secretary of Commerce, to become vice chairman next April 1. They also elevated Robert E. Mulcahy, 43, a group ,vice president, to become president and chief operating officer oh Dec. 1.

title: About New york
description: David Dubinsky went to school in Poland and in New York, but he never finished a course in either place. That's why he was so de. lighted when, last month, the Fashion Institute of Technology called its neNvest unit the David Dubinsky Student Center.

title: HOUSE PANEL ACTS TO CITE KISSINGER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The House Select Committee on Intelligence voted today to move ahead with at least one contempt citation against Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger despite President Ford's protest that the action involves grave matters affecting our conduct of foreign policy.

title: Walker Quits Bulls
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20 (AP)  Chet Walker, who for 13 years in the National Basketball Association usually let his oneonone artistry do his talking, says he has quit the Chicago Bulls because they treated him like an idiot. Walker, 10th on the N.B.A. career scoring list, announced during the summer that he would not be back in the N.B.A. unless he was traded.

title: Net Up 59% at Alexander's and 72% at Associated
description: The trend of large quarterly earnings gains by major retailers continued yesterday as Alexander's Inc. reported a 59 percent increase in its first fiscal quarter and the Associated Dry Goods Corporation said it had a 72 percent advance in its third quarter from the yearearIlier level.

title: Business Briefs
description: While buying plans of consumers showed a slight improvement in September and October compared with the previous two months, there has been a loss of confidence in the economy in the recent period, the Conference Board reported yesterday.

title: Rough Road for a King
description: MADRID, Nov. 20Nothing has been made easy for Juan Carlos de Borbn, the 37yearold Prince who will become King of Spain Saturday as the designated successor of Fran

title: FORD TAKES STEPS TO PROTECT JEWS IN ARAB BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 President Ford announced today a series of measures designed to protect American citizens and businesses against discrimination because of foreign boycotts. The measures would bar any such discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex or national origin. But Administration officials acknowledged that today's actions were designed primarily to discourage discrimination against American Jews through Arab boycott activities.

title: West Berlin Fails to Attain a Bigger Economic Role
description: WEST BERLINIn 1971, when France, Britain, the United States and the Soviet Union signed a treaty formally recognizing the status quo in this divided city, predictions abounded that West Berlin would quickly become a turntable for the Western world's trade with Eastern Europe.

title: Algeria Rejects Accord To Split Spanish Sahara
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 20Secretary General Kurt Waldheim announced today that Algeria had informed him officially it did not recognize any right of the governments of Spain. Morrocco and Mauritania to dispose of Spanish Sahara or determine the, fate of desert territory's population.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 21, 1975

title: Nixon Asserts Franco Won Respect for Spain
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 19 (AP) Former President Richard M. Nixon said today that Generalissimo Francisco Franco earned worldwide respect for Spain through firmness and fairness.

title: ARABS RAID GOLAN, KILLING 3 ISRELIS
description: TEL AVIV, Friday, Nov. 21Arab guerrillas infiltrating from Syria on the Golan Heights last night killed at least three Israelis who resisted their attempt to take them hostage.

title: Sad Story for Voice of America
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20It wasn't the kind of story that anyone at the Voice, of America was very happy about.

title: School Boycott in Boston
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20 (AP) More than 300 white students at South Boston High School did not show up today in an apparent protest over attempts to close the socially troubled school. School department fjgures showed that 97 whites and 135 blacks attended the school today, compared with enrollment projections of 770 whites and 446 blacks.

title: Books of The Times
description: So you want to know what's really been going on in this country for the last three decades or so? You have an inkling of Kirkpatrick Sale's startling theory from the title of his new book, Power Shift: The Rise of the Southern Rim and Its Challenge to the Eastern Establishment. But don't go away; there's considerably more to it than that. According to Mr. Sale, the Southern Rim is that broad band . . that stretches from Southern California through the Southwest and Texas, into the Deep South and down to Florida. It is defined by a cliMatic, historical, and cultural cohesiveness that serves to set [it] off from the rest of the country in many ways. (Look at a typical weather map, and an atlas; read John Steinbeck's The Grapes of Wrath.) Beginning in the 1940's, when a combination of population migrations, technological changes and new employment patterns began to take effect, the Southern Rim underwent a rapid growth of wealth and power, until by the 1960's it stood as a cowboy kingdom to challenge the Yankee hegemony of the Northeast.

title: FLORIDA JUDGEHALTS SALE OF OIL STOCKS
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 20 (UPI)A Miami Judge ordered today an immediate halt to security sales by 15 companies that Comptroller Gerald Lewis said had sold Floridians at least $3 million worth of stock in fraudulent Texas oil wells.

title: Skating Summaries AT PORT WASHINGTON INTERMEDIATE WOMEN
description: Group A1, Mary Inhoffer, Skating Club of Montclair; 2, Elisabeth Rabin, North Jersey Figure Skating Club; 3, Elizabeth Laszlo, Long Island Figure Skating Club; 4, Gail Livingston, Metropolitan Figure Skating Club; S Lynn Kruse, Cantiague Figure Skating Club; 6, Stacie Young, Skating Club of Riverdale; 7, Roberta Host, Skating Club of New York; Michele Dillard, Skating Club of Bergen.

title: METHADONE GROUP CALLED WASTEM
description: The state's Welfare Inspector General has portrayed one of the largest methadone pro grams here as a spendthrift agency with little incentive to curb staff extravagances, as, serting about half the $1.1 mil, lion in a year's expenditure! it submitted for Medicaid reim bursement were ineligible, un substantiated or Questionable.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
United Teachers Weighing Disaffiliation With N.E.A.
description: The union representing 217,000 elementary, secondary and college teachers in New York State is on the verge of ending its affiliation with the National Education Association, an action that would be a bitter setback to the cause of teacher unity throughout the country.

title: $16 Million Worth of Generosity
description: George Allen, the cuddly coach of the Washington Redskins, wants the National Football League to make instant replay available as an aid to game officials on difficult decisions but Art McNally, the supervisor of officials, says that when a referee, umpire, linesman or judge calls a play wrong, the league prefers that he stay wrong. To be sure, those aren't McNally's words, exactly. He said the league believes that to use instant replay with all its ramifications would ruin the continuity of the came. So at his came next Sunday when the referee, on signal Sports from the television director, calls the 10th time out for a sales pitch on an underarm of deodorant, Allen might just possibly mutThe Times ter, what continuity? Still, it would not be altogether accurate to say that their reluctance to experiment with new ideas proves the football people have closed minds. In laying down the ground rules for an expansion draft by the teams they have enfranchised in Seattle and Tampa, the club owners demonstrated that they are capable of compromise. We have created, Pete Rozelle declared when the plan was announced, the largest pool of quality players ever available in football expansion.

title: About the Jets...
description: The new coach, Ken Shipp, had been offensive coordinator as well as coach of the quarterbacks and receivers. Bob Fry now will coordinate the offense in addition to his duties as offensiveline coach. Mike Holovak, the scouting director, will work with the passing game and also observe it during games from the press box. ... Rosdoe Word the right cornerback, suffered a slightly sprained right ankle yesterday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Zicarelli Conviction Reversed by Court; Jury Selection Cited
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20The bribery conviction of a reputed Mafia figure in New Jersey was overturned today by the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit on the ground that the jury that convicted him had excluded residents of the community where the alleged crime was committed.

title: Stoneham in Hospital
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 20 (AP)Horace C. Stoneham, 72yearold owner of the San Francisco Giants, entered Stanford University Medical Center today. He will undergo surgery tomorrow, officials of the team announced.

title: Music: Bach Concerts
description: Our Bach Concerts, a series of midnight events that has become a nocturnal institution here in the last few years, has ventured into new territory. Wednesday night at Tully Hall it gave an 8 o'clock concert. .Henry Schuman, oboist and director of the Liquid Music Society, which presents the concerts, assured midnighters they were not being forgotten. We just wanted to give the 8 o'clock people a break, he said.

title: Giants Drop Westrum And Aides
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 20 (AP)The entire coaching staff of the San Francisco Giants, including Manager Wes Westrum, has been officially dismissed in preparation for selling the club, Giants executive said today.

title: Sketches of Five Cited as Alleged Targets
description: Following are sketches of the five men cited as alleged assassination targets in the report released yesterday by the Senate intelligence committee:

title: Opera: Rasaika
description: There may have been previous fully staged performances of Dvorak's Rusalka in this country, but if there have indeed been any, the Juilliard School has not been able to find them. Playing it safe, however, the Juilliard American Opera Center, which presented Rusalka Wednesday night, says that it is believed these performances mark the American premiere. (Repeats were scheduled for Thursday night, tonight and Sunday.)

title: A NURSING HOME MUST REPAY U.S.
description: The Federal Government yesterday won a $1 million settlement of a Medicare overpayment claim against Charles E. Sigety owner of the Florence Nightingale Nursing Home on the Upper East Side. It was the largest such recovery known to officials here.

title: Food Prices Led Increase Of 0.7% in October Index
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Consumer prices rose a little more in October than in September, with most of the problem in the volatile sector of food prices, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Argentine Army Steps Up Guerrilla Hunt
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 20IAn expanded offensive by the Argentine military against subversion appeared today to be aimed at the political and labor arms of the outlawed Peronist movement.

title: Texas Sets Full Oil Output
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 20 (UPI)  The Texas Railroad Commission ordered today oil wells in the state to continue maximum production in December for the 45th consecutive month and noted that crude imports are increasing despite the 100 percent allowable. The 100 percent produc tion factor has not varied since April 1972.

title: 5 Firemen Are Injured In Explosion in Bronx
description: Five firemen were injured today in an explosion of undetermined origin while fighting a twoalarm fire in a row of stores in the Lirathe Bronx, fire officials reported.

description: Thursday. Nov. 20. 1975

title: REMOVAL SOUGHT FOR U.S. ATTORNEY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI) Representative Henry Helstoski, Democrat of New Jersey, who is under investigation by a Federal grand jury in Newark, introduced a resolution in the House of Representatives today calling for the impeachment of Jonathan L. Goldstein, United States Attorney for New Jersey, and his executive assistant, Bruce I. Goldstein.

title: BUDGET CUT CLOSING 8 FIRE COMPANIES
description: Eight fire companies and one fire division throughout the city will be eldminated tomorrow because of an $8.3 million department budget reduction, Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan said yesterday.

title: Auction at the Met to Hammer at Company's Deficit
description: America's most expensive cultural entertainment institution, the Metropolitan Opera, will briefly replace its sopranos with an auctioneer whose chants will, it is hoped, raise funds to help erase the company's $402,000 deficit.

title: Mexico Cautions on Change
description: MEXICO City, Nov. 20Mexico, the only country that still maintains full diplomatic relations with the Spanish Republican government in exile, said today that it would not recognize any new Madrid regime until a true process of democratization emerged in Madrid,

title: Wisconsin Sells 6% Bonds
description: The State of Wisconsin, which has a triple A credit rating, yesterday sold two bond issues totaling $101.9 million at the modest interest rate of 6 percent, United Press International reported. We have been rewarded very handsomely for the fiscal restraints we have placed upon ourselves, said Patrick J. Lucey, the Wisconsin Governor. John Eger of First Wisconsin Nation Bank of Milwaukee called it a credit to Wisconsin taxpayers for running a very tight financial ship.

title: Met Gives New Production of Figaro
description: The Metropolitan Opera has needed a new production of Le Nozze di Figaro. The great Mozart opera was, not very well served by the Metropolitan the last time around. So a new production was unveiled last night. For this the company went to Guenther Rennert, whose Nozze di Figaro is one of the adornments of the National Theater in Munich. Mr. Rennert directed, and sets and costumes were provided by Robert O'Hearn. These sets and costumes were patterned in part after the Munich Figaro, but were never a carbon copy.

title: WALLACE TO RUN IN PRIMARY HERE
description: Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, who last week announced his candidacy for the Democratic nomination forj President, plans to enter primaries In New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania in his quest for delegates to next year's national convention.

title: Flyers Top Seals, 32, On Dornhoefer Goal
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (AP)Secondperiod goals by Bobby Clarke and Gary Dornhoefer lifted the Philadelphia Flyers to a 32 victory over the California Seals tonight in the National Hockey League.

title: Rising Food and Car Costs Push Consumer Index Here Up 0.5%
description: Higher prices for food and new cars and higher rents pushed the Consumer Price Index in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area for October up by fivetenths of 1 percent.

title: CITY TEACHERS BACK CONTRACT BY 3 TO 1
description: Teachers belonging to the United Federation of Teachers have ratified by a margin of better than 3 to 1 the new twoyear contract that emerged from the fiveday school strike in September.

title: Delta St. Women Beat China, 7370
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 20 (AP)Lusia Harris scored 27 points to lead Delta State University women's basketball Team to a 7370 victory tonight over the national team of China.

title: School Study Calls 28% of TeenAgers Problem
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Nov. 20 (AP) A national study has found that 28 percent of the nation's teenagers are problem drinkers.

title: Dictaphone Is Moving To Lefton From Scali
description: The Al Paul Lefton Company has been named to handle the Dictaphone Corporation's advertising for its dictating and telephone answering systems. The account which Dictaphone says will spend $1.5 million, has been handled by Scali McCabe Sloves since the fall of 1971.

title: Advertising
description: There could be a quiet revolution against violence on television brewing in powerful advertiser circles.

title: Grain Prices Irregular
description: Trading in a narrow range, grain futures closed mostly on an irregular tone yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Gains for Land Use
description: California will be able to protect its shoreline far into the future and show other coastal states how the job should be done if the Legislature has the wisdom to enact the admirable recommendations of a special agency created for the purpose. The citizens commission, appointed to carry out the mandate of an initiative measure passed three years ago, favors control over all further development in a fivemile zone running the length of the coast. Its remarkably farsighted plan would restrict port expansion, preserve coastal wetlands, keep farmland for farming and limit development to areas already being developed:

description: The television offering for Sunday goes from the ridiculous to the sublime. Two games will be telecast, the first being the Giants against Green Bay at Milwaukee (Channel 2. 2 P.M.) and those teams have lost 14 out of IS this season. The second matches the Raiders and the Redskins at Washington (Channel 4, 4 P.M.), and those two playoff contenders have won 13 of their 18 games. The Jets,

title: Synecdoche
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A potential fad word, synecdoche, emerged today from the Senate intelligence committee's report on alleged assassination plots.

title: Castro Plot Study Finds No Role by White House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence reported today that it had not found any evidence of White House authorization for repeated attempts by the. Central Intelligence Agency to inspire a bizarre variety of plots against the life of Prime Minister Fidel Castro of Cuba.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1,389 billion up 13 percent from the yearearlier $1,234 billion. Total retail store sales were about $11,438 billion up 12 percent from last year's $10,236 billion.

title: Canada to Cut Oil to U.S.; Full Halt Advanced to 81
description: OTTAWA. Nov. 20Canada announced today that it would cut oil exports to the United States to 510,000 barrels a day Jan. 1, a reduction of onethird from the present allotment and that it expected to end the flow entirely by 1981, two years earlier than previously forecast.

title: Suspect in Reagan Attack Linked to Phone Threat
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20. (AP)I thought someone was just falling down, and I was persuaded by the Secret Service to leave, said Ronald Reagan, who was shaken but smiling today after a youth with a toy pistol was wrestled down by Secret Service agents protecting Mr. Reagan near the Miami International Airport.

title: Soviet Five Tops Notre Dame, 7776
description: Notre Dame lost its poise last night and maybe some of its pride.

title: Jersey School Rules
description: The New Jersey State Board of Education approved a series of new regulations to be imposed on all local school districts requiring them to provide a thorough, and efficient education, as mandated by the State Supreme Court, for all public school children. Page 47.

title: Viardo Is Pianist With the Muscovites
description: Prokofiev's Piano Concerto No. 5 used to be regarded as the stamping ground of Sviatoslav Richter, its early champion, but others have been challenging the great Soviet pianist on that turf, one of the younger artists being Vladimir Viardo. Mr. Viardo, a lavishly gifted Soviet musician who won the 1973 Van Clibum International Piano Competition among other contests, took over the controls of the Prokofiev Fifth at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday night and put the work through a brilliant run.

title: A Winter Aid for Trotters
description: Harness horses who spend their winters racing in deepfreeze weather may soon be suffering less and traveling faster.

title: JERSEY'S PRIMARY ON WALLACE LIST
description: Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, who last week announced his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for President, plans to enter primaries in New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania in his quest for delegates to next year's national convention.

title: Plot Panel Ignores Levi's Bid for Data
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence has not responded to requests from the Department of Justice for access to the evidence assembled in the panel's investigation of alleged misdeeds by a number of Federal intelligence agencies, a committee spokesman said today.

title: VIOLA PHOENIX
description: Viola Phoenix, associate director of the United Neighborhood Houses and a board member of many civic groups, died Wednesday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center after a long illness. She was 63 years old and lived at 10 West 135th Street.

title: Minimums for School Day Are Set by State Regents
description: The State Board of Regents adopted new rules yesterday setting minimum lengths for school days that could result in the loss of state aid to the city if the rules were applied to the shortened school schedule here,

description: GUINGAMP, France Mat eo ar jeu ganit? sounds to most Frenchmen like a soft Teutonic garble and look like a series of typographical errors. To the 800,000 Bretonspeaking French citizens here in Brittany, it means How are things going?

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Federal agents are investigating possible frauds against the United States in its grainstorage program as part of their broad inquiry into corruption in the grain industry, according to Government sources.

description: ATLANTA, Nov. 21 (UPI)The Pittsburgh Penguins stopped the Atlanta Flames, 41, in the National Hockey League tonight for their first; victory in seven games.

description: It is particularly disconcerting that President Ford and the C.I.A. have seemed more intent on preventing the publication of the Senate committee's report than in reassuring the American people that the aberrations it documents are to be purged from any future intelligence operations.

title: LAWYER TESTIFIES ON GULF RETAINER

title: Carey to Propose Single Primary
description: Governor Carey agreed to put before the special session of the Legislature a proposal calling for a single political primary next year in late May or early June.

description: After reaching peaks for the year in late September or early October, prices of meatsbeef, pork and poultryhave started to decline.

description: The stock market gave up a little more ground yesterday in continued lackluster trading.

title: People and Business
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, yesterday urged a Congressional panel to back specific steps that would help small businesses prosper and grow.

title: World Network Helps Political Prisoners

Sakharov, the Soviet physicist and Nobel Prize winner, about the forthcoming trial of another Soviet scientist and political dissenter, Andrei Tverdokhlebov.

title: CHURCH EXPECTS SENATE SUPPORT OF C.I.A. CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Senator Frank Chuirch said today that he believed the Senate would pass before Easter legislation providing for strong Congressional oversight of the intelligence agencies.

title: Report of Rudd in Cuba Tied to Lampoon Hoax
description: News reports yesterday that Mark Rudd, the radical activist of the late 1960's, was a prisoner in a Cuban homosextual rehabilitation camp apparently were based on a hoax published in the October issue of National Lampoon the humor magazine.

title: Music: Winds on Parade
description: Pierre Boulez nut the New York Philharmonic's wind sections on parade at Thursday night's subscription concert and demonstrated both their communal virtuosity and his own keen ear for balancing and adjusting orchestral choirs. The program opened with Stravinsky's Symphonies of Wind Instruments (1920) and closed with Dukas's La Peri, whose fanfare introduction is a standard test piece for winds.

title: Music: Tchaikovsky Bill
description: For the second of its two concerts at Carnegie Hall this week, the Moscow State Symphony offered a Tchaikovsky bill Thursday night. And for anyone with preconceptions about how Russians play Russian music, it was a disconcerting evening.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WQXR. Violin Concerto No. 5 in A, Mozart; Suite from the opera Isse, Destouches; Overture to His Majesty's Birthday Ode, 1775, Boyce; Passo A Se:, Ballo Di, Soldati from William Tell, Rossini; 3rd and 4th Mvts from Symphony No. 5, Raft; Jubilee Overture, Weber; Intermezzo from Notre Dame, Schmidt; Flute Concerto, Szervanszky. 7:30.10:18, WKCRFM. Hymn of Jesus, Hoist; Christmas Cantata, Honegger; Symphony No. 3, Blomdahl; Connection, Billings; II Convito Musicale. Vecchi; Requiem, Lassus.

title: City Is Foreclosing On Village
description: The Beame administration foreclosed the mortgage yesterday on a controversial $25 million project, West Village Houses, and said it planned to rent the 420apartment complex at a loss to the city of an estimated $12 million.
