title: CITY SHUTS DOWN FOE FIREHOUSES
description: Many thanks and God bless the finest men in the job, Capt. Frank Carino wrote on the blackboard of the firehouse of Engine Company 269 in the Park Slope section of. Brooklyn yesterday morning.

title: Japanese ArtifactsExotic Yet Available
description: The opening of the Burke collection of Japanese art at the Metropolitan Museum earlier this month (it will be on exhibition until Jan. 4) provides a longawaited feast for those with a hunger for Orientalia. But, of course, the exquisite paintings, scrolls, lacquer and metalwork col lected by Mary and the late Jackson Burke are well beyond the reach of the average collector. Nevertheless, there is a surprising variety and quantity of precious and relativelyprecious objects made by Japanese craftsmen to be found in the United States, often at modest prices. Indeed, there are more samurai swords, and more antique bronze mirrors in this country today than there are in Japan.

title: Strategy of Terrorism
description: BUENOS AIRESAlthough South America is still characterized by pelitical violence, guerrilla and terrorist movements have tended to lose portance over the paat few yearsexcept in Argentina. Elsewhere they have been defeated or contained by security forces or expelled to the periplieries of significance.

title: In Addition to Enthusiasm, It Has Money, Doctrine, Expertise
description: WASHINGTONThe nastiest putdown that some people can come up with about Ronald Reagan is that he is a George McGovern of the Right. But they seem to forget that George McGovern enlisted the Democratic Party's best workers in 1972, tapped its richest contributors, appealed to its most articulate thinkers and won the Presidential nomination on the first ballot.

title: State Opera Will Open With Tosca
description: FANWOODJust because you are peasants in this scene doesn't mean you have to sound like peasants, Frank Guerrini, the assistant conductor and chorus master of the New Jersey State Opera, bellowed at the 27 singers assembled before him. Heads dipped into musical scores, and the passage was begun again.

description: TOKYO, Sunday, Nov. 23 (AP)Two persons were killed and 18 injured in a gas explosion and fire early today an 11story apartment building on Tokyo's western outskirts, the police reported.

The first is a wickedly funny Redlich premiere that does not celebrate the Bicentennial and the second is Hanya Holm's first new moderndance work in nearly two decades.

title: Barbara Leslie Is Married Here
description: Barbara Denise Leslie, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Stephen H. Leslie of New York, was married here early yesterday evening to David C. Saypol, son of Dr. and Mrs. George M. Saypol of New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: Ostolozaga of Loughlin Sets Course Mark in Bronx Run
description: Luis Ostolozaga, an unbeaten Bishop Loughlin High School senior from Brooklyn, broke the course record yesterday with his 10th victory of the season in the Christian Brothers scholastic crosscountry championships at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Girl to Visit Pair Accused of Killing Her
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Nov. 22 (AP)Last March, a San Bernardino woman and her former husband were convicted of murdering their 3yearold daughter in 1965.

title: U.S., AIRLINE AGREE TO SHARE DAMAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) An agreement has been reached between Trans World Airlines and the Federal Aviation Administration to share damages in a T.W.A. crash last year in which 92 people were killed, a Justice Department spokesman said today.

title: How Proposed Tax Rise On Cify Income Works
description: ALBANY, Nov. 22The new income tax rates for New York City residents, which would go into effect Jan. 1, 1976, would mean that taxpayers at the lower end of the income scale would pay less than before, while higherincome taxpayers would pay up to 30 percent more. The net increase to the city would be $75 million.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Trouble with really good writers is that they sometimes can get so involved with techniques and style that they tend to forget the raison d'tre of the crime novel. So it is with THE BLACK TOWER by P. D. James. (Scribner's. $6.95). Mrs. James is an exceedingly good writer, and her detective, Adam Dalgliesh, is one of the more unusual ones in action today. Nevertheless, The Black Tower is so slowmoving that it will try the patience of most readersand that has to be the besetting sin of a crime novel.

title: Nephew of Nixon Cited With Vesco In U.S. Subpoena
description: DETROIT, Nov. 22 (AP) Robert Vesco, the fugitive financier, and Donald Nixon Jr., who is a Vesco aide and a nephew of the former President, are among the subjects of a Federal grand jury's investigation into heroin smuggling, according to a subjoena.

title: East Brunswick Gets New Park and Ride
description: EAST BRUNSWICKLocal officials are keeping their fingers crossed as they await the formal opening tomorrow of a parkandride facility in the parking lot of a defunct department store.

title: Buckeyes Triumph, 2114, on Late Touchdowns
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 22Just as everyone figured, a lad named Griffin was the difference in today's annual Big Ten championship war between Ohio State and Michigan, both unbeaten and both bowlbound.

Buchanan, the young ideological slugger on President Nixon's speechwriting staff, became familiar to a wide televisions audience during the Watergate hearings for his spirited defense of some of the Nixon Administration's tactics as political hardball. He was known earlier to the White House press corps as the author of several of Spiro Agnew's famous speeches attacking television news coverage and the major newspapers.

title: Warren Panel Aide Calls for 2d Inquiry Into Kennedy Killing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A senior member of the Warren Commission staff called on Congress today to reopen the inquiry into President Kennedy's death because of new questions posed by findings of United States involvement in assassination plots against foreign leaders.

title: Yuletide In Lee's Virginia
description: ONCE upon a Christmastide I was unpacking a huge cardboard carton that had been shipped from my husband's former home. Incongruously tucked in among the pieces of a ham radio set was a plain envelope containing three original letters from Robert E. Lee, part of my husband's jumbled inheritance from his aunt, Mrs. Robert E. Lee 3d. All the letters were signed Your father, R. E. Lee, and the most fascinating was the famed Christmas letter of 1851, written when the Civil War, which would rend the lives of Lee, his wife, Mary, and their seven children, was still almost decade away. The letter was addressed to Lee's son, Custis, then a cadet at West Point, and it includes an evocative recreation of the family's celebration of Christmas at Arlington, their homestead in Virginia.

title: Bubbling with busy happiness, anguished by the onset of breakdowns

title: House plants hate hard rock
description: Dorothy Retallack of Denver presented recordings of classical, semiclassical, avantgarde and rock music to ordinary garden and house plants placed in a closed cabinet with a loudspeaker to one side. The plant s were exposed to hymns and to La Paloma, to strings and to steel drums, to jazz and to Country Western. . . . The East Indian temple ragas aroused the most favorable response from all the plants used  petunias, carnations, geraniums, beans and squash. . . . Devotional music was played to bean plants. In three weeks they were about two inches taller than others grown in a quiet chamber.... Jazz had a good effect on growth, loo, while Country Western music was the only type to produce no reaction at The most dramatic effects were observed among all types of plants exposed to acid rock. They leaned away from the sound, as if trying to escape, and would not bloom. At the end of three weeks, they were dying.  Lucy Kavalcr, Menace.

description: Some call it the monster of the tunnels, but to the 5,000 motorists who were stranded in the BrooklynBattery and Queens Midtown tunnels last year, it is a welcome sight

title: Ithaca Victor In Division III
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Nov. 2,2t (AP)  Gene Ncolato, a linebacker, intercepted a pass and Dave Pitzer ran 4 yards to give Ithaca a goahead touchdown and the Bombers went on to rout Fort Valley of Georgia, 4112, and advance today to the semifinal round in the National Collegiate Division III football playoffs.

title: Theater Notes:
description: Come late spring, or next fall at the latest, Broadway will finally make the acquaintance of a play that has already been seen and applauded by theatergoers from Portland, Oregon, to Washington, D.C. The play, The Last Meeting of the Knights of the White Magnolia by a 39yearold Texan named Preston Jones, will thus become the most conspicuous example to date of the work of American Playwrights Theater, an organization devoted to bringing new American plays to life on the stages of our regional, university and community theaters.

title: Eileen Holschuh Bride of D. C. Dominick
description: Eileen Marie Holschuh, a medical social worker with the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Md. was married yesterday to Donald Charles Dominick, a cartographer with the National Areonautical and Oceanographic Division of the Department of Commerce in Washineton.

title: The Road Home
description: In the wake of Watergate and the more recent revelations by the Senate committee on intelligence it has become increasingly difficult for Americans to hold the mirror up to their own country's behavior without the painful discovery of a devastating resemblance the worst features of governmental systems they have always properly detested and spurned.

title: San Marino's World
description: Just when San Marino seemed to be the one comforting place left where the bell did not toll the problems of the first, second and third worlds, the Government of the world's oldest (founded A.D. 301) and smallest (24 square miles) republic has fallen. The postagestamp regime in the Apennines of northcentral Italy had dissolve its Grand and General Council because of power dispute between the Socialists and Christian Democrats.

title: Hanging Tough
description: At one minute before noon last Wednesday, New Yorkers and the nation had every reason to expect that months of growing malaise over New York's deepening fiscal crisis and its potential consequences for the city and nation would soon be ended.

title: Truce in Beirut Collapses; 27 Killed and 32 Wounded
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sunday, Nov. 23A night of violent clashes along Beirut's confrontation line and in the suburbs, killing at least 27 people and wounding 32, left the latest ceasefire in tatters yesterday.

title: $52 Nets $45,548; 5 Jockeys in Spill
description: HAZEL PARK, Mich., Nov. 22 (AP)A $52 investment netted a payoff of $45,548.80 for a 22yearold racing fan in the sixth race superfecta at the Hazel Park Race Track today. The fan correctly picked the 2843 finish. He bet 20 different combinations at $2 each and then boxed the winning numbers for $12 more. The winners odds were 51, 461, 72, and 301.

description: One of the more inventive salutes to Aaron Copland in this month of his 75th birthday was given at Carnegie Recital Hall Friday night by Martin Josman and his National Chorale. The allAmerican program, the first of three Bicentennial concerts by the 17voice professional choir, contrasted a dozen Copland scores with 10 by his contemporaries.

description: BERLIN, Nov. 22 (UPI)Grazuano Mancinelli of Italy turned in a faultless ride aboard La Bella today to win a show jumping event at the West Berlin indoor horse show. Mancinelli, an Olympic gold medalist, gained the victory with perfect forM in 116.5 seconds for the two runs.

title: Correction

The statement was made by Gloria Morris of the State Gaming Commission. The Times regrets the error.

title: The Curse of Being Vladimir Horowitz
description: To tell you the truth, sometimes I'm frightened of myself, said Vladimir Horowitz, during a recent latenight interview in his East Side town house. Always, when I play, the people wait on line for a whole night to buy tickets! Always, the houses are, sold out. It's been like that since 1934. Why does it happen?

title: Not a polisher, but an utterer
description: The poetry of Jack Spicer, who died in 1965 at the age of 40, is an influence on younger poets today for its seeming openness to inner and outer experiences and to the wobble between. Spicer's poetry was antiacademic, rarely boring, but occasionally verbose, and diffuse; he was not a polisher but an utterer, a maker of burlesques as well as lyrics,

Reynolds 3d. He is a son of Mr. Reynolds Jr., chairman of the board of the Reynolds Metals Company, and Mrs. Reynolds of Richmond.

title: Book Ends
description: Robbery. Under mysterious circumstances the New York apartment of an author working on an inside biography of Bebe Rebozo was broken into and 384 pages of completed MS., plus transcripts and tapes of interviews, were stolen. No valuables were taken. The, author, Thomas Kiernan, is under contract to Farrar, Straus & Giroux for the book, which is said to probe deeply into Mr. Rebozo's relationship with President Nixon and Watergate, Mr. Kiernan fortunately will be able to reconstruct the book from other notes and copies, and plans to leave the city at the end of this month to complete it. For the meantime, he's invested in new locks for his apartment.

title: Cornell Loses 8th, 2721

Jan Ginter entered the plea yesterday at his arraignment in United States District Court.

title: Kaiparowits Has Become A Fighting Word in Utah
description: DENVERKaiparowits is a Paiute Indian word meaning mountain home of the people. It is also the name of high, 50milelong, desert mesa in southern Utah, a wilderness covered with juniper and pinon pine trees. Nobody lives on the Kaiparowits Plateau. The only signs of human habitation these days are a few dirt roads, a few bulldozed pits and a lot of holes drilled by geologists to pinpoint the location of the plateau's one economically valuable resource: coal. Atop this mesa, a consortium of California and Arizona utility companies wants to build the nation's biggest minemouth electric generating plant.

description: Dr. and Mrs. Alan E. Van Sciver of Larchmont, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Kathryn Thalia Van Sciver, to James Merrill Croop, son of Dr. and Mrs. Edward J. Croop of Pittsburgh.

description: Pushed by the uncertainties of the city's fiscal crisis and pulled by the lure of lower taxes and a lessstressful suburban environment, some of the nation's leading corporations with headquarters in New York are again actively seeking relocation sites in Connecticut.

title: After Mao and Chou: Analyzing the Chinese Succession Problem
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Speculation about who will succeed Mao Tsetung and Chou Enlai as China's leaders is a necessary function of responsible journalism, but much of the current speculation tells us as much about American ignorance of China as it tells us about Chinese realities.

description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 23 (UPI) Five scientists have come here to try to determine how the air pollution emergency last week affected children.

title: In a Brief Slip, Rockefeller Describes His Situation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Vice President Rockefeller let slip a revealing comment about his situation in the Ford Administration last week at the meetine of Re publican Governors in Wichita, Campaign Kan. In an exNotes change with Gov. Mills E. Godwin Jr. of Virginia, Mr. Rockefeller remarked that it was not enough to berate the Democratic Congress for overspending and budget deficits. The question that Republicans have to answer, he said, is this: If we were in power, what would we do? Then he caught himself. But the President is in power, Mr. Rockefeller added quickly, so I'm sure he will come with some solutions.

description: LONDONAs a child, David Attenborough was fascinated by the mysteries and eerie complexities of tribal masks. As an adult he yearned to travel into the least charted areas of the world in quest of tribal festivals unseen by Western man and rare animals and the customs of birth and life and death.

title: TV: CBS News Is Presenting Two HourLong Programs on the Assassination of President Kennedy
description: Tomorrow and Wednesday at 10 P.M., CBS News is presenting the first two hours in its fourpart series on The American Assassins. These first installments deal with the assassination of President Kennedy. The others, still to be scheduled, will examine the assassinations of Robert F. Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 23The former chief counsel of the Rockefeller Commission, which investigated the Central Intelliegence Agency, said today it was reasonable to assume that Presidents Eisenhower and Kennedy knew of the agency's assassination plots against Prime Minister Fidel Castro of Cuba.

description: THE HAGUEJ. K. Baboeram, a brisk lawyer from the Dutch territory of Surinam, sits at his desk in a welfare office each day and listens to his Visitors.

title: Raiders Win in Overtime
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The nation's capital is extremely passionate about its pro football team, and so there was wailing in the streets tonight from Anacostia to Georgetown because the Redskins had lost again in overtime. They went down to the Oakland Raiders, 2623, when George Blanda kicked a 27yard field goal at 7 minutes 13 seconds of the suddendeath period.

title: Japan Widens Lead Over U.S. in Golf
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 23 (AP) Japanese golfers bolted to a 30stroke advantage over the United States today after three rounds or their annual team competition. Tom Nakamura of Japan gained sole possession of the individual lead.

description: WASHINGTON Nov. 23 Census officials, fearful that the 1980 census will be damaged by a mistrust of government and by recent reports of misuse of personal information gathered in confidence, are mounting a campaign against a bill that would open personal census returns after 75 years.

title: PARKER W. KNIGHT
description: Parker W. Knight, president of Cardion Electronics and a director of the.. Henschel Corporation and Axel Electronics Inc., all units of the General Signal Carporation died Saturday of a heart, attack in Smithtown L.I. He was 50 years old and lived in Fort Salonga, L.I.

title: Devolution or Disunity?
description: Prime Minister Wilson has finally begun a cautious advance toward creation of regional assemblies for Scotland and Wales, to exercise wide governmental responsibilities within the framework of the United Kingdom. Queen Elizabeth II made the proposal in her speech from the throne, presenting the Government program for the new session of Parliament. It foreshadows the most fundamental constitutional change the British Isles since 1921, when what is now the independent Republic of Ireland was cut loose from the United Kingdom.

title: Chrysler Clash: Detroit vs. Coventry

Unlike many of the old factories around Cow entry, in the West Midlands industrial core of Britain, the Ryton plant is long, low and highly automated, stretching over acres of grassy flatland.

title: Z. Z. TOP AND SLADE FILL THE FELT FORUM
description: Z. Z. Top's time has evidently come. The Texas rock trio appeared at the Felt Forum on Saturday, playing elemental Southern boogie music with great deal of violent attack.

description: The struggle for open government continues to make progress.

title: TRADERS WORRIED ON MONEY SUPPLY
description: The capital market, after a run of higher prices from early October to early November, suddenly finds itself facetoface with imposing problems, according to Wall Street ana lysts. There still remains, of course, the imponderable cliffhangerNew York City's financial crisis  yet to be resolved. This has affected mainly the taxexempt sector of the credit markets.

title: Bomb Injures Israeli
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23 (AP) A bomb exploded today near Shufat, about five miles north of Jerusalem, in the occupied West Bank of Jordan, slightly wounding an Israeli soldier, the military command announced. The spot where the bomb went off is used by soldiers to get Tides to their bases or home on leave.

title: Illegal Jitney Vans Popular in Riverdale
description: Jitney services, an illegal form of lowcost group transportation popular in the slums, is winning converts in an unlikely quarter  the wealthy Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nets Victors Over Stars, 113 to 106
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 23Showing some tenacious defense and getting good performances from the bench, the Nets broke away from the Utah Stars for a 113106 victory today at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: Charles Greenman Weds Jane Friedlieb
description: Jane Merril Friedlieb and Charles Preston Greenman, both New York lawyers, were married yesterday afternoon in the North Shore Synagogue in Syosset, L.T. Rabbi Mark Goldman of Temple Sinai in Lawrence, L.I., performed the ceremony.

title: About New York
description: Some of the oldest Byzantine art still around can be seen in Kiev or on Mount Athos or on Mount Sinai, but some of the newest Byzantine art, carrying on a tradition that is more than a thousand years old, is being. created every day up in Washington Heights.

title: Bank Outlook Glum; Loan Losses Heavy
description: The nation's banks, beset with a broad array of problems linked mostly to bad loans, find themselves in their most troublesome period since the Depression. Not for 35 years has the nearterm outlook apneared so glum.

title: DIVIDED SURINAM AWAITS FREEDOM
description: PARAMARIBO, Surinam, Nov. 23 (AP)This territory, to the Dutch by the British in 1667 in exchange for what has since become New York City, will gain independence Tuesday. Its longrange economic outlook seems bright, but racial conflict looms in its irnmediate future.

title: TIGHTER BUDGETS FOR TOWNS SEEN
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 23New Jersey communities, already required by strict state policy to live within their budgets, are going to have to live with still morerestricted budgets, said Robert H. Fust, executive director of the New Jersey State League of Municipalities.1

title: Red Smith
description: Reunion in the Cathedral

title: Corsicans Clash With Police
description: ALERIA, Corsica, Nov. 23 (AP)  Corsicans supporting this French island's autonomy movement threw teargas grenades at the police today and set fire to an administrative building and a shed on the grounds of a prison farm, causing damage but no casualties officials said.

title: Latura, Morales Win at Net
description: John Latura and Miguel Morales defeated Paul Auerbach and Randy Hirschfield, 62, 6.3, yesterday in the final of the New York City Public Parks doubles tennis championship in Central Park.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: New Jersey's jobless rate has remained at the 13 percent level for six consecutive months, the worst since the Depression, according to Labor and Industry Department officials. They said that preliminary figures indicated that unemployment for the month of October did not change substantially from the previous month, when the jobless rate registered 13.6 percent.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 17yearold Poughkeepsie youth stole a large highway bus for a joyride early yesterday, setting off a highspeed chase that ended about half an hour later when state troopers maneuvered him to a halt on Route 9 at Indian Brook Road near Fishkill, N. Y., the state police reported. They said the bus, when forced off the road, tore down more than 240 feet of guard rail, flipped on its side and slid 40 more feet on the roadway, sustaining heavy damage. Two troopers were slightly injured in the chase, and the youth, whose name was withheld as a juvenile offender, was charged with reckless and intoxicated driving and grand larceny.

title: Klan Radio Ads Seek Public Support
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 18David E. Duke, the 25yearold national director of the revitalized Knights of the Ku Klux Klan, listened intently as the WLCS disk jockey, Terry Collins, barked the new Klan commercial into the microphone in the taping studio last week. Today the white majority is enduring the butt of discrimination...We're the ones who pay most of the taxes and enjoy less and less of their benefits...Thousands of organizations work for the special interests of minorities...Give them a little cornpetition...Come to a huge rally of the Ku Klux Klan...Hear David Duke, the dynamic and articulate young leader of the Ku Klux Klan... Enjoy the great Anthony Brothers Band...See the beautiful cross lighting ceremony...

title: To Samaras, the. Medium Is Multiplicity
description: No one could ever accuse Lucas Samaras of being a oneImage artist. In an age when many of his peers ring endless variations on a single theme, he favors diversity, developing ideas and materials with the resourcefulness of a sorcerer.

title: Gallup Poll Shows Big Jackson Gain In Race With Ford
description: If President Ford and Senator] Henry M. Jackson were to oppose each other in a Presidential election today, each would get about 44 percent of the vote, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: A DENTAL SCHOOL IS GIVEN $7MILLION
description: Columbia University's School of Dental and Oral Surgery has received two government grants and a private foundation gift totaling $7.5 million that will allow the school to Sri crease its patient load 40 percent within the next five years.

title: New Orders Grow For Machine Tools
description: New orders for machine tools in October ran 8.5 percent higher than in September but fell 29.1 percent behind the yearearlier level, the Nationali Machine Tool Builders Association reported over the weekend. October shipments trailed the September level by 1.2 percent but were 8.5 percent higher than in October 1974.

title: Lisbon Political Crisis Comes to a Boil With Communists Pressing Socialists
description: LISBON, Nov. 23Portugal's military leaders are faced with what appears to be the most serious crisis of authority since they were brought to power by the revolution 19 months ago.

title: Lindenhurst Loses To Ward Melville
description: Lindenhurst (L. I.) High School won a legal battle yesterday but then lost football game as Ward Melville scored a 108 victory for the Suffolk County AAA conference chamoionshin.

title: DEATH TOLL RISES IN BEIRUT FIGHTING
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, Nov. 24  Fighting spread in Beirut and its suburbs last night as a ceasefire, proclaimed three weeks ago, continued to unravel. Eight persons were reported killed yesterday and 15 were reported wounded, and as night fell the sounds of explosions increased.

title: New Yorkers Rally Today in Times Sq. In Bid for U.S. Aid
description: Governor Caray Mayor Beanie, Senator Jacob K. Javits and other officials, along with entertainment arid sports figures and two orchestras, will mark a New Yorkers United Day rally starting at noon today in Times Souare.

title: Music: Arrau Recital
description: It's difficult having reservations in a houseful of idolators, but that was how this listener felt during the allBeethoven first half of Claudio Arrau's recital yesterday afternoon at Avery Fisher Hall. Fortunately, the RavelLiszt second half did much to alleviate the sense of alienation,

description: When Dr. Elaine First Sharpe, professor of English at Jersey City State College, decided to try to establish courses that would cater to the very practical needs, interests, talents and abilities of women, it did not even occur to her to dream of instant success.

title: Closing of Will Rogers Hospital Creates Atmosphere of Despair at Saranac Lake
description: SARANAC LAKE, N. Y.  The last of the warldfamous tuberculosis sanitariums in the Northern Adirondacks, the Will Rogers Memorial Hospital and Research Center, is closing down here in.anratmosphere of disappointment and despair.

title: V. Amritraj Beats Orantes in Final
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 23 (AP)Vijay Amritraj of India delighted his countrymen today by defeating the United States Open champion, Manuel Orantes of Spain, 75, 63, for the men's singles title in the $50,000 Indian Grand Prix lawn tennis chamnionshios.

title: Five Contenders for Presidency Stump for N.D.C. Backing Here
description: The liberal end of the list of Democratic Presidential candidates began yesterday the final spurt of electioneering in advance of the meeting at which a handful of New Yorkers will choose the official liberal in the states early  and therefore significantprimary.

title: Nader Undaunted by Setbacks to Consumer Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Hunched against a Corinthian column in the lobby of the House of Representatives, Ralph Nader fixed the passing congressmen with a stern, admonitory gaze as they trooped to the floor to vote on amendments to the Consumer Protection Act, a bill he had nurtured and pushed for six years.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Women's Role Cited In Jewish Agencies That Raise Funds
description: More than 21 percent of the members of boards of Jewish philanthropic fund groups in communities of 5,000 to 40,000 population in this country and Canada are women, according to a report issued here yesterday.

title: Susan's Girl at Big A
description: Fred Hooper's Susan's Girl, a candidate for female horse of the year, will head a field of 14 today in the $60,000 added Berlo Handicap for fillies and mares Aqueduct.

description: Theater

title: Nebraska Changes Mind, Votes for Fiesta Bowl After. 3510 Loss to Oklahoma
description: Nebraska's football players recovered from the agony of Saturday's defeat to Oklahoma and their anger with bowl  selection committees just long enough yesterday to reconsider a bid from the Fiesta Bowl. They voted to go to that postseason game at Tempe, Ariz., Dec. 26. Nebraska will meet either Arizona or Arizona State.

title: Brezhnev Gets Award
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23 (UPI)The Soviet Union announced today that Leonid I. Brezhnev has been awarded the World Peace Council's highest prize for his efforts toward the relaxation of world tensions. The council, based in Helsinki, Finland, is backed by the Kremlin.

title: OTTAWA VOTE PUB ON WAGE CONTROLS
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23The Government's new wage and price control measures, scheduled to run for three years, are encountering strong opposition in a broad sector of the public.

title: Children Wait for Willy Wonka As NBC Plays Out Football Tie
description: Confronted once again with the dilemma of televising a tensionpacked pro football game to its conclusion or of showing a widely anticipated children's film on schedule, NBCTV chose the game last night and drew angry calls from parents of denied, tearful children.

title: ModernDance Choreography Offered by Reynaldo Alejandro
description: Reynaldo Alejandro, who directs a Philippine folk dance company based in New York, presented his own moderndance choreography Saturday night at Washington Square Methodist Church.

title: Convention Poll
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 23 (UPI)Senator Humphrey was the leading choice for his party's 1976 Presidential nomination among delegates attending the National Issues Convention here this weekend. He nosed out Senator Birch Bayh of Indiana as the favorite candidate among 984 persons voting in the informal survey by a company marketing a new telephonic polling device.

title: The Screen: 'Rancho':Spoof Western Opens at the D.W. Griffith
description: "Rancho DeLuxe" is handsome, witty, apt and languid. It is so cool it is barely alive. First-rate ingredients and a finesse in assembling them do not quite make either a movie or a cake. At some point it is necessary to light the oven."Rancho," which opened yesterday at the D. W. Griffith Theater, is a kind of parody Western, a genre barely younger than the Western itself. And as long as Frank Perry, the director, and Thomas McGuane, the writer, are being wry about ranch owners who ride around in helicopters and ranch hands whose chores include vacuuming the rancher's Navajo rugs, they do extremely well.All their characters are phonies, and this is fine. They are often very funny phonies. But the heroestwo fey and charming young rustlers who saw up other people's cows as an existential actare infested with humorous self-pity.Through them the portentous message creeps in: the West is dead and inhabited by maggots. Nothing happens to the message; it doesn't go anywhere. It is used as dcor, dressing the set in a fashionable tone of lavender.Affectations aside, there is a great deal that this picture does well. It relates the ill-starred but decidedly non-tragic war between the two rustlers, Jack and Cecil, and the rancher, John Brown.They begin by shooting a cow or two and sawing them up with a portable chainsaw. They go on to hold a prize bull for ransomin a motel bedroom  and finally they attempt to steal a whole trailer-rig of cattle in partnership with Brown's ranch-hands.Jack, played a bit too fatly and lovably by Jeff Bridges, is a rich boy who has left his wife and bums around with Cecil, a literate and spaced-out Indian.Both of them move through a perpetual haze of self-parody. As they drive their pickup truck off from one cow-killing, one asks the other: "Do you believe in the tooth fairy?"When Jack makes love to one of two sisters who hang out with them, he slips on a comic dog mask at the crucial moment.Cecil, very well acted by Sam Waterston, makes jokes about being an Indian. "Let's burn and pillage," he suggests to Jack as the two sit around with nothing much to do.They are blatantly inauthentic rustlers, and they know it. Their self-knowledge and their deliberate kookiness is their commentaryand the film'son Western pretensions of retaining old values while in fact living off all the comforts and shortcuts of urban American life.The film's other characters are just as inauthentic, but without self-consciousness, and this makes them much funnier. Brown, the rancher, wears lumberjack shirts and goes on about preserving "a West that's free." In fact he is a refugee from the hair-dressing business back East and wears his cattleman image as a child wears a soldier suit.His wife puts in game appearances at cattle shows, tries to seduce the ranch hands with war cries of "how about a little desire under the elms?" and longs to go back East. Their lavish ranch house is airless, and its picture windows frame the spectacular mountain scenery as if it were, in fact, no more than pictures.Brown's two ranch hands are just as phony. One is a former appliance repairman, the other used to model hot combs. Their beautifully indirect inveiglement by Jack and Cecil into becoming their accomplices, played out in a bar, is the best scene in the movie.As a decrepit and seemingly inept professional rustler-detective, hired by Brown, Slim Pickens for once has a strongly written comic role. He plays it with great effect, and Charlene Dallas, as his sluttish assistant, is almost as good.Their earthy roles and acting styles do a lot to liven up a picture whose artfulness is marred by its own narcissistic excess.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The faithful who had fought for Generalissimo Francisco Franco gathered in the Valley of the Fallen yesterday where their leader was entombed inside a mountain in the vast crypt he had built about 40 miles northwest of Madrid. Some 70,000 veterans of the Civil War, Falangists and others came from all the provinces of Spain in a fleet of buses to say their farewell. [Page 1, Columns 14.]

title: Soviet Journal Reports Shortage of Seed Grain
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23, (Reuters) A Soviet farm newspaper reported today that many areas of the Soviet Union were having serious difficulties preparing grain seed for sowing next sprint.

title: Billy Graham III in Athens
description: ATHENS, Nov. 23 (AP)The Rev. Billy Graham arrived in Athens today suffering from a severe intestinal infection that may cause him to cancel a visit to East Africa, his spokesman said. The evangelist had completed a twomonth preaching tour of the Far East and Middle East. He is scheduled to see Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel next week in Jenusalem before going to Kenya.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Italian Airports Are Struck
description: ROME, Monday, Nov. 24 (AP) A 24hour strike by airport workers started just after midnight today, grounding all commercial flights and closing down airports.

title: .   and the Reagan Bid
description: Mr. Reagan, in the old phrase, is unquestionably choice, not an echo. But what is new about his candidacy that gives rightwing Republicans the hope that if he is nominated, he can do better than reenact the Goldwater debacle?

title: More Companies Here Seek Connecticut Sites
description: Pushed by the uncertainties of the city's fiscal crisis and pulled by the lure of lower taxes and a lessstressful subUrban environment, some of the nation's leading corporations with headquarters in New York are again actively seeking relocation sites in Connecticut.

title: Angolan Group Says SovietBacked Rivals Have Superior Arms
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Nov. 23Western arms being supplied covertly to two antiCommunist liberation groups fighting in Angola are described by Western diplomats and leaders of one of the groups as paltry and ineffective compared with the supplies the Soviet Union has been pouring into Luanda for the faction it is backing.

title: New Chairman Elected By Kidney Foundation
description: The election of Jack C. Kent of Denver as chairman of the National Kidney Foundation was announced yesterday. Mr. Kent, an automobile executive, was president for the Rocky Mountain region of the foundation from 1972 through 1974.

title: Prosecutor Awaits Significant Facts In Respirator Death
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 23 District Attorney Dennis E. Dillon said today that his investigation into the death of Mary Jane Dahl, which the Medical Examiner has termed a homicide, was awaiting other significant facts.

title: Attempt on Waldheim Denied
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 22A broadcast report that an attempt on the life of Secretary General Waldheim had been made in Syria was denied this afternoon by the chief press spokesman of the United Nations, William C. Powell.

title: Drop In An Apple Presto It's Juice
description: The Vita Mix is playing the Palace.

title: HENRY B. GOODFRIEND
description: Henry B. Goodfriend, who retired after having been dealer in pearls and precious stones here for many years with Goodfriend Brothers, died Saturday at Lawrence Hospital in Bronxville, N,Y. He was 82 years old and lived at 176 Garth Road. Scarsdale. N.Y.

title: Tarkenton Passes Mark; Griese Is Lost for Season
description: Fran Tarkenton, who began playing professional football in 1961, set a National Football League record of 2,840 pass completions yesterday as his Minnesota Vikings won their 10th straight game without a loss, a 2813 triumph over the San Diego Chargers at Bloomington, Minn. It was the 10th loss in 10 games for the Chargers this season.

title: Women's Group Honors Israel U.N. Representative
description: Simcha Dinitz, Israel's representative to the United States, received the Rambam Award last night from the American Mizrachi Women in recognition of his service in developing close relations between this country and Israel.

title: Waldheim Optimistic After Seeing Syrian Leader
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 23 (UPI)Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations said today that his talks here with the Syrian President, Hafez alAssad, could prove very helpful in getting further ArabIsraeli peace negotiations under way.

title: A Dead Museum in Jersey
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 23In an age when many museums are curtailing their operations and some are closing, the Jersey City Public Library Museum reopened its doors today following a 24year shutdown.

title: STUDY FAVORABLE ON PEAT, MARWICK
description: As a step in the accounting profession's efforts to restore belief in its reliability, Peat Marwick, Mitchell & Company, the biggest firm In the field, released over the weekend a review of the quality of its worka review conducted by Arthur Young & Company, another large accounting partnership.

title: Church Assembly Opens in Nairobi After a Disruption
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 23 (Reuters)The fifth assembly of the World Council of Churches opened here today with a colorful ecumenical service of dedication after being briefly disrupted by a Scottish Calvinist nrotest.

title: Electricity Granted Reluctant Approval In Battery Park City
description: After a bitter, yearlong dispute involving city and state agencies, the City Planning Commission has given its reluctant approval for the use of electricity to heat and cool the first 3,364 apartments in Battery Park City, the huge new town under construction on Hudson River landfill.

title: Franco Laid to Rest in Valley of Fallen
description: VALLEY OF THE FALLEN, Spain, Nov. 23The faithful who had fought for Generalissimo Francisco Franco and lived in the Spain of his vision gathered in the Valley of the Fallen today.

title: Inequities Found in Hospital Payments
description: A new study has found that the city's municipal hospitals receive lets reimbursement of funds under state regulations and laws than voluntary hospitals.

title: U.N. LOBBIES SEEK SAHARA SUPPORT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 23Algerian and Moroccan diplomats were strenuously lobbying over the weekend in opposing efforts to line up support in forthcoming United Nations debates on Spanish Sahara.

title: Postal Service Considers End to Saturday Deliveries
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)With the United States postal service losing more than $250,000 an hour, Postmaster General Benjamin F. Bailer is considering further economy moves such as discontinuing Saturday mail deliveries or special delivery service.

title: Oakland Publisher Seeks Supremacy in News Biz
description: OAKLAND, Calif.Joseph W. Knowland, the thirdgeneration Knowland to publish and edit The Oakland Tribune, is enthusiastic about his newspaper and abciut what he calls the news biz in general.

title: North Carolina Fire Kills 6
description: LOCUST, N. C., Nov. 23. (AP) A family of six died late last night when a fire engulfed their mobile home near the Stanly County community of Locust, the authorities said. The sheriff's department today identified the victims as Sam Pinion Jr., 49 years old; his wife, Peggy, 39, and their four daughters, Cindy Lee, 7; Rosie, 5; Crystal, 3, and Angela, 2.

title: Challenge to Mr. Ford ...
description: The entrance of former Gov. Ronald Reagan into the Republican Presidential campaign means not only that President Ford faces a stiff challenge to win nomination in his own right but also that extremely conservative ideas about public policy and the size of Government are going to be thoroughly and perhaps more effectively articulated than they have been by Mr. Ford.

title: Israelis Irked at Waldheim
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23Israeli officials were angered by Secretary General Waldheim's meeting in Damascus with Yasir Arafat, the Palestine Liberation Organization leader.

description: Governor Carey plans to send a special message to the Legislature today, telling the members that the specter of default requires them to put aside the local concerns that have stalled since Friday passage of the $200 million New York City package.

description: GREENBERGVlole. Beloved Woman of Valor. I think about you everyday. Alt the love In mi heart belongs to you forever. Rest In Peace,

description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 23A young and growing organization of black educators from schools and colleges throughout the country gathered in New Orleans last week to develop ways to improve the education of black youngsters and to identify the most critical issues black educators should confront in the year ahead.

title: SCHLESINGER SAYS BUDGET WOULD CUT FORCES BY 200,000
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23James R. Schlesinger said today that before his dismissal as Defense Secretary the White House was proposing a defense budget that would have required a 200,000man reduction in the size of the armed forces next year.

description: Xrays of Denis Potvin's injured left ankle proved negative yesterday, according to Dr. Calvin Nicholas. The New York Islanders top defenseman and scorer suffered sprained ankle during the second period of Saturday's game with the Kansas City Scouts.

description: If you should happen to see Boy Scouts in a grocery or drug store, studying prices and then narrowing their study to three products, they probably aren't getting ready to help a little old lady with her shopping,, but are working toward the newest merit badge in scouting.

title: C.I.A. Said to Have Links With Azores Secessionists
description: The Central Intelligence Agency has developed extensive contracts with a group favoring secessionfor the Portuguese Azores and State Department officials have received representatives of the group, Time magazine has reported in its issue that goes on sale today.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)Representative William S. Moorhead, Democrat of Pennsylvania, said today that Congressional investigators had found truly astounding cost overruns on water resource projects built by the United States Bureau of Reclamation.

description: The transcript of 75 hours of oralhistory tape recordings made in 195051 by the late Henry A. Wallace, opened to scholars last week, discloses small but crucial roles for Mr. Wallace in two of this century's most notable technological efforts: the atomic bomb and the ereen revolution.

title: Traditional Values Persist in Rural Japan
description: SANNOHE, Japan The maples are turning russet and the oaks yellow amid the green pines and firs on the mountainsides. The rice has been harvested and the straw stacked to look like the tents of an army camped across the valleys. The apples, red pink, and green, hang heavy on their trees awaiting the pickers.

Nixon ordered the C.I.A. to help organize a military coup in Chile to keep Salvador Allende from becoming President.

title: Resettlement Nearing End, But Not Refugee Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The resettlement of more than 130,000 Indochinese refugees, which officials agree developed into the most difficult such resettlement in the nation's history, is drawing to a close. However, the related problems, and complaints continue.

title: Miss Haynie Triumphs
description: FORT MYERS. Fla., Nov. (AP)Sandra Haynie sank a 6inch putt for a par on the second hole of a suddenleath playoff today and won We Greater Fort Myers Classic golf tournament. She beat Pat Bradley, who missed a 25foot putt and took a bogey 5 on the hole.

title: Grey Cup Is Captured By Eskimos
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 23 (AP)Dave Cutler kicked three field goals for all of Edmonton's points today and gave the Eskimos a 98 victory over Montreal In the Canadian Football League's Grey Cup championship game.

title: McGovern Cautions Party Against Retreat on Busing
description: LOUISVILLE, Nov. 23Senator George McGovern boldly admonished his party today not to sell its soul on busing, which he described as one inescapable remedy of the Constitution for a proven case of segregation.

title: Comoro Islands to Mobilize After Invasion's Failure
description: MORONI, Comoro Islands, Nov. 23 (Reuters)  General mobilization has been decreed by the newly independent Gov. ernment of this Indian Ocean archipelago following the failure of a peaceful invasion of breakaway Mayotte Island.

description: There are few foods that, given a purse of sufficient size, cannot be purchased in the United States in or out of season.. One exception is fresh white truffles, an Italian delicacy that's available here for only a brief period.

title: Anne Lang Married to a Physician
description: Anne Michelle Lang, daughter of. Mr. and Mrs. Hans J: Lang of Des Plains, Ill., and East Hampton, L.I., was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Thomas Joseph Paolino Jr., son of Associate Justice Paolino of the Rhode Island Supreme Court and Mrs. Paolino of Cranston, R. I.

title: Carey Likely to Fill a Void at Convention
description: Despite months of intensive wooing of the 62 Democratic county leaders in this state, none of the Presidential candidates has managed to win the endorsement of a single county leader, and there New York is less than two Political months before the Notes start of the process of selecting delegate candidates for the state's Presidential primary next April.

title: Recipes From the Cave: CroMagnon Man Never Ate Like This
description: SWINDON, EnglandWe didn't wear clogs nor dance several jigs, but we came to Swindon for one compelling reasonto meet Jane Grigson who, through her writing and cookery books, we have long considered to be one of the most civilized and admirable of English ladies since the late Mrs. Beeton.

title: Fredell Lack Pleases in Violin Recital
description: Fredell Lack, a violinist who has played many, recitals here since her debut in. 1943, came back to Tully Hall for another Satuiday night. With her was Albert Hirsch, the pianist with whom she has appeared for some years. The program consisted of sonatas by each (BWV 1023), Beethoven (Op. 30, No. 2), Ysaye (Op. 27, No 2 for unaccompanied violin) and Benjamin Lees (No. 2) plus shorter works by SaintSatins and Paganini.

title: Moravian Woman Ordained
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Nov. 23 (UPI)  Nan Illman Crews of Lititz, Pa., was ordained today as the second woman in the ministry of the Moravian Church in America. Mrs. Crews, a WinstonSalem native, is married to the Rev. Donald A. Crews, assistant pastor at the Lititz church. She was ordained as a deacon, the first rank in the church ministry, and will serve  as youth minister for the East Fairview Church of the Brethren at Manheim, Pa.

description: The troubled Jets secondary is in even more serious trouble. Delles Howell, the free safety, broke a bone in his right arm before the half and is out for the season. The club probably will pick up a player today to replace him.

description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 23 (UPI) Artis Gilmore scored 29 points tonight in leading the Kentucky Colonels 93.85 American Basketball Association victory over the Spirits of St. Louis.

description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 23With the threat of a general strike on Tuesday hanging over New Haven, the school board and striking publicschool teachers reached a settlement on a twoyear contract today.

title: This Is Called National Defense
description: I was a little more perturbed than the next fellow, I'd say, when I learned shortly after his assassination that Martin Luther King's telephones had, been tapped and his living quarters bugged, and that the recorded tapes thus obtained were played many times for the privite entertainment of various officials and, certain journalists friendly to, the F.B.I., who, chortling, all added ribald comments of their own to the personal conversations on Which they were eavesdrhnning so shamelessly.

title: Gregg Savors His First Coaching Victory as Browns Upset Bengals, 35 to
description: I don't have to tell you how I feel, said Coach Forrest Gregg of the Cleveland Browns after a 3523 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals yesterday in Cleveland. It's been a long, dry spell.

title: Celtics 105, Cavaliers 90
description: CeltIcs 105, Cavaliers 90.

title: MOORE ERIN MARTIN SHARE A DANCE BILL
description: The two approaches to good dance are through the head and through the heart. Erin Martin is a visceral choreographer, and Jack Moore is ruled by logic. Each has produced striking pieces, when following his or her natural bent. They gave joint concert at the American Theater Laboratory on Saturday evening.

title: Packers Triumph, 40 to 14, Over ErrorPlagued Giants
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 23If someone had put blue and white uniforms on the Three Stooges, the Marx Brothers and the Moscow Circus clowns and given them a football, they could not have played a more stumbling, bumbling football game than the Giants did today.

title: Advertising
description: Lord, Geller, Federico, which does advertising for Tiffany, Steinway, Paul Stuart and The New Yorker, is adding still another classy name to its classy client list Saks Fifth Avenue.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: The Consumers League of New Jersey, studying the effectiveness of the Small Claims Courts in the state, has issued a leaflet advising the public how people can act as their own lawyers in Small Claims Court.

title: JUDGE IS CONVICTED IN A SMUGGLING RING
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23 (AP)  Judge Vito Pisciotta of Common Pleas Court has been convicted of smuggling cigarettes, conspiracy and tax evasion in a scheme that involved several state tobacco tax agents.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: BELGRADE DROPS DRIVE ON ALBANIA
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 23Yugoslavia appears to have given up its intensive campaign of the past year to draw Albania back into the European family of nations.

title: Elia Kazan's Mother. Dies
description: Athena Sismanoglou Kazan, mother of the stage and screen director Elia Kazan, died Friday in Beverly Hills; Calif. The widow of George Kazan, a rug importer here who lived in New Rochelle, N. Y., for many years, she had resided in Rye since his death. Surviving also are three other sons, Dr. Avraam Kazan, George and John; 12 grandchildren, and four greatgrandchildren.

title: Gordon Lightfoot, In a Relaxed Vein, Offers Folk Songs
description: A year ago, Gordon Lightfoot played four soldout concerts at Avery Fisher Hall and, at least at the show this observer saw, he was in a foul temper. There was no opening act, and yet the folk singer walked off in a Snit after only an houran hour during which he undercut the moods of his songs with curses about his sound system and general angry disgruntlement.

title: Lakers 110, Rockets 99
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 23 (UPI)Gail Goodrich scored 28 points and handed off 11 assists, both season highs, as the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Houston Rockets 11099 in an N.B.A. game tonight. The victory was the Lakers ninth win without a loss at home.

title: Anaconda Urges Holders To Reject Offer by Crane
description: The Anaconda Company over the weekend urged its shareholders to reject an exchange offer by the Crane Company, made originally in early August and amended earlier this month, for five million shares (22.6 percent) of the diversified copper producer's common stock.

title: Yale Rerevives Dynamite Tonite!,
description: NEW HAVENDynamite Tonite! opened Off Broadway in 1964 and after disastrous reviewsand one performanceit closed. Refusing to let Dynamite die, the Yale Repertory Theater brought it back in 1966 and has now, in its 10th anniversary season rerevived it.

title: Bayh Leads Iowa Poll
description: WATERLOO, Iowa, Nov. 23 (UPI)A poll conducted among nearly 1,000 persons attending a Democratic fundraising rally here showed Senator Birch Bayh of Indiana and former Senator Fred R. Harris of Oklahoma as the first and second choices for the 1976 Democratic Presidential nomination. Senator Bayh received 271 votes, or 38 percent of the 944 votes cast. Mr. Harris received 189, about 20 percent.

title: N.A.S.D. Elects Chairman
description: The election of Robert W. Swinarton, vice chairman of Dean Witter & Company, the brokerage house, as unpaid chairman of the National Association of Securities Dealers was announced yesterday. He will serve for one year.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BIENVENIDO! Jos

title: Soldier and M.P. Are Wounded In Gun Battle During a Robbery
description: FORT MONMOUTH, Nov. 23 A 39yearold Army sergeant, suspected of armed robbery, and a 29yearold military policeman were both in critical condition at a Long Branch hospital this afternoon after gun battle during an attempted robbery outside a bank at the military post here yesterday.

title: Resettlement Nearing End, But Not Refugee Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 The resettlement of more than 130,000 Indochinese refugees, which officials agree developed into the most difficult such resettlement in the nation's history, is drawing to a close. However, the related problems and complaints continue.

title: Bruins Tie Leafs On Late Goal, 33
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)Andre Savard converted a pass from Bobby Orr at 15 minutes 13 seconds of the third period tonight, giving Boston a 33 tie with the Toronto Maple Leafs and extending the Bruins unbeaten streak to seven iames..

title: Israel Devalues Pound
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 23 (UPI) The government devalued the Israeli pound by 1.5 percent late today, the national radio said. The move put the pound exchange rate at 7.10 to the dollar, up from seven pounds.

title: Stage: By Bernstein,
description: Two decades ago in his revue 'New Faces of 1955, Leonard Siliman had a number called Three for the Road. These were parodies of tunes that had supposedly been taken out of musicals on the road! before they reached Broadway. One of these memorable pieces of unmemorabilia was called The Wiener Schnitzel Waltz.

title: New Haven Board And Teacher Union Reach an Accord
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 23With the threat of a general strike on Tuesday hanging over New Haven, the school board and striking publicschool teachers reached a settlement on a twoyear contract today.

title: Segregation Trial on Today
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 23 (UPI) A desegregation suit filed in 1973 by the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People against the Cleveland school system is due to go to trial in United States District Court tomorrow because no settlement was reached in pretrial meetings.

title: Realty Trusts Try to Reduce Debt With Asset Swaps
description: Saddled with millions of dollars of unprofitable property investments, the nation's ailing real estate investment trusts are intensifying efforts to get rid of these properties by offering them to bank creditors in lieu of Daving off bank loans.

title: Rikers Rioters Seize Five And Hold Two Cell Blocks
description: Rioting inmates seized control of two cell blocks at the city's House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island last night and held five correction officers hostage as they negotiated an undisclosed list of demands with Benjamin J. Malcolm, Commissioner of Correction.

title: 4 Dead, 4 Missing in U.S. Navy Collision in the Mediterranean
description: ROME, Nov. 23At least four men: were killed, four are missing and 16 injured in a collision in the Mediterranean Sea last night between the United States aircraft carrier John F. Kenhedy and an American cruiser, Navy officials announced tonight.

title: Texas A. and I. in Playoff
description: KINGSVILLE, Tex., Nov.23 (AP)Undefeated Texas A. and I., tie nation's topranked smtd1 college, decided today to play in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics Division I football playoffs for the sixth time. Texas A and I., defending Division I champion, has a 100, wonlost record and will face Oregon College here Dec. 6 in a semifinal game.

title: Henry &
description: WASHNGTONAs power ebbs; the., sense of humor sours and the hatchet hand loses its skill. Some examples:..

title: THAILAND ACCUSES HANOI OF MEDDLING
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 23 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Chatichai Choonhavan accused North Vietnam tonight of interfering in a dispute between Thailand and Laos that led to armed clashes last week across the Mekong River.

title: Franco Laid to Rest In Valley of Fallen
description: VALLEY OF THE FALLEN, Spain, Nov. 23The faithful who had fought for Generalissimo Francisco Franco and lived in the Spain of his vision gathered in the Valley of the Fallen today.

title: Jersey City Library Museum Open On Shoestring
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 23In an age when many museums are curtailing their operations and some are closing, the Jersey City Public Library Museum reopened its doors today following a 24year shutdown.

title: Rangers Set Back Seals, 32
description: The homesick California Seals stopped by Madison Square Garden last night, dropped a 32 verdict to the Rangers and raced for the plane home. As a result, New York climbed out of the Patrick Division basement and California fell deeper into the Adams Division cellar.

title: Bouvier Judged Best In Maryland K.C. Show
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 23The topwinning working dog in America, Chet Collier's Bouvier des Flandres, Ch. Taquin du Posty Arlequin, rang up his 21st bestinshow award tonight. He was chosen from a field of 2,531 at the Maryland Kennel Club's 63d show in the Fifth Regiment Armnrv.

title: Arthur Goldenberg Weds Mary Brown
description: Mary Elizabeth Brown and Arthur P. Goldenberg, bath of Huntingdon Valley, Pa., were married at noon yesterday in Temple Rodeph Shalom in Philadelphia. Rabbi David H. Wice performed the ceremony.

title: Broadcasting Rules and Right to Reply Are Issues in Suit Over Attack in Radio Talk Show
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23On March 8, 1973, at the height of the nationwide meat boycott, the host of a New York radio talk show asked a Congressional leader of the boycott to be interviewed by telephone as part of that day's show.

title: TAX EASING URGED BY CHARITY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)  A privately funded commission that has been studying charitable contributions for the last two years has recommended that the tax laws be relaxed significantiy.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
The Coleman Debate
description: When Dr. James S. Coleman recently expressed doubts about the effectiveness of busing as a tool for the desegregation of the schools, he inadvertently reopened the debate over his widely quoted 1966 report on the impact of integration on black pupils academic achievements. Perhaps encouraged by the influential sociologist's own second thoughts, two educational researchers have now published charges that the Federal Government deliberately distorted Dr. Coleman's original findings in order to justify its measures to enforce the desegregation guidelines.

title: For Ritz's Thrifty Customers, 40 Years of Used Fur Coats
description: Where do all the mink coats and stoles go when their owners are tired of them? A great many find their way to the Ritz Thrift Shop at 107 West 57th Street, where they are cleaned and glazed and introduced to new, less prosperous owners, who will cherish them for a few more years.

title: Books of The Times
description: American writers are always seeking new fields for disillusionment. It has been revealed to Robert Lipsyte that sports and the people who control them are not untainted by the motives that move ordinary souls. When in doubt, discover new minority group: Mr. Lipsyte is one of the new breed of sports writers who see the profeSsional athlete as the victim of a conspiracy to dehumanize him, to reduce him to a machine for winning.

title: Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 23 The world's biggest collection of master points grew appreciably here last night when Barry Crane, a television producer from Los Angeles, won the National Mixed Pairs title, the opening event of the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals.

title: Brokerage Firms Show A Profit in 3d Quarter
description: Brokerage houses earned $38.2 million during the third quarter of 1975 contrasted with a yearearlier loss of $34.1 million, New York Stock Exchange figures showed yesterday.

title: In Memorum
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (701) MARKET 3.3900: WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (911) WHITE PLAINS 9.5300; NASSAU CO. (516) 741.0500: SUFFOLK CO. (516) 669.1803; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Civilized Way of Life A Casualty in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 24 As Beirut's warring gangs slide into another mindless cycle of violence, the capital is passing, perceptibly, into a new stage of individual and social degradation.

title: Spanish Socialist Leader Says King Has One Month to Chart Course
description: MADRID, Nov. 24The leader of Spain's Socialists said in an interview today that King Juan Carlos must make clear his intentions for a democratic transformation within a month, or the pressures will mount inexorable aeainst him.

title: The Far Side of Styx
description: When Francisco Franco died he went to the New York Department of Motor Vehicles.

title: Village
description: The Village Independent Democrats  whose members drove Carmine De Sapio out of office when what they called reform politics was youngmet last night, many of them middleaged members of the political establishment, to pick among the Liberal candidates for President.

title: Tunics: Exuberant, Simple or Slinky
description: The tunic is, of course, the newest top to wear over pants, but that's only the beginning. It's one of those fashions that sweep across the fashion board almost instantly these days, turning up in inexpensive sportswear geared to teenagers and those not much older, as well as in the rarefied atmosphere of a Galanos or Norell collection.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL.

title: Brookings Study Expects Westto Adjust to Oil Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) The worst effects of recent increased oil prices are over and the Western industrialized nations should gradually adOust, Brookings Institution analysts say.

title: COLLEGES ADVISED ON ENDOWMENTS
description: A study group commissioned by the Twentieth Century Fund, in a report issued yesterday, urged financially troubled private colleges and universities to spend less of their endowment funds and to invest substantial portions of the funds in common stocks.

title: New York Stock Exchange Bond Trading
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 21, 1975

title: Workable World
description: BONNAfter more than two decades of flickering experimentation, dozens of still only dimly linked programs on both sides of the Atlantic are providing increased hope of progress toward improving the quality of work life and giving workers in major industries a sense that they are not merely ciphers in gigantic corporate structures.

title: High Court Hastens Ruling on School Aid
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24 (AP)The State Supreme Court indicated today that it would try to rule as soon as it couldpossibly before the end of the yearon the constitutionality of the new state schoolaid formula.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Ninety New Haven school teachers who were jailed for a week or more for defying a backtowork order were freed after they ended their twoweekold strike.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article on Ralph Na der in The New York Times yesterday, the name of the director of Congress Watch, a Nader project, was given incorrectly. Her name is Joan Claybrook.

title: STOCKS END SLIDE; DOW CLIMBS 4.88
description: The stock market, which went into a minor slump last week over worries about New York's financial problems and too rapid growth in the money supply, became a little more cheerful yesterday as prices rose moderately.

title: TV Guide Executive Rescues His Family But Dies in a Blaze
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa., Nov. 24 (UPI)A father saved his wife and three children by dropping them out of a second floor bedroom window today, but then died in a blaze that destroyed the family's home in nearby Plymouth Meeting.

title: NYACK TEACHERS RETURN TO CLASS
description: NYACK, N.Y., Nov. 24Teachers here returned to their classrooms today, ending a 28day strike after ratifying an agreement early this morning.

title: People in Sports
description: I used to be Joe Torre, said the man currently masquerading as a third and first baseman for the New York Mets.

title: ACCORD ON TAXES NEAR, CAREY SAYS
description: ALBANY, Nov. 24Governor Carey announced tonight that the Democratic and Republican leaders of the Legislature had reached broad understandings and were now optimistic that the $200 million New York City tax package, stalled here since last Friday, could pass both houses tomorrow.

title: Books of The Times
description: What is going on in ??????? family life? In The Making of the Modern Family, Edward Shorter, a young historian of the new social history school, asks some very basic questions and explores some highly tentative answers. First of all, Professor Shorter wants to know, how can we really apprehend what has happened to the family in Western civilization: more specifically, how can we see beyond the familiar court gossip con
