description: Flutist Improves When She Switches From Baroque to Modern Instrument

title: Advertising
description: When the New York Racing Association decided that a Saratoga Fair held in June would be a good way of making some money from its unused horse racing track it hired Grey & Davis, the public relations arm of Grey Advertising, to promote it.

title: Mortgage Delinquencies Show Drop for October
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (UPI)Mortgage loan delinquencies of savings and loan associations in the nation were sharply reduced in October, the United States League of Savings Associations said today.

title: G.M.A.C. OFFERING SHOWS A DECLINE
description: Another corporate issuethe General Motors Acceptance Corporation's latest financingfell several points yesterday as dealers lightened inventories preparatory to a heavy calen dar of new offerings in December. Credit Initially, $100 Markets million of the G.M. unit's 10year notes was offered lat 100 to yield 85/8 percent on (Nov. 13a landmark session when new corporate financings totaled around $1 billion.

title: The Philadelphia Names Mad Guest Conductor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24 (AP)The Philadelphia Orchestra announced the appointment today of Riccardo Muti as principal guest conductor for the 197778 season.

title: U.S. Ends Duties on Some Products From Less Developed
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 24President Ford proclaimed today a list of 2,724 products on which no import duties will i be charged for 10 years if they come from 98 countries and 39 territories deemed less develoned.

title: 2 Businesses Express Faith in City By Going On With Planned Projects
description: Despite New York's fiscal crisis, two business organizations have decided to go ahead with plans requiring large new capital commitments in the city.

title: Why the City Missed Out On 2 Big Foreign Operas
description: WASHINGTON  New Yorkers have grown used to the sky threatening to fall down on :hem. But when the word came put that both West Berlin's eutsche OperCurrently enconsed at the John F. Kennedy

title: Fire Scorches 40,000 Acres in the Los Angeles Hills
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 24A major brush fire burned out of control today in the rugged hills above Los Angeles, sending a dense orange pall over the city as strong shifting winds raised repeated threats to sections of the populous San Fernando Valley.

title: Behind Magic Flute,
description: What's the relationship between, say, elephant hides and The Magic Flute, the new film that has drawn critical hallelujahs and is enticing lines of paying customers to the Coronet Theater? The unsung connection is Carmen F. Zollo, a successful dealer in exotic leathers, who provided all the money $150,000 for the distribution rights to Ingmar Bergman's loving, Swedishmade movie of the Mozart opera.

title: 2 Hunters Are Killed
description: DINGMAN'S FERRY Pa., Nov. 24 (AP)Two hunters were killed by a shotgun blast today when a 13yearold boy apparently mistook them for bears. Maynard Branscome, of Lafayette Hills was pronounced dead at the scene. Daniel Phillips of Philadelphia was dead on arrival at a Port Jervis, N.Y., hospital, the police said.

title: 3 Westinghouse Issues Given a Lower Rating
description: The Westinghouse Electric Company's three outstanding debenture issues were downgraded in rating yesterday from AA to AA by Standard & Poor's. The three issues total $450 million in face value.

title: French Payments Surplus
description: PARIS, Nov. 24 (Reuters)France had a balanceofpayments surplus in the first half of 1975 of $591.5 million compared with an overall deficit of $6,54 billion last year, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: The Carey Taxes
description: The $200 million New York City tax package for which Governor Carey yesterday accepted full responsibility is, as the Governor warned the Legislature, a painful but essential choicethe last hope for averting the dreadful chaos of a city default that now looms less than two weeks away.

title: Texas. El Paso, First in N.C.A.A. Run
description: UNIVERSITY PARK. Pa.. Nov. 24The University of Texas, El Paso, edged Washington State for the team title and Craig Virgin of Illinois won a tactical duel from Nick Rose for individual honors today in the National College Athletic Association crosscountry championships at Penn State University.

title: Hanoi to Be Reunion Capital
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24 (Agence France, Presse) Hanoi has been chosen as the capital of a reunited Vietnam, the Hanoi radio, monitored here, said today. It said the capital would be reconstructed before the reunification of North and South, now under discussion.

title: New Haven Strike Ends; Jailed Teachers Freed
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 24Ninety New Haven public school teachers who were jailed, some for more than a week, for defying a backtowork order, were freed today after ending their twoweek strike.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Morrall, at Age 41, To Dolphin Rescue
description: For the third time in his 20yearcareer in the National Football League, Earl Morrall is being asked to replace the starting quarterback and take the team to the playoffs. The About 4Iyearold Morrail, whose son Pro Matt plays ColFootball lege football at Florida, stepped in for injured John Unitas in 1968 and steered the Baltimore Colts to the Super Bowl. In 1972 Morrell was Miami's quarterback in 10 of 14 games of an undefeated season after Bob Griese injured an ankle.

title: Theater: The ShowOff
description: NEW HAVENThe key to the durability of The ShowOff, George Kelly's 1924 character comedy, is in the authenticity of the two main characters, the shrewd mother, Mrs. Fisher, and the smug showoff, Aubrey Piper.

title: 2 Arraigned in U.S. Court In Insurance Swindle Case
description: A Canadian couple, accused of having swindled more than $100,000 from insurance companies, were arraignd yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn on charges of mail fraud.

title: CITY U. CHIEFS ASK STATE TAKEOVER OF THE UNIVERSITY
description: The City University's Faculty Senate and the council of its college presidents yesterday called for the state to take over the City University's financing and management rather than have the university face additional cuts in the already reduced budget.

title: U.N. PANEL VOTES TEXT ON TORTURE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov, 24The General Assembly's Social Committee approved today an international declaration against torture.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: LOS ANGELES  Hedgmon Lewis, Detroit, and Carlos Palomino, Los Angeles, drew, 10 rounds, welterweights.

title: Mobil's Chairman Criticizes Energy Bill
description: Rawleigh Warner Jr., chairman of the Mobil Oil Corporation, said yesterday that the American public now opposed Government intervention in the oil business, including price regulation.

title: Detroit on Central Tape
description: The New York  Stock Exchange said yesterday transactions on the Detroit Stock Exchange would be added to the consolidated ticker tape starting Nov. 26. Algeady on the are the New York, Midwest, Pacific, Boston, :CinCinnati and PBW exchanges as well as overthecounter  trades and. Instinet transactions between institutions.

title: Judge Acts to Speed AirCrash Suits
description: A Federal judge has moved) to break the logjam that has delayed the adjudication of damage claims of tens of millions of dollars growing out of the March 1974 crash of a DC10 jumbo jet in which 346 persons were killed.

title: Elevator Repairers Negotiating Again As Strike Goes On
description: Negotiations resumed last night in an effort to end the monthlong strike by 1,400 elevator maintenance and repairmen as more and more breakdowns began to plague the more than 39,000 elevators they service in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Conspiracy to Join N.B.A. Is Alleged
description: The players of the American Basketball Association, worried by the contraction of job opportunities in their league and further losses, began legal action yesterday to help block a merger of the league with the National Basketball Association.

title: Beirut Fighting Spreads As Arguing Stalls Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon; Nov. 24Lebanon's militaryand political situation took a sharp, turn for the worse today as fighting spread to wide sections Of the capital and a highlevel political conference broke up in argument.

title: Knick, Laker Courts Viewed For Possible DoubleHeaders
description: The American Basketball Association has applied for 50 playing dates each at Madison Square Garden and The Forum in Los Angeles for next season in a further battle for survival and recognition.

title: Production of Steel Up for a 2d Week; October Output Of
description: Weekly steel production coninued its upward trend for the second consecutive week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The Made association placed industry output for the week ended Nov. 22 at 2,088,000 tons, a gain of 1 per cent over the preceding week. This lifted the production index to 85.6 percent from 84.7 in the week ended Nov. 15 when total output was 2,067,000 tons.

title: Newark's St. James Hospital to Growl
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24  St. James Hospital, currently celebrating its 75th anniversary in this city's Ironbound section, today announced a 10year $5.2 million expansion plan.

title: The Stage: Boccaccio
description: Eight delightful and talented young people pitted in a doomed struggle against the plague: that is the story of Boccaccio, which opened last night at the Edison Theater. The eight young people were the cast and the plague was the play, a musical that had apparently spent three years in its, gestation and really need not have bothered.

title: ELEANOR D. BORELLA
description: Eleanor Dwinell Borella, widow of Victor Borella, who was chief labor consultant to Vice President Rockefeller, died of cancer last Tuesday in Mary litchcock Memorial Hospital n Hanover, N. H. She was 64 years old and lived in Enfield, N. H.

title: LAYOFFS HELD UP AT CITY HOSPITAL
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday stayed planned staff layoffs at Goldwater Memorial. Hospital, asserting that such a reduction could increase the number of deaths among chronically ill patients.

title: Pfizer Declares Dividends
description: Pfizer Inc. declared yesterday a 5cent extra dividend and a regular 19cent dividend on its common stock. Both dividends are payable Dec. 19 to shareholders of record Dec. 4. Pfizer paid a similar extra dividend last December.

title: ;United New York Rally Draws Only a Sparse Crowd
description: New York gave itself a rally yesterday to show that, despite its fiscal condition, its people stood united against Gerald Ford, but only a few New Yorkers15,000 or 8,000 or 5,000. according to different policemenshowed up in Times Square to take part in it.

title: Campus in Boston, Not Harvard, Will Be Site of Kennedy Library
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24The family and friends of President John F. Kennedy abandoned toiday a dozen years of efforts to build his memorial library at Harvard, the university so closely associated with him.

title: Two Needle Trade Union,s Enter a Period ofAmity
description: The International Ladies Garment Workers and the Amalgamated Clothing Workers, which a generation ago were split by personal and political differences, have entered a new period of friendship that has both of them thinking about an eventual merger of the powerful needletrades unions.

title: Sugar Price Cuts Eluding Users
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI) An Agriculture Department specialist said in a sugar outlook report today that consumers were not receiving the fUll benefit of the declines in grower prices. The report added that for the first time in four years the world has a small sugar surplus and prices for Itarmers were clown to or near production costs. Fred Gray. la specialist for the department. said retail sugar price declines in this country had lagged behind declines in raw sugar levels but had still fallen significantly in recent months. But most of the United States sugar supply goes into processed foods ranging from bakery products to soft drinks, and prices for those products have changed only slightly, the economist said.

title: Rikers Island Revolt Ends With Release of Hostages
description: A 17hour revolt at the House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island ended at 2:31 P.M. yesterday with the release of tile last of five correction guards whom prisoners had held hostage but had not harmed.

title: CITY U. CHIEFS ASK STATE TAKEOVER OF THE UNIVERSITY
description: The City University's Faculty Senate and the council of its college presidents yesterday called for the state to take over the City University's financing and management rather than have the university face additional cuts in the already reduced budget.

title: Extra Crane Dividend Set
description: The Crane Company said yesterday it had declared an extra dividend of 20 cents in addition to the 50 cent regular quarterly, both payable Dec. 15 to shareholders of record Dec. 5. The company said cash dividends in 1975 would total $2 a share, compared with $1.40 for 1974.

title: Israel's Respite
description: Implementation of the Sinai agreementand the ensuing disarray among the Arab stateshas given Israel an unanticipated breathing space.

title: Chess
description: Anatoly Karpov, unlike his two immediate predecessors, Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky, has performed like a champion since he was awarded the world title in April.

description: Kin of Dead Girl to Be Fingerprinted

title: For Bellow, Novel Is a Mirror of Society
description: For Saul Bellow, there are basically two kinds of writersthose he calls greatpublic writers and those who are smallpublic writers.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ABOUT TIME Although Somerset Maugham's vintage play Our Betters is a recognized work of quality, it has a curious history and has virtually vanished, at least in this country. A sharpedged comedy exposing the parasitic corruption of London Society, it first opened on Broadway in 1917, then tactfully opened at home after the war in 1923. It last appeared here in 1928 at Henry Miller's Theater (now a pornographic movie house). Our Betters also appears in printed collections of Maugham plays (alongside The Constant Wife and The Circle). The equally obscured Hollywood version in 1933, starring Constance Bennett, was screened a few years ago in a fringe program of the New York Film Festival.

title: Thai Mob BurKS and Loots Vietnamese Refugee Homes
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24 (UPI)Angry Thais burned the homes and shops of hundreds of Vietnamese refugees today in the aftermath of fighting between Thailand and Laos a week ago.

title: Two Needle Trade Unions Enter a Period of Amity
description: The International Ladies Garment Workers and the Amalgamated Clothing Workers, which a generation ago were split by personal and political differences, have entered a new period of friendship that has both of them thinking about an eventual merger of the powerful needletrades unions.

title: VW SEEN SPURNING JOINT U.S. VENTURE
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24Leonard Woodcock, president of the United Auto Workers Union, said today that he had learned that Volkswagen had decided, to go it alone on any United States assembly plant.

title: CLARENCE M. DEAN, EXTIMES WRITER
description: Clarence M. Dean, former associate director of the American Press Institute and for 10 years a member of the news staff of The New York Times, died Saturday in a fire in his apartment at 121 Madison Avenue. He was 64 years old.

title: U.S. FILES LAWSUIT ON DRUG AD CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Justice Department filed an antitrust suit today against the American Pharmaceutical Association and the Michigan state association, charging that their rules against advertising the prices of prescription drugs were illeeal.

title: C.I.A. Calls on Congress To Help It Repair Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Central Intelligence Agency, a harried homeowner of late, is worried about leaksand about cracks in its foundation, worn linoleum in the cafeteria and deteriorating curbing in the parking lot.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Monday, Nov. 24, 1975

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Among Ford's Guests Are Potential Nominees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  Nearly 50 Federal judges, at least seven of whom have apparently been under consideration for the vacant seat on the United States Supreme Court, dined tonight with President and Mrs. Ford.

title: Reformed Mennonite Church Sued Over Shunning
description: CARLISLE. Pa., Nov. 24A potato farmer punished by his fundamentalist church for questioning its authority took that challenge into court here today in a complex, poignant case that could eventually test the limits of religious freedom.

title: Municipal Hoipitals N'erdiate New Pact Withthe Voluntaries
description: For the first time since 1967 the Health and Hospitals Corporation has renegotiated its affiliation contracts with the voluntary hospitals and medical schools that provide doctors for the municipal hospitals.

title: Poll Has Ford Losing Ground to Reagan
description: SAN FRANCISCO Nov. 24In the last three months, President Ford has lost ground among California Republicans to former Gov. Ronald Reagan, according to a study released today by Mervin D. Field, operator of the California Poll.

title: U.S. Arms Official Opposes BigCity Bombing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 The director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency proposed today that the United States, as a matter of fundamental morality, should renounce the first use of nuclear wgannns against cities.

title: DU PONT LIFTS PRICE ON FABRICS AND YARN
description: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company said yesterday would increase nylon prices by 5 percent for apparel hosiery and upholstery fabrics and to 8 percent on nylon and 21C denier Dacron polyester industrial yarns.

title: Jersey Bill Alters Voting in Primaries
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24A highly controversial measure that would end the present primary system in New Jersey cleared the Legislature this evening after a feverish lobbying effort on the Assembly floor in its behalf by the Democratic state chairman, State Senator James P. Dugan of Hudson County. He said that he anticipated Governor Byrne's support for the

title: Air Strike Disrupts Italy
description: ROME, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Most international flights in and out of Rome were canceled today and domestic air traffic was brought to a standstill by a strike of ground staff at Rome's Fiumicino airport.

title: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games
Thomas Tucker Weds Lucy Little
description: Lucy Jade Freeman Little, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Little 2d of Water Mill, L.I., was married yesterday afternoon to Thomas J. Tucker, son of the late John J. Tucker and the late D. Frances Guinand Tucker of White Plains.

title: Bradshaw and Hariis Help Steelers Rout Oilers, 329
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)Terry Bradshaw's aerial artistry, powerful running by Franco Harris and Pittsburgh's Steel Curtain defense carried the Steelers to a 329 National Football League victory over the Houston Oilers tonight in the Astrodome.

title: Yale Elects Staffieri
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 24Vic Staffieri, an offensive guard from Lynbrook, L.I., was elected tonight as captain of Yale's 1678 football team. Staffiari, a 6foot, 220pound junior, will be Yale's 100th football captain..., He succeeds John Smoot, a linebacker, of Dorchester. Mass.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Up at Weekly Auction
Bill Is Passed in Jersey To Alter Primary Voting
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24A highly controversial measure that would end the present primary system in New Jersey cleared the legislature this evening after a feverish lobbying effort on the Assembly floor in its behalf by the Democratic state chairman, State Senator James P. Dugan of Hudson County. He said that he anticipated Governor Byrne's support for the measure.

title: Mehta's Los Angeles Orchestra Does Mahler's Fifth Beautifully
description: It is hard to believe, but Zubin Mehta, has been conductor of the Los Angeles Philharmonic for 14 years. Hard to believe, for Mr. Mehta at least, from the viewpoint of one in the audiencelooks no older than when he took on the assignment in 1962, at the age of 26. So much for growing old gracefully.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 25, 1975

title: Ridgefield Is Battling to Remain Ridgefield
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn.This cozy Fairfield County town looks at Westport, Greenwich and Darien for clues to its futureand doesn't like what it sees.

title: Ford Bids C.I.A. Aides Answer Chile Queries at Closed Session
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI) The White House said today that President Ford had ordered intelligence officials to answer questions about secret United States intervention in Chile's politics for the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, but only in closet session.

title: Dried Potato Chips Given F.D.A. Approval
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration ruled today that restructured potato chipsthose from dehydrated potatoes that come in uniform sizesmay be called chips even though they are not made in the traditional manner.

title: NATIONAL AIRLINE SUES OVER STRIAE
description: MIAML Nov. 24 (AP)National Airlines announced today that it had filed suit in Federal court in Washington, D.C., against the Airline Pilots Association and the striking flight attendants negotiating cornmittee.

title: Mara Supports Arnsparger
description: The Giants, produced by Wellington Mara and Andy Robustelli and directed by Bill Arnsparger are behaving like a sequel to a movie a bad movie, the one about the Jets.

title: Doctors in Medicare Fraud Sentenced to Charity Work
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24 (UPI)A podiatrist and an osteopath who pleaded guilty to Medicare fraud received sentences today that included fines, probations and charity work at a hospital or clinic.

title: Public Advocate Is Critical Of Federal Power Agency
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24Stanley Van Ness, the Stare Public Advocate, asserted today that the federal Power Commission had failed to represent the needs of New Jersey citizens and of the region.

title: Proxmire Charges Zarb Wasted Fuel on Flights
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 Senator William Proxmire said today that the Federal Energy Administrator, Frank G. Zarb, was a winged wastrel of energy because he has taken Air Force planes, not airlines, on 13 official tries.

title: Safeguard ABM System to Shut Down; $5 Billion Spent in 6 Years Since Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24After a $5.7 billion investment, the Defense Department is planning to shut down the Safeguard antiballisticmissile system, which from the start the academic and Congressional critics said would never work.

title: SLOWER ADVANCE SEEN IN ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24An internal analysis in the Treasury Department has concluded that the troublesome figures on unemployment in October, and several other economic indicators, signal some slowing of the pace of advance in the economy in the current fourth quarter but not an aborted recovery.

title: YUGOSLAV ASSAILS SOVIET MEDDLING
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 24The Yugoslav Government, :having arrested several hundred proSoviet Communists, has officially asked the Soviet Union to avoid meddling in Yugoslav politics.

title: Soybean Futures Score Advances
description: Continued sharp price rises marked futures trading in grains and soybeans yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Some corn prices were up the daily limit of 10 cents a bushel and some soybean contracts rose thier 20cent limit. Wheat futures were up almost their limit of 20 cents a bushel.

title: ACCORD ON TAXES NEAR, CAREY SAYS
description: ALBANY, Nov. 24Governor Carey announced tonight that the Democratic and Republican leaders of the Legislature had reached broad understandings and were now optimistic that the $200 million New York City tax package, stalled here since last Friday, could pass both houses tomorrow.

title: Senate Panel Weighing Disputed 74 BellmonEdmondson Election in Oklahoma
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) The Senate Rules Committee, after long but unsuccessful efforts to decide the disputed New Hampshire Senate election, is sorting out an election battle involving a Senate seat from Oklahoma.

title: 3Year FinancingPlan for City Snags On Opposition by Banks and Teachers
description: The threeyear financial plan for the city ran into trouble or two separate fronts yesterday, as major banks and the teach ers union attached conditions to the purchasing or exchang ing city and Municipal Assist. ance Corporation securities:

title: Solomon, Gottfried Gain Final
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 24 (AP)Harold Solomon and Brian Gottfried each scored fourset victories today and set up an allAmerican men's singles final in the South African open tennis championships. They will meet tomorrow.

title: Courts Already Ordered Some AskedFor Reforms
description: A dozen or so of the nearly 2,000 inmates at the men's jail at Rikers Island are allowed to touch and embrace their visitors. The others are separated from their visiting friends and family by sealed windows, and they must communicate by telephone.

title: Business Briefs
description: BONN, Nov. 24 (AP)West Germany's Council Economic Advisers predicted today a 6 percent rise global trade next year after a 7 percent decline this year, as the West recovers from the worst recession since World War II. In the United States, economic recovery already has assumed the proportions of a powerful upswing, the five governmentappointed advisors said their annual report.

title: Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 24One of the world's top women pairs led into the final session of the life master women's pair championship here tonight at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals.

title: Music: Flute Quartets
description: Mozart is a composer of some quality, and Karl Kraber is a remarkable flutist. So, it naturally occurred to Mr. Kraber to round up all of Mozart's flute quartets and perform them on one program. The concert, on Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, was the first of three programs this season by the flutist and his associates. While the level of performance remained high throughout, the concert also demonstrated that there can be too much of anything. Even Mozart.

title: Combustion Engineering To Close Saginaw Plant
description: WINDSOR, Conn., Nov. 24 (UPI)Combustion Engineering Inc. said today, the Saginaw, Mich., plant of its power systems unit would be closed at the end of January. The company said approximately 250 persons would be affected by the shutdown. Output of industrial boilers at the plant will be shifted to the company's Chattanooga, Tenn., facility.

title: Soviet Far East Turning to Trade With Pacific Basin
description: KHABAROVSK, U.S.S.R.The Soviet Far East, an area ranging from mosquito  ridden swamps to permanently frozen wastelands and encompassing the sprawling Pacific territories of the Soviet Union, is quietly shaking off long years of geographical and economic isolation. Hydroelectric dams and railways are being built, and, with Japanese help, the Russians are developing timber and paper industries, constructing a deep water port and prospecting and drilling for oil and gas.

title: Mamie E. Davis Dies at 70; Former Y.W.C.A. Executive
description: Mamie E. E. Davis, a retired executive of the Young Women's Christian Association, who headed its Job Corps Extension Residence Program from 1968 to her retirement in 1973, died Sunday in West Side Adams Community Hospital in Los Angeles. She was 70 years old.

title: Housing Agency Completes Bond Sale
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24  The New Jersey Housing Finance Agency completed a sale of a $65 million bond issue today, overcoming investment doubts and stiff market resistance generated by New York's financial crisis and the prospect of default.

title: When a Beloved Doll Is Hospitalized, Its Little Owner Needs Moral Support
description: These are hospitals with a difference: no ambulances, no night nurses, no meals. What really sets them apart, though are the patients.

title: U.S. Indicts Mandel and 5 For Maryland Corruption
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 24Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and five of his longstanding, wealthy friends and political supporters were indicted by Federal grand jury here today Dn charges of mail fraud, bribery and a pattern of racketeerlag activity.

title: Notes on People
description: The highestranking American in the United Nations secretariat, Under Secretary General Bradford Morse, was named yesterday to head the United Nations Development Program. His appointment by Secretary General Kurt Waldhelm must be confirmed by the General Assembly. Mr. Morse is expected to be succeeded by William B. Buffum, now a top aide to Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger as Assistant Secretary of State for international organizations.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 25, 1975

title: Humid South Battles Invasion of Bugs and Weeds
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.The South, which has been invaded over the years by Yankee soldiers and industrial exploiters, is now under attack by an alien assortment of Asian weeds, South American bugs and other foreign growths and pests.

title: Surinam Is Independent, Dutch Await Last Flight
description: PARAMARIBO, Surinam, Tuesday, Nov. 25This is South American territory became independent of the Netherlands just after midnight this morning.

title: United New York Rally Draws Only a Sparse Crowd
description: New York gave itself a rally yesterday to show that, despite its fiscal condition, its people stood united against Gerald Ford, but only a few New Yorkers15,000 or 8,000 or 5,000. according to different policemenshowed up in Times Sauare to take Dart in it.

title: Choosing a Justice
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 From the moment William O. Douglas retired as Associate Justice on the Supreme Court Nov. 12 because of poor health, one of the biggest questions in town has been who his successor News will be. But almost Analysis as big a question, here and in courts and law schools across the country, is on what basis that successor should be chosen.

title: Blackmun v. Press: A Bad Case
description: In his dissenting opinion in the Pentagon Papers case, Mr. Justice Harry A. Blackmun wrote that he shared the concern of a lower court judge that publication of the papers could clearly result in great harm to the nation. That harm had been defined by the judge as the death of soldiers, and destruction of alliances, the greatly increased difficulty of negotiation with our enemies, the inability of our diplomats to negotiate.

title: Labor Gains in Bay State
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations has won collective bargaining rights for about 90 percent of the 52,000 state employees who are covered in Massachusetts, the labor group announced today.

title: Secondary Is Primary Jets
description: The New York Jets did not draft defensive hacks who were slowerwitted than other teams defensive backs.

title: Penn State Victor In Lambert Voting
description: Penn State won the Lambert Trophy for the 12th time and fifth year in a row yesterday, earning the Eastern collegiate football prize by a margin of 1 point on the playing field and 11 points, in the balloting. Coach Joe Paterno's Nittany Lions, who will play Alabama in the Sugar Bowl, Dec. 31, came from behind to edge Pittsburgh,. 76, Saturday in their regularseason finale. Then the sevenman Lambert Trophy selection committee

title: Mauch New Twins'
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 24 (AP)Gene Mauch, a manager in the National League for 16 years, was hired today to manage the Minnesota Twins of the American League.

title: STATE DEMANDING MORE WORK HOURS
description: ALBANY, Nov. 24Not content with a proposed wage freeze, Governor Carey opened contract bargaining with state employeeS today by opposing existing paid leave for union activities and by demanding more hours of work for the Same nay.

title: Jury Gets Fromme Case
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov 24The jurors at the trial of Lynette Alice Fromme began deliberations late today after Federal judge instructed them that they could find her guilty of assaulting, rather than attempting to assassinate, President Ford.

title: SEARS PROFIT UP 12.6% IN QUARTER
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest merchandiser, reported yesterday a 12.6 percent increase in third fiscal quarter earnings on a sales gain of 4.2 percent. For the nine months ended Oct. 31, net income plummeted 28 percent from last year, with sales 2 percent higher.

title: Civilized Way of Life A Casualty in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 24 As Beirut's warring gangs slide into another mindless cycle of violence, the capital is passing, perceptibly, into a new stage of individual and social degradation.

title: Milan's Prosecutor Visiting U. S. to Ask Sindona Extradition
description: MILAN, Italy, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Milan's public prosecutor, Guido Viola, has left for the United States to press for extradition of Michele Sindona, the Italian financier wanted here on fraudulent bankruptcy charges, justice sources said I today.

title: KISSINGER WARNS SOVIET AND CUBA ON AID TO ANGOLA
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24  Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger warned today that the United States cannot remain indifferent to Soviet and Cuban military intervention in the civil war in Angola, adding that it could have consequences for EastWest dtente.

title: Abandonment of Safeguard ABM System Stuns the Town of Langdon, N.D
description: LANGDON, N.D.When the Safeguard antiballistic missiles came here and Langdon's population doubled and its economy soared, Jim and Duane Olson saw their big chance. They borrowed $100,000, opened a restaurant at the edge of town, called it The Stables and began doing a brisk business.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: ANTIBUSING STAND VOIDED BY UNIONISTS
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)Bowing to the demand of George Meany, A.F.L.C.I.O. president, the executive board of the Massachusetts State Labor Council voted today to rescind an antibusing resolution adopted two weeks ago.

title: 2 W ABCTV Agencies: Della Femina, Mahoney
description: WABCTV, Channel 7 here, is really becoming big time. It had decided it needs two advertising agencies. So it has named Della Femina, Travisano & Partners to promote its Eyewitness News, its movies and its primetime access programming, and Helene Mahoney & Associates for A.M. New York, children's programming and special projects.

title: DON JUAN URGES DEMOCRATIC SPAIN
description: MADRID, Nov. 24King Juan Carlos I was urged by his exiled father today to establish a multiparty democracy in Spain.

title: DAYS LOST IN STRIKES ROSE IN 60 NATIONS
description: GENEVA, Nov. 24 (Reuters) The number of working day; lost in strikes in the nonCom munist world jumped by more than 35 percent last year, the International Labor Organize. tion reported today.

title: Dr. Henry Heald of Ford Fund Dead
description: Dr. Henry Townley Heald, who as president of the Ford Foundation from 1956 to 1965 directed the distribution of $1.75 billion in the United States and abroad, died Sunday night of respiratory failure in Winter Park (Fla.) Memorial Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: Computer Diplomacy
description: Computers have always played a special role detente. They embody an advanced technology which the United States is capable of exporting, and which the Soviet Union in particular is eager to acquire. Periodically in recent years United States Government approval for specific longterm computer export ventures has been presented as a tradeoff for political concessions from Moscow.

title: Rikers Island Revolt Ends With Release oil Hostages
description: A 17hour revolt at the House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island ended at 2:31 P.M. yesterday with the release of the last of five correction guards whom prisoners had held hostage but had not harmed.

title: Judge Guided By Blackmun In Maintaining Press Gag
description: DAVID CITY, Neb., Nov. 24Basing his judgment on an opinion issued last week by Justice Harry A. Blatkmun of the Supreme Court, a Nebraska judge partly maintained a gag order on the press today in a firstdegree murder case here.

title: Gifts Abroad Given By Castle &
description: Castle & Cooke Inc. confirmed yesterday that it had informed the Securities and Exchange Commission that over la period of several years it had made small payments to ;local functionaries of some Latin  American Governments. A spokesman said the payments had been made to provide services essential to the company that the local governments could not provide out of their own resources.

title: MRS. HERMAN PROSSER
description: Winifred Sprague Prosser, widow of Hermart A. Prosser, retired vice president of the American Smelting and Refining Company, died Sunday at her home. 1001 Park Avenue. She was 98 years old and also lived in Greenwich, Conn.

title: Fire During Rush Hour Halts L.I.R.R. Service
description: A small fire on a power rail forced the Long Island Rail Road to halt service into and out of Pennsylvania Station for 40 minutes during the rush period last night, delaying thousands of homebound commuters.

title: Boycott the Boycott
description: One of the most persistent Arab illusions, ever since the establishment of modern Israel, has been that the new state would shrivel and wither away if the surrounding Arab states would withhold from it all normal economic exchange. For nearly three decades there has not peen even the most basic intercommunicationpostal, telephone or transportbetween Israel and the Arab states nearby (except in the limited case of JordanWest Bank). Later the ideology of boycott was extended third countries; loyalty to the Arab cause demanded severing commercial relations with foreign companies conducting any significant business with Israel.

title: Syria Is Said to Press for Israeli Concessions
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 24Secretary General Kurt Waldheim conferred for several hours I with top Israeli leaders here today amid reports that Syria was pressing for political concessions in exchange for a renewal of the mandate of the United Nations peacekeeping force on the Golan Heights.

title: MOYNIHAN TO STAY AT FORD'S BEHEST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24President Ford today expressed complete confidence in the United States representative at the United Nations, Daniel P. Moynihan, and White House officials said later that the controversial diplomat had agreed to remain at his post for the foreseeable future.

title: Senate Democrats Reduce Emergency Appropriation
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24Meeting in a lengthy caucus today, Senate Democrats reached tentative agreement on a $35 million emergency aid program for bus and rail subsidies, increases in public employee salaries and partial restoration of the state's Medicaid program.

title: HERMAN CHIRLIAN
description: Herman Chirlian, retired sen or partner of Chirlian, Parker it Company, public accountants sere, died Sunday in White Plains Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived in White Plains.

title: KISSINGER WARNS SOVIET AND CUBA ON AID TO ANGOLA
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24  Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger warned today that the United States cannot remain indifferent to Soviet and Cuban military intervention in the civil war in Angola, adding that it could have consequences for EastWest dtente.

title: 8 Sacks of Jewels Hijacked From Mail
description: A mail truck carrying diamonds and other gems mailed by midtown jewel merchants was hijacked yesterday by team of disguised thieves who fled with eight sacks loaded with the valuables, the police said.

title: FARMERS CUT OFF MAIN LISBON ROAD
description: LISBON, Tuesday, Nov. 25  Several thousand farmers blocked the main highway to Lisbon about 40 miles north of here last night in a protest against the seizing of land by Communistled groups.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Bank Fined Over LieDetector Test

title: People and Business
description: Walter Bodenstein, whose appointment as group vice president of processing of Iowa Beef Processors, Inc., last week was severely criticized by many shareholders of the company, resigned Yesterday.

title: MOYNIHAN TO STAY AT FORD'S BEHEST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24President Ford today expressed complete confidence in the United States representative at the United Nations, Daniel P. Moynihan, and White House officials said later that the controversial diplomat had agreed to remain at his post for the foreseeable future.

title: New Group to Intensify Fund Campaign for Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24Republican fundraising experts from all over the country met here today to try to inject some new vigor into the lagging campaign to raise money for President Ford's 1976 primary campaign.

title: 1,000 Attend Services for Fire Captain Who Died in Queens Fire
description: HICKSVILLE, L.I., Nov. 24 More than 1,000 mourners attended funeral services today for Raymond Koehler, a New York City fire captain who was killed last Thursday in a fire in Jamaica Queens.

title: Lwyr Sks 730Dy Yr
description: I work about 25 days each month to support my wife and children. Fortunately. I enjoy my work, so that supporting my family has never been unpleasant or onerous. But, I am running out of days of work to support them.

title: Lola Vickers Seymour, 74, Wife of Bar Leader, Dead
description: Lola Vickers Seymour, wife of Whitney North Seymour Sr., a civic activist and a leader in the Association of the Bar of the City of New York, died yesterday in Indianapolis. Mrs. Seymour, who was 74 years old, lived at 40 Fifth Avenue. She was on her way to a family Thanksgiving reunion in Crawfordsville, Ind.

title: U.S. to Shut Thai Air Base And Withdraw 4,500 Men
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24 (AP)The United States has agreed to close Korat air base and pull out the 4,500 American servicemen and 50 aircraft stationed there by the end of February, the Thai and United States military commands announced today.

title: Tree Farmer Is Honored
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  John Evans of Londonderry, N. H., has been named New England's Outstanding Tree Farmer of the Year, the American Forest Institute announced.

title: Litton Net Rises 4.8%
description: Litton Industries Inc., West Coast diversified industrial company, reported yesterday net income of $8.8 million, or 22 cents a share, for its first fiscal quarter, up 4.8 percent from $8.4 million, or 20 cents a share, a year earlier.

title: U.S. Scores Pollution Of Hudson With PCB
description: Fish taken from the Hudson River at Poughkeepsie have the highest PCB levels of any point monitored in the United States by the Department of the Interior, according to a Federal official.

title: R. S. TAPLINGER, 66, OF PUBLICITY UNIT
description: Robert S. Taplinger, president of the public relations concern of Rogers, Cowan & TapLinger, a division of Rogers & Cowan Inc., died of cancer Monday in Memorial SloanKettering Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 223 East 49th Street.

title: Jailhouse Bargaining Amicable but Tense
description: A few hours after the beginning of Sunday nilht's inmate rebellion at the Men's House of Detention Dri Pikers Island, the City Commissioner of Correction, Benjamin J. Malcolm, and the chairman of the Board of Correction, Peter Tufo, crawled through the rubble of a teargassed prison shower room and poked their, heads through a large hole that had been knocked through the cinder block wall by in

title: Family Wins Fight Against Bats After Overcoming Ban on DDT
description: NASHUA, N. H., Nov. 24 (AP)A man and his family, driven from their house by swarm of bats, are back home today after a battle with the Government over whether they could use DDT to kill the invaders.

title: Japan's Golfers Beat U.S. by 42 Shots
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 24 (UPI)Toru Nakamura carded a fourunderpar 68 today and won the individual competition in leading Japan to its second victory in the fifth $100,000 United StatesJapan nrofessional golf match.

title: Shippine/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Zaire Marks Decade Of Rule by Mobutu
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Nov. 24Zaire celebrated the 10th anniversary of the Government of President Mobutu Sese Seko today.

title: Limitation on Filing Libel Suits Is Affirmed by Appellate Court
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)A person cannot file suit against libelous statements after one year has passed, because of the oneyear statute of limitations, even though the libel was published because of negligence, the Appellate Division of New Jersey Superior Court ruled today.

title: Communist Summit
description: The joint declaration of the French and Italian Communist parties that each would set its own strategy and seek power through the Western democratic system, independently of Moscow, apparently was designed announce a common position for the projected allEuropean Communist summit conference.

title: Susan's Girl Is Third in Her Last Race
description: Fred Hooper's Susan's Girl, the 6yearold mare many horsemen are convinced will be named this year's top performer in the filly and mare division, ended her racing career on a ails appointing note at Aqueduct yesterday. Made the 6 to 5 favorite by the crowd of 15,321 topcoated followers of form, the milionaire daughter of Quadrangle parted with the lead in the stretch to finish third in the $59,250 Berlo Handicap. The winner of the mile contest, run in 1:37, was George Zimmerman's $21.40for$2 Costly Dream.

title: Market Place
description: To register or not to register. That's a question that holders of municipal coupon bonds frequently ask. To do so, some Wall Street experts warn, is to sacrifice marketability for the convenience and safety of reigstration.

title: Stevenson Rules Out Presidential Bid
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d said to day at a news conference that he would not be a candidate next year for either President or Vice President.

title: COLT BID RAISED IN GARLOCK TALKS
description: An agreemcnt announced yesterday between the mamgemoms of Colt industries Inc. and Garlock inc whereby Colt's tender offer for all of Garlock's shares is being increased to $:15 a share from $32 a share. MeanMerger while another GarNews lock suitor appeared in the midst of this contested tender offer yesterday. Robert Gott. chairman of AMF Inc. said he had notified Garlock of a decision by AMF's management to acquire Garlock's stock through an exchange offer.

title: Hopes Abandoned for a New Golan Pact, U.S. Officials Concede
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24Top Administration officials have hegun conceding privately that American efforts to promote a new round of SyrianIsraeli negotiations have proved fruitless. They have now turned their attention to deciding what kind of international conference might at least provide a seMblance of, diplomatic progress next year.

title: U.S. Indicts Mandel and 5 For Maryland Corruption
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 24Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and five of his longstanding, wealthy friends and political supporters were indicted by Federal grand jury here today on charges of mail fraud, briblery and a pattern of racketeer ing activity.

title: Dr. Edward Jacobs Is Dead; Mount Sinai Uroloaist. 74
description: Dr. Edward Jacobs, a retired urologist who was on the staffs of the Hospital for Joint Diseases and Mount Sinai Hospital, died Sunday in Doctors Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 308 East 79th Street.

title: Early Christmas Mail
description: WASHINGTON,. Nov. 24 (AP)  The Postal Service says Christmas cards should be mailed by Dec. 15 to insure delivery before Christmas Day. Surface parcels should be mailed by Dec. 10, it added.

title: Holiday Car Toll Estimated
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (AP)The National Safety Council estimated today that between 450 and 550 persons may die in traffic accidents during the Thanksgiving holiday period. Last year, there were 504 fatalities reported during the comparable period between 6 P.M. Wednesday and midnight Sunday.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article on Ralph Nader in The New York Times yesterday, the name of the director of Congress Watch, a Nader project, was given incorrectly. Her name is Joan Claybrook.

title: Needham Assails Backers of Plans On Central Market
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, assailed the Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday along with Ray Garrett Jr., its former chairman, and two major Wall Street firms leading the call for revamping of the stock market.

title: Killer, Under a New Law, Must Be Sentenced to Die
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 24A Bronx man was convicted today of the 1974 slaying of a Yonkers policeman and became the first person in the state to face a mandatory death sentence under a law revised last year.

title: Dave Anderson

State Aims to Weed Out Welfare Cheats
description: The 338,000 recipients of welfare checks in New York I City will be asked to fill out Inew eligibility forms and return !them in 10 days or face being dropped from the welfare rolls, city and state officials announced yesterday.

title: 3 VICTIMS OF CRASH SOUGHT ON CRUISER
description: PRIOLO, Sicily, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Workers cut through the blackened and twisted superstructure of the United States guidedmissile cruiser Belknap today searching for three men believed crushed or burned to death during the ship's fiery collision with the American aircraft carrier John F. Kennedy.

title: DALE HOUGHTON, MARKETS EXPERT
description: Dale Houghton, professor emeritus and a distinguished scholar in marketing and sales at New York University and a pioneer in motivational research, died of cancer Sunday at the New. York Infirmary. He was 82 years old and lived at 157 East 18th Street and had a farm in Ridley. Md.

title: French Are Going Ahead With RhineRhone Canal
description: PARIS, Nov. 24France is going ahead with plans to build a canal between the Rhine and the Rhone Rivers. President Valery Giscard d'Estang announced today.

description: Monday, Nov. 24, 1975

title: Soviet Grain Crop Hurt By More Dry Weather
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) The Soviet Union's newly planted 1976 winter grain crop is being plagued by the same dry weather that crippled this year's harvest and forced Moscow to buy huge quantities of United States wheat and corn, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: PRICES IRREGULAR IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday in quiet trading as investors continued to be uncertain about progress toward solving New York's fiscal problems. Prices in the OvertheCounter market rose, however, in slow trading.

title: Columbia College's Faculty Votes to Admit Women
description: The faculty of Columbia College voted yesterday to admit women as undergraduate students.

title: Chinese Women's Five Defeats Queens by 8558
description: While friendship might been first, competition was a close second as the Chinese national women's basketball team defeated Queens College, 8558, before a crowd of 7,029 last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Bridge: Lapides and Walvick Capture The Life Master Pairs Title
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 25Two major titles were decided here last night in the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals, but no New York players came close in either event.

title: 2 GOLD COMPANIES ARE CURBED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP) A Federal judge issued a permanent injunction today to prevent violations of United States securities laws by two concerns that allegedly participated in the illegal sale of about $200 million in gold or goldrelated investments.

title: INDIANS INDICTED IN 2 F.B.I. DEATHS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) A Federal grand jury late today indicted four Indians on charges of murdering two agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in a shootout on the Oglala Sioux reservation near Pine Ridge, S.D., last June 26.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Jakarta Strives to Keep Foreign Aid; More U.S. Arms and Other Help Due
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 25 Indonesia, faced at home with a crippling financial scandal and on the island of Timor with a war that it is trying its best to disown, is fearful that it will lose military and civilian foreign aid, which it would like to see not just continued but expanded.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The former chairman of the Nassau County Democratic Committee was indicted by a Federal grand jury on charges of extorting more than $40,000 from one engineering firm and getting two others to pay party workers and party bills in connection with the awarding of more than $2 million in contracts.

title: Pentagon Eliminating Loopholes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)  The Pentagon is closing potential loopholes in its financial reporting rules that have allowed some officials to receive free hunting trips and other favors from defense contractors.

title: Dow Up 10 Points On Default Outlook
description: The stock market, whose mood has been linked closely to the ups and downs of the financial outlook for New York City, advanced fairly sharply yesterday. The chances averting default appeared better, and the Dow Jones industrial average climbed almost 10 points.

title: RUTGERS TO DISMISS 215 ON ITS FACULTY,
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Nov. 25 (UPI) Rutgers University announced plans today to send dismissal notices to all 215 firstyear and secondyear faculty members because of the prospect of reduced state aid.

title: STATE ASKS CHASE FOR SETTLEMENT
description: The New York State Insurance Department is trying to work out a settlement with the Chase Manhattan Bank of allegations that the bank wilfully and negligently allowed a $100,000 check  switching scheme to take place that drained part of the assets of the $13.7 million Paper Industry UnionManagement Pension Fund.

title: Election Panel Revises Campaign Reporting Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25The Federal Election Commission, reluctantly submitting to Congressional oppOsition, approved today a revised version of a campaign reporting regulation, designed to meet the objections of Representative Wayne L. Havs.

title: Soviet Five Wins, 6362
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Nov. 25 (AP) Ivan Edeshko hit two field goals with 11 seconds left to lift the Soviet national basketball team to a 6362 victory over Alabama tonight. The Crimson Tide blew a 5point lead with less than one minute to go.

title: In Memoriam
description: ACKIRONMax. Threw sad and lonely years

title: Byrne's ExPartner Cleared in Inquiry On Using Influence
description: TRENTON, Nov. 25 (AP)A state grand jury has voted not to indict a former law partner of Governor Byrne whO allegedly offered a top state job to a Camden County official to influence a contract award, the Attorney General said today.

title: U.S. Magazine Aide In Canada Criticizes A Nationalist Tide
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 25 The head of the Canadian edition of Reader's. Digest, appearing before a committee of Parliament today, declared that pending legislation adversely affecting the publication of American magazines in Canada was result of a flowing tide of extreme nationalism.

title: A Multiple Victory
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25In the ragged art of politics, it is fact that even as the reality of an issue remains greatly disturbedin New York City the worst is still to be felt in

title: Landmark Status Voted For 5 Places in City
description: Five scenic and architectural resources of the city were designated official landmarks yesterday by the Landmarks Presrvation Commission.

title: OREGON POLICE HEAD IS KILLED AT CAPITOL
description: SALEM, Ore, Nov. 25 (UPI)Holly Holcomb, Oregon state police superintendent, was shot and killed ,today as he walked across the State Capitol mall. A former state policeman who ran for Governor in 1962 is charged with the murder.

title: Council of Churches Is at Odds Over Activism at Kenya Parley
description: NAIROBI. Kenya, Nov. 25The question of how Christians should relate to movements for political and economic revolution, particularly in the nonWestern world, has emerged as the central theme in the early stages of the 18day assembly of the World Council of Churches gathered at the attractive Kenyatta conference center near downtown Nairobi.

title: Pants: They're Going To Any Lengths
description: Just when it seemed that pants were getting a wee bit tiresomea year ago it seemed so unlikelyhere they are undergoing a new burst of vigor. It's not that the oldfashioned kind of pants is going to wither awayit's simply that nobody raises an eyebrow anymore; most employers accept them and it's a rare restaurateur who dares bar the doorway to women pants. The acceptance by the older crowd, who finds that at least pants keep them warm in winter, has made the more adventurous woman look for a new kind of fashion excitement. And since fashion designers abhor a vacuum, there they are with a new breed of trouser fashions. Some are bloused at the ankles, like parachutists uniforms (an effect that can easily be duplicaled by pushing standard straightleg trousers into short boots), and some are cropped various intervals from above the knees to above the ankles. Attaching the pants to shirts or blouses and creating the jumpsuit, much the way some clever manufacturer in the early part of this century attached shirtwaists to skirts to create the dress, is another way designers give pants new interest. The jumpsuit has been the big runaway success story in fashion this fall. Croppedleg versions are an important entry for spring. Illustrated above are three ways Victor ions has rescued pants for the young crowd in his spring collection for Cuddlecoat. Abovetheknee version, left, resembles Bermuda shorts but is in the new onepiece form. Jumpsuit at center is cropped below the knees. Pants at the right are cut off above the ankles and have an adjustable stringtied waistline. They do not exhaust the varieties of pants that will be coming into the stores soon and include culottes as well as lowbloused styles and an assortment of lengths that stop at point the wearer fancies.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: HERE IT COMES Macy's has supplied sideline data on its annual Thanksgiving Day parade this year, for the benefit of more sophisticated youngsters who might ask parents questions as the mammoth cavalcade of bands, floats, balloon figures and celebrities glides past an estimated total of a million watchers (in good weather).

title: The Other Deficit
description: Completion of the $200 million municipal tax package to help New York City reduce its budget deficit will not unfortunately for New Yorkerswind up the taxing business of the current special session of the Legislature,

title: Sonics Need Overtime To Beat Knicks, 128127
description: Bruce Seals, who was waived out of the American Basketball Association because he didn't get the money he wanted, and Tom Burleson, who received the money he asked for because he was 7 feet 2 inches, combined last night to help the Seattle SuperSonics defeat the New York Knicks, 128127, in overtime.

title: U. S. Recognizes Surinam
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) The United States officially recognized Surinam as an independent nation today. A White House statement said an ambassador would be named in the future.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)An investigation has disclosed that Common Market countries are using bounties and grants to subsidize the export of canned hams and shoulders, the Treasury said today.

title: PRETRIAL ACCORD ENDS NAVAL SUIT
description: The families of five sailors killed and three men injured in a 1971 engineroom accident aboard a Navy transport vessel won a $4.2 million settlement in a joint damage suit here yesterday as a jury was being picked to try the case in Fed, eral Court in Brooklyn.

title: Israel States Position
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 25 (AP)Israel announced today that it was willing to extend the life of the United Nations truce force on the Golan Heights by six months, but Secretary General Waldheim said Syria wanted progress toward an overall settlement before it agreed to an extension.

title: Bullets Conquered By Rockets, 10089
description: LANDOVER, Md., Nov. 25 (UPI) Calvin Murphy scored 32 points and Mike Newlin 28 tonight as the Houston Rockets defeated the Washington Bullets, 10089, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Economic Paradox
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25In the third quarter of this year the nation's money supplycurrency plus checking accounts in banksrose only 2.2 percent by one measure and a stillmodest 6.9 percent by another.

title: Rams Out to Clinch Two Titles on TV
description: The turkey has long been the symbol of the Thanksgiving weekend, but the networks have just about changed it into the football. There will be nine games tel ecast here from tomorrow through Sunday, four pro and five college. The two holiday games in the National Football League are Los Angeles at Detroit (Channel 2, 12:30 P.M.) and Buffalo at St..Louis (Channel 4, 3:30 P.M.). On Sunday the local telecasts are to be Pittsburgh and the Jets at Shea Stadium (Channel 4, 1 P.M.) and the Giants at Dallas (Channel 2, 2 P.M.). The late game, Minnesota at Washington, will not be shown here. A preview of tomorrow's contests follows with wonlost records in parentheses.

title: Mail Registration Drive Begins; Democrats Expect Large Gains
description: A campaign to raise the number of registered voters in the city to the four million mark began yesterday with hopes from election officials that it could get the city out from under Federal surveillance of its voting and hopes from Democratic Party leaders that it would put many new Democrats on the rolls.

title: Movements Restricted In RevoltTorn Prison
description: Inmates at the Men's House of Detention on Rikers Island were fed in their cells yesterday and movements were sharply restricted as guards cleared away twisted hand rails, smashed toilets, burned mattresses and heaps of shredded records and files left by the 17hour revolt that ended Monday afternoon.

title: Surinam Celebrates End of Dutch Rule
description: PARAMARIBO, Surinam, Nov. 25 (Reuters) Surinam became the world's newest independent state today in an outdoor ceremony marked by the tearful public reconciliation of the nation's two main rivals for political power.

title: NEW INSTRUCTION FOR FROMME JURY
description: SACRAMENTO Calif., Nov. 25 A Federal judge at the trial of, Lynette Alice Fromme today told the jury, which had been unable to reach a verdict after more than nine hours of deliberation, that if it could not agree that the defendant had attempted to assassinate President. Ford, it could consider a lesser charge of assault.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch in The New York Times Monday said as a result of a typographical errror that the Dutch Government has allocated more than $1.5 million over the next 10 years to help Surinam. It should have said more than $1.5 billion.

title: STOCKS SHOW GAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange closed higher yesterday in slightly increased trading although there was little concrete news that could be construed as bullish. Similar conditions prevailed in the OvertheCounter market.

title: 20,187 Datsuns Recalled
description: CARSON, Calif., Nov. 23 (Reuters)  The Nissan Motor Corporation (Datsun) announced today that it was recalling 20,187 of its 1971 model 510 sedans in California to correct a defect that could create a fire hazard. The problem involves a rubber plug that closes off a small tube at the fuel tank.

title: The Worst of Both Worlds
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  From 1970 to 1973 Chile's Allende Government experimented with a socialist medley and ended up with chaos, bankruptcy, falling production and anarchy. Since 1973 the Pinochet Government has held the country in leaden dictatorship's vise.

title: A Greek Village Is Richer, but Poorer...
description: SKOURA, GreeceSkoura is less than 10 miles from Sparta, in the Laconia region of southern Greece, but it is virtually a suburb of New York.

title: Brush Fires Partly Contained; Threat to Los Angeles Abates
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 25The fire threat to Los Angeles abated today as the major blaze in the foothills above the city. was partially Contained and burned in a direction away from populated areas.

title: About New York
description: One of the nation's newest settlements, a small community of pioneers, is about to celebrate its first Thanksgiving Day on its rockbound island home in the East River.

title: Cavaliers 98. Bulls 94
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 25 (UPI) Jim Chones scored 23 points as the Cleveland Cavaliers held off a fourthquarter rally by the Chicago Bulls to earn a 9894 victory tonight. The loss was Chicago's ninth in succession, tying a club record..

title: Workshops in Schools Add to Chinese Output
description: PEKING, Nov. 25Sideline production by students in China's secondary schools is becoming an important economic factor.

title: Credit Rise Expected
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (Reuters)Market sources said today they expected the Euromarket credit now in syndication for the Hanoibased Vietnam Bank for Foreign Trade would be increased to $34 million from the $23 million planned originally.

title: October Sales Up By 7.5% at Chains
description: Warm weather in a month that features sales of cold weather apparel had somewhat of an adverse effect on chain stores volume in October.

title: Clinics to Frown on Victory
description: The players of the National Basketball Association, who spend eight months a year striving to win games, will try to teach 200,000 youngsters this winter that winning isn't everything.

title: SPAIN ANNOUNCES CLEMENCY MOVE
description: MADRID, Wednesday, Nov. 26 The Spanish Government announced a general pardon last night for some political prisoners and common criminals to mark the accession of Juan Carlos de Borbn as King.

title: Investigation of L.I. Track By 6 Agencies Is Dropped
description: YAPHANK, L.I., Nov. 25Citing a lack of evidence and a breakdown in cooperation with one another, six Federal and local agencies have discontinued their investigations of the controversial $22million Suffolk Meadows Quarterhorse Race Track.

title: LEBANESE DEBATE CAUSES OF STRIFE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. Nov. 25I Gunmen battled near the Parliament building here today as Prime Minister Rashid Karami rose in a halffilled chamber to plead for a peaceful settlement of the factional conflict

title: EDWARD CASS CROUSE
description: Edward Cass Crouse, a retired industrial designer, died yesterday at his home in Weston, Corm. He was 67 years old.

title: Sydney M. Shoenberg Dies; Founder of C.I.T. Was 94
description: Sydney M. Shoenberg, a founder and longtime director of the C.I.T. Financial Corporation, died yesterday in the Jewish Hospital in St. Louis. He was 94 years old and lived in St. Louis.

title: About the Jets
description: Still another defensive back has been hiredthe third in two weeki. The newest member is Bronxborn Donnie Walker, a 24yearold free safety. The former Lindenhurst, LI., high school star was with Southern California Sun the W.F.L. Delles Howell, who broke his arm last Sunday, is out for the season and on the injuredreserve list... Members of the First and Ten Club, composed of Jet fans, have voted for their choice as the next coach. Chuck Knox of the Rams was first and Don Shula of Miami was second. ... 3yearold Long Islander who watched Willie Wonka and the Chocolate Factory called it Joe Willie Wonka.

title: Soviet Is Adamant Against Detente in Struggle of Ideas
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25While the Soviet Union has committed itself to such goals of EastWest accommodation as reduction of strategic arms and expansion of trade, it has also

title: A 3YEAR ACCORD
description: The major banks and the teachers union  the two remaining holdoutsrelented yesterday and agreed to join in the complicated threeyear plan to provide cash and ease the debt for New York City.

title: Bond Sales and Realty Tax Will Pay Bills Until Dec.
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation and the city raised enough money yesterday from a combination of bond sales and prepayments of realestate taxes to meet city bills coming due between now and Dec. 3.

title: Rikers Island Revolt Leads City To Add 69 Correction Officers
description: In t he wake of a 17hour revolt at Rikers Island, Mayor Beanie yesterday authorized the hiring of 69 correction officers with available Federal and state funds and an immediate. Budget Bureau study of hiring others rather than use city funds for overtime.

title: Consumer Notes
description: A current advertising Campaign by the Allstate Insurance Company features a company promise to guarantee repairs to a customer's car when the company recommends a repair shop. Sounds good. But in New York State, the same guarantee must be provided by all insurance companies to comply with a regulation of the State Insurance Department.

title: Jersey Bell Plans to Market $100 Million in Securities
description: NEWARK, Nov. 25 (UPI)New Jersey Bell Telephone said today it would try to sell $100 million in debt securities next year to finance general construction projects.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 26, 1975

title: Solomon Wins in So. Africa And Gains Masters Berth
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 25 (AP) Harold Solomon of Silver Spring, Md., won the South African open tennis championship today and gained the final spot in next week's $100,000 Grand Prix Masters in Stockholm. Solomon outlasted Brian Gottfried of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., in a prolonged baseline duel, 62 64, 57, 61. The match lasted more than three hours.

title: Grain and Saybean Futures Off; Most Other Commodities Drop
description: Falling grain prices set the tone yesterday for a commodities market in which most futuresmetals, cocoa, hogs and beef cattle, eggs, orange juice, sugarshowed decline.

title: As Many of Its People Move Here, Still Retainin Home Ties
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Nov. 25This is my restaurant, Gus Vakkas said. This is a private table. Come, have some wine.

title: Advertising
description: Canter & Achenbaum, a marketing consulting firm, all of the partners in which are former agency top executives, is moving into its third year with a new name and a new service to clients.

title: Opera: Met Returns With Elektra
description: Richard Strauss prided himself on being a literal composer, one who could set a glass of beer to music, and when he turned to the grotesque subject of Electra the result was a masterpiece of literal grotesquerie. The Metropolitan Opera's production of Elektra, which returned for its first performance of the season last night, follows Strauss beyond the grotesque into the realm of pure ugliness, and it takes impressive singing to redeem the hour and 45 minutes that the singleact work takes up.

title: Longer State Work Week Proposed by Mrs. Grasso
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 25  To help ward off a projected deficit of more than $80 million in Connecticut's current budget, Gov. Ella T. Grasso tonight presented a program of new austerities that would stretch the work week of state employees from 35 hours to 40.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New Jersey Parole Board has been asked by Governor Byrne to make a recommendation on whether Rubin Hurricane Carter and John Artis should be granted executive clemency.

title: A Well Donebut Slight Habeas Corpus
description: In the theater it is not merely a question of a rose always being a rose. Regrettably a lemon is always a lemon. Alan Bennett's London farce, Habeas Corpus, opened at the Martin Beck Theater last night, most brilliantly staged by Frank Dunlop. It was markedly better than the London production, beautifully performed and with a few decent laughs. But it was really the same play as in London, still with a couple of gaping gaps where its heart and its mind might have been. A parade of British musichall humor tarted up with hopeful affection by a university wit. But not a playand a parade only worth watching for the quality of the paraders rather than the occasion of the parade.

title: Kissinger Elaborates On His Angola Remark
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that his motive in criticizing SovietCuban intervention in the civil war in. Angola was to put an end to it and to see whether an African solution can be found to an African nroblem.

title: CAHILL PROPOSES A NEW BOND ISSUE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 25 (AP)Former Gov. William T. Cahilbe the head of a new commissions for deciding on major state projects and borrowing the money to pay for them, said today he favored going back to the voters with another bond issue proposal in 1976.

title: Souvanna Phouma's Son Reported to Flee Laos
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)A son of Prince Souvanna Phoum a of Laos, Prince Panya was reported today to have swum across the Mekong River to Thailand in fleeing arrest by the Pathet Lao.

title: Wimbledon Prices Up
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (Reuters) Fans will have to pay more to watch the British tennis championships at Wimbledon next year.

title: 4 Men Named in High Court Search
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25The Ford Administration has asked the Federal Bureau of Investigation to conduct full field investigations on four men as possible successors to the Supreme Court seat vacated by Associate Justice William O. Douglas two weeks ago, according to sources close to the Administration.

title: List of Taxes Voted for City
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25Following are the new city taxes enacted by the Legislature today:

title: TV: 2 Series and Zero Mostel Brighten Music. Presentations
description: The ways of presenting serious music on television are astonishingly limited. The root experience, of course, remains aural, and the inadequate sound reproduction reproduction systems of most TV sets are not conducive to maximun satisfaction. But the fact that audiences still patronize concert halls in goodly numbers, when the purely aural experience can be reasonably simulated on home sound systems, suggests that the music experience has a pronounced visual side. Listening to a violin is one thing. Listening while watching the violinist is anothernot necessarily better:but demonstrably different.

title: People and Business
description: John J. Riccardo, chairman of the Chrysler Corporation, will return to Britain today to hear the Government's proposals on the company's financially troubled British operation, the Prime Minister, Harold Wilson, announced in London yesterday.

title: Company Recreation: Now It's More Than Softball
description: Several afternoons a week, when the clock strikes 1:30 at Doyle Dane Bernbach, the advertising agency, a dozen or so employees often take what is known as a Vitality Break. Under professional teacher's guidance, they do breathing and stretching exercises to foster less fatigue, better disposition and fewer Valiums.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch in The New York Times Monday said as a result of a typographical error that the Dutch Government has allocated more than $1.5 million over the next 10 years to help Surinam. It should have said more than $1.5 billion.

title: Television
description: 9:00 P.M. Baretta (7)

title: Waldheim Sees Golan Crisis Unless Talks Develop
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 25  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim, in a report to the Security Council, warned today that unless Israel and Syria moved toward negotiation the situation in the Golan Heights sector will be unstable and, with the passage of time, increasingly dangerous.

title: Bruins Beat Kings, 42, With Three Early Goals
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25 (AP)Boston struck for three quick scores in the first period tonight, including Dave Forbes's third shorthanded goal of the year, and the Bruins went on to a 42 National Hockey League victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: Aeros 4, Racers 1
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) Gordie Howe followed his own shot and slammed it into the net on the rebound tonight and added an assist on another goal to lead the Houston Aeros to a 41 victory over the Indianapolis Racers in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Commuter Fares in Jersey Raised an Average of 35%
description: TRENTON, Nov. 25The largest commuter fare increases in New Jersey's history, averaging 35 per cent, were announced today by the State Commuter Operating Agency. The increases, applying principally to travel within the state, will be phased in over a 30day period beginning next Monday.

title: A Correction
description: In the recipe for venison cutlets Ardennes style published Monday, one of the ingredients1/4 cup chopped cooked hamwas omitted while another ingredient1/4 cup chopped parsley  was listed twice.

title: MRS. WALLACE URGES DRUG TO GET TRUTH
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)Truth serum should be administered to Arthur H. Bremer to get him to reveal a possible ccnspiracy behind the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, the Governor's wife, Cornelia, said yesterday.

title: Saints 3, Whalers 2
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 25 (AP)Mike Antonovich converted a Dave Keon pass at 6:22 of overtime to give the Minnesota Fighting Saints a 32 W.H.A. victory over the New England Whalers tonight.

title: CUTS ARE PLANNED IN POSTAL SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The United States Postal Service is planning reductions in personnel and some services in an attempt to curb losses now accumulating at a rate of $200 million a month, Postmaster General Benjamin F. Bailer said today in an interview.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Meets at 10:30 A.M. and P.M.
