title: As Many of Its People Move Here, Still Retaining Home Ties
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Nov. 25This is my restaurant, Gus Vakkas said. This is a private table. Come, have some wine.

title: Morton's View: Giants Are Lazy
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 25 Gift turkeys rested on stools in front of some lockers in the Giants locker room today and a visitor suggested the Giants should put some of the turkeys in uniform.

title: A Navy Staff Study Calls Big Carriers Less Costly
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25A Navy staff study contends that the mediumsize aircraft carrier proposed by the Defense Department would be more expensive and less effective than another nuclear power supercarrier.

title: About Education
description: Christopher Jencks of Harvard University has cast new doubts on whether the usual standards for good schools  small classes, experienced teachers and so forthactually lead to improved student performance. In a new study of high school students published in the current issue of The Harvard Education Review, Mr. Jencks, the wellknown sociologist and educational researcher, argues that while some schools seem to be somewhat more effective than others, the reasons for their superiority remain obscure.

title: Damage to Intelligence Seen
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25 (AP)Secretary of State Kissinger said in a speech yesterday that foreign affairs operations faced] disruption from continuting Congressional probes of United States intelligence activities.

title: Pearl Bailey Rebuts Cuban in U.N. Debut
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 25 Pearl Bailey made her debut as a United States representative today and turned back a sharpworded Cuban attack with an improvised answer she said came from the heart and the head.

title: No Fault
description: The State .Court of Appeals yesterday unanimously upheld the constitutionality of the no fault ,automobile insurance law, Page 37.

title: DR. IRVING DURK
description: Dr. Irving Durk, an ophthalmologist, died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 490 West End Avenue.

title: PORTUGUESE UNITS STAGE REBELLION; REGIME HITS BACK
description: LISBON, Wednesday, Nov. 26 Paratroopers and other regiments went into open rebellion against the Government yesterday and military leaders took strong action last night to crush their revolt.

title: Rikers Reprieve
description: The best that can be said about this week's highly predictable blowup at the Men's House of Detention is that when it finally came, public officials acquitted themselves with honor and avoided the loss of a single life. The worst that can be said is that it didn't have to happen.

title: Plots Report Draws Attention to Helms
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25The Senate Select Intelligence Committee's report on assassination plots inspired by the Central Intelligence Agency against foreign leaders has served to refocus attention on the record compiled by Richard M. Helms, now the American Ambassador to Iran, during much of his 26vear career with the agency.

title: ERWIN L. BOHAN, 76, FOREIGNAID ADVISER
description: DALLAS, Nov. 25 (AP)Merwin L. Bohan, an international economist and former Foreign Service officer in Latin America, died Sunday. He was 76 years old and, when not on foreign assignments, made his home here.

title: TV AUDIENCES DIP FOR FORD'S TALKS
description: The news conferences and addresses by President Ford that have been carried simultaneously by all three networks reached a larger proportion of viewers during his first six months in office than they have since then, a special audience summary by the A.C. Nielsen Comnany disclosed.

title: Nov. 1120 NewCar Sales Rise 33.1%
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25 The United States auto industry reported today sales for the Nov. 1120 period of 252,942 cars, an increase of 33.1 percent from last year's sales of 190,093 units and the fifth straight 10day selling period that the totals topped 1974 levels.

title: Market Place
description: The Xerox Corporation, whose earnings are expected to remain in the doldrums for some time, is receiving charitable treatment from Wall Street analysts.

title: Mary C. Wellman Dies at 80; Was a Survivor of the Titanic
description: TOPSFIELD, Mass., Nov. 25 (AP)Mary C. Wellman, a survivor of the liner Titanic, died Sunday at her home. She was 80 years old.

title: Man, 26, Said to Threaten Both Ford and Rockefeller
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 25 (AP) A 26yearold prisoner has been charged by Federal agents with threatening to kill President Ford and Vice President Rockefeller by using either a rifle or an elephant gun, officials said today.

title: NeW Books
description: GENERAL

title: About the Giants . .
description: One player who won't be at today's practice is Dick Enderle, a seventhyear guard who was cut yesterday make room for Bill Windauer, a defensive tackle. Windauer, a thirdyear pro, was signed in an attempt to strengthen the defense. He played two seasons for Baltimore and played in one game with Miami this year.

title: RollCall Votes on Tax Package
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25Following is the rollcall votes by which the Legislature today approved the $75 million increase in New York City's income tax, the chief part of a varied tax package totalling $200 million:

title: Coiled Cobras and Casual Leopards
description: For the 23d time since the late John Jay Hopkins set out to cure the ills of the planet by bringing all nations together on the first tee, the World Cup golf tournament comes off next week. John Jay Hopkins was a lowhandicap golfer with a lot of money and a notion that people who putt together can live together. To foster harmony among nations, he established this annual competition for twoman teams made up, he hoped, of the two best golfers from every country where the game is played. A movable feast that is getting to be the oldest estabSports lished permanent floating golf game on earth, the tournament shuffles breathlessly about of the globe, touching down in Tokyo, Rome, The Times Buenos Aires, Paris, Singdpore, Mexico City, Madrid, Caracas, Melbourne, Dublin, San Juan and way stations. This time the site is Bangkok, and there will be teams from 47 nations including, as first time starters, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Pakistan and Yugoslavia.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975 by Trlanzle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: A Note of Harmony In MixMatch Rugs
description: If you like the idea of coordinating everything in the house, including what's on the floor, Dylan Carpet may have an answer. The company has just introduced an extensive line of wool broadloom and area rugs from England, all of them in the same five tones: ivory, pale sand, tan, mediumdark brown and a deep brown. Thus you can get walltowall carpeting in one of the tones (in a choice of velvet or shag piles, or a tweedy mixture) and top it with an area rug in matching

title: City U. Plans Tightening Of 76 Admissions Rules
description: The chancellor of the City University, Dr. Robert J. Kibbee, appears to have a solid majority of the Board of Higher Education behind a proposal to impose minimum academic standards for freshmen, starting next fall.

title: SCOTT BARS RACE IN 76, FRIENDS SAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 Senator Hugh Scott, the Senate Republican leader for the last six years, has decided not to seek reelection in 1976, according to wellplaced sources.

title: Foreign Car Aid Scored
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (Reuters) The Defense Department has spent nearly $9 million to ship foreign cars home for United States servicemen during the last three years, Representative Les Aspin said today. The Wisconsin Democrat charged that shipment subsidies were a waste of tax funds.

title: Lottery Workers Face a Pay Cutoff; i 234 Are Affected
description: Comptroller Arthur Levitt has notified State Budget Director Peter C. Goldmark Jr. that after today no funds will be available to pay salaries to 234 employees of the Lottery Commission because the lottery has been suspended since Oct. 23.

title: Gilmour's Case Is Delayed
description: William (Buddy) Gilmour's $12 million lawsuit against New York's downstate harness tracks ran into an unexpected delay yesterday when a showcause hearing in Fed eral Court was At the adjourned for a week. Judge EdRace ward Weinfeld, Tracks annoyed by the failure of the defendants to submit prehearing briefs, granted the stay after advising Gilmour's attorney, Anthony Genovese, that he and his client had been put at an unfair disadvantage.

title: COMPROMISE WON
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25After lastminute compromises that won support from both Republicans and the Black and Puerto Rican Caucus in the Assembly, the Legislature tonight passed a slightly revised $200 million New York City tax package that it now hopes will persuade President Ford to support Federal aid to avoid a city default.

title: The New York Times/Carl T. Gossett
description: BROOKLYN AREA NAMED LANDMARK: A scene in the area at the Brooklyn end of the Brooklyn Bridge. The old Fulton Ferry section of the waterfront was named a historic district by the city's Landmarks Preservation Com mission. Other designations were Prospect Park, Grant's Tomb, the BayardCondict building at Bleecker and Crosby Streets and the approach to the Manhattan Bridge. Proposals on 13 other sites were also debated by group.

title: NO FAULT
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25The State Court of Appeals today unanimously upheld the constitutionality of the state's no fault automobile insurance law.

title: Morton Offers to Yield Names in Arab Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Secretary of Commerce Rogers C. B. Morton reversed himself today and said he would turn over to Congress a list of United States companies involved with the Arab boycott against Israel.

title: People in Sports
description: William O. DeWitt, who has held executive positions with five major league baseball clubs in the last 50 years, was identified yesterday as a member of the Bill Veeck group that is buying the Chicago White Sox.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Antitrust Laws: The Predators Win

title: SUFFOLK BONDS FIND NO BIDDERS
description: Oregon's $100 million of veterans welfare bonds and Delaware's $50 million of improvement bonds found bidders yesterday in the taxexempt market, but Suffolk County found no bidders for its $54.3 milCredit lion of sewer Markets bonds. Tax exempt specialists said the absence of bidders on the Suffolk obligations was a further reflection of the marketplace's current resistence to New York issues. No question about it, declared one municipal underwriter, the unresolved New York City situation has affected other wouldbe New York State borrowers.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE UNCONSCIOUS GOD. By. Viktor E. Frank! 161 pages. Simon & Schuster. $6.95.

title: Kleppe Defends Coast Offshore Leases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Thomas S. Kleppe, the new Secretary of the Interior. strongly defended today in his first news conference his decision to proceed with the Dec. 11 sale of oil and gasleases off the Southern California coast despite the protests of the state and affected local counties and cities.

title: Nederlander Family Adds Alvin to Its Holings
description: The Nederlander organization, the first theatrical empire to emerge since the Shuberts attained their dominance in the 1920's, has added the Alvin Theater to its holdings here and says it is interested in acquiring two more theaters in New York and one in Boston.

title: Film Analysis Backs Warren Report
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., Nov. 25 (AP) An analysis of films showing President Kennedy's assassination indicates for the first time that some of his erratic movements after being shot may have been caused by his wife, photo specialists said today.

title: No Fault
description: The State Court of Appeals yesterday unanimously upheld the constitutionality of the no fault automobile insurance law. Page 37.

title: New Rothko Charges Denied by Gallery
description: Marlborough Galleries, confronted last week by Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz with what he called new evidence that it fabricated documents and testified falsely during the Mark Rothko trial that ended more than a year ago, has filed papers denying the charges in Surrogate's Court.

title: Luanda Force Reports Repelling Attacks
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)Sovietbased forces in Angola's civil war asserted today that they had repelled attackers from the north and south and had captured some black South African soldiers.

title: Gulf Oil and Its Millions for Politicians
description: Depositions and documents filed in a Washington court in the last few weeks reveal a pattern of illegal domestic political activity by the Gulf Oil Corporation that overshadows anything yet uncovered at other companies, according to Federal investigators.

title: 21 Medicaid Patients in Nursing Home Win a Holiday Reprieve on Trarisfer
description: ELIZABETH, Nov. 25An 84 yearold woman who was .to, have been moved from the nursing home in which she has lived for the last four years received a holiday reprieve in an outofcourt settlement today.

title: Notes on People
description: The party had ben sched uled for weeks but when Dan. iel P. Moynihan returned from assuring President Ford he was not resigning from his post of chief United States delesate to the United Nations, he was greeted at the mission here Monday night by 300 guests at a reception given by the Social Democrats U.S.A. The antiCommunist Socialists presented Mr. Moynihan an engraved silver cup for his contribution to democrary, most recently his position on Zionism.

title: Beaths
description: ABRAMSWilliam, beloved husband of Paula, dear tether of Estelle Nisenson and Gloria Agrams, proud grandfather of Rita Edelman and Dr. Roy Nisenson and grealgrandfather. Services today, 1 P.M., Westminster Chap. els, Coney Island Ave. at Ave. H, Brooklyn.

title: Macy Sales Gain of 10% Nationwide Is Reported at Annual Meeting
description: R. H. Macy & Co., Inc., the area's largest retailer, told its shareholders here yesterday that New York metropolitan area sales have continued strong through November and also that the average salescheck in its 72 department stores across the country is about 10 percent higher in amount than a year ago.

title: COMMUTER FARE RAISED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 25  The largest commuter fare increases in New Jersey's history, averaging 35 percent, were announced today by the State Commuter Operating Agency. The increases, applying principally to travel within the state, will be phased in over a 30day period beginning next Monday.

title: The Mood At Army: Restraint
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Nov. 25 The Cadets are whoopin it up in Washington Hall (the mess hall) three times a day this week to show the Army football players that The Corps is still behind them despite a woeful 28 wonlost record this season.

title: Concert
description: Miss Devetzi, Pianist, Plays Three Masters

title: German Trade Surplus Up
description: WIESBODEN, West Germany, Nov. 25 (Reuters) The German trade surplus for October rose to $1.09 billion from the $1.06 billion surplus in September but was lower than the $1.79 billion surplus in October last year, the Federal Statistic Office said.

title: Major Obstacles Remain
description: The city's efforts to avoid default cleared a major hurdle yesterday when the Legislature enacted a $200 million package of new taxes and the major banks and employee pension funds agreed to their shares of a threeyear $6.6 billion financing plan. But the city and the state still face a number of obstacles before they can totally resolve the financial problems that have plagued them since last spring. Following are the major issues still pending:

title: PORTUGUESE UNITS STAGE REBELLION; REGIME HITS BACK
description: LISBON, Wednesday, Nov. 26 Paratroopers and other regiments went into open rebellion against the Government yesterday and military leaders took strong action last night to crush their revolt.

title: Gulf Oil and Its Millions for Politicians
description: Depositions and documents filed in a Washington court in the last few weeks reveal a pattern of illegal domestic political activity by the Gulf Oil Corporation that overshadows anything yet uncovered at other companies, according to Federal investigators.

title: S.I.C. Charges Drug Unit With Outrageous
description: The State Commission of Investigation has charged the state's residential drug treatment program with having (costs and unacceptable costs as well as shocking patient mistreatment.

title: Contract Awards
description: An order worth about $150 million has been received by the General Electric Company from the Southern California Edison Company, Rosemead, Calif., for three STAG 500 combinedcycle power systems.

title: Key Theory in Hoff a Case Is Still Lacking Evidence
description: Investigators have developed a theory that James R. Hoffa was murdered under a plan developed by a faction of the Detroit Mafia and former and present teamsters union officials who feared his return to power in the big labor union.

title: 15 New Mayors Spend A Weekend at College
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 25 (UPI)  Fifteen newly elected mayors went to Harvard during the weekend to learn how to do their jobs. They agreed that their biggest problems were too little money and too much unemployment.

title: NAVY LISTS NAMES OF 7 DEAD IN CRASH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP) The Navy today released the names of the seven persons, killed in the.collision of the aircraft carrier John F. Kennedy and the cruiser Belknap east of Sicily Saturday night. They were given as follows:

title: Angola Intervention
description: While Portugal itself is again threatened by Communistinspired takeover, Soviet imperialism has reentered the African continent in crude force, this time in the former Portuguese colony of Angola.

title: Senator Mathias Is Exploring Possibility of 3d Political Party,
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Senator Charles McC. Mathias. Jr., a liberal Republican, said today he was exploring the possibility of forming a third. political party and that he: would like to he considered! for such a party's presidentiaF nomination.

title: South Africa Finds An Afrikaans Poet Guilty of Plotting
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 25 (AP) A poet who is a militant foe of South Africa's policy of racial separation was found guilty today of conspiring to overthrow the country's white minority Government.

title: SPAIN ANNOUNCES CLEMENCY MOVE
description: MADRID, Wednesday, Nov. 26 The Spanish Government announced a general pardon last night for some political prisoners and common criminals to mark the accession of Juan Carlos de Borbn as King.

title: Solita Solano, Novelist, 86; Wrote With Janet Flanner
description: OREGEVAL, France, Nov. 25 Solita Solano, a member of Paris literary circles since 1922, died here Saturday. She was 86 years old.

title: A Greek Village Is Richer, but Poorer
description: SKOURA, GreeceSkoura is less than 10 miles from Sparta, in the Laconia region of southern Greece, but it is virtually a suburb of New York.

title: Helstoski Told to Testify Or Face Contempt Action
description: NEWARK, Nov. 25 (UPI)Representative Henry Helstoski, who said last Friday he could not appear before a grand jury investigating his finances because he was ill, was ordered today to testify next week or face contempt of court charges.

title: U.S. Tells I.L.O. It Plans To Pay $6.7 Million in Dues
description: GENEVA, Nov. 25 (Reuters)The United States has said it expects to pay $6.7 million it owes the International Labor Organization, the United Nations affiliate reported today.

title: Adelphi Wants to Go First Class in Class
description: Before it joins the University Division next year, Adelphi University of Garden City, L. I., has a good chance of repeating as national champion in Division II, or the College DiviNews sion. The Panthers of need two more victories to make Soccer a triumphant entrance into Division I. We feel very confident we can take the national championship for the second year. said Dr. Mel Less, the coach of Adelphi, whch meets Seattle Pacific in one semifinal Friday. The University of Baltimore faces Wisconsin, Green Bay in the other semifinal at Memorial Stadium in Seattle.

title: Two Dead in Shooting
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25 (UPI)A sniper firing from a thirdfloor room of the Lincoln Motel yesterday killed a grocery stock clerk who was pulling two women out of the line of fire and wounded two policemen. Then he apparently committed suicide during a fire ignited by police bullets and tear gas. The police identified the sniper as Paul Dawson, 28 years old. The man killed was Gerald North.

title: Canadians 4, Flames 0
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 25 (UPI)Ken Dryden blocked 35 shots and got his fourth shutout of the season tonight as the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Atlanta Flames, 40.

title: COMPROMISE WON
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25After lastminute compromises that won support from both Republicans and the Black and Puerto Rican Caucus in the Assembly, the. Legislature tonight passed a slightly revised $200 million New York City tax package that it now hopes will persuade President Ford to support Federal aid to avoid a city default.

title: Data Indicate Neanderthal Man Used Herbs for Healing 60,000 Years AO
description: Neanderthal man, once thought of as a hulking, brutish creature far removed from modern man, appears to have known as early as 60,000 years ago that certain plants possessed medicinal properties.

title: HEALTH SPENDING 118 BILLION A YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 25  The nation spent $118 billion for health in the fiscal year 1975, which was 8.3 percent of the gross national product, or $547 for every man, woman and child, the Social Security Administration reported today.

title: ExNassau Democratic Chief Is Accused of Extortion
description: The former chairman of the Nassau County Democratic Committee was indicted by Federal grand jury yesterday on charges of extorting more than $40,000 from one engineering firm and getting two other firms to pay party workers and party bills in connection with the awarding of more than $2 million in con tracts.

title: About Real Estate
description: In and around the city stand the casualties of hard times in the construction business. They are the apartment buildings that ran out of money before completion.

title: ;SCOTT BARS RACE IN 76, FRIENDS SAY
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 25 Senator Hugh Scott, the Senate Republican leader for the last six years, has decided not to seek reelection in 1976, according to wellplaced sources.

title: Colonels 125, Stars 123
description: LOUISVILLE, Nov. 25 (AP) Artis Gilmore poured in 45 points, including Kentucky's last 6, in leading the Colonels to a 125123 doubleovertime victory over the Utah Stars in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: TOYOTA LIFTS PRICE; MONSANTO SETS RISE
description: Toyota Motor Sales U.S.A. Inc. announced yesterday that it was increasing manufacturer's suggested retail price on its 1976 Celica ST twodoor hardtop model by $250 to $4.145.

title: Hanoi Official Invites New Bids For Petroleum in South Vietnam,
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 25 (Reuters) American oil companies are welcome to resume offshore operations in Vietnam, a senior North Vietnamese Foreign Trade Ministry official said today.

title: TOTAL PETROLEUM ASSAILS HANOVER
description: Total Petroleum (North America) Ltd said yesterday it considered that the Hanover Petroleum Corporation had breached the merger agreement between the two companies negotiated on Aug. 7 and that Total was considering all legal and business alternatives available to it.

title: Rocky's Rocky Road
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25It is easy to get the impression these days that Vice President Rockefeller is reduced to attending funerals and presiding over the Senate, an equally melancholy chore; but in fact he may be coming into his most useful year.

title: MOYNA M'GILL, 80 ACTRESS, IS DEAD
description: Appeared in Gaslight Film and Boy Friend on Stage

title: HEWLETT PROFITS CONTINUE TO DROP
description: Earnings of the HewlettPackard Company continued to slide the fourth fiscal quarter, by 18.1 per cent, the major producer of electronic measuring devices reported yesterday. Sales increased 12.8 per cent in the quarter. For the full fiscal year, earnings were relatively flat while sales rose 11.2 percent.

title: October Reserve Assets Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (Reuters) United States reserve assets rose $278 million in October to $16.57 billion the Treasury said today. The U. S. reserve position in the International Monetary Fund rose $48 million to $2.19 Billion.

title: ECONOMISTS GIVE GLOOMY INSIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Four economists, tackling separately the puzzling phenomenon of the persistence of inflation even during periods of recession in the economy, produced gloomy new insights today on why this can and does happen.

title: As Individuals Celebrate Titles, Ivy Champions Select Captain
description: Bill Emper, a defensive back for Harvard's Ivy League football champions, has been elected captain of the Crimson's 103d football team.

title: Diplomatic Immunity No Barrier to Divorce
description: Diplomatic immunity may apply to traffic violations or arrests, but a Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn held yesterday that it does not apply to a divorce action.

title: Kissinger Confirms Plans for Meeting Moscow's Leaders
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger confirmed today that he was making plans to meet Soviet leaders next month to attempt to break a stalemate in negotiations for a second treaty on the limitation of strategic arms.

title: MSS. Depict Soviet Savagery in War;
description: The memoirs of Lev Kopelev a figure in the civil rights movement in the Soviet Union in the 1960's and 70's. who was instrumental in initiating and furthering tile writing career of Aleksandr L Solzhen and who was the model for Lev Rubin in Mr. Solzhenitsyn's The First Circle, have been smuggled out of the Soviet Union. They will be published here next year by the 7. B. Lippincott Company. After the publication of a Rssiananguage version, also to be Published here by Ardis, the Russianlanguage publisher; in Ann. Arbor, Mich.

title: PERU HALTS EXPORTS OF FISHING PRODUCTS
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 25 (AP)The Peruvian Government, which controls the world' s largest fish production in normal years, has suspended all exports of fishmeal and fishoil indefinitely, the Governmerit said today.

title: Judge Orders Turkish Airlines To Produce Plane's Wreckage
description: A Federal judge ordered Turkish Airlines yesterday to produce the cargo door and other wreckage from the DC10, jumbo jet that crashed near Paris in March 1974 killing all 346 persons on board.

title: Of Oil and Hamburgers
description: The other day while I was leaving the United Nations, a radio reporter brandishing his microphone asked me: Following the recent increase of 10 percent in the price of a barrel of oil by OPEC, each American must now pay one to two cents more for a gallon of gasoline! What do you think of this state of affairs, you who come from an oilproducing country?

title: A 3YEAR ACCORD
description: The major banks and the teachers union  the two remaining holdoutsrelented yesterday and agreed to join in the complicated threeyear plan to provide cash and ease the debt for New York City.

title: City University Fives Obtain TVRadio Pact
description: The City University of New York announced yesterday a 27game radio and television package for the league's 197576 varsity basketball season. City College will get the season under way in Baton Rouge, La., against Louisiana State University on Friday.

title: SOVIET IS PRESSED FOR DATA ON VENUS
description: American scientists received yesterday a set of enlarged, refined photographs taken by the two Soviet Union spacecraft that landed on Venus last monthbut they are pressing Soviet scientists to share othei data that might prove useful, in planning the next American mission to Venus in 1978.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 26, 1975

title: The New Fare Schedules
description: Central Railroad New Jersey

title: Iturbi, at 80, Celebrates
description: At a time when marathons are popular, Jose Iturbi put on a small one at Avery Fisher Hall on Monday night that would have taxed many a vouneer man. The Spanish born pianist, who has been a fixture in American life since the mid1930's, decided that he would celebrate his 80th birthday, which falls on Friday, by playing a program of four concertos and conducting them himself.

title: City U. Plans Tightening Of 76 Adrnissions Rules
description: The chancellor of the City University, Dr. Robert J. Kibbee, appears to have a solid majority of the Board of Higher Education behind a proposal to impose minimum academic standards for freshmen, starting next fall.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Tuesday, Nov. 25, 1975

title: Duke Five Beats Canada
description: DURHAM, N.C., Nov. 25 (UPI) Willie Hodge scored 21 points lost night to lead Duke to an 85.75 victory over the Canadian national basketball team. It was the first loss in five games for the Canadians on their American tour.

title: Flawed
description: However deficient the pending energy bill may beand we have found much in it to criticizea Presidential veto would have the probable effect of an overnight lifting all oil price controls, with the result that the future price of oil would henceforth be determined by the free market (sic) mechanism of the Middle Eastern oil cartel. Such a situation could be disastrous for this country's economic recovery and antiinflation policies. A veto on grounds of the controversial oil pricing formula, moreover, would automatically nullify all the other worthwhile and hardfought provisions in this omnibus energy billincluding establishment of a strategic petroleum reserve, mandatory fuel efficiency standards for automobiles and a variety of energy conservation measures.

title: Senators Will Hear Nixon At Inquiry on C.I.A. Plots
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Nixon has agreed to testify Senate Select Committee on

title: No Escape
description: WASHINGTONThe novelty of scientific findings may divert attention from their implications whereas it is .the implications that are meaningful for the development of public policy. Such an instance occurred with the publication of a recent report, The LongTerm Worldwide Effects of Multiple Detonations of Nuclear Weapons, prepared by a committee of the national research council of the National Academy of Sciences, whose chairman is the distinguished physicist, Prof. Alfred O. C. Nier of the University of Minnesota.

title: Theater: La Rondelay
description: The Impossible Ragtime Theater (I.R.T.) is a fresh, busy Off Off Broadway company. In this, its second season, it has scheduled five new plays, two revivals and a series of projects by new directors. The I.R.T. operates two theaters, with a main stage situated in comfortable quarters in the heart of Manhattan's flower district.

title: Mehta Battles Image of Glamour Boy
description: The world of conductors is full of glamour boys, but Zubin Mehta doesn't want to be counted among them.

title: Consumer Notes
description: A current advertising campaign by the Allstate Insurance Company features company promise to guarantee repairs to a customer's car when the company recommends a repair shop. Sounds good. But in New York State, the same guarantee must he provided by all insurance companies to comply with a regulation of the State Insurance Department.

title: 76ers 109. Warriors 108
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 25 (UPI) Fred Carter's jump shot at the final buzzer gave the Philadelphia 76ers a 109108 victory over the Golden State Warriors tonight and enabled the 76ers to retain first place in the N.B.A.'s Atlantic Division.

title: The Moynihan Affair
description: However one judges the flamboyant performance Daniel Patrick Moynihan as United States Ambassador to the United Nations, it would have been irresponsible for him to leave that post under present circumstances. Such an abrupt exit would surely have been interpreted as signaling abandonment of the American policy keeping the record straight, calling member states to task for practicing double standards and warning of the perils of capricious or meaningless resolutions at the United Nations.

title: Ford Reported Prepared To Act Quickly to Aid City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25President Ford is standing by to give prompt consideration to financial aid to New York City as soon as Governor Carey's fiscal package is implemented, the President's top economic advisers said today.

title: Senators Will Hear Nixon At Inquiry on C.I.A. Plots
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Nixon has agreed to testify Senate Select Committee on Former President Richard M. the next 60 days before the Intelligence but will reserve his right to refuse to answer certain questions, either by invoking the Fifth Amendment against selfincrimination or the principle of executive privilege, according to sources familiar with the investigation.

title: Plans for a SyntheticGas Plant Delayed by Navajo Council Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Plans for the first multimilliondollar synthetic fuel refinery to convert the Navajo Indians vast reserves of cheap, stripminable coal into cleanburning pipeline gas suffered another setback last night when the Navajo Tribal Council voted overwhelmingly to postpone a lease renewal proposed by the El Paso Natural Gas Company.

title: PHILADELPHIA AIDE HELD IN SHAKEDOWN
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. (AP) City Councilman Isadore. Bellis Was indicted today. on charges of extortion, bribery conspiracy and demanding an illegal political contribution in connection with an architectural contract at the Philadelphia International Airport.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Parole Board has been asked by Governor Byrne to make a recommendation on whether Rubin Hurricane Carter and John Artis should be granted executive clemency.

title: Judge's Son, Held in Killing, Hits Prosecutor With Chair
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Nov. 25 (AP) A judge's son accused of murdering his psychiatrist was sent to a mental Institution yesterday after he swung a chair and knocked the prosecutor to the floor of the courtrooms.

title: Scott Bars Race in 76, Friends Say
description: Continued From Page 1, Col.

title: Reorganization Petition Filed by Goldsmith Bros
description: Goldsmith Bros., the longestablished stationery chain here, filed yesterday a voluntary petition for reorganization under the Chapter XI provisitions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Syria, Cool to Egypt, Acts To Improve Ties to Iraq
description: DAMASCUS, Syria Stung by Egypt's signing of the accord on Sinai with Israel, and skeptical about the prospects for MiddleEast diplomacy, Syria has been striving to strengthen its hand against Israel by improving relations with Iraq and consolidating ties with other Arab countries.

title: Rangers Hosts to ExMates
description: John Davidson will be in goal and Phil Esposito will take up his accustomed cheering position on the sideline tonight as the Rangers face the Boston Bruins in Madison Sauare Garden.

title: TENNESSEE ELECTS DEMOCRAT TO HOUSE
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 25Clifford R. Allen, a Democrat and veteran Tennessee politician, was elected to the House in special election in the Tennesisee Fifth Congressional District today, easily defeating the Republican nominee, Bob Olsen, and two independent candidates.

title: U.S. JUDGE DISMISSES A BROCK COMPLAINT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 26 United Stges District Judge John P. Fullam dismissed yesterday a complaint against United States Senator Bill Brock that had named him a defendant in a suit by purchasers of land in the Pocono Mountains. Judge Fullam gave the buyers 30 days to amend their compaint. The Tennessee Republican, five development companies, four other persons connected with the land companies and three banks, were charged last November with misrepresentation and commissions of material facts in connection with the sale of lots in the Sherwood Forest development in Wayne County, Pa.

title: Los Angeles Council Panel Drops Assassination Inquiry
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 (UPI) The City Council committee formed to investigate the police handling of the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy dissolved itself today. It reached no conclusions and made no report.

title: HUMPHREY DRIVE BEGUN IN PRIMARY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Supporters of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey have started write  in campaign in New Hampshire, which will hold the first of the 1976 Presidential primaries on Feb. 24, and they plan similar drives in Vermont and Massachusetts.

title: Viruses Said to Shift Genes of the Species
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Virus infection can cause the transfer of genes from one animal species to another in fashion that may influence evolution, scientists have concluded after studies of rodents, cats, pigs, monkeys, apes and man.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: TV REPORTER JAILED IN CONTEMPT CASE:
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26A television newsman spent nearly four hours in jail today for filming an interview in the basement of a court building herean action that a 10judge panel has ruled to be in contempt of, court.

title: Deliverance? ...
description: After agonizing months of bouncing from crisis deeper crisis, New Yorkers on this Thanksgiving Day can breathe more easilybut not much more.

title: Tuesday's Fight
description: Miami BeachJuan Hildalgo, 136 pounds. Miami, outpointed Jose Gonzalez, 133, Lancaster, Pa., 10 rounds.

title: Past Ford Quotations on City's Crisis

title: India's Top Aide in Dacca Wounded in Ambush by 6
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 26The Indian High Commissioner in Bangladesh was shot and wounded this morning in an ambush at the chancery building in Dacca.

title: Carey Sees a Vindication Of Merit of Our Position
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beame hailed President Ford's recommendation last night for a program of Federal loans to the city that, the Governor said, represents vindication of New York's case, of the merit of our position.

title: WALDHEIM IN SYRIA HOPEFUL ON GOLAN
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Thursday, Nov. 27 Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations emerged from a fourhour talk with President Hafez alAssad early today, hopeful that Syria would agree to extend the mandate of the international observer force in the Golan Heights beyond its expiration on Sunday.

title: Sonics Topple Celtics
description: BOSTON, Nov. 26 (UPI)Slick Watts scored . two fourthquarter baskets that led the Seattle SuperSonics to a 110109 victory over the Boston Celtics in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Public Service Commission yesterday granted the Consolidated Edison Company a $21.8 million rate increase for steam customers. Added to an interim rate increase $10.3 million granted in August, the total increase amounts to nearly $32.1 million. The utility had sought an increase of $46.9 .million, or 32.4 percent, for its 2,550 steam customers, mainly large office buildings in Downtown and Midtown Manhattan.

title: Federal Immigration Aide Is Guilty of Conspiracy
description: NEWARK, Nov. 26 (UPI) The third highest Federal immigration official in the state pleaded guilty today to charges that he conspired to help an illegal alien from Taiwan get permanent residency in the United States.

title: Wreckage of Ore Carrier Found in at Least 2 Pieces
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 26 (AP)A Coast Guard board of inquiry adjourned tonight until Dec. 10 after hearing testimony that the ore carrier Edmund Fitzgerald is lying in 530 feet of water at the bottom of Lake Superior i, at least two pieces, possibly three.

title: Suspicious Packet Sent To Australian Leader
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Thursday, Nov. 27 (Reuters) A suspicious packet addressed to Australia's caretaker Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser, was intercepted today at the Brisbane central mail exchange, but the police later said that the device was hoax letter bomb.

title: Close Call in Lisbon
description: The Communist threat to Portugal is far from over; but the strong, effective actions ordered by President Costa Gomesresulting in the rapid collapse of a concerted rebellion by leftist forceswill greatly encourage the democratic majorities in both the armed services and the general population. For once, the President, who had not only tolerated but appeared to sympathize with leftist maneuvers in earlier crises, recognized that was imperative to reestablish promptly the authority the Government.

title: L.I. TEACHER IS FINED FOR HITTING STUDENT
description: HICKSVILLE, L.I., Nov. 26A Hicksville Junior High School teacher was fined $1,000 last night by the School Board for allegedly breaking the jar of a 14yearold student after he was allegedly provoked by the student's habit of tapping him on the shoulder when he saw the teacher in the hall.

description: Negotiations are under way for the sale of Cartier Inc., the Fifth Avenue jewelry store, to Cartier of Paris, its onetime owner, informed sources said yesterday.

title: Snow Storm Hits Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26 (AP) The heaviest snowstorm in recent years covered the Soviet. capital during the night with S to 11 inches of snow. Traffic was jammed and cars were stuck. Skies were clear today and the temperature was S degrees Fahrenheit.

title: EDUCATORS WEN A CIVIL RELIGION
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 26An interfaith organization of religious educators met here this week to take a look at what some have described as America's civil religionthat blending of patriotism and piety manifested when children sing a national hymn that invokes the name of God or a clergyman offers a prayer at the inauguration of the President. The concept has been examined with increasing attention in the last few years, particularly among sociologists and religious students. At their biennial meeting, 1,000 members of the Religious Education Association of the United. States and Canada considered whether civil religion was good or bad and whether the concept actually existed.

The two fires prompted warnings for 5,600 residents to flee advancing flames, which have blackened more than 100 square miles of tinderdry hillsides.

Ron Jessie, the Lions', receiver last year, played out his option and was signed by the Rams. A Los Angeles running back, Cullen Bryant, was to be awarded to the Lions as compensation by Commissioner Pete Rozelle of the National Football League.

title: De Funes, in 'Delusions,' Keeps the Gags Rolling
description: The refreshing thing about the frenetic comedy of Louis De Funes, one of France's biggest box-office stars, is that it seems to be adrift in time. Whether the setting is contemporary, as in "The Mad Adventures of 'Rabbi' Jacob," seen here last year, or 17th-century Spain, as in "Delusions of Grandeur," which opened at two theaters yesterday, Mr. De Funes seems always to be operating within his own tiny universe, out of touch with everything except his own ill humor, his greed and his schemes to cheat that inevitably fail.Though his comedy is studiously untopical, it is far from being timeless in the manner of the truly great screen comediansChaplin, Keaton, Tati. Indeed, he is funny just because the character he has created seems so furiously petty. It's not simply that this character doesn't possess a generous bone in his body, he also has absolutely no awareness of this fact.In "Delusions of Grandeur," directed by Gerard Oury in 1971, two years before he collaborated with the actor on "The Mad Adventures," Mr. De Funes plays a corrupt but supremely unsuccessful tax minister in the court of the King of Spain. Yves Montand plays the minister's roguish valet and the plot has some connection with Victor Hugo's "Ruy Blas"though it's a very loose one.The settings are splendid and the gags, some quite funny, are nonstop as Mr. De Funes maneuvers transparently to discredit the queen in order to win back the favor of the king.Mr. Montand looks uneasy under these circumstances. He's a good comedian himself, but it must be trying to act with someone who mugs as outrageously as Mr. De Funes, who also is given the best of the cheerfully foolish lines. "Did you get my anonymous letter?" he asks the king at one point.I also liked the pledge of a group of noblemen who are plotting to overthrow the king: "All for one and every man for himself."

title: Stevenson Says No
description: Rather unexpectedly, Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d has declined the opportunity to be the Presidential candidate of his fellow Illinois Democrats. Having been endorsed by Mayor Richard J. Daley and the party organization, Senator Stevenson would have been a topheavy favorite to win the Illinois primary, the earliest held by a major state. Bearing one of the Democratic Party's most distinguished names, he might have been strong competitor had he chosen to enter a few other primaries and thereby arrived at the convention as compromise candidate.

title: Nation's Libraries Face Economic Pinch
description: In an outlying area of the Bronx, the city's newest branch library has no books and no librarians; it has never been used. Completed seven months ago, it has been shuttered ever since, the silent symbol of a low priority city servicethe public library system.

title: FORD EXPEDITING DECISION ON COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 President Ford said tonight that he would not submit a nomination for the Supreme. Court vacancy caused by the retirement of Justice William O. Douglas before he leaves for China on Saturday.

title: Strike Ties UP Japan's Transport and Communication
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26About 860,000 Japanese railway, telephone, postal and other government workers struck today, crippling the nation's transport and communications.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
HEARST CASE DATA FILED BY 2 SIDES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 26The outlines of a bitter fight over a psychiatric defense for Patricia Hearst are visible in defense and prosecution motions filed in Federal District Court.

title: 15 Majdanek Guards in German Trial
description: DUSSELDORF, West Germany, Nov. 26  Thirtyone years after the Red Army closed Majdanek, the:.. azi concentration camp near Lublin, Poland, a West German court brought 15 of the camp's guards and officers to trial here today on charges of mass murder.

title: Telethon Rings Up No Sale
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 26 (UPI) The producers of New York City Revival 75, a telethon planned to raise money for New York City, have announced that the show had been. postponed from Tuesday until Dec. 24. The. reason is lack of financial supPort.

title: The Big Names Tell It Like It Is
description: In the Big Stadium in the Sky, the Big .Names were waiting to be introduced. Babe Ruth was there, and Jim Thorpe, Jack Johnson, Bobby Jones, Bill Tilden, Howie Morenz, Joe Lapchick and Earl Sande. They had been assembled for the annual Thanksgiving Day sports nostalgia ceremony for the new group of eternityticket subscribers. As the Angel Gabriel blew his horn to quiet the assembly, the personalized TV set at each seat began to show film clips of the Big Names. Arrayed on the arena floor, the Big Names waited patiently. In his camel's Sports hair cap and overcoat, Babe Ruth had a cold beer in one hand and a blonde in the other. of Jim Thorpe was wearing the Olympic gold The Times medals that he had received on his arrival. .lack Johnson was reading a copy of Muhammad Ali's hook. Bobby Jones was smoothing his plusfours. Bill Tilden was inspecting a grass court that the West Side Tennis Club had dug up. Howie Morenz was reading the testimony from the Dave ForbesHenry Boucha hockey assault case. Joe Lapchick was trying to shoot sky hook. Earl Sande was over by Man o War's stall. And as they waited, they talked among themselves.

title: LABOR EXTREMISTS WARNED BY WILSON
description: LONDON, Nov. 26 (Reuters) Prime Minister Harold Wilson moved sharply tonight linto a dispute between the left and right wings of his governing Labor Party, issuing an unusual public warning that these divisions could cost it the next general election.

title: Islanders Rout Stars, 91, As Harris, Trottier Excel
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 26 Two goals by Billy Harris and a goal and four assists by a rookie, Bryan Trottier, helped the New York Islanders trounce the Minnesota North Stars tonight, 91.

title: Brooklyn Fire Adds to Dispute Over Closing of Engine Co. 212
description: I don't know what I'm doing, I'm all mixed up, Gladys Ballu said yesterday as she removed the remains of her charred belongings from the wood and shingle frame house in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn that was destroyed by fire on Tuesday. I had no sleep all night, said Mrs. Ballu, who is 66 years old. We kept knocking on doors, asking people to let us sleep there, but they had taken in the others, so they were all filled up. We just walked all nightwe didn't know where to go.

title: TRADE IN SURPLUS 9TH MONTH IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26A surge in agricultural exports and a drop in the volume of imported oil combined to give the nation its ninth consecutive monthly trade surplus in October, the Government said today.

description: TEPOZTLAN, MexicoRebecca Martinez, 35 years old, her bare feet caked with mud, fatigue on her face, sat on chair in her small front yard and cradled Emilio, 3 months old, her seventh child in 12 years.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 President Ford said tonight that differences between the United States and the Soviet Union over a new agreement on limitation of strategic arms had not been narrowed sufficiently to justify a trip by Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger to Moscow at this time.

title: Paul A. Porter, Capital Lawyer Who Held New Deal Posts, Dies
description: Paul A. Porter, a leading Washington lawyer who held a succession of key Federal posts a generation ago, died yesterday in George Washington University Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Bergen County Loses Lawsuit Against P. U. C. on Dump Fees
description: TRENTON, Nov. 26 (UPI)Bergen County today lost its suit against the Board of Public Utility Commissioners, which had denied a 1971 fee increase at two refuse disposal sites.

title: AFRIKAANS WRITER GIVEN NINE YEARS
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 26 (Reuters) One of South Africa's leading poets, Breyten Breytenbach, was sentenced today to nine years in prison for plotting to overthrow the Government.

title: Ford Aid to the City Gives No Guarantee The Crisis Is Over
description: Although President Ford's support of Federal assistance will do much to lift the fiscal crisis that has engulfed the city for the last year, it does not, according to financial experts, insure that the crisis is over.

title: Winter Storm Hits Odessa
description: MOSCOW. Nov. 25 (AP)Odessa and other populated coastal areas of the Black Sea have been hit by a winter storm, followed by heavy icing, that caused considerable damage, the Soviet press agency Tass reported today.

title: Oregon St. Picks Andros
description: CORVALLIS, Ora., Nov. 26 (AP) Dee Andros, football coach at Oregon State for II years, has been named athletic director for the Beavers. Andros replaces Jim Barratt, who is resigning effective Jan. 1.

title: Music: A Boulez Mix of Old, New and Andre Watts
description: Last night's New York Philharmonic concert started on a somber note. Pierre Boulez came onstage and told me audience that David M. Keiser had died that afternoon. In his memory, Mr. Boulez said, Mozart's Adagio and Fugue in C minor would be played. Mr. Keiser, active so many years in Philharmonic affairs, was honorary chairman of the board at his death yesterday.

title: Game Farm Blocked, Site Pat Up for Sale
description: MOUNT HOLLY, Vt., Nov. 26 (AP) The 627acre site of a proposed wildlife Wonderland farm for domestic and exotic animals is up for sale.

title: 8% INTEREST RATE

title: Dance: Ailey's Mooche
description: The Alvin Ailey phenomenon is still with us and in this month of talk about increasingly long seasons for moderndance companies, it might be remembered that the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Company is the only moderndance group that has been able to play three weeks at City Center twice a year, with the recent addition of twoweek summer runs at the State Theater.

title: Bruins Defeat Rangers, 64, On Four Goals in 2d Period
description: Waiting for Espo, a tragedy in three acts, continued its run at Madison Square Garden last night. Crippled by the absence of Phil Esposito for the fifth time, the Rangers were routed, 64, by the surging Boston Bruins, who ran their string of unbeaten games to nine.

He also asked the Norwegians to send formal invitations to the ceremony to four dissident friends, two of whom are in custody awaiting trial.

A spokesman said some of the refuse may not be completely picked up until Monday.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Question: When is a final decision nol final? Answer: When 15 influential senators decide it isn't.

description: A Federal Appeals Court ordered Rabbi Meir Kahane to prison yesterday, saying that authorities there could satisfy his constitutional right to kosher diet without offering him meat or other food that required special preparation.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Department of Environmental Protection said it had denied a permit for the construction of a condominium project in Beach Haven in Ocean County. The Bay Cove project was denied a permit under the Coastal Area Facility Review Act because of insufficient offstreet parking, possible limitation of public access to bay waters, undesirable zoning practices increased runoff of surface water and incompatibility with surroundings. The Maurice River Company of Millville proposed to build the 114unit Bay Cove project on a 3.8acre site between Bay Avenue and Little Egg Harbor Bay.

title: Striking Nurses Near Accord
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov: 26(AP) A tentative settlement was reached today in a sixday strike by 160 nurses at St., Joseph's Hospital here, a hospital spokesman said. The nurses will vote on the proposed contract agreement next Sunday.

title: Claims Filed for $8 Million
description: Claims totaling 1,8 million have been filed against the City of Niagara Falls, N.Y., as a.result of a sewer construction iaccident in which five workers drowned on Aug. 29 when water suddenly filled a tunnel in which, they were working.

title: Carl Zigrosser, Prints Curator At Philadelphia Museum, Dies
description: Carl Zigrosser, curator emeritus of prints and drawings at the Philadelphia Museum of. Art, died yesterday in Montagnola, Switzerland, where he had lived for the last three years. He was 84 years old.

title: 3 DEAD IN COLLISION ON BELT PARKWAY
description: A Brooklyn couple and friend from out of town were killed yesterday when their car was hit head on by another vehicle, which the police said had jumped a divider on the Belt Parkway in the Canarsia section of Brooklyn. Two other women occupants of the car that was struck sustained injuries.

title: Obsessed 'Romantic Englishwoman'
description: Lewis Fielding (Michael Caine) and his wife, Elizabeth (Glenda Jackson), think they have nothing when they have everything, which is just one of the curious reversals that keeps Joseph Losey's "The Romantic Englishwoman" interesting long after you've decided that something is decidedly wrong with it.Lewis is a successful novelist and screenwriter. He and his wife have a handsome young son, a big, comfortable house in the country, access to other beautiful/successful people and no maid problems. Lewis and Elizabeth love each other too much or not enough?When Elizabeth gets bored and runs off to Baden-Baden for a weekend, Lewis becomes obsessed with fantasies of her imaginary infidelities. The first two things Elizabeth does when she comes home, is to race to her bedroom, and then to the au pair's, to search for signs of Lewis's hanky-panky with the domestic help. This shared, obsessive fretfulness keeps Lewis and Elizabeth in a state of high, apparently pleasurable, sexual tension until Lewis has the had taste to stage-direct their lives to simulate melodrama."The Romantic English-woman," which opened at two theaters yesterday, is about an unequal, threesomeLewis, Elizabeth and Thomas (Helmut Berger); a self-styled poet and gigolo who sometimes makes ends meet by smuggling heroin, across national boundaries. When Thomas turns up in England after having met Elizabeth in Baden-Baden, Lewis invites the young man to live with them. Lewis has just begun to write a screenplay about a woman, unhappy in her perfect marriage, who runs off to the Continent to find herself and in the process falls in love with another man."The Romantic Enslishwoman" is an exceedingly elegant looking movie. It isn't just posh locales and handsome interior decoration that give this effect. The camera sees everything with a singular kind of appreciation for its high-priced mostly cold beauty. The camera is also obsessed with reflections of reality, which, I suppose; is one of the things the movie is meant to be about.The film opens with a reflection of Miss Jackson's face in the train window en route to Baden-Baden. Scene after scene begins in such a way that one can't be quite sure whether one is seeing the real thing or a mirror image. When late in the film Elizabeth finally does fall in love with the gigolo, the question is raised, what has come first, the true passion or its reflection that is, Lewis's suspicions?The screenplay, by Tom Stoppard (author of Broadway's "Travesties") and Thomas Wiseman, is full of the sort of auto-critique that seems designed to earn the film makers congratulations for the film they've made and forestall outside criticism. Early in the movie, when a producer asks Lewis to write a script about "the new woman," Lewis says with a sigh, "It sounds very boring. Why not turn it into a thriller?"Mr. Losey and his writers have not turned "The Romantic Englishwoman" into a thriller. They've attempted to make an intelligent film about intelligent people, and as long as Mr. Berger is kept off the screen, it is. Mr. Caine and Miss Jackson are interesting performers. When they are supposed to be thinking, puzzling things out, or caught up in feelings beyond their control, we believe it.Mr. Berger is something else. It's impossible to know when he's supposed to represent fraudulence within the film or if he's simply being himself, a not very good actor defrauding the film of a performance.He's a missing element and the movie, unequally balanced, goes off into a wobbly, out-of-control orbit as a result. When we should be moved or intellectually engaged, we are more inclined to snicker. Which is too bad, since "The Romantic English-woman" is in many other ways a film of feeling, tact and intelligence.

title: Thanks
description: The general tenor of each day's news in recent weeks could persuade the average American that the only reason for giving thanks this day is that he has not yet fallen victim to assault, default, or the disappearance of the ozone. For many Americans those negative, and possibly tentative, blessings will hardly outweigh such present hardships as unemploympt, poverty and discouragement.

title: Extortionist Gets 3 Years
description: CLEVELAND, Nova 26 (UPI) Richard Kravanja, 35 years old, of Brooklyn, Ohio, pleaded guilty today to attempting to extort $250,000 from Randolph A. Hearst, president of The San Francisco Examiner and father of Patricia Hearst. He was sentenced to three years' imprison, ment by United States District Judge Ben Green.

title: Yugoslavia Jails American for 7 Years After Secret Trial on, Spying Charges
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 26 An American was arrested on espionage charges while visiting this country in July and was sentenced in a secret trial to seven years imprisonment.

title: Indians and Environmentalists
description: Earlier this year, the leading environmental organizations, including the Sierra Club and Friends of the Earth, suffered an awkward defeat by the tiny Havasupai Indian tribe, whose 435 members inhabit Arizona's Grand Canyon. After a bitter contest, Congress awarded the Indians 185,000 acres that the environmentalists had wished, instead, to have included in an enlarged Grand Canyon National Park.

title: A Soviet Satellite to Study Effect of Gravity in Space
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26 (UPI)The Soviet Union announced today that it had launched biological satellite carrying American experiments in another step toward international space cooperation.

title: Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26Two young East Coast partnerships led going into the second semifinal session of the blue ribbon pair championship at the American Contract Bridge Leagues Fall Nationals here tonight.

title: Nation's Libraries Face Economic Pinch
description: In an outlying area of tne Bronx, the city's newest branch library has no books and no librarians; it has never been used. Completed seven months ago, it has been shuttered ever since, the silent symbol of a low priority city servicethe public library system.

title: CALIFORNIA SPLIT ON NEW YORK AID
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 26Californians are closely divided as most of the rest of the country has seemed to be in other pollson the question of Federal assistance to. New York City, according to an opinion sampling released today.

title: City Begins Festive Season
description: Winter begins on Dec. 21, but in New York the holiday season begins today. Between now and the end of the year, New York puts on its party clothes, decorates its front door and invites the rest of the world to drop in for some fun.

title: TORREY H. WEBB, 83, AIR PIONEER, IS DEAD
description: Torrey H. Webb, an air pioneer and former vice president of Texaco, Inc., died Sunday in Hope Memorial Hospital in Newport Beach, Calif. He was 83 years old and lived in nearby Corona del Mar.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 27, 1975

title: Radio
description: that. Broke the Plains, Thomson; Arcadian Symphony, Bristow: 89:30, WNYCFM. Prelude to Act III of Lohengrin, Wagner; Concerto for Violin and Cello, Brahms; Symphony No. 1, Mahler.

title: Foes of Pornography Winning a Few Skirmishes, but Not the Major Battles
description: DES MOINES, IowaIn their continuing and often frustrating war against pornography and prostitution, upholders of community morals are winning a few skirmishes in some American cities, but overall they appear to be losing the major battles.

title: 50 Extra Guards Start Work Today On Rikers Island
description: Fifty correction officers, rehired following a 17hour revolt earlier this week on Bikers Island, will start work today, several days ahead of schedule, the chairman of the city's Board of Correction said yesterday. All the arrangements were made quickly, said the chairman, Peter Tufo, who described conditions at the Men's House of Detention as very tense.

title: Nigerian Military Governor And 215 Others Relieved
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Nigerian Government today announced the removal of the military governor of Nigeria's EastCentral State, Col. Anthony Ochefu, and 215 other officers from the Nigerian Army.

title: Bridge: 2 Married Pairs Are Among Leaders in the Final Session
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 27Two married couples were among the leaders going into the final session of the blue ribbon pair championship at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals here tonight

title: Soviet Finds Evidence Of Music by Cavemen
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Soviet archaeologists have unearthed evidence that cavemen made music, the newspaper Sovetskaya Rossiya has renorted.

title: JOHN D. HOLAHAN
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27 (UPI) Former general manager of the Pittsburgh professional football team Steelcrs and member of Duquesne University's sports Hall of Fame, died yesterday in a hospital here. He was 71 years old.

title: Mao's Wife Is Reported Under Attack
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27Chairman Mao Tsetung's wife, Chiang Ching, has come under strong criticism and may have suffered a decline in Communist Party standing because she disclosed confidential information to an American scholar, recent travelers from China repcirt.

title: FOOD CONFERENCE ENDS IN CONFLICT
description: ROME, Nov. 27The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations concluded today a threeweek conference marked by a series of conflicts between developing and industrial countries and a lastminute struggle over the use of the word racism.

title: ABM Down
description: In the history of the strategic nuclear arms race, there have been only two occasions when massive public resistance has interfered with Pentagon plans. Curiously, both instances have involved socalled defensive measures: underground bomb shelters and the antiballisticmissile (ABM) system.

title: DirectSubsidy Rent Plan Due Here Soon
description: Wanted: 1,075 New York City families of low and moderate incomes who live in extremely substandard or grossly overcrowded housing, or who live in adequate housing but have an unusually severe rent hardship.

title: Policeman's Ouster Upheld
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 27 (UPI)The Pennsylvania Commonwealth Court upheld yesterday the dismissal of a policeman ousted because he allegedly had an adulterous affair. Lee

title: Berserk Veteran Surrenders
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27 (AP)A Navy veteran surrendered to the police yesterday after firing shots at random from the fitst floor window of his South Side apartment. No one was injured. Brian Coyle, 23 years old, was charged with aggravated assault. He babbled like a prisoner of war, the polite said. He kept repeating his name and serial number. He was dressed in a Navy peacoat, dark slacks and a black turtleneck sweater.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975. by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: 4 Officials in Azerbaijan Dismissed in New Purige
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (Reuters) Four district Communist Party and local government officials have been dismissed in new purge in the Republic of Azerbaijan, it was reported here today.

title: Australian Train Hits Bus; One Dead and 17 Injured
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Friday, Nov. 28 (AP)A freight train collided with a bus loaded with commuters today in a Sydney suburb, killing one person and injuring at least 17.

title: 2 Killed in Lebanon By Accidental Blast At Training Center
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. Nov. 27Two youths were killed and 10 were wounded today when bomb exploded at a school here where young men were engaged in military training.

title: Britain Details Autonomy Plan, With More Power to Scotland Than Wales
description: LONDON, Nov. 27The British Government made public today its plan to grant wider autonomy to Scotland and Wales while keeping them firmly within the United Kingdom.

title: PANAMA CANAL TALK REPORTED SET BACK
description: PANAMA, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)  Negotiations for a new treaty between the United States and Panama on the Panama Canal were set back here today as the United States special representative, Ellsworth Bunker, left for Washington after nine days of unsuccessful talks.

title: Head of Bangladesh Seeks India Parley On Improving Ties
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 27The President of Bangladesh told Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today that he planned to send a highlevel delegation to India soon to discuss the further development of relations between the two countries.

title: Franklin Township Wins, 216
description: Franklin Township's most successful football team .ever scored, a. 216 Victory over Piscataway yesterday and headed toward Ceniral Jersey Group 3, playoff championship game Dec. 6

title: Syria Is Said to Agree to Extend U.N. Force as Waldheim Ends His Mission
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 27The brief mission of SecretaryGeneral Kurt Waldheim to the Middle East has underscored the extent to which Syria's diplomatic strategy has become one focused on political, not territorial gains, in the view of diplomats and other sources here.

title: Edward M. Raynolds Dies; Advertising Executive, 72
description: Edward H. Raynolds, former director of market research, for the WarnerLambert Company, [died Tuesday at Overlook Hospital in Summit, N. J. He was 72 years old and lived in Springfield, N. J.

title: ELINOR AMLEN SINGS SONGS IN 5 GROUPS
description: Elinor Amlen, a soprano who has sung here previously, gave a somewhat offbeat recital at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night. Whereas singers usually group their selections according to composer or period, Miss Amlen arranged hers according to subject.

title: Male JobSeeker Says Fair. Sex Was Unfair
description: HULL, Mass., Nov. 27 (AP) The Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination is investigating what is believed to be the first cornplaint of a man against a town board charging job discrimination based on sex.

title: COALITION CABINET ASKED IN FINLAND
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 27, (UPI)President Urho Kekkonen demanded tonight that five parties including the Communists form a majority government of national emergency, by Monday to cope with risings unemployment and other economic ills.

title: Store Bombed on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 (AP)A bomb blew a twofoot hole in the rear wall of a Safeway store tonight and knocked down part of a fence, the police said. There were no injuries. The food chain has been the target of bombings in the past.

title: Guinness Book Editor Shot Dead in London
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 (Reuters)A. Ross McWhirter, who with his twin brother, Norris, compiled the bestselling Guinness Book of Records, was shot dead by two gunmen at his home tonight as his wife looked on.

title: Fire Damages Tenement
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 27 (AP) A fire of unknown origin swept the third and fourth floors of a fourstory brick tenement in the downtown area at 122 Bright Street tonight. One fireman was injured slightly battling the blaze, which was brought under control in less than an hour.

title: Knicks
description: LANDOVER, Md., Nov. 27  The Knicks have finally .won on the road.

title: ABC Cancels 6 Shows in MidSeason Schedule
description: ABCTV has announced its midseason schedule changes, including the cancellation of six programs, the addition of six new ones and a change in the time slot for three others. Alteretions were made in the lineup for every night except Sunday.

title: Michael Moody Weds Anne Wadsworth
description: Anne Littleford Wadsworth and Michael Dorn Moody were married yesterday afternoon in the Crescent Beach Inn at Cape Elizabeth, Me., by Justice of the Peace Herbert J. Nisbet of Portland, Me. bridegroom's father per

title: Futures Trading Cleared In Treasury Certificates
description: Futures trading in short.term. Treasury .bills on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange has been approved, as expetted, by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, and is to begin Jan. 6.

title: Hofstra Beaten By Post
description: HEMPSTEAD, Li., Nov. 27 With a host of tiny ponds dotting the AstroTurf at Hofstra Field today, a duck would have felt more at home than a turkey at the 18th HofstraC.W. Post football game, the 16th held on Thanksgiving Day.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Peking Purchasing U.S. Oil Equipment To Step Up Output
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27China has quietly turned to American companies for highly, sophisticated oil equipment and technology, marking what petroleum industry experts here believe is the beginning of an advanced phase in that country's oil development efforts.

title: BRITISH HOSPITALS HIT BY SLOWDOWN OF YOUNG DOCTORS
description: LONDON, Nov. 27  Thousands of .young British doctors began a slowdown today, forcing dozens of hospitals to refuse patients and some to start closing. Thousands of their senior colleagues have agreed to join the action on Monday.

title: Israeli Soldiers Enter Lebanon, Raze House and Take Prisoner
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27Israeli soldiers crossed into southern Lebanon early today, reportedly killed a villager and took another man with them when they withdrew.

title: DR. LEWIS K. DAHL, INTERNIST, IS DEAD
description: Authority on Hypertension Linked It to HighSalt Diet

title: The Rainy Season
description: The school football season could not get through final big day yesterday without another plague of rain, the  fifth time this season the weather had disrupted a big schoolboy day. The major postponement was in Nassau County, where the game between Farmingdale and Massapequa for the AAAA championship was put Off untiltoday at 1:30 P.M. In the city, New Utrecht's meethig with Lafayette in the socalled Lasagna Bowl, was also put back until today. In New Jeisey, the bulk of the postpcinements put games back until tomorrow. Among the major postponements were Wayne Valley at Passaic Valley, Becton Rutherford and Hackensack at Teaneck.

title: Nastase Triumphs In Helsinki Final
description: HELSINKI, Nov. 27 (AP)Ilie Nastase beat Wojtek Fibak of Poland, 75, 46, 62, today in the final of an international tennis tournament.

title: Vandals on Coast Demand $100,000 For Free Clinics
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 (AP)  City officials appear unimpressed by a terrorist threat to jam more parking meters unless the city spends $100,000 on free medical clinics.

title: Suspect Is Seized in Blaze That Killed a Fire Captain
description: A 25yearold inspector of burglar and fire alarms has been charged with setting the blaze in Queens last week that took the life of Capt. Raymond Koehler and injured 14 other fire fighters, one criticially.

title: Bridal Is Held on L. I. For Rhonda Rubinsky
description: Rhonda Elayne Rubinsky, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Rubinsky of Brooklyn and Lauderdale Lakes, Fla., was married yesterday evening to Frank Palatello Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Palatiello of Trumbull, Conn.

title: 17 Perish in India Cyclone
description: MADRAS, India, Nov. 27 (Reuters)At least 17 people were killed and more than 100,000 lost their homes when a cyclone hit this city in southern India during the night.

title: Juan Carlos Has Throne, Not Powers
description: MADRID, Nov. 27Much is being asked of Spain's New King, Juan Carlos I; in the way of political change, but neither in law, in practice nor in prestige will he have the powers that Generalissimo Francisco Franco wielded during his 36 years of rule.

title: Accused Hijacker of Jet to Cuba Lays Return to. Shift on Castro
description: MIAMI, Nov. 27 (AP)A man charged in the first airplane hijacking from the United States to Cuba says he returned because he no longer sympathized with the Castro Government.

title: Tax Reform and Investment Incentives
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.Get the rich! Eliminate their capital gains! Hang them by their municipal bonds!

title: Argentine Is Sought In a Fraud Involving Airline Ticket Sales
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27 (AP)A 15state alarm was issued for an Argentine national who allegedly swindled scores of Hispanic families in an airline ticket ruse, the police said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Florida Builder to Return Deposits

title: Visual Thinking,
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 27Rube Goldberg should have been there to see it. Yesterday afternoon, in the wellworn attic of Stanford University's old engineering building, 120 inventive, inspired students erected an equal number of inventive. preposterous contraptions to fulfill a requirement in a course called visual thinking.

title: Dance: An offbeat Boa
description: The Lar Lubovitch Company of Dance has always been an offbeat group and in addition to Mr. Lubovitch's own dances, it now has Sara Rudner as guest choreographer this week with an even more offbeat piece entitled Boa.

title: WILLIAM T. WINTERS JR.
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 27 William Thomas Winters Jr., a disk jockey for the last three years with radio station WCBSFM, in New York died today at Stamford Hospital after heart attack. He was 35 years old and lived at 657 Den Road.

title: JET DIVE AVERTS MIDAIR COLLISION
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27 (AP)The pilot of an American Airlines DC10 with 190 persons aboard. dropped his plane into an abrupt 2,000foot dive last night to narrowly miss a collision with another jetliner carrying 113 persons, according to a Federal official. Twentyfour persons were injured.

title: Market Closings
description: All stock markets and commodity exchanges in the United States were closed yesterday for Thanksgiving. They will be open today.

title: Adoptees and the TruthAdoptive Family's Role
description: An adoptive father, reading Betty Jean Lifton's book, Twice Born, found himself vowing that what happened to Mrs. Lifton would not happen to his child.

description: FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 28, 1975

title: Turner Pages East grange Upset of Barrinter
description: Clarence Turner scored two touchdows yesterday as East Orange surprised previously unbeaten Barringer, 200, in New Jetsey's oldest continuous. Thahksgiving Day

title: Temple Kicker Sets 4 Marks in Victory
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP)  Don Bitterlich, placekicker, broke four National Collegiate Athletic Association records today as Temple defeated archrival Villanova, 413, in their traditional seasonending college football game.

title: Court Curbs Osaka Flights
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 27 (Reuters)A court here today ruled that flights in and out of Osaka international airport be banned from 9 P.M. to 7 A.M. to protect local residents from noise. The ruling may be appealed.

title: State Lottery Staff, Including Director, Facing Dismissals
description: The 325 employees of the New York State Lottery, including the lottery's $30,000ayear director, Jerry Bruno, will receive dismissal notices from Governor Carey in the next few days because of a lack of funds to pay their salaries, sources close to the Governor said yesterday.

title: Suspect Found Incompetent To Stand Trial in Murder
description: WATERLOO, N.Y. Nov. 27 (AP)A 21yearold Seneca County man accused in the shooting deaths of his mother and three sisters has been found incompetent to stand trial.

title: RAINTHINS CROWD AT MACY'S PARADE
description: Underdog went down on his nose at 43d Street, and Snoopy did not even make it that far; John Dendomo was stuck with a load of soggy bagels, and the crowd was thinned by cold, unrelenting rain.
