description: 8:00 P.M. Country Music Hit Parade (2)

title: Britain Plans Curb On Certain Imports
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 (AP)Britain has begun informing key nations that it will soon begin temporary curbs on some um ports that threaten certain industries vital to the national economy, qualified Government sources reported today.

title: HEARST CASE FIGURE INPSYCHIATRICWARD
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 27 (UPI) Walter Scott, who said his brother, Jack, the sports activist, tried to sell, Patricia Hearst to the Federal Bureau of Investigation, was in a hospital psychiatric ward today after he reported to the police that someone was trying to kill him.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Highlands Makes It 10 in a Row
description: Northern Highlands, Bergen County's only unbeaten and untied team, made Old Tappan its 10th victim yesterday, 236.

title: Benjamin Baumritter Dead; Pioneer of Summer Camps
description: Benjamin Baumritter, a retired teacher and pioneer in the summercamp movement, died yesterday at his home at 33 East End Avenue. He was 83 years old.

title: DAVID ROCKEFELLER PREDICTS A CRISIS INSTATE AGENCIES
description: David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, predicted yesterday that New York State's efforts to refinance its tour troubled construction agencies would run out of time and that they, like New York City, would require Federal loans to avert default.

title: The Past And The Future
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The practical question in most American minds these days is probably the present condition of their private livestheir families, their economic and spiritual security, and beyond this, their anxieties and hopes for the future.

title: Connecticut Ponders the Dark Drama of Man Everyone Liked
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 26  A memorial, mass will be offered Saturday at St. Joseph's Cathedral for James N. Egan, classics scholar, quizshow star, raconteur and lawyer. Hundreds of friends from all over the state are expected to attend.

title: BLACKMUN SCORED ON CURB OF PRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) Sigma Delta Chi, the society of professional journalists, critized Associate Justice Harry A. Blackmun of the Supreme Court today for a decision permitting Nebraska courts to continue a news blackout on major developments in the Erwin Charles Simants murder case.

title: KILLING BY POLICE UNDER 2 INQUIRIES
description: On the night of Nov. 4, Francis McConnell, an offduty police officer with 21 years on the force, fired his pistol at two youths after a confrontation on Third Avenue near 57th Street.

title: Tito Signs Amnesty
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 27 (AP)  President Tito signed an amnesty for 535 prisoners, Tanyug, the Yugoslav press agency, reported today. It said 87 people had been released from prison and that the terms of the others had been reduced.

title: Dollar Up Abroad, On Move by Ford To Aid New York
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 27 (UPI)The dollar advanced today, reaching the highest level in seven weeks on some Markets. One banker Said President Ford's move to help New York City was the principal factor. Gold opened at $140.50 an ounce and closed unchanged in Zurich and up 25 cents in London.

title: Issue and Debate
description: In the next week or so, the Securities and Exchange Commission is expected to resolve a controversial issue that has been raging over Wall Street for more than a decadethe question of whether members of the New York Stock Exchange should have absolute freedom to shop the over  the  counter markets when they execute customers orders in listed stocks.

title: CoIonia Defeats Rahway, 28,0
description: Unbeaten Colonia, heading toward its second straight Central Jersey, Group 4, championship game, routed Rahway, 280, yesterday for its 10th victory.

title: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS SUES FOR STATE AID
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 27, (AP)  The Borough of Hasbrouck Heights has field suit against the state, contending $11,734 in anticipated state aid has not been forthcoming.

title: Connally Hints at 3d Party Bid For President to Serve Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) John B. Connally, the former Texas Governor and Secretary of the Treasury, says he might run for President next year on a third party ticket if he decides that neither the Republicans nor the Democrats are on a course that would tend to best serve the nation.

title: Mao's Wife Is Reported Under Attack
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27Chairman Mao Tsetung's wife, Chiang Ching, has come under strong criticism and may have suffered a decline in Communist Party standing because she disclosed confidential informa1 tion to an American scholar, recent travelers from China report.

title: Bills Win, 3214, From Cards, Rams Down Lions, Clinch Title
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 27The weather turned cold here today and so did the Cardinals. The St. Louis team lost to the Buffalo Bills, 3214, in a contest of 10 turnovers, seven in favor of the Bills. The temperature was 33 degrees at the start of the game, and it dropped 5 more as the afternoon proceeded, with the restless crowd of 41,879 amusing itself by throwing snowballs.

title: Iona Prep 140 Victor; Casali Stars
description: Iona Prep defeated its traditional Thanksgiving Day rival, New Rochelle, 140, yesterday in the 28th meeting between the two schools.

title: Sachem Beats Patchogue, 180
description: Brian Dehler, a sophoracire quarterbaCk, threw two touchdown passes yesterday and Jerry. Figgiani, a juniorvarsity player making  his first Start, rap for another

title: CONFLICTING DATA BY ROHR SCANNED
description: LOS ANGELES. Nov. 27The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating Rohr Industries Inc., a southern California aerospace company that entered the rapid transit business with disastrous results, for alleged misrepresentation I of future profitability.

title: U.S.FRANCE PACT ON RATES LAUDED
description: PARIS, Nov. 27It's an improvement, said a Zurich banker. In Frankfurt one money man spoke of the prospects of more sophisticated consultations as a result of it. A London foreign exchange dealer termed the constructive approach that it pointed to a great achievement.

title: Philippine Leader Ousts High Aide, Creates 5 Posts
description: MANILA, Nov. 27President Ferdinand E. Marcos dismissed today a top member of his martiallaw Gbvernment by abolishthe Cabinetlevel post of PresidentialExecutive Secretary.

title: Two on Liferaft Saved
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)A young man and a woman who spent four days adrift in a rubber liferaft off the southern California coast were rescued today by crewmen from a passing fishing boat. They were Susan Shepherd, 26 years old, and Alen Zovar, 32. Both were listed in good condition except for hunger and blistered hands from their efforts to paddle back to shore.

title: ALVAN MARKLE JR.
description: Alvan Markle Jr., former president of the Markle Banking and Trust Company, died Tuesday in Hazleton, (Pa.) Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived at Marfield Farm, SugarI loaf. Pa.

title: Felony Charges Are Dismissed Against 13 in Revolt at Attica
description: The Attica prosecution continued to wind down this week, as felony charges against 13 inmates who took part in the 1971 prison revolt were dismissed by a State Supreme Court justice in Buffalo.

title: Major Community Is Being Built In Rural County in South Jersey
description: SWEDESBORO, N.J.Despite high unemployment and high mortgage rates that have hobbled the housing industry in New Jersey, construction has begun near here on a major new community.

title: Five in Family Die in Blaze
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27 (UPI) A mother and four of her Children were killed early today in a twoalarm fire that destroyed a twostory frame home. The victims were identified as Mrs. Charlotte Hillebrecht, 26 years old, and her children, Edward, 10; William Jr., 8; Lisa, 6, and Michelle, 2. Mrs. Hillebrecht's husband, William, 30, and two other persons were taken to South Side Hospital. The cause of the fire was undetermined,

title: Coin Flip Will Decide Tied Mayoral Contest
description: CLYDE HILL, Wash. Nov. 27 (AP)What the 1,132 voters here couldn't decide In the last mayoral election will be settled Monday with the flip of a coin.

title: SOUTH AFRICA ROLE IN ANGOLA IS CITED
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 27 (AP)South Africa has troops in Angola and is providing advisers and logistical support to forces fighting the Marxistoriented Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola, authoritative Government sources reported today.

title: The Intimate Art of Arthur G. Dove
description: In the art of the Amertcan painter Arthur G. Dove (18801946), the pastoral and the abstract are united with an uncommon intensity. A love of nature is combined with a passion for pictorial form that distills and celebrates, without literally describing, nature's most compelling visual attributes. It is an art that occupies two worlds, which the artist aspires to make into a single, organic whole.

title: State to Decide Soon on Water Checks
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)Early next year, the state will have to decide whether it wants to assume responsibility for checking virtually all public drinkingwater supplies in New Jersey, or let the Federal Government do it.

title: Stage: Ice Age
description: There is something wonderfully moving about old age and survivalat least there is for the middleaged. he Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn has come up with a most absorbing and beautiful play at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. It is a Play called Ice Age by Tankred Dorst, and it has been translated from the original German by Peter Sander. ists, born in 1859, winning the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1920 and dying in 1952. Always of a rightwing persuasion, and possibly with something of an antiSemitic bias, in 1940 he wrote acclaiming the German invasion. In 1945, true to his last, he wrote a laudatory obituary of Hitler, knowing precisely what he was doing. A curmudgeon of a man thenstubborn, bitter but with great courage. His opinions were disgraceful, but the way he stuck to them has to inspire at least grudging admiration.

title: Advertising
description: Cipe Pineles, the woman who broke the sex barrier at the Art Directors Club of New York by becoming a member, has also turned out to be the first woman to be inducted into its Hall of Fame.

title: Hotels Near Philadelphia See No Bicentennial Boom
description: CHERRY HILL, Nov. 27 (UPI) Hotel managers in this area say that the vast numbers of visitors expected to stay here next year during Philadelphias celebration of the national Bicentennial may not be coming after all

title: Japan Mine Blast Kills 10
description: MIKASA, Japan, Nov. 27 (AP) A gas explosion deep in coal mine 10 miners and injured seven early today, authorities reported.

title: MIRV Up
description: The irony is that a new threat of crisis instability is coming on the horizon just as the ABM disappears, a threat that the ABM itself helped to bring into being.

title: YUGOSLAV FRAMEUP CHARGED IN JAILING
description: DENVER, Nov. 27 (UPI)A Colorado man sentenced to seven years in a Yugoslav prison for taking photographs of a sugar plant was set up, an aide to Representative James P. Johnson, Republican of Colorado, said today.

title: A Matter of Principle
description: The ghost of bankruptcy haunting New York City has vanished with an extraordinary agreement struck by the White House and city and state officials that each side feels is consistent with the orincioles it has News been enunciating Analysis for months. On the one hand, President Ford  by promising to grant direct loans each year to cover as much as $2.3 billion in the city's borrowing needs  stated Wednesday night that the city had assuaged all the major misgivings he had cited last month as reasons for his rejecting such assistance. On the other hand, city and state fiscal experts say that it was President Ford who reversed himself beearlier advocated a bankruptcy proceeding that has now been avoided.

title: Ballet and Opera Thrive in Novosibirsk
description: NOVOSIBIRSK, U.S.S.R.They danced their way through 4,900 pairs of ballet slippers at the Novosibirsk Opera and Ballet Theater last year.

title: GOING OUT Guied
description: ISRAEL LIGHTS As the vocal star at Sabra East, 232 East 43d Street (between Second and First Avenues), Ruthi Navon concludes a pleasant entertainment hour exotically flavored by a group of cheerful young people in song and dance, ranging from traditional to groovy. A native of Haifa, with expressive eyes and a voice like a bell, Miss Navon is equally at home rendering a Hasidic medley, a crackling Don't Let It Rain on My Parade, the plaintive ballad Feelings and a spirited

title: U.S. and Lebanon: Echoes of 1958
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 26As wouldbe mediators from the Vatican, France and the United Nations come and go, the American role in the Lebanese crisis has been obscured.

title: Portugal's President says He Will. Keep Democracy
description: LISBON, Nov. 27President Francisco da Costa Gomes said tonight that a coup of vast proportions had been quelled. At the same time, he pledged to defend a multiparty democracy.

title: JAMES B. FLYNN
description: James Bernara riynn, regional vice president here of Supervised Investors Services Inc., an investment service and mutualfund management organization, and former, vice president of the Crosby Corporation in Boston, mutualfund distributors, died Tuesday in Cherry Hill, N. J., apparently of a heart attack. He was 50 years old and lived in Spring Lake, N. J.

title: Radio
description: Rabbi A. Allen Block of Temple EmanuEl of Canarsie.

title: G.A.O. QUESTIONS WATERWAY POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) Federal investment in inland waterways has encouraged their use to the point that traffic clogs some arteries even as environmentalists oppose their expansion, according to a General Accounting Office renort.

title: Underground Blast Cuts Power to a Struck Paper
description: CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 27 (UPI) An underground explosion near The Delaware County Daily Times early today cut off electric power to the printing presses of the newspaper now in its fourth day of a strike by Local 10 of the Newspaper Guild of Greater Philadelphia.

title: Thanksgiving Brings Good Cheer to Many
description: Despite bad weather and the persistent recession, Americans from the White House to the Bowery yesterday honored the practice set by the Pilgrim fathers 354 years ago and marked Thanksgiving with at least measure of good cheer.

title: AIR CANADA HEAD QUITS IN SCANDAL
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 27The chairman of Air Canada, the Govermentowned airline, resigned today after a judicial inquiry into a number of scandals, including charges that the company had agreed to payments to a Lebanese Cabinet minister.

title: Captures Crown, 136
description: Undefeated North Shore defeated Cold Spring Harbor yesterday, 136, and captured the Nassau Conference VIIVIII Championship at Mineola.

title: Spanish Cardinal Cautions King
description: MADRID, Nov. 27King Juan Carlos I was greeted today with popular acclaim, but also with serious warnings, as he and Queen Sofia celebrated with prayer and pomp his accession to the throne of Spain.

title: Jayne Deerson Wed to Abraham Skoff
description: Jayne Ellen Deerson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Deerson of Flushing, Queens, was married last night to Abraham Skoff, son of Rabbi and Mrs. Benson Skoff of Richmond Flights, Mo. The bridegroom's father performed the ceremony at Temple Hillel in North Woodmere, L.I.

title: Portugal's President Says He Will Keep Democracy
description: LISBON, Nov. 27President Francisco da Costa Gomes said tonight that a coup of vast proportions had been quelled. At the same time, he pledged to defend a multiparty democracy.

title: Henry Poor's Passion: Building in the Spring
description: NEW CITY, N. Y.Building was his vice. Every spring he'd decide we needed another addition to the house, or a studio, or a workshop, and he'd start building again.

title: CELANDERS STONE BRITAIN'S EMBASSY
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Nov. 27 (AP)About 150 youths threw rocks, eggs and snowballs at the British Embassy today to protest the intervention of British warships in the fishing dispute with Iceland. They broke an embassy window but caused no injuries; the police said.

title: San Francisco Aide Preparing for Quake
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27Edward P. Joyce is preparing for the end of San Francisco.

title: KAHANE IS REPORTED ON A HUNGER STRIKE
description: The Jewish Defense League said last night that, its leader, Meir Kahane, had begun hunger strike at Allenwood Federal Penitentiary in Pennsylvania because authorities there were not providing him with kosher food.

title: Spanish Cardinal Cautions King
description: MADRID, Nov. 27King Juan Carlos I was greeted today with popular acclaim, but also with serious warnings, as he and Queen Sofia celebrated with prayer and pomp his accession to the throne of Spain.

title: U.S. Called Worst in West In Conservation of Energy
description: PARIS, Nov. 27 (UPI)The International Energy Agency said today that the United States was doing less than any other industrialized Western country to conserve enemy.

title: BRITISH HOSPITALS HIT BY SLOWDOWN OF YOUNG DOCTORS
description: LONDON, Nov. 27  Thousands of young British doctors began a slowdown today, forcing dozens of hospitals to refuse patients and some to start closing. Thousands of their senior colleagues have agreed to join the action on Monday.

title: Motor Vehicle Aide Named
description: Governor Carey yesterday announced the appointment of Stanley Gruss as deputy commissioner and counsel for the State Department of Motor Vehicles. Mr. Gruss. a 43yearold resident of Manhattan, is graduate of the New York University School of Commerce and the NeW York Law School. His last post was that of law secretary to State Supreme Court Justice Samuel R. Rosenberg and Civil Court Judge Louis Grossman.

title: Arabs in the Occupied Areas Put at a Million by Israelis
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27 (Reuters)The number of Arabs living in the territories occupied by Israel in the 1967 war has passed the million mark, with over 300,000 of them refugees, it was officially announced here.

title: Dilettantism in Everyday Life
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Having spent a considerable amount of time contemplating the job prospects for young people graduating from liberal arts colleges, I have lately been considering starting a campaign to revive the use of a perfectly good word that had been forgotten.

title: Warriors Top Bucks After Trailing by 31
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 27 (AP)Gus Williams scored 13 of his 22 points in a fourthquarter rally that gave the Golden State Warriors a 106105 National Basketball Association victory over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight.

title: Tear Gas Used in Protest Over Busing in Louisville
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 27 (UPI)Tear gas was used by the Jefferson County police last night to break up an antibusing demonstration by more than 300 protesters in suburban Oklona, where there have been several antibusing disorders.

title: The Zarodov Approach
description: WASHINGTON, Conn.Rumblings of change in Soviet ideological orientation that seem to foreshadow Soviet encouragement for more militant policies by Communist Parties abroad are associated with the name of Konstantin Zarodov, editor of the Sovietsponsored international Communist journal Problems of Peace and Socialism.

title: Tons of Marijuana Seized; 6 Are Arrested in Atabama
description: BAY MINETTE, Ala., Nov. 27 (UPI)More than 100 police officers, aided by special dog units, arrested six of 10 suspects accused of smuggling 15 tons of marijuana into Alabama today.

title: A Major New Community A building in South Jersey
description: SWEDESBORD  Despite high unemployment and high mortgage rates that have hobbled the housing industry in New Jersey, construction has begun near here on a major new community.

title: U.S. Team to Survey Needs of Sinai Observation Posts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27A government survey team will go to the Middle East next week to determine requirements for the stationing of 200 American civilian technicians in the Sinai Desert to operate an earlywarning electronic fence.

title: Matavvan Rally Sets Back Raritan, 146
description: Matawan was in the unaccustomed position of trailing early yesterday against Raritan, but rallied on. Raritan turnovers for a 146 victory that pushed its winning streak to 18 games.

title: Nigeria Backs Angola Group Supported by the Russians
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Nigeeria h asannounced its recognition of the government established in Luanda by the Sovietbacked popular movement for the Liberation of Angola.

title: $103,500 Stradivarius Cello
description: LONDON, Nov. I oteuters) A cello made by Antoniusi Stradivarius in 1721 was auctioned today at Sotheby's for 50,000 (about $103,500)the highest price ever paid for a cello. The instrument is named the Jansen after an amateur cellist and collector who once owned it. Sotheby's did not disclose the names of the buyers or the sellers.

title: Proposed Tax Ruling May Curb Free Rides for Federal Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Eighthundred highranking Government officials may lose their free, chauffeured limousine rides between home and office as a result of a recent proposal by the Internal Revenue Commissioner, Donald C. Alexander.

title: DirectSubsidy Rent Plan Due Here Soon
description: Wanted: 1,075 New York City families of low and moderate incomes who live in extremely substandard or grossly overcrowded housing, or who live in adequate housing but have an unusually severe rent hardship.

title: Gripping Night of Wagner by Mehta
description: It is one of the frustrations of American musical life that two of the world's finest Wagner conductors are musical directors of major orchestras in the country but cannot currently be heard in a New York opera house. One of the Wagnerians, of course, is Sir Georg Solti of the Chicago Symphony. The other, who led excerpts from Die Walkilre and Gotterdammerung at Carnegie. Hall on Wednesday night, is Zubin Mehta of the Los Angeles Philharmonic.

title: Mrs. Peron Ends Seclusion, Attends a Mass for Franco
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 27 (AP)  President Isabel Martinez de Pern, looking thin but smiling and waving at cheering crowds, today attended a mass for the late Generalissimo Francisco Franco of Spain. It was her first Public appearance in more than a month.

title: Dutch Insurer May Seek Midwestern United Stock
description: The Midwestern United Life Insurance Company of Fort ayne, Ind., announced yesterday that the Netherlands Insurance Company had expressed an interest in making a tender offer of $19 a share in cash for at least twothirds of the approximately 2.3 million outstanding common shores of Midwestern United. Midwestern United shares closed Wednesday 11 bid in the overthecounter market.

title: Change in Fuels Urged
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)New England Energy Policy Council urged today that 31 plants in eastern Massachusetts switch to fuel oil with a higher sulfur content. The council said the change could have more than $50 million annually while conserving clean fuel and reducing the cost of electricity, produced in some of the plantsIt added that the environment would be adequately protected.

title: Dr. Carol Margeson Wed in Boston
description: Dr. Carol Margeson, coordinator of children's services and Assistant professor of child psychiatry at the Tufts New England Medical Center in Boston, was married last evening to Dr. Robert Nelson Towndrow, a senior resident in psychiatry and teaching fellow at the Tufts Medical School.

title: Prices of Gasoline Are Down a Little
description: While President Ford and Congress have been trying to come to terms on energy policy, including a rollback in the price of gasoline, a decline in the cost of motor fuel of about 1 cent a gallon has already occurred in most sections of the country.

title: CANADA IMPROVING DEFENSE SYSTEM
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 27The Canadian Government today announced plans to improve the country's air force by buying 18 Lockheed longrwge patrol planes from the United States at a total cost of $950 million.

title: Deaths
description: Daths

title: Mathias Sticks His Neck Out
description: Senator Charles McC. Mathias Jr. of Maryland, ordinarily the mildest of men, is making belligerent political noises these days. First, he said he just might become a candidate himself for the Republican Presidential nomination; then he said he might help form a third party and run for President on its ticket. The funny thing is that he means it.

title: The Pop Life
description: Both Joni Mitchell and Neil Young, who have new albums out this week, have won large and fanatical followings by the very way they overcome and exploit their natural vocal limitations.

title: EXPERTS BAFFLED BY RISE IN CANCER
description: National cancer experts, baffled by the apparently sudden and dramatic rise in the cancer death rate reported earlier this month, are searching their records for some clue to the cause.

title: Medicaid Patients Grateful for Reprieve
description: PLAINFIELD, Nov. 27Medicaid patients here at the Hartwyck Nursing Home certainly had reason to be thankful yesterday, when their scheduled transfer to other homes was postponed.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: The Cafe des Artistes, which reopened recently at 1 West 67th Street, after closure for refurbishing, is a strong argument for having your face lifted if you had a good one to begin with. The walls are lined with rejuvenated middleaged murals by Howard Chandler Christy in which his famous magazinecover and poster girls, born early in this century, have taken off all their clothes to disport themselves in the open. Very pink within their very green copses, like peppermint mousse on beds of spinach, they were daring in their youth and are touchingly innocent in their reincarnation.

title: Report of Asset Freezing Is Erroneous in Gold Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) A court injunction freezing certain assets in a case involving goldrelated investments did not apply to two Massachusetts concerns, the American Institute Counsellors Inc. and the American Institute for Economic Research, according to a spokesman for the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: A Matter of Principle
description: The ghost of bankruptcy haunting New York City has vanished with an extraordinary agreement struck by the White House and city and state officials that each side feels is consistent with the

title: Law Impedes Corporations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Corporations, seeking to revive the conservative political power formerly enjoyed by the wealthy, are encountering serious legal problems in their efforts to build muscle for the 1976 elections.

title: Presidential Library
description: The Kennedy Library cliffhanger is overafter a dozen years of controversy that has left an unfortunate residue of bitterness for all involved. The frustration of the family of the late President John F. Kennedy and the disappointment of Harvard University at losing the facilities are understandable; and it is unfortunate that legitimate issues of concept and planningnever resolved on the Harvard siteled to such destructive delays.

title: Hail the Pirates Scores by a Nose
description: Defeated with favored Festive Mood by only a nose in yesterday's $57,600 Queens County Handicap at rainswept Aqueduct. Herberto Hinojosa surprisingly had only praise for the rider who had just beaten him.

title: Bulls Trade Thurmond To Cavaliers
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27 (AP) The Chicago Bulls today traded two reserves, Nate Thurmond, center, and Rowland Garrett, forward, to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Steve Patterson and Eric Fernsten, a rookie forward.

title: EightDay Festival Of Hanukkah Starts AtSundownTonight
description: Hanukkah, the Festival of Lights, begins at sundown today, and Jewish leaders drew a parallel yesterday between the guest of the wacient Macicabees for religious and political freedom and Israel's desire to remain secure and the right of Soviet Jews to emigrate.

title: Roxy Music, British Rock Band, Offers Exotic, Compelling Beat
description: Roxy Music, those masters of sophisticated modal hoochiecoochie music with the big beat, can probably claim to be the most interesting of the current crop of. British, progressiverock bands. And so while the group has not broken through to the broadest mass American market yet (which may or may not be good for the members immortal souls), it does have large avid pockets of cult followers, and its annual concert here Wednesday night at the Beacon neaten, not only sold out promptly but also attracted a larger than usual critical turn

title: RELIEF COMPARED TO WAGE INCOME
description: A state study estimates that the net income of an average worker in New York State, after taxes and working expenses, is often exceeded by welfare grants and related benefits to relief recipients, such as food stamps, Medicaid, day care, school lunches and subsidized housing.

title: Peking Pirchasing U.S. Oil Equipment To Step Up Output
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27China has quietly turned to American companies for highly sophisticated oil equipment and technology, marking what petroleum industry experts here believe is the beginning of an advanced phase in that country's oil development efforts.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Suit to Block Fare Rises Planned

title: Books of The Times
description: It is coincidental, but appropriate, that the engrossing book by E. J. Kahn Jr. on the extraordinary story of the American diplomats in wartime China should be circulated at this particular time. There's connection between the sorry China episode and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's recent refusal to expose a confidential report on Cyprus to the scrutiny of a Congressional committee investigating intelligence affairs. Mr. Kissinger offered to hand over a summary of the document's contents, without the reporting officer's name.

title: Second Berrigan Released
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) Daniel J. Berrigan, the antiwar activist, pleaded not guilty today to a charge arising from a demonstration at the White House and was released after posting bond. He and his brother Philip, who was released yesterday, were among several persons taken into custody when they dug holes in the White House lawn to protest America's arsenal of nuclear weapons.

title: A Team Mantle Couldn't Make
description: Dave Anderson wrote a column the other day picking an alltime allstar New York professional football team, mere child's play because he had to go back only 30odd years to the time of Mel Hein. If he had any class he would go back 75 years and choose an allstar New York baseball team for this century.

title: Comoro Islands Nationalize Property Held by France
description: MORONI, Comoro Islands, Nov. 27 (Reuters)  The Government of the Comoro Islands today ordered the nationalization of all French Government property in this Indian Ocean archipelago.

title: The Rambouillet Economic Parley: Mostly a Nonevent
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The economic summit meeting in France ended only a week ago Monday, but its impact was so amorphous that it already appears to he slipping quietly into the dim recesses that history reserves for minor footnotes about insubstantial events.

title: Jonathan Prude Marries Miss Eberiel
description: Rosemary Eberle and Jonathan de Mille Prude were married yesterday afternoon at Hampshire House by Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel of Temple EmanuEl.

title: Britain's Burmah Shell Oil Due for TakeOver in India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 27The Government announced today that Burmah Shell, the Britishowned oil company in India, would be taken over at the start of the new year.

title: Notes on People
description: A bitterness 30 years old welled up in Paris yesterday when the election of Felicien Marceau, playwright and novelist, to the 40member French Academy prompted the resignation from it of Pierre Enunanuel, a poet and editor. He said the choice of Mr. Marceau was incompatible with the national honor.

title: No Solace for Jets or Giants Sunday.
description: There are still four more games to be played at Shea Stadium before the season mercifully ends for the Giants and Jets. On Sunday the Pittsburgh Steelers, who are playing as well as any other team, meet the Jets, playing about as poorly as any other team, at Shea. If it is a cold day there will be many thousands of noshows as Channel 4 will televise the contest starting at 1 P.M. As for the Giants they, too, face a potential playoff team in the Cowboys at Dallas, Channel 2, 2 P.M. Those in Westchester, Connecticut and Eastern Long Island who point their antennas in a northerly direction can watch the big game, Minnesota at Washington, over Hartford's Channel 3 starting at 4 P.M. A preview of the games follows with wonlost records in parenthesis.

title: Market Place
description: Hewlett Packard, long glamour company and one whose stock is a big favorite of the institutions, reported lower earnings on Tuesdayand then surprised some observers in Wall Street by actually gaining ground in the stock market.

title: Islanders Lose to Montreal
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 27 In an uncharacteristic, lowscoring game tonight, the Montreal Canadiens finally defeated their nemesis, the New York Islanders, 21. The last time the National Hockey League's Flying Frenchmen came away from an Islander game with 2 points was on March 17, 1974. Since then, the Islanders had beaten them three times and tied them three times.

title: Abusive Treatment
description: The investigation and hearings conducted by the State Commission of Investigation leave no doubt that there is a great deal wrong with the way the Office of Drug Abuse Services is running the state's drug treatment program. Although the commission's study would have had a more authoritative ring had it included visits all twelve treatment centers instead of only the Tour most troubled installations, the findings are still alarming. Among other things, the commission found:

title: 3Dimensional Comic Strip of Downtown on View
description: You feel as if you could put your arms around the city and give it a big hug, a viewer commented as she gazed at the soaring twin towers of the World Trade Center.

title: Brezhnev Gets a Peace Prize
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (UPI)Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Cornmnist Party leader, today received the World Peace Council's Gold Medal of Peace, an award some Western diplomats saw as a move to counter the Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Dr. Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident physicist and human rights campaigner.

title: Texas Southern Victor
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Garland Montgomery hit Willie Taylor with a 9yard scoring pass with seven seconds to play last night to give Texas Southern an 1814 football victory over Prairie View.

title: Girl With Mended Heart Has a Real Thanksgiving
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Nov. 27Two groups of Rotarians bridged 7,500 miles to bring a happy Thanksgiving Day to 5yearold Grace Agwaru of Uganda.

title: About Real Estate
description: Good afternoon. This is Uncle Hud, and I am here to tell you how one of the Government's new housing programs works. I will concentrate today on the procedures of the Section 8 housing assistance program as it applies to existing housing not new or rehabilitated housing.

title: CHILEANS REPORT ARGENTINE ARRESTS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 27At least eight Chilean exiles who are members of the Socialist Party of the late President Salvador Allende Gossens have been arrested in Argentina this week, according to relatives of the exiles.

title: WILLIAM A. VIRTUE
description: William Alexander Virtue, a steamship broker here for more than 50 years, who retired as president of the company bearing his name two years ago, died Wednesday in Boulevard Hospital, Long Island City, City, Queens. He was 80 years old and lived at 4601 39th Avenue, Sunnyside, Queens.

title: Soviet, and Arafat Urge Revival of Geneva Talks
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (AP)While the Soviet Government played host today to Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader, the newspaper Pravda accused the United States and Israel of trying to avoid an overall settlement of the Middle East conflict by revival of the Geneva peace talks.

title: RAIN THINS CROWD AT MACY'S PARADE
description: Underdog went down on his nose at 43d Street, and Snoopy did not even make it that far; John Dendomo was stuck with a load of soggy bagels, and the crowd was thinned by cold, unrelenting rain.

title: 3 Civil Rights Leaders Bid Ford Reopen Dr. King Death Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) Three civil rights leaders urged President Ford today to reopen the investigation of the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: TV IS A GREEK HIT, AROUSING DEBATE
description: ATHENS, Nov. 22On a national holiday here last month a television documentary included pictures and songs about the Greek guerrillas who fought the Germans during World War IL Some of the partisans were Communists who later staged a bloody civil war against the Government, and conservatives were outraged.

title: States Slow in Ending Dual School Systems
description: Two years ago this month, Federal education officials fired off strongly worded letters to top government and education officials in 10 states ordering them to file detailed plans for eliminating their dual systems of higher educationone for blacks, the other for whitesthat had been sanctioned by both tradition and law.

title: Lawmen Collect Evidence in Hunt for Slayer of Patients in Michigan Hospital
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27The fear and suspicion that was in evidence last August and September at the Veteran's Administration Hospital in Ann Arbor has moderated.

title: About New York
description: When William Schuman stepped down as preSident of Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts in 1969, he did something few other expresidents are equipped to do. He went back to writing music.

title: Firefighters Declare 2 Blazes Fully Contained in the Los Angeles Area
description: GLENDALE, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Firefighters declared full containment this evening of a pair of blazes in the Los Angeles National Forest that had raged five days, destroyed 43 structures and blackened more than 100 square miles of brush and timber.

title: ELMER G. M'DOWELL
description: Elmer G. MacDowell, for 20 years a director, vice president and general sales manager of Alcan Aluminium Ltd., died Wednesday at Lady of Fatima Hospital in North Providence, R. I. He was 84 years old and lived at Hammond Farm in Saunderstown, R. I.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 28, 1975

title: Algerian President Assails Spain on Sahara Accord
description: ALGIERS, Algeria, Nov. 27 (AP)President Houari Boumediene has accused the Spanish Government of repudiating its obligations, violating international law and giving in to external pressures in agreeing to hand over Spanish Sahara to Morocco and Mauritania.

title: Vandalism of School by 2 Boys Stuns Upstate Town
description: PINE PLAINS, N.Y., Nov. 25It's not supposed to happen here to usthings like this happen in other schools in other places, said Janet Bergers, a junior at the Stissing Mountain JuniorSenior High School here.

title: A List of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: 7 SCIENCE SEMINARS FOR PUBLIC PLANNED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) The National Science Foundation has begun a campaign to improve public understanding of science as it relates to public policy.

title: Connecticut Ponders the Dark Drama of Man Everyone Liked
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 26 A memorial mass will be offered Saturday at St. Joseph's Cathedral for James N, Egan, classics scholar, quizshow star, raconteur and lawyer. Hundreds of friends from all over the state are expected to attend.

title: Time Bomb Found In a Jet Preparing To Fly to Bahamas
description: MIAMI, Nov. 27 (UPI)A maintenance man found a time bomb in a jetliner restroom at Miami International Airport just before the plane was to begin taking passengers aboard today. Explosives experts disarmed the bomb before it could explode.

title: Hamburg Opera Goes On
description: BONN, Nov. 27The Hamburg State Opera, most of its sets, costumes, and workshops destroyed by an $11.2 million warehouse fire on Oct. 31, has decided the show must go on and, with help from three other opera houses in West Germany and Switzerland, it hasn't missed a performance since.

title: Slain Girl Is Identified As a Missing Student
description: The body of a young woman found Wednesday in a marshy area of Wayne Township, N.J., was identified yesterday as a 19yearold student of Fairleigh Dickinson University who had been reported missing Nov. 12, according to the township police.

title: LUCY SIMON SINGS AT OTHER END CLUB
description: Lucy Simon, no relation to Paul but the sister of Carly, opened at the Other End on Wednesday with a program of songs concerned with life around her, like most singers of a folkmusic background.

title: SOVIET DENIES LINKS TO YUGOSLAV GROUP
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 ,(Reuters) The Soviet Union asserted today that proSoviet Cominformists arrested recently in Yugoslavia represented no one but themselves.

title: A Need to Modernize Overtaking Agriculture in Greece
description: LARISSA, GreeceStanding on a hillside here in Thessaly on a sunny autumn day, one can often see half a dozen tractors sowing wheat in the moist brown soil.

title: CALIFORNIA ENDS TALK WITH SAUDIS
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Nov. 27Negotiations on a. $25 million plan to send California state employees to Saudi Arabia to help on highway construction ended yesterday because that country refuses to admit anyone with Zionist beliefs.

title: Harpsichord Music Is Played by Bagger In Effortless Style
description: Louis Bagger, a Brandeis University faculty member, is getting to be a regular visitor here, and it is a good thing. On Wednesday night the harpsichordist gave his third New York recital in as many seasons. This time he appeared in Alice Tully Hall, and his program offered works by Rameau, all but one from the Nouvelle Suite; Wilhelm Friedemann Bach's Sonata in D (Blume No. 4); eight Scarlatti sonatas and Johann Sebastian Bach's Overture in the French Style.

title: DAVID ROCKEFELLER PREDICTS A CRISIS INSTATE AGENCIES
description: David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, predicted yesterday that New York State's efforts to refinance its tour troubled construction agencies would run out of time and that they, like New York City, would require Federal loans to avert default.

title: Harris Stars in 200 Triumph
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Nov. 27 (UPI)James Harris passed for three touchdowns today and the Los Angeles Rams clinched their third straight National Conference Western Division title with a 200 victory over the Detroit Lions. Harold Jackson caught two of the scoring passes in the National Football League game.

title: Stamford to Require Teachers to Show Mastery of English
description: The Board of Education in Stamford, Conn., has adopted a resolution requiring that applicants for teaching jobs there demonstrate mastery of written and spoken English as a prerequisite to being hired.

title: SOVIET SAID TO AIM FOR ANGOLA BASES
description: LONDON, Nov. 27The principal goal of the Soviet Union in Angola is to gain air and tea bases on the South Atlantic, rather than Angola's oil and mineral resources, according to military analysts here and at North Atlantic Treaty Organization headquarters in Brussels.

title: Choking the Press
description: The latest intrusion on the ability of the press report the facts in a criminal proceeding was undoubtedly designed to insure a fair trial for an accused defendant. But good intentions do not necessarily make good law.

title: More Letters on That $4,000 Dinner for Two
description: The publication in The New York Times last week of letters concerning Craig Claiborne's $4,000 dinner for twovirtually all of them assailing the articlehas set off another wave of letters, these discussing the readers criticisms. A sampling of these letters, some excerpted, appears below.

title: Fromme Jury Silent on Deliberations
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 27The jurors who convicted Lynette Alice Fromme of attempting to kill President Ford remained slient today about their deliberations, reportedly out of fear of reprisals from the socalled Manson family.

title: Green, on 67, Leads By Stroke in Japan
description: MIYAZAKI, Japan, Nov. 27 (UPI)Hubert Green shot a fiveunderpar 67 and took a onestroke lead today in the first round of the $200,000 Dunlop Phoenix golf tournament.

title: Holy Cross Beats Flushing, 220
description: HcilyCrosi whipped FlUihing, 220, yesterday behind a strong defentwhich yielded only 68 yardsand the running of Steve Sokolich. Three times: Flushing had the ball inside the Holy Cross 5yard line and could not score. The defense also produced the last touchdown as Mike Murphy, blOcked a punt and Pete Mackey, a scooped it up and lumbered 17 yards for the score.

title: Lady Godiva's City Shivers in Economic Chill
description: COVENTRY, EnglandEverything that seems to have gone wrong in the British economy seems to have gone wrong in Coventry, a medieval city that burst from the rubble of German bombing 25 years ago to become a boomtown.

title: YOUTH HELD SANE FOR REAGAN TRIAL
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28 (UPI)Two court  appointed psychiatrists have found Michael Lance Carvin, 20 years old, sane and competent to stand trial for charges stemming from his alleged brandishing of a toy gun at Ronald Reagan, a Republican Presidential candidate. But psychiatrist hired by the defense said the youth was so phobic he could not resist wrongdoing.

title: CHARLES A, DANA, FINANCIER, DIES Philanthropist, 94, Assisted Schools in East and South
description: Charles A. Dana, a leading industrialist and philanthropist, died Thursday at his home in Wilton, Conn. He was 94 years old.

title: Notes on People
description: Calling his action a protest to pinpoint the overwhelming domination of the United Nations by the Communist, Arab and thirdworld bloc, Gordon H. Scherer announced yesterday he had resigned as the American member of the executive board of UNESCO (the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization). He said the recent resolution calling Zionism a form of racism, added to the antiIsrael resolutions passed by UNESCO, destroyed his belief that we might be making some progress and made him fear eventual destrucof the United Nations.

title: Kahane Ends Prison Fast
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane, head of the Jewish Defense League, who had fasted Thanksgiving Day at the Federal penitentiary at Allenwood, Pa., ended his abstinence from food yesterday. The rabbi decided to eat again after officials at the penitentiary arranged for separate pots, pans and other utensils and a special kosher nook in the prison kitchen. Rabbi Kahane is in prison for violating a parole condition barring him from contact with dangerous weapons.

title: U.S. DENIES REPORT OF PANAMA PROTEST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The State Department denied a report today from Panama alleging that Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera had handed American negotiators a note protesting against the United States position on a new Panama Canal treaty.

title: Equity Financing Begins to Attract Companies Again
description: Despite the stock market's lackluster performance since July and continued economic uncertainty, a lot of industrial corporations, all but barred from selling new stock during the dog days of 1974, are returning to equity financing.

title: CRIMINOLOGIST ASKS HELP FOR ELDERLY
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 28 (UPI) A criminologist here believes that the aftereffects of crimes committed against elderly persons might affect the elderly more than the crimes themselves, and should be handled as special cases.

title: BiggerCar Importers Confident
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28Importers of mediumpriced and luxury cars appear undisturbed by American efforts to challenge foreign penetration of the United States market.

title: Korea's Pittsburgh: Nettles Amid Chimneys
description: ULSAN, South Korea This city, once a farming and fishing center with 60,000 people, is becoming the Pittsburgh of South Korea, the beacon for the nation's economic aspirations.

title: TaxiFleet Owners Seek Higher Fare, Citing Rising Costs
description: The Metropolitan Taxi Cab Board of Trade, which represents fleet medallion owners, has applied to the Taxi and Limousine Commission for fare increase without specifying the amount.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 29, 1975

title: Screen: Endless Devil's Cleavage
description: People like us are the tripods that keep up the ceilings of motels, says Ginger Menninger, one of several heroines who lurch from one shattered dream to another in The Devil's Cleavage, George Kuchar's metaphorstuffed, sometimes solemnly funny parody of terrible movies. The film was presented by the Film Forum yesterday at the Vandam Theater, Greenwich Village, where it will be shown this weekend and next.

title: 15thCentury Donatello Denied Exit by Britain
description: A small bronze relief by Donatello, rediscovered after 200 years and described as the most important Italian 15thcentury sculpture still in private hands, has been prevented from leaving England in the hands of a New York dealer.

title: A Colorful Resurgence for the Art of Stained Glass
description: If all you can think of when someone says, stained glass, is a church window, you're in the wrong pew.

title: House to Vote on Nuclear Insurance Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The House of Representatives is scheduled to vote next week on the extension of a controversial insurance program that the nuclear power industry argues is essential to its growth but that critics of the industry contend exposes the public to unnecessary dangers. The expected vote on a 10year extension of the PriceAnderson Nuclear Indemnity Act has become a central focus in the increasingly bitter battle in Congress between those who believe that the United States must continue building atomic reactors and those who think that nuclear power exposes the public to serious and unnecessary risks.

title: Kennedy and Brown Ahead Of Ford in California Poll
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 28 (AP)For the first time since becoming President, Gerald R. Ford trails two possible Democratic Presidential contenders, Sen. Edward M. Kennedy and Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California, a statewide public opinion poll shows.

title: Ken Kushner Is Dead at 78; ExBowling Industry Leader
description: Ken Kushner, a leader in the bowling industry for 30 years, died Wednesday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, L.I. He was 78 years old and lived in Roslyn Heights, L.I.

title: Nets Down Squires, 116 to 97
description: UNIONDALE, L.I Nov. 28  Bill Musselman the new coach of the Virginia Squires, found a way to slow down the fast break of the New York Nets last night, but there was no way to stop the rest of the offense and the Nnic wnn aninn away. 11697.

title: Market Place
description: Government notes and bonds, once held almost exclusively by professionals in $100,000 blocks, are now available to small investors in $1,000 to $10,000 denominations.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A fire believed to have been set by an arsonist routed more than 100 people from a new Ramada Inn that opened on Nov. 3 in Runnemede. Two firemen and two hotel employees were overcome by smoke, but there were no other injuries.

title: Cyprus: Time to Act
description: Whatever they say for political purposes at home, the leaders of Turkey and the Turkish Cypriot community now know that their intransigence on Cyprus has isolated them from most of the world. They also know that, under provisions of the act easing the American arms embargo against Turkey, President Ford is obligated early next month to report to Congress on the progress negotiations looking toward a Cyprus settlement.

title: Nassau Prosecutor Drops Case of Respirator Death
description: MINEOLA, LI., Nov. 28The case of the death of Maryjane Dahl, a 16yearold terminally ill patient who died in a hospital after a lifesustaining respirator had been disconnected, was closed today when the Nassau County District Attorney decided that the evidence does not justify a presentment to erand jury.

title: Hoboken's Housing Innovator Leaves Post as Model Cities Program Chief
description: HOBOKEN, Nov. 28  For years this waterfront city has been to New Jersey what Cucamonga is to California, always good for a laugh. But with the inflation in housing costs and the desire of, many young couples to be part of the urban scene rather, than live in the suburbs, Hoboken has evoked new interest. And one of the reasons for the Hoboken renaissance is some fancy footwork by a man named Michael Coleman.

title: People in Sports
description: Babe Parilli, a former reserve quarterback behind Joe Namath, is back with the Jets as cinematic scout. In what is considered to be an interim job, Parilli, will study films of the Jets and other players in the National Football League, primarily to help the club decide which players to protect and which players to trade for.

title: Don Calvin Choate Weds Elsa R. Adair
description: The La Grange (Tenn.), Methodist Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Elsa Roberts Adair of New York, daughter of Mrs. D. Mitchell Cox of Sherman, Conn., and Forrest Adair 3d of Atlanta, to Don Calvin Choate of Memphis. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Charles Brady.

title: State Tells Nursing Home Not to Shut
description: Owners of the Village Nursing Home notified the State Health Department on Thanksgiving Eve that they would close the home Wednesday night, stranding 267 patients and leaving the lower West Side without a single nursing home.

title: 318 Prisoners Are Transferred From RiotDamaged Rikers Jail
description: A total of 318 inmates were transferred yesterday from the House of Detention for Men on Bikers Island, the scene of a I7hour riot earlier this week.

title: CELANESE UNIT LISTS 3 PRICE INCREASES
description: The Celanese Chemical Company, a subsidiary of the Celanese Corporation, said yesterday that it planned to raise prices on methanol, formalin and paraformaldehyde, effective Jan. 1. The methanol price will go up 2 cents to 40 cents a gallon, f o.b., Clear Lake, Tex. Formalin will be raised by 0.35 cents a pound to 4.6 cents a pound delivered and paraformaldehyde flake by 1 cents a pound to 16 cents a pound delivered.

title: Invasion of Junkies Reported in Clinton
description: The problem is as pervasive as the early winter chill in the musty corridors of 422 West 48th Street, in the old Hell's Kitchen area west of Times Square.

title: Psychologist Sets Up a Job Club And Helps Members Find Work
description: ANNA, Ill., Nov. 28 (AP)Ninety percent of the unemployed persons who joined job club here were working within two months, according to a social researcher who organized the club and applied behavior  modification techniques to the task of job hunting.

title: Juliet Jallabert Bride Of Charles Robert Six
description: Juliet Greenfield Jallabert of Paris, who is Bache & Company's foreign syndicate coordinator for France, was married yesterday afternoon to Charles Robert Six, director, general of Boussac of France. The ceremony was performed in the Town Hall in Neuilly, France, by Deputy Mayor Henri Suquet.

title: The Program
description: THE DEVIL'S CLEAVAGE, directed and written by George Kuchar; director of photograpny, George Kucher, with additional photography by Larry Huston and Mike Kucher. Running time: 115 minutes. At the Film Forum, Vandam Theater, 15 Vandam Street. This film has not been rated.

title: October Dip Shows Slower Recovery
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy apparently declined in October for the second consecutive month, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Judge Robert E. Tehan, 70, Of U.S. Court in Wisconsin
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 28 (UPI) Robert E. Tehan, the senior Federal judge in Wisconsin's Eastern District and a member of the Federal judiciary for 26 years, died yesterday. He was 70 years old.

title: Barbara Frackman Wed
description: Barbara K. Frackman, a widow, and Armand J. Kleinberg, both of New York, were married here at noon yesterday by Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel in his study at Temple EmanuEl. The bride is with the Merchandising Group as a men's wear consultant for du Pont de Nemours & Company. Her husband, whose previous marriage ended in divorce, is president of Kleinberg & Son, importer of precious stones.

title: COURT IN JERSEY TO LET FARES RISE Removes a Temporary Ban. That Deferred Increases Slated for Monday
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28A move to postpone proposed rail and bus fare increases scheduled to go into effect Monday for 700,000 New Jersey commuters succeeded briefly today in the state appellate court, but was oiverturned a few hours later by a State Supreme Court justice.

title: 76 ers Defeat Sonics
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28 (UPI)The Philadelphia 76ers made up 12 points of a 16point deficit in the last 5 minutes of the firs; half, then took charge after halftime in scoring a 11394 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics in a National BasketballAssociation game tonight.

title: Man, 25, Killed in Crash
description: COLUMBUS, N.J., Nov. 28 (AP)A 25yearold man was killed when his car collided with another last night and ran off Route 206 here, the police said, The victim was identified as Danny D. Harris of this Burlington County community.

title: Dance Spell Is 61, but Jockey Is Confident
description: Jean Cruguet, the French jockey, yesterday hurriedly thumbed through the entries for this afternoon's 62d running of the Remsen at Aqueduct and when he had finished he was elated. He said he felt his scheduled mount, Dance Spell, should win the $75,000 added 1mile event, the richest of the remaining stakes on New York's 1975 program.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times on Thursday incorrectly said that a vote by the Hicksville, L.I., School Board to fine a teacher, Jerome McCarthy, S1,000 for allegedly breaking the jaw of a student, was unanimous. The vote to impose the fine was 4 to 3.

title: 4 Pounds of Heroin Seized
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 28 (UPI)A 44pound cache of Mexican brown heroin, said to be worth $24 million, was confiscated by Federal agents, in Echo Park, Calif., who were looking for a fugitive who had been arrestedthen accidently releasedfollowing an earlier seizure of 44 pounds of the narcotic. The fugitive was not found but another man was taken into custody.

title: 2 Gunmen Take $5,000 In Bank Holdup at Ventnor
description: VENTNOR, Nov. 28 (UPI)Two gunmen held up a bank here today and made off with $5,000 after herding clerks and customers into a bathroom, the police reported.

title: Keeping the Past at Arm's Length, but Seeing Its Worth
description: We are all captives of our past, personal and collective. Just as we often seem limited and defined by the expectations others have had of us, so society as a whole seems limited and defined by the expectations for it which one generation foists on to another.

title: Convict Tied to Alleged Plot On Dr. King Reported Freed
description: TORONTO, Nov. 28 (UPI)A Toronto man who has been named as a possible witness in an alleged assassination plot against the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was released from an Ontario prison two months ago, according to Correction Department officials.

title: Army vs. Navy: A Dimming of Splendor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28 Philadelphia police and bus drivers call it Black Friday .that day each year between Thanksgiving Day and the ArmyNavy game. It is the busiest shopping and traffic day of tEe year in the Bicentennial City as the Christmas list is checked off and the Eastern college football season nears conclusion.

title: BEIRUT IS WARNED AGAINST PARTITION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28A. Saudi Arabian warning against any partition of Lebanon between Moslems and Christians was published here today as another truce was proclaimed in the country's civil strife.

title: GAMBLING BEATEN BY UPSTATE VOTE Final Results on Amendment Shows It Lost on Nov. 4 by Narrow Margin
description: Contrary to earlier indications that it won, the state:s voters turned down by a narrow margin an amendment that would have legalized gambling for charitable purposes, the New Election Service reported yesterday in an update on the results of the Nov. 4 elections in New York.

title: Business Briefs
description: COVENTRY, England, Nov. 28 (AP)The Chrysler plant at Ryton, Coventryin the heart of Britain's carmaking Midlands closed today and left the 3,500 employees wondering if it would ever open again.

title: Army 56, Lehigh 29
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 28 (AP)Tom Valerio and Gary Winton scored 15 pointv apiece tonight as Army opened its first season under Coach Mike Krzyzweski with a 5629 decision over Lehigh.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Friday.

title: EDITORS ASSAIL BAN IN NEBRASKA CASE
description: RENO, Nov. 28 (AP)A United States Supreme Court Justice's limitation on news reporting in a Nebraska case is an unconstitutional prior restraint amounting to censorship, the Associated Press Managing Editors Association said today.

title: Early Anferican Ship to Get 190YearOld Tree as Mast
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 28 (UPI) A huge Douglas fir tree, said to be 12 years older than the early American fighting ship the U.S.S. Constellation, was floated across Baltimore Harbor today for use as the new mainmast of the Constellation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: City Crisis: The Undertaxed Homeowner

title: Flames Triumph Over Leafs, 6 to 3
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28 (UPI) Larry Romanchych scored two goals and paced the Atlanta Flames to a 63 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight in the National Hockey League.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: OTB payoffs subject Ito 5% State tax.

title: Conservationists Pressing Their Fight With Hunters
description: TRENTON, Nov. 26A Pro, longed battle by conservationists to end control by hunters of the public use of land will be decided this winter with arguments before the New Jersey Supreme Court.

title: Food Stamp Rolls Stable
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The number of persons receiving food stamps in October totaled 18.5 million, the same as in September according to preliminary statistics released by the Agriculture Department today. The cost to the Government last month was $429.1 millilln.

title: Bridge:
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28One of the country's best young partnerships scored a slender victory in the early hours of this morning in the blue ribbon pair championship the American Contract Bridge League.

title: Dance: Joyful Coppelia
description: George Balanchine's staging of Copplia is conventional and charming. Whether it is conventional because it is charming or charming because it is conventional, hardly matters. The ballet works. It is an almost unexpected guest in the New York City Ballet repertory, even though that is a particular repertory that has learned to expect the unexpected.

title: People and Business
description: Cut in Deficit Spending Urged

title: PORTUGAL PURGING PRESS, POLITICIANS AND THE MILITARY
description: LISBON, Nov. 28Portugal's military leaders have started what appears to be a wideranging purge of the press, of extreme leftwing politicians and of the armed forces after this week's abortive leftist uprising.

title: 30 Santas, Briefed on Their Duties, Off and Jingling
description: Yes, Virginia, there is Hyman Rosenblatt.

title: Reversal Follows 2 Weeks
description: The nation's money supply, a key factor in national economic policy, contracted fairly sharply in the latest week following two weeks of explosive growth, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: The Restless Center
description: Abandoning his tentative plan to enter some Presidential primaries next year in order to demonstrate the voting strength of progressive Republicans, Senator Charles Mathias of Maryland has now decided to explore the possibility of running as an independent third force candidate. This surprise venture by a respected G.O.P liberal places the turmoil inside the Republican party in a new perspective.

title: City Lists Halted Construction Work
description: The Beame administration made public yesterday the full list of 46 city construction projects being suspended because of the fiscal crisis.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MANILA, Nov. 28 (AP)Benjamin Corona of Mexico averaged more than 205 pins today in taking the lead the quarterfinals of the Bowling World Cup.

title: Not Those Fearful Teeth Again
description: New Yorkers enjoy the highest taxes the United States, and we were enjoying them thoroughly last Wednesday when the great news was shouted through the East Side, the West Side and all around the town.

title: TRYING IT OUT FOR SIZE: Bamhi Charkow of Long Branch sitting in a customized threewheeled bike with a Volkswagen engine at the motorcycle show in Asbury
London Killing Stirs DeathPenalty Cry
description: LONDON, Nov, 28The murder last night of an outspoken British conservative, who was campaigning to raise $100,000 for aid in capturing Irish bombers, marked a new dimension of the terrorism that has shaken this city since August.

title: PROGRESS LACKING IN LAUNDRY TALKS
description: James J. McFadden, a special mediator in the labor dispute involving 200 laundries here, reported no progress toward a settlement yesterday, but he scheduled another meeting for today in a renewed effort to bring about a contract agreement that would avert a strike threatened for midnight tomorrow.

title: The Program
description: THE DEVIL'S CLEAVAGE, directed and written by George Kuchar director of photography, George ?? with additional photography by Larry Huston and Mike Kuchar. Running time: 115 mlnutes. At the Film Forum, Vandam Theater, 15 Vandam Street. This film has not been rated.

title: State Opera Raising Its Curtain
description: The New Jersey State Opera can be different by satisfying its own needs, by bringing opera to thousands of people in the New Jersey area, and by creating a pride of possession

title: Nassau Prosecutor Drops Case of Respirator Death
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 28The case of the death of Maryjane Dahl, a 16yearold terminally ill patient who died in a hospital after a lifesustaining respirator had been disconnected, was closed today when the Nassau County District Attorney decided that the evidence does not justify a presentment to grand jury.

title: Fordham Five Sends Navy to 6355 Loss
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 28 Kevin Collins, Kevin Fallon and Rich Dunphy combined for 36 points tonight to lead Fordham to a 6355 victory over Navy in Halsey Fieldhouse.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The unemployment rate tor Dotn NeW Y OrK Lay ana the state dipped slightly in October, the State Labor Department reported yesterday. Total unemployment in the city last month was 368,000, a decrease of 9,800 from the September total. The jobless rate was 11.7 percent, down from September, when the rate was 12. The number out work in the state last month was 769,800, a drop of 9,000 from the September total. The state's unemployment rate for October was 10.1 percent; the September rate was 10.2.

title: FARMERS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Prices farmers get for raw agricultural products dropped 4 percent from Oct. 15 to Nov. 15, the second straight monthly decline, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: CITIBANK OFFERING EARLYRETIRE PLAN
description: A new program designed to encourage employees of the First National City Bank to take early retirement is generating strong response, Lawrence M. Small, senior vice president in charge of personnel, said yesterday.

title: Soviet Criticism of Tito's Foes Welcomed Warmly in Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 28Moscow appears to have taken a major step toward improving strained relations with Yugoslavia by publicly reflouncing Soviet support for proSoviet Communists in Yugoslavia.

title: Iceland Warns NATO
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Nov. 28 (UPI)Iceland threatened today to withdraw from NATO and to close an Americanmanned post monitoring Soviet sea and air activity unless Britain recalled its invasion of warships from inside Iceland's newly proclaimed 200mile fishing limits.

title: RURAL ROCK PLAYED ALLMAN BROTHERS
description: The Allman Brothers Band, appears to maintain its leader ship as a band'playing a specific kind of rock n roll, and not only because it could complete1 ly fill Madison Square Garden on Thursday. It is a group that basically made the first major breakthrough for a Southern boogie band some years ago, and it is not the Allmans fault that this market has lately beovercrowded.

title: Airlines Lose Bid to Raise Fares on 2 Caribbean Runs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board rejected today an 8 percent increase in airline fares between the United States mainland and Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

title: PRETORIA CONFIRMS ANGOLA INCURSION
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nova 28 (Reuters)Defense, Minister Pieter W. Botha confirmed tonight that South Africa had troops inside Angola, but denied they were supporting groups opposed to the Sovietbacked Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola.

title: New Trial Ordered in Editor's Abduction
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28A threejudge Federal panel ruled today that what it called prejudicial errors by the prosecution and pretrial publicity had prevented a fair trial for the abductor of Reg Murphy, a newspaper editor.

title: The President's Choice
description: Twentyeight years ago as a young Chicagoan with a sheaf of references, an unprepossessing manner and a new law degree, John Paul Stevens went to Washington to begin two years of service as law clerk to Justice Wiley Rutledge of the United States Supreme Court. Yesterday, the former clerk was selected by President Ford to return to the Court, this time as an Associate Justice and the successor to William O. Douglas.

title: World Church Talks Weigh Wornen's Role
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 28A woman translator from Bulgaria, here for the fifth assembly of the World Council of Churches, politely refused dinner invitation from a group of women'srights activists the other day. She said with pride that she preferred to dine with the allmale Bulgarian delegation.

title: Garbage Strike Ends
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 28 (AP)The SO sanitation collectors in this industrial city of some 156,000 ended their strike late today and agreed to return to work tomorrow morning.

title: Antiques: Porcelain Sale
description: When the late Charles Edward Dunlap began acquiring Chelsea figurines, Meissen teapots, Worcester vases, Chantilly tureens and the cockatoos, partridges and parrots of other 18thcentury ceramics factories, such fragile appointments were appropriate in his homes and to his lifestyle.

title: Chile and the Coldest War
description: ANTOFAGASTA, ChileOn a visit to Santiago four years ago French Ambassador Rena. St. Leger told me that Chile lay at the heart of the SinoSoviet argument. Although St. Leger had been General de Gaulle's diplomatic counselor and boasted a distinguished reputation, at the time I thought he was nuts. Now I am not so sure.

title: 2 Held in Darien Slayings
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. 28 (AP) Two Stamford men were arraigned on firstdegree murder and assault charges and held without bail today in the shooting deaths of two men outside the Sugar Shack bar heredaily Thanksgiving Day. They were Thomas E. Hallock, 22 yedrs old, and John M. Cherkowsky, 30. The victims were identified as Rudolph Graham, 27, and Andrew Vass, 23, both of Siluth Norwalk

title: U.S. Soviet Space Search for Life Pressed
description: Quietly and with little expectation of early success, American and Soviet radio astronomers are intensifying a systematic scanning of the heavens for any beacons of possible civilizations far out in space.

title: Japanese Gird for I.B.M. Computer Fray
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28Japanese computer manufacturers, having broken the dominant hold of the International Business Machines Corporation on their market, are gearing up for a renewed competitive threat from I.B.M. expected Dec. 1 when the protective barriers that shielded them from competition begin to fall.

title: The Battered Wives of England: A Place to Heal Their Wounds
description: LONDON, Nov. 28  The policeman's wife appeared at the door with six broken ribs, burns on her thighs from boiling water, and bruises all over her face. A 19yearold with a ruptured gallbladder arrived, having been kicked and slashed. A woman who was raped at knifepoint by her husband in front of their three sons collapsed on the doorstep.

title: Admirable Appointment
description: President Ford was quite right in saying that the nomination of a Supreme Court Justice is one of the most important decisions a President has to make. In nominating Judge John Paul Stevens of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, the President met the high standards of that responsibility.

title: Texas Beaten
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Nov. 28 (AP)Texas A.&M.'s brawling defense, led by a linebacker, Ed Simonini, set up an important fourthquarter touchdown, held off Texas wishbone offense today and led the secondranked Aggies to a 2010 victory in the annual showdown with the Longhorns.

title: Store Blast Laid to Bomb
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 28 (UPI)An explosion blew a two foot hole in the rear wall of a Safeway store last night, and the police said they had no doubts the blast was caused by a bomb. No injuries were reported and the police said that, so far, no one had taken responsibility for the explosion.

title: F.D.A. Recalls Pimentos
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration disclosed today the recall of 17,000 cases of Spanish pimentos, the latest in a series of such recalls involving suspect canning processes. The F.D.A. said that the pimentos were being called back because of a failure to control acidity in the canning process, which may pose a potential for bacterial outgrowth. The latest recall involves large cans of the type intended for restaurant use.

title: REFORM IS SOUGHT FOR U.S. SHIPPING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Ford Administration, having tackled regulatory reform of railroads, trucks and airlines, now has a task force looking for ways to overhaul operation of the nation's merchant marine.

title: New Trial Ordered in Editor's Abduction,
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28A threejudge Federal panel ruled today that what it called prejudicial errors by the prosecution and pretrial publicity had prevented a fair trial for the abductor of Reg Murphy, a newspaper editor.

title: Justine Ward, Who Developed MusicTeaching Method, Dies
description: Justine Bayard Cutting Ward, creator of the Ward method of music, a simplified teaching method used internationally in parochial schools, died Thursday at her home in Washington. She was 96 years old.

title: 2 Camden Brothers Held In Fatal Beating of a Man
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 28 (AP)Two brothers were, arrested today on a charge of beating a Camden man to death, the police said.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: 11 Inches of Rain Hits Honolulu in Four Days
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 28 (UPI) Four days of torrential rain, strong winds and high surf tapered off yesterday, leaving one surfer dead and streets badly flooded. The National Weather Service reported that more than 11.2 inches of rain fell at the Honolulu International Airport from Sunday night through last night.

title: Criticism by Algcrian President On Sahara Is Censored in Spain
description: MADRID, Nov. 28The I angry attack by President Houari Boumediene of Algeria on what he termed Spain's pure and simple capitulation in the Sahara was censored by the Government today from the pages of a leading Spanish weekly.

title: ExChairman Sues Labor Agency Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Robert D. Moran was reasonably happy and secure for the first several years of being chairman of the threemember Occupational Health and Safety Review Commission after it came into existence in April 1971. Mr. Moran, a lawyer with experience in labor matters both in the private sector and with the Government, had sixyear Presidential appointment and a salary in the high$30,000 range with the commission, which serves as the court system for the Labor Department's Occupational Health and Safety Administration.

title: Cuban Ambassador's Car Blown Up in Mexico City
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 28 (UPI) :A dynamite bomb ripped apart the car of the Cuban Ambassador, Fernando Lopez Muino today as his chauffeur Stepped on the starter.

title: From Brooklyn to Coco Bowl on a Shoestring
description: Two months ago, the players on the financially beleagured Brooklyn College football team would have looked away in embarrassment if anyone had suggested that they would end their season with a bowl game in Puerto Rico. Tonight, at the Coco Bowl in San Juan, there will be nothing but satisfied grins.

title: Economist Finds Widening In BlackWhite lncome Gap
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28Despite temporary gains made by blacks toward economic parity with whites in the 1966's, recent trends indicate that the gap is once again widening, and that it may be at least 75 years before blacks catch up, according to one economist.

title: Art: Radiant Prints by Richard Smith
description: For the best part of 20 years Richard Smith has been one of the most inventive colorists around. But what to do with that gift? How best to support it, structure it and keep it from getting out of hand? Difficult questions, those. But he solved them to general admiration in a retrospective at the Jewish Museum, and at the British pavilion in Venice, when the Venice Biennale was still the most important exhibition of its kind, and in a second retrospective last summer at the Tate Gallery in London.

title: Adelphi Upset, 10, In N.C.A.A. Soccer
description: SEATTLE; Nov. 28 (AP)Daudi Abe scored from about 10 yards out today as Seattle Pacific upset the defending champion Adelphi, 10. in the semifinals of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division II soccer tournament.

title: U.S. Criticizes South Africa In the U.N. on Racial Policies
