description: Christmas is both the high and low point of the year, and most of the fare published for children plays up to the season's glitter and glad hearts. What, I wondered, would The Great Christmas Kidnaping Caper have to offer? A little suspense or variety perhaps?

title: Schedule of Hearings By Council Committees
description: The following public hearings will be held this week by City Council committees:

title: A Tougher U.S. Stance On Fire Island Beach
description: Eleven years after Fire Island was designated a National Seashore, the Federal Government is taking steps to tighten and enforce its controversial stewardship over the island's fragile barrier beach. In an increase in activity that indicates a major rethinking of attitudes toward Fire Island, the National Parks Service and its parent Department of the Interior have of late:

title: Pressure Is On King Juan Carlos To Liberalize
description: King Juan Carlos I has begun to remake Spain as a more open and democratic society but how open and democratic is in question. So far his efforts have not been enough to obviate demands for swift and great change.

title: Oil Threat From Hulk Off Fire I. Is Studied
description: The United States Coast Guard, in cooperation with a study icy the Polytechnic Institute of New York on oilpollution threats, will mon begin dropping surfacedrifter cards over the spot where a torpedoed World War II tanker lies at a depth of 185 feet, 80 miles southeast of the eastern tip of Fire Island.

title: Great Neck North Wins Crown, to
description: Great Neck North High School edged Levittown Memorial yesterday, and Port Washington won an even closer game against West Hempstead, wrapping up the Nassau County football playoffs.

title: Miss Blakely, W. R. Bennett Have Nuptials
description: St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Greenwich, Conn., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Christine Blakely, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Talbot Blakely, to William Russell Bennett, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Edgar Bennett. Both families live in Greenwich.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: Pat Fitzsimons is a freespirited young touring professional with wrinkled red hair and wrinkled slacks, but suddently without wrinkles in his game.

title: Brocknort Gains Final
description: BROCKPORT, N. Y., Nov. 29 (AP) Lyn Briggs scored in overtime today, giving Brockport State a 21 victory over Johns Hopkins in the semifinals of the National Collegiate Division III soccer championship. Brockport faces Babson tomorrow for the title. Babson defeated Ohio Wesleyan, 50.

title: Nixon Says He'll Discuss Chile, Under His Rules
description: Former President. Richard M. Nixon has offered to appear before the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, evidently in hopes of warding off attempts by other Congressional committees to secure his testimony. Mr. Nixon, however, has laid down number of conditions that the Senators have not yet accepted.

title: Philippine Officials Hoping That President Ford's Visit Will Hasten Military and Trade Agreements
description: MANILA, Nov. 29 When President Ford arrives here next weekend, he will find Philippine officials eager to discuss sensitive issues involving the economic and security agreements between the United States and the Philippines.

title: Ann Sessions, MezzoSoprano, Is Bride of John K. Warsaw
description: Ann Sessions, daughter of Thomas Rountree Sessions of Lexington, S. C., and the late Sarah Taylor Sessions, was married yesterday afternoon to John K. Warsaw, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Warsaw

title: Nervous Cats and Dogs Treated at Home
description: JERSEY CITYHis patients are Yorkshire terriers, Samoyeds and Siamese cats, and theanimals problems range from a passion for chewing up bedroom slippers to an uncontrollable urge to bite. He prefers to make house calls because his patients become shy or nervous in an office.

title: Giants Face Dallas
description: IRVING, Tex., Nov. 29Craig Morton came home today and enjoyed instant victoryno one laughed him or his New York Giant teammates out of town. What happens after they play Dallas tomorrow might be a different story, but for the moment Morton was able to concentrate on his strategy for the Cowboys instead of sending off the slings and arrows of outrageous ridi

title: U.S. Finds Epidemic
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24, (UPI) More than a million American children suffer physical abuse or neglect each year, and at least one in five of the young victims die from their mistreatment, the Government announced today.

title: Huntington May Get a New Town Hall
description: HUNTINGTON  The residents here may buy a new Town Hall for. $1. Confirmation of such a deal depends on the outcome of a vote scheduled for Dec. 9 by the Huntington Union Free School District.

title: The Fiscal Crisis Reaches Commuters and Medicaid
description: TRENTON  The fiscal crisis predicted in New Jersey by Governor Byrne has finally struck hard at state aid programs for commuter transportation and Medicaid services.

title: Penguins WinEsposito Back
description: PITTSBURGH  The New York Rangers ran into a hot offensive team trying to make up for a slow start as they lost, 83, to the Pittsburgh Penguins before 12,932 fans tonight.

title: S. A. Hard Weds Lisa A. Barnes
description: Lisa Anderson Barnes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Allen Barnes Jr. of Bronxville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Stephen Anders Hard, a traffic analyst with Nabisco Inc. in East Hanover, N. J. He is the son of Mrs. Frank A. Hard of Hillsdale, N. J., and the late Mr. Hard.

title: Schweitzer's Hospital Imperiled by Finances
description: PARIS, Nov. 29 (Reuters)The jungle hospital at Lambarene of the late Dr. Albert Schweitzer's will have to close Jan. 1 unless Gabon gives it immediate aid, acHospital International Association.

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Mt. Ford Bends, Carey's Aid Plan Gets Over the Top
description: The cavalry will soon he dispatched from Washington by Commander in Chief Ford with a shipment of gold that will permit New York City to buy its way clear of the wasteland of municipal bank??

title: Is it an art, a sport or sheer exhibitionism?
description: The front wall of Gold's Gym in Venice, Calif., used to have big glass windows, but owners of the gym had to cover them overso many passersby stopped to gape that the men inside couldn't concentrate. The interior of the gym is Rube Goldberg paradise inhabited by grotesques, men so colossally muscled they look like inverted pyramids.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Russia is terrible. It snows and snows and snows. If you look out the window and say, It snows too much, a Government machine reports you to the police and they lock you in a madhouse to have your brain altered. Russia is terrible.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A: VERMONT ROSES (Nov. 9)  li Mrs. C. W. W., Manchester Centre, Vt., an experienced rose grower, finds that her ii   rosebushes continually develop gall growths around the graft. She asked what caused this and what to do about it. Henry Deidriksen, a Westchester County rose hobbyist, writes, Crown gall which appears near the crown and on some roots may be the problem. It's a bad nuisance hard to get rid of. I suspect that Mrs. C. W. W. may have purchased diseased plants in the beginning. The disease can be carried in fresh nursery stock and go undetected by untrained eyes. If the disease keeps reappearing, Mrs. C. W. W. should start fresh with new plants planted in a new soil location. The disease bacteria lives over in the soil for several years.

title: Ballet to Begin Tour of Statel
description: NEWARK  The Garden State Ballet, the resident company of Newark's Symphony Hall, will begin a monthlong tour of New Jersey tomorrow with a performance at Arts High School. It will dance the first of a series of performances of the company's special program for young people.

title: Kingsmen In Palmy 5012 Rout
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Nov. 29 From the hdme of the chocolate egg cream to the home of the pia coladaa difference of 1,600 miles and about 160 calories  the Brooklyn College football team embarked tonight on pioneering mission designed to bring unbridled joy and honor to the campus that gave the world Allie Sher

title: Energy Data Required
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 (AP) Prospective buyers of refrigerators and freezers in Massachusetts will soon be able to compare the appliances energy efficiency as well as prices. A state law that will become effective Jan. 1st requires that such appliances bear labels how much electricity they consume each month.

title: DR. ERNEST SCHACHTEL
description: Dr. Ernest G., Schachtel, a psychoanalyst and teacher. died of a heart ailment Friday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 315 West 106th Street.

title: MilkPrice Compromise Due
description: TRENTONA 10year dispute over state regulation of milk prices is drawing to a close, with both sides settling on a weak compromise bill that will continue price controls with little change.

title: Greater State Role In Gas Rates Urged
description: NEWARKOver the last three years, the Federal Power Commission has received requests for rate increases, totaling more than $67million, to cover the cost of piping natural gas to New Jersey consumers. The state was not represented at any of the proceedings, and no appeals were made in behalf of consumers.

title: Tarkenton and Vikings Face Challenge of Redskins Today
description: For Francis Asbury Tarkenton the ..plaudits are falling this autumn like peach blossoms in the springtime back home in Atlanta. Tarkenton is not doing anything radical About Pro Football ly different this season than in his last 14 in the National Football League. It's just that circumstances are different. He is playing quarterback for his best team, one enjoying an easy schedule and, therefore, undefeated and untied.

title: BIG QUAKE JOLTS ISLAND OF HAWAII
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 29  The strongest earthquake to hit the island of Hawaii in nearly 100 years caused extensive damage today to commercial buildings, homes and highways.

title: The Nurse Who Rules The Cuckoo's Nest
description: Los ANGELES

title: Omnibus Gag
description: The mills of the gods grind slowly. In 1967, when the Freedom of the Press and Fair Trial Report issued by the Committee of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York, of which I was chairman, was published, the omnibus gag order seemed like speck on the horizon.

title: Rerouting Of Trucks Is Planned For Queens
description: Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens announced yesterday that steps were under way to reroute truck traffic in the borough to keep large trucks off our local streets and out of our residential neighborhoods.

title: Dance. Liberian Suite
description: Although Lester Horton worked chiefly in California and died relatively young more than 20 years ago, his work has become known in the East and is probably better regarded now than ever before. This is due to the diligence of his students, such as James Truitte, Carmen de Lavallade sand Alvin Ailey, who have kept his work alive and his memory fresh.

title: City University Is in for Some Drastic Changes
description: It is almost certain that New York City's financial problems are going to bring major changes at City University. Exactly what they will be, however, still being debated.

title: Beirut Leaders, in New Accord, Imply Shifts in Political System
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 29President Suleiman Franjieh and Prime Minister Rashid Karami, long political opponent, said tonight that they had agreed on a basis for what the Prime Minister called necessary readjustments in Lebanon's sectarian political system while providing necessary guarantees for the various religious communities.

title: Books: Battle of Machiasport
description: An oil refinery at a deepwater port along the coast of Maine has, since the 1960's, been one of the most persistent and elusive dreams of wouldbe petroleum industry entrepreneurs.

title: The Hippies Wintering In Mild Goa
description: CALANGUTE BEACH, Goa Like colorful migrating birds following the winter sun, the American and European hippies who roam the Indian subcontinent have come south to Goa to nest until spring.

title: Early America
description: The Pilgrims remain first in our affections among the colonists, although, as Francis Dillon tells us, they once massacred Indians without provocation. They didn't execute Quakers, gave us our only interfaith holiday and signed that glorious Compact.

title: The Coming Election
description: Each national election can be described as a contest between hope and fear, between the lure of the future and the tug of the past. Elections like other major events tend to cast their shadow in advance; it is therefore possible to see that some elections are likely to mark a decisive turning point and others only a formal pause in the momentum of events.

title: China Digs Deep Into Its Artistic Past
description: Some of the most important activities taking place in China today are occurring undergroundthe diggings of ancient tombs which have yielded some remarkable archeological goods. Priceless artifacts and panels of magnificent wall paintings, longlost manuscripts written on bamboo and silk, as well as two wellpreserved bodies dating to more than 2,000 years agothese are among the exciting discoveries that have been uncovered in recent years.

title: Ford Off to Visit A Solvent Peking
description: President Ford this week makes his first official visit to China, intent on solidifying America's diplomatically useful relationship with that country. Mr. Ford and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger believe the friendship with China is a counterweight, providing leverage in dealing with the Soviet Union, which is hostile to Peking.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Probably the day of the crimepuzzle novel is about over it is certain that scarcely any of the novelists entering the field work within the tradition, say, of John Dickson Carr or Ellery Queen. The lockedroom puzzle or the challenge to the reader has gone out with the De Soto and the Trimotor.

title: COLUMBIA COLLEGE IS SCORED ON COEDS
description: The faculty vote to admit women to Columbia College for the first time in its 221year history will not immediately alter Columbia's status as the only remaining allmale Ivy League preserve, but it has spurred a siege mentality at Columbia and at Barnard College, its sister school.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Household Refuse A Source of Riches, U.N. Group Asserts
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29 (AP)The United Nations Economic Commission for Europe has said that there are riches in the refuse housewives throw away each day.

title: 2 Girls Die in Fire
description: HURON, Ohio, Nov. 29 (AP) Roger Dickman rescued his pregnant wife from a house fire early today, but was unable to save the couple's two children, the authorities said. Nineyearold Linda and Debbie, 6, were killed.

title: CLAUDE CARTIER, JEWELER, 50, DIES
description: ExHead of New York Store Noted as a Trapshooter Claude Cartier, former president of Cartier Inc., the jewelers here, died Friday of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis at his home. He was 50 years old.

title: Kialoa, Windward Passage. Ready for Duel in Australia
description: The Southern Cross is a Constellation in the Southern Hemisphere. But for Jim Kilroy the Southern Cross is a bit more. Its a cupwith his name engraved on it.

title: Court Nominee Is Hard to Label
description: President Ford has nominated a successor to Justice William O. Douglas on the Supreme Court. He named John Paul Stevens, a judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit Since 1970, a selection that confounded political speculation. Mr. Ford would pick either a woman or his old Republican colleague from Michigan, Senator Robert Griffin.

title: Joyce Is a Blue Chip
description: In a poll conducted recently, Money magazine subscribers allowed as how, if they could have anything they wanted, 7 percent would most like to have original artworks or firstedition books. (This is rather more than wanted a fulltime French chef, but fewer than those who yearned for a villa on the Mediterranean.) The statistic struck me with force. Who would have guessed so many people cared about first editions? (Let's ?? those artworks)

title: Suffolk Election Unit Called In
description: RIVERHEAD  Voters in Suffolk County turn out in large numbers for most elections, but the Board of Elections is not doing its job, it was charged last week by Ann Sielman, president of the Suffolk League of Women Voters.

title: BOYCOTT BY JEWS UPSETS MEXICANS
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 29The Mexioan tourist industry is already feeling the effects of a boycott organized by Jewish groups in the United States who are angry at Mexico's support for a United Nations resolution describing Zionism as racism.

title: Puppets Are Cartoons Come to Life
description: More than 3,000 years ago, puppet plays were already being widely performed in ano they have never lost their appeal. They are still entertaining audiences throughout the world. In theaters, schools and homes of this country today, as well as on such television programs as public TV's longrunning Sesame Street and the Kukla, Fran and 011ie and Shari shows, which have recently returned to NBCTV, puppets are giving pleasure to millions. Moreover, children and adults alike are finding, that the pleasure of puppetry is not entirely a spectator sport; it can be an unusually rewarding hobby as well.

title: The ugly duckling, updated
description: A chickensized ball of cinnamon fluff, a monthold whoopingcrane chick, feeds on sedge roots, beetles and grasshoppers in the marshy bottom of a plantchoked lake bed in southeastern Idaho. Suddenly, he freezes. A half mile away, a man comes crackling through the underbrush. The whooner's parents. standing guard over their charge, emit two sharp warning cries, ordering him to follow them into the dense, safe cover of the upland meadows. But the chick acts on his own strong instinct: he splashes straight into the nearest puddle of water. The frantic mother gives chase, rounds up the straggler and hustles him into the grasslands. which swallow up both of them.

title: Aqueduct. Race Charts
description: Saturday, Nov. 29. 18th day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: Getting Blacks Where Jobs Are
description: Are the new jobs that are coming with the nation's economic recovery just physically out of the reach of the nation's blacks? It's possible.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayLong Island Sports Car Club gymkhana at Mitchel Field, Hempsfead, L.I. Registration: 9 A.M., first car off 11. Seat belts and helmets required.

title: A Shunned Man Asks the Law's Intervention
description: In a case that could eventually test the limits of religious freedom in the United States, an excommunicated member of the Reformed Mennonite Church has asked a court to stop the church from using shunning as a form of discipline on the ground that it violates individual rights.

title: SIDNEY L. WOLKENBERG
description: Sidney L. Wolkenberg, a lifeinsurance adviser and an estate planning consultant, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital of a heart attack. He was 68 years old and lived at 400 East 56th Street.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABCAM: Message of Israel. Address by Dr. Human Judah Schachtel.

title: Factors in Court Choice
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 President Ford made a seemingly safe and respectable choice yesterday when he named Judge John Paul Ste

title: Endpaper
description: I suppose I have murdered as many good friends as the next nonmilitary novelist in my time of novels. Most of my murders have been committed as the one God typing away in one of many underpopulated pantheons. The degree of involvement the killings is total, because I am helplessly involved in everything I write, to the extent of clapping my thigh and laughing aloud when the words seem amusing to me.

title: Bill Allowing Civil Divorce Likely to Pass in Colombia
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 29 (Reuters) The Senate has approved a government bill to allow civil divorce in this staunchly Roman Catholic nation.

title: ZEBRA
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 29The murder trail of four young black men accused of a random series of street killings here two, years ago has completed its ninth month with testimony about Black Muslim religious doctrine.

title: A Familiar Story, But at a Sustained High Level
description: WASHINGTONMaryland's is a startling catalog of corruption for only five years: a Vice President of the United States, once the Governor of the state; a United States Senator; the chief executives of three of the state's most powerful counties. All were convicted of various criminal charges. Last week a sitting Governor was indicted.

title: Red Smith
description: The Gil and George Show

title: 2 Killed in Utah Crash
description: WILLARD, Utah, Nov. 29 (UPI) A pickup truck spun out of control in a blizzard yesteril day afternoon, skidded across the highway and collided with a crosscountry bus. The couple] in the truck was killed, and al dozen passengers in the Continental Trailways bus, bound for St. Louis from Seattle, were treated for cuts and bruises in Brigham City, seven miles south of this northern Utah town.

title: Jets Play Steelers;
description: What would appear to be the grossest mismatch in Jets history will unfold today at Shea Stadium.

title: Stock Cars Eligible For Le Mans Race
description: A 3,700pound American stock car battles one of those little European sports cars for the line through a corner. The American hog gets there first and a bunch of Frenchmen boo.

title: John Pond, Movie Engineer, Won Oscar for Zoom Lens
description: FALMOUTH, Me., Nov. 29John Ellery Pond, a design engineer with motionpicture companies who won an Academy Award in 1958 for his work in developing the zoom lens, died of lung cancer here Thursday. He was 72 years old.;

title: William Kamke to Wed Donna Wheaton
description: Mr. and Mrs. Don Carlenos Wheaton Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., and Kitty Hawk, N. C. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Donna Elizabeth Wheaton, to William Paul Kamke, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Augustus Kamke of Toledo, Ohio, and Clear Lake, Ind. The wedding is planned for Jan. 10.

title: CITY CONFRONTED BY NEW DEADLINE
description: Despite broad agreement on a threeyear financing program for the city, fiscal officials said yesterday that the municipalemployee pension funds would not furnish cash for city expenses until the State Legislature voted to redefine the responsibilities of the pension trustees.

title: A Bust of Franklin Is Sold for $310,000,
description: A white marble bust of Benjamin Franklin, America's most thrifty statesman, was purchased here yesterday for $310,000 by a British collector who will take it out of the country for the first time since 1785.

title: Kates Outpoints S. African in Bout
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 29 (Reuters)Richie Kates of Philadelphia outpointed Pierre Fourie of South Africa in a 10round lightheavyweight fight tonight and strengthened his chances for a shot at the title. The World Boxing Association title is held by Victor Galindez of Argentina and the World Boxing Council crown is held by Britain's John Conteh. Kates is recognized as the No. 1 contender by both bodies.

title: AntiAbortion Candidate for President
description: MERRICKEllen McCormack, who announced her Presidential candidacy in Boston recently, is an unusual figure in American national politics. For one thing, the average voter has never heard of her.

title: Raise House Plants From Seed
description: Growing house plants from seed is rewarding. Plants can be grown in quantity inexpensively, and a wider assortment is available for sharing with friends and other hobbyists. Practically all kinds of house plants can be started from seed: philodendrons, asparagus ferns, begonias, coleus, scheffleras, Christmas peppers, kalanchoes, coleus and so many others.

title: Leslie Walbridge Florida Bride Of Lewis P. Smith, a Consultant
description: Christ Memorial Episcopal Chapel in Hobe Sound, Fla., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Leslie Walbridge, daughter of Mrs. Eugene William Stetson of Jupiter Island, Fla., and George O. Walbridge 2d of Madrid, to Lewis Peter Smith. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Howell Smith of Lake Forest, Ill.

title: Detroiters Play Till It Hurts
description: Car sales are not the only thing causing top auto executives to grimace this fall.

title: Taking Risks, and Losing
description: Shortly after the turn of the century, blacks realized that to obtain the loans being denied them by the nation's white controlled banking system would require them to establish their own banks, They did, and those banks have become a vital part of black economic development. But after a heady, period of expansion in the last decade, many of these banks have undergone a financial crisis that has diluted black control of the institutions and forced them back to the conservative policies of their early years.

description: ART

title: What's Doing in the HOLY LAND
description: HALLOWED GROUNDThe Holy Land, with shrines sacred to Christians, Jews and Moslems, has attracted pilgrims throughout the ages. This year is no exception. Airline and hotel bookings indicate an influx of 30,000 visitors during the Christmas season. Many will be Catholics from the four corners of the world on group tours whose stopoffs in Jerusalem ill ?? their ?? nages to the Vatican during the Holy Year that is now drawing to an end. Others will be more casual vacationers, both Christian and Jewish, who find the slack period at home a convenient time for a holiday.

title: Horse Show Group Meets Next Week
description: The annual meeting of the Federation Equestre Internationale, the world governing body of equestrian sports, is scheduled for Dec. 8 through in Brussels and a fourman delegation from the United States will attend. The group will be headed by Col. Donald W. Thackeray of New Windsor, Md., a member of the bureau, or executive committee. The other Americans who will be in attendance are Albert E. Hart Jr., chairman of the board of the American Horse Shows Association and a member of the United States Olympic Committee; Bill Steinkraus, the president of the. United States Equestrian Team, and Dr. Joseph O'Dea, the chief veterinarian for the 1976 Olympic games in Montreal. Dr. O'Dea, who was the first American to be appointed an Olympic chief veterinarian, will be nominated for the bureau, which is the policymaking group  and, of course, the most powerful

title: Nashville's Grand Ole Opry
description: Recently Robert Altman's movie, Nashville, received an uncommon amount of gaga ballyhoo. This made me happy.

title: A Sameness Flaws Program of Dance By Jan Van Dyke
description: Three Gothic dances with flecks of macabre humor made up Jan Van Dyke's monotoned program Friday evening at the American Theater Laboratory. Alone each might have had, more impact but together they seemed but slight variations of one wearying theme, the trials of the outsider.

title: Rockets Triumph, 9998, On Goaltending Penalty
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 29 (AP)George McGinnis of Philadelphis was called for goaltending on a lastsecond shot by Mike Newlin, giving the Houston Rockets a 9998 victory over the 76ers tonight in the N.B.A.

title: Navy Downs Army, 306, For 3d Straight Victory
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 29The biggest element of suspense and excitement today in the 76th ArmyNavy football game was in the seventh minute of the fourth quarter when the Middies, leading, 300, made a goalline stand to prevent an Army score. But the fine Navy defense bent just enough so that the Cadets scored from the 1foot line for the first points against Navy, in 12 quarters of football.

title: 10 Arizona Youths Are Rescued After Being Snowbound 2 Days
description: FLAGSTAFF. Ariz., Nov. 29 (AP) Ten high school youngsters stranded two nights in, heavy snows on San Francisco Peaks north of herewere rescued today after taking refuge in a mountain cabin.

title: Food News
description: ORANGEIt took a young man with oldtime ambition to turn a family coiner store into a flourishing business specializing in Italian food. The establishment is Andrea's, and among its bestselling items are creamy, ricottafilled ravioli, which, at this time of the year, it turns out by the thousands every day.

title: C. D. Snowdon Weds Miss Kaptain
description: The marriage of Kathleen Barbara Kaptain to Charles Dean Snowdon took place yesterday afternoon at the George Town Club in Washington. The Rev. Almus M. Thorp Jr, of St. Francis Episcopal Church in Potomac, Md., performed the ceremony.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Coach Joe Paterno, after Penn State squeaked by Pitt, 76: When I get home, I'm going to church real quicklike.

title: Nuptials in Suburbs for Kitty Mojo
description: Kathleen Craven Mojo, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis A. Mojo of ArdsleyonHudson, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., to William Ernest Moeller, a vice president of the First National City Bank of New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl W. Moeller of Dayton, Ohio, and Hilton Head, S.C.

title: WOLFF SIDE BOWS IN BRIDGE TOURNEY
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 29Several world class players were on the sidelines here today when the final stage of the Reisinger BoardaMatch Team Championship began, the concluding event in the Fall Nationals of the American Contract Bridge League.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appears in Section 2:

title: Baltimore Rocket Fuel Plant Found to Emit Carcinogens
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 29 (UPI)Emissions from a southwest Baltimore chemical plant are causing high concentrations of known cancercausing agents, or carcinogens, in the city's air, but scientists have not determined if the concentrations are dangerous, according to Federal and state officials.

title: Landmark Status Sought for Success
description: MANHASSETAs I look back on life, it has been a great satisfaction, said Grace Amelia Smith, glancing out her small window overlooking Community Drive, where cars continuously whizzed by on the fourlane hiehway.

title: Juntas Move Right and The Church Is Now the Left
description: BUENOS AIRESThe repressive police methods employed by the rightwing dictatorships in Brazil, Chile and Uruguay are producing energetic protests from the strongest religious congregation in those countries, the Roman Catholic church.

title: ADM. C. E. VAN HOOK
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Nov. 29 (UPI) Rear Adm. Clifford E. Van Hook, deputy commander of the United States Seventh Fleet in the Western Pacific during World War II, died yesterday at his home. He was 89 years old.

title: A History Of Jewish Literature
description: With the geographical breadth (many continents) and temporal sweep (several millennia) of Hebrew writing, the literary historian is faced with a formidable task. Yet in Israel Zinberg, Jewish literature found a brilliant and erudite exponent who considered the literature of the Jews in a broad spectrum, and brought under his wide umbrella all the diversity of the written word.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The following comments were made by the chief executive officer of an American company:

title: N.J. Commuting To Cost More
description: About 700,000 New Jersey rail and bus commuters are likely to be paying higher fares soon, but just when and how much is in doubt.

title: Dr. Strominger Weds Suella Sabine Here
description: Suella Sabine, director of S. Sabine Architectural Interiors, was married here last evening to Dr. Sheldon Strominger, a dentist. Rabbi A. Allen Block performed the ceremony at the apartment of the couple, whose previous marriages ended in divorce.

title: Canada to Curb TV Ads Made in U.S.
description: The Canadian RadioTelevision Commission is scheduled to proclaim a new policy next month that is aimed at insuring that most commercials aired in Canada are produced there, even when the advertisers are United States corporations or their subsidiaries.

title: Pittsburgh Strike Of Teachers Likely In Wage Deadlock
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 29 (AP) A teachers strike against the Pittsburgh public schools Monday appeared imminent today as lastminute efforts to avert the threatened walkout failed.

title: L.I. School Districts Face Credit Pinch
description: When the Mount Sinai School District in Suffolk County came within a halfhour of defaulting on a $1,078,000 bond anticipation note a week or so ago, it was not just an isolated case of a small school district encountering financial difficulties. Mount Sinai's close call was symptomatic of the effect that New York City's money problems are having on Long Island school districts.

title: Other Nations Raise the Ante In Angola
description: The armed forces of two nationalist groups seeking to oust a third from control of the Angolan capital of Luanda have apparently been halted 120 miles from the goal after a march of almost 1,000 miles. For the moment there is a military stalemate, into which outside foroes and much heavier weaponry are being introduced.

title: County Attorney Named for Nassau
description: MINEOLA  The appointment of James Catterson Jr. as Nassau County Attorney, effective Jan. 1, has been announced by County Executive Ralph G. Caso.

title: Inmates to Get Holiday Pass
description: BILLERICA, Mass., Nov. 29 (UPI)Prisoners at the Billerica House of Correction will be able to take advantage of ari experimental furloegh program on Christmas because of what some of their fellow inmates. did this week. title: Medicaid Cutbacks May Face Court Test
description: TRENTONMedicaid payment to New Jersey hospitals will be cut by an average of 10.8 percent in last half of the current fiscal year, Anne Klein, Commissioner of the state's Department of Institutions and Agencies, said last week. Her announcement, and the action it will precipitate, are certain to be challenged in court by the New Jersey Hospital Association.

title: Alabama Rolls to 280 Victory, Spoiling Auburn Coach's Finale
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 29 (AP)  Richard Todd ran for two touchdowns and threw passes for two more today as fourthranked Alabama routed Auburn, 280, spoiling the football coaching finale of Ralph (Shug) lordan.

title: Point of View
description: New York needs a viable housing stock if it is to be an economically healthy city. New construction is virtually nonexistent here, however. It is therefore even more vital to preserve our existing housing stock.

title: Hiking Puerto Rico: Awoke With A Gun Barrel in My Face
description: OF the town of La Parguera I remember three things: the dust, the heat and the stares of local residents. I had chosen this arid little settlement on the Caribbean coast of Puerto Rico as the starting point of a walk that would take me over the mountainous hump of the island's Cordillera Central to the Atlantic shores: from sea to sea, literally. Walking alone under the midday summer sun with a 50pound backpack and heavy boots, I was clearly a strange sight to the people of La Parguera, who followed my progress through town from their dusty front yards.

title: For Those Who Think English Cookery Is Dull and Monotonous...
description: LONDONWe have never considered London to be one of the ultimate gastronomic capitals of the world, and yet we can, with some reflection,. recall various components of one meal, which, taken altogether and in sequence, provided one of the headier experiences of dining in Europe. The dishes were sampled during the course of a meal shared by three, with each of the three ordering a separate sequence of foods. The restaurant was that of the Connaught Hotel, one of the most civilized and comfortable hotels on earth. The dishes that added up to a certain rapture were a croustade of quail eggs Maintenon; roast grouse anglaise, salad, cheese and an English trifle.

title: L.I. Potato Production Off 14%

What began, in the planning a year ago, as a journey to further President Nixon's inauguration of SinoAmerican dtente has deteriorated into an exercise in political atmospherics.

There were the obligatory references to the Golden Door (Emma Lazarus) and the good people of New York City, with their generous instincts (Uriah Heep), and a farrago of bucolic outrage at, contempt for and triumph over The Profligacy of the Great Whore of Cities. it evoked the notion of Abe Beame as a pillar of saltor even a pinch and it was faintly comic. How could anytell?

The leaders of both political parties are beginning to wonder whether their assumptions of the past have any relevance to the future. In short, they are beginning to doubt and even to think, which is a perplexing and even painful process, but it is Drobablv good thing.

title: Three from the Fiction Collective
description: The Fiction Collective, whatever its publishing rationale, must feel entirely justified with Mimi Albert's perfectly written novella, a work that captures without waste or sentimentality the mood and texture of life in the sixties. Life, that is, in the shabby urban recesses, to which so many of the young people fled to escape the oppressive conformity of affluence or the abrasive conditions of the poor. Mary, in flight from her comfortable home, meets Florian from the underside of society, and their intertwined destiny works itself out in sordid rooms, dim bars, greasy spoons. He becomes a succubus eating out her substance; she realizes too late the bankruptcy of her position. Miss Albert conveys intensely the girl's inability to throw off her beginnings, which she carries around with her like original sin, and she reveals, too, the damning shapes that poverty takes. The words used to describe this book are not words of praise: menacing, sinister, painful. But it is not a sermon on its subject; it will the text for one.

title: Lisa Hess Mann Is Married To William Gemmill, Engineer

title: The Census, All Year Round

Thou sands of ordinary citizens each year send in $7.50 for information that will help them get Social Security benefits or the right to inherit the money of some long lost uncle. title: A Haven for Vikings, Saxons, Crusadersand Weekend Sailors
description: THE wind blows steadily from the southwest  from the open sea below Cornwall and Devon, eeross the Isle of Wight and into the mouth of the tiny land locked harbor, Bosham is a sailor's dream full of wind and boats and the scent of seawrack, yet sheltered. from the full force of sea and wind by a deeply scalloped tidal shoreline. Though no more than a mile's detour from the busy eastwest main road between Chichester and Portsmouth, Bosham (pronounced BOZzum), population 1,500, has the relaxed air of a sleepy English seaside resortan ideal spot from which to explore the historic mires of more noted tourist centers near:pi. Yet the first instance of the establishment of Christianity along the Sussex coast was recorded here. There is good evidence that Canute, the Viking adventurer, used the village as one of the seats of a North Sea empire embracing England, Norway and Denmark. And the last of England's Saxon kings. Harold Godwinson, who had a manor at Bosham, sailed from here before his succession to the throne on a voyage that played a, part in the Norman

description: HOUSTONIt was no big deal. And it certainly wasn't meant to sound offensive in any way. But, after months of involved negotiations officials of the M. W. Kellogg Company had one teenyweeny suggestion for their newest client, the People's Republic of China: no Mao suits.

title: Regional Plan Unit Criticized
description: HAUPPAUGENassau and Suffolk county representatives and civic leaders have voiced dissatisfaction with the role of the TriState Regional Planning Commission.

title: A Suicide
description: Similar arrests and torture, without any court order legal defense, have been widespread in Brazil. The issue was dramatized last month when Vladimir Herzog. the news director of a television station in So Paulo, was found dead in a detention center a few hours after being arrested. He was declared a suicide and buried without an autopsy. Military authorities had forbidden one.

title: Rutgers Dean Wearing 2 Hats
description: PISCATAWAYCharles A. MarierMarrero of Rutgers University is wearing two hats these days. He is Dean of Students for both the College of Engineering and the College of Pharmacy.

title: J. H. Bates Fiance Of Elizabeth Lewis
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Kendall Lewis of Califon, N.J., of the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Merriam Lewis, to Jonathan Hartley Bates, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Caldwell Bates of New Canaan, Conn.

title: SUPERFLYWHER HOPE FOR ENERGY
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 29 A simple device that keeps potter's wheels and toy tops running smoothly is being viewed by many engineers today as a possible broadrange solution for some of America's critical energy problems.

title: Design
description: Americans have finalh begun to show real awareness of the energy crisis. The seriousness of the oil shortage and the increasing cost of fuel and electricity have sharpened the public's curiosity about solar energy and about the design of houses. Whether we like it or not, predicts Ronald Beckman. executive director of the Research and Design Institute (REDS), an independent, nonprofit agency that tries to find new ways to save energy, the shortage will have a profound effect on what architecture and interior design will

title: Helstoski's Bid to Oust Goldstein Facing Hurdles
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Henry Helstoski is expected to have a difficult time getting the House of Representatives to act on his resolution demanding the impeachment of Jonathan L. Goldstein, the United States Attorney for New Jersey, Congressional sources saild last week.

title: Poll Finds Many Are Hazy on History
description: Despite community Bicentennial celebrations and a year of advertising by Bicentennial planning commissions, 28 percent of the United States public cannot identify what important event occurred in this country in 1776, according to a recent Gallup poll.

title: The Perk That Discriminates
description: The American Jewish Committee has asked the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to prohibit corporate sponsorship of memberships in clubs that discriminate against minorities and women.

title: Six Arrested in Colorado In ChristmasTree Cutting;
description: BOULDER, Colo. Nov. 29 (AP) Five men and a juvenile were arrested for cutting down., without the required permits at least 3,000 Christmas trees in Rccky Mountain National Park, Roosevelt National Forest and on private land.

title: In This Issue
description: TELEVISION. By Raymond Williams

title: If You Go
description: on a Sierra Club service project you must first join the organization (1050 Mills Tower, San Francisco, Calif. 94104). Dues are $20 for the first year, $15 thereafter. You, and 150,000 other members, receive the monthly Sierra. Club Bulletin and can pick from hundreds of outings to go on. In the 1975 schedule, 28 were service projects. They arose out of a need to minimize the impact of man on the natural environment. The projects are often the outgrowth of an unusual Park or Forest Service request. Since the club cannot handle all the requests it picks the more interesting and or important. Those who volunteer for service projects Are usually hardy, optimistic campers with a for.work.T. G.

title: MIAMI POLICE LOSE PAY ME REOUEST
description: MIAMI. Nov. 29New York City's financial problems have apparently been a major factor in the rejection by the Dade County (greater Miami) Cornmission of a police request for higher pay.

title: It's a Family Affair Is Really an Adventure
description: STONY BROOK  If we were home I would probably be watching football or working in the basement and the kids would be into something else. Instead, we are doing something together which we don't normally do.

title: Tube of Plenty
description: Quite simply, Erik Barnouw's threevolume History of Broadcasting in the United StatesA Tower in Babel (1966), The Golden Web (1968) and The Image Empire (1970)is what everybody who writes about television steals from. Mr. Barnouw, Emeritus Professor of Dramatic Arts at Columbia University, did all the work, burrowing through the bins of business and government, bringing back every fact that was portable. Those of us who play with the subject, impulsive sermonizers, soidisant popcultural hitmen, rely on his trilogy the way mountaineers rely on the mountain: because it is there, we can be, too.

title: A. GORDON HULL
description: A. Gordon Hull, vice president  for engineering of Prudential Lines Inc., shipping, died here Friday of cancer. He was 58 years old and lived in Jamestown, R.I.

title: Mr. Moynihan Returns in His Revolving Door
description: Daniel P. Moynihan, who had decided to resign AS chief American delegate to the United Nations, has decided to stay, and the reasons were murky in both cases.
